product_name: Eternity 25th Anniversary Edition for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This smells a like masculine cologne to be honest. In the beginning it's spicy, musky and strong however after a while the dry down emits a green herbal scent. A good unisex fragrance for the office. But it cannot be a signature scent for a woman. It's too strong but after dry down it becomes a little flowery.

product_name: Eternity 25th Anniversary Edition for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Received this today....%$#&!!!
What did they do with the CARNATION...!!!...???
All I get is an aquatic/herbal/sage scent...and later in the dry-down phase....MAYBE...a touch of floral...lily??? REALLY???
This is NOT white floral to my nose at all....I guess I can feel the marigold...bitterness...more like a vintage men's cologne..very dry..WEiRd !!!!
At first spritz...I thought..What's going on here ???
I will admit..that when it dries down it gets better, but...this one is a NO Way Jose IMHO.
I gave this 2 chances today, both with the same result.
Sometimes I wait a couple days and try it again...since I spent the $$$...I will try it again....or maybe not.
Sigh....sigh.

EDIT: The bottle IS cool,I admit that.
Read the review below mine....I think that sums it up !!!

product_name: Eternity 25th Anniversary Edition for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: too bad not that great as the original, even though very similar. like a worsened version of the original or a fake. great bottle thoigh! anyway, i didnt buy it

product_name: Eternity 25th Anniversary Edition for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Same as the original!?

product_name: Eternity 25th Anniversary Edition for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
can't wait to get it!

Edit:
I got it. And the bottle is such a dissapointment. It's simply ugly.

product_name: Eternity 25th Anniversary Edition for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: J'espère qu'on le trouvera en france !!!

product_name: Cotton Musk Body Mist Calvin Klein
review_content: very nostalgic scent to me despite being new on the market. excited to use as a layering scent or just as a light and cosy bedtime ritual scent. love!

product_name: Cotton Musk Body Mist Calvin Klein
review_content: Harsh and nasty aroma chemical nightmare 😅

product_name: Cotton Musk Body Mist Calvin Klein
review_content:
The scent is more like coconut than cotton. I sometimes use this spray as air freshener.

I think it's very overpriced, considering it's marketed as a body mist rather than a perfume. Mists tend to be more targeted at teens in my opinion, and teens typically spend £1-10 on them.

product_name: Cotton Musk Body Mist Calvin Klein
review_content: smells like musk and milk

product_name: Cotton Musk Body Mist Calvin Klein
review_content: Think dry shampoo, but for your clothes

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells like cucumber 🥒 and varnish. When it goes on and when it settles it's just cheap and rank.if you live in England iam selling it for £15-20 used twice with cellophane still around the box.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content: Reminds me of Light Blue Eau Intense Homme EDP. Salty aquatic notes.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content:
I totally agree with the review of "sp00kie".....this is not a summer fragrance.
Cooler weather, spring or Fall. Ones the top notes are gone which is a few minutes, it becomes too deep and heavy to wear it in the Summer.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content:
A super release that has nothing to do with any Eternity flanker before it. A step in a new direction before Summer Daze brought it back on course. I wonder if this was a record-scratch one-off-type deal. Either way, this is one of my favorite Eternity releases. I'm going for this one in the evening when I want to smell exotic and approachable.

An air of mystery to this for sure, as noted in previous comments. I think this is because you don't often get these gorgeous notes altogether: Right out the gates, this is rich, sensual, and spicy with lovely tropical touches from the coconut. Generally, not a fan of coconut scents but this one changed my mind completely and made me inspired to go out and get more.

Let me say something about the finish here: Shocking. Unfolds onto such a delicate, dusty Sandalwood with deep Labdanum and sweet, sweet Frankincense. Why isn't this more popular?

You have to love Calvin Klein's wild scent notes and weird off-the-wall futurism - It totally puts some people off but I can't get enough of it. CK is the best fragrance out there for the money if you ask me, so take that with a grain of salt. CK is a brand that has held high brand recognition and respect, even though they end up at bargain stores like Ross and TJ Maxx. In short, nobody is going to smell like you and this will get compliments if you are looking for that sort of thing.

Make sure you check the outer box, recent years look similar, but you can't really go wrong, to be honest. Compared to everything else out right now, CK Eternity Summer editions hold up.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content: This fragrance is a little confusing I won’t lie. At first spray I smelled absolutely nothing just a burst of alcohol, i put more sprays because it’s very very light you could barely smell anything and I still didn’t smell anything after spraying more. Later I drove to work and started smelling nothing but leather all the way through, although there is no note of leather in this fragrance and there no comments mentioning leather that was all i got. It’s weird because as soon as I got to work i got compliments from my co-workers although I could barely smell it on myself. I will say the performance gets much better after about 4 hours, you could smell it after wearing it for a while it definitely works better in high heat. After about that 4 hours you also get a lot of woodiness and a dash of coconut. It’s more a spring than summer fragrance but would work great for both. All in all It’s a solid fragrance for a beginner.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content: What a disappointment this is. Doesn’t last at all. 30 minutes and it’s gone. You have to shove your face wherever you applied it to maybe get a whiff of something. Got this at Burlington for $22, good price. Terrible performance. 👎

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content: Tried this today with Hugo Boss Unlimited, preferred Eternity Summer , hands down. Also lasted way longer 6+ hours. Really great fragrance, with projection and clear scent progression.I don't pick up on the coconut really, it's a fresh, green opening, with a really nice incense, woody dry down.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content:
I don’t like it
The smell is so boring. Kinda smells like saliva after brushing

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content: Very strange yet good smell. Its refreshing spicy kinda of smell. If you want to try something new this is excellent. Remember its like any other yearly edition from CK it might not be available all the time so grab one now.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content:
For some reason, Hawaii is the first thing that came to my mind when I first sprayed this on. Unlike the going trend, I find the scent interesting and dare say kinda unique. I can't think of anything else that smells similar.
Comparing this to the 2019 version, I think this is much fresher, and way less salty. You should go for the 2019 if you want to be reminded of the beach/the sea and the OG Eternity. This shouldn't even be an Eternity flanker in my opinion, as it has its own character without much of the OG DNA.
To round this up, don't listen to the haters: you and everyone else around will love this! Blind purchase approved. ❤️
And a closing question: does anyone know for a fact who the perfumers are? Calvin Klein's HK website lists Pascal Gaurin.
Update: I literally had someone run after me to ask what I was wearing. LOL!

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content: I'm with sp00kie down there. A mineral sandy, dune environment accord is all that reminds me of summer, the rest being a balmy all year round pleasing, nurturing scent for 4 hs. I discern no coconut whatsoever in this, as opposed to Eternity Now, which is a realistic coconut meat (not milk) frag. Eternity for men Summer 2019 feels more summer-like than this. I suppose the parfumiers spent the summer of 2020 indoors? In any case, I really like this scent and I use it all year round, day and night.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content:
Calvin Klein Eternity for Men Summer 2020 is a bit a tough nut to crack. It is rather unique since Eternity for Men Summer 2020 is a fresh tropical spicy-green fragrance. It is somewhat tropical with the heavy coconut, there is some spice with the sage and anise. As for green, the closest is maybe the sage. Honestly I don't know why but this smells a little bit like Tommy Hilfiger Summer 2016 and a less sea salty 2019 Eternity for Men Summer.

Surprisingly, this was the fragrance that got me more into coconut. Normally it has either been dominated by rum like in Joop! Homme Wild or just come off like suntan lotion like with Set Sails Martinque or English Laundry Tahitian Waters. Now while I do like coconut rum, I got more of the booze than the coconut in most cases with coconut fragrance.

With Eternity for Men Summer 2020, I get a coconut water smell. Sadly, this is the only thing that makes the fragrance stand out and it dies into a hardly noticeable olibanum and sandalwood mixture. Now don't get me wrong, I do get sage, anise and bergamot in the open but, really this fragrance is mostly coconut.

Eternity for Men Summer 2020 is a typical CK release in performance. It lasts 4 hours and doesn't project all that strong after the first hour. For this reason it is a nice spring/summer errand and work fragrance. It may work on vacations, but not as easily as the previous years' Eternity for Men Summer release which is a vacation ready scent. Don't get me wrong Eternity for Men Summer 2020 does smell nice, but it isn't as good of summer vacation scent as past Eternity for Men summer releases.

Calvin Klein Eternity for Men Summer 2020 is nice but it isn't a must go out and get fragrance. It is unique-ish but not that very uesful. I list it as a like but that is because I "like" any fragrance I rank a 6 or higher. There really isn't anything obnoxious from the fragrance but at the same time it isn't special, it performs like a CK release and it outshined by the 2019. Is this better than the 2016 Tommy Summer release, yes. Should you get it if you enjoyed that, sure if the supply for 2016 Tommy is dry. Unless you truly love the Eternity for Men Summer releases, I think that is the only reason to get this. But really, I must give this a 6.5, 0.2 higher than the Tommy due to the added tropical feel from the coconut that gives this an added character.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content:
The first time I smelt this, it was side by side with CK One Summer 2020. I was pretty disappointed because I made the mistake of comparing it directly to that. Don't do that.
As a stand alone summer fragrance,this is actually pretty great.
As long as you don't go into it expecting too much. I mean it is an annual summer release from Calvin Klein.
When my wife smelt it on my wrist, she wasn't a fan. But when she walked into the scent trail, she really loved it.
If you can pick this up for $20 or $25, I think you'll be completely satisfied.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content: Fresh and green scent for me. A bit on the more generic side where the mass of the designers are. Easy to wear and easy to like. Nothing that will blow your mind.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content:
It really reminds me of classic Michael Jordan which for me is one of my favorite warm weather juices ever. This is a definite recommend from me especially at the price point right now of $20-$30.
8.5/10

These flankers tend to be cheap for the first year after release and then they go up in price every year after that so snag a bottle while you can

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content: For me this is not a summer scent. Not that I don't like it but I think it's misnamed. You might be able to wear it in summer but not during the day. The sage/bergamot opening is very pleasant but it lasts for such a short time that you can't classify it as a summer fragrance on that basis. The labdanum/sandalwood drydown is where the warmth comes from and for me it makes this the perfect fragrance for a relaxing weekend during autumn or the cooler part of spring. Performance is nothing special at 5 sprays even on clothes. It's a skin scent after 3-4 hours for me. In short, its a safe blind buy. Get it if you can find it really cheap and be prepared to overspray. It's definitely worth the 18 euros I paid for it. I will be using it in a few months.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content: That one is so bad, I hate it. Nothing coconutty, nothing sweet, just basic sage. I hate the original Eternity as well and this could be the reason but that smells cheap.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content: This ones a banger folks. Finally we get a flanker from the CK house that to me anyways isn’t a lunchbox letdown. To anybody who likes the OG Eternity for men it definitely has some of the vibes from it, but it’s clearly not the same. To my nose this is a a much softer and better smelling version of Eternity Intense with some small differences between the notes breakdown, and I love Eternity Instense, just saying. On my skin it didn’t last too long (about 3 hours) but I didn’t spray much either, a couple on the chest and couple behind the ears. I’m fairly confident that if I was a little more generous I could get between 4-5 hours. Obviously because of the name this is a warm weather scent, but it’s nice to know that CK isn’t putting out trash again and again. So far in the past year I’ve picked up Eternity EDP, and now this, they have both been exceptional. I’ll give this a solid 7/8 out of 10 because it smells really nice. I’ve even caught my GF snagging a few squirts to put on my sweaters and shirts for when I’m not around for a few days so she can wear them at night. She’s picky as hell, so they’ve done something right here on this years version. Lastly, I’ve since compared the notes between this one and Eternity Intense and it doesn’t seem to share any of the same notes, but for some reason I find that there some subtle similarities, apologies in advance for throwing any readers here a curveball with my senses.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content: Really nice! Dries down warmer with a bit of smokiness, which helps its staying power. Coconut isn't very prominent, but some sweetness remains throughout. I could imagine this as a casual summer night, perfect for going out to an outdoor restaurant or tiki bar or something like that. Worth a look if you've enjoyed previous Eternity Summers and want a break from summer fragrances that go heavy on the citrus.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content: This frag has just been released here in the UK,I’m not a fan of Calvin Klein but thought I’ll give this one a go as I’m looking for Summer Scents now, it’s fresh,clean and nice, basically turns into the Classic Eternity.. not bad at all.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content: Incredible, I love this version. 80% similar to eternity summer 2017, It starts with strong coconut note, and after 15 minutes it evolves to a fresh with a middle note of incense fragrance. I also note a little bit of ginger in the drydown. Overall I thinks it´s perfect for summer. I would recommend it for summer nights. Not strictly for using it to a beach trip during the day.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content:
After trying this today, the words
summer on the bottle confuses me,
there is nothing about this scent
that reminds me of summer, this scent
is spicy, smokey and a bit sweet, but it
has nothing fresh in there, that beeing
said i think it was an ok scent overall.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2020 Calvin Klein
review_content: WHAT !!!!!! 2012 PACKAGE WTF

Damn! Very nice summer scent. So far the best CK One Summer for me. Very fresh and fruity.

Sun, beach and CK One Summer 2016 - That's my recipe for a very great day.

Calvin Klein CK One Summer 2016 is one of the better iterations of the CK One Summer collection. I regard is a sort of sweet palm with mixed citruses and other fruit. Its note listing includes a mojito accord, which contrasts it from the more margarita-like vibe of its 2014 counterpart, and certainly the execution on 2016 isn’t quite as pleasant as 2014, but 2016 still does give the tropical cocktail vibe, to put it crudely, while not veering off in an overly synthetic direction at any one point. Like 2014, it’s good, not great, but certainly quite good for the money, as it’s been available in its standard 100ml size for $20 at times, surely a bargain if there are qualms over the quality. The 2017-19 version are available on FragranceNet currently for such prices, though I expect the earlier versions like 2016 and especially 2014 might start demanding higher prices. Certainly a fun try and worth tracking down for the right price, but otherwise replicable via other options in a similar sweet fruity fresh category that’s fairly ubiquitous. I’ve 2018 and 2014 as well, with 2014 being my favorite and 2018 being roughly on par with 2016.

6 out of 10

Purchased 2016 and 2014 ckos recently. My must say this one was a treat! it’s different then years past. I ejoyed this scent very much compared to 2014 ckos.. I own multiple CK One summers and 2014 is my least favorite by far
on my skin the coconut milk is predominant. I mixed it with the classic One for a better imprint

Take water, add a mojito drink into it, boom you have this cologne, but the water and mojito would probably be stronger than this cologne. It smells great but it turns into a skin scent after 30 minutes. Luckily for me I got a 100Ml for $30 bucks at a cologne expo. To me, the 2017 version has better longevity and silage. Skip this one if you’re looking for a scent that lasts longer than an hour.

My husband doesn't want to give me his bottle of this fresh mojito!
Summer to the nth degree. Fresh green "drink" in which the coconut is well hidden.
I put it on MY shelf :P, sure to wear it much more often than he did.

A nice, fresh summer frag. You can smell the original CK One in the base of this, but the addition of the mojito and coconut accords give it a little twist. You feel like you are going to the beach instead of running errands...
definitely summer. best during the day or casual evening events. longevity not great, but it never has been for CK One or its flankers. A fun alternative for the summer....

Definitely a summer scent, no question about that. Smells kind of like coconut scented tanning lotion and shea butter mixed with lime/citrus and white rum. Would make a great beach scent. Very similar to Set Sail St. Barts for men by Tommy Bahama, a summer staple of mine.

CK One Summer is unquestionably unisex, leaning toward feminine, although it easily can be worn by both men and women. Nothing exciting about this one. Very safe scent and I doubt anybody will dislike this one enough to get negative reactions because it's so fresh and light it's not that noticeable anyway. Most people will have the opinion of it being just a nice summer scent, nothing more, but also not bad either.

The longevity on this however sucks. I'm talking one of the weakest in my collection of 160 fragrances and my wife's 200+ perfumes. It's hard to believe it's an EDT because it's more like a cologne. I actually get better longevity with Versace Eau Fraiche -- so if you know that fragrance, that will give you an idea of the weak performance of CK One Summer. But again, I do believe the perfumer created this for those that prefer really light fragrances. As for me, I had to double up on my usual 3 sprays and apply 6 sprays. That still barely lasted an hour. The poor projection/sillage is not a major issues with me because I wear fragrances for myself and my fragrance addicted wife and not an entire room. Even with 6 sprays,.my wife needed to literally come just a few inches from my chest to detect the scent only 15 minutes after application!

CKOS does make a nice air freshener to spritz a few times around the house, ideally just before guests arrive for a summer cookout or whatever. It does seem to get slightly better longevity on my shirt. I'll probably gift it to my wife, or perhaps swap it for something I enjoy more.

It starts really good citrus green smell but it drysdown into this harsh woody green smell that is not comfortable to wear.

& not just that, the projection & longevity are on the weaker side.

This is a neutral for me, not good, not bad.
Perform better in high heat summer
Cactus juice with poor longevity. NICE bottle that I refill with other frags!

I bought the 2014 version and liked it so much decided to try this version and really like it also. These are perfect for people like me who don't have a lot of cash to throw at fragrances but they still smell really good. I have to say these CK summer fragrances are really hitting out of the park with me for being good yet cheap.

I don't get the comparisons to the 2014 edition. To me this is completely different other than it's a summer oriented scent. And 2014 to me reminds me of the beach where this reminds me of a beautiful summer day.

This one is a fresh green scent but has some sweetness to it. I don't get alot of the mojito in this. I get the lime and the green and I guess it's the guava that gives the sweetness to this. But another winner in my book. Of course the longevity and projection isn't the greatest on these scents but they last long enough for me. I'd recommend the 2014 and 2016 for anyone to try. These are the only two I've tried so far tho ")
As the name indicates, this is summer in a bottle. Smells so good, however, the longevity is not that great.
Fresh and very nice opening - but synthetic drydown (smells like dust).

I hate the fact that I like this... I hate the fact that I like it, and I hate the fact that it's strong as HECK for being a fresh scent. And it's only $18 on Notino. Seriously, it's frustrating for me, after spending $75 on a large bottle of Dior Homme Cologne as my "go-to" clean scent! I'm not saying it's going to replace my beloved Dior Homme Cologne, but this is a really good clean scent none the less!

For some reason, people keep including samples of this when I swap with them, and I'll be d*mned, it's pleasant to say the least. Even if you don't like CK One, the added coconut/mojito vibe is a very nice addition to that scent.

Smells like a day at the pool, in a bottle.

Don't get me wrong, it won't replace my favorite fresh scent and I won't be buying a full bottle, but the decants I have of this will surely get used.

With that being said, this scent makes a great gift.

One of the best Ck one summers!
The bottle itself is gorgeous as is the scent.
It smells almost identical to the 2014 version but with a little mint in the backround.
The notes that stand out the most are lime,coconut,mint and some spice thrown in, the perfect summertime scent!
Its more on the masculine side but not overly thanks to the coconut.

I bought this yesterday. Amazing scent specially the opening...alas, longevity and sillage are so poor.

Edit :Well after trying it for two days.... it did get noticed after less than an hour of applying and i got a compliment from a friend who thought it smelled fantastic. Well after like 9 hours i did get whiffs of it and this one performs much better in high heat.

Got my bottle today and decided to try it out for work. Honestly I am quite impressed for a cheapie, as the longevity, at least on me, is right up there with some of the best daytime performers I have. I get solid whiffs of it for the first 4-5 hours, then I only get whiffs of it every so often from the 6-8 hour mark. But once I get home and take a whiff from inside my undershirt, I can clearly still smell it.

As for the smell, well, after a full days use I am going to classify this scent in the same category as Mugler Cologne (which I really enjoy). There is this inherent clean freshness vibe to it, and it doesn't really come across like a cologne/perfume kinda smell, but rather a 'fresh out of shower' soapy-clean kinda smell. Just like Mugler cologne does.

I would even go out on a limb and say that if Thierry Mugler were to ever come out with a flanker to Mugler Cologne, this could have easily been it. Perhaps aptly named: Mugler Cologne - Tropical Summer.

The smell is bright, green, mildly sweet on opening, clean, fresh and tropical. And just like Mugler Cologne, this is the perfect fragrance to simply freshen up on, without making a statement that you are wearing cologne/perfume. I would say this is the perfect frag to spritz on before doing some yard work in the middle of summer, or using as a summertime work scent to remind you and others around you about those fun vacations, or just for hanging around the home taking in the summertime vibes. Yes, I would say this is definitely a summertime only kinda scent. But it could always be used in the dead of winter to remind you that summer is only a few months away (scent memory is kinda fun that way).

If you enjoy frags that are of the "clean, fresh, out of shower" type of scents, then this should be right up your alley. And if you enjoy Mugler Cologne as a scent, then I highly recommend you check out CK One Summer 2016 while it is still readily available at a cheap price.

Just received it today, this is one of the most beautiful scent from CK One Summer Line, it smells like 2014 version but sweeter, the coconut is very prominent in this, and that's a good thing, it blends perfectly with mojito, that makes it magical. I'm gonna wear this on my vacation to Vietnam & Thailand next week, this is perfect for hot summer holiday

So I've worn this a total of 4 wearing a now and I've already got this fragrance down as its a very easy fragrance to understand.

This opens up very citrusy,bright with that lime and mohito accord and then it quickly dies down to a very fresh,pleasant soapy green scent that's also slightly creamy what I guess is from that coconut note. In a nutshell this stuff is great and really caught me off guard considering the price point. Not in the way that it smells expensive but in the fact that is VERY pleasant and appealing and this lasts 6-8 hours and while this doesn't project like a beast it WILL get you noticed and leave a nice silage trail.

After having this for only 2 days I've already received compliments on how nice this smelled and a few people have asked me what I'm wearing so they can buy this the self.(((Which says a lot right there )))

Like I said in my last review I said that this doesn't smell like a fragrance but more so like a tropical smelling shampoo or body wash.

After further testing I've had this last 6-8 with 2 hours of good projection but it still leaves a good scent trail for the duration of the fragrance.

Overall rating 8.5 out of 10 ! VERY impressed with the scent and performance but can't give it a 9 because I can't put it in the same category as my top 5 faves

PS... I DID choose to pick Love for this fragrance
Love this. I'm not at all a fan of the original CK one. But this is refreshing, light, and crisp. I get citrus and green notes, with a woody base. It dries down soft and quite feminine on me.
Should receive it monday or tuesday. What do you think of it compare to 2014 ?

The mojito lime zest only lasts a few minutes on the opening before it quickly settles into a creamy coconut scent with a hint of a green note- a bit like you have just bathed with the Body Shop's coconut shower gel. Definitely different from all the previous CK One Summer versions that were mostly fruity zesty/melon type affairs, apart from the 2010 version that was a very sharp bitter citrus smell that reminded me of an older gentleman's aftershave.
This 2016 version is certainly exotic and is probably what a paradise island smells like (though I've never been to one). The downside is lack of lasting power.
Update: shockingly poor silage and longevity - what a huge let down!

This perfume is lovely and fresh and so light!! Can't stand strong perfumes in the hot weather it really is just too much - but this is light and airy. Would definitely recommend for anyone who wants a lighter Chanel chance (the green bottle one!)
Refreshing, pleasant scent for summer. More for men than for women though. I like its top and middle notes very much, but base is very woody, so if you want to buy it, you should love cedar.

Tested a spray on me at a department store.

Disclaimer: the tester bottle was different from the one pictured here. It was frosted translucent glass but did say CK One Summer and was at the same table as the green bottles. It _may_ have been a different one.

The one I tried smells like a marine-citrus shampoo. Pleasant and innofensive, but much less interesting, for me, than the original One.

Would wear it if offered (decent enough for discreet scents days), but would not buy it myself.

What woman wants to smell like an evergreen tree in the middle of summer?! To me, this fragrance fails on all fronts. I get no fruits, nothing but masculine heavy cedar. Not at all evocative of swaying palm trees.

Who would have thought. I LIKE THAT!
I am no fan of "summer editions" of fragrances in general and I could never wear the original CK one.But!

This is refreshing with some exotic-sweet sensuality and intrigue. I absolutely LOVE the green-leafy bottle. Guava/tiare/apple, yes they are hidden somewhere in there.

Still, it's all about the opening. The drydown is mediocre and that's a usual problem with cheaper/commercial frags. Don't expect any complexity, don't expect ANY coconut. It turned too quickly to a masculine ginger-lime aftershave.

But my overall opinion is that this is one of the best Summer editions of CK One.

A really nice fragrance, what I would describe as a blend of crushed citrus fruits, crushed because somehow they don't have a definite freshness. It is very pleasant, better then the last few, but I would have to agree that sillage and longevity are very poor. A skin scent I will use after a Summer shower. I can't see any soapiness with this.
This is probably the closest smell to dish washing soap I've smelled! It totally turned me off once I made the connection to soap.

A cottage into a tropical plantation.
Green leaf Chewing gum !

I love the bottle wich actually reprise the juice that is a sort of sugary fruity fresh green leaf smell. Must be this guava... Taste like ficus. Like cutted plants. Cucumber and figue.

It is very interesting, simple, warm orange and coco/tonka/vanillic notes also, plus the mentioned bitter and crude green notes.

What to say? It is a shame that us so weak.

Remember me in a far way La Perla Creation for that orange, and Armani eau de Cedre for that petrol taste. And un jardin sur le nil.

This is nice, but way too weak.
When you first spray you get the mojito,already faint, but within seconds it all turns into a skin scent. later i can recognize a very shy tiare flower. It pairs very well with the mojito, making this one more of a feminine than unisex perfume.At the end i get a bit of coconut but i really have to sniff my wrist to smell it.
I think this fragrance is great, very green, tropical and refreshing, but sillage is terrible.

What a fresh scent! On me it started off as a cool mojito enjoyed in the heat. The citruses were of course prominent from the first whiff. I also noticed an unpleasant tangy note, which I suspect is from the apple. Luckily it faded after a few minutes. As the scent developed on my skin, I noticed a sweet undertone peeping through slightly, which I believe is a mixture between the coconut and guava. I also pick up a cool almost aquatic note, which might be the minty freshness the mojito is famous for.

It´s a perfect summer scent, though I find it to be slightly too masculine for my taste!

The CK One summers are simple citrusy fresh scents with slight twists each year and great bottle designs. I've been collecting them since 2010 it's always nice start the summer with these frags, sometimes there hits (2013) and sometimes complete misses (2015). You can also find them really cheap if you shop around or online.

This years is a hit,but similar to 2014! Its a Fresh citrusy sweet floral scent- initial spray is fresh+citrusy "mojito" vibe, as it dries you get a more sweet+floral smell still with that underlying citrus smell at the end you get a soft citrusy soapy skin scent but keeping that "mojito" vibe.

This years bottle design is very nice miles better than last year it's palm trees with an embossed palm trees pattern on the back. Projection/longevity poor as usual 2 hours max. Overall 8/10 for this year's offering.

If you really want the best of the best of the CK One Summer line the 2008 edition is by far the most awesome! The 2013 edition resembles the 2008 and Yes 2015 is by far the worst ever. I sampled the 2016 version at Macy*s and I really like it!
I agree with the review below. CK One Summer 2015 is the worst, following the second place is 2010. Really lack of character. 2014 is the best year for CK One Summer.

I am in love with these Summer ones- pun intended! I am collecting what I still can pheasibly-I am not paying an arm and leg for the much older years. If I LOVE it, it will be bitter sweet anyway! First off I will say I have 2015-2011, this being the oldest one, but newest to me. I started collecting backwards, with 2014 being my first and very favorite year! It is the most feminine out of all the years I have. It's def 50/50-a truly unisex scent! It might even be too feminine for some fellas!! I don't know how feminine the years 2010-2005 were, but for unisex fragrances the rest are all a little more masculine about 60/40. The water, mint, watermelon, and cucumber notes (each have at least one) are what make them wearable for ladies. I LOVE them, but I have always loved wearing polo sport and other aquatic men's fragrances once in awhile anyway. If you love the smell of a man so much you wear those scents EVER, you'll love this line! If you love most citrus scents, you'll love this line as well. This particular scent is nice, very citrus and aquatic, but the kicker in this scent of me is the fern. It's def a more green scent that the others because of that! It makes this one unique, as well as the awesome bottle! The 2015-2013 bottles were all more similar in color schemes, so this one stands out for that reason as well! They are going quick, this is the oldest year I was able to get reasonably! eBay is still rocking them, so don't hesitate!
I still wonder what the Romanian flag is doing on the bottle xD

I absolutely LOVE this particular edition of CK SUMMER! It is my all time favorite, I am so sad I cannot buy it anymore…! The other versions of CK summer do not even come close to this one. A one of a kind! So perfectly fresh and sweet at the same time. A perfect summer fragance. I will never like a perfume so much anymore. I could wear this all my life!

This smells pleasant, I can see a dude or chick pull it off easy; so it is thoroughly unisex, it is quite linear(which isn't bad since it smells good), I don't have a problem with longevity and it's a cheapy, I don't see why not.

Just 2 days ago i have purchsed this fragrance its amazing it makes me fresh and clean really good 1 for CK*..Love it love it:D NIce bottle,, I advise every1 to wear this summer fragrances U wont regret NEVVEERRRRR!!!!

I will never understand these Perfume Company or Retail End Marketing practices...my only REAL perfume counter in my small town got this as a tester but NO stock for sale?!? Now, according to my "best girl", it is far too late in the season for us to get any summer flankers, at all! *sighs* The same thing happened with Le Male 2011, and Eternity Summer (men's and women's), so now they will all end up in some drawer, or in a dark back room at the store; and no one can buy this beauty...and a beauty it is!

I was a bit skeptical of the notes listed as they seemed like a "mish-mash" of earlier editions, and the flacon being tri-colored only added to my fears...but, lo and behold...this is gorgeous! It has "citricity" but is not overly biting or zesty (the tangerine and light lime are exquisite) and I do not get the melon ("calone") so much, as a supremely satisfying fern note (like real lush ferns growing outside in the woods or in a cool wooded area). There is a slight sweetness, but nothing too sticky or saccharine. As it begins to evaporate, I get the freesia (somewhat warm and powdery floral) and the rhubarb blends seemlessly with the lush fern to make something just a bit different from all the other ck One summers, but still comfortably familiar. Warm subtle greens and and more of a "marine" breeze (rather than actual "watery" notes) swirl about and never "crowd" the central theme here. The drydown takes a nice cedar note, rubs it with musk adds a twist of soft fruitiness and tops it off with a dollop of incense smoke, intruiging and not oriental or dark, just enough. All in all, THIS summer flanker is (IMO) worth buying and considering the longevity (better than last years, by far) and that the price for a 100 ml EDT has only gone up two US dollars...this is a "getter" and a "keeper" for sure!!

Sillage: quite good

This is still available on the companies web site (for now); and as soon as I can, I am SO getting one! I have a plethora of cK scents already and am usually am quite skeptical of seasonal flankers (also SPORT, ICE and EAU FRAICHE, etc...) but THIS has to be smelled and (if you are like moi) owned. It is at once FRESH, cool, bright and lushly green with just enough florals and vegetal notes to intruige but NOT smell just like everything else out there. I can almost swear I get a lotus or water lily note hanging around in the background. Yes...it is mass market; and YES it is summery, however it IS very nice!!

This CK One Summer is more like a Aromatic Fruity to me. It is like a fruity cocktail drink party here. I get a lot of melon, some tangerine, some tangy rhubarb, and sweet peach with a drop of zesty lemon. Then the scent gets slightly green (but not aquatic) and still stay fresh and fruity, but then it gets a tiny bit plasticky as well. I don't think I get an incense here or anything that is obviously woody. It can be easily worn by anybody.

For a summer scent, the staying power isn't all that great. Think of it as a vacation, it doesn't last but it's all good time while it does. I spray it all over my both arms and it lasts about 3 hours max on my skin. Anyhow, I am looking forward to collect one, what a beautiful collectible bottle, at the right price.

An unknown destination, the rhythm of the music, a beach party on a summer night... Calvin Klein presents the 2011 version of ck one summer. A stimulating, refreshing fragrance with citrus, aromatic, fresh and green notes. Limited edition, for him and her, all night long.
The fragrance’s opening unveils refreshing notes of mandarin and melon underscored by a fougere accord. The more bracing heart unites waves of lime and rhubarb with a sea-spray scent, while the trail blends facets of cedar and moss.

This is the best blended floral perfume i've smelled. Even if it's freezing outside and the leaves are crunching on the ground, if the sun decides to peak round for a bit of winter shine this perfume is still more than appropriate. This is bright and happy and friendly, imagine a golden retriever in a flower garden.

I confess that normally Calvin Klein scents don't really last on me, so I haven't given them much attention. But Eternity Moment was a gift from a beautiful friend, and I knew I owed it to her to give it a try — and I am so glad I did. This is happiness in a bottle! Others are right to say it’s uplifting and makes you feel instantly happy — a real mood lifter. It smells pretty, and I feel pretty wearing it — a very feminine, clean, sparkly scent that lingers softly on the skin without ever being overpowering. It has that delicate balance of freshness and sweetness that makes it perfect for everyday wear, yet special enough for those moments when you want to feel effortlessly elegant. I have worn it everyday since I got it and am a bit sad that winter is on its way when I know I will start leaning towards warmer, snuggly scents...or will I? I know this is going to be a repeat buy for me!
I don’t like it smells a little bit like ultraviolet rabanne for women

Really beautiful floral scent, makes me happy when I smell it and was hoping to have it as an easy to reach for signature scent until I made the mistake of wearing it on one of the hottest summer days out in the sun and it turned indolic which threw me off 🥲. Still will keep it in my collection and try again once I’ve gotten over the shock haha. If you like floral, pink scents I would definitely recommend. I think spring and early summer might be best times to wear it.

With such a cult following, many of the Eternity flankers have thrived through the decades. This one particularly, although released over 20 years ago, doesn't feel dated. In fact, it's a composition we love and recognize today with it's floral lychee notes and an effervescent fruitiness. As oppose to the og Eternity which has more of a mature, almost vintage scent, this one is young, fresh, sweet and playful. It's an easy grab for Spring/Summer as it's inoffensive and leaves a soft but still perceived scent trail. It has good longevity and is just so uplifting to catch as you move around through the day.

Eternity Moment and I had a bit of a love-hate relationship at first. There were moments I wasn’t sure about it… but somehow, it kept growing on me. And before I knew it, it became one of my most-used perfumes — especially on those days when I had no idea what to wear.

It’s effortless, feminine, and just works. Whether I’m running errands or heading out for a casual dinner, this scent always feels right. I used up my 100ml bottle with genuine joy — something that doesn’t happen often in my collection!

It might not be the most complex or niche, but there’s a comforting charm and reliability in it that I’ve truly come to appreciate.
A cheap chemical mess. I always thought Calvin Klein fragrances were overrated. This one really proves my point.

I personally don’t detect any fruity notes in this scent, only floral ones. Perhaps I’m just sensitive to jasmine, which I’m not particularly amazed by, but all I can smell is jasmine with a hint of lily. It has a clean and fresh floral aroma. While it's not groundbreaking, I still like it, and my mom absolutely loves it; it suits her perfectly! There’s definitely something confident and feminine about this scent.
Floral, yes. Fresh, maybe. Uplifting? This scent is so bitter to my nose. It might be the rosewood coming through. You have to have a strong nose and a commanding personality to wear this..

Ps. I didn’t like the original much because it was cooler and had a weird unpleasant note that worked bad with my chemistry. It doesn’t show up in Moments so im really happy about it. I love this perfume :)

I am always on the look for fruity scents so when I saw the melon and guava notes on this one I decided to give it a try. At first I didn't really love it, I wished the fruitiness was a little more present and I couldn't really pick out the guava that much. But after some time I found myself reaching for it more and more.
Now I actually like it, I can pick out a lot of the guava and melon on the first hour and it's a pleasant scent after it develops. You can pick it up as you move throughout the day. The only thing I'd change would be to tone down the musk a bit since it can be a little overpowering at first.
Peony and Rose shampoo scent.

I got it from a friend who was flying in the winter 2025 and bought perfumes tax free.
I prayed on my wrist and rubbed my other wrist on it and I was totally overwhelmed by how STRONG and heavy it was. This was not a subtle scent as described. All I could smell was lots and lots of Jasmine and Lilly and it was so heavy I felt it was headache inducing. I don't smell any of the top notes at all. I only smell sticky heavy floral.

The time passed and after 1-2 hours I smelled it again with the same result. Jasmine and Lilly overload . It is not fresh and light. It is heavy and too much. An old lady perfume you pick up long before you actually is near the old lady who wears it. Maybe I got a bad batch? Maybe I have a super sensitive nose but I got a headache from this because it was so overpowering. I tried to wash it off but it stuck to my skin even if I used soap and warm water. I can't understand the other reviews at all. Gentle and light?!

I will ignore this bottle for a while and try in the spring again. When it is warmer outside. Maybe spray on my knee or something so it appears far away from my nose. If I get the same reaction then this will be my new toilet spray when the cat has used his litter box. Or I try to spray it inside my summer wardrobe far away from my bedroom. Maybe it will smell nice in 4 months. I can't even imagine spraying it and going to bed for a calmer sleep. This perfume is too LOUD!

I was flying back home from an amazing holidays with my LDR partner who always wears CK ONE, and decided I needed a cappuccino. While looking for it at the menu, my eye got suddenly caught by a fragrance page, where I notice two CK presented. Really ,just out of nostalgia for my partners amazing smell ( because CK ONE is unisex and I could be as well wearing it myself , but I don't find it feminine enough so that wasn't an option for me), I gave myself in, and made a totally blind buy, just because we both like symbolical things and I thought it would be lovely to both have some casual CK on us, while apart..

Braved up to open it just the next day evening ( I'm not that lucky on blind buying the fragrances :D), I was so positively surprised, that this fragrance was really just the thing I was looking for for a quite some time.

Although the design of the bottle looks and feels a little cheap , the aroma itself was beautifully combined of the sweetness and a little fresh spark, that makes it just perfect for everyday use. It was strong enough to feel when entering the room, and it still lingers on my clothes hours after I have sprayed it, but not too overwhelming that it would become distressing. It is very simple, clean and what some would call generic, but I believe that's what makes it so universal and nice. I can sense white flowers in abundance, especially lily of the valley ( although it's not in the composition, strangely enough I can sense its delicate aroma there), and a jasmine.
Can't tell about the berries - as I was imagining more fruity opening, but I can't say it feels very present.

Overall, after the first notes had dried down, I realized there was something more and very dreamlike - the undertone I could remember from the fragrance my grandmom used to wear when she was still alive ( her favorite fragrance was from Oriflame and it was a little pink bottle with a new moon on it, titled ECLAT, and as far as I know they don't produce this aroma anymore)...and this sentiment, of course, blew my mind..

Eternity Moments are also my first perfumes I tried to use before I go to bed ( I read here, some of you tend to do that and decided to try, mm what a good idea, thank you) :) ...and they made me feel so soothed and relaxed, I was really surprised it works that way too.

Delicate but noticeable, very feminine, versatile for everyday use, and I would also say, despites it's generic nature it still has a hint of individuality, Eternity Moments is a pretty safe Blind buy for anyone who loves white flower compositions,( maybe not that perfect as a gift if you giving it to someone who appreciates the beauty and feeling of the bottle itself ), but the aroma itself is so satisfying, sentimental and dreamy, that the bottle didn't bother me after all.. Really simple and modest, but so satisfying aroma.

I received so many compliments wearing this!
My boyfriends mother gave me this as a Christmas gift, and she said she wears it herself. It’s so fresh and pleasant. I love it! Perfect for daytime.

I’ve worn it in hot weather recently and it was beautiful but I just prefer to wear it when I said I do. When I did wear it couple days in hot weather it kinda took away that crisp freshness to it that’s the only reason why I don’t wear it that much in summer.

A subtle, comforting scent with slightly jarring additions of watery tropical fruits. These notes themselves are inoffensive, but clash harshly with the lighter white florals. The scent is somehow soapy without being clean, becoming much more musky and sweet woody once dried. Very intimate silage and underwhelming lasting power. Overall, a bit too juvenile for its intended market, even for a youthful warm weather scent.

I chose Eternity Moment over a couple of other selections sampled in store and it won me over for my next floral fresh everyday spring time fragrance.
It’s not complex but that’s why I chose it, sometimes I just want a light scent to uplift me when I’m working from home or just enjoying a chill day off.
It has a fresh fruity opening with the florals coming through instantly, it then dries down into a musky skin scent. Not a strong projection or long lasting but for the price you can feel comfort in respraying often.

I have tested it in perfume store, This perfume Flory fresh with a little of sweetness, The most note I had smelled was the Pure Jasmine and white flowers. I think this is safe choise and acceptable to majorty of people, you can buy it blind buy.

Very feminine cozy balanced easy to wear. very suitable to wear during the day, in Summer and Spring seasons. Sure it's lasts long.


لقد جربته في متجر العطور، هذا العطر منعش برائحة الزهور مع القليل من الحلاوة، وأكثر ما شممت رائحته كانت رائحة الياسمين النقي والزهور البيضاء. أعتقد أن هذا اختيار آمن ومقبول لدى أغلب الناس، يمكنك شراؤه شراء ً أعمى.

أنثوي للغاية ومريح ومتوازن وسهل الارتداء. مناسب جدًا للارتداء أثناء النهار وفي فصلي الصيف والربيع. بالتأكيد يدوم طويلاً.

Very pretty and aquatic fruity floral.
Opens with a fresh and lightly sweet litchi & raspberry before it settles into a fresh bouquet of peonies, jasmine, and waterlilies. Gets muskier as it dries down but the fresh and clean floral profile is still present.
Warm and hot weather only, perfect for a casual day running errands, an inoffensive office scent, or just lounging about.

I bought this nice perfume private, because I was looking for peonies, jasmins and litchis, witch I love the smell of, and, this beauty delivered!

It is very fresh and green, and, it also remind me of another of my beautiful perfumes; L'Eau d'Issey Florale by Issey Miyake, they are in fact sisters! And, they smell wonderful together!

I'm trying to leave a message at "This perfume reminds me of..", about these two sisters, but, it's sumting wrong with the side/Fragrantica, cause it doesnt work with neither of my machines.

Anyway, happy summer to all of you smelling good people out there!!!

I received this as a gift last year.
A very feminine floral scent, pretty generic.
It smells nice... just nice, nothing more.
I wear it pretty often despite not absolutely loving it since I don't want to use my other more unique perfumes when I'm just running errands that day.
I'll be giving it away soon because I've grown tired of it. (used up 30% of the bottle)

I have both Eternity and Eternity Moment, and I really don't need both. E Moment is fresher when you put your nose to the skin, but the sillage/projection is pure original Eternity, at least to my nose.

Smells like a warm and sparkling rose bouquet. I can really smell the rose in this, even though it isn't a main note. Or could that be the peonies???

Reminds me of my youth as it was one of my first perfumes. 😊

I can kind of understand the 'generic' comments, but to me this is quite a memorable perfume, which is playful, romantic and mood-lifting.

Perfect for a job interview or first date as it's uncontroversial.

Has fairly good projection and staying power for the price.

I hate it. I know it's all about out own PH anyway. I gave it a chance in different climates and temperatures and the result was the same.
It's unbearably strong on me, I can't stand using it, it gives me a headache.
It was a blind buy, I remember that as a child my aunt used it and it suited her very well.
While I had it I used it one summer to spray it into the garbage container.

The middle notes (floral) are too overpowering too much lily and jasmine, less rose and unfortunately the passion flower is not detected here. The top notes (fruity) are not felt at all, some sandalwood is rescued from the base notes.

If you like Jasmine and Lily this will be your cup of tea.
Cheap and cheerful !!! Ok for everyday wear/ running errands & would be a safe blind buy for a floral lover.

I much prefer moment to the OG eternity,
mainly because here we lose that slightly sickening sun cream note.

This is cheap and cheerful, potent, simple, playful, and very sweet.
Has some similar DNA to many floral street fragrances, but at a fraction of the price.

I don't get a whole lot of distinctive notes really, it's just a big cloud of floral/fruit.

VERDICT:
Definitely for teenage girls,
A bit basic, and I have no urge to buy a bottle -
But at it's price, it does a great job.
A dead ringer for Elizabeth Arden "Splendor", which I used to have. But a little more mature and screechy.

My mom always wore the original Eternity which I loved and I was searching for my own floral twist. Eternity moment did not disappoint. Small undertones of the original Eternity with hints of a flower bouquet. A mature scent yet wearable by younger women, I find it to be very feminine and safe. I do find it to be somewhat basic in its floral scent but for the price you can usually find this for it’s worth having on the shelf.
For me this scent falls into rather generic floral category, I wouldn’t distinguish this out of other perfumes, but either way, it is a quite lovely floral perfume, especially once it settles down.
A nice, floral, but alas like it’s name it only lasts a moment so I returned it. You have to really like jasmine and water lily to appreciate this Calvin Klein.
smell lily of the vally and lilac. Weird, these notes are not there

Really safe floral, generic buy you would grab from the airport duty free store or to give as a gift. If you enjoy floral scents you will like this one.
I usually use it before I go to bed or on a Sunday to run errands. very basic and calm floral scent. Great buy for the price.

I like to call this ,,the background perfume''. It's a normal day, not much is happening. Stay at home, take a shower, do some reading but I want to smell something nice. Not too strong or heavy. Just a nice smell to give this slow day background, like music does.
Que bonito és!, floral dulce y suave y un poco empolvado con buena duración de estela suave, salida un poco fuerte pero enseguida asienta, huele limpio, queda bien en el día a día y atemporal.

I tested this in store today, and was strongly reminded of a scent I couldn’t pinpoint. After several hours of sniffing it suddenly hit me: it reminds me of 5th Avenue. While they have very different notes, one very prominent note is the same. This is quite a lovely fragrance if you’re into florals. It’s quite chic and elegant too. In the opening the Jasmin is quite prominent, which gives it depth and sets it apart it from 5th Avenue, the rose also separates them, but the vibe is extremely similar. In the dry down they’re almost the same, although I haven’t tried them side by side.
This is a lovely fragrance at a great price point. I do think 5th Avenue is just a tad more interesting, and if you already have one, you don’t need the other, unless you live this scent profile so much you want everything that smells similar with subtle differences.

This is an easy office friendly scent, that does make a safe blind buy if you enjoy floral scents. It won’t rock your world, but it’s a lovely go to scent for a sweet price.

By the notes listed I expected something more feminine but this is really sour and it’s no sweetness. It’s like sour soap, I love the soap part but that loud sour in the forefront really takes over and never leaves. I wonder which note that is so I can steer clear of buying fragrances with that note in it. It doesn’t subside either and it’s screechy. I like this scent and I just grin and bear it when I wear this cuz the soapy smell is really nice!— if only that gross sour part wasn’t there then this would’ve been a winner.
smells like rose scented wet wipes... i really very liked on my friend. it smells very fresh and fruity but it's just wet wipes on me.
She is a pretty pretty girl which leaves the party way too early. It's the classic curse of eau de toillettes and a few eau de parfums. I wish she would last. :(

this is a fresh out the rose petal bath fragrance, a watery fruity floral scent that is overall clean & fresh, sweet without any stickiness or gourmand essence, just a simple pristine fragrance. what pink smells like :) it reminds me of a litchi soap I once got in paris. the waterlily stands out as a key note, whilst the raspberry & melon was a bit lost on me. this was a blind buy that was well worth it, its significantly less alcoholic-smelling as the traditional Eternity fragrance, but maintains the warm wateriness & clean vibe. its not what I would choose for a night out but definitely something in the morning after a shower, before work or errands. it feels like the freshness of spring, or walking through just-watered gardens.

Smells like fresh roses.
Lasts several hours on my skin. I only feel the roses on me.
I think it can maybe be too strong for ppl who easily gets headache/migraine. I think its just amazing.

This actually smells nice.
But it's not for me. Finally let go of my bottle
Lasts forever, suited for spring

What a pleasant surprise this blind buy of Eternity Moment is for me. I just couldn’t resist the massive discount it was being sold for online, but I honestly didn’t expect that I would like it as much as I do.

There is something very bright, bubbly and refreshing about the opening for me that makes me think of champagne. I just got this delivered yesterday morning and wore it all day. sprayed some on again at night and it was the first scent I reached for this morning. It just knocked my Christian Dior Sakura mini obsession out of the way.

My teenage daughter said it reminds her of a mojito so I guess she is also feeling the bubbly refreshing notes like I am. I can’t even pick out the melon, guava notes because everything is so well blended together. The dry down notes work great on me. I can smell the sandalwood with some other woody notes nicely rounded on my skin. I have zero complains about the sillage and longevity being moderate because I only paid $10 for a 100ml bottle.

It brings back some youthful, happy feeling for me so I am very satisfied with it and I will purchase it again if I find it at a bargain price, so my daughter can have one for herself too. I much prefer it to the original Eternity.
reminds me very much of laura ashleys "emma" perfume, very very pretty floral

My friend didn't want this any longer and so gave me her bottle to try. This is strong to begin and really makes me think of the cold / hot play off of the elements in the original eternity. Overall this is a fresh feeling, slightly watery, slightly sappy floral. The waterlily to me is the thing that I think gives it that feel. It's also quite musky and linear and a little woody. This one isn't special for me, it just makes me think of shampoo really. It's a clean soap like watery floral version of eternity.

I got a full 100ml bottle for several years, but I just can't use it. It's a pleasant inoffensive scent, however I want to scrub it off every time I try to spray it. There's something that bothers me, I find the same note in Versace Dylan Blue, even if these are two completely different perfumes. I wish I can detect that note to avoid it in the future

Me recuerda a el olor de las cartas intercambiables de mi infancia, Olor suave pero duradero, secado fantástico a flores con un toque dulcecito, perfecto para uso diario, quedando bien para cualquier edad y en cualquier época, me parece superversatil y bonito, me encanta!!!!

A nice, clean linen/detergent kind of scent. Very fresh and aquatic with strong florals, I don’t get the fruits even in the opening. I wouldn’t advise anyone to blind buy this, I bought this because of the fruity notes, but the only fruit I get is a little hint of lychee 10 mins after drydown. I don’t dislike it. It’s a good smell that I’ll use to feel fresh and clean in work environments or if I want a bedtime comforter. 👍
One of my all time favourites. Feminine and romantic, I wore this on my wedding day. Think lychee, raspberry, and pink florals but not too sweet, with an effervescent champagne quality.
Good choice for summer nin offensive citrussy smell
like other people said, it just smells like shampoo

this is very floral, bit dated but inoffensive. Like another reviewer said its an equivalent of sensible shoe. Nothing standout about this scent, not really. I don't get fruity notes at all, its mostly greenish type floral with no distingushing qualities. I will use it during summertime or before bed or something but I would never repurchase. Its only saving grace is lasting power as it lasts longer than lot of other florals

The perfume equivalent of wearing a sensible shoe.
It's fine, no one will complain, but where's the effort?

First 10 minutes are terrible, I thought it’s going to be scrub off for sure, but then it slowly gets better and better until clean good old fashion soap, which is pleasant. Wonder what was that terrible note that bugs me so much in the begging, was it guava?

Used to wear it on dates and has been a safe scent that goes well with my skin. This scent always got me compliments and also a very memorable scent. It stays on for clothes even after washing multiple times, it stays on for literally an eternity!

in theory this should be an inoffensive perfume, fresh, light and pleasant, but it smells like the sound of cray screeching against a board, forks repeatedly scraping harshly on one plate and it has too many similarities with rusty metal after it's been sitting in the rain. smells like wet dog.

I haven’t tried this scent but the reason I’m here is to highly recommend CK Eternity Flame. I know many of us fragrance lovers are susceptible to a Calvin Klein blind buy, and the reviews here look mostly lackluster. I have had good luck with some CK scents that I didn’t expect much from and Flame is one I will absolutely buy again. You might find it nicer than Moment.
i mean it’s a safe fragrance for a woman.

A sharp and nauseating melon floral. Wanted to like it for the passionflower note; hate it for the water lily/peony/melon combo. Really terrible, one that lingers through multiple scrubbings. Reminiscent of the modern Chloe, but add some nasty melon.

I got this as a birthday gift from my boyfriend, the initial scent is very floral and motherly in a sense.

It dries down very fruity in my opinion. Very feminine and soft, he likes it on me and I don't hate it (coming from someone who hates floral notes) so I think it's a win.

If you want a simple soft scent with a hint of fruitiness wrapped in a soft warm fuzzy blanket. You will definitely like this fragrance.

blind buying this because the review and the notes looks promising. it is not. smells very cheap and artificial. i don't really smell the litchi, but the raspberry and musk notes were strong. the dry down smells like cardboard on my skin 😣😣😣 maybe it just doesn't go well with my body's chemistry.

Smells like sitting in a a bubble bath as a kid with shampoo in your hair that smells fruity. Youre playing mix and match of all the gels and shampoos within your arms reach and having a blast of fresh and sweet smells in your nose.

I bought this as a blind buy because it was a great price, and you usually can't go wrong with a CK fragrance.

Unfortunately, I forgot why I didn't like Eternity in the 90's and this flanker I am getting the same experience. For some reason, the opening top notes are so screechy and astringent that does not go away for most of the wear. I get this when fragrances are too aquatic or fresh, like Cool Water, where it just hits me right at the nostrils.

Due to this, I am not able to really catch the nuances of the notes. I'll try again during hot weather and see how this goes.

Peony, jasmine, and litchi are the most stand out here. Other fruity notes make this perfume cheerful, and the woodsy notes in the list are the settler that prevent this to become too aquatic.

I love EM for its simplicity and how transparent and airy this one is. It smells so pleasant, far from complex. This is one of the perfumes that I would reach for when my mood is good and I have a peaceful mind.

Perfume has a special memory attached to it and also it has my favorite note which is fruity lychee. It is perfect for summer and Early mornings. Definitely going to buy it again. It was really affordable price at Marshall’s

This was one of my very first perfumes, probably when I was just a young teen, got it from my mom. She wore/wears it too - we both always has one bottle in hour collection - for almost 20 years now.. It's just such a great, every day perfume, not offensive, classic in my opinion. I will always have bottle of this, along with CK one, kicking around on my shelf.
Floral shampoo that's all 😑

Tested this on a strip.

This is my kind of fragrance, fresh, floral and gorgeous.
I'd buy a bottle in a heartbeat.

Calvin Klein make some great perfumes.

This was a blind buy for me from Ross a while back. At first I didn’t really like it because it was too… I don’t know, kind of grapefruit-y? I have a hard time describing perfumes lol.

So I put it in Facebook marketplace to sell and it has sat in the trunk of my car for a couple months with no hits on Facebook. Well every time I opened my trunk something smelled really good. Not sure if it was this or a Bath and Body Works lotion that I have in there somewhere.

Well I decided to give this scent another chance and I love it now! Very floral and kind of powdery, a little fruity but not too much. Definitely has good sillage and can be smelled coming off my neck and wrists. I’m definitely going to need more of this scent! Luckily I see it at Ross a lot.

I had to review this perfume in case anyone saw that it was compared to Gucci Envy Me on here and believed that! It definitely doesn't smell like that and I remember that one well. The only similarities are probably the first initial burst of freshness with this one. Nonetheless, I was disappointed with this! It's super screechy and head-ache inducing floral. All I smell is sharp and loud lily. It's strong and not in a good way. I actually love florals and those are my favorite notes in a perfume but this one is simply too overwhelming. I made the mistake of spraying it multiple times on my neck and felt nauseated for a while. I do think it smells summery and fresh in its own way but there are way better perfumes out there that aren't so damn screechy. Beware !

This is such an interesting scent! Our live-in nanny used to wear Eternity all the time, and I’d compliment her each time. Because I was so intrigued, I got Eternity Moment. While I loved the smell, I wouldn’t reach for it as much, don’t ask me why. It’s a gorgeous sparkling fruity floral. I get the sweetness, probably from the litchi, and the melon and raspberry. It’s almost effervescent. However, after months of having it and not reaching for it, I gave it to my nanny.

Oh. My. God. I realised I loved smelling it on her. I think it’s got to do with how well the perfume projects. It’s a room filler for sure, although I do notice that the smell is gone fairly quickly. But when I can smell it, it is truly gorgeous. I think this is one of the perfumes that needs to be appreciated from the distance. Whatever it is, I am glad I get to smell this one.
My 2nd favorite floral perfume after marc jacobs daisy eau so fresh. It's so refreshing, light, and feminine. Makes me feel surrounded with flowers.

I blind bought this after seeing it reviewed by some youtubers I trust. At first spray on the cardboard box all I got was jasmine and musk, like jlo glow but sweeter. I was pretty disappointed bc that scent profile gets to me after a while. But when I sprayed it on my wrist it was totally different. It started with the litchi and raspberry with that jas/musk profile very light behind it. On the dry down it is totally melon, 90s melon, reminds me a lot of ck escape type of melon. It generally feels very fresh and green. This makes me think of being outside, a great one for being out in nature on warm days. I will definately wear this, but likely wont repurchase.

Someone gifted me Eternity Moment by Calvin Klein as a Christmas present. When I sprayed it on a piece of paper, it smelled decent & generic. But when I sprayed it on my skin, it literally smelled like a cat litter box or some animal. I believe it was the base note of musk in it that was unbearable for me. It didn’t mix well with my body chemistry at all. I desperately wanted to wash it off my skin after spraying it. It instantly made me nauseous and I wanted to gag. My mother loves this fragrance (I don’t know why) so I gave it to her.

I have to say I don’t love this perfume. It’s not bad but it’s not good or memorable. It definitely has a fresh kind of smell to it but in a very generic kind of way. I use it as a air freshener for my bathroom
It's too generic, smells like flowers and some tropical fruits.
Generic fruity floral, smells like a cheap drugstore perfume. Really simple fragrance, no character. Might be a nice gift for a young girl, otherwise not worth it.

This might be generic or boring to some. But I find it perfect for out of the shower or when going for a walk/hiking (yes, I wear perfume when hiking lol). Mixes well with sweat or damp skin without getting nasty. It also mixes well with nature? If you get what I mean. Blends well without "taking away" the experience of a mountain hike or being too intrusive.
It's fresh, clean and soapy, quite shower gel like. Has a wateriness. I think one wouldn't enjoy it if you dislike squeaky clean scents. Definitely predominately floral, however I also get a pear vibe, even though pear is not listed? This is very fresh compared to fruit-choulis, but doesn't have the citrusy aspect very many "freshies" have.
Not very unique but it does the job without breaking the bank!
A sweet and fruity generic perfume.

It was my first blind buy and initially I was very satisfied with it. 🌸 It's a day time fragrance which, while being floral and delicate, is not overly sweet. As it develops and the head notes fade away, the woody notes kick in. I'm not as happy with it as in the beginning, it seems a little too banale and simple, like an air freshener. Not my vibe anymore

Another blind buy 🙈
I must admit that I was pretty scared, some of the reviews make it seem like this scent is horrible.
Thanks to YT, I took my chances - what a win for the price.
I like it a lot, clean, fresh a tad bit sweet, perfect for spring and walks.
If you like floral(think pink) you'll like this one
How can anyone hate this is beyond me🙁
It does have a similar vibe to Versace bright crystal - EDT
This is a 'dumb' reach really

Very loud and way too many floral notes in there! It’s confusing!! drydown is better but that’s a long time to wait! I get a headache with this one but it’s much better than eternity (that one almost killed me).
It's exactly like any cheap drugstore floral scent. Except, it's not that cheap. Pass.
Imagine a date with Scarlet Johansson and you’re bored to death! That’s this perfume. Pretty…Boring.

If you look on my profile you'll see I like everything, this I can't stand. I got it as a gift, used it as a air freshener. Now it's just sitting in my perfume drawer, I never touch it, I don't know what it is about it.
To me, it smells like an annoying person, even tho one of my coworkers uses it, on her its fine but I still think it doesn't suit her. IDK?! Never has such a reaction from a fragrance 😕
Anyway, it smells cheap sharp childish.
Reminds me of a floor cleaner my grandmother used when I was a child, straight lilly of the valley, artificial.
Just got a headache from smelling it now, bleah.
My partner is not a fan either
This smells dominantly like lilies. Do not be fooled by the notes and reviews it does not smell fresh or fruity.
Opens with a melon and guava smell. Sort of musky or musty? like smelling the bottom of a cantaloupe mixed with the flowers Jasmine and Peony. I do like it.

I tried in store, I thought it was overbearing and synthetic at first, but after a couple of hours it's just lovely. The sillage is not very good, though. If it was stronger I'd buy a bottle as it's always on offer...but I can't be bothered to respray all the time.
This smells way better in cooler fall weather.

I have to say, I really wasn’t expecting to love this one as much as I do. I own both the original Eternity and Eternity Now. I love them both so I didn’t think I needed this one. I was shopping in Marshall’s one day when I saw a few one ounce bottles and thought what the hell? I was also surprised to see this one period because I thought it had been discontinued years ago. I spritzed it on and thought basically what everyone else is saying here which is hmmmm, nice! Pretty generic and basic but nice! After an hour went by though, I started getting whiffs of this deeply rosy, woody sensual scent. Like the original, this one definitely needs time to develop.

I have plenty of soapy, fresh out of the shower scents. And yes, I am partial to that. I guess I am a pretty basic bish and a one trick pony when it comes to perfume. I love stuff that smells naturally like what lingers after a hot shower or what just subtly adds to the clean smell of my skin, hair or clothes. Eternity Moment is that and it does simple very well. It’s sort of hard to describe but it has the same vibe as Cerutti 1881 which I am obsessed with. I am not saying that they smell exactly alike but they both make me feel really clean, ladylike and put together. If you mixed Cerruti with J Lo’s Miami Glow and added a little bit of Britney’s Believe that might come close to describing Eternity Moment. If you like any of those perfumes, you would probably really enjoy it. I have recently discovered that I love the rosewood note in most fragrances and it’s prevalent in this one. I was afraid that the melon note was going to be too strong but I can barely detect it. Thank God because for me, melon just goes acrid on my skin. The raspberry, passion flower, guava, peony, cashmere and musk blend so well and create that sexy ‘your freshly washed skin but a little better’ effect that I like so much. This is different from the original Eternity and Eternity Now. EM would be like the romantic, girlier flanker of the three to me. I don’t feel unisex here, this is straight up femme. Eternity Now would be like the summer version or eau fraiche version of Eternity. I don’t think EM and EN smell alike. All three are beautiful in different ways but I think EM is my favorite right now. There’s just something special here that was a nice surprise.

The bottle that I bought in store was pretty good but it didn’t perform the way that I wanted it to. Maybe all the bottles circulating the discount shops are watered down because the reviews on here were saying that the longevity/sillage were really good when it first came out. I think there’s something to that because I managed to get an older bottle. Older formulations are made in the U.S., the juice is a darker gold and the stickers on the bottom are metallic. Comparatively, the newer bottles are made in France, the juice is a paler pink/gold and the stickers are clear. I thought my older bottle had turned at first because it smelled a little smoky and stale. After a half hour went by, it became that amazingly clean scent only deeper and longer lasting. It lasts past six hours and the sillage was in fact perfect. It’s not heady or suffocating but I could smell it as I moved around at work. Someone described wearing this after a hot shower with a cup of tea and a book. Maybe a Yankee candle is lit up nearby, the windows are open, and you can start to feel the breeze that’s tickling the curtains. The pitter-patter of rain commences as you snuggle into your favorite blanket. I think that perfectly encapsulates the vibe. Cozy, cottagecore, N-I-C-E ness. I feel like this can be worn in all seasons. It’s so subtle that I don’t think the weather really impacts performance but that’s just on my skin. I loved it in summer and now it’s transitioning nicely into fall.

This IS really similar to Oscar de la Renta’s Flor. After falling so hard for EM, I had to try it. Flor is the green sister while Eternity Moment is the fruity-woody sister. Both are stunning! Flor doesn’t last as long but the sillage is a little better. I guess fragrances like these are getting phased out right now but they feel pretty classic. In my humble opinion, these are both cheap, well-made, good performing fragrances. Try them if you’re into the freshies.

I was gifted a full bottle by a friend and I just never liked it. Every time I've put it on, it gives me a headache/makes me gag. Too bad, because I don't think I'm one of those people who can't stand florals. (Red Door is one of my all-time-faves) And the Eternity for Men is a BIG favourite with both my husband and I. Strange. Wish I could pinpoint the exact note that doesn't agree with me, but alas. One of the few unused, can't-stand-it perfumes I (unfortunately) own.

Very flowery and fresh. Moderate sillage and longevity. It's a great spring/summer scent, great for a little casual luxury. Not getting much melon or peony, but I smell lots of raspberry and water lily. Relatively inexpensive given the product quality.

Very very light version of Oscar de la rentas flor
Its meh to me. Its way too light. If it just had a deeper musk and a dominant note to ride on the musk, then it would be fine. It is summer time so this may be better in different weathers, we shall see 😚 otherwise it's pleasant but just too safe for my personality, too quiet and subdued.
