Ill also try using this as a layer top fragrance maybe just layer it with flor for added power, although flor is strong just how i like it😉. You know, i cant stand sugary scents, but i own tons of them. The sugar juices are all missing something floral, so i think ill try adding this to finish off my sugar bombs. It just might work!
beautiful floral fragrance. My 14 year old loves it and layers hers with a vanilla body spray. it wears well alone or with layers.
this is a soft, floral, clean, calm, peaceful scent, every time I change a perfume, I come back to this one <3 <3

Wow I finally found a Calvin Klein perfume that I really like during the entire wear. It started for me with a burst of yummy fruity scents with the melon leading the way, which quickly develops into a lovely floral bouquet of delightful scents. I really notice the lily, jasmine and rose notes which make a beautiful scent.

Moment gives off a big enticing scent that lasted on me all day and I could softly smell it in the morning. Oh yes the dry down was a very nice light musk cashmere woody scent that was just alluring, husband verified. I would repurchase this perfume for it works great in this cold weather right now and can see using in honestly all year around.

A safe blind buy for floral lovers with hints with fruit, touch of musk with the florals leading 90% of the way. Good for day and night use, jeans or dresses .

I'm wearing this today, and I'm really liking it. On me, this fragrance starts very alcoholic, but after 10 minutes it becomes an intense floral/berry blend. As it settled, I detected clearly raspberry, rose and jasmine.
The drydown on my skin is soapy and flowery, with hints of warm sandalwood.

Performance-wise, it lasts about 4-5 hours and the sillage is moderate. I had to refresh it during the day, other than that imho is office friendly.

Is it only me feels it similar to Versace bright crystal one? I find this one even more complex and better performer.
It’s a nice clean fresh fruity floral evolves little by little throughout the wear.
It’s not groundbreaking, it’s something I would love to use everyday.
Nice for a casual day, formal situations, quite versatile.

This is a true beauty. It's a perfect blend of florals with fruits. I smell mainly peony and melon with something very soapy (maybe the water lily and musk). It's a very clean and feminine perfume, and very easy to wear. Starts out strong but then it sets down to a more mellow and flowery scent. Perfect for spring and summer.

It's one of those perfumes that I like to wear for uplifting my mood.

A beautiful, inoffensive floral, with a tad of sweetness from the fruit, and softness from the musk and cashmere.
I don't usually make declarations on other people's perfumes, but I have to say that this is the type of fragrance every woman should have in their collections. It's great for young women's first real perfume, grown women's feelgood scent and the more androgynous women's (like me) flower shop fragrance.
I love this.

This is one of the fragrance that i bring with me on my vacation in Africa. I use it almost everyday and its perfect for lazy beach afternoon vibe, where you can relax and enjoy the sunshine. Its fresh floral scent without the citrus note. It last 4 to 5 hours.

I LOVE this scent, it’s perfect. But why does my brand new sealed bottle last literally only an hour even sprayed on clothes?! Is anyone else’s this weak too?? I want to find an exact dupe that smells identical but with amazing lasting & projection power, I don’t care if it’s expensive.

Edit, 1/21/21:
So I just received my bottle of Oscar de la Renta Flor, yes, it smells EXACTLY like this! Projection power is really nice on this one, still testing the longevity :)

I like this one, it smells more expensive than it is, and reminds me of Lys Mediteranee by Frederic Malle (which is wonderful, but £150 for 50ml, whereas you can find EM for £20 in the right High St shops or online). To me it mainly smells of lilies, which I love. I like it layered with Bvlgari Goldea in winter.
Very nice, and if you love Lys Mediteranee but can't stump up £150 at the moment, this is well worth a try!
First my friend bought this to me confusing it with eternity. First I was sad because I wanted Eternity but it turned out I loved this one too. Not as much as Eternity, but very much too.

I read a lot of reviews before blind buying this fragrance and a lot said it was for a younger audience however when I originally smelt it it reminded me a lot of something my gran might wear. It’s super floral, expectedly so with little sweetness (in my opinion) and a little bit powdery. I sprayed this once in my room and for the next 3 days you could smell it all over the house so the longevity is incredible. And I can say that the more I smell this the more I like it! So it’s definitely grown on me a lot
so far my fav from CK, cheapie price but expensive smell

Reedited my previous review, as I think it didn't do this one justice. This is a wonderful scent, sweet, floral, clean yet so alluring that it's a pity people don't praise it for what it is. Very loved in Europe, especially on European YouTube channels (Italian mostly).

For the reviewers who mentioned this is 'green' - I simply get the exact opposite. To me, this perfume has absolutely nothing to do with D&G Light Blue, freshness, greeneries or anything of the sort- quite contrary.

It's sweet but light, not cloying, not spicy or patchouli-ish at all. Some people smell 'green' and 'citrusy' fresh, to me there is nothing of the sort in this. Just sweet flowers, very potent and possibly 'intoxicating' had this not been so beautifully balanced. A sexy vixen perfume, but for one who loves summer dresses and white satin gloves. Conjures up feelings of 'girlfriend', 'wife', 'adoration', 'love' ... I'd wear this as a bride or bridesmaid :)

Eternity Moment has the same base as Eternity with a lot of floral elements and a 'honey' on top. It's something sweet, but I can't tell where it comes from.
I am not good at naming notes and that is also confusing to me, but I can describe it as if you imagine you're sniffing Eternity, with tuberose on top and about 10%-15%, if not 20, of JPG Scandal (the warm honey core). It's beautifully balanced as in you can immediately feel it as sweet, but can't detect sugar or patchouli. Honey as in a honeyed echo, not the scent itself.

I also feel a fat, juicy and gooey peony, sweetened lily of the valley and lotus, surprisingly they aren't listed in the notes, but melon is. I can't feel that one.

This is flowery but sweet and sexy, I could say this might even belong in the same category as Si and the likes. However it does not smell of incense, it does not smell 'fresh' like laundry, it is not generic like Miss Dior and Coco Mademoiselle, or sweet like Britney Spears/ Paris Hilton, or whatever other fragrance du jour people like wearing.

It is quite a unique, a very feminine and elegant scent, one that's also surprisingly very expensive-smelling for its price tag (100 ml/ 3.3 fl OZ for 20 eur in Belgium).
To me it is very similar to 5th Avenue, but much sweeter, and has almost 0 citrusy notes from the orange blossom flower.

Potent but not cloying at all, it can be worn successfully at the office, on an outing with friends, if you prefer, even if it's glamorous. Again, it's sweet but not heavy or candy-like. To me, it smells completely different from let's say Elie Saab, but has the same exact vibe- a heavy, thick and creamy satin veil, bridal and attractive, sweet and love-seductive, as opposed to 'attraction'. Really, really love this one. Will continue repurchasing to no end, it's my most favourite flowery perfume that has dethroned my 5th Avenue that I've been wearing for 15 years now. Absolutely adorable.

This one is a winner for me. I love it. It is a particularly strong perfume. When I spray one spray, I get different notes than if I spray 3 sprays. With 3 sprays, I get almost a soapy vibe which I usually detest. After about half an hour, that fades. There's a burst of white sugar in the opening. It comes across as a strong floral fruity perfume with woods and resins.

Upfront, there's lychee, guava (nice not at all sour), peony and passion flower.

The reason why I've picked passion flower, is because this perfume is like Guerlain Aqua Allegoria Passiflora's older and wiser sister. The Mom, was Calvin Klein Truth. The Dad, was Eternity original. They gave birth to fruity, ozonic children.

A bargain fragrance. I only smell about 20% of Eternity original's DNA in this. I feel like this is a safe blind buy as a gift. Happiness in a bottle.

I really, really like the long, elegant shaped bottle too. Unfortunately, I had to buy 50mls because, like the traditional shaped bottle, the 100mls is too tall for my drawer.

This smells like a toned down Gucci Bloom (the original). A soft, powdery floral. I do not get much of the sweetness from the fruity notes, but more so the florals. The peony is very strong, which helps the rose not be too overpowering. I like that they used lighter wood notes at the base, so it doesn’t have that aftershave-type pungency perfumes can take on when they overdo it. This is a light, airy fragrance safe for everyday wear. I was kind of hoping for something that would project more, but as stated, I do have other fragrances that smell similar to this. I guess the main drawback is that this doesn’t smell very unique.

A fresh, greenish scent with white flowers. Reminds me of lily of the valley's scent. My mother loves this and I like it on her, but not on myself. It's nice and fairly inoffensive, a decent green and fresh offering from CK. Definitely a day-scent, too light and airy for evenings.

I loved Eternity back in the 90s. This version upon first spray is quite alcoholic but give it 10 minutes and you are left with a beautiful rose delight. I think this fragrance would make a perfect wedding scent as it is light, fresh and flowery. Nothing groundbreaking but then sometimes perfume doesn’t need to be that, it just needs to be nice and this is really nice. A good blind buy if you like soapy, sweet perfumes.

I'm a fan of CK's Eternity line, especially the original EdP and Eternity Air, Eternity Moment is in my view just as good as the original and Air.

I'm surprised to see that Eternity Moment is from 2004; I genuinely thought it was a more recent release but that said, it does have the typical "shower fresh" facets that most fragrances of the early 2000's have.

I always feel that the original Eternity (and Air for that matter) is perfectly suited to the warmer months as it has a very cold, metallic, ozonic and green freshness to it, Eternity Moment is equally suited to the warmer months, daily casual wear and for the office. Unlike most shower gel type scents, Eternity moment does have quite good lasting power and a nice moderate silage, it will last from 8am till 5pm quite well and is strong enough to get some compliments but not enough that it will fumigate a room.

Notes! Eternity Moment is predominantly on me a mild fruity aquatic floral, the DNA hints to L'eau D'issey by Issey Miyake. I mainly pull from it melon, guava, waterlily and musk, I cant detect any cashmeran notes or any of the woodsy notes, its just a fresh and clean scent thats very easy to wear.

Would I repurchase? Once my 100ml bottle runs out, I would quite happily reconsider buying again, its a versatile scent and makes a great easy reach scent, its also available at some pretty good prices too!

The opening is a bit alcoholic, but it turns fast into a fresh and feminine floral. Delicate and pretty. After that it turns into a powdery bar of soap. I don’t really like this stage.
Overall it’s a nice fragrance. Nothing groundbreaking but it is pleasant. A bit more jasmine wouldn’t have hurt though.
Final note: 6/10

I was overwhelmed by the initial sweetness, good thing is it settles down in abut an hour or so. Had to wait until the dry down to understand why this perfume is in Eternity family. Absolutely gorgeous, all-year-round imo, would love to see how it develops in warmer weather, (it is currently winter at my end). Extremely well blended. Mood lifter. Happy scent. Ideal for office as it is not cloying.

Beautiful rose and peony. One second I smell rose (dog rose Rosa canina), another peony.

There is a chemical note in the background (plimsolls rubber and ballpen ink). But peonies' fragrance also does have a chemical note to it (to me peonies smell like roses with freshness of lily-of-the-valley and discrete note of hair lightening cream (sniffing deeper) sometimes as strong as horseradish or crushed papaya seeds. Peony without this fresh harsh note is just rose.

The perfume reminds me Pivoine by Yves Rocher, but two times stronger.

You know those candies that are like "Sweet...and then sour." This reminds me of those because it's basically two different scents in one.

It's floral first. A bursting fresh floral type of scent at first. Very pretty and clean. Lasts a moderate 5 hours total but those last 2 hours it's a skin scent. At that point...it's still on you but when you stick your nose to your arm to smell it...it's just the fruit notes left over. And it's pretty until the very end.

Anyway...this isn't anything incredibly remarkable. However...it's very clean and versatile. One of the first words that comes to mind when I smell this is "friendly." It's a SUPER friendly, pretty perfume that has a lot of versatility in terms of age. I can see a 15 year old wearing this as well as a 40 year old.

But yes. It's floral. Then fruity. NOT a linear perfume. Changes a lot from initial spray to skin-scent dry down.

Longevity - 5 hours total projecting well for about 3-3.5 hours.

Projection - About 3 feet. Spray your neck, arms, AND shirt to give it some extra strength.

Overall Score - Somewhere between a 7.5 & 8 out of 10.

This one is definitely a pleasant scent. And one I would consider a safe blind-buy. Thumbs up Calvin Klein. I personally really enjoy your fragrances and think that the line as a whole is much too overlooked and criticized.

Sweet and delicious, but it has something sharp that makes it a bit shower gel-like. Feminine and youthful. If it weren't for that sharp note, it would be 10 times more expensive-smelling and beautiful.
it reminds me Halloween Halloween J.del.Pozo

Bought this last week after reading the reviews.
First spray.........urgh what what I thinking?!!!!! Didn’t have time to wash it off before going out. 30 minutes later......what is that gorgeous smell? That’s right, EM is absolutely beautiful!!!! Lovely feminine floral. I had only bought the 50ml and am going through it soooo quick I’ve just ordered 100ml as back up. My new favourite fragrance! ❤️

Nice, unassuming fruity-floral, more floral on me actually. I really like CK fragrances, I have a good relationship with them. This was another blind buy and it is a safe one. It's young and fresh but it can get a bit cloying on very hot weather I imagine. To my nose, the drydown is quite close to Tracy by Ellen Tracy, minus the creaminess of the latter. A good buy for a very good price.

A light, clean, and fruity floral. Sadly a little generic too. Eternity Moment is a suitable office scent. It lacks citrus, amber, vanilla, patchouli, and other staple notes among popular fragrances. This lends itself to a lighter, unobtrusive atmosphere, but it never leaves body-spray territory. I wish the woods came through more or that there was an additional note to add variety, like moss. For these reasons, it doesn't justify the price or strong pursuit.

I was given a 100 ml bottle of this a couple of weeks ago. It's a fruity floral that can be worn and not bother anyone. The longevity and sillage are quite measly despite it being an edp. This is a very popular workplace fragrance in my country that is nearly always discounted so I am eager to use it up and move on.

Eternity Moment - this was a blind buy for me and my first CK perfume lucky enough, to be able to add to my collection. I love this scent. Its all “Floral”. At first spray I pick up litchi, pomegranate blossom, water lily and Jasmin.
I love this sooo much, that I'm now on my second bottle. Eternity Moment does not disappoint!
A fresh cut flower smell, very fresh and clean, perfect for day wear. Could be worn at work as it's inoffensive. Pretty and feminine.

This is lighter than what I usually go for but there's something about it I find intriguing. Maybe it's the passionflower in there which I always really enjoy. And I do like the peony which is not too overpowering maybe because it's getting along nicely with the litchee fruit. It's just lovely, and though its light, I enjoy spraying every few hours just to get those first fresh wafts of this beauty.

After this horrible endless snow filled overly cold winter, a bit of spring is happening today, and Eternity Moment fits the bill perfectly for me right at this "moment"! Gals at my dentist's office complimented me on this, said it was so nice.

Edit: 3 weeks later - I have finished my 50 ml. bottle and have since heard this was discontinued. No! So I hurried up and ordered a 100 ml bottle which I just received. It smells a lot fresher and stronger than the 50 ml I finished up. Probably the drugstore where I got that had it hanging around a long time. Thinking to maybe hoard a few more, I love this.

Very light fragrance. It's not overbearing or invasive, just simple and elegant. The kind you'd wear to work or something you don't want to announce your awesomeness. This was my first calvin klein fragrance so I hink I'd buy more from him.
Does anyone else think this smells a little like hair relaxer? I'm not a fan of the first hour or so, but once it dries down, this is a beautiful fragrance.

Believe it or not, I found an almost full bottle of this on the foreshore of the River Thames in London.

Being a perfume addict, I picked it up. Unfortunately I don't actually like it, so I use it to spray it around the house and bathroom as air freshener. I think they tried to add a muskiness to it that just doesn't jive with the fresh top notes.. then again I am no expert. But there is something in it that definitely puts me off. I guess someone felt the same way when they tossed it into the river! :D

Personally I adore the smell of flowers, and this one is soo flowery.
At first it's a strong mix of flowers, makes me think of daisy's actually (even though it's not in there), then the water lily becomes very apparent, and it settles into a melon floral scent.the melon is very light though.
I adore this perfume, on my skin flower smells work so well. If you have trouble with florals then this is probably a pass for you or at least test it first. The first calvin klein perfume I tried years ago, I was like twelve, and from then on its been one of my absolute faves.
It's lively, and elegant, and happy, all at once.
I never tried the original, but I intend to so I can have a basis of comparison for the two.

Another "sale" purchase, bought blind entirely based on the reviews I read on here but I was pretty certain it would be a safe everyday kind of fragrance.

It is lovely; fruity and floral with some soft, woodsy element. Out of the box it reminds me of Next Just Pink which I wore in my very early 20s and loved for its zesty uplifting qualities. Eternity moment has the same kind of effect - it's not sexy or alluring or complex but a couple of spritzes of this perfume will instantly lift spirits and induce happy feelings.

I am wearing this fragrance right now. I actually used a lot of Eternity before, this is the first day I am using Eternity Moment and it is just very nice. It is not too cold out there so I believe the smell is not too empowering but it has a strong element of water lily and pink peony to it that makes it very special. One thing that I found fascinating was the woody notes after you leave it on your skin for some time. And I love it. Its like the fresh air you smell after the first rain.

This works best on me in the hot weather. In cold weather it smells sharp and sour. Doesnt last all day on me i have touch up after a few hours. Lovely colour bottle. I like both eternity's but in winter original eternity smells like this on me. Very strange. I am on my second large bottle of this and will repurchase its perfect for any occasion not too much of anything but that same trait i find positive makes this boring and un eventful for other people. Cant please everyone I guess.

Agree w many reviews that it's nice n on me it is especially nice! Settles in smoothly w no sharp edges which i luv! 1st bottle 2017 n imagine it will not be my last. Very excited about this one!! Yes similar to White Linen/Estee Lauder which i also enjoy! And Vera Wang but less sharp which is good...
Note- remnds me of Paris YSL

I was looking for a summer perfume that leaned more towards the floral fruity or floral aquatic family and this was amongst my choices along with D&G Imperatrice and Eternity NoW which I both know and adore but I decided to opt for this one for several reasons amongst whom the fact that is highly probable that is discontinued, the price/quantity ratio (I bought 100ml for 30 euros) and last but not least the excitement of a blind buy. I know that blind buys are always risky but for now I love taking risks at perfumes.

So, I had no idea what this perfume would smell like not even looking at the notes. I was hoping for a floral fruity aquatic with prominent fruity aquatic notes, but it was not the case with this perfume. Not that I hate it but it was simply not what I was looking for. It's a nice and generic floral but nothing special or groundbreaking. I would dare say that sometimes I find it boring.
First spray and it reminded me of another perfume I have already had and enjoyed: of course the classy EA 5 Avenue, the floral vibe is almost like EA but the difference is that EA stays floral all the way while this one has an inconfondable fruity vibe given by litchi and the leading floral note is peony. Also the fruity part I find it similar to Versace Bright Crystal only that BC is more girlish and watery while EM is more adult. I think if 5 Avenue and Bright Crystal blended together the result would be Eternity Moment. To me during the first 5 minutes this perfume is a typical floral but then the fruity notes start to appear especially litchi and raspberry even though the never fully take the stage. In the drydown becomes a creamy floral so not fresh or aquatic.

The fragrance screams spring to me; the blossom of the flowers and how they fill the air with their perfume in the early morning. It's like walking barefoot in the middle of a garden and inhaling the perfume of peonies, jasmin, water lilly. This perfume started to grow in me, there's something mature and classy about it, it's easywearing but it requires a character. I also believe it makes a statement for whoever wears it but I think it especially suits women above 30.

And by the way I loved the publicity of this fragrance back when it was released. Everytime it would air on TV I would leave whatever I was doing and go watch the beautiful Scarlett Johansson and the elegant bottle with the pink juice. I loved the poster of this perfume starring her and I always thought that one day I would have this perfume and I would feel like her wearing it. It was truly magical. Finally that wasn't just a dream as I now own Eternity Moment and it will always remind me of good old times.

I need to test this again. When I tested it, something really bothered me in the scent. One or two of the notes, really could not put my finger on it, was just totally off-putting. And I have no problem whatsoever with light, generic, breezy, flowery scents so based on the reviews I will give this another try.

So many perfumes come to mind trying this one - starting from Jean Paul Gaultier`s `Fragile` to Calvin Klein Escape..I should like it, really, but it doesn`t happen. It just turns sour on me as soon as it starts to develop after drying on my skin. In the end I have to ask myself: what occasion would justify wearing it? And I can`t find any..I don`t find it uplifting, refreshing, seductive, innocent, show-off..I wouldn`t say it stinks either but the original one is the one I always used to know and liked - I could even do with a bottle now - but this one is just sour and confusing..Maybe I should give it a second testing..

Oh so fresh and bright!! Eternity Moment lifts my mood instantly. Beautiful fresh floral! Perfect for everyday wear. Lasts pretty long on clothes, stays close to skin but people next to you will be able to smell it, especially when the wind blows, it gently gets carried away creating a beautiful trail that will surely bring many compliments! I feel Eternity Moment is best for romantic,femenine,happy and free spririted women! I feel this pairs gorgeously with airy floral summer dresses and and a cheerful,happy personality. Definitely one of my favorites and the one I most reach for!!

Unfortunately I agree with the reviews about this scent. Soapy and i smelled it already. I had a sample Eternity Moment edp, for me its nothing special scent, a little strong note of everything in it.

I have it given away by a friend who absolutely hated it - well, I like it and it is definitely better on my skin than on hers, but to me it is a bit too aggressive though. I like wearing it when I have to go to work early in the morning - the fresh scent can totally wake me up! During the daytime it becomes boring though, and I would not wear it for night, as to me it totally goes with a business suit, creating a rather cold although energetic aura.

Unfortunately, the peony is far too strong for me here. It's almost all I can smell. It smells like lots and lots of peony with some lily, musk and sandalwood. Although, it initially smells OK in a bottle - appears flowery and fresh - when I spray it on, very soon it starts to smell very strong and heavy and, for me, it is also headache inducing. Unfortunately, this one's not for me. This fragrance is extremely flowery and , although, I generally love flowery scents, there is something here that really does not agree with me.

This is the perfume I reach for when I want something for work or a day time fresh perfume. It reminds me of a dressing table my mum had with her powder puff, to me it smells just like powdery makeup. It's great for spring and most people wouldn't not like it, I would say it's safe to blind buy, but it is very generic. It's like when I sat in waiting rooms when I was younger flipping through the magazines and sniffing the fragrance sample pages. In a word - this perfume is boring, but not necessarily in a bad way. I'm pleased to have it in my collection as I don't have anything else like it and it's trustworthy to not offend anyone and it's so light and fresh but it isn't something I would run out and buy tomorrow if I finished it. It's a like but not a love.

Eternity Moment is a very nice light fruity floral. I detect mostly peony, water lily and fruit with a touch of musk. I find this fragrance to be well balanced. It moves from top notes to middle notes and finally to base notes fluidly, unlike some fragrances which can seem muddled. Eternity Moment has a very feminine air about it. It's one of my favorite perfumes.

It was a birthday gift from someone who loves me, but don't really know me.

Clean, fruity floral, subtle even during the summer, ideal sweet water for the days you're not in a mood for A perfume but you still want to wear something. It's just wearable without smelling commonly cheap, but nothing more.

It's nice, tender, airy, clean, but funny - even during the time it was on my shelf, I could never precisely remember how it smells if wasn't wearing it that very moment.
That is what best describes Eternity Moment.

* like
* longevity: moderate (up to 6 hours)
* silage: moderate (arms lenght)
*weather: any/year round
My mon had that perfume and it smells really nice and very féminine when I smell it somewhere it bring me good mémoires of her

I was super excited to try Calvin Klein’s Eternity Moment since peony is one of my favorite florals and I have never smelled water lily in a fragrance before. That being said, this perfume is a major disappointment; it literally smells like the most generic drug store body spray you can imagine. It’s a brew of synthetic scents that leaves behind a very unpleasant odor of plastic and damp skin.

The initial spray smells heavily of alcohol, then immediately simmers down to a peony opening with litchi and a hint of jasmine. The water lily gives this fragrance a fresh and bright floral composition which helps to bury the scent of plastic that eventually overwhelms me anyway. The dry down consists of sandalwood and Guava, which creates a very unusual accord similar to fruit that’s been sitting in a smoky room for way too long. I don’t smell cashmere woods, though the musk is a bit overwhelming and strangely out of place in this composition. Sillage is moderate on me, and longevity is decent (3-4 hours).


I feel like Eternity Moment has way too much going on, the notes seem to clash against one another instead of flowing smoothly in unison. It tries to be woody, fruity, floral, and aquatic at the same time…but fails to master at any. I’ve tried to wear this on my skin after a shower, before bed, during the day, at night; and I can’t seem to enjoy it. Overall this is a decent purchase for the price but it certainly is short of quality, you can buy a generic body spritzer for half the cost.

Bought this for a friend of mine for her birthday today as I know she wears the original Eternity, when she got it she opened it immediately and sprayed some on her wrist, smelled gorgeous to me from about a meter away (this is a male point of view btw) a couple hours later she text me to say she loves it. "It's Lighter than the original but really fresh" is how she described it. She's taking it with her to a pamper session this weekend with her BFF.


Nice :)

Eternity Moment is gorgeous. Beautiful. Delicious. Lovely fruit, gorgeous flowers, and generous woods. Fresh and comforting. And I'm wearing it with Eternity today, and they're fabulous together! I love love love both of them separately, and together!

Adorable sillage and longevity! (easily all day and fills the room softly)

I really love Calvin Klein's perfumes. I've only got a few - these two, of course, and Eternity Aqua, Euphoria, CKIn2U, Obsession and Beauty - but hopefully will be able to get more when the money comes! But I totally adore the few I have. They're all gorgeous.

I was a bit disappointed of it when I tried it in summer..I found it too heavy and pungent. But trying it out now, on a cold autumn day makes me like it somehow. :) Is a very familiar scent, noticeable, but nothing new. Sillage and longevity are very good.

I like this fragrance a lot. Beautiful soft florals with a slight aquatic tinge. A barn burner it is not! I can see this for any age, many social settings. Perfect for a picnic in the park, meeting the girls for brunch, work, church...anytime you want a little lift.
Unlike the original Eternity, which kills me with carnation, this one is wearable for me. That said, I find it to be a disappointingly generic floral. Meh tbh.
my musician fragrance, its wonderful to wear when you are doing art and music with this floralscent

I was so expecting to like this. Perhaps I set my hopes too high. On me Eternity Moment is surprisingly generic, similar to many lower-end fruity fragrances. It's on the fresh-sour side of fruity, rather than sweet, so comes off as a little cold to my nose.

It has a particular similarity to Siren by Paris Hilton, which I really like (yup), but without the warmer, juicier notes that make Siren friendly and summery. Eternity Moment is for a cooler kind of lady.

It has good sillage and decent longevity though, so if you like the fragrance it will serve you well.
one of my favorite since 10 years now! soft light and very innocent feminine flowers, i smell there pink roses and piwonie
One of the most gorgeous perfumes ever! Absolutely stunning!
This is Gorgeous! What a divine perfume! Beautiful! My second favourite I think, after Armani Si Intense, and equal with Arpege! It's heavenly, heavenly, heavenly!!!

Wow this is a beauty. Smelled it on a woman on the train, asked her what it was, tested it from her bottle and had to have it. Clean, feminine, very powdery floral suitable for pretty much any occasion. Just gorgeous.

I like this! I prefer this to the original Eternity. This is a younger, but not teenagey, crisp floral. This is gentle and delicate, yet ballsy and strong at the same time. I'd wear it to the office, great for spring and cooler summer days.

If a scent is not too much of this nor too much of that..it must be just right!
like very much! Elegant soft and very great smell

Not sure yet what I think of this other than PEONY lol - and the dry down is really nice. Doesn't last very long and is light. Makes me think of pink flowers... have not decided if I should keep it or not
EDIT: although a nice flowery scent, I returned it :/ Just not really me I guess...

Wow! I am impressed! I bought this one as a blind buy because of the good reviews and also the ingredients and the noses behind it. I knew the original Eternity from my teenage years, my best friend wore it all the time. I knew it couldn't go that wrong, first spray was already wonderful, this is a more mature and sofisticated fragrance. This fragrance gets even more delicious at the base and dry down. Peony, jasmin and lychee are quite predominant to me, what makes it a delicious flowery-fruity fragance. I do smell the woody as well. It kinda reminds me of D&G Rose the One, one of my personal favorites. I also though funny enough there was some rose in it at the first spray. The price is also amazing, 19.99 euros on the local drugstore for 100 ml of this delicious juice, don't know why it is such an underestimated fragrance, but yey me! I will definitely keep purchasing it for the spring/summer time.

The first few times I smelled it it was like a typical spring fragrance. The following times I experienced something else. Something elegant. Something sophisticated. Something mature.

This is a beautiful fresh flowery fragrance, however I do clearly smell some fruity notes. This flowery fruity and slightly sweet perfume is for the sophisticated women with elegance and style. The last time I smelled it it smelled more unique than before. It has that touch to it which is unexplicable.

This smells like springtime to me - not the first green breath of spring - that would be the original Eternity, but later in spring when the sweet scent of blossoms are in the air from flowers and fruit trees. It is very feminine in an innocent, ethereal, young at heart (but not girly) kind of way. I find it lasts well without being overpowering. I can still smell it a little in the evening from a few sprays in the morning. I love it and it makes me feel cheerful at the thought of springtime.
From memory. This smells exactly like Paco Rabanne Metal that I absolutely love in my late teens :)

A more feminine and elegant take on this Calvin Klein classic. If i had to choose between both, i'd take this one as it has more hints of floral and vague fruit.

However, i personally still find this a little too much on the "fresh" side and strong for my liking, so i barely wear it. I've had my bottle of it since it released in '04 and it's still a full bottle. Regardless, if you like the original Eternity and like really light florals, like a Chanel Coco Mademoiselle, then this perfume might be for you.
I get strong melon at the first spritz then it's light flowery scent. Great for the mellow mood but still keep the feminine side.

A gorgeous, mature scent. It's all floral for me, with a tone of sweet fruitiness in the background, but in no way an "old lady" floral. If you love peonies and lillies, you'll love this. The jasmine accents it all perfectly as well. This is probably going to be my signature scent for awhile.

My first experience with this perfume was over 10 years ago. I was a teenager and i brought a 15 ml Eternity Moment together with a 15 ml etnerity. I liked Eternity Moment alright but admittedly it did not have the strong character that Eternity had. Eternity is so modern and so cold. Eternity Moment was however, a very pleasant lady like and easy to wear perfume.

Little did i know it would be Eternity Moment that leave an impression on me to the point that I crave it and get a full bottle of it 10 years later. I am very glad to report there is no reformulation. It smells fruity-rosy-green (in the order of predominance) as i remember it is. On me litchi, raspberry, jasmine, and what i thought as rose (? rose is not listed hmmm?) mixes together to produce a refreshing and uplifting scent until about 4-5 hours later, I get melon and guava. Strange because usually fruit is the top note.

It lasts about 4-5 hours. Soft sillage after an hour or two upon application. This perfume performs in both summer and winter, good weather or bad.

Strange thing - I really fell in love with this perfume when I was pregnant with my first child for ten years ago. I bought it, but didn't use because I was afraid of like destroying the body balance or something, I tried not to use any unnecessary chemicals at all. So I waited till I stopped breastfeeding and over a year later opened the box. It was such a disappointment! I hated the smell, it was too sweet, sticky even - I gave away the box immediately!
It smells like a serious, classy woman. I love it but I tend to resist myself from smelling it and finding its depth because it kinda smells like rubbing alcohol when I do.

Oddly enough, this scent remind me of the scent of a grapefruit. There is a fresh bitter-sweet citrus top with a floral undertone along with some greens. Its one of those perfumes you can spray several times and not worry about. Its a spring day perfume and it sits close to the skin (not too loud). But you might have to really it if you want it to really pop after several hours.

This is spring in a bottle, sunshine on a rainy day. Quite cliché, sweet-woody-floral but it does smell expensive, romantic, nice and elegant. Absolutely nothing to hate here, suitable for all ocassions.
Excellent projection, without being obnoxious.
I am in LOVE with this floral musky springtime beautiful fume long lasting good quality CK
Love this perfume...its only parfume that i buy many time. Hope it reproduce again
My warm weather holliday fragrance. Always get a lot of compliments wearing this.

This is the first perfume I purchased with my own money.
A staple in my collection. It has very soft, clean, pure scent to it. Almost baby powdery I would say, which I love. It has a decent staying power to it. Up to 6 Hours. Perfect for spring.

There are certain moments when a particular type of perfume is more appropriate. It was in a moment of impulse shopping that I bought this yesterday after trying CKs Reveal which turned sickly nasty sweet.

I used to wear Eternity Moment a few years ago but I couldn’t really remember it other than it is supposed to be a fresh floral and I had liked it. But on wearing it today, I can say it’s not really fresh at all. I wouldn’t call it aquatic either unless by taking a full on floral and then watering it down, you could call it aquatic. Despite all the fruit notes that are supposed to be there, I get none. The bottle is elegant.

Eternity Moment is a bouquet of unidentifiable flowers, musky, powdery, lightly woody and classic. I think any woman could wear this and it wouldn’t be too young or too old. I think it could be worn at any time of year or time of day and it wouldn’t be considered out of place.

Generic? Hell yeah. Inoffensive? Undoubtedly. Eternity Moment is for moments when you need to be feminine and poised rather than sultry or carefree. Hopefully those moments won’t last for an eternity.
It's a lovely scent. It's flowery, fresh and it lasts forever. Like a walk through a rosegarden.

I'm wearing Eternity Moment on my left wrist and Eternity on my right wrist. I see where CK was going with this one. This is a much more delicate scent compared to its mother scent, Eternity. Comparing the two together, I like both for very different reasons.

This is a spring/early summer fragrance that is very fresh, slightly woody and is reminiscent of blush coloured flowers (the peonies etc). A spring wedding fragrance that has echoes of the original classic, but not as big in personality, this will last the whole day and not be offensive or overpowering. It has presence, but it is respectful and inoffensive. I'd wear this to a high tea on weekend for sure!

Interesting bottle. It isn't as solid as the original eternity bottle. EM's bottle is taller and has a transparent lid. I think the marketing people are getting at the fact that yes, it is a 'moment' hence the transparent lid (as opposed to the 2 in 1 silver lid sprayer or the original bottle). The bottle is reminiscent of a Moment of the original Eternity as opposed to the boldness of the enduring, classic, Eternity. Maybe I'm being too philosophical here?!
It's very elegant, very sophisticated jasmine scent. It's not grandma type, it's classic.

Bought this blind because of the good reviews on here, thinking it would be light and refreshing. I love the original Eternity - I use it to give me confidence in powerhouse meetings - and thought this would be a lighter, more girly equivalent. It's not.

It's a very old-fashioned smell, a bit like rose-and-jasmine-scented talc in the 70's, not at all light, modern or aquatic. I didn't get any lichi/lychee at all, possibly a little peony. Thankfully it didn't last long on me.

Slightly like Elizabeth Arden Splendor, which I also dislike for the same reasons.

Nice fresh, clean smelling scent. I first smelt it on someone in the gym and it was just perfect, fresh but not strong. i find it a great scent for excercise etc but just a very light spray does it. I've always liked Eternity for men on men but the original female version is just too strong for me but Eternity Moment has the freshness in a softer and lighter way.

So I buy most of my perfumes at shoppers drug mart, if I don't buy them online. Their prices are painfully outrageous but I still buy them! So today...I'm in there looking around and they have a whole big shelf full of 19.99 perfumes, but they have no testers so it's a blind buy if you've not smelled it before..and I decided to buy eternity moment...I'm very glad I did! It has a classic smell to it, and it's very pretty smelling! Not something I would normally go for, but in building up my collection...it fits in for a nice change! Very fresh, very airy! Love it

Tried this at a friends house, and loved it so much I went straight home and ordered a 30ml bottle online from Amazon....it arrived and I am so happy with it, its a gentle and classy light floral....gentle but do not confuse that with weak....it is definately not weak, it lasts me forever ( approx 6-7+ hours) reading here that it may be discontinued....I panicked and bought 2 100ml bottles straight away, I dont want to ever be without this beautiful perfume.
I can hand-on-heart say, that as a flanker, this beauty is better than the original, I think lovers of Eternity will probably not like this.
Some have mentioned old lady......there is nothing old lady in this scent, its fresh, floral, musky and beautiful, I think if you love SJP Lovely, you would also love this. Its a very pretty fragrance, classy and feminine and completely gorgeous.
EDITED to add, I couldnt put my finger on what Eternity Moment reminded me of, and this morning it came to me.... SJP Lovely has a very similar vibe, I think that anyone that loves SJP Lovely will also love this.
The smell of this fragrance is absolutely divine. Thought it was rose in it, but i was wrong.

I really didn't think I would enjoy this perfume as much as I do! :)

Received the original for Christmas last year and found it smelled like an 80's powerhouse perfume and had to get rid of it.

This flanker is very different from the original, one of those moments when you're like, 'why is this even a flanker?'

Anyways, Eternity Moment is a lovely, timeless scent.

Some say 'old lady' but I think that's just because it lacks any trendy or super contemporary notes, as well as the fact that it is quite heady (I don't where people get the idea that 'old lady' is a bad thing anyways though, to be honest ^_^)

The perfume starts off with a pretty high-pitched hit of white florals, but quickly begins to even out as the florals melt away into a sweet (not sugary!), fruity blend that is almost a floral skin scent.

I smell this and I feel myself drifting back in time.

I am convinced this is exactly what Marie Antoinette smelled like!

Or at least Kirsten Dunst while playing her in the Sofia Coppola film... ;-)

I see a beautiful, flower adorned swinging bench in a clearing in a dense and beautiful forest with a slight refreshing breeze carrying this fragrance in the air.

I see lace gloves, and heavily decorated tea cups.

This perfume says princess to me, but not in the bubble gum, sugary kind of way.

The name is Moment but I think this should have been the original Eternity because I feel like this scent has no era and it has super intense sillage and longevity.

Near the end, the fragrance relaxes into a creamier scent as the amber slowly begins to consume the sharp white florals.

The fragrance is also ageless, perfect for the flower girl or the mother of the bride.

I love to spray this on my sheets, not because it's a 'meh' perfume that I don't care to waste or anything, but because who doesn't want to go to sleep and wake up feeling and smelling like royalty? ;-)

A basic floral perfume. Not unpleasant, but doesn't leave an impression at all. Therefore there's nothing to hate or love about it. I could tell it was made with some sort of lily, but I didn't smell the nice, wonderful jasmine scent from it (I used to grow jasmine in my yard, so I'm very familiar with the scent of real jasmine flowers, and I love it). All the sweet fruity notes were also nowhere to be detected. It is light and modern though. I’ll wear this on the days when I don't feel like perfume. But I think on most days I'll layer it with another just-fruity perfume, since that's what it's lacking.

I give it 7/10.

I got this fragrance after reading excellent reviews all over. Having extensively searched for a fragrance with heart notes of Peony, I finally thought of giving this a try and I am highly impressed!
Eternity moment smells heavenly!! Its a refreshing floral fragrance which I feel is not at all overpowering..with just the right amount of sweetness its beautifully feminine. The top notes I get are guava, melon and rasberry. They are strong but quickly settles down into delicate floral. I can detect peony and jasmine in the heart notes. Base notes of sandalwood and amber are very light and soothing.
Just like its name Eternity moment is a long lasting fragrance. Without being too strong it stays on for 7+ hours (even more if layered).

I feel Eternity moment is very similar to CK's cool water sea rose (again my favoirite) except for the staying power - sea rose is very delicate and not at all long lasting. If you liked sea rose then you will Love eternity moment!!

Update: This is really strong!!!! be careful how much you apply otherwise it really gets to your head!!

I got this for my step daughter, The Young Goddess as I call her, for her seventeenth birthday in February. Eternity Moment is absolutely wonderful. She had been with me testing different floral fragrances which are her favorites. I had already bought her Chanel Chance Tendre for Christmas so she decided on this. It is so unique and it is so very feminine. It is hard to pick out the notes but I do smell quite a bit of peony. It is light, fresh and gorgeous.
10/10

Just 'had' to have this after smelling it for the first time! I was never a fan of the original Eternity,so when I saw 'Moment' I took a whiff out of sheer curiosity - and am glad I did, as I loved it then, and I love it now. A perfectly feminine, understated and classic floral! It's living happily in my closet and I'm delighted to bring it out to play!

Definitely getting more iterested in exploring as many of Calvin Klein's range as I can. This one is a beauty, it has to be said. I find quite a few CK's have a bit of a chemical essence to them, none of that here at all. The initial spritz is a pretty heavy white floral burst, definitely get Jasmine, and what I thought was tuberose, as it dries down I get the slightly floral/woody base with a musky background, which all in all is quite wonderful, Love it. 9/10

Yes it is fresh (at least it smells clean) and floral, but its very disappointing to me. Its not as light as i had hoped. At the opening I get only roses, than shortly after that a very sharp soap with jasmine, loads of jasmine. And thats it, thats the way it keeps smelling. The staying power is super, In my hair I can smell it still after tree days! So, if you like roses, soap and jasmine, this should be great for you. I don't like it...at all!

Only 3 ingredients out of 13, are the same in this perfume as those in PWLCoral! IMO ,I think that it's the pale pink color that is the only real match,not much else. But this smells rather nice- especially for the price. Really nice drydown.....

A few years back I sniffed a bottle in store and I couldnt smell anything ,I tried too hard but it was like nothing.Now I purchased a big bottle and I had to choose between bright crystal and EM and I dont know why I bought this one.Its too sharp in the begining and after some time becomes a little tame & soft and powdery.Its a flowery scent and is a little too heady for me.It stays on for a long time and projection is very strong.Its a pretty frag,for summer and sure is a pink perfume.I just have issue with guava note,I dont like this note at all,if it wasnt present in this composition,I would have loved it.Overall a pleasant floral,with decent sillage & longevity.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Fresh fragrance yet not durable, many sprays only guarantee barelly 2 hours on skin, maybe 3 on clothing, Eternity DNA very pronounced for those who like it, nautica voyage, as fresh fragrance as well, have better performance for the price, for sure this will be my only one bottle.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: singlehandedly the easiest dumb reach fragrance in my collection. versatile and the projection/longevity is actually good for a fresh fragrance. easy to wear and not think about. the only fragrance i’ve ever repurchased. a 10/10 all around

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
70% Polo Blue
30% Acqua di Gio EDT

A fraction of the cost

Beautiful, well blended freshie.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I stopped someone in the hallway because I like their cologne. I asked them what they were wearing, and I was surprised when they told me it was Eternity Aqua. I usually go for the niche fragrances, but this stood out to me. Fresh, clean, and non-offensive. Maybe it's super generic, but I liked it and I can see myself wearing it on days where I don't want to think about what I want to wear. I just might pick this up

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
This fragrance is a classic example of the modern “blue” scent family — fresh, versatile, and instantly likeable. While it doesn’t break new ground in the perfume world, it delivers a reliable and familiar charm, reminiscent of the original Calvin Klein Eternity but with a clear shift toward the crisp, aquatic vibe that defines blue fragrances.

The longevity is surprisingly solid, holding its character for around three hours or more. I can’t say for certain how well it projects.

This isn’t the kind of scent that will stop people in their tracks with a “wow” factor, but it works well as an easy, casual choice — especially for warm summer days when you want something clean, refreshing, and effortless. A safe, everyday option that gets the job done without fuss.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Ótimo perfume, pena que não acho pra vender, uso o meu em ocasiões especiais, mesmo ele não tendo boa performance. É refrescante, elegante, maduro, cheiro de homem vistoso. É como se esperasse alguém e você nunca havia visto essa pessoa, ela chega e já passa uma impressão bem formal, porém despojada.

Aroma: 9/10
Performance: 6/10

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
For When You’re Floating in a Pool of Denial and Cucumber Water

The opening is a splash of cucumber and lemon—like a chilled glass of water with a perfect slice of citrus on the rim. You’re floating in the pool, no plans, no worries, a lotus flower drifting nearby as its delicate aroma mixes with the green, herbaceous chill of the air. Sweet, watery, and just clean enough to fool everyone into thinking you’ve got your life together.

As it settles, lavender and sea breeze kick in like the scent of a beach house that’s been open for days—calm, airy, and quietly confident. The dry down goes smooth with sandalwood, musk, and a hint of driftwood, like the final whisper of dusk before the night wakes up.

It’s masculine, but in a breezy, button-down kind of way. Less “chopping firewood,” more “mixing cucumber gin tonics in linen pants.” Think Nautica Voyage, but older, cleaner, and finally over his ex.

THE BREAKDOWN

Rating: 7/10 — fresh, relaxing, and perfect for pretending you're on vacation
Profile: Fresh Aquatic with Green and Woody undertones
Smells Like: Cucumber water, driftwood, and the scent of summer denial Longevity: 4–6 hours — enough to last through a poolside nap Projection: Light — intimate, like a clean shirt drying in the sun Best for: Lazy beach days, rooftop drinks, and faking your beach house lifestyle

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
For the all over body spray:
I almost can't believe how good this body spray is. It's scent stays linear and not old man aquatic and it even has not bad performance. Bravo. 👍👍

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Notice how only the men are complaining about the cucumber note? woman love the cucumber note sorry to break it to you guys but yall got no idea what women like the smell of. This is a chick magnet and so are pretty much all aquatic fragrances. Girls love aquatic, cucumbery, fruity, basic, boring fragrances... luckily this I don't think is boring or too basic it's got some depth to it with the green notes, wood, lotus and it's like an aromatic aquatic scent. Just imagine you took D&G light blue or Versace pour homme then made it more interesting, more woody, more aromatic then you have CK eternity aqua... How's the performance? It's very good for me last way longer than versace pour homme and this stuff has always gave me good performance all day for an aquatic scent is impressive. Not outdated, smells better than majority of stuff on the market today. I understand most people would just wear light blue, acqua di gio or versace pour homme over this but those are too popular now stick with CK eternity aqua to be a little different

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
The fragrance is fresh cucumber mixed with green herbs, a strange scent that I didn’t accept easily.
The performance was below average and best suited for young men on a summer day.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Nice fresh clean vibes. Carries that classy clean feel. Refreshing pleasant. A bit too cucumber heavy for my liking and the plum note could be stronger. Smells very generic. You wont receive compliments but people enjoy being around you. Decent for the price. Not the most masculine scent though. Would much rather pay a little extra and go for polo.blue

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
For When You’re Floating in a Pool of Denial and Cucumber Water

It opens with a splash of cucumber and lemon—like a chilled glass of water with a perfect slice of lemon on the edge. You’re floating in the pool, no plans, no worries, a lotus drifting beside you, its delicate, floral aroma mixing with the cucumber and lemon. Sweet, green, and herbaceous—just pretending this vacation you can’t afford is actually your lifestyle.

As it settles, you get a light breeze of lavender and sea breeze, like the air in a beach house that’s been airing out for days. Clean, effortless, and totally unbothered—just the kind of vibe that says, “I showered today, but I’m not going to talk about it.”

The dry down? A smooth mix of sandalwood, musk, and driftwood—like the last whisper of night before the dawn. It’s not loud, but it lingers with quiet confidence, reminding you that you’ve got your life together, even if it’s just the illusion of it. Masculine, but not rugged—more like someone who’s effortlessly cool without even trying. Think Nautica Voyage, but grown-up—someone who’s upgraded from the frat house to the beach house, and it’s all happening without a single word of effort.

THE BREAKDOWN

Longevity: 4–6 hours — spray a little extra if you want it to last through a nap by the pool
Projection: Light — it won’t chase you down, but people will notice when you’re near
Smells like: Cucumber water with a lotus nearby that definitely smells better than your vacation plans
Best for: Lazy summer days, pretending your life is a beach house ad
Rating: 7/10
Vibe: Effortless and in serious denial about your next paycheck—but you still look like you’ve got it together

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: It just smells very metallic and synthetic. I hate it.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Good if you need a cheap fresh fragrance to not offend anyone. Very easy to wear and most people enjoy the scent. Actually got a few compliments off of it.


6.0/10 good freshy

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is such a masterpiece. The cucumber note is there and it's smells very nice
When I wear eternity aqua many people say that it's similar to Versace Pour homme. Sometimes for them it's difficult for them to tell the difference.
A person who has used both for long periods of time can judge easily.
Overall I'm gonna say it's a classic a scent which leaves a very good impression
Fresh,Clean and Masculine
Easy to like DNA.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
It's not a bad aqua scent but not really for me.
WARNING!! DO NOT BLIND BUY THIS FRAGRANCE.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I think this will be strictly a gym scent for me. I've worn it a few times, and it just doesn't last long. I get about 3 hours, with very little projection. The smell is pleasant, but not particularly aquatic in my opinion. To me its more green and fruity. For $20 it's not a bad purchase, but it's probably not something I'd buy again.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Wore it a few times and then just couldn't anymore. It smelled like a harsh synthetic laundry detergent. Maybe it's fine in the air? I really disliked smelling it on my skin.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Had an interesting opening but the dry down is musty, like rotten vegetables. Whatever they put on the base, it's too much and robs away the freshness it could have had.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
TL:DR - Harsh opening but otherwise very good scent, terrible longevity.

I blind bought this because of it's similar profiles to other fragrances I like but cheaper price tag. My immediate thought on first spray was that I mostly smelled alcohol, but thankfully that disappeared quite quickly. What remained was a refreshingly pleasant aroma - like a somewhat more mature Polo Blue or Nautica. It's a smell that can be a summer scent both day and night, unlike some brighter "blue" colognes.

However, the major problem with this bottle didn't show up until a few hours after I put it on - or rather didn't show up. An hour after application this was a skin scent. By two hours, it was barely noticeable. By hour three it was gone completely. I am aware everyone has different body chemistry, and for me fragrances tend to wear off a bit on the quick side, but this is a contender for fastest vanishing act.

So if I want to smell really good for a short while, this is a great find. If I want something that I can apply before leaving for the day, then I'll need to look elsewhere. This may become my summertime "keep-in-the-car" bottle.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
This cologne works surprisingly well on my skin. I bought this in a blind buy. I never expected him to do his job in beast mode like this!

A clean salt water scent. The scent is pretty simple. Simple is sometimes very good. I love the musk in this scent. It's one of the cleanest scents I've ever smelled. When I wear this cologne, I feel clean and fresh as if I just got out of the shower. I often turn to this cologne for daily use in the summer. It's very easy to wear. In the high inflationary conditions in Turkey, this cologne is one of the colognes that can be ideal for daily use in the summer months with its cheap price.

I read in the comments on Fragrantica that it is similar to Polo Blue. I've never smelled Polo Blue before. I want to try this soon.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I had this around 2013, I had gotten it as a gift and I absolutely loved it. This was around the same year we had gotten a new house about 5km from the beach if not less. We also moved in during a hot summer so I wore this a lot and as one would figure, it created fantastic memories for that time.
So I went and did what any fragrance lover worth their salt would do, I repurchased it. I didn't think much of changes in formulation or performance, I figured just the scent would be enough.

I've been left a tiny bit disappointed though, I don't remember it being this flat. I wasn't expecting much but I'm left feeling a bit silly, with my dick in my hand. I'll keep trying it when it warms up where I am but ya, feeling a bit hollow about the repurchase, not cos of the money spent but because it's not exactly the scent I remember.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Heads up: I do NOT have a bottle of this, but a little dabber bottle, so I can't give any good advice on sprays or whatever.

Scent 9.25/10
The scent opens with the best opening I've ever smelled in a fragrance. Granted, I haven't smelled that many colognes but my lord it opens beautifully. If anyone knows a fragrance like this that lasts longer, let me know. Unfortunately, the opening only lasts like 5 minutes before becoming a bit of something else which I'm honestly okay with

Sillage 3/10
The only people who have ever noticed this on me are the people that I've specifically told that I'm wearing it and they've deliberately come up close to smell it, but other than that it's practically non-existent

Longevity 3/10
Same story

I would put this in OK because of the performance, but the scent itself is just too good.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
One of my first fragrance when I was just starting out. Everyone starts somewhere and most do with a cheap designer from their local stores. Honestly I still enjoy this although I never really wear it much anymore with my collection growing in size and quality. It smells almost nostalgic to me, like it has its own aquatic vibe that doesn’t automatic scream “beach” or anything. It just kinda smells blue to me if that makes sense. Very refreshing too, I’d love this as a thing to scent my room with more than I’d like to wear as it dries down quite poorly for me.

6/10

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
It's giving me Aqva Pour Homme Marine Bvlgari vibes [without the ocean/seaweed], and absolutely smells like Polo Blue but not as high quality. What I thought were marine notes are probably the vegetal/lotus scents. Great summertime frag; easy, light, aquatic. This is also $29 vs $59 for the Polo.
Update: This isn't the strongest frag, so I tend to overspray. There is a chemical smell that occurs when I use a few too many sprays. Its an acrid, almost bitter chemical smell that only appears if I use too much.
Edit: Yeah it's still good, but that chemical harshness is there if you use even slightly enough to make it last.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Calvin Klein Eternity Aqua for Men instantly captivated my senses in the best possible way. Intrigued by its distinct aroma, I asked a stranger about his cologne, and he was delighted to share. I could tell I made his day with my compliment.

The sillage is exceptional, creating an aura within a two-meter radius, even more pronounced with a breeze. The scent reached me before I saw the wearer, which speaks volumes about its presence. Eternity Aqua offers a unique blend, borrowing from classic summery aqua fragrances while introducing its own distinctive character.

Wearing it for the first time, I’m consistently surprised by the refreshing wafts that emanate from me. The name "Aqua" is truly apt, and the Sichuan pepper note adds an intriguing twist that I find irresistible. I can’t stop smelling my wrist. This is undoubtedly my new weekday go-to fragrance.

Although it’s an Eau de Toilette, and thus not the longest-lasting, its brilliant and vibrant presence is like a shooting star—brief but unforgettable. At $69.99 for a 200ml bottle, it’s an absolute steal.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: An underrated aquatic freshie that's a bit different from the rest and ignored often. Try it out.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells refreshing, my fav summer fragrance! Normally i dont wear blue type but this is cool and my type.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
To be honest with all the freshblue fragrances on the market I cant find a reason for you to purchase this. It is out preformed and out shined by almost every other aquatic scent on the market right now. I do think the atomizer is decent for the price and the presentation is good but this was one of the worst blind buys I’ve made (not like thats saying much). It doesn’t smell bad just a lack luster and boring cucumber scent with synthetic citrusy tones. Just buy dolce & gobanna light blue or versace pour homme/fraiche for a little more. It is a little different with its saltier accords but thats about it when it comes to uniqueness.

Projection: 5/10
Longevity: 3/10
Sillage: 2/10
Overall performance: 3/10
Scent: 4/10
Value: 7/10

Overall: 4/10

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
The scent to me is a balanced salty, less harsh Light blue intense. I love salt so much, yes salt is a smell did you know that.

10/10 scent when worn close to the coastline.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: my favorite summer edt .... i have a lot of memories with it ....

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: a watery and overtly fresh opening with some citrusy floral undertones, that quickly becomes a plum heavy lavender with some woodiness to it. It’s fruity, fresh, and cool just as the name suggests. The dry down feels smoother, less fresh and more so musky, with some soft woods, remnants of that fruity heart and a hint of herbal patchouli.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Basic blue fragrance, smells pleasant - reminds me of polo blue which is a style of blue that I very much enjoy. Better then things such as Missoni wave which just smell like the sea. Longevity could be better. 6/10 for what it is, and for the price its a 7/10

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: nice aquatic citrusy scent. pretty basic tho

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Not a big fan of the fragrance, it smells like too much is going on at once, It not a bad smell, its just overwhelming.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: It does resemble Polo Blue with the added fruit and sparkle which makes it more metro. I already own Polo Blue so I'll just stick with that as I don't particularly like fruity frags.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Really nice, fresh pleasant smell with some of the original eternity DNA in it. Performance is not great and as you may expect from a fresh fragrance it’s somewhat generic. I do like that it lacks the synthetic smell you might find in some other “aquatics”.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Cucumber heavy. HEAVY. Then, I get the watery green notes, the lotus, citrus, patchouli and plum.

It's a nice fragrance, got it at TJ Maxx for $20. I wouldn't buy again. The original is soooo much better.

Definitely an office fragrance, not offensive, and I do like it. Not a love. I love the original Eternity for Men.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Smells like shampoo or de-tangler hair spray.
I am disappointed.
Wanted to like it, but just couldn't and threw it in the trash after several wearings.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I find that the opening dissipates way too quickly, leaving just the oriental notes left on my skin. I had one colleague comment on how flat this fragrance smelled from when I sprayed in the office till the end of day.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Aquatic and musky a lot like Davioff Cool Water but with a completely different tone to it. Suitable for everyday wear and quite generic for a water scent but will never fail to get compliments and enquiries. It carries and projects well without being completely obnoxious. Definitely an improvement on Eternity.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I quite like this fragrance. I have had Polo Blue Parfum sometime ago and heard that Eternity Aqua was similar in scent from reviews i had read so thought i would give this a try.

It's a very fresh and aquatic fragrance that is a good daily scent for anytime. I think you can get away with this at a casual event too so work its perfect for and semi smart events too so a nice restaurant. I find it more of a spring summery scent or early autumn, although i think it can be suitable for anyone wanting to smell very fresh, clean and aquatic.

It's also a good fragrance choice for someone looking for Polo Blue at a cheaper price. This can be bought cheaply in drug stores or online at a reasonable price of around £25.00-£30.00 in the UK. Maybe cheaper on eBay.

I would buy this again but i do like to cycle through dailies and try others to see how they sit on me, as fragrances always differ on the persons natural aroma.

Silage is okay i think it lasts for about 2-3 hours depending on applications but max id say is 6 hours. I can smell it after a long day when i go to the gym and i get warm but its not overpowering. Just a nice clean scent.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I personally love this. In spite of all the other fresh aquatic summer types of scents, something stands out to me. It’s just a nice aquatic scent. The cucumber and lotus are well blended and peak through the aquatics nicely.

Funny story, I’ll need to buy a new bottle and here’s why. I got a 6.7 fl oz bottle for roughly $35 from Fragrancenet.com. Had it for over a year, and enjoyed it. Left it in my car where the temperature fell below 32°F. I thought it would be fine as fragrances are meant to be kept cool, but NO. It smells like pure harsh chemicals now. Don’t make my mistake

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Much like voyage, a fresh cheap yet basic scent, something to purchase if you are wanting to start a fragrance collection especially going into the summer.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Def for the summer and late spring. Crappy longevity 3-4 hrs. tops. Cucumber/ melon and citrus heavy opening transitions to plum and lavender. Sandalwood, musk, and patchouli on the back end. Good value. Decent projection for the price. I'd take this over Acqua Di Gio because of the price. They smell very similar. If you don't mind reapplying after 3-4 hrs., then get this.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I would buy this before spending $100 on Aqua di Gio that will give you just as horrible longevity. Fresh aquatic scents are all equally as boring and generic. Why spend a lot of money on them? You will get bored and trash them long before you’re through more than an ounce of them. Buy small and buy from a discounter.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: A nice summery aquatic! The cucumber helps it stand out from the crowd. Fresh, lightweight, and just slightly quirky. This would be the perfect scent for a teen boy or someone with an optimistic outlook.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Aqua is something i tried before in Sephora. Tday sprayed it again on myself, well it is fresh bright citrus cucumber very airy , suitable for the country that I reside. the climate at my place is hot and humid so it is suitable. Is it worth it? Nah..the frag is nothing special, just generic type of smell. There are better and cheaper frags out there. Price is ok but the longevity is an issue just disappeared on my body after 1 hour, very safe fragrance to be worn even to office. Definitely a Summer frag.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Immediately reminiscent of Calvin Klein Contradiction (due to the pepper) but lighter, perhaps mashed up with Eternity Cologne For Men (due to the aldehydes). It's a dumb reach grab & go, nothing to get excited about or impress anyone with and for the same use/purpose/wear I would take a Tommy Bahama cheapie like St. Kitts or St. Barts every time over this.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I've been on the hunt for what I can only describe as a "neutral oceanic fragrance," something that isn't obnoxiously sweet and fruity like so many can be, but isn't briny and salty the way some of them can be. This is a step in the right direction toward what I've been after; this is very ozonic and airy smelling, with a slight mild aquatic feel to it, and not much else. It's VERY simple, and I like that about this fragrance.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Great frag for a Sunday funday, brunch by the ocean.
Very VERY inoffensive and light. Performance isn't great but neither is the price tag.
It's a really nice smell so look for it at your discount retailers.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Blind bought this since the 200ml was super cheap but this stuff smells like sunscreen it smells pretty bad.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
After just reading "smellmyfingers" take on this, and really pondering on it, I changed my mind on what I was gonna post. I seen mentioned this used to be a powerhouse and realizing the $22 bottle I got, doesn't punch like I remember. Long ago when I first smelled it, when it came out, had that Polo Blue vibe but way more depth. I really loved it and still do but I can definitely see how much my taste has evolved over a decade.
For the price, it's definitely toilet bowl lid worthy. You get the premium extra courtesy treatment. Thanks to "smellmyfingers" this won't just head to the back of my stuff that I thought was good that I just don't grab. Instead of letting them waste now, they go to the toilet bowl lid to die with dignity.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
got a 3.4 oz and another backup 6.7 bottle years ago and hardly ever use it i never reach for this stuff cause its just too much its a power house scent or at least it was .
it has some good vibes going on and smells like your out at the beach but i dont live at the beach and people are angry very angry so its best to wear something more dark and depressing

reading Rockdj review sounds like it has been neutered and is not such a power house anymore

testing the older bottle last almost 20 hours on skin which is great

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I keep one of these on top of my toilet to spray after taking care of my business. It's pleasant enough but not something I would want to spray on myself. There are better inexpensive blue frags out there.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I really enjoy the opening. Hit's all those familiar and likable aquatic/blue notes. The dry-down sort of kills it for me though. I don't care for aquatics that turn to sharp wood, which is where this goes after ~20min to me. Longevity is what I'd expect for this brand/product.
Scent opening - 9/10
Scent drydown - 5/10 (not bad, not my cup of tea)
Sillage - Moderate for ~20-30min, then intimate
Performance - 5/10. It's average, expected for pricepoint and ingredients

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I must say, it's a very interesting scent.
I used to have this, thinking it would be more a unisex scent but I was mistaken. I decided to gift this cologne to my guy friend for his birthday and he loves it.
It is a very fresh smell and is very clean.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Just got a 100ml bottle for 25 bucks. My first thought: what a great value!

It is similar to polo blue family, just like them, smells fresh and crisp, is perfect for mornings right after shower.

I would say it is a safe blind buy, will not offend anyone and 100% office safe.

Personally, the most appealing part is that it is very fresh without depending solely upon citrus notes. Nowadays most male designer fragrances are either bubble gummy or citrus-y, this is neither of these, I get a little vintage 90s vibe.

Conclusion: if you are looking for a fresh everyday fragrance and like watery notes, this can be a great alternative.

Happy smelling!

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: my brother owns this one. he always smells fresh. can’t go wrong and is great for warm weather.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Very light, crisp, penetrating scent. Not the same, but in the same category as Versace Man Eau Fraiche, with more oomph.

I get more watery cucumber and citrus in the foreground, with musk and wood notes in the background. Not getting the lavender or plum; nothing is remarkably floral or sweet about it.
