I like Edt very much but still i find it diluted and doesn't last even an hour on my skin, pitty it would have been a favorite of mine.I'll see abt. the Edp, quite excited actually:)

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: Fruity floral, perfectly nice but a little boring. I got this as one of four minis in a CK gift set, and I'm glad I haven't caved in to the temptation of buying a bigger bottle for a bargain price. It's not a bargain if you won't wear the fragrance, and I don't see myself wearing this over my (too many!) other options. On the other hand, Euphoria EDT would be a nice and safe fragrance gift for a woman who likes fruity florals, and the bottle is lovely. The scent is bright at first then quickly softens into a light, pretty floral -- nothing tacky, and not too strong. It would work well as an office scent.

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content:
I love the EDP and I like this EDT very much.
I use the EDP in fall and winter and come summer I switch to the EDT which is lighter and fresher but still retains some sweetness, it doesn' last very long but it certainly is a sensual fragrance.
If you like the EDP but find it too heavy this EDT will not disappoint
Also can't wait for the new Deep Euphoria to be launched in Fall

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content:
Perfectly beautiful orchid/lotus fragrance but I thought I was getting the EDP which smells entirely different. So now I have a full 1.7oz still in box for trade.

Anyone in the States care to swap? Peruse my "had" folder and let's make a deal! :)

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content:
I have never ever liked a single Calvin Klein fragrance. Ever. Until now! I actually like this! I will admit I've had a feeling about Euphoria for a while now. The shape of the bottle and the color of the juice. One day, while at Marshalls, I even caught a whiff of the body spray version and that is what kept my interest going. Then last night I decided to order a sample to once and for all make a decision and put the secret question to rest. I spent time reading reviews for all of the flankers and the original and ordered a 1/2 ounce of the EDP and samples of this. Well wouldn't you know, with some free time this evening, I went to TJMaxx and saw this little beauty sitting there tempting me! So I caved and bought it blind despite having a sample on its way to me as I write this.
I already had my day fume on but it was slowly fading so I figured it would work to spray on the other side of my wrist. I was immediately convinced I had finally found a CK scent for me! The woodsy notes are what win me over. I think CK spices are what I dislike (read- hate) so this is in the clear on that front. Orchid, Sandalwood and Amber along with a touch of green notes are what come together on my skin. I feel like I know this combination but I can't put my finger on it. I can't believe I'm saying this but on me, it's almost a cousin to Coco Mademoiselle! There is something very strong, not in the aroma but the feeling or emotion. It is the scent of a woman who is sure of herself and is ready to take on the world. It isn't sweet but strong, crisp and defined. I really like it a lot. And I can't wait to try the EDP for comparison because I hear it is sweet. I think having both with be great!
I was quite shocked at this scent. Shocked at how I could like a Calvin Klein. Shocked at how different it seems to be on me than on others based on reviews. Shocked at how different it seems to be from what I'm guessing the EDP will be like. Overall, I'm shocked in a really good way! I am glad I finally gave it a shot. Sometimes it pays to be less snobby than I was being ;-)

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: The more I wear it, the more I love it.

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: ...acting by made me forget about the parfume I was looking for

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: I went to one of the great French perfume shop smell un parfume I had in mind,passing a sales person was wearing an awful parfume hot, mysterious, and sweet.I ran to ask what wore,and answer me Euphoria Eau de Toilette.

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is a much, much softer version on the EDP. It is citrusy, airy and very powdery. I know EDTs have limited longevity but this disappears from my skin in 15-20 minutes. And I mean completely gone, I can't detect it at all.
Even if I layer it with another perfume CK Euphoria EDT will disappear completely leaving behind the other scent. I bought this blind but I wish I had tested it first. The EDP is such a power house so I assumed the EDT would have some lasting power. Bummer, lesson learnt....

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: Love this. The EDP was a bit strong for me, but EDT is perfect.

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: Tried this at the perfume counter the other day and I have to say I didn't smell anything fantastic. Some citrus yes but nothing woodsy or sweet. Hmmm, perhaps I should give it another try but I won't be buying this one....yet. Quite frankly, between "Euphoria" and Halle Berry's "Pure Orchid" the latter wins in my book as a fantastic scent. But, I keep in mind every fragrance is not for every woman so for those of you who love it, be blessed!!!

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: I smell vetiver right at the opening. nice sweet n fresh. after sometime the sweetness is a little overpowering but, when you feel you might end up with a headache it turns a nice powdery fragrance with a hint of sandalwood. cannot make up my mind if i love it or hate it.....need some time. will get back on it.

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: This is one of my top CK perfumes. I prefer this to obsessiob or CK one anyday..its alot more girly to me and i like that alot in perfumes..so this does the trick and i get loads of complements

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: I think I prefer this over Flowerbomb....this is much less sweet n more fresh. Am in love. And for a edt it lasts a long time.

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: Euphoria EDT is definitely my type of a floral composition. It is a green and bright floral. It starts with orchid and lotus accompanied with a gentle sandalwood. I find it sparkling and light, not powdery at all. Longevity is just right for an EDT, I would say about 3 hours on skin and a little more on clothes. It is very refreshing, just like a sip of water from a frosty glass, I will enjoy it much in scorching summer months.

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content:
Now.... there is no way that i could talk bad about this perfume because i love its cousin =p

I have been a true Euphoria addict for many years and have had my share of bottles so there is no turning back now. LOL

As for this perfume...i got it as a gift and it was a mix up because they intended to purchase the perfume instead of the edt =p Oh well i made the best of it! =p

To me it smelled like a watered down and more delicate flowery version of the original. The base notes are tamed in this one. A bit more shy... like u would want to wear the edp but u feel its 2 strong for u...that's the only way i can see this working.

Still... not bad... at all! =)

U can follow me on YouTube @ BeautyOnSale

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: One of the few scents that give me an instant headache and make me feel nauseous. Truly horrible

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is now sadly on my "had" list due to dropping and smashing an entire 100ml bottle on a hard floor :(

I really enjoyed this one and preferred it to the EDP which I found too woody for my liking and it had some sort of coffee smell to it.

Stayed on clothes well(I used a jumper to mop up as much as poss so i could it enjoy it for as long as poss) but it disappeared from my skin by lunch time. (hence why i got a huge bottle in the first place to spray lavishly!!)

GUTTED!!

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: I like it so so much. Feminine and mystical. Not too heavy not too sweet and spicy. I hate spicy scents because they can be very heavy on my skin. When i want to be sexy i could not find a fragrance works with my skin chemistry. This one suits me very well :)

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content:
At first I loved it...It's quite an addictive fragrance. I have owned it but just couldn't stand it after a while...
Something strange happens to it when worn by some people or maybe it just gets old. It smells of a damp cloth that's been damp for too long...if you know what I mean...Sort of like a trash bin smell...I know it sounds awful but it's true. Maybe it's just the way I perceive it.

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content:
I love this perfume this has to be one of my favourites
It's soft fresh and doesn't smell overly sweet :) it's a keeper :)

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content:
Euphoria EDP is heady, too much of an oriental for me, EDT is lighter, easier to wear also, i like it, feminine, elegant, not my favourite but still I am enjoying having it in my collection. More an 80ties type of perfume
It reminds me a bit of JAdore. Same type of classy scent.

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content:
Ah, I can't believe it! Apparently the cold weather had affected my Euphoria somehow, and it took a few weeks for the scent to settle back to original.

Now it smells just like I remembered, and I'm wholly bewitched by this beauty. It's incredibly silky and a bit juicy, I can almost feel the milky consistency in my nostrils. Yeah, it's pretty much orchid and lotus in milky water, breathtaking in a subtle way.

It's both aristocratic and charming. I know now what I'll be wearing in spring.

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content:
it is amazing
makes me really happy

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: Bought the EDT - the EDP is too strong in the summer. It is unmistakeable, and way too heavy for a stuffy office environment. The EDT is just right, a soft fragrance and more interesting than a simple floral perfume, and not too intrusive.

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: I got the sample from my friend and I really love it. It doesn't last long, still want it badly though!

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: This little sister is even more beautiful. It lacks that sticky sweet note which comes out from time to time in the original Euphoria. Only the most beautiful notes have stayed here and it is georgeus. So light but misterious. Orchid still plays the main role with the woody note. I've got to have it. I don't desire its bigger sister anymore. I desire Euphoria EDT. The lasting power is great.

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content:
AAAMAZING!! One of my favorites for summer. (While Euphoria edp is one of my favorites for winter and going out).
It's fresh, fruity, a little sweet and has that special sexy fresh woodyness that lasts and lingers. It's sexy and feminine, without being too young, but it is not an 'old' perfume either by any means!
It would make a great all year around signature fragrance. I love it very much and think it is the best out of all the Euphoria flankers (yes also much better than forbidden euphoria).

Go get it!

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: Finally I tried this one today.. And I´m sad I haven´t tried before, If I knew It was so simmilar as the edp but lighter, I would go buy this one instead of euphoria forbidden.. But between the EDP and the EDT I prefer the edt, altough it doesn´t last not even half of the EDP.. But anyway This one is gorgeous.. BRAVO :)

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: The main notes above are exactly what I get out of this; lotus, sandalwood and orchid. This is so lovely and feminine and not an ordinary floral. The sillage is perfect, it leaves a delicate trail, just a small hint of something pretty. Fairly linear except for the sandalwood coming out a little more in the dry down, but great staying power for an EDT, still going strong after 6 hours.

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: I prefer the EDP it's more sensual, warm, deep

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: It smells exactly like the EDP, I don't smell any bergamot or peach in it. It is what it says, the EDT version of the original Euphoria. Good for summer, since the EDP is a little too strong for the hot days.

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: To tell you the truth, I am not very keen on orientals but I got this one in 30ml just to keep it in my bag when i go to the beach as it is sweet but not too intoxicating. The price was reduced and I decided why not. It has a peachy openning with a little sour which I guess is coming from an apple. The peach note remained for as long as the scent lasted on skin and then somehow my nose detected lilly of the valley. This mixture remained on skin for about 2 hours and then just flew off. Overall, the scent is very-very plain. However, it totally suits the purpose and the price.

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: Strong, sweet, sticky, warm and delicious. Euphoria EDT was a nice surprise. It reminds me some 90`s fragance in a good way.Flowery and woody, great staying power in my skin. I will buy a bottle of this after my sample is empty. It really worths a try.

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: I prefer this to the edp. The edt is a little less strong, a very cheerful floral- the peach and honeysuckle make it sunny. The gourmand notes aren't at all obvious on my skin, and it has a nice clean drydown. The downside is the lasting power isn't as good as the edp but this would be very wearable for virtually anyone.

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: I have edp and which is more suitable for nights, but this version is better to use during the day - it's softer and brighter. I can say that I love both edt and edp:)

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: Soft and romantic smell, floral, but don't last long on me. Still, i love it very much!!

product_name: Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: I have bought it as soon as it appeared. This is softer from the edp, but in a good way, more what I looking for; chypre -floral fragances. It has a bright, feminine and cheerful point. Perhaps, it´s youger version, with the same long lasting. I think, I prefer this version. Try it, if you can, cheers

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2005 Calvin Klein
review_content: my first summer edt ..... i like it

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2005 Calvin Klein
review_content: Man this is definitely a go to. I'm just irked they have so many flankers with different bottle design but I got this when it first came out in 2005. The cedar tarragon and hyacinth are key notes. So fresh and clean yet has those undertones that are distinct. This Versace Signature and Lacoste are must haves.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2005 Calvin Klein
review_content: Nice but found it boring. Didn't finish the bottle.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2005 Calvin Klein
review_content: If you're someone who wants a fresh, individual scent that lasts, this is one cologne to consider..one of my favourite spring/summer scents! More of a day scent but can also be worn at night.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2005 Calvin Klein
review_content: I love this one - very fresh fruity and green - much better than Truth. I can detect violets in there too.....It's very good, a brilliant summer fragrance - Lasts all day on me

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2005 Calvin Klein
review_content: Can't stand the cedar notes in it. The first time I use it, it's okay, but after several days, I think it's too thick for a summer scent. I can't believe I change my mind...too bad.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2005 Calvin Klein
review_content: Together with Truth for Men, this one is such a fresh ad invigorting scent. I loved every single spray of it. It is over now and I ordered the 2008 version which I hope will be just as good.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2005 Calvin Klein
review_content: Starts off just like Coast deodorant soap and ends as a standard men’s scent. Okay, but nothing great. More woody than floral, less Vetiver or citrus than most

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2009 Calvin Klein
review_content: I bought this fragrance back in 2009, but I did not like this at all. To me, it smells very...grassy, but in an unpleasent way. Also the performance is pretty bad. For me, this is a pass.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2009 Calvin Klein
review_content: (just like some summer editions of other known scents,) this one is simply a good remix of original scent eternity for men, slightly more summery and fresh, if you like the original, this is neat for ya while it feels like the original yet a lot lighter.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2009 Calvin Klein
review_content: the opening is delicious, like a lime sweet cocktail, too bad it just last for 15 minutes and then it´s just one more summer frag

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2009 Calvin Klein
review_content:
I am a HUGE fan of all things cK and his summer fragrances are no exception, I am typing this on the summer solstice and am in fact wearing this and enjoying it as I type this...

I got '07 ES men first and (stupidly) skipped the much ballyhooed '08 ES men so when I read the notes in the press release I was not gonna let this one get away. I actually found it at TJ Maxx before the end of last summer for 20 USD (SCORE!)...

This one begins like a cool evening cocktail with a faint bitter note of bergamot as it saunters into a robust heart of spicy pepper and fresh basil with a gentle touch of chamomile to keep it from getting too out of line from that cocktail. The drydown is unique for cK because it isn't the formulaic patchouli, sandalwood, musk+ fizzle...no,no, this cool customer finishes you off with a not-to-orintal White amber, some anise (usually found in the top or heart), and slumps you down in the shade of the cool light green nuances of the hinoki wood...aah

Sillage: moderate
Longevity: 8 hrs and still on skin
Overall: 4.0/5

I have found ultra-lite and summer frags work on my skin better if I apply generously before dressing then reapply again before I go out...this helps blend the levels and strengthen the longevity.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2009 Calvin Klein
review_content:
Hi all. I want to ask you if this is the one that smells similar to jean paul gaultier for men or is the 2008 version.
I few months a go I test and eternity perfume but I don´t remember which one it was.

Thanks

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2009 Calvin Klein
review_content:
wow are all these notes part of that fragrance!!!!!! must be in small quantities all i got was a little citrus and a fresh smell that was nothing memorable

ck needs to STOP copyin their classic scents and start makin new stuff

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2009 Calvin Klein
review_content: To all the guys out there. I need help! Could you recommend me some fragrances for men? Ive a little brother who is in dire need of one!! He keeps using cheap-smelling deodarant that smells heavily of just sandalwood. Thanks for your help!

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2009 Calvin Klein
review_content: This is a very light fragrance, after 2 hours, it barely smell nothing. It kind of floral and lighter version of the Original Eternity. This fragrance is perfect for sunny hot day.

product_name: Eternity For Men Summer 2009 Calvin Klein
review_content:
hmm... my reflections:

-definitely there are some notes in this scent (also in previous version) that makes me sick and even sometimes terrible headache.
i don't like synthetic scents and this one is surely that kind.
in spite of those facts i bought it. i even strongly enjoy wearing this fragrance in particular days.

-it's typical "showy" fragrance (variation of aqua di gio). good for clubbing all night long. for sure fun lovin' girls will notice you. they will think that you smell good and quite rich.
i don't like this kind of lifestyle and perfume. for me it's symptom of shallow personality... but several days during year i put those kind of fragrance on me and go to spend crazy night in club or disco.

do i have schizopherania???
- i don't think so...
- me neither

;)
All I've ever gotten from this scent is pencil shavings. Barf.

This is one of those frags that seems to change with each whiff you get. I'm not going to get into specific notes or any of that shit, because its the combination of all that sends me.

Seriously, this aroma nearly brings me to tears its so beautiful & sublime 🤗☺️😚

This is definitely my #2 CK frag. Sitting right there right next to its sibling in the #1. That being Obsession. The OG, bitches ☝

All told, nothing comes between me and my Calvins 💕😍💋☺️💘

This is so comfortable to wear & yet is so beautiful. On my skin, I get juicy orange, gardenia, light vanilla and soft woody amber. There is also a rain-like freshness to this fragrance that I really enjoy. The night sky blue bottle alludes to this fresh aspect.
I'm looking forward to trying this in all the seasons.

Weirdo vanilla--which I appreciate. But I can't decide if I like this or just think it's ok. Spicy and a nice note of Angelica and bitter orange. Vanilla and sandalwood show up fast for me. Gardenia mostly for the floral. Not really thinking "delicious thrills" as stated in the copy for their original promo.
Could possibly be unisex, but I think it's more feminine.
Herbaceous and a little cool-spicy yet warm with the amber/vanilla/tonka.
A little sweet, but still mostly in an herbaceous way. Powdery. Dries sweeter on me than the beginning. Keeping it because I want to figure it out some more.
Worth a shot if you like vanilla, but want something out of the ordinary for that category.
I really like to wear this to bed. It’s clean and soft.
Cold vanilla ice cream 🍦 with some soft petals sprinklers 🌸 yummy and addictive
Just blind bought it for 10€ at clearance and I'm surprised how ahead of time this oldie was - it gives me Ariana Grande's REM vibes - but even cleaner, unisex, shaving cream vibes in a good way

I definitely prefer this to OG Obcession for women.

It smells like a orange cream lotion with some real depth to it.

Might buy it soon, to give it a real wear test when my collection thins.

wow, i tried this ages ago, years, and it wasnt nice.

what i get today is not what i expected either. this is a modern smelling floral (no i dont think its like armani code), a little floral sweet, light, nothing like the obsession line, the OG is a heavy hitter, this one is so light. nothing night about it to me, a bit woody powdery, i dont know.. i should test it again on its own, this isnt a big scent
This should have been labeled Obsession Afternoon because Obsession is truly a nighttime fragrance. A heavy, amber, spice bomb from the 80's. This is actually the lighter of the two.

this opens with bitter orange, bergamot and angelica. the cashmere wood comes on quickly, followed by some nondescript white florals. mostly this is cashmere wood and orange and it leans trad. masculine and goes kind of aquatic and screechy. not what i was hoping for, unfortunately.
I used to love this. I thought I had it around the age of 18. But I was 21 in 2005 when Fragrantica said it was released. The times aren't matching up with my memory.

at first i really liked it. now, i don't think it's a special perfume and i rarely wear it. i think it's perfect for going to the gym/running, because it's not an elegant fragrance (it's giving aftershave 🤨).
It’s a like. Not a love. Giving to my mom. Very nice but nothing spectacular. Safe for everyday. Work or church scent.
I thought they discontinued it?!!!
All I get are lemon scented pencil shavings. Yuck.

I would wish to like this because i love the original obsession. Unfortunately i don't smell much. A very light aftershave kind of smell. I can't even tell if it's sweet, fresh or something else so non existent it is on my skin. My skin is eating scent with amber so maybe that's the case here. But a pity because the notes sounded promising. 😞

Something in it makes me sneeze every time I put it on.. not sure what's tickling my nose, but I love this fragrance! Wore it back in 2006, thought it was discontinued, and pleasantly surprised to find it's not. Such a delicate blend of peppery, woodsy, fruity notes that mix so well together and last for hours. Perfect for daily office work, or a night out on a date. Different/better than the original Obsession, which I never liked. Will always be a 'go to' for me; 10/10
Beautiful floral with a powdery sweetness. Definitely different than the original but still a love.

A really perfect bedtime scent. Light, fresh, and cozy at the same time. This sits nicely next to the men's version, but I don't think they smell the same. Same family though. This is much more floral than CKO Night Men. I'm surprised that anyone considers this unisex, but a man could probably wear this without raising an eyebrow.

It is so weird how people smell things differently. This perfume is beautiful, I don’t get the whole “shaving cream” vibe. It’s clean and not offensive, so a good choice for the office. Definitely reminds of “Armani Code”. Longevity is not amazing, though, at least for me.
Clean Girl Aesthetics....If someone like Armani Code intrigue scent.. if You like Tea in perfumery you will like it. Taste of Earl grey...
Great everyday freshie! It does smell a little tiny bit like shaving cream but I don't mind it. Great price and good performance.

Woods, vanilla, powder and musk. As already mentioned by others this bears no resemblance to original Obsession. Not warm amber or chilly musk. Neutral. The powder, musk & cashmere wood make it soft and fluffy. I'm wearing this in hot weather during the day and perfectly happy with day wear.

The dry down is similar to Guess Gold minus fruit and more powdery. Longevity is the same.

Obsession Night has moderate sillage for the first 2-3 hours then falls off a cliff into a skin scent. The good news is it lasts on skin for most of the day but no one else will be able to smell it unless they are very close.

Scent 9/10
Longevity 6/10 Long lasting but sits close to skin.
Продавам, разменям

I love Obsession so much, but Night is just so boring. Like it smells good, I won't knock that, but it's more "wow my clean laundry smells amazing" or like a candle that is smooth enough not to be cloying. I don't particularly want to smell like this. I don't get the citrus or anything to give it a bit of twang. It's just like a soft blanket fresh from the dryer, and maybe my opinion could change in the summer or something, but for the winter it was a bit boring and almost soaked into nothing on me.

Everything is blended so well in this . All the notes compliment each other perfectly. This definitely more of a feminine perfume. I don't get the pencil shaving smell nor do i think it learns more masculine. It is just beautiful and not given the credit it is due. Captivating and soothing, it makes you feel better if you put it on at the end of a crappy day. So glad i took the plunge to purchase this.

So average, I'm really glad I didn't blind buy it, which I almost did because Obsession is one of my favs. Night is nother deodorant-like perfume, gives me a feel similar to Arden's Green tea collection, like it's CK's green tea. It's ok, it's nice, but oh so plain. I sprayed it, sniffed, and it was...flat! It did absolutely nothing for me, no reaction at all. Where are all the emotions, never mind if good or bad, a good perfume brings out in you? Original Obsession is in my top 5, but this one is just not in the same class, they have nothing in common, this one has no personality at all. Anyway, a unisex, bergamot and orange and mybe some sandalwood are what I get most, it's citrusy but a bit warmer than, for example, CK One, though sillage and longevity are quite similar. Nothing special about this one, again, I can't believe it's an Obsession flanker, they're like yin and yang, like a live person vs... robot?

I’ve scoured the comments and no one has said this so I’m probably alone in thinking this but: Rhubarb and custard, that’s what I get!
I think it must be the Angelica and the vanilla but seriously i get strong rhubarb.
I’m now wondering if this is just something the Brits will get as no other nation seem to have such ridiculous flavours as we do lol

Very light and unisex scent, doesn't project much but has its place in my collection as a nice skin scent and lasts well over 9 hours on my clothes. Contrary to its name, it is well-suited for daytime and even the office as it's non-offensive. Yes it kind of resembles a clean, aftershave scent, and leans a bit to the masc side. It has absolutely nothing to do with the original Obsession, and I actually prefer Night so much more. This scent is pretty linear so I wouldn't call it interesting or unique - it's a basic citrus and white floral. But the vanilla and cashmere wood come out hours later in the drydown and make it a bit cozier. This fragrance would pair so nicely with a white cotton button down shirt.

Бях го забравила дълго време, днес реших да го понося и се радвам, че не го разкарах. Купих го покрай любовта ми към obsession, с който няма нищо общо, може би затова го позабравих. Акварелен, но плътен аромат, нотките се преливат една в друга, зелен и топъл едновременно, много траен за моя нос. Унисекс.
Pleasant enough just doesn't last
This is beautiful! Out of the bottle, it is basic and strong. If you spray it, wait 20 minutes, it is wonderful. Not too much of anything. Just the right amount of everything.
Non-offensive unisex shaving cream smell. Nothing unusual. Not strong. Won't piss anyone off. Safe for the office.

I feel like the best CK fragrances are those that are very simple and clean. When CK tries to do something different (with the exception of the masterpiece Obsession and CK’s shocking floriental Euphoria), things are just weird, unnecessarily complicated, and seem like maybe an unfinished experiment or something? I feel this way about Obsession Night. From an air/blotter spray at first I didn’t like this at all. There were no distinctive notes. Then I sprayed on my wrist to see if it changed. Much later, something mildly aquatic/ floral floated up from my wrist drew me in for more. According to notes on the idea behind this fragrance, the scent is supposed to evoke blooming night flowers in the moonlight. The jasmine and woods are very soft and go well together, creating an odd sense of freshness that I guess eventually achieves the objective, but it’s really only very far into the dry down. It would have been nice if it unfolded like a story, as so many other great scents do. Unfortunately, the opening just smells of alcohol and synthetic florals. As a CK fan, I just bought a bunch of CK fragrances I’ve never tried, including this one. I really wanted to like this but it will stay on the shelf for awhile.

I really enjoy this fragrance & I get Earl Grey Tea with Bergamot & an extra dose of Sweet Lemon added to it, even though no tea notes are listed. Comforting when you want an easy going scent bubble. It lasts for 6+ hours, but I wish it was deeper or had stronger presence.

Updated edit: I have been also using this fragrance in the high heat of summer & it's a nice lemony citrus fragrance to take my mind off of the heat & also has a slightly sweet mint scent to it as well. It's a very nice tea scent. I sometimes wonder how this compares to other tea scents. I keep also hearing about Still by Jennifer Lopez as a very nice tea scent as well. My bottle of Obsession Night was purchased online & is a current version. I sampled this a few years ago prior to my purchased bottle & the previous one had more floral aspects & more depth compared to the bottle that I have.

I also think that Calvin Klein must have had some sense of humor when they put Obsession Night as the name for this very daytime kind of scent. & Conversely, naming Obsession with the deeper scent should have been named as an evening/nighttime scent.

Obsession Night is a keeper. This is such a stunning Amber floral! Smells a lot like shaving cream at first spray, however after settling into the skin for a few minutes, you are really greeted with the white floral notes - Jasmine and Gardenia I pick up the most. The base notes blend so beautifully together and make for a stunning dry down. It actually reminds me a little bit of how Alien wears on my skin. So glad I purchased this - what an underrated fragrance!

Another Marshall’s blind buy success! $24.99 for a 3.4oz bottle and such a great value.
It starts off very shaving cream as others have mentioned but mellows out to a solidly unisex creamy vanilla musk. I definitely get the citrus but not so much the florals. It’s just a perfect daytime scent. I don’t typically dig Calvin Klein perfumes. Reveal and now Obsession Night are my two faves.
Yay!

Gorgeous. Soft and sweet, maybe even creamy. Interesting with the bitterish orange and herbal angelica. It whispers “hey let’s chill…”
My brain says: Sweet vanilla flowers and cucumber? I love this. It’s like slipping on your softest, warmest long sleeve shirt and jeans when it’s a bit chilly. I’d call this a cool vanilla because of the green note. So approachable and crowd-pleasing.
That cashmeran note I guess is what turns this into a cuddly vibe. I don’t know how to describe it but it works. Lately I think of this as my year rounder signature (if I had one!)
Definitely my top reached for over the seasons…
The whole composition reads to me as soft, sweet, with an interesting herby green twist. Leans unisex because of that element. I feel confident to wear this day or night, all occasions. It lasts around 5 hours on me then is detectable only if I have some on my shirt. I want to have this as a staple. It keeps my nose happy. It doesn’t remind me of the older Obsession. She deserves an original name!

I find this perfume to be more of a Citrus Floral type. I mostly smell the Bitter Orange and Lily of the Valley and something else which I assume is the Angelica note. Only after 3 hours, the Citrus Floral scent goes away and a woody, smoky scent replaces it. The woody scent is subtle and sticks to the skin.

I find the perfume to be unisexual. I see this fragrance being worn by businesswomen. That being said, it may not be suitable for the office. The woody scent can be alluring and sexy. This scent is more suitable for casual events. I also think this scent will be good to wear on certain games or sports like pool or golf.

Anyway, longevity is 3-6 hours. I think this scent can be worn on all season. Night time seems more suitable but I think it can be worn on the day as well.

I don't understand how this is considered a "Night" fragrance. I was expecting something darker, deeper.
This shocked me at first. I felt so disappointed.
I bought the entire bottle and it felt like a waste.
However...
I wore it during the day. I wore it at work. I wore it doing errands. I realized I actually quite like it. The vanilla and cashmere just work for my skin. It's softer than it's sibling Obsession. Like, this one is the angelic sibling that seems to be discarded for the ostentatious elder sibling. I have never really been a fan of white floral but I am a fan of this one. She's really quite special. The Lily and Rose just bring her out with this divine drydown.
This is a cozy stay-at-home date fragrance and it's perfect for everyday wear. I love it.
Please don't expect a spicy perfume when purchasing her. Expect something softer and sweeter, you'll probably see her in a better light.

I actually prefer this one to the male version ,I ran through 2 bottles before I knew it was the one for ladies,quite unisex , slightly aquatic, gently floral with mild spicyness.Even though the Masculine version smells like a more muted TF Black Orchid.( btw this came out first so TF may have copied & improved on It🤷🏾♂️)Perfect for Summer Evenings..A love at first sniff and the drydown is divine.

A classic. I believe me and my girls together used up around 15 bottles of it. I myself finished 4 of them for sure. Balsamic, fragrant. stimulating and lots intriguing. Love the spice dominance and all of the dry down. Lasts forever on clothes hanging in the foyer and stays on your skin after shower sometimes. Also, for an older perfume it's cheap as hell, saves a headache!

I love this! My husband got me a 3.4 oz bottle for $25 at the drugstore today! The opening is sharp, balsamic/ sour sweet with a fairly short descent into a musky sweet vanilla. The dichotomy in the notes that others describe as fighting , are an adventure to me, the same way I love the spicy sweet stomach calming original. This is a steal and a blind buy for me. Great for the summer, this also gives a nod to aquatic scents. For a little extra sexy, I added Prada iris to my hairline and core
I don't like this perfume at all. It's too masculine, almost like cheap shaving lotion for men.

Not much to add to the already said, other than:

1 it has a very masculine opening, hinting at shaving foam scent
2 the drydown is to die for, but takes quite its time to arrive

Not for me, but I can see men pulling this off, very easily so!

I officially tested this perfume every day for 3 weeks, after it had a long waiting in my closet.
The heart of this perfume is 1:1 with So De la Renta by Oscar de la Renta and the opening is very similar with the opening from the Italian house Manilla G from the Eau the Fraiche, very citrus, the bitter orange is very pronounce but for me is a good thing. The middle is floral but in a easy way, acvatic, I don't feel the masculine vibe everyone speaks about, but of course I think a true gentleman can wear it, but it isn't harsh like in the masculine vibe CK one have. The final note is very charming, amber but a powdery not sweat one. Over all I like it, it not a night perfume,that coming for me trust me means a lot 😂 because I can't stand a powerful perfume worn on day, still this is very suitable for day. I don't know why the others find the classic Obsession good, but hey it's very oriental and suffocating so I can relate but still this one is very good for my taste.

When I 1st tried this, it smelled more masculine on me. It was an ok scent, but just wasn't "pretty". This was a body chemistry thing, and I tried it again when that changed (with change in diet, etc), and now I get SWEEET VANILLA out of it. It smells way more feminine now, but with that dark mysterious base, which can still get a bit like a man's cologne, but the sweet powdery citrusy vanilla takes center stage. So I like it now.


Given the name, and the masculine notes, it made me think of, like, a Lifetime movie where some obsessed stalker woman sneaks into her object-of-desire's house at night while he is not there, and she puts on his work shirt smelling of his cologne 😭😭😵

That "cashmere" wood spoils the whole composition, Cashmer does nothing but propel the musk with an intense amber shade. It is a "night" perfume because it's calamitous uncontrolled sweat fragrance.
Update: well I need to apologize to this Blue soul here, I didn't treat it fairly. Last night I had white sleep that practically mean that I can sleep so I go to my perfume showcase with the idea of perfuming myself with something cold aromatic that would relax me so much that I finally fall asleep I ended up sitting in front of the closet for 3 hours smelling and arranging perfumes.....
Between my perfumes, I find this bottle her sister Obsession and her cousin Moschino, some time ago I read about Moschino in a perfume blog and the author, a man, write about how Moschino is a perfume and successful woman perfume, well I see it oriental and I was sceptical but curious after some weeks I call my perfume gallery I speak with my consultant for 6 years already and beg him to order a bottle for me, he told me " madame Amy you will not like it isn't a powerful woman perfume, it's a black oriental, not cold not vertical, isn't suitable for you" Of course I insisted and after all he order it. Reading about that perfume I seen that people compare him with Obsession so sure that I would love it I order that too, ignoring my consultant, poor him he tried to explain me in vain, I said : I want that perfume Javier, but madam Amy.., no but!😂 I m a little viper...who I lie, I m a huge one.
Anyway when I go to take my perfumes, Javier insisted to test first I refused and after propose me this perfume he told me that Obsession Night is a cold oriental and it's more suitable for a powerful business woman like me, I was in a hurry because of a meeting so I take all 3 and go. When I arrived home that evening I open my box and put all three bottles on my living room table. I spray Moschino first....ahch who said that a powerful woman perfume never seen a powerful woman before, never but never a powerful woman would wear outside such a hot perfume, we wear cold, distinguished perfume, who vibrance the power of the person it touch. Disappointed and swearing that I will never trust a man who I don't know speaking about woman power, I sprayed the Obsession ichhhh the same feeling maybe more likable because it's was at least close to the skin because Moschino was practically everyone perfume doesn't count who spray it that fragrantice would go everywhere. The last and very disappointed I spray this blue bottle and I thought it was so sweat and so overwhelmed and nothing powerful in it. I put them in the back of my showcase and live it there. But last night I was curious and sprayed this again before trying the other two... splendiferous, I don't feel the oriental for it, it's a spicy citrus with something floral I have feeling who remember me of my lovely Perle Verte, loving it. It's cold, aromatic not really hard, it's concentrated it's true but not overwhelmed. I don't see this like a night perfume, I see it like an everyday, maybe not in summer ...still I don't think it would be a problem to wear it in summer time to, but anyway for a powerful woman is a suitable cold concentrated perfume beautiful to be put on a vintage Escada suit and to go with it to the office. The other two...no, no I tried it again still hate it but this....my apologies blue bottle you are a friend for a powerful woman I'm sorry I neglected you dear.

No offence to anybody that likes this but I HATE it. I can't think of any perfume I've disliked as much as this one.
My nose can pick out the notes I like, the citrus, the gardinia and vanilla, but it's like they are swimming in this soup of weirdness that tugs my brain all over the place. The notes seem to bounce off each other instead of blending together, like a child banging on piano keys vs someone playing a song.
There is a note that my nose just can't stand, and don't recognize, perhaps the labdanum, which I'm not familiar with, but what bothers me most is the sense of chaos and competition the notes give off, like they're all fighting to be on top.
For me, perfume is all about aromatherapy. This fragrance makes me feel agitated and stressed out, not what I'm looking for.
I would not suggest a blind buy on this one.
I enjoy reading the positive reviews and am always astounded by differences of opinion regarding fragrance. It's always good to see the other perpesctive.

This is the perfume that made me fall in love with perfumes. It probably holds more sentimental value for me now than anything else but I still enjoy it very much.
It must have been 2005 and I was very young and it was the first and only time I asked a stranger what scent they were wearing. I didn't only ask, I had to get off on an earlier stop from the bus and I had to chase this poor person down a steep hill, almost breaking my legs in the process.
I still remember that it was a warm evening and how the air smelled and how impressed I was with this magical scent.
Did they tell me? Yes,they said "Blue Calvin Klein". And being myself I immediately forgot what I heard. I spent 15 years trying to find it, trying all the blue bottles I could find. And only recently I did find this one last year and although I know it doesn't smell exactly like it used to be I am happy to have it.
So why did I fall in love with it? It wasn't a very feminine scent and I enjoyed the masculine notes so much. It felt like someone just met their boyfriend and after a long "hug" their perfumes mixed and it developed into this amazing blend. So the masculine notes must be the citrus but I usually hate citrus so why would I love this? I can't smell vanilla here either and I usually love any hint of vanilla so this again is strange. I get the hint of sweetness but definitely not in a gourmand sort of way. I get some white flowers but again I used to hate anything with white flowers. This is definitely one that is more than just a sum of its parts.
This scent felt very adult and mysterious to me, and confident and sexy. Now it feels safe for the office, ok for summer but also great for a blind date. It feels too safe for me now to love it as much as I did but I know I will always have a bottle. Maybe it is like meeting an old flame after many, many years, you can see why you fell in love with them but all of the excitement is gone.

When I was a teenager I'd have the boys I dated take me outside the city to stargaze. This is totally the scent I would have worn those decades ago had it been available. It's not the field or the stars or the boys or anything other than the darkness between the stars; the mystery how lives were to unfold. It has that depth and anticipation inside of it, one that seems to come with dreamy youth.

I love the way this fragrance unfolds: bitter and sweet, morphing into a well blended humid, woody, out-doorsy vanilla. It's the promise of excitement and the realisation that maybe excitement is nice, but what we really want is something more traditional to anchor us down when we watch the stars.

As far as I am concerned, this is an underrated gem. I suppose it depends on the memories this smell evokes. Does anyone else smell sharpened pencil shavings in the opening? Obsession Night dries down ... a long time later ... to a lovely, soft, baby oil type vanilla. I am wearing this for comfort during the coronavirus outbreak and I just love it. I have owned this bottle for at least 12 years and the juice is still good, by the way. Please stay safe and well, everyone.

The opening feels like a fight between sour citrus and flowers. There is a strange bitter tarry smell under it all the pokes through again and again each time I smell my wrist. It chills out to a *very* nice vanilla with flowers. Its nice but not worth the wait to keep using this.
Мога да го разменя
Мек, плътен и същевременно прозрачен аромат, има типичната СК ДНК, но някак в посока сандал, крем... Такива неща. Хубаво смесен.
Хубав аромат, но мога да го разменя
Бих го разменила
Orange dream-sicles and stacks of new clothes at the mall! This smells clean and fun. Not at all Obsession or night though. More like Obsession summer afternoon or Obsession lunch break. Hehe.

I smell cumin in here for sure -- nasty; like something else I hated and sold; sweet, bitter, sweaty like caramel mixed with salt and crushed flowers and baby vomit, a sourness to it and a mishmash of mishap; vanilla, sandalwood, cashmere, bitter orange and orange, angelica, some light white flowers, ick. Seems a cold weather frag. I am wearing it in June but it's only in the 70s. Maybe I will try it again this fall. Gets a little better as it dries down. I hated the top.

Definitly a spring/summer perfume..it is a longlasting, close to skin to moderate..don't think it is masculine, it settles in a nice sweet orange, white flowery perfume..I personally like the opening, than it is louder

The review below by Shellapoo is excellent. Most of what they said is how I feel about this scent. It took me a couple tries to come around on this one, but when I did, I was really happy that I added it to my arsenal. It's such a hard fragrance to categorize. Klein's use of the term "night" to this obsession isn't totally a sell for me. It encaptures so many different nuances and they are so blended seamlessly that one cannot only have one thought if it. The opening citruses and florals complement each other perfectly. Neither being too forward, but each mixing together in just the right amount. The dry down allows the tonka, vanilla, and amber to underpin the top to give this it's luxurious creaminess. It's such a perfect harmonious blend of citrus, floral, and cream. Each being perfectly proportionate without making the fragrance overly gourmand, floral, or fruity.The strength doesn't quite reach EDP status even though my bottle is the EDP. And it definitely doesn't have the POWER that its Mother, Obsession, has. This scent is very different from Mother Obsession. And it's definitely adaptable for day or night wear. Night wear would require just an extra spritz or 2, and you're good to go. I encourage you to try this. It's beautiful.

I have recently re-tried several perfumes that I had previously written off as being bad mixes with my chemistry. Most of them have been what I would describe as spicy scents, and those heavy on woods and amber, with very little florals, fruits, or green notes. One of these was Obsession. I don't know why I thought I hated it - I LOVE it! Once I discovered how much I love Obsession, I took the plunge and blind bought this beauty. I didn't know what to expect, but now I can say it is a treasure! I smell some similarity to Obsession, but enough of a difference that I will be keeping BOTH of them in my collection forever. This is such a well blended scent that I can't seem to identify individual notes too well. I can say, however, that it is gorgeous. On my skin, it is beautiful but not overly strong. I'm not going to save this one for night. Even though it is somewhat potent (never potent enough for me though!), I think it is safe for the office as long as you are light with the spritzing. I wouldn't describe this as a floral, yet there are enough florals to notice and enjoy. I definitely wouldn't say it is an aquatic, yet there is a hint of "blue" in there. I think I would call this spicy, although it is not in the same league as the strong spice of Obsession. Whenever I've stepped out of the shower and dressed in the morning, I spray this on and I immediately get a "mood lift" and get the feeling that today is going to be a very good day. Who doesn't need that in their daily life?

Certainly it's been reformulated over the last 13-14 years since being introduced in 2005. I'm fortunate enough to have a bottle from 2006... So I suspect I have an original formulation in my possession...The juice has even taken on an aged patina within the blue bottle. I wouldn't risk ordering a new one to compare, for fear of complete disappointment.

I find it a good cold weather scent, with average longevity. I don't mind wearing it anytime- day or night.

I will be doing my best to use as much as i can before this beauty spoils. No telling how much longer it will keep.

Really reminds me of Coty Dark Vanilla... very much so. Probably the jasmine, and vanilla. Plan to test one on each wrist to see how they compare. Ive been searching for a Dark Vanilla dupe for years, and this is as close as I've come yet.

I was hesitant to buy this fragrance because the reviews are all over the place. Saw it on sale for a great price so I went for it. Glad I did because I love it. I don’t find it masculine but the florals are very subtle so perhaps that’s why some reviewers find it to be masculine. It’s not a night scent to me but a beautiful soft bergamot , amber, musk and powdery vanilla.

I just got this today and with the 1st testing, I feel it leans quite masculine , giving me a sense of dejavu as it is quite generic,leaving me to think it is a cheap cologne, which is a shame.

I admit, I was hoping for something much darker but instead it is almost entirely aquatic in the opening which again is slightly disappointing as I adore original Obsession, which incidently, this flanker bears no resemblance too.

I honestly felt with this composition, that the addition of incense, spices or vanilla could really amp this up a little and make it something special.

So until further testings, I would safely say that this scent isnt especially noir or night, so it is safe for daytime wearing to the office etc and it does have decent lasting power with moderate perfomance.. Which isn't bad for the price and amount per bottle. And I'm hoping that in warmer weather, the scent might open up a little, into something entirely different to what it is now.

I just got a big 100ml bottle at very reasonable price and instantly opened and sprayed. Now this bottle is made by Coty - I saw some negative comments bashing this edition - and I must say there is defo a bit of truth in there..It says eau de parfum, but I`d rather classify it as an eau de toilette, although it did last good 4 hours on me..Given that the scent itself is not as strong in nature as the original Obsession basically one shouldn`t expect miracles here anyway.

The scent itself is quite a surprise. It isn`t really something you`d expect..I`m not a fan of the original Obsession, although it definitely is a powder-bomb powerhouse scent, just too much for me, always was..Love to take a whiff, but don`t like it on me. Whereas this one is more wearable - initially waaaaay too citrusy for my liking, but that impression fades quick enough and it slowly dries down to be this lovely cashmere-vanilla-flower beauty. I get mainly these three notes and something fruity also even though there aren`t any fruity notes listed apart from bitter orange..To my nose this note is slightly like PAPAYA! It is definitely there though, I much more get this than a lot of the other scents, now I do not know what angelica smells like, so it could also be the impression of that - but to me it is papaya, and that is that..But cashmere, vanilla and flowers are defo out there more than anything else, there is almost a milkiness to it also which makes it easy to wear.

I like it because the drydown is not typical, not a mass-produced one, it would almost pass as unisex too, but still more on the feminine side. Elegant! I love the cashmere note particularly and it is paired well with flowers here.

It is possibly an all-year-rounder, but not typically for night or for colder months. I recommend trying if you don`t want anything sweet, heavy or very citric. Thumbs up from me.

EDIT: I just sprayed it on cca 3 hours ago, and now I`m sniffing it closely. The drydown actually does hold abit of similarity with the original Obsession! After all the citrus and white flowers gone comes the cashmeran wood, then musk and then this..very similar..don`t know what note it is, but similar. It is interesting noticing this..I sprayed the original - my Mum`s bottle - on my skin a few days ago and it just hit me..

This is so weird. Absolutely not what I was expecting. Given the original Obsession, and the "night" claim, this is a simple, safe, aquatic scent that is more like "day" or "sun" or "beach" or "summer." It is nice, but I'm not sure I need a bottle of "nice." But again, I'll use up my decant and update if my opinion changes.

The only thing Obsession and Obsession Night have in common is the sweet green herbal note that the current formulation of Obsession has. Obsession Night otherwise goes a more floral, musky route and has little staying power. I had to really overspray this one for it to last even just a couple of hours. It's a shame because I actually really enjoy this scent; without the herbal note it could be a generic woody floral but the green aspect really turns this fragrance into something unique.

Obsession is known for being a powerhouse fragrance, why oh why could they not make Night just as strong??

I wrote below once and I will write again, 6 years later, that this is an incredible perfume. Maybe it's because I love perfumes from the 90s and 00's. They were less contrived, so to speak. Most perfumes I smell in shops today are way too in your face, they lack simplicity and sincerity. I go 'yuck' almost every time I sniff another bottle at the mall, so I stopped doing it. Out of 100, I will like 1-2.

Obsession Night, however, is still that very oldie. Along with everything Biagiotti does. Along with some Paul Smith. I just ordered three CC and one Biagiotti, opened Obsession Night and went WOW. I have missed this terribly. The last bottle I had was of poor quality.

But now, oh, I'm in heaven. And I really don't know whether it's masculine or not. To be honest, I don't care. This scent is just... WOW.

The notes in this are kind of a strange combination. Usually citrus and huge florientals are opposites, but they coexist here. The clean aspect screams yOU BEHAVE! while the voluptuous aspect whispers hey come here i’m Here. Great for occasions where you are not sure if you want to scare off your guests or entice them.... i still don’t know if i hate it or love it
I did like this when I bought it but after wearing it for some time, honestly it's a perfume that smells like laundry detergent.

This perfume is just enchanting. Floating buttery floral sweetness and smooth cashmere that reminds me of liquid amber, with a tiny edge of bitter citrus and herbs to keep it interesting. First 2 minutes are bitter orange and angelica herbal bite. Makes you believe this might be a challenge.

But then she just folds out the sweet, liquidy woods and white flowers. I usually like fragrances with gardenia and white flowers in a supporting role, and here they play beautifully with the woods and cashmere to create a luxurious, sweet and deep smell.
I can see why it's called Night, it could be very sexy. I think it's sheer enough for daytime, too. It's sillage is not too out there. Longevity around 4-5 hrs.
Mmmmmm-I love this one.
P. S. So sad I think mine has turned. I hope I can find some newer stuff out there!

GOOD GOD I lovvve' this so much. I'm a guy but this is just magical and mysterious on my skin like a dream. Bad news first: it doesn't last.. and guess what? I don't care! Just keep spraying it! I don't care if fragrance last. But make sure u get big bottle. So anyways this is the first fragrance that I ever sprayed and was like this is 'ME.' I bought it thinking it was the men's but turned out it was woman perfume and i am a man! Since then I have bought all obsession flankers (summer) both men and women's except the men's night version. They are all beautiful. I believe Dior could trick people put his name on obsession woman night and market it toward men and it will be just as good as Dior Homme Eau! I rather have this for $20 then spend a $100 on men's Dior Homme Eau! Creamy dreamy night aquatic subtle compact powder musk. I recommend this to men. I love love and am dying for another bottle when I can find it for $20 I'm going for it. And I love the bottle...a beautiful blue color just so me I like it over all my colognes! Sorry ladies this one is for me!

I don't know what happened. I used to love this scent but now I feel like something in it irritates me (and I can't point out what it is)! I wish I could love it this perfume as I used to as I just got a big bottle of it. Maybe will have to give it some time as I remember it used to be one of my favorites, very feminine and sexy.

Obsession night is my sex time perfume and the only perfume that I ordered a backup bottle of it in my whole life.

One of my passions is looking for perfumes that are non popular and difficult to find. Obsession night was in my list for some time until I found it online. It was cheap but in my country it is very difficult to find, in fact the seller called me and informed me that they have only one bottle of it in the stock.

The first impression was disappointing. To me it was an ordinary aquatic men cologne. But I fell in love with the bottle and even the box. So simple and yet beautiful. Then I noticed that that there were no "pour femme" or "for woman" label anywhere on the box or bottle, so I checked fragrantica again to make sure that it was not the male version and of course it was not.

Anyway after wearing it for some time I found it was noway aquatic, it is warm, woody, dreamy, a little sweet and unisex and at the same time wet...It smells amazing. It is an underrated perfume for sure. Maybe it does not have the best quality (it is not expensive right?) but it smells unique and is long lasting. In fact the ad perfectly describes it.

Since I found the perfume sexy and sensual I decided to wear it during lovemaking and guess what? My partner who hates perfumes and always coughs and stares at me badly when I wear any perfume told me how good I smell!

I simply adore regular Obsession and just out of curiousity I blindly bought a tiny bottle of Obsession Night. And I dislike it a lot! It has nothing in common with Obsession, except the bottle shape. It's cloying and simply boring. I cannot detect any particular notes in it. I am really glad I ordered such a tiny bottle and not a 100 ml one because I just don't know what to do with it. I also planned to blindly buy Sheer Obsession but since it has been discontinued and it's quite pricey I'll pass.
BTW I just don't get why CK decided to name it Obsession Night and sell it in the same shaped bottle and suggest it's a flanker of Obsession when it's obviously not. The same happens to Euphoria...

Wow so many people have good things to say about this, I found it heavy, and horrible, like some older woman smell, I find Panache vile when I was little someone used to wear it. What ever is in it I can't stand it, just wish I would pinpoint it.
I brought mins online as I did with that other brown teardrop shaped bottle by CK, maybe they were fakes but the seller had good feedback. Got provocative woman also, and now I can stand that one.
Gee I see a pattern....

I am very happy that I've been waiting with this review for quite a while. I bought this fragrance in January and I was a bit puzzled...the sillage was quite poor, longevity non- existant and I didn' t quite know what to make of it. And now in May I can appreciate this wonderful complex fragrance. It is overwhelming in a good way. It starts rather sharp but within seconds envelops you with intoxicating aroma. I don' t smell citrus, not at all but a lot of white flowers with I guess, gardenia leading...there is something haunting about it really...no sweetness...it is haunting and dark..a bit aquatic...a night walk in the woods along the lake...white flowers, woods and water. Funny because I definately smell grasses and herbs (angelica?), there is no lavender listed either but think I get lavender as well. Tonka bean, sandalwood and vanilla...warm drydown. Mysterious, hauting, complex. Longevity and sillage are good ( in warmer temperatures at least). And yes, it has a good deal of this sexy intimate vibe...very nice for a date.

I love it on my husband! It's not really lasting on my skin, though for me it's a refreshing, beautiful scent, totally fit for late night's dates in the summer. I'd call it romantic, but not flirty. On my husband it has the perfect sillage, it lasts for 8-9 hours and it compliments him so much. We share it and we love it.

This is a strictly "middle of the road" scent to me. It doesn't offend, but it doesn't knock my socks off either. On me, it's very linear from first spray into the dry down.
I get a subtle lavender and white flowers (can't pick out the jasmine from lily of the valley. weird I know...)along with a citrus vanilla. I really don't understand the lavender, as it isn't listed, but to my nose, it's definitely there. From the notes listed, I can't really explain why, because I'm not familiar with all of them, angelica in particular. No rose, no cashmere wood (which, to me, is a bummer!),no Tonka bean, no amber (another bummer). Taken together, maybe one or more of these things, along with the flowers and citrus, accounts for the lavender impression I get.
Anyhow, I do like this creation and find it very comforting. I also think i'll try this in warmer weather to see if my impression changes.
In addition, it doesn't project past arms length. Very subtle...

Lovely scent. I'm wearing it today and for me it's so sensual and a bit mysterious. It is slightly "herbal", I guess that's angelica and bitter orange effect. I imagine that also men could wear this scent, but for me it's a perfect choice that cuddles me on this cold day. I just smell the collar of my cardigan and I'm in cashmere floral vanillic heaven :)
I love it! It's absolutely wonderful fragrance for work.

Obsession Night is not quite what I hoped for as it's more berries than citrus and has an unexpected sweetness to it. I think it is the vanilla that plays that trick with me. The woodiness is pleasant, sIlage and longevity are adequate and the powdery dry down is lovely but current buys in the CK range that I find much better are In2u for a citrus amber and Eternity Night for a fruity floral.
I already own In2u & also have Nicole Richie's No Rules which does a much better job of the fruity-sans-patchouli genre so it's no biggie for me that this has been discontinued. There are still genuine samples available from reputable sources and mine hasn't turned.

I've already reviewed this, but I just had to come back and say some more. It's already been a few years since this has been discontinued and I still haven't found a perfume that will suit my skin and personality the way this perfume did. I still have a 100ml bottle; it's obviously a fake, but dare I say a good one? I get most of the notes I did in the original perfume, just that I can really smell the alcohol in this one. It's not really pleasant for my nose sometimes, but it makes me happier than most of the perfumes I've tried over the last few years. So for anyone looking to try this perfume: you'll most probably be buying a fake one or a really dated bottle (and if you do find one, please PM me, I'd love to get my hands on one :)). Obsession Night will make you feel confident, sexy, mysterious and you'll be turning quite a few heads. In my honest opinion this perfume should have been called Night Obsession: it's definitely a night perfume (even though I frequently find myself wearing it during the day) and I have and always will be OBSESSED with it.
I keep hoping that some day CK will start producing this again or that some perfume house will copy it and resell it under a new name. Until then, thank you for everything Obsession Night, you'll never be replaced, nor matched.

Not my cup of tea...harsh, dark, masculine.
Powdery after a while, but could work for someone who is into oriental and heavy scents. Well balanced.

When I first used Obsession Night a few weeks ago I passed it off as a fresh, citrus unisex scent,more suited to daytime use but something has changed about it in that time.
Yes, it's still quieter and more subdued and not related at all to the original, which was a loud,look at me now fragrance but now it's a bedtime for two, come with me scent. This for me is not a clubbing scent, where it competes with a hundred other perfumes for attention, it's more elegant, more ladylike but she will certainly get her man. Soft sensual woods, white flowers and a little bit of citrus that will get you lots of attention.

The initial scent when I spray this is horrible, it's like dead reeking flowers. After about an hour it calms down to something bearable, but that initial time... yuck. Don't care for this one at all.

As several people have noted, Obsession Night actually seems like more of a day fragrance, at least initially. It is soft vanilla and citrus and wood. But last night, I wore it to bed, and it was such a relaxing fragrance for falling asleep, that I think I understand where the "Night" aspect comes into play. For wearing out and about, I'd stick to daytime use of this scent, but at home, it will definitely be a sleepy time scent for me.
This smells very light and vanilla fresh. More suitable for daytime or workplace. Stays close to skin and doesn't have great longevity. Smells good though.

I was so excited by the reviews that I blind bought a 100ml bottle because the standard Obsession has been ruined by reformulation and yes I have written to Coty.
Sorry fans but I hate this one. It is an early 00s unisex that clogs the back of my throat. It is nothing like my beloved Obsession used to be. It has that weird grossness that Diesel in the red bottle has so if you miss Obsession Night get Diesel or CK One or something. Sorry I can't describe it in fancy shmancy perfumista terms a I don't know them but I do have a nose lke a bloodhound and I am not a happy pooch! This smell makes me sad in my heart. After half an hour it starts to smell a bit like Vera Wang Princess got mixed into it but still that weird Diesel rising bile feeling. Luckily I am going swimming later so the chlorine will blast out my nose and throat of the last traces because eww! If anyone in the UK wants it there's a 100ml bottle up for grabs

Love this scent. A bit darker than Obsession, which really didn't do much for me (it was the craze in high school, so maybe that prejudiced me toward it).
However, this is a cashmere wood, truly, with spiciness that stays on my skin. It will also cling to a coat or blazer, so there is just a waft of scent you get as you are putting your clothes on- usually I think, "oh,someone smells nice!", then I realize it's ME.
Lasts a while, and is a great all around scent.

I don't see this as an evening scent. I agree with a few reviews below that this in fact is a great scent for daytime and office wear. It's heavy on the musk but bright with slightly citrusy sandalwood and vanilla. Not overly sweet or powdery and has a touch of an herbal feel to it.

I also don't see the link between the original Obsession and this one. Obsession Nights isn't sharply spicy whatsoever like the original Obsession.

Obsession Nights is not a head turner (nose turner?). It simply smells clean, fresh in a midly sweet and soapy manner. A very inoffensive fragrance even if heavily sprayed. I'm sorry to learn it is discontinued, but for US residents, CVS is still selling it online for under $30 a bottle.

This one is quite a surprise because it's neither candy-sweet nor floral, rather it appears woody, dark and it contains perhaps a piece of nuts. These are typical attributes associated with male fragrances, but are only first impressions. This one should by no means be disregarded as being too masculine, as it develops nicely along the hours and becomes mildly sweet, more and more mysterious and sexy. Furthermore, it seems to last forever, Perhaps the ideal fragrance for hot summer nights? Give it a try if you are looking for something unusual.

****
Es un perfume unisexa mi parecer , bien masculino pero es grato !
I liked this at first but ultimately the wood note drove me crazy . . . it smelled like pencil shavings.

I don't see any similarity to men perfumes since I am not into unisex scents these days. I find it a really nice playfull floral fragrance. What I don't get is why it is called night, since for me it can be obviously worn during a spring or summer day without offending anyone. At my skin I can mainly smell the white flowers and not much of incense or vanilla. Well, actually the vanilla is more profound at the drydown. Also, I need to tell that it hasn't got any similarities to the original Obsession. Don't expect a lighter or heavier version of it. It is a totally different perfume. I would have changed their names though (this would have been the Obsession and the Obsession would have been the night). The sillage is moderate but the longevity is really big.

Lots of comparisons for this but mainly mens frags like PH Just Me, Azzaro Chrome. Also womens Davidoff Cool Water, Jil Sander, VS Heavenly, YSL Elle, Caberet Gres, Benetton Giallo, Samsara & Katy Perry Royal Revolution... I'd like a sample someday but not much into the masculine ones myself...

I love this fragrance. While it is labeled as Night, I do find it lovely for daytime use, what with it's light floral scent. I prefer it in the warmer months as the citrus is very refreshing. This scent does go a little powdery on me, but the wood notes mellow that out.

It reminds me of VS Heavenly mixed with Jil Sander Style, and the new Katy Perry Royal Revolution, but more masculine then the mentioned. Nothing new, but very nice nonetheless. It is a masculine tropical scent. A night time scent for dining or drinks in a sprawling metropolis in the midst of the tropics, Kuala Lampour perhaps? Citrus fruits and woods with a cashmeran drydown. Balmy sweet with an astringent edge. It is very unisex, strong charactered. I prefer it in humid weather. This would be even more lovely layered over a cashmere or vanilla scented body oil/lotion, and would be better suited for daytime if so. I recommend lovers of such scents to try it.

On the first spray I thought, "dark fruits." It smelled like a tropical night in the jungle. The dry down seemed really powdery to me, and the jasmine started coming through more clearly, but still a little citrus showing through. I didn't detect the cinnamon or vanilla, which was disappointing, because I love a gourmand, but the mix of sandalwood, white flowers, and citrus is beautifully dark and sexy.

This definitely seems like an evening scent to me - something to wear on a date. I can't wait to wear it out with my SO.

The first exclusive fragrance, which I found as a teenager! Evokes beautiful memories for me. It is sophisticated, certainly unusual and unique. A lot of people say that it is a bit masculine, but for me it's mint-citrus blend, although I know that it is not composed of mint. The first impression regarding the smell, which describes it to this day, this candy ice! Perfect for any time of year, many people complimenting them.

I really enjoyed this one, and hurriedly bought a bottle blindly once I heard it was going to be discontinued. I was shocked to find out that this has a very similar dry down as Avon's Sweet Honesty. The powdery note is amplified on my skin in both and doing a side by side comparison I could not detect but a very slight difference. I have and love Sweet Honesty and since it is slightly cheaper, I will stick with that one. Although this does not add much variety to my wardrobe I do not regret it, I love powdery scents and can you really have too many comforting scents. As always skin chemistry plays a huge role in how this will turn out for you, but I do think it is a safe office scent especially if you like powdery skin scents.

Crisp and clean, citrusy, aquatic, Lillies of the valley. A lovely, light fragrance that has a unique smell and is good for events where you don't want to overpower people and be "that" perfume girl/guy who stinks up the room lol.

I made a blind buy with the positive comments in here but it's not suitable for people who loves watery or airy scents, delicate, innocent perfumes. For this reason i don't like it on my skin, also it made an headache. So if you don't like sugary or powdery sexy heavy scents get away from this.

i use ck obsession night for day and ck obsession for night couse obsession night more fresh than obsession
i dont smell any sweet notes its more woody for me. good for daily use happy perfume

Fresh citrus opening, the vanilla comes to soften the orange. This is like an orange cookie on me. Sweet, without being sickening. Lasts about 2-3 hours. I love the bottle, beautiful blue color, easy to hold, has more of a spray than a spritz. Comforting, warm scent, no alcohol smell in the beginning. Wish it lasted a little longer, seems kind of weak. All in all I really like it. Good value for the price, got it for 20 bucks at Marshall's.

This was my sweet 16 fragrance. To me it was sexy and right in your face. Just what I wanted!I wore it through the whole year, even though I've never bought it again. I don't know why I liked it that much at the time, but it must be due to a fact that I was craving for a more adult womanly scent than those sticky sweet perfumes that girls in high school usually wear. It definetly brings up good memories, but it's my ex-fragrance so I've already moved on.

I had a sample of this perfume and in my personal opinion, this perfume is really full of citrus. It is quite a lovely scent and it can be wear in all year´s seasons. Reminds me of Davidoff: Cool Water Woman just a little bit. Calvin Klein is a good brand indeed.

This was a blind buy for me and I really like so far. Firstly, it's very different for the original Obsession, so just be warned that they have nothing in common if you want to try it. I actually figured this frag would be heavy but it's not; I think it's better suited for warmer temps but one could wear it year round. I would describe it as being a "fresh woody" scent. On my skin, the citrus and wood are most predominant and I can catch some floral nuances here and there. It has a very invigorating aroma about it; to me it's energizing.

I actually think a man could quite easily pull this one off as I think it's more unisex than feminine. I get moderate longevity and sillage with this one. If you like the fresher scents with a unisex edge, try this one.
For me, it is just light floral fragrance. Nothing I'd expect after sexy promo photo. It is just ok, clean, pleasant. Reminds me of one celebrity perfume, but I can't remember which.

***This review is about Obsession Night prior to the Great Coty Disaster.***

Best fragrance ever in my opinion.
Was the most complimented fragrance ever, by men or women at daytime or night

Very unique and very pleasant and very intoxicating without being heavy, spicy, or too much or too ripe or too citrucy or too anything. The last Calvin Klein masterpiece.

That cashmere with bitter orange merged into something that looks exactly like the advertisement: Wet wet wet and wet. This is a wet smooth fragrance that feels like it was blended in the dark. Nothing like it. It elevates you to a different plateau.

Reinventing "Fresh and woody", full of spirit, just slightly flowery but not at all cheesy, with some intoxicating bitter hint, mysterious yet fresh, super elegant yet young, sexy as hell, without any residue of pepper and cedar or "timeless" hints.. it's all about the present. This was heaven in my opinion.
