The citrus is not boring and flat like many of those gazillion citrus perfumes out there, and I wouldn't call it at all a citrusy fragrance.
I've had like 20 bottles of Obsession Night.
LOVE IT.

Compliments mega monster.
It gives a very strong impressions, people give you those spontaneous "woh-wow! excellent what is that?" compliment, before they even realize they are smelling a fragrance.
It had awesome longevity and projection back in the days...

HOWEVER... this is R.I.P

DO NOT PURCHASE THIS.
The Coty bottles are no good. A fraud.

THE COTY BOTTLES ARE NO GOOD, NOT THE SAME BLEND, FORMULA FLATTENED, LESS THAN ONE MINUTE LONGEVITY!

CALVIN KLEIN WHAT IS WRONG WITH YOU !!!!!!!

Also, that was my signature since I first laid my nose on it, and now I'm lost with no identity, no protecting halo, so if you liked it back at the time when NY was responsible for the production and think there's something else I must love, please, do message me!

I really like this! Obsession Night is indeed unisex. It smells quite reminiscent of Van Cleef & Arpels' Midnight in Paris! There's less of a leathery note here, no tea, and a little more bergamot; but that deep, leathery vanilla characteristic of MIP is definitely here. There's a slight hint of mint with this one as well, I think, a 'coolness' of sorts. I'll keep this one in my collection as long as I can find it. Very nice!!

One thing to mention, however, is that while both ON and MIP are quite lovely, MIP lasts quite a bit longer and projects farther. ON is much more of an intimate fragrance, while MIP makes more of a statement.

i just reviewed this but i can't help but put 2 more of my cents in on this fragrance...very special and it draws me in throughout the day to sniff it. i know other reviewers have mentioned no likeness to it's big mama the original heavy hitter Obsession but lemme tell you, on my skin at about 3 hours it really does have that soft spiced powdery vibe to it and it's nothing short of intoxicating at that point. this a gorgeous fragrance as it dries down, a total chameleon. it starts off smelling like one genre of scent and ends up being a totally dif one...i'm crazy about this masterpiece and feel it's been severely overlooked as a great fragrance and under rated as such...could it be because it wears the name of Calvin Klein? hm, could be....

ok, i get play-doh and a bit of plastic doll head but play-doh for sure lol wow i'm really loving this...there's a freshness i can't quite place my finger on and a similarity to CK Encounter for men (omg my favorite!! mens frag) almost eucalyptus in feel...kinda powdery play-doh is all i can come up with for lack of better terms. i usually don't have such a difficult time putting fragrances into words but this one has me stumped all i can say is that i adore it! i spray it into the air just so i can walk through the beautiful (if not intriguing) cloud it leaves behind. CK would have nailed this one no doubt if it lasted longer...longevity is decent at best but that's par for the course when it comes to CK fragrances in my experience...i really like this scent a lot i just wish i got more mileage out of it as this is a scent i want to smell for a loooong time =) i do have success if i spray it in the crook of my arm...i know, i must look ridiculous sniffing the inside of my elbow like a fiend but it's all good cuz this smells delicious!

I made the mistake of having my friend sniff this the first time I ever wore it. He loves it on me, I don't. *SIGH* There is something present at the very start that is unpleasant, but I don't know which ingredient is the culprit. (Damn my indescriminate nose!)

I am trying it out a 2nd time today, and that same note got me again. It is almsot all gone now (after 45 minutes) but so is the rest of the scent. I am not accustomed to having an EDP disappear so quickly.
Love this scent. Perfect for date night or when u want to get cozy...sexy...seductive...great gift.

FYI - I saw this today at Marshalls (I'm in California) $20 for the 1.7oz

I was so tempted, but based on the reviews here I'm kinda glad I resisted as I love the original and this sound like a weak floral version. I'm sure it's not bad, but probably not my thing.

== update I tried a tester of this and yup, Very weak light floral.. nothing like the original.. no silage & didnt last long either, under 2 hours
I love this for evening out!
I think the smell is... sour? But it really reminds me of a hot night in summer. So, so, so sexy. Stuffy, but it has its charm.
Yes, I think this female version is near a male version. It's nice scent indeed and yes it is discontinued, they told me in a big shop.

I've been reading the reviews and it seems like this has been discontinued? I just saw about 20 bottles of this in a shop in London for a very good price, I'd better buy it before they sell out. It's such a pleasant, classic, dreamy fragrance. When I smell the tester I just feel like whoever wears this has very good taste. It's lovely.

Coty must be only the factory used by CK to produce their fragrances, as Prada doesn't make theirs either but that is done by a company in Spain. I think Coty, or Puig for that matter, follow the very protocols issued by Calcin Klein Corporation.

Now, do you think a man could wear this female versaion? Reading the notes it seems a lovely scent.

I must preface this review by saying that I have tested 5 CK 'fumes and have not liked any of them. Clearly I am not in sync with this brand but there are so many great reviews for this fragrance....shrugs...we can't all like the same things.

To me, this is an insipid fragrance. True, it is nothing like the curried original but it's nothing special, designed and marketed for the Gen X masses - woody, citrus - ground breaking! The only thing interesting was the use of Angelica but everything else was just a standard inclusion with nothing really pulling it's fragrant weight. I find it unisex and lacking the confidence to carry off something with more personality, it just kind of blends in in a way that might have been attractive to me in my early 20's. I feel it was released 10 years too late to be fashionable, I think it would have been a great accompaniment to the 90's along with Eternity.

Hi, kaejuntun, amazing review!
You describe this beauty so well,and spoke exactly my words!

Blind bought this based on the reviews -

Oh. My. Word.

Opened the package and sprayed this inside the box to get a feel for the fragrance before I put it on my skin and wasn't so sure about it - smelled a little sharp, powdery, spicy, balmy... Not really what I was hoping it would be. And then I tried it on the skin.

This is FANTASTIC!!! I am absolutely LOVING it. The woods are so smooth, not masculine at all, and the vanilla is sweet but not overly so. The flowers are very subdued on me - I think they do a good job of keeping the fragrance feminine. Creamy, soft, warm, probably best suited for cooler weather. I can't take my nose away from my wrist! It wears so close to the skin, keeping the fragrance intimate without being too "raw" if that makes sense. It reveals a certain sensuality without being too bold. This could be worn either day or night, I suppose, but would probably be best worn at night.

An unimaginably successful blind buy! Delicious.

I think the original is stronger but this is still a nice fragrance. I think I was expecting it to be stronger because the "night" or "noir" versions usually are but not in this case. Not really a criticism just an observation. If you are expecting the overpowering nature of the original you will not find it here.

Instead this is very mellow and relaxing -- if this is "Night" the sort of evening I picture is a deep twilight before the moon has risen, when everything is dark and peaceful, with crickets chirping, and everything becoming slightly dewy as the temperature drops.

The woods and the vanilla are most dominant and the notes are quite good and long lasting. A little citrus in the opening but not overwhelming. Reminds me of a toned down Samsara -- not spicy but the woods remind me of it. The vanilla is the same vanilla as the original.

It is more linear than the original -- the woods and vanilla dominate the whole way through rather than progressing through a complex series of notes.

It's very lovely but it is not the same strength and projection of the original. A very peaceful, quiet Night.

It's nothing like original Obsession which was one of the few CK's that i liked.
It's a floriental that feels very predictable..
A bit like Dream Angels Heavenly, only less powdery, a much 'damper' scent . Alcoholic citruses, damp watered woods and basic warm sweet vanilla - it does not smell bad but i couldn't stand it on my skin, so i gave it away after few tries. Very 'campus' smelling.

I definitely like this more than the original Obsession but I don't love it. The original smells like men's cologne (and not in a good way) on me and while I get a lot less of that masculine vibe from this one, it's still there. However, after a half hour or so, it really starts to balance out. I definitely get some citrus and tonka bean but I'm not sure what else. It lasted about 6 hours on me. I probably wouldn't buy it again but its definitely something I will keep wearing until the bottle is empty.
This perfume, girls, this perfume, oh my god, girls, oh my god, this perfume, just oh my god. It's heavenly. Enough said.

First time with this perfume. Wasn't expecting much as I'm not overly keen on CK, but this has done well! It's quite vanilla-heavy, but mixes well with white floral scents pushing through. I like it! It's not my favourite by far, but definitely wearable.

The perfume is beautifully composed im not much of a perfume expert bit i do lnow that it smells wonderful its something i have never experienced for me its unique and has an awesome staying power i can even smell it the next day! (: I dont know if im crazy but for me its better to get the perfumes or EDT in smaller bottles because the concentration is better and keeps fresh idk im just saying but definitely is a 10/10 for me <33333

This one i have had over and over again. I do love it but have to be in the righ sort of mood for it...

Actually, i have recently given a bottle of a tester away - in my opinion the testers are sometimes stronger than the EDTs - because when i sprayed it i usually forgot and sprayed too much, which was actually giving me headaches.. never happened with my normal EDTs before..

i have got a mini spray which does not do that, so i will get another one soon - maybe father christmas shall bring me some again :)

Anyway, this fragrance is warm and interesting, lasts a long time on me, and dries down lovely...

What is even better, my beloved loves the male version of this, which is GORGEOUS and clean, so we have matching fragrances... Sad but for that reason i do not think i could ever let this one go...
aaaaaah..

Glad I got the mini of this fragrance. I like it but unfortunately do not love it. If I would have to associate it with something related to Night it would be the white-blue moon since it is mysterious, light and somewhat luminous. The notes seem misleading since on me this frag smells a bit masculine and very fresh. I was expecting something smoldering and warm. It does have cozy notes but is too unisex to my liking. A great frag I would use for day though! I find it 'fallish' and like the fact it stays close to the skin. To me, it has a calming and balancing effect which I love. Shall not get a f.b. though...

24. september 2012

Let me start by saying that i LOVE the vintage "Obsession" original and the modern one is also very nice. So when i saw this in local store at a discount price recently i was eager to try it and had high hopes for this one. Honestly, i didn´t know what i expected it to be, since "night" part makes you think of something very "sexy and seductive" but the original one is already quite an evening fragrance.
Well, i am totally dissapointed, but mostly beacuse i had really high hopes and associations with original "Obsession". Like already mentioned many times before - this has NOTHING to do with original "Obsession", except the bottle design, label, and name (partly). I can´t see it as a "night" fragrance at all. If only this would be the quietest night on earth by the lake on an early spring day. Very watery and woodsy. Gardeina, wood, lilly of the valley and orange is mostly what i get from it. This could be easily the men´s fragrance, that much masculine drydown it has. The drydown is all about angelica and wood. I don´t smell anything powdery here at all!
To me this is a plain. Sadly. I really wanted to like it but it didn´t fulfill my expectations at all.
Though it has a decent sillage and quite ok lasting power but i will pass. Not my cup of tea at all.

Please do not remove this comment, since others might find it useful. Not every review should be positive, so people like me wanted to make a blind buy might find it very informative. Thanks.

This was a blind buy and I'm so happy with it! To me, this smells like 'Eau ressourcant'from Clarins. I really love Eau ressourcant, but there's no eau de parfum and the eau fraiche and eau de toilette have no staying power. Obession Night is an eau de parfum and stays with me during the day! The scent is sexy, a bit masculin, but in a really good way. It's nice and fresh and makes you feel clean and relaxed. The way Eau ressourcant was intended to be ;-) Makes a nice combo with de original Obsession. I use Obsession Night during the day and Obsession for nights out! So it's opposite to what the names suggest!
This is my favorite! So sad it discontinued. There are very few scents I love and this smell and sean john unforgivable for men is my favorite. I love to wear it in fall and winter!

Calvin Klein Obsession Night Woman is masterfully blended without any one particular note being overly discernable or overpowering on opening.

The resinous base of sensual tonka and earthy vanilla become a little more prominent as the fragrance dries down, all the while remaining lightly infused with citrus and a small handful of white petals. Amber also glows gently and radiates a comforting warmth. I dare say that I also detect a little creamy almond or marzipan-like accord.

Woody, clean, gently floral, very smooth and diaphanous. Obsession Night Woman is an enigmatic fragrance akin to waxy, sweet moonlight on a balmy summer's eve.

I just picked up my package with some perfumes I ordered online, of which one is Obsession Night. It's beautiful, both the bottle and the scent. I smelled the sprayer and I can tell it's related to Obsession, at least from what my nose can tell. There were someone else who didn't think so. It's not as strong as the original Obsession(which I think smells a bit masculine), but there are some notes in it that is also in Obsession, so I can smell they are related. Although Obsession Night is softer, more delicate, not as "in your face" as the original and defenitely more feminine. It's toned down a step or two. But I like it. I feel the original can be too strong sometimes, so this was a nice surprise(I blind bought it). I think the scent is sensual or maybe even romantic. It could be a bit stronger though. But it gives a feeling of sensuality, so I would defenitely wear it when going out in the evening. Sensual evening wear, for sure.

I just purchased this today because I was looking for a light oriental for the summer. I was in Brussels 2 weeks ago and very excited to smell, and hopefully purchase Opium Vapeurs de Parfum since it isn't available in the states yet. To my joy, I liked it and bought it. However, it and my jewelry bag were stolen out of my checked luggage! So if anyone is curious as to what OV smells like, it smells a lot like Obsession Night. The only difference I can detect is slightly more woods and a little less citrus with ON.
Hope that helps, and be cautious packing your bags!

Малко е необичаен за дамски-в началото помислих това.Но после се затопли от ванилията,после пак като че ли отлетя-отнесен от вятъра...Но той ме върна-нежен,топъл,шепнещ ми...Той е дъждът,който ме напоява...Пълноводната река,която ме носи...Пръски от водопад в лагуна...

This has nothing in common with the original Obsession. This smells very woody to me throughout wear, but there is a soft, warm, powdery aspect to it that prevents it from being too masculine. I can smell the amber, sandalwood and fresh woodsy aromas, with a hint of citrus. This is complex in that it smells both masculine and feminine, soft and fresh, yet deep and mysterious. A delicate balance of interesting notes nicely done.

This fragrance has a certain sexiness to it that is somewhat masculine yet tenderly alluring.
On me it's very woody during the initial spray, I do not get any citrus at all. Then it transformed to a sweet and powdery scent evocative of vanilla and sandalwood. Give it a few more minutes and it's just pure sensuality on the skin that is highly addictive. It is a unique and beautiful fragrance sure to excite particularly when worn at night ... very aptly named Obsession Night.
very good frag sweet and woody and creamy perfect for spring!!!like a lot

When I wear this perfume, I get so many compliments at work that I'm really beginning to get tired of it. ;-) I bought this one by chance, a good deal on eBay, and, wow, it's adorable! Very bold, very refreshing, very distinctive. My fav. bergamot's there, too. I find it too strong to wear in winter, but in summer it smells divine! *thumbs up*

Zesty orange start, a little itchy to my nose, goes softer quite early. Creamier, softer with the smooth white flowers , can´t detect lily of the valley at all but dont mind... Then it´s the sandalwood, vanilla and wood that takes over, fine with me cause it´s... subtle, soft, gorgeoues !
For your knowledge..
it does not resemble Obsession at all..../
even though I love that one too !) I think they ought to trade names because this is a day scent to me and vice versa.
The start resembles both Mediterainien and Toujours glamour in some ways. Drydown resembles
Style By Jil Sander. very close to skin -
Worth trying !
I love this smell of this! Its so sexy! So sad it is hard to find

This is surprisingly unique and refreshing! It doesn't smell anything like the original Obsession. Even knowing that I was caught off guard by how much I liked this. I bought it blind on ebay, because it was super cheap and I wanted to try it.

It is bright with juicy orange citrus over light woods and sandalwood. To my nose the white flowers are more of a backdrop, but they are present. I normally do not like citrus, but this is a nice take of citrus mixed with a great wood. The cashmere is there too. That just might be the note that brings this to the top. This is not a dark scent, but it still has complexity. I don't know what it is exactly, but this is divine. I can totally picture myself wearing this on summer nights.

Somebody know whether that's been reformulated?
I remember that was more stronger and intense.

I was quite obsessed with buying this perfume when the ad's showed up in magazines. It smells so good, not at all like the original Obsession. I now have both in small .5 oz bottles just to add to my collection. I recently pulled out Obsession Night for the winter and decided it was delicious and I need to wear it. So warm, inviting, sexy, and casual enough for daytime. The more that I smell it, the more it smells like Juicy Couture copied it with Viva La Juicy. Only slightly...
i feel the creamy balmi cashmir vanillia sandelwood later rosa lilly angelica.its very plesant smell elegant ocasional!5/5

mmm I love this one. It was on sale so I got the biggest bottle. Love the design, the egg shape. Love the name, love everything about it. First spray is really heavy. Very sensual and chypre, lots of bergamot and manadarin orange. The middle notes are soft but the drydown is gorgeous. It's very creamy and yummie. Subtle but noticable. Close to my skin. I really like this obsession, next to the secret obsession.

First time I smelled this perfume on my partner's relative and I loved it straight away - in fact I have ordered the bottle the very next day. Then it was my every day/night (almost signature) fragrance (perfect for me as I work nights ;)).. until I went home for holidays and I left my mum the bottle - as she also loved the fragrance :) Now last week I realised I am missing it - and ordered it again ;) This story would be my review ;) Obsessed ;)

I just can't find enough words to describe this perfume. It was my first expensive perfume and it still is my favourite. It's sexy yet mysterious, masculine yet at the same time perfect for a woman. It's pure sex and sensuality and I've never met a guy who wouldn't be enchanted by it's scent. Just perfect!

It is actually a pity CK named this fragrance Obsession Night - I guess that under another name it would be perceived as a separate entity, without the disappointment caused by high expectations referred to the original Obsession. And no, this is not really a night fragrance as the name suggests - the original could easily be considered a night one by today's standards.

Obsession Night works fine in autumn/winter daytime as an inoffensive, fresh, clean, a bit sourish and rather invigorating EDP.

The scent is incredibly herbal thanks to the prominent angelica - once it appears at the beginning, it stays strong till the end and completely dominates other notes. There is some wood and citrus mixture that supports the effect and only in the drydown a slight vanillic accord appears. The white flowers here are so much different than in other floral/oriental floral perfumes that I am a bit confused whether they exist in N.O. at all - well, the exception is the lily of the valley which is easily detectable.

Sillage is limited, longevity up to 3-4 hrs on my skin, but much better on clothes. It is not UBER-feminine, but it is not masculine.

I like it, it is wearable especially if you are tired of heavier perfumes and need a short break once in a while, but I won't buy it again.

When I spray this on I get a blast of wood from it (which I don't mind at all because I like wood) When that tames down a bit I can smell the rose and lily of the valley, then a little vanilla. It kind of reminds me of Caberet by Gres but I need to wear them one ater the other before I say for sure. It only lasts about 3 hours. Best for Fall/Winter

I don't really consider the social implications of "women's" fragrances since I hardly ever wear them in public (usually it's by accident, such as when I don't think I'll be going out but then something comes up and I don't have much choice). There's something about this fragrance that intrigues me, but I have to be in the mood for the accord that opens it up, and I'm guessing there is strong angelica that is most responsible. If I'm not in the mood, it comes across as "hair spray."

If I am in the mood, it comes across as floral/fresh, but with a really interesting and enjoyable edge to it. Over time, the vanillic/tonka gets stronger and stronger, but never becomes obnoxious. Basically, if you're lucky, you will perceive a nice dynamism between these two dominant elements that lasts quite a long time and with good projection ("sillage"). Considering what is marketed to men these days, I don't see why this couldn't be marketed as "unisex." I do get the idea that this has a somewhat "synthetic" quality, so be sure you are in the mood for it and don't smell it up close on the skin.

UPDATE: California by Holliser (a "men's" scent) has a very similar drydown. I wouldn't be surprised if the same perfumer created both of these.

This smells so awful on me I wondered if I'd got an 'off' bottle.
Everything about it reads like my kind of scent which works on my skin but having tried it 3 times I had the same results.
Starts sharp and nasty like nail varnish remover. Acidic and no redeeming features. Eventually something faintly woody but mainly pepper came through. Finally I'm left with sweetish but sickly cheap smelling vanilla. I've got washing powder which smells better.

Can't understand why this is such a disaster on me but yuck. No thanks.
lasts longer with the cream....very sweet...reminds me of a friend who used to sneak out on a date and wear this:-)....nice

The name is definitely misleading, because I always thought this was even stronger than the original Obsession, so I didn't even bother to check it out until today. Actually, I was very surprised to get a really nice soft musky scent. I would wear it during the day even in the summertime. Well, and since I love white flowers and roses it's another one on my perfume-to-buy list.
**

So different to the original. I love the original and this one, obviously, for very different reasons. It has a woody, citrus-like smell initially, then I couldn't smell anything - until I'd leave the room (when I was the only person in it) and walk back in and go "what an awesome scent! (Which was a gorgeous subtle, fruity, musky odour.) Who's wearing that?!" - the answer was ME! Some many people have commented on how lovely this one is when I'm wearing it!

from start to finish musk, musk and more musk. but sharp...how is musk sharp? it was so overwhelming. and then pencil shavings, but not in a 'happy memories of school' way. more a 'i've had a pencil sharpener rammed up my nose' way. had the same kind of experience with secret obsession....although i did at least like the first few minutes of that. it seems CK and i are destined not to be friends. there's no softness there, no powdery gorgeousness. they both seem so astringent it almost makes me catch my breath.
I've heard somewhere that it smells similar to dior addict eau fraiche, is it true?

I have owned all 4 versions of Obsession and have enjoyed them all but I must say that Obsession Night bears no relation to the original.
Its a very nice fragrance, but sadly not in the same class as its older sister. It doesn't have that power or the instant recognition but its a pleasant enough floral which starts off with rather bitter citruses. The fruits don't stay for long, giving way to a powdery floral pretty quickly. I'm left with a delightful cashmere vanilla that stays with me several hours.

The angelica note stays with me throughout the entire dry-down, and it feels out of place in the composition. It's probably just my chemistry, but I think the rest of the fragrance is so lovely that it doesn't need it.

Obsession Night feels aquatic in an earthy, midnight sort of way. But with the angelica ever present, I feel I am smelling not only cool clean air and wafts rising from a babbling brook somewhere in a damp forest at midnight, but also the algae growing on the rocks and in the crevices along the banks of that brook. And then that note begins to remind me of the bitter, green smell of flower water...

My favorite part of this fragrance is the dry-down, where the gentle note of cashmere wood surfaces, and the sweetness of tonka and vanilla emerge.

While it's not a fragrance I would recommend for evening wear, it does evoke images of the night.

Obsessive enough for me... I feel as if I know this perfume, still I cannot remember with what perfume I'm sure I know very good this one is like (not any perfume anyone mentioned here, because I don't know them). It obsesses me.
First time I smelled it I really did not like it. But now - it is winter - I keep smelling it, again and again. I find it floral-woody-oriental, feminine and sexy.
I'm in a period in my life during which my self-esteem as a woman dropped down, but this perfume, somehow, made me feel feminine and attractive again, it made me dress beautifully and sexy, use make-up, accesories and... perfume :)
I use it on my wrists and in my hair...
Yes, obsessive and sexy enough for me :)

Absolutely gorgeous!
The smell of summer rain in whispering lagoon.

Obsession Night is a day time scent easily wearable. Quite the opposite of what I have been expecting, because of the name, and knowing the darkness of original Obsession. As sherapop said totally misnamed perfume. This doesn't seem like Obsession, nor it evokes night. In fact, doesn't even seem as CK.

Night is a light floral (doesn't seem oriental to me) with pronounced woody notes. Possesses tender sweetness and imprint of tiniest spice. Find it gentle and joyful, quite unique and lovable. Has long lasting time and average power, appropriate for wearing during entire year. Recommend it highly!
PS. missk said everything I meant but miss the words;)

Calvin Klein OBSESSION NIGHT WOMAN is a great flanker, but it is completely misnamed. It should really be called: CERRUTI 1881 SANS SAVON. I jest not, the similarities between ONW and CERRUTI 1881 are patent, despite the apparent dissimilarities of their floral notes. The bases are nearly identical, and the proportions of flowers must be about the same, although OBSESSION NIGHT WOMAN boasts neither iris nor violet.

It's rather remarkable, in fact, how wrong OBSESSION NIGHT WOMAN is as a name for this very likeable, totally unobsessional, daytime, unisex fragrance. This is a light woody-floral, slightly sweet and barely spicy perfume, which I like a lot. I prefer CERRUTI 1881, because it has a bit more depth and I do like its soupcon of soapiness, but if I run into a bottle of ONW, I might well add it to my collection. Very nice and subtle. Essentially the antithesis of OBSESSION.

It's my mistake, ive put very high expectation to Obsession Night. I have the original Obsession (O) and Secret Obsession (SO) with me tho. I never want Night Obsession to be as loud as the original Obsession or SO, but at least the keyword such as mysterious, dark or anything like that (perhaps like Midnight Poison?)

But what I get is something which is almost similar to Lancome Miracle Forever. The Vick's Vapor Rub smell it's the one definitely u'll get when u spray this. And oh yes, it will introduce itself with a burst if fresh and citrusy smell. On my skin, the dry down was nice. No more the citrusy-fresh into like before, but more to soft sweet smell with a hint of jasmine. And after long time, you can really smell the sandalwood, amber and vanilla playing together. Im not sure how's cashmere wood smell, but overall ON will give a slight masculine character especially on its base part (not too much, but it's good for me when my mood strikes for a non-girly scent on certain day).

Yes, you can wear this not only at night but also daytime. Since it's completely different than SO (too flowery for u?) and original O, you don't have to worry if people will give you one kind of look when you wear this (like how my colleague reacted when she smelled me in Obsession at the workplace). To me NO it's ok. Nothing really special or unique about it though. Coz ive already smelled it on Miracle Forever. What a bad coincidence... But hey, the blue liquid in a cute blue egg-alike bottle is really cool in a blue metallic box.

(Thank you Tane4ka for this tester)

Obsession Night in my opinion is a modern and more wearable version of Obsession. I can pull this day and night, summer and winter. Really clean and fresh, the citrus notes are really well balanced with the flowers.
Its sharp in the beginning but after a couple of minutes it becomes softer, a little bit soapy and lovely.
I like it a lot and I think its a perfect scent that can be used at work, as a casual scent or a flirty night fragrance.

Sillage: Average
Lasting Power: Last 12 hours

7/10

I bought a mini without smelling.
Not bad, but Obsession Night will be a fragrance I buy once, not twice.
Why? Because has nothing really special.
Haha looks like katarina and me have exactly the same experience!

Calvin Klein and me never have been best buddies, and I suppose never will. In so many of CK fragrances there is this kind of unsubtleness. Like here a verey unsubtle citrus which gives me the creeps. I had bought a mini unsmelled and I when I walked out the shop I sprayed it on my scarf. A few minutes later I kept thinking: 'who is wearing that cheap smelling perfume?' first I thought it would be one of the ladies standing next to me in a shop, but later I found out it was me!
My skin tells a little bit of a different story: there Obsession Night has the time to settle down in a more modest way but still being very 'womanly'. For me it is between a like and a dislike, but if I'd wear it, it would be definitely ONLY on the skin! (i gave the mini away to my mom by the way, she is a chanel chance-lover, it reminds me a teeny bit of that)

This fragrance struck me as being very unique, also being very different to what I expected it to smell like. Obsession Night in my mind, was a darker and sexier version of the original Obsession, perhaps a little smokier and sweet. In reality, Obsession Night is mostly a gentle floral with some masculine qualities, a tad too musky and in some ways synthetic, but not in an unpleasant way.

Everytime I smell this fragrance, I'm stuck for words to describe it. It's non-descript yet rather appealing. The scent itself is quite subdued, mostly a nice blend of clean white florals, a hint of sweet citrus and dusty vanilla.

Towards the drydown is where Obession Night begins to smell slightly masculine. It has a somewhat woodsy, pencil-shavings kind of smell to it. After awhile the scent does bore me, however if I bring my wrist to my nose and inhale deeply, I am once again intrigued and fascinated.

Obsession Night may be one of those fragrances that grow on you. As I'm reviewing this fragrance now, I almost feel bad for saying what I've said in the previous paragraphs, because the more I smell it, the more I begin to like it.

Smelling it again, it almost smells like baby wipes. I must add that I like the scent of baby wipes. My opinions on this fragrance are continually changing. I don't believe that it's possible for me to come to any kind of conclusion.

In terms of sillage and lasting strength, I'll give this fragrance the thumbs up. All I have left to say is that this is an interesting scent, rather smooth, sometimes creamy, and generally likable.

It's been a while since I tried on a perfume that quickly made me want to find a restroom to wash it off. It was that overpowering on me. I can't wear this. There was a thick and heavy sweetness that some may enjoy, but I do not. Hot weather may intensify it even more. I have other things with most of these fragrance notes in them, but I am not a fan of gardenia which may be the deciding factor here...That mixed with strong amber.

im so in love with this fragrance!!
i got a mini of this and im planning on buying a bottle of it!
i love it very much that i only use it on special occasion (i afraid it might run out). even if the bottle has the 'night' name on it, it is not that 'night' trust me. nothing similar to any other night fragrance.
i cant believe myself i dint get this any earlier.

Finally, I own this! :) My friend gave it to me, because she no longer wore hers. Starts off with a bright kick of pepper, and it actually reminds me of Paris Hilton's Just Me. After a good 20 minutes though, it settles down into a mellow, vanilla-cashmere scent that is irrisistable! It's not cloying or rich somehow, and I can't stop sniffing my wrists! Very long lasting as well. I put on one small spray, and I could smell it for a good 4-6 hours!

This starts on me with a burst of orange that intoxicates me very strong I don't like much the first 15 minutes but after ward it pure heaven. its long lasting and I don't know way I get a scent of coconut and its mote included in the notes . But the combination of this coconut with the base notes is to die for!!!! I feel sexy and alive when i wear it!1

I absolutely love this one!!! I just cant get enough of this vanilla/amber spiked floral concoction... Perfect for a date or a night on the town. Its soft and sensual right from the start and very long-lasting. The compliments and inquiries dont stop when I wear this one out...

This was a really nice surprise! Somehow it is cool and warm at the same time. Soft, sweet, creamy flowers (not too flowery) mixed with the warm base. Can be used day and night. Just beautiful, sexy, simple and elegant.

My friend in class wears it from time to time, it's her mother's perfume. I can't stop leaning in to smell it on her! Fresh, clean and subtly sexy. It's too bad I can't find it in department stores, maybe it's being discontinued? I'd love to try it on my skin!

Difficult review. This perfume is special. Why?
Because it pretends to be an uncomplicated scent, but it isn't.
Outside, she looks young, fresh and a bit shy. Nothing too unusual. Little make up, summer dress, the lights of Times Square in a midsummer's night dream.
But deep inside, she hides sweetness and passion. Usually, 'night' oriental perfumes have a troubled soul. They are sensual, charming and desperate.
This fragrance isn't. Behind its innocence lies a tender happiness, a sweet melancholy. It's like a Tchaikovsky's violin concert. It's a confession, a strive for harmony, in every single note. A poem read in a sunset, a whisper in the moonlight.
He will come, with his dark eyes. He'll put his hands around her waist. The Vanilla will embrace him like Cashmere, the Sandalwood will hold him tight, struggling between the innocence of the Mandarin and the maturity of the Amber. A bittersweet kiss, full of fear, full of love. So longed for.
While the blue of the sky shines and the first stars come out.
Will it last?
Each skin will tell.

I got a bunch of minis a long time ago. While cleaning out my stash, I came across this one. I tried it and found it a totally wearable fragrance and with the drydown reading a bit more masculine, I thought it was a guys fragrance and gave it to my husband. Oops! He wears on those days he needs a mental pick me up. And since it's flowers at first application, I can see how it perks up his mood. The sillage floats more feminine from the floral notes but combined with his specific body chemistry, after about a 10 minute drydown it trends more masculine. Because of that, I haven't felt the need to reveal it's really a ladies fragrance since on him, it really reads more unisex.

the first perfume
i have bought myself
a second bottle of
before i finished the
first

this
out of fear
it might be
discontinued

I wore this when it first came out, back in high school. I really liked it back then because at the time I was looking for a "defining" scent that embodied my personality and that I would wear on a regular basis. However, I soon became overwhelmed by the constanct scent and gave it up. I did like it because it was something you could wear any season, day or night. I may have to reintroduce myself to this fragrance!

This fragrance is wonderfully blended. It does not have any alcohol scent. I am not good at describing the notes. I think with something this well blended it would be hard to separate the notes.

It smells wonderful on me. It is not a simple floral on me and smells very enticing. The longevity and sillage are both above average.

It does not resemble its namesake Obsession at all. I wonder why they did not give this a different name. This makes a wonderful "go to" fragrance that will not offend or shock anyone. It is much more pleasant and less erotic than Obsession. However, Obsession and Obsession night both are wonderful fragrances...just not alike.
I just had to add to my review.This is the sexiest fume ever.When i put IT on today,I almost melted.I love every single note in it.The perfect fume.

a good all round fume.no age limit,no season ,no time of day,just a huge boquet of fragrant real flowers surrounding uthe beautiful powerdy drydown is like another fume on its own.its a simple fume.sometimes simple is better.there r less things to find wrong with it.

Firstly - this fragrance has nothing in common with the original Obssession. It is a different era, different feelings, different world.
It is likeable and somehow slightly sharply flowery and woody (I am not getting any citruses) and crisp and quite strong, but surprisingly it is not as lasting as I would expect.
The opening shockingly reminds me of YSL Elle, but luckily only in a gentle way and shortly. Almost as if Elle (which I really detest for it's provocative agressivenss) was calmed and tamed and sedated and pretyfied somehow. :-) Soon it becomes warmer, softer and inviting, however, to me it still has a rough edge. Although not superbly outstanding, it's quite unusual really and almost contradictory: little dark, little frivolous, little modern, little spicy, very feminine, but with a hint of masculinity.
Sprayed on clothes it last much longer and also seems to develop much more pleasantly than on my skin. Still - as it evolves, I do like to sniff my wrist as it's becoming more sweet and soft and powdery/warm indeed. I will be wearing it from time to time.
And this is really nitpicking - but I am disapointed that the bottle actually doesn't look as blue. Since the frag itself is some kind of yelow/brown shade, the bottle is actually tainded by the darker liquid and appears more green/yellow/brown. To me personally it's a shame as I adore the blueness in those images! :-)

Update: I have said that this fragrance is likeable. Wearing it again today, I am actually starting to think that it's much more than that! I seem to be growing very fond of it. :-)

I got this one from my hubby 5 or 6 years ago. I hardly wear it, I'm just giving it another chance. Perfumes don't last long on my skin. My new strategy is just to do 2 sprays on each side of the neck around the hair and in my arms. Lets see if this work!

Update: I like this better on clothes than on the skin! It lasts more that way!

This is just beautiful; I love how it's composed..the sweetness, fruits and florals are all balanced out really well which makes it smell quite refreshing but sensual -if that makes sense! Call me crazy, but everytime my classmate walks past, I'm literally inhaling the trail...ugh, I love it.
*If you like scents that follow along the lines of 'Armani Code by Giorgio Armani', 'Allure Eau De Toillete for Women by Chanel', 'Lanvin Eclat Darpege by Lanvin', 'Gucci Rush 2' and 'Chanel Chance', u should defo give this one a try!

I bought this because it was very cheap on sale and I liked the blue bottle. With Obsession being such a strong, spicy scent I expected the night version to be stronger still but this is a light reflection. It's almost as if Obsession is being out in the heat of the day, then the temperature drops in the evening and a cool breeze blows through that is obsession Night. It's a very restrained fragrance for someone who is the subtle type of sexy. I don't pick up too much in the way of fruits but it has a deep but light floral, like you'd expect night blooms to smell like in a cool climate.

I don't get the other views on this one.
This perfume is so me. It's clean and erotic. It's dark and understated. I think it's so spicy, sexual and unique.

Its a nice scent but I didn't fine "Che" with it on my skin. It is different from the gold Obsession that if for sure. A more crisp scent. I have a bottle without a box if anyone wants to trade with it just message me.

All I can seem to get off this is a lean scent of pencil shavings-I live in a dry climate, so maybe that is contributing to the scarity of substantial notes I am sensing. Have to say, it strikes me as totally synthetic and steely, in a bad way. This fragrance has the anonimity of living in a big city-no one will notice you for it, and if they did, they wouldn't like you very much.

Nice, really.
It's not "obsessive", but very pleasant and a little bit sweet, in good and unobtrusive way. Powdery and soft, elegant.

Maybe it's not a very outstanding fragrance, but it definitely smells good. Sweet, warm, woody and a bit masculine. Light enough for summer nights. So if you're into white florals and like citrus and searching for a warm scent for colder days, try this out.

I too thought this smelled like a cross between Dream Angels Heavenly and CKOne. It also has a little bit of a wood shavings smell to it. It's nice and the vanilla is slightly noticeable, but the scent itself is very hard to detect. It's pretty and all, but it just doesn't last.

I am in love it this one.When i was looking at the bottle i thought that it is another aquatic and sporty Ck frag,but it is so creamy and sensual instead that i cant stop smell my wrist.Probably it is very suitable for night ,but for me it is also perfect for the day .It makes me very confident .My new favourite
I just received it and I like a lot its powdery notes, sexy and bold.

product_name: CK IN2U Her Collectables Calvin Klein
review_content: very citrusy, so if you’re into that this is the perfume for you 🙂↕️ not too long lasting for me

product_name: CK IN2U Her Collectables Calvin Klein
review_content: I purchased this from SDM in Canada for $22. Weirdly although a brand new unopened box, it came without a cap! I sprayed this on my pits and the scent lasted for hours. I prefer to wear this than deodorant. The citrus really projects, but more like a tangerine than lemon. I’m considering getting a few more bottles because I like it so much. A perfect scent to wear at the gym. I consider it a unisex frag. ;-)

product_name: CK IN2U Her Collectables Calvin Klein
review_content: Surprisingly lovely, warmer than I expected. Really nice, fresh blast of citrus in the opening, then quickly moves to a warm and slightly powdery floral paired with a very likeable cedar. Decent performance for the price (I paid $20 at Ross) and very inoffensive, perfect for the office or smaller spaces.

product_name: CK IN2U Her Collectables Calvin Klein
review_content:
I liked this very much when I was younger and got a ton of compliments. It is border line unisex. I do think I've graduated from it but still a nice scent.
strong but not over powering

product_name: CK IN2U Her Collectables Calvin Klein
review_content: Beautiful bottle, I need to try it:)

product_name: CK IN2U Her Collectables Calvin Klein
review_content: smell like a man scent, so disappointed!!!!!!!

My favorite from the eternity line. This one performs in hot humid weather and what i find special about this one is that its not like the typical tropical perfumes whuch smell like sea sand and sky aka a place like a beach. No this is definitely perfumey and excuse me but i want to smell of perfume when im wearing perfume. Too many of those gourmands that smell like food or location smells that smell like a location. My brain dosent really know what to do with that. This one smells like sweet coconut and aquatic body wazh refreshing cool with some florals and sandalwood creaminess. A refreshing yet soothing and absolutely balanced performer. Really love this one. I like the og eternity but i do not like pachouli so cant wear it but this one is a WIN! 👍👍👌
Definitely not a spring/summer one. Very sweet and cloying in warm weather, inappropriate. When it’s cold though, it becomes a delicious sweet-salty coconut. Perfect gourmand for my fall in Moscow🍁
This is faint and unremarkable but clean and pleasant. It reminds me of Maison Margiela’s Bubble Bath with that whisper of a coconut note, but I prefer Bubble Bath.
A subtly coconut, gentle composition with a holiday vibe. Very pleasant and easy to wear. It's a different type o scent compared to the original Eternity.

This is shockingly good. I dislike most of the notes listed so I thought I’d hate this. I ended up with a sample so I tried it on a whim, and wow! I’m not picking up any of the notes listed here that I would normally avoid. Instead, I’m getting a rather spicy aquatic floral, if such a thing exists, complex and wearable in any season. I only was able to wear this till I used up my sample but I thoroughly enjoyed it. I will never again judge a perfume by its notes.

Wow! Someone copied La belle Paradise Garden EDP...but forgot to lower the price. Smelled it yesterday and I was a bit impressed. I couldn't find what it reminds me of. Then yes, got it. Honestly, it's slightly better than La belle's Paradise Garden edition but only in the opening. Later on it becomes a bit flatter and I guess lasting power won't be the best. It worth a try, but I am tired of clones.
im sorry but this smells like sweet dill to me, this is so nauseating i hate this....

Nice at first: sweet (but still fresh) aquatic coconut. Very summery, which is nice in summer, but and I feel like I wouldn’t want to wear it during autumn or wintertime. Wore it for one day and it got a bit annoying - too summery for me i guess. Won’t buy it for myself.
I would also like to know who is the perfumer

Coconutty syrupy cocktail next to the beach. This one is rather strong! Sadly it has the aroma chemical that smells like tar in it so the dry down isn’t good. I feel like this would be a great a perfume for those who enjoy Olympia and other sweet and slightly salty beachy scents.
Can we know the perfumer?
Generic sweet aquatic coconut Shampoo smell. It's barely aromatic, but if you squint and find it, you'll discover it adds a Body Wash accord to the mix too

Waiting for the price to go down and finally got a full bottle! The name is misleading, not very aromatic. Mostly a soft coconut and gentle sandalwood scent with a very light sweet lavender in the background. I think it's lovely and I've gotten a lot of compliments, especially for men. It becomes a skin scent after about 2 hours but I can smell it on my clothes and hair the next day.

This was the perfect blind buy for me. It’s the perfect combination of sweet and aquatic notes. Perfect for the heat and not overly reminiscent of sunscreen. I paired this with Quai St. Barts and it was perfect.

Oh wow, I would never think I would like something from the Eternity line so much.
This is amazing, sweetish, bubbly coconut fragrance with slightly salty notes. The scent evokes to my nose feeling nice and comfy after bubble bath or something like wellness. Excellent bubblebath, after shower time scent. 🧖
I wanted to buy the Bubblebath one by Replica but I feel like I don't need that one anymore.
Great for daytime, spring&summer, hot weather especially.
However...prepare yourself, this doesn't really last. The longevity and sillage is something inbetween...stronger than weak (not a body mist type of scent) but moderate at maximum, after respraying couple of times. Light fragrance, suitable for summer, though. I got the biggest bottle for great price, thankfully. The bottle is so nice. I love the teal color. Little storytime - when I was a child, I collected all kinds of empty bottles. Perfume bottles, shampoo bottles, washing liquid bottles, etc. I had one of a beautiful teal color and Eternity Aromatic Essence reminds me of that. :)

I like this one. It's different to the original eternity but it does share some of its sweetness. I can see how this would be a dumb reach for a lady during spring/summer.
I get the aquatic and citrus notes on top, the berries and coconut in the mid, and for the dry down a slight sandalwood smell. Is it anything revolutionary? no, but I don't think most people are expecting that (and there's no problem with it not shaking the fragrance world, it smells nice and seems like something people would want to wear)
In terms of price, at the moment it is on the pricey side everywhere (makes sense as it just came out) but 100ml is slightly cheaper at Allbeauty in the UK in comparison to Boots & Superdrug. I suspect that with time the price of this perfume may drop to become cheaper.

Given that coconut and salty marine notes are having a moment in fragrances right now, I'm really disappointed with this one. It's a low-resolution version of these notes that is completely forgettable. Projection is poor, and the longevity is worse.
That said, I do know some women who don't enjoy strong perfumes, and would potentially like wearing this one, so I wouldn't completely rule it out. However, there are so many others of the same ilk (think Ralph Lauren, Davidoff etc) that are much better that I personally won't break my back to use it.

I sadly have to agree with what other reviewers have already written… I actually really liked this immediately upon the first spray but as it dries down it gets more and more synthetic and fully dried down I was left with the strong scent of an only medium pleasant shower gel. I feel like they‘re playing it too safe with these Eternity flankers and thus end up right in the middle of things, which I don‘t think anyone is really all that into. Commit to the bit, CK!

11 March 2024

This is my review for giving it a full day wear test on my skin and also from the paper strip.

I honestly do not like it. It has indeed nothing in common with the original classic, which i rediscovered only couple of years ago and fell in love with, but based on the notes one can clearly see that already. I was really hoping for a true aromatic essence, full of wonderful aromas of lavender and sandalwood, it could have been so wonderful, if done the right way, but the truth is that it smells very chaepish-synthetic. I do not know why, but to me it dmells more fruty-sweet, than anything else. No pronounced lavender at all, indeed to me it smelled more like an older Escada summer flanker "Born in paradise". I do not understand where all of those "reminds me of" come from? There is in fact not much to talk about for this scent, that simple and uninspiring it id. I also cannot compliment staying power, neither development of the scent.
Not a safe blind buy, but the colour of the bottle is very pretty. I will stick to original.
It appears to be ridiculously expensive..

First I get nice fresh light coconut....but the dry down is just spoiled dead fisch and chemicals 🎏.
DISGUSTING 😳

At first upon smelling this I was really surprised how different it was from previous summer releases, but after having it on pure magic happens. At first you get very strong hints of a clean boozy lavender musk which later wraps itself in a sexy coconut, beachy tone with hints of the original Eternity. The name aromatic essence is perfect being it really is a unique aroma that tingles your senses. This scent goes through many phases with the first phase drawing me away a bit but warms to such a sexy intriguing summer scent. Out of all of the summer releases I find this one to be the most unique and different, but not in a bad way. Lasts 4-6 hours on clothes, 9+ hours in skin.
pina colada
Isn't released until March 1 2024 and already has downvotes here in January...smh.

product_name: Eternity for Women Reflections Calvin Klein
review_content: There’s something unmistakable about CK fragrances, not a specific note, but a kind of signature chemical base that gives them all the same “CK DNA.” The moment I sprayed Eternity Reflections, I knew exactly what family it belonged to. It’s a simple, fresh summer scent, pleasant enough, but closer to a body spray than a proper perfume (think Elizabeth Arden - Green Tea). It opens overly sweet and loud, then fades fast into nothing. The dry down barely lingers, like it evaporates mid-sentence. Not terrible, this is something you’d spritz on after a shower than a scent meant to define you. Definitely body spray territory.

product_name: Eternity for Women Reflections Calvin Klein
review_content: Eternity Reflections reminds me of the Eternity Summer editions Calvin Klein used to release up until 2020. It’s a simple fragrance, perfect for spring and summer. The opening feels fresh and uplifting, and later it settles into a softer, sweet vibe. It’s not a beast mode scent, but it certainly doesn’t deserve such low ratings. The launch price was over the top, but now it has reached a much more reasonable range. I’m even planning to get it for my teenager, as it feels like a light, versatile everyday fragrance.

product_name: Eternity for Women Reflections Calvin Klein
review_content: I smelled this perfume last year, the price like 119€, I liked it but it was definitely not worth the ir. One year after release I hapilly bought it for 29€. 😂 It's a simple but pleasent scent for spring and summer, I'm sure I'll be wearing it a lot.

product_name: Eternity for Women Reflections Calvin Klein
review_content:
I love a lot of the Eternity flankers especially Eternity Moments so when I saw this going on a clearance sale online due to the box being damaged, I bought it without even knowing what it will smell like.

The sweet opening shocked me because I was not expecting that at all. I was expecting something light, watery and airy. It is strong in the opening then mellows after 10 minutes but you can smell it every time you move or the breeze catches it.

I can imagine how this will be by the beach or waterfront. You must never do more than 4 sprays if you don’t want to give yourself and others around you a headache.

Sillage is moderate and longevity is about 6 hours on skin. It lasts longer on clothes but don’t overspray because it is very sweet and cloying. I do get some powdery feel after like 3 hours.

When I layered 2 sprays of this with Lancôme Idole, it was an overload of pear and it was crazy sweet.

Would I repurchase? Nope. It’s nice to have but it’s not a love for me.

product_name: Eternity for Women Reflections Calvin Klein
review_content: Beautiful from the Candy opening until the fade down but unfortunately it doesn’t last too long or project too well. Lovely summer skin scent though and great addition to the collection.

product_name: Eternity for Women Reflections Calvin Klein
review_content:
I'm looking for a very fruity (more pear/grape/black currant fruity than strawberry fruity) but deep scent which I can also wear at night. This comes closest to what I'm looking for. It's fruity from the beginning right to the end. At first spray it's very fruity (pear and blood orange being almost the same strength but pear in my case a bit more). After about 15 minutes or so it gets a bit "more complex" (I'm guessing it's the jasmine). After an hour or so it gets a little bit "deeper" (guessing it's the sandalwood). I normally reapply after the first 2-4 hours and two to three times a day - each time the scent gets a bit stronger as the longevity and sillage aren't that great but in doing so at least the longevity gets a bit longer after each application. And maybe it gets better the longer I have it.
I'm not too sure about which season this perfume is best to be worn but right now (it's autumn where I am) I'm loving it - and I can imagine it being an all year scent for me but maybe a bit more for warmer temperatures.

product_name: Eternity for Women Reflections Calvin Klein
review_content:
Calvin Klein is one of my favourite of all time
Brands, and this being a fresh citrusy floral is right up my alley so I blind bought this and it came today! It’s very citrusy, aquatic and fresh. It reminds me of my current favourite Capri Summer by Skylar I assume from the blood orange notes, I hope
It projects a bit better than I feel like it will, fingers crossed! Either way though, if you get it for a good price than who cares how often you have to reapply, that’s my take on it anyways :)

product_name: Eternity for Women Reflections Calvin Klein
review_content: Very nice...for the five minutes you can smell it.

product_name: Eternity for Women Reflections Calvin Klein
review_content:
Skin test, cold autumn day.

Fresh, green, airy, fruity, clean, rounded..

Lasted a couple hours... I’d try it again on a pulse point.

product_name: Eternity for Women Reflections Calvin Klein
review_content: I bought the one for women and love it for everyday use. It's giving me Juliette Has A Gun, Pear Inc vibes, but fresher and not as sweet. I've layered them together and wish I'd bought a backup bottle of the Eternity. It also pairs well with Elizabeth Arden's Green Tea. I'm really loving the fresh, green perfs atm.

product_name: Eternity for Women Reflections Calvin Klein
review_content:
I find this really appealing and familiar. I have purchased the entire Reflections release. The fragrance simplicity is not a negative, in fact maximalist or needlessly complex perfumes are increasingly off-putting and I find refuge in Calvin Klein fragrances. You could say marketing knows this and targeted me accordingly, but why should I mind? My interest in the brand rekindles and if they continue their minimalist aesthetic then I am happy to continue trying the new scents. I was born in 1990 for reference. Eternity original and CK One original have nostalgic impressions for me, so these new releases allow me to carry that along. I feel sorry for people who do not have the positive associations that I have and are extremely negative about Calvin Klein for whatever reason, no matter what they create.

Additional Notes: I am wearing this fragrance in Autumn, I think that it would become too cloying if worn in warmer weather, but time will tell. I tend to prefer its sweetness now as it comes across slightly sedate. It still has a heady kind of effect, but it isn't fusty. I may just like it because it gives the aura of post sex with a fantasy woman.

product_name: Obsession for Men Summer Calvin Klein
review_content: Personally my favorite cologne, because of the color but the juice inside is even better. Fishing on a boat in a white-T soaking up the sun and ocean air.

product_name: Obsession for Men Summer Calvin Klein
review_content: Own it...blindly bought it, and was meh initially as it smelled familiar and cheap. It took me to buy(find) a refill of the ol' Dunhill X-Centric to find it reminds me now of the Obsession Summer for Men...a gawk says they both share sage & cedar notes so this would make sense. The Dunhill has more character/notes, but both are mild. You're not "missing out" I guess..lol

product_name: Obsession for Men Summer Calvin Klein
review_content: I feel like I've been in a cave! I love Obsession and have tried the various flankers over the years (including the new one just come out), but I must have missed this entirely! I need to try this out as the original is a masterpiece in my opinion.

product_name: Obsession for Men Summer Calvin Klein
review_content: I've tried plenty of these Aqua fragrances but I loved this one as soon as I smelled it and so did my wife. I'm surprised it gets negative reviews to be honest because its so light and unoffensive. As far as the projection and longevity are concerned I think it has plenty of both. I can still smell it after 6 hours and a 20 minute motorcycle ride in to work.

product_name: Obsession for Men Summer Calvin Klein
review_content: Starts off as a some herbal slightly powdery after shave water. then dries down to LHomme Libre/Stetson Black type scent. Its light though. I got it because it's summer scent and those are always safe scents that are not cloying or offend anyone. Also u will get plenty compliments from women love this stuff

product_name: Obsession for Men Summer Calvin Klein
review_content: My girlfriend loves this on me, and I'm quite the fan, as well. Clean and cool, light and seductive. The original Obsession is one of my first favorites as a teenager, eliciting so much nostalgia when I wear it, so I rather enjoy having a flanker that's appropriate for warmer weather.

product_name: Obsession for Men Summer Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells like Curve and apple pie to me. Not bad, but where it fails is projection and longevity. It literally disappears in 30 minutes and is a skin scent for a little while after that. Wife loves it though. Go figure...

product_name: Obsession for Men Summer Calvin Klein
review_content: I smelled this on a card and I was thinking "Acqua di Gio, simplified." I don't wear these kinds of scents often and I already have too many of them, so I certainly wouldn't buy a bottle unless it was selling for next to nothing, but summer/fresh fragrance fans may enjoy it.

product_name: Obsession for Men Summer Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells very feminine to me. Obsession and most of its flankers (minus Dark Obsession) have been a disappointment to me. Pass.

product_name: Obsession for Men Summer Calvin Klein
review_content: I tried it and not impressed at all. Poor longevity and hardly any silage and smells generic. Lacks character and uniqueness. Nothing creative about this release from CK.

product_name: Obsession for Men Summer Calvin Klein
review_content: I was excited and surprised to see this at my store but after 3 wearings I'm really not impressed. There are many new designer frags that have recently released and while I was hopeful for a summer take on Obsession, what I got was blah
I get zero coconut from this, the rest is just an edt version of CK One. Wanted to love it, but it’s pretty mid.

Mojito blast that settles into the coconut with white tropical flowers.

Super fresh for the summer heat. Fruity and fun for the summer lifestyle.
It's one of my favourite perfumes, I wear it all the time :) I just wish the projection and longevity were higher.
Why didn't these ck people improve longivity of their ck one summer line?????
A lovely and unusual, tropical Summer juice. It does smell of a Mojito cocktail. Fresh and bright. Lovely

This is a tropical contact-high smell, part fruit part flowers, sweet and creamy, best suited for summer nights and less for the heat of day. This is an outlier in the CK One Summer varieties, as it is not a citrus based fresh scent. It is less fresh and tangy than the usual CK summer's but as wearable, unisex and mass pleasing. I smell Tiaré flower, coconut and citrus from top to it's 6h bottom.

I can’t identify any specific note in this, it just has a very general fresh mens cologne smell. This is far from unisex to my nose and very traditionally masculine in it’s scent profile. Super disappointed, bought this for the mojito note!

Smells yummy... summer.

Nothing special, but its syntheticness isn't offensive.

Spray-and-go in the heat. Everyone will appreciate the freshness.

You get what you pay for-- a simple shower gel-like synthetic amalgam, with a bit of mojito lime / mintiness at the top. It's a great fresh dumb reach for when you want to just feel clean & maybe wear something else later in the day. If you have a kid that wants to follow your passion in fragrances, start them with this one. too light and simple for them to overspray.

I am a big big fan of 2008 and 2013 editions. Unfortunately, they are gone! i ordered this one and i am hoping it will be similar to these editions i love!

Is it similar to 2008 and 2013 editions? i hope so!

This is my summer/spring dumb reach fragrance. I wear it so often I'll probably have to consider it my signature scent... lol. People actually compliment me on this. Opens with sweet citruses and dries down to soft coconut-y woods. Performance is not too great, but that's OK with me, considering it's a summer frag. I might get another bottle while it's still around.
it's smell like synthetic and cheep , after seen some revives on here i bought it from a online shop but not impressed .

This seems to be still available online and I even managed to try it in a physical store now in 2020 even though it's from 2018.
It's pretty nice, hard to identify specific notes but to me this smells more like summer version of cK Be. Opens sort of fruity, but not in an Invictus way. Then it's very similar to cK Be, sweet powdery with a touch of that fruitiness still lingering.
Performance not great but above average for the cK One Summer line and it's pretty affordable so overall not terrible.

SMELL 4/5
Wonderful smell that brings me back with my thoughts to memorable summer and festive evenings on the beach..fresh, youthful and exotic fragrance. The notes I hear most are Mojito and coconut milk. It's similar to the 2016 version which had something more magical.

PERFORMANCE 2/5
The sillage is moderate for the first/second hour, after it becomes a skin scent.

VERSATILITY 3/5
In my opinion it's suitable for all occasions but only for summer and for boys and girls.

BOTTLE 4/5
Really nice bottle, but the vaporizer is weak.

FEEDBACK 3/5
I have received some compliments with this fragrance.

VALUE FOR MONEY 3/5
I bought it at 32€ for 100ml, wonderful smell but poor performance.

I really don't care for this fragrance at all. From the moment I sprayed it, it reminded me of generic man's shower gel. Very masculine smelling to my nose, I do not enjoy wearing this as a twenty-something woman.

Now, in the far stages of the drydown (4+ hours in), it smells less manly, but still not very interesting or complex. I am getting lots of strong cedarwood (which is where the masculine vibe is coming from, I guess?). I get a faint mojito note, although it is a very bitter/sour mojito.

I am getting absolutely no coconut and no pineapple in this - so there is nothing to sweeten or round off the harsh mix of cedar wood and lime+mint (aka mojito).

A fail for me...

Calvin Klein CK One Summer 2018 is yet another pleasing entry in the line, like 2016, that’s not quite as good as my favorite, 2014. There’s a fairly similar mojito vibe to 2016, and it’s a listed note. It’s really virtually the same fragrance, which explains why I like both, with perhaps a touch of pineapple on top of the guava that’s also in 2016, with cedar and coconut in the base as opposed to just cedar in 2016. So by the notes, at least, it’s a slightly more complex, fruitier offshoot of 2016—perhaps less mojito, more fruit. Again, it’s very pleasing, easy to wear, and seems readily available on the cheap (under $20 on FragranceNet currently). It’s not much in terms of performers, like most Calvin Klein freshie fragrances nowadays, but it’s a decent value and overall pretty nice, a like but not a love.

6 out of 10

I can smell the sweet cocktail Piñacolada from this bottle. Pineapple and Coconut milk shake? Maybe. May not be a unique scent but I like it still even with its weak sillage and longevity. Most of the latest fragrances are weak on sillage and longevity for the first place.
Overall Rating 6.5/10

kingk4de is, unfortunately, correct. Maybe that person and I got bottles that had turned?

Yes, there is a note in this that is off-putting. Kingk4de called it "cat piss.". ( By the way, I love it when users select colorful language when describing fragrances! Really accentuates the full effect of emotion.). I'd agree and to me it comes across as Windex window cleaner...which can sometimes smell a bit like ammonia...which is what makes cat piss smell so bad. I really like the notes, took a blind chance, and nope. The mojito comes across as just typical fragrance alcohol, the citrus is amped up too much and drowns out the coconut and cedar, and the net effect is Windex. Or car piss. Lol.

I may try it again later this summer and see if it does better in hotter weather. And it should as a summer fragrance. Or cat piss. Haha.

Fresh, airy, light and slightly powdered musk. A hint of citrus with white flowers that makes it leaning feminine. Smells modern and Reminds me somehow of the style of Aqua di parma colonia pura.

Pleasant and light after the shower cologne for hot summer days. It totally disappears within one hour.

OMG...this brings back memories of Avon's pink bubble bath. I swear it's exactly the same scent. I thought I was crazy, so I went to a neighbor. She said she couldn't smell the cologne over the soap I washed me hands with...lol

Rub a dub dub...

Very close to 2014. This one is slightly more saltier and marine. It's very nice and lasts quite a while too. I do wish though, that every Summer fragrance was more varied. However, 2018 is a lovely Summer juice.
Opens girly and gross, off-putting...then evolves into a near Tommy Bahama Set Sail Martinique ripoff with less longevity. Pass!

So, I am not as experienced as some others on this site when it comes to understanding the complexity of flankers. Even though I have easily over 130 bottles of cologne at home, I feel like I am always learning more each day about colognes and perfumes. This being said, I’m hoping someone can DM me about my issues with this cologne. My favourite Ck one Summer cologne is the (2017) version,it’s just super fresh and sweet. This cologne however has something in this scent that ruins the overall smell. Whatever is in this I smell the same ingredient in Hugo boss the scent intense. I checked the pyramid and didn’t see the same ingredient, so I am legit confused. I don’t know if it’s the pine or the guava, or maybe even a pepper of some sort. Either way it wants to be a good scent but whatever that ingredient is it smells kind of a bitter smell, almost like cat piss. Smell is obviously subjective, but whatever it is it makes me want to wash the cologne off right away. The silage is weak and so is the longevity. If you can grab the 2017 CK one summer, do that instead.
Scent- 4/10
Silage- 3/10
Longevity 4/10

Did a blind buy on this one. Maybe got a funky bottle but it opens with a Azzaro Chrome floral with sour (not lime) smell to me. Deff no coconut at first.. and projections not great (blasted myself). Some clean vibes, more floral than I wanted. The dry down on me’s a diff story. Smelled amazing. Versace Fraiche/Dolce&Gabbana light blue for women (love that scent). Took hours though. Really good scent.. once it gets there.


EDIT: Been trying it for two days and it’s got the worst projection/longevity ever. In the history of fragrance. Had hiccups last longer

Very similiar to 2016 version.. Coconut stands the most.. I love it, but i just wished they would come with something new.. Not old juice in new bottle. I hope they surprise me with a good one next year

I have this and TB Set Sail St. Barts. St. Barts on me is all lime and musk. I layer something over that one to make it wearable. CK One Summer, I definitely smell mojito and pineapple. I was looking for some warm/hot weather scents. I found some lovely everday, anytime fragrances, Elie Saab Resort Collection is my favorite. CK one Summer just satisfies the mood when I want something fun, reminds me of time spent sailing or summer dock parties. I’ve never bought a CK fragrance before, but a few months ago while shopping, I passed a woman who smelled so fresh and Springlike. She was wearing CK One Summer, and it had palm fronds on the bottle (2016?) I found this bottle in the men’s section at Ross. (I’ve taken to checking men’s and women’s sections and the discount stores.)
This just makes me smile, and I get the urge to go get some Red Stripe.

CK One Summer 2018 is mostly the same to Tommy Bahama Set Sail St. Barts. I smelt it at the Calvin Klein store and it is redundant. It has already hit the discounters so keep an eye out if you want to replace past CK One Summer bottles with similar notes (2014 and 2016 mostly.) For me though, it is a skip due to me having St. Barts.

I got to sample CK One Summer 2018 this morning and I will be picking-up a bottle when it hits the deep-discount market. Sure it's 80% or more similar to all the other Ck One Summer scents...but it's just a likable summertime freshie, and I just like this CK One Summer releases.

Performance is on-par with other CK One Summer releases; pasts 4-5 hours on my skin and is pretty much a skin scent after 30-minutes. Cheers!
The Mojito blends in perfectly with the coconut and the lemon. The scent is uplifting, fresh and very likeable. This is totally unisex. Simply great!

I really like this one! I tested it today.
It starts off very masculine on me, with lots of citrus and cedar. When it has dried down for 10-15 minutes, the white flowers, coconut milk and the other fruits starts to show up too, giving it a bit more sweetness, so that it feels more unisex! And to be honest I don't know what mojito smells like, but in this perfume I guess I can sense a slight "greenness" with a hint of mint.
So far I really like it!
It's a perfect fresh, clean and summery fragrance, it's very uplifting to me! It's not groundbreaking tho, it has the same vibe as a lot of other perfumes. But, I have recently started to appreciate perfumes like this, especially for hot weather when you just want to have a fresh, clean scent that makes you feel comfortable! Perfect for casual, everyday use.
Would absolutely love this perfume on my boyfriend too.

i dont get much pineapple but i sure as hell get a lot of coconut, it gives me a suntan lotion kinda vibe, i like it! during the hot summer months this will be in my daily rotation for sure, after that i wont use it much. the name gives it away really, "Summer" just use it liberally over the warmer months & dont even worry about performance, its cheap enough just to use it up!
Same like the 2016 version. :( Too masculine for me anyway.

It's starts citrusy, fresh and then developing into creamy, coconut scent.

Like wearing body lotion, thin and stays close to the skin.
At the base gets little feminine.

Good for summer if you can find it cheap.

I can't vote for the notes for some reason or hit the like button.
It smells very citrusy and a bit woody to me. Masculine vibe is there in the top notes.
It settles down nicely.
A simple, light, uplifting fragrance, but nothing original.
A cool blue bottle. It could be a good scent for training.
It's quite good, but it's not an aventus wannabe at all. It smells different, stop comparing literally everything to aventus.

Hey! This is a little different.

The summer dna is barely visible but it feels deeper.

I didn’t like it at first sniff but I was expecting the usual ck summer

Now I really like it! Check this out - even if u dont like ck summer
Perceiving the review below, i couldn't be more agree. The 2017 version is the worst version, no character at all.

I sampled it in store and I find it to be the same soft creamy coconut scent as the 2016 edition that came out in the green bottle. Smells pleasant enough but I expected something different.
In any case it is still much better than that awful 2017 effort! That really was the worst CK One Summer edition.

This is a very fresh, light, sweet, bright, and uplifting fragrance! Definitely worth the buy if you can get it discounted. This fragrance is way to "basic" to pay retail for. (Never pay retail for any iteration of CK One)

Nonetheless, this flanker is an excellent "spray & go", "easy to use" and "mass appealing" fragrance for daily use during the warm spring and hot summer days if you're someone that only owns a few bottles of fragrances.

Longevity is 4-6 hours on skin, so you'll want to spray your clothes to improve longevity to carry a decant.

Overall: 7.5/10
thays nice and gentle but SO light,evades from skin after a few minutes,shame...

I was really looking forward to this flanker. The notes here sound fantastic. Unfortunately, I think that it smells just like cucumber with a little bit of mojito in the head note. An earlier reviewer stated that he gets a vegetable-like sensation from this. I can totally relate. It is not unpleasant or bad. It might be actually very refreshing on a hot summer day, perfect for temperatures above 25 degrees celsius. Longevity is rather weak.

Maybe I have to have another try, but I do not think that I like it enough to buy it. The bottle is beautiful though.

EDIT
