I have tested it again, and I must say I liked it much better today. The top note is still mojito and cucumber, but in the base note I could smell coconut with a little bit of guava. It is actually a very nice scent, but performance is quite poor.

Beautiful smell, but I have to press my wrist against my nose to be able to detect it.

When i tested this today i was
sure it had a fig note, but i
think it must have been the mojito,
anyway i did in fact like this scent
and i tend to not like these flankers
but this one was pretty good not fantastic
but good enough to make me wanna buy it at
the right price, projection and longevity
was not very good as most of these flankers
have in common.

I purchased This in cabazon California it was release not to long ago
They are trolls and/or bots. It happens with all the new popular fragrances. IMO Fragrantica should disable ratings until the fragrance is widely released.

Looks like it ticks a lot of boxes for me - love pineapple, love mojito, and love coconut (that doesn’t smell like shoe polish that is). Really look forward to trying this, got a good feeling about this one!! Don’t know why there are so many bad reviews already - is there something I don’t know?!? Is it out already!?!?

I cannot understand why they keep producing infinite versions of this ordinary CKone while they discontinue their unique decent, sophisticated and spectacular creation, CK2. Please Calvin Klein, bring CK2 back!
Wow mojito and guava? very interesting
what is with so much hate when the perfume wasn't even released yet
pineapple note, so it smells like aventus ??? lol

This looks promising, but I'm a little worried about the lemon and cedar notes. Lemon typically comes across as furniture polish to my nose and cedar smells either like the inside of a wooden chest (which isn't so bad) or pencil shavings (which is so bad LOL).
i think i will love it!
There is 20 people that votes about all new fragrences. Who are they ? im so curious ...

Agreed..another blue bottle..still though judging by the notes I feel like this one might be up my alley.. Oh & to the pre voters I really doubt this will smell like creed Aventus just b/c a few note similarities.. One is meant to be unisex & Aventus is anything but & super strong..oh & ya'll are a bunch of a**holes..
I'm excited about the pineapple note!
Blue again oh please... Can't you come up with other colors like red or yellow? CK One Summer have 5 blue bottles in 5 years a row... Sadly disapointing.
It might be my signature scent because of coconut
I know I will have to get it. The notes sound promising.
Looks like it has the DNA of the 2016 version minus the green apple, ginger, juniper and moss... plus they have added the pineapple note at the heart. i think it will be a good one.
man I love that bottle - blue summer sky :) the fume looks good too ha ha
Wow! I do so look forward to this.

I bought this today by chance thinking that the difference from the original was only the shiny metallic collector's edition bottle. I used Euphoria several years ago and maybe can't quite remember the scent now, but I think they seem to be pretty similar. The signature Euphoria's tart fruity sweetness and floral seductiveness on the woody base is here, pomegranate is definitely prominent, as well as orchid and lotus. But the musk is switched in favor of whipped cream, and I think it works this way quite well too. It is creamy and less masculine in the dry-down. Now I want to find the original Euphoria again so as to compare side by side since I am curious about what Japanese Loquat and Champaca notes are adding to this limited edition, or how they smell.
UPDATE: I'll be returning this. Even though the notes are almost the same in the description, I feel that this is too synthetic smelling in general and has harsh alcohol smell on the initial spritz. The dry down is much more pleasant, but I just can't get past the initial strong alcohol smell. I somehow missed this nuance the first day I was testing it out since I was mainly looking for similarities or differences with the original Euphoria (in my memory). Also, longevity and sillage are just barely moderate, unlike the original.

no, the original has no whipped cream in it, so this must be a cremier, better and hopefully more sensual version of the original. maybe just slightly different, considering the notes...not bad! cant wait to try..
I have ssen this already last month in a department store....didnt know this is another scent, as they didnt have a tester, thought it would be just a colletor eddition bottle of the original and teh sale assistant told me the same.lol gotta go back and blind buy this gem!

i would say this is my boyfriend's (current) signature scent, and i simply love it. it smells very fresh and clean, a bit musky, and very very cold. i don't know how else to describe it - it smells like pine and cold air with a tiny bit of tobacco sweetness. i guess the sweetness comes from the wood or incense, as there is no tobacco in the notes. i can definitely smell the mint as well. i love that it has violet leaf in the notes, as violet is one of my favorite fragrance notes; i think it makes it quite romantic that our scents are connected in that way! lovely everyday fragrance for an outdoorsy mountain loving man ♡

Longevity is the only issue.
Otherwise this is an absolute banger and winner. A beautiful, masculine, and calming fragrance that we could easily imagine in a niche bottle. I love it. It's a linear offering, but there is nothing wrong with it; it's semifloral, with a warm base of vanilla and spices that make it very comforting in a masculine way. Then, the real magic must be a note of violets that gives this petrolish vibe, very subtle but enough to make a dent. There is nothing citrusy; it goes in the warm, spicy, floral, ambery realm.
Not a hyped fragrance, which is unfair
Smells like cantaloupe. 😐

A recommendation as an everyday scent. It’s actually not bad — the quintessence of a normal men’s fragrance, with a hint of Fahrenheit, though not fully — it’s like a Fahrenheit Sport, which probably doesn’t last very long.
I wish it smelled longer, but it's good smell.

This, now a classic, is fragrance which is great to start (and use it occasionally) with designer fragrances. Its aura is good, moderate longevity and it will keep the feel of cleanliness all the time. Good fragrance for all ocassions and ages.

A floral, summery men's scent that progresses in a straight line from beginning to end. Nothing special but not bad either. I think it's a fresh and pleasant scent that is okay to have in the closet. Sillage is low, longevity is below average, scent quality is average.

On first take, for a flash of minute, this looks like a retread of the already well-trodden Dior Fahrenheit model, with that burst of gasoline violet mingled with citrus that the top notes promise. But, in no time at all, at least on my skin, this mutates into a thoroughly American spearmint bubblegum, with only distant spars of spice that linger before settling into that summery, nutmeg kissed calone that is familiar to anyone taking the sun by the pool in the wherever US. The violet returns towards the end, like a distant echo, from a bed of warm, familiar woods. In short, those anchoring for Fahrenheit are better off with Mercedes-Benz Intense.

This is billed to Gottlieb but both Jacques Cavallier-Belletrud, behind Acqua di Gio and L'Eau d'Issey, and Harry Fremont, he of CK One and lots and lots of Lauren, had a say in this, and it shows. Is it commercial, not niche in any way? Of course it is. Original? Arguable, if you like losing debates. Is it strangely enjoyable? Well, any kid who has taken pleasure from chewing mint flavored gum on a warm summer day, grass waving in the wind, would not think twice about the answer to that. Is it a great value? No kidding.
Good

Crass opening, that is very much comparable to an aerosol deodorant spray. Violet is the first thing you’ll notice, not unlike Fahrenheit. I then get nutmeg and a woody mix. I think if you could detect the amber it would feel a bit more rounded, but I don’t get it at all. For the price point it’s solid, but I can’t see myself wearing this daily. I feel like you’d end up with headaches.
I liked ... clean and fresh

Hard to rate. Opening is a sharp scent like Fahrenheit petrol like (it's the violet) dries down to a sensible masculine scent for older men. Pretty standard solid scent but it's gone to a skin scent in an hour. Maybe it's just me. I love CK products all the way back to 1985 Obsession but this one is like a modern toned down Dior Fahrenheit without the super strong petrol smell. BTW petrol smell is from the type of violet used in a scent. It's not always a bad thing for me but a little headache inducing. I will try it some more and change review if needed. It's cheap so little to loose. After trying several days, I can't get on board. It's OK just no sillage, projection or longevity. The violet is too harsh too. I do not like Dior Fahrenheit at all probably the same reason.
For me, it works best when I apply Al Haramain’s Sultan and then layer this fragrance on top. It adds longevity and complexity, making the already good fragrance even better

Was just gifted this by my brother. On my wrist i smell a cool fresh icy fragrance with a hint of the legendary farenheit. The atomizer could be better. Not powerful like the JPG fragrances or the EDP clones which are flooding the market.
Sillage & Longevity Okaay...
Not bad for the price he paid so would rate it 6/10

Very mid-late 2000s.
Fun, clean, inoffensive... Devoid of any character or personality though.
A scent for people who don't think about scent. Dumb reach, spray on and leave the house vibe.

You get a vague citrus, you get the violet leaf. You get the very 2000s blend of nutmeg/cinnamon and mint.
And yet, I don't hate it.

In fact, I'll be wearing it when I don't wanna feel like the fragrance snob who has to spray on Amouage's Reflection just to do his shopping or Dior Homme Parfum to walk his dog.

A&F Fierce toned down.
Fahrenheit's grandson.
Narciso Rodriguez for him's castrated nephew.

Fragrances like this are heroic. They do the job no fragrance wants to. Unsung heroes of this game.
Outstanding fragrance. Dry down is so beautiful, reminds of a peaceful summer sunset. Very masculin. Great for office + casual wear.

I get a family resemblance to Truth. As if you took Truth and spiced it up a bit with the nutmeg. It has the same soft profile - it’s not big and in your face, just subtle and clean. Very balanced and inoffensive. Which is what I probably like about it most. It’s a masculine scent but not an obnoxiously masculine one. I would say it’s office safe, but depends on your office.
got as a gift, sweet and woody. kinda simple and boring but its decent. 5/10

This feels like a pretty underrated scent. It's a mildly sweet, ozonic, aromatic scent driven by violet leaf. I don't get much nutmeg or other spiciness in the opening but it comes through a little bit in the drydown. The comparisons to Fahreneit aren't completely off but this like the CK version of Fahrenheit Aqua or Cologne. It's very mid-2000s in the sense it's not really sweet (like current stuff) and it's quite aromatic but missing the overload of early 00s white musk. This is an office-friendly, masculine release that is completely pleasant and brings something different to the table than you're likely to find in today's releases (without feeling very dated). There's an underlying tonka that isn't listed but is very present (as in things like YSL L'Homme) in the drydown. Sandalwood, incense, amber - nothing that I can find, even looking for the notes.

Longevity, for me, isn't as bad as everyone is saying. I get 5-7 hours, not a beast, but a good workday scent with low-to-moderate projection for an hour or so before it settles down. Not sure if this got watered down but mine is from 2008.

This is a 7.25/10 for me. You could easily wear this as a daily office scent. For what it's worth, and likely not a lot, but I've received multiple compliments from coworkers on this one.

Its actually beautifull, the spicy citrus, cinnamon and wood hits u all at once in a very fresh and masculine way. Its really a perfect every day frangrance in every season besides summer. Solid 7/10 for the price.
This is a simple clean fresh cheapie with a very unique unexpected nutmeg/cinnamon note that sticks out in a fun way. I like it. 6.9/10

I bought this fragrance while exploring some cheap daily fragrances for work/gym use etc.

I was really surprised with this purchase and happy. Its a great fragrance for anytime of the day. Good for use in the office or daily routine etc. Its not very expensive i got mine in the UK a 100ML bottle for £22.00 and for this price its a bargain.

A nice woody fresh fragrance with the hints of the bergamot and orange at the top and a nice dry off to a woody fresh clean fragrance. Definitely a light young manly scent. I wouldn't particularly use this for nice lavish nights out or evening wear to a luxury or high up restaurant or venue, but it would be okay for general outings at casual places etc or somewhere mid market.

I do find that i can smell this for quite sometime after i have sprayed it. I always spray in the morning as i get ready for work at around half 6 of a morning and find i can still smell this in the afternoon after my lunch and still sitting there when i am in the gym.

I really enjoy this fragrance that i did decide to buy it again and will probably have it as a daily use in amongst my daily fragrances. I get through a lot of perfumes/Colognes etc and will come back to this again and again.
On my skin dominant note is black peppery spice.
Lasts half an hour at best, smell is mediocre green spicy scent nothing special...
I don’t know why people are complaining about the longevity. It lasts easily 4-5 hours on my skin. It lasts even longer on clothes. It’s a great, cheap summer fragrence for young men like me.

This isn’t going to be an exciting review, and I’m not saying anything that hasn’t been already said, but take it as confirmation that Man smells great, but has no longevity.

Even given that, it’s very wearable for both work and going out, but it’s not something I will buy again because the nice scent doesn’t make up for the fact that it only at lasts for a couple of hours.

I got through half the bottle and gave the other half to my significant other who doesn’t really like wearing cologne anyway and will take a while to get through it.

Sorry. Not a favourite but ok!
Here are two main notes. Violet leaves and mint. But Gets more complex over time ;) Wintery Christmas smell. Wormwood. Hyssop? Lemon balm?

Sticks to skin for 8-10 hours. After 3-4 hours the violet, mint and wormwood lingers around, but the smell has deepened and gets more complex in a good way. Smells rather nice then on skin after a couple of hours. It's not a summer smell.
I love Calvin fragrances... this smells great...bottle is beyond...but it lasts literally 5 minutes. Only fragrance I've ever returned to store!

Beautiful scent. But!!!
Literally 20 sprays on t-shirt ..1 hour later doesnt exist..none nothing what so ever. Never saw such bad performance

Ditto (repeat/+1) everything already said about poor performance. This will not project and will evaporate off of your skin very quickly. On clothes, I get about 5 hours when I dig my face into my shirt. I hope it will perform better after i get some air into this skinny bottle.

This is sold at drugstores and discounters for a low price in Toronto. The scent is really nicely blended and the quality is on par with other CK offerings. On my skin, this is pretty straightforward, a quiet leafy green opening, immediately making way to a dry powdery amber and woody base. I like what I can smell. If there was better performance, this would be a winner for me.

It's going to have to be my second favourite CK scent after Shock, and will be used for quiet days at home more than anything. I'll stick to using my Cavalli Uomo and Dior Fahrenheit for the office and nights out.

If you are looking for an accessible violet scent and don't want/can't get CK, Dior or Cavalli; Burberry's Touch is an ultra powdery one. Lalique offers L'hommage a L'Homme (original) which is slightly more mature and formal while Zegna's Uomo is probably the most refreshing violet leaf scent I have ever found and one of my all time summer favourites. CK Man fits in the middle of all these and will have its place when I need something quiet and calming. Thank you to our perfumer, Ms. Gottlieb, for this charming scent.

Well, I don't even know why I am disappointed about this scent. I know Calvin Klein is not the most unique or sophisticated house in the market, hence I don't buy frags from this company (my first purchase from them was CK One Shock which has left me disappointed too, anyway) The scents of this house are mostly generic, synthetic and underperforming...This particular one has all these qualities. Opens up rather harsh and loud. The violet leaf dominates here but it's not natural violet. Then moves to the second stage where nutmeg comes up (no mandarin, neither mint) and that one merges with the base note of amber and guaiac wood and it finishes there...This last part is kinda identical to Puig Quorum Silver (which actually I adore) Now, If I have to talk about the performance or sillage I'd start crying... Even tap water would stay longer on me than this...The only good stuff about this scent is the bottle. Stunning box presentation and the minimalist black square bottle. Really appreciate this but that's all Folks! I have learnt my lesson again, I simply have to stay away from Calvin Klein scents in the future.

A surprisingly under the radar fragrance, I think maybe it is a little too 'green' smelling to have been a hit with the masses and stick around for longer. I really like the scent but it's one of those I wouldn't feel like wearing all the time. A rainy day scent, urban & modern with a nod to nature, a city park or garden in the rain with brightly lit glass & steel office buildings all around? Maybe. If CK/Coty released an intense or EDP version (and increased the citrus in the opening perhaps) they could be on to a real winner.

Anyone get l'eau d'issey similarity in drydown?
I was repelled by opening so I stopped sniffing my hand for an hour. Then it settled down to what I'd say is miyake relative but I'm not sure since I had it long ago.
Anyway, drydown is ftw if you're into greeny, bitter, spicy, woody citrus

What a pity I am not picking up any of the mandarin orange and bergamot in the opening. The opening isn't the best part of the fragrance. I feel it a bit heavy on the violet leaf and rosemary. If the mandarin and bergamot were more elevated it would've brightened CK Man, made it more fresh and light. The dry-down is good, as it settles into the woods with a gentle musk.

I am almost done with a bottle that I've had for more than a decade, and I won't be getting another one. This one's had its time, and I have barely reached for it when there were plans to go out into the world. It isn't bad by any means, just not impressive enough in overall scent and performance.

I like CK cologne’s I use a lot of them, even as a signature scent back in the 90’s. My favorite so far is the newer Eternity EDP, so now the Man…Very Herbaceous in the opening and through the mid. As it settles down it picks up more wood and becomes more smooth, but it is closer to the skin at this point,
But it smells very nice and even some freshness. This is a good all around anytime Cologne that will not offend, also great for dates, office, or Church. I’ll give it an overall 7.5 rating.

The violet leaf and Rosemary really stands out with this one. To me it smells more like a aromatic fougere. Smells good, but very poor sillage and longevity. About 2 hours,.

6 out of 10 with the rateing
5/5 light barbershop cologne with strong unique taste has a kind of signature vibe ....and under 25 ? go now and get it !!!!!!!!!!! hidden gem? YES

So beautiful, I love it. It’s sweeter on my skin then the guy I tested it on but it was still beautiful on him. Citrusy ozone opening from the bergamot, Mandarin and violet. The heart of this is so delicious bay leaf nutmeg and mint so aromatic and smell like beauty, all that drys into a green musky smell. I think this is a great date fragrance for warm to hot weather. The performance and longevity are good enough for me to compliment a guy but this isn’t and in-your-face smell.

i like the woody effect on this perfume. Almost barbershop but not so. To me this is pure gentleman. i bought new in box when it was launched decade ago. Still in my collection and i appreciate its quality. The bottle is rare and minimal and the performance is marvelous. Probably i got the first batch of its production. Now it sits well with my niche. It reminds me of Amouage Portrayal Man which is also my favorite niche.

IMO....this has slight vibes of a "lighter" Dior Aqua Fahrenheit.....and not...Fahrenheit.
The violet note departs on me quickly. Performance is mediocre. On my skin...skin scent...very quickly,sadly.
This scent smells "nice"....an average everyday -easy to wear-scent.

This is a hidden gem, Elegant, Classy and Romantic. It is between freshness and warmth. If you like the Violet Leaf note , you will like this one. It opens up with like fresh citrusy, violet leaf and green notes in the background then dry down is slightly smoky , woody. It is suitable for the all seasons. I really enjoy it and I like Man Calvin Klein EDT for Men. I'm so happy that I have it in my collection. Highly Recommended.
Thumbs Up.
Rating : 8 / 10

This is a cheapy and nice. As a skin scent, I'm surprised how poor the performance is. But it's a lovely uplifting scent, I like the distinctive opening but im not sure about the drydown. Given its the Man EDT, it really doesn't seem manly , still very much unisex ironically. For the price point, it's decent

But I love the bottle. Elegant , well designed and slots right in on the table

close encounter fragrance gorgeous smell with hint of black pepper ideal for cold weather in casual day or date
this fragrance for gentleman not bad boy vibe
longevity better on clothes

rating 8

Just got Calvin Klein Man and smelled the violet on the opening. I did not get the gasoline vibe of Dior Fahrenheit; there is only a slight similarity due to the violet. However, one minute after spraying I went nose blind to it. So all I get is violet on top and not much else. I'll edit this review when I test this out some more. Update: Still nothing. My nose doesn't pick this up at all. Got my gf's opinion on it and she wasn't impressed, either.

I had to revisit this one (the final drops of my last sample!) due to people referring to this as a clone of Dior's Fahrenheit, well I really don't get that I must say! I'm not a fan of the Dior at all, I appreciate the fact people love it but it's just not for me. CK Man has NONE of that leathery aspect found in DF, no 'gasoline' type smell either. They share some violet leaf sure, they might appeal to a similar public too (though not always as with me!).

One interesting thing is that CK Man was a collaboration between three perfumers, Ann Gottlieb apparently oversaw proceedings with Harry Fremont and Jacques Cavallier-Belletrud. Interesting because the latter would go on to create l'Eau Bleue d'Issey pour Homme (2004), which to me has some of the essence of CK Man, only in part of course, but they share some kind of stark, herbal yet sort of ozonic aura. Both kind of introspective, rainy day scents. Yet paradoxically they both open very bright. These two fragrances actually share several notes, the most noticeable to me being cypress and rosemary but CK Man certainly goes off to visit the land of violet leaf whereas Issey Bleue loses (or finds?) itself in a spicy forest of juniper.

CK Man, on me quickly becomes a close scent (but lasts quite well), which is kind of a shame in a way as it really seems to give off different nuances at different times, with various notes popping up to say hello during the course of the wearing. If only CK/Coty made this a little stronger, an EDP version could've been great! As it is this fragrance really is a reflection of it's promotional material, a sleek, modern (prior to the ambroxan craze) masculine scent. An office building housing a touch of mystery beneath it's glossy bland exterior. Not a must have perhaps but I think it's well worth a try if you find a sample or even a bottle at a good price ;)

This has been in my collection for a minute..12 years or so and I’m only on my second bottle. I honestly don’t get the Fahrenheit notes like I do from other offerings. Don’t remember the last time I wore the cologne but it does get compliments especially from ladies. The aftershave balm is great and the scent in general feels good after a fresh shave! Longevity? I’ll say this is a 4-6 hour cologne..but I’ve smelled the woody base on my skin up to 10 hours later when showering after wearing to work. Insane sillage; put it on and someone smelled it across the street...wow !!

8.5/10

For some years, CK Man was my daily office fragrance since it's fresh opening, friendly nutmeg heart note, and easy to wear woody and musky based note. I still keep 2 bottle, the older one is made in US, sweeter and more citrusy. Another bottle is made in France, woodier and less sweet.

This is a good every day and office wear type of scent. The violet leaf really stands apart from the other notes. To me this smells very similar to Ermenegildo Zegna Uomo but this smells a little bit darker though with the incense and cypress notes. This is a good blind buy if you like citrus, green smelling fragrances. This use to be all over discount stores about a year ago when I bought this. This smells very fresh, very green and herbal in a way. Moderate longevity and sillage for me. It's a good one to have in your collection. I give this an 83/100.
It's very synthetic on my skin. Smells like musk mixed some kind of chemical

Fantastic all-rounder suitable for any time of day, any season or event. It's very similar to Fahrenheit but lighter and fresher. Now my bottle is down to the final milliliters I can't bring myself to part with it.

Got this as a birthday present from one of my friends, who wears the fragrance himself as well. I must say, it does suit him and it smells quite good on him, but this most definitely does not suit me. I really hate it. Bayleaf mixed with nutmeg and citrus. Smells cheap. Gave it away to one of my colleagues.

On the one hand, it's like a soft Fahrenheit, but it also kind of goes in it's own direction, in that instead of a contrast between light and heavy, it stays light so that there is only pleasantness, which of course is perfectly fine. There's also no major synthetic quality and the interplay of notes is compelling, with reasonable complexity overall. I have only tried the aftershave, which seems on the strong side as far as aftershaves go. In sum, I don't think one can expect more from this kind of release, so I would give it a high rating.

UPDATE: I obtained a bottle of the EdT and it's similar but stronger. To those who say, just buy a dollar store clone of Fahrenheit, sure, if you just want something "in the ballpark," but you can say the same thing about buying a botlte of Fahrenheit itself! I much prefer CK Man to something like Bleu de Chanel, which to me is harsh and there's too much iso e super. CK Man is a light herbal scent to me, with a little this and that added for complexity (and no obvious lavender, thankfully). It's cheap, so it's not like some sort of major commitment of funds. Sure, if you are thinking you are getting something like vintage One Man Show when you look at the notes, you'll likely be disappointed - this scent is obviously not meant for someone like you. I think this is much better than Jaguar Performance, for example, which is a similar idea. Know what you are seeking and you'll likely make better buys!

Very underrated fragrance, blue fragrance before blue fragrances where even a thing. Very versatile and mass apealing, suitable for any situation, but in my opinion perfect for office/school and even manual job. Opens up with a blast of herbal spicines that quickly settles to a transparent herbal violet leaf kinda scent and dries down to a nice violet leaf, woody base that might remind you of Fahrenheit. Solid performer and very appealing scent that is even unique considering that most of the modern scents follow strict citrusy+woody+resinous combo.
Scent 8/10
Performance 7/0
Versatility 10/10

I've had a sample of this for a few years now and I'll every so often give it a sniff, then ask myself (you know like Gollum in Lord of the Rings) whether I should get a full bottle.

I still stand by my previous abstract review below, that is the ambiance I get from this one. It's not a fun fragrance, it's kind of austere but I think due to the rosemary and the blend in general it is somehow compelling. A modern glass and steel structure surrounded by vegetation. When I first sniffed CK Man I was sure I didn't like it but after a while I kept having to sniff my arm where I'd sprayed it.

I honestly think some people (like me) will actually find some complexity in CK Man, a scent which is generally written off as nothing special. It's a scent of contrasts or even to (almost) cite the name of another CK frag 'contradictions'. Bright and strangely dark-ish at the same time, urban and green, cold yet somehow inviting. Definitely an odd one for me for something which seemed/seems bland on first view it's certainly interesting and thought-provoking.

Full bottle worthy? I'm starting to think so...

EDIT: I'm getting some similarities to Lanvin Oxygene Homme on the dry-down, not the exact same of course but they are definitely olfactory cousins at least. It must be the cypress and ozonic qualities.

I claimed this bottle from my husband after I had read the reviews and i was curious whether the rosemary (my favourite herb) and violet leaf (i love violets) stood out in the fragrance.

I sprayed it on my wrist and forearm last night, and immediately thought "wow that astringent/nose tickling." I didnt smell any other notes than the bergamot, a distinct lemony blast, the bay and the cedar. The initial blast reminded me of 4711.

This morning I woke up to the most gorgeous fragrance, a very close skin scent, yes Man had transformed into a warm rosemary, woody scent. It was the rosemary note that had initially intrigued me with the violet leaf. Both are evident some 6 hours later.

I'm definitly keeping this bottle, it's well worth the dry down. In summer this would be great as initially it's very refreshing. It doesn't sell aquatic to me, unless it's the faint mint that will developed more on someone else.

Even though I have a large ladies fragrance collection, I have been buying my favourite mens fragrances; Tuscany by Aramis, Cacharel for Men, and Tabac as I find them oddly comforting.
Reminds me of Fahrenheit a little. Pleasant and very good for the price.

Bought it for my husband based on smelling it on a card. The scent is completely different on the skin, and in fact reminds me so much of one of my own favourites Simply by Jil Sander that I think I'm going to keep it for myself...

A sleek tinted black glass & steel office building, the stark brightly-lit entrance lobby in which there is a large forest landscape painting hanging on the wall behind the reception desk, the young receptionist's name badge says Violet.

A man wearing a dark suit enters the building and walks between the two rows of impossibly clean looking plants towards Violet, she looks up and eyes him with her cool green eyes, but doesn't smile.


Scent:7.5
Versatility:7
Longevity:7
Sillage/projection:6

This is an amazing scent, don't know what people are talking about poor longevity and silage, just spray a little more and preforms as good as any other designer fragrance. Great sophisticated and affordable buy for the office.

This is such an amazingly average fragrance. Got it for $5. This is my go-to scent for chilling at home after I've gotten out of the shower and I don't care, but still want to smell nice.
Happy to waste this, but I'm happy to use it too.

Waxy violet leaf and incense. Below average performance. I would hold this in higher regards if it had better performance.

A similar but MUCH better substitute would be Yves Saint Laurent's L'Homme Libre.
This is definitely a dark fragrance. And yet this is a transparent fragrance. A rare combination, and that is what I like about this one.
good for the hot days, poor performance ...

Most of you who have said it’s like Fahrenheit are correct, but their is an asterisk attached to that. Like most Calvin Klein colognes the Sillage and longevity are poor to moderate. This one falls on the 1 to 2 hours mark, so it’s on the poor side. There are some positives to this cologne though. The first opening 10 minutes it does resemble Fahrenheit cologne. For anyone wanting that type of cologne smell without the burning gasoline smell, this is it. The dry down is a mint/insense woody vibe. It’s nothing spectacular, but it’s decent for the price. I picked this 100ml bottle for $29 bucks at a Rexall pharmacy. I’m a huge Fahrenheit cologne guy, so whenever I see here on this site a cologne that has any DNA Fahrenheit may have, I’m in. It has some, but it’s not as much as you would think. 6/10

I have used it as a daily cologne for some time and then stopped, it was nothing special for me (although my girlfriend loved it on me from the first sniff).
After a year I tried it again and now I like it. Maybe I have developed my taste in that time or something changed, but now it is good.
It is smooth, not offensive and very attractive. I love when perfumers are able to make fresh sweetness with some deep notes. It has a bit of everything: sweet, fresh and deep notes.
Very universal scent, most suitable for spring and summer, you can wear it with official clothes, sport clothes or casual clothes.

I have a unique obsession with this cologne as it was the scent my husband used to wear when we first started dating. It still gives me butterflies whenever I smell it on him - having beautiful scents linked to wonderful memories is one of the best feelings on earth. There isn't too much special with this scent, very basic men's fragrance with woody and spicy notes and a hint of freshness. I would imagine this to be good for a young man, perhaps a teenager who is just starting out with their scent collection. I think it is an excellent basic staple, it is non-offensive and smells very sexy and masculine.

i bought axe suave few days ago but it doesn't last and also someone told me not to use axe..so i stopped using it but i liked the smell and thought this is better than many famous perfume...i would even rate the smellh over any of my tom fords(tobacco vanilla,tuscan leather,oud fleur)...then i found this and it's to me the same smell..though fresh scents doesn't last much still u can keep a decant with u and reapply if u like a smell

edit:wah..just found the information that the nose behind axe suave and ck man is same...:PP

Very pleasant smell. It's sexy, masculine & freshness on him, not a sweet scent from my point of view which I do enjoy that, not too overwhelming also, a bit woody but not that much. The top notes which I noticed are: violet leaf & bergamot. I'll definitely be wearing again.

As most of the CK perfumes for men, this one is underrated too. Not saying, that this is the scent of 2007, but really not a terrible stuff…. However a little bit too synthetic, but which one isn’t? The scent pyramid seems totally wrong for me: the cypress is not a base note, I can smell it only in the first 1-2 minutes. The violet leaf isn’t a top note, I can smell it with the laurel in the mid. So the first few minute is a big cypress bomb, than come the laurel with the violet leaf. Many reviewers wrote that this stuff is very spicy, but I don’t feel it. The drydown is a common woody-amber-musk combination. Except for the first half hour (storng cypress+laurel), this is a wearable stuff… but bit boring.

- Really jolly joker, good for any time (winter, summer day, night, date, office etc.). Only for men over 30.

- The sillage and longevity as most of the CK, a bit under the average, 4-5 hours

- Safe blind buy

Scent (open, top-mid): 6/10 (x2)
Scent (drydown, base): 7/10 (x2)
Sillage: 4.5/10
Longevity: 4.5/10
Uniqueness: 7.5/10
Versatiliy: 9/10

Total: 6.438/10

Got this one yesterday as a birthday present, having never smelt it or even heard of it beforehand.
On first sniff I thought 'Generic designer' that literally gave off hints of Sauvage, 1 Million, a couple of David Beckham's etc etc and and was one of those that doesn't smell like any one frag but gives off hints of many. Best suited to a teenager or someone just starting out in frags so a definite NO from me.

However, giving it a proper test on skin I actually get a sort of Eternity/CPE/new GIT vibe off it, which is due to the mint, peppermint, violet and sandalwood.

Longevity is decent, 7-8 hours, projection moderate for 2-3, overall a pretty decent frag for spring and summer. Could see this being a gym or office staple as its easy to like, pleasant and unassuming and id be hard pressed to find someone who could take offence to it.

Although I won't wear it all that often l'd rate this a pretty decent 'work horse/everyday' frag and am pleased to have it in my collection.

I feel as though this is the perfect scent to wear any time, anywhere, any season. I guess the rather broad name "Man" is apt considering how versatile it is. I'd happily wear this day or night, summer or winter, casually or on a date. The top note is rather sweet, in the base I could really smell juicy apples, the dry down is rather masculine. It is a little reminiscent of Calvin Klein Eternity but it seems more mature and a little less summery. Longevity for me was pretty good, reapplied after about 4 hours, sillage is good too. Nice price at $29.99 for 100ml here in Australia. It has the potential to be a signature scent and would make the perfect gift for a gent, I think every kind of man could wear this. I love it!!

My everyday casual scent all year round is warm inviting and masculine. I enjoy this simple timely aroma for doing things around the apartment or just food shopping. Got a nice feel and I like the attitude, I get noticed. This is a low priced scent and a good place to start in the scent world.

During my early days in cologne land, I scored classics such as KL Homme, Nemo, Versace L'Homme, Gucci Nobile, Gucci Envy, Trussardi Uomo, The real Aramis Devin and Aramis 900 in their original large bottles. And many others... The problem was I lacked a collectors mindset so I doused myself as I pleased and within a few years many of those masterpieces had been hacked or killed off altogether.

My point is this, my first bottle of Calvin Klein Man in 2010 was simply incredible, natural smelling, fresh and strong. My next bottle in 2014 was a hacked version, a puff of scentless alcohol water followed by shades of the original in the background. My appreciation of the original made me tolerate the hack.

Lesson: Resolve to buy the early version (of any launch that might interest me) and then buy a second bottle as soon as possible!

Questionable marketing? Out of touch with 2007 trends? Whatever the reason, Man was unsuccessful commercially. Yet it is a quality fragrance, to my nose. The batch I received has a "Fahrenheit-lite" vibe going on with citruses and a faint note of nutmeg in the background. I don't detect ANY of the brine/pickling note others have written about. There is a little undertone of "manly body odor" that I pick up on every now and then. Maybe this is part of what drove the name of this fragrance - and part of what turns some off.

Bottle design: weighty, minimalist, and solid. It feels great. If it were glass rather than plastic it may even be a '10', for a mainstream non-niche fragrance.

If you like violet in any degree, this woefully underrated scent from the CK house is worth checking out. I bought it blind and I am very, very glad that I did.

Batch # 5351
Nice woody spicy frag. Smells quite classy and elegant. Something for a mature gentleman. Don't overspray though, since the scent borders on BO.

Calvin's best male fragrance. Perfect smell & quality while his other fragrances usually are very poor quality. I simply adore it but I love both violet leaf & cypress. This one will not be for you if you don't like those notes for they are the only ones you will smell. I really cannot smell any amber, incense nor nutmeg. An absolutely perfect aromatic violet fragrance. Quality also is perfect. A quality Calvin's fragrances is not known for.
It was like someone did the pickling mixture and tried pickling cucumbers, but forgot the vinegar.....

The forest floor is littered with beastly bay trees - their cinnamon like odor tingling in the bronchi of your lungs. The wind sings its whimsical song through the treetops calling you to rise from your place. You see a trail ahead of you - it calls to be explored. As you ascend to some unknown height, violets begin to bloom mere steps ahead of you...as if magic is held in every step. The trail winds is serpentine path toward an imposing peak, far from view. The silence of the forest takes hold of your wandering mind - it forces you to face questions of your being. Are you man, machine, or some natural force yet to be revealed...you continue to climb. The smell of nutmeg clings to the air as does hints of some from some faraway fire. As you break above the treeline, the world opens up and you are confronted by a ferocious wind cloaking giant drops of icy rain. The world below rises with the wind into amalgam of spiced woods and sweet, gummy resins...here you stand, bravely, against the wind and the rain. Tensions melt away and time is forfeit to the elements...no longer man nor machine, you have found your purpose.

Day 77 - Ascension
Listening to: The Black Keys - Howlin' for You

Notes: I must say that the greatness of my experience was provided more by nature than by the actual scent. It certainly is enjoyable as the bay leaf and nutmeg notes are quite present as is the lush violet with a faint waft of muted incense. These notes linger for a few hours before morphing into a bubblegum like wood and spice scent. The latter phase lasts around 8 to 10 hours but ultimately lacks the intrigue of the intro. It is pleasant but a bit commonplace, even among the CK collection!
Man Calvin Klein , long story short an average fragrance except for the bottle design which is really good!

I love green spicy crisp vibe here. If you like it too, try Beckham Homme. And yes, violet leaf gives Fahrenheit impression, but this is more clean and versatile. Good for all year and occasions, just maybe i wouldn't wear it on hot summer day.

It was the favourite fragrance of my ex and hold him with this scent on was a trip into a comfort quite sensual zone.
Id like to win a bottle of this, maybe I will keep this splendid artistic flacon for me and spray it on my pillow or perhaps I could give it as present for him just to remind US to him or make his girlfriend crazy ;)
Very nice aromatic scent. I would love to win this!

IF you like violet leaf, then you will enjoy CK Man. I say if, because I can't stand violet leaf, it gives me an instant headache.
The fragrance is quite fresh, mingling some citrus with violet leaf, light spices and a vague incense. When the violet leaf is not so potent, I kind of like this scent. But then I remember that other (way more affordable) fragrances smell similar.
I like a few of the CK perfumes. CK One, some eternity summer, CK Shock and CKin2u.
You won't stand out with CK Man, but if you are after the "fresh and clean" hype, then you may find yourself happy with this scent.

Much too weak for an EDT - it's about as strong as an aftershave, not good!

BUT.......It has a lovely smell.
This perfume is unique! It has a unique scent that I cannot find anywhere else! it's really mysterious I LIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIKE IT, no, I LOVE IT!

و اما بنظر من یک عطر بسیار فوق العاده و خوشبو، بسیار لذتبخش ،مناسب پاییز و بهار بنظر من،البته این به منطقه آب و هوایی هم ارتباط داره ،طبیعتا نه تنها جنس مخالف بلکه خوشایند همه خواهد بود ،متاسفانه ماندگاری زیادی نداره ولی باز ارزشش رو داره

Man, I must have bought a fake, because this is the first EdT that smells of..."nothing"; not even water!! Probably I got water with some kind of scentless alcohol that gives a refreshing feeling. My daughter, who happens to have Rhinitis, felt some smell, but to me it was as odorless as a bottle of Evian. I remember to have tried a vial in a shopping and it smelled good on the paper stripe, but on my skin...
Go figure!

This reminds a little of Bleu de Chanel without the citrus. Modern fresh and woody scent with a little spice. Easy to wear and fantastic casual/office day scent BUT has zero longevity as in not even a skin scent after an hour.

It's a fresh but slightly spicy fragrance with poor performance. It's gone within 2 hours leaving the buyer confused. The scent was likable but nothing new after it. No depth or transformation. Vey linear and not grown man worthy.

I don't think people realize the fragrances intention. It is supposed to be a modern man fragrance, with a hint of the classic man. It is subtle and close to skin type and supposed to be layered on skin and although not to be judged at initial spray, let it settle and project with a mans natural scent upon dry down, it compliments your natural scent. Earthy, green and woodsy like a rugged man. Clean yet earthy,dark but lightly modern yet classically brooding. It's not magical but not offensive. It compliments your natural scent giving off a mans second skin. It's not trying to be better than other ck fragrances. Nor trying to be a prize winner.

Boring, woody fragrance, smells very synthetic, and lasts less time then an episode of Mrs Brown's Boys. Drab, bland and like most of CK's fragrances is gone before you know it, next please...... Ohhh the bottle is lovely though, heavy and masculine.

I think CK fragrances are being unjustly, harsly criticized with being unoriginal, banal, and with poor longevity etc. I think CK is a very good fragrance house. It can be said Calvin Klein Man might lack in the originality and sillage departments but it is a very good cologne nevertheless.

Semi-sweet, fresh minty-ozonic-woody cologne which is very versatile. Opening is herbal- fruity which is not very natural but in 15 mins or so the cologne settles. Close to skin with mediocre longevity. Very modern, safe and versatile.

8/10
Nice masculine smell to it but its compromised with it being weak lasting and average silage. nice bottle though. its probably best to avoid calvin klein

Nice fragrance i always by passed this one since I always saw them at stores like Ross & Marshalls for 19.00 & I never liked any CK fragrances. Smelled this at a friends house and its a very soft go-to fragrance year round that recalls bits of Dior Fahrenheit & Carolina Herrera CH.
I may pick it up for everyday work smell if i see it again.

Ozonic spiced wood smell, a bit like furniture polish.

Soooo boring. This and Eternity are probably among my most hated scents of all time.

At the first spray, you can really sense the woody notes in here. It was really great! It's a little bit spicy but not overpowering. Did anyone notice that in every woody scent, they have the same scent molecule that is similar to each other?
Not a fan of the violet notes, here. I like the way they're modulated in Dior Fahrenheit, but not with this one. I guess it's the spice-violet mix which leaves me cold. Not for me.
my worse edt.pineapple scent.
Nothing special. 2/10

I differ a little bit of some comments below whom didn´t mention the masculinity and spicy blend in this CK fragance, it might be true that is not a classic CK aroma, it isn´t either the best aroma of this designer, But It is fresh and innovative. It´s definelity a manly original fragance for any time and place. The opening is quite herbal, but as soon is drying it become more woodden and citric as well. I just adore Man of CK. Please before you discard the decision of buying Man CK, give yourself the opportunity to try at least once this aroma.

This is cheap, synthetic and generic smelling rubbish and is worn by chavs with no class or discernible sense of smell. Steer well clear of this one. I consider myself fortunate NOT to own a bottle but unfortunate that a classless and tacky individual at work happens to spritz himself with this extract of BO when i happen to be around!

I'm big on violet, so this is pretty fantastic in some aspects. Unfortunately I have to use 6 sprays when I have excellent skin. I usually only spray fragrances 1x times or 2x if I really want to project out. If the initial blast could last longer it would be better. Lot of eastern smells going on, and I can get a lot of compliments in the dry down, again if I use a lot of it. Without showering in it, nobody can smell it, including myself.
This is average woody cologne. Nothing special.

My first thought was "Nothing special"; a basic woody fragrance which suits me for everyday wear to the office. I have to spray LOTS on and still the sillage is quite weak and I struggle to smell the dry-down after lunch time! Everyone thinks its "nice" which is good if you like to blend in and wear "nice" things; I prefer something more individual and unique myself! :). Oh, it was a gift froim Mum on the recommendation of the sales clerk at the local discount chemist store, so I'm actually quite surprised and pleased all at the same time.. Thanks Mum! :-)

It's nice and it lasts long. But it's very musky and spicy. Don't buy if you don't like musky smells. For me it is smells too much like a 30/40 year old man. And i'm only 20. I got this as a gift and it was a very thoughtful gift :) but just not really me. I'll use it for college till it runs out :)

CK Man is an olfactory essay on modern masculines since 1985, circa Green Irish Tweed & Cool Water, up through Fahrenheit, and on into the nineties with things like Sport Field and Green Valley. See another common theme here? They're all GREEN. And so is Man. It opens with a peppery violet leaf and bay combination, which rapidly (within five minutes) segues into an herbal/nutmeg-infused hawthorn accord not far removed from Fahrenheit's, but less tarry. Violet notes compliment the hawthorn with a strong sweetness that pervades the moderate, five-six hour lifespan of this scent. But underlying everything is clean, soapy freshness, a bit watery and wan. One of the better CK fragrances, surprisingly lacking airtime with aficionados, although I guess when you consider that it assembles aspects of superior fragrances without adding anything new, there's not much else to talk about here. Still, if you want something crisp and pleasant in the GIT/Fahrenheit axis, this is something you should try.
Great fragrance, longevity and projection are average. Perfect for a date.
Ow, guys, I bought it myself! I smell spicy sweet herbs, and sometimes I feel the smell of machine oil. Resistance is rather weak.
It is another CK, I mean, nothing special, it smells cheap fragrance. It is not for me...

Fresh, sweet and green and quite pleasant. Comes in a masculine heavy square bottle. Staying power and sillage are only moderate. The violet note predominates and it's a little like Paul Smith Men but less sweet. It's nothing mind blowing but I like CK Man. I was a bit disappointed with this coz it's quite weak. Better off with Paul Smith Men.
بوی خیلی خوبی داره. یه جورایی خاصه. اما ماندگاریش خیلی کمه. در حد 2-3 ساعت. ضمنا پخش بوش هم ملایمه و کسی رو آزار نمیده. عمدتا مورد پسند همه قرار می گیره
reminds me of dior fahrenheit

It's opening consists of two parts: first part is a fresh icy minty one and the other is warmer and sort of musky-incense-y. Unfortunately on my skin the two parts don't provide a harmonious scent; even in dry down!

I guess they wanted to create a contrast between these two parts and make it the second Fahrenheit! By the way it has traces of Fahrenheit in it, most probably because of the contrast between cold and warm; and violet note!

My brother got it as a gift and interestingly the problem is a lot milder for him! It projects a nice scent on his skin, but nothing special or groundbreaking.

Not a bad choice for daily wear in the colder weather, even though I expected a lot more from something bearing the name 'Calvin Klein Man!'

It has good longevity and projection and overall gets 4 out of 10 IMO.

A VERY strong and spicy scent. Great longevity and projection. I used it as an evening scent when going out, it's too dark and spicy for an everyday scent in my opinion. It's actually so strong, I have had the same 50ml bottle of it for literally YEARS and I'm only now beginning to finish it!
Very Strong Notes
Boring line of fragrance from Calvin Klein once more, this is Budget, synthetic rubbish.

This is an ok fragrance. At first I really didnt like it but it's warming up to me a little bit, as in I wont throw it away. The scent is at it's best when first applied. It reminds me of something I smelled in the 90's, very spring like scent. On the dry down it seems to completely mimic CK Euphoria, which I hate. I think MAN is not MANLY enough, meening it is too floral. If they took away the violet and put maybe something like leather or more cedar it would be better. The longevity is ok, and silage ok. Overall this would get a 6/10 from me. I will wear it to work and super casual events and thats about it.
Too spicy and bit strong. But good choice for spicy Lovers. Long Lasts good. Projection very good. I dont like because its too spicy.

If it was 1987 now, I would say it is one of the best scents ever. But in 1988 Fahrenheit came out and there is no place for the obvious copies on my shelf.
I will consider it only if Dior discontinues Fahrenheit...never I hope.

EDIT...since my firs review I started to like this perfume more and more to the point where I bought it

EDIT 2...I changed my mind about this one again :) I swear if you take violet away and put little bit more woods/pepper this is Gucci por Homme. Actualy I think this is lighter and softer version of GpH. I still like the original Gucci better, but i think CK Man can be worn in more situations. The longer I have it more I like it.
بویه تلخ ولی دوست داشتنی ای داره.برازنده آقایان.اکثراه خانوما ازش خوششون میاد.اصلا آزار دهنده نیست.خیلی ملایم و رمانتیک
I am not a fan of CK but this one is original. It is fresh yet masculine. It strays away from all the aquatics out there so for summer its perfect and you won't smell like everyone else

Perfume absolutely wonderful.
It smells wonderfully well.
It is certainly one of my favorite perfumes.
The longevity and projection are impressive.
And to top it off, a perfume is something unique.
What more can you ask for in a perfume?

There is always a level of snobbery in the fragrance community, so something so mass market like CK is not going to get much recognition. To me this is one of my favorite releases from them. To a perfume collector this is not going to be anything revolutionary, but for me its a good overall smell. Its fresh, its sharp, and its versatile.

I get a lot of violet in it and I am a fan of violet. I have gotten a lot of compliments wearing this and most girls dig the scent for sure. Its a very violet, slightly minty/incensey vibe that is fresh but robust enough to be all season in my opinion. Longevity for my particular bottle is decent. No worse than most other fragrances in my collection. However, a lot of people complain about longevity. Not sure if it has to do with how bargain bin frags are stored or what the case is. I might have gotten lucky with my bottle. Anyway.. I think this scent is a great everyday frag for the average person.

I think this one is nothing special to write home about. Initial burst of scent is nice but it dissapears so quickly . I also find it quite synthetic and it smells liek so many other cheap fragrances out there . Even when I spray the fragrance on it seems to be quite watery pehaps due to the lack of oils in the composition .

I wouldnt buy this one again .

pfuhhh! Smell's like a cheap deostick from the supermarket, for example - The Green Malizia Vetiver Deodorant with the price - 2 Euro.

I'm totally disappoint!

From 1 to 10 --> 2 points!
i love it when i smell it on my husband. its so man-like. absolutely favorite. this smell make me feel safe.
Calvin Klein MAN is one of the best fragrances that is perfect to work or go out at night. Is soft, masculine and the lasting power is good.

Bergamot, Mandarin orange and Amber give this a very spicy feel which may not be appealing to some people, In my opinion this one is a nice break from super sweet scents which are quite popular around here.
Negative with this are moderate sillage and poor lasting power.
Scent score 7/10.

I really like Man. To me, it has a sweet, bananary body, fruity, not citruses, but Instead, banana and a berry. I don't know what in the pyramid is causing it, but it's really nice.
I would have jumped on this so hard, had I the spare money, but now I realize I'm getting Euphoria, so will have to test for similarity because I'm pressure I categorize them very similarly.

Calvin Klein Man is actually pretty nice but it smells a bit like a few fragrances that I already own. At the beginning, it smells similar to Mont Blanc Exceptionnel Homme (orangey, herbs, and woody notes). It's not as sharp and strong like Exceptionnel, so it's easier to wear, in my opinion. In addition, it never gets spicy on me like Exceptionnel. To make it more interesting, I smell a small trace of coffee here. I must be out of my mind.

Then it becomes oriental/amber-like sweet like Halston Amber Man. Actually I smell something like tobacco'ish scent that reminds me of tobacco blossom in Graphite Blue by Liz Clairborne. Mixing in a sexy sweet musky base note, I am liking this one more and more. Unfortunately, I own other fragrances that I mentioned earlier, there is no point for me to get Calvin Klein Man... Well, unless I find one at a really good bargain, then maybe... :)

BTW, it lasts about 6-8 hours on me.

This become my New Signature scent, Bergamot n Rosemary Dominates the Top notes that last for couple minutes, it clean, fresh n off course spicy .. if U like Bvlgari Aqva , U definitely would like This one, worth try even I disappoint with the longetivity
I don't like this. Too spicy on my skin, and low sillage. 4/10.
I find this very refreshing at first but does tend to fade. Dont get me wrong it still hangs about you in a fresh kind of way.

only smells clean and fresh, but doesnt last long, watery and shallow.....
can't buy!

After a half an hour somewhat transparent fruity note came out in the background which surprised me.

Drydown is unambiguously incense with guaiacwood,but they are not harsh just mildly smokey-woody sweet.

Perfect office wear and wearable in any season, for any occasion.4,5*

This EDT has too spicy notes of entry, like their middle notes are spices very marked, it seems a dominant anise scent of incense. Base notes almost identical but more pronounced anise.

In general I feel that dominates the aroma as "a jar of spices." The smell has a strange effect on smell, as if the aroma of a sudden explode and disappear, and reappear intermittently. A preference for older men aroma. Situations professional interest only, no fun or romantic notes. Duration of 6 hours on my skin.

Very nice scent. i bought it in Nigeria. A blind buy but i really love it.fruity spicy fresh & manly. it is not bad as people said here. Girls love it on me. Silage is average, longevity = 8hrs
Very versatile,comfortable,non offensive & so unique. v.good for summer. the mid notes is top of the class,aquatic spicy, nothing like it. really wish there is intense version of it.
would definitely buy another.

Rating:
