Scent Quality: 8/10
Longevity: 6hr

Edit: dont understand why people dont really like this, its a very high quality perfum.
it's ordinarily sweet-fruity-fresh and it doesn't really stand out in the crowd.

Nothing special. It smell kind of minty-spicy on my skin. Moderate sillage and 7+ hours on my skin. Non offensive fragrance but there are better choices in this category (Terre d'Hermes, Dirty English, Viktor+Rolf Antidote) IMO. 7/10
all i can smell is musk and bergamot. wake up CK. this is year 2k and you bring us back to 80's? ridiculous. even Ted by Ted Lapidus is way better than this.

i like this scent very masculine, but not in the overdone musky-woody way. it's a strictly fall-winter/cold day scent for me.

never wear this in a hot day. i made a mistake doing so in a hot morning, it was a nightmare day for me. it was to strong for my nose, it made me so dizzy & vomity. so beware. keep it for the cold days or better yet nights. that's why i wonder why the setting for ck man's ad is a man in a desert.

Hmm, this one is interesting: Not only does the name make it look like a definite statement, not only does the bottle have a classic look to it - from the first moment on this one appeared to me as already being around forever. Almost an instant classic.

****

I hate to disagree I wear this everywhrer and the ladies love it . Not everyone can where a scent and expect it to smell good on you> Our bodies are all different so something that smells bad on someone else might be the bomb on you> you need to find your niche

Versatile and comfortable, is not so bad ! why people ? ck is no like 90s ok, but with MAN the brand tried to make a simple semi spicy-fruity base with a little woody touch, for day or night, warm or cold weather, this harmonize great..

What is going on with CK fragrances? They are all average quality and extremely synthetic. I will never let this thing touch my skin.Irritates and reddens my dark skin which tolerated any fragrance until those CK's.

well...
some of you says that this is Spicy! I Agree...

but for me, its so tasty! -as additional-

Warm, gentle, and suitable for those who love to show off!
It is a very nice smelling cologne. It is minty and has a uniqueness to it. It isnt those everyday colognes and smells very different from others. Its very nice and i would definetly buy another

Its a nice combo. Somehow sensual and gains attractiveness but frankly if you want to go for CK MAN dont even think to buy anyother CK fragrance, it is absolutely positive that these fragrances are all alike at some stage. EUPHORIA and specially EUPHORIA INTENSE.. i have applied and what came in my mind was CK MAN, exactly DITTO.

i regret paying those dollars to an ordinary fragrance. this has a great opening like other CK fragrances, but becomes a huge disappointment in just minutes.
Ck's always attract me with their fabulous opening but fade away to nothing!

I agree with chocolateguy... What's wrong with Calvin Klein? Ever since they sold their fragrance division to Unilever Cosmetics then Coty Prestige, their fragrances lost its desirability. Take Euphoria for Women (smells like granny's perfume) and the In2U series for example, they are all horrid! They have never come up with a successor to Eternity whose longevity in the market is admirable. They came up with Eternity for Men Summer but they only ended up destroying the name by coming up with a cheap-smelling, common and run-of-the-mill scent.

It starts out as a nice, fresh, but manly fragrance, a soft, peppermint fragrance. But after about 2-3 hours it is not much worth mentioning, it has almost disappeared and is very faint. Calvin Klein Euphoria Intense is SOOOO MUCH Better and much longer lasting..... save your money on "Man", it's a let down.
It is not groundbreaking, but it is very nice! Silage and staying power are average.
2 Light! Smell ok but not powerful... and not so intens either!
Crave, Euphoria, In2U, and now, Man. What's wrong with Ck perfumes thesedays? Some's boring, some can make you vomit. I really miss the wonderful Obsession, One, or Eternity.
I love it on my husband; it makes him smell clean, spicy and very appealing indeed ;)
It smells just like every other men's fragrance. But it's a nice every-day-scent.

Possibly my favorite CK aside from Reveal. Definitely my favorite CK one. The musky and woodsy undertones add a soft weight to it that makes it excellent imo. It feels fuller, rounder, and smoother than the other iterations. Great juice
Very nice fragrance. Has a lemon soda vibe. Fresh, aquatic, a bit sweet. Perfect for summer and really unisex.

I love the original CK One; easy to wear, refreshing, cheap, timeless.

But some of the flankers haven't been as good.

I'm pleased to say this is fantastic. Green tea and lemon; you'll feel uplifted wearing it. There's other notes going on here that are not listed; there's a tropical note giving this even more personality.

Longevity and projection are very good - surprising for CK One I know - I could smell it on my clothes the next day.

I have received compliments already just from a few days wear.

Cheap as well so overspray if you're not getting the desired longevity; you'll not overwhelm anyone as it's a light fragrance.

It does lean slightly feminine - which I prefer - but anyone could wear this.

9/10

Reminds me of the iced green tea from Lipton, very simple and clean scent.

However the longevity and sillage are horrible... I spray this about 7-8 times and it barely lasts an hour.

Considering its price point as well (~$20), overall this fragrance is just adequate.

This is a good fragrance to spritz on in the summer 🌞 when your running errands or just chilling out with friends or family. I purchased this fragrance a while ago at a rack store for 20.00 and I really like the simplicity of CK One reflections. Longevity and projection are good for me and I love wearing this to work because it is so inoffensive and pleasant smelling.

Disappointed in this, very synthetic and feminine leaning. Longevity is lackluster; save your money and buy CK One Essence instead, it's a superior fragrance on all fronts, even the original CK one is superior to reflections.
I have to say, the scent is so good, but the performance is the worst I have ever experienced. With twenty sprays, it barely reaches a foot of projection and dissapears after an hour or two.

CK One fragrances have always felt like women's scents to me, they don't work well on a man's skin.Reflections is one of the best in the series.Tea,ice,lemon,ginger.A very pleasant feminine fragrance.

To answer dusty memphis comment.
You need body heat to dissipate the various notes with a fragrance. The perfume notes don't dissipate well on clothing. Fragrance isn't bad for you either , the fragrance standard agency has banned a lot of harmful ingredients.
Fragrance is meant to be used on skin. Not clothing unless you want stained clothes with the fragrance oil
good opening meh dry down

This is a great summer fragrance. It's fresh and citrusy with a hint of green, and there's a touch of floral even though there aren't any floral notes, making it a simple, inoffensive choice. Perfect for school or work, but not for special occasions. Longevity is just average, typical for CK fragrances. Think of it as a white T-shirt and jeans kind of scent. If you're looking for something simple for summer days or evenings, this is a great option. 6/10.

I went into a store to try this since I heard good things and in theory I like all the notes, but I end up not liking it at all. I was really disappointed, I wouldn't blind buy this, felt the same vibes as Escentric 01, where all the notes make sense but the blend doesn't work for my nose, smelled like cardboard on strip and like old rag on skin. Glad I didn't blind buy it.
3/10

Very fresh, pleasant and not at all sharp.

It starts with a fresh lemon that doesn't bother the nose, slightly sweet, like lemonade.Then a green note comes out, but fresh, not sweet.

It lasts quite a while on my skin, even longer on clothes. But it doesn't project much (which for me is ideal.)

It is wonderful in the summer here in Chile, since the sweetness it has is very natural, nothing heavy or honeyed, literally the smell of a lemonade with sugar and ice, so it benefits from the rich aroma of lemon but without that sharp part that bothers the nose that other lemony perfumes have.
I really like this scent but the longevity is really poor
Smells like cough drops I hate it it’s redundant to a bunch of other ones like summer daze and a little bit of everyone edt

Very very fresh, like rain and first snow. My absolutely favorite fresh fragrance. Doesn't have the disturbing cucumber undertone in it.

Unfortunately it gives me allergic skin rash, so I'm not able to use it anymore (add a crying emoji).

A very successful virgin mojito scent. Although it is a perfume that you cannot get enough of, with its light sweetness and intense citrus and mint touches, it is mediocre in terms of performance. If only it had a more lasting and long-lasting scent, then it would be indispensable.
Smells like orange Fanta

The first 2 minutes of this are refreshing citrus spice with some sort of limey-tropical fruit accord.
After 2 minutes, it becomes a familiar musk with just a smidge of Ck One. Airy, slightly effervescent citrus. Then it's gone after an hour.
Budget version of Santa Maria Novella Cinquanta
It’s an ok perfume, nothing special about it and more like a skin scent
For a CK fragrance, this one really lasts a long time, but is immediately intimate. But the scent reminds me at first like a toilet cleaner and at the end it smells very powdery.
feels a bit bubblegummy to my nose after some minutes

Opens fresh with a uplifting grapefruit note.

It then becomes fruitier with some tropical notes followed by an orange-citrus aroma, possibly mandarin?

It has an airy, tonic quality and becomes sweet and a little watery.

The base is a light, clean musk, familiar to the line.

Good for both men and women, summer is where it'll work best, daytime.

Good for all ages really.

Performance is not massive, projection ok for the first hour, then fading to a skin scent. The skin scent isn't much more than a faint, fruity musk, but this does linger for a good while.
Fresh, citrusy pleasant scent. Very summery. Definitely unisex.

Almost a like, but not quite.

Opening is good. Refreshing enough, but the dry down isn't so lovely.

It's chemical, faint, blurry, musky (but not powdery), and, strangely enough, a little salty on my skin. Longevity is nowhere to be found and the same can be said with sillage.

The irony is the scent is completely gone from my skin within 90 minutes. I don't think this is even worth $10 given how terrible and mediocre this performs; there are other CK fragrances out there that deserve higher ratings, but this one's 4+ stars on Fragrantica does surprise me.

Mediocrity in a bottle.

Calvin Klein cK One Reflections for whatever reason skipped the typical Calvin Klein release schedule. Instead of being in department stores to start off, they release them into discounters and rack stores first. Honestly considering the fact Calvin Klein fragrances flood those, I think it should be their release strategy going forward. Also considering typical Calvin performance, that is a good thing. I disagree with another reviewer about Calvin Klein fragrances and not just in the cK One line (or line extensions like cK Be, cK2, cK All and cK Everyone), many suffer from performance issues.

cK One Reflections opens with a blast of iced lemon and ginger. You get some tea from the mid giving it a bit of an Arnold Palmer vibe. The ice notes continue on into the mid with the existing tea note. The base is not that noticeable for whatever reason. I get vibes from a few other cK one flankers with Reflections. I mostly get a mix of cK One Summer Daze (minus the cumquat) and cK Everyone. Due to cK Everyone smelling like cK Summer 2019, I get that too. That isn't a bad thing. Honestly, I like this more than Everyone like I do with Summer 2019.

cK One Reflections lasts about four hours on my skin. It isn't a strong projecting fragrance but it is pretty good none the less. Good for spring and summer, especially as a gym scent. It is rather unisex. I don't think it is feminine or masculine.

Calvin Klein cK One Reflections I rate a 7.1 out of 10. I happen to enjoy cK One Summer 2019 more. This is good if you want to replace that or your bottle of Everyone without going to the EDP.

I have to wonder if people just automatically judge CK as being weak because this one (and many others), at least on my skin is anything but, especially for this type of 'warm weather' scent!

Quite long-lasting and with decent sillage. Alas, the scent itself isn't really my cup of tea (as I get a lemongrass vibe similar to CK Everyone EDT, which I'm not too keen on ) but it does smell good and of decent quality (it doesn't smell 'cheap'). It is one of those scents that might grow on me with repeated wear. Smells nothing like the original CK One to me but as I hinted at it's very similar to CK Everyone EDT but with an added refreshing coolness.

Very fresh, musky, clean, and green! There is a nice aquatic note in the background along with a wonderful tea aroma. This is definitely a safe grab for when you just want to smell clean. Would be a perfect, non-offensive work fragrance. I can definitely see this as a unisex scent.

This is so gorgeous- I don’t care who you are- your nose can’t disagree with the sparkling fruity freshness of this green tea fragrance! There are unlisted fruits snuck in here. Something in here is tropical fruity but subtle. Ice twice but no fruits but lemon listed. Ha
Drinkable and cooling like a tropical green iced tea. When spraying, I make sure I hit my shirt too.
Very light musky but still crisp and cool in drydown, even though muted 4 hrs later…
Weather report here says 106 in a week. Lord help me and you know I’ll be using this.
Put this out on the bathroom counter for friends and family in the summer heat and enjoy the compliments! 💦 💦🍋🍃 whoosh
I don’t think anyone is expecting more than eau de cologne strength from a CK one type these days, are they? $20 at Burlington- winner 👏🏼
I like it. Unisex. Easy to wear casual summer day scent. Fresh, but at the same time a bit sweet.

Good fragrance to splash on if you want to smell clean. Nothing great or bad about this fragrance and at the price point of 20$ I'm not mad at all. I use this fragrance for work and when I'm fresh out of the shower 🚿 and I'm laying around my house. I layer this with a citrus body oil and a citrus body spray to help push the longevity. Good grab & go freshie👍🏾.

The opening is nice for like 10 minutes. It’s basically just the original CK1, but kinda smells like someone put one spray of Erba Pura in the bottle to give it a little extra nondescript fruitiness. Projection is about 30 minutes then it dries down to a soft musky skin scent with some soapy-ness.

This is not worth buying unless you don’t already own a CK1 flanker. But I’d recommend the original or Ck All over this one.

The opening on this is really nice, fruity and fresh.

I see other comments mention it being on the feminine side and the dry down on this definitely goes in that direction as it does feel a little overly floral but the opening is great and that part is unisex for sure.

I've sampled lots of ck one flankers and this was the only one I was in any way remotely tempted to buy. If you had a slot for a casual daily summer scent this would make a great purchase.

Similar to the original CK One, yet more fresh than citrus. To me it leans a bit fem, and as it’s a CK One summer scent, not much development. What you get in the initial spray is what you’re going to have for the next 3 hours or so.
Actually projects pretty decent for the first 30-45min and then sits close to the skin.

I like it, for $20, definitely. It’s a nice, uplifting scent that can be worn with ease. Also, definitely one I can share with the wife, she may get more use out if it than me.

Just bought a bottle at the airport. Had no intention of buying anything at all, but after trying the sample, I instantly decided to make a purchase. Even made a sniff comparison with the original cK One; this one stands out a bit.

The fresh, citrusy vibe is very much what I need during this super hot weather. Some may say it smells quite soapy & tangy, but I think it's the type that calms you down. Neither provocative nor attention seeking, just nice to be noticeable. After 15 minutes of testing it out in the sun, I could feel the subtle woody second layer evaporating to balance the tangy opening. However, I doubt the sillage of this one would be very far reaching.

Highly recommended for young guys who are searching for a perfume to wear with their pineapple Hawaii shirt and bermuda, sipping tropical punch by the beach bar.

4.5 out of 5 for me.

This is son fresh and summery.
It is 100% summer in a bottle. You spray this on yourself and you feel free and fun, really careless and reminds me of lemony jhin tonic with tea and ginger, in the best possible way!

Es un perfume que cumple.
Fresco e ideal para primavera verano.
Huele muy fresco y quizás esa nota de hielo-mentol es lo que hace la magia.
No es novedosa y de hecho se parece mucho a la CK One original, sin embargo en aspectos de longevidad y estela, es un poco mejor este flanker. Y en cuanto a aroma, hay una nota frutal tropical que siento que no está declarada, pero que la hace un pelin diferente.
Waste of time and too feminen smell like hand cream
This is feminine, conjuring images of womens schampoo. How people smell any masculinity in this are beyond me. A nice smell overall but nothing that excited me.

Ice Ice Woodsy
Ice Ice Woodsy
Ice Ice Woodsy
Ice Ice Woodsy

One of the best smelling perfumes I've smelt. Smelt it in a perfume store today and it was amazing! First thought I actually only smelt mango.. Which is actually not listed but I swear to god this is like a mango juice perfume.

Scent 10/10

The fragrance contains a lit if menthol- this gives the icy touch. However, mint is not listed in the notes. Very close to the original one and TBH I need to stop buying the summer editions every year - they are not worth it.
Would suggest getting the original CK ONE

I don't always want to be comforted by the original CK One, so Reflections provides a familiar but new experience of clean for those who enjoy the Calvin Klein subtlety. It's delicious all the way through, and it would cause me to think well of anyone who uses it. Fantastic for smelling on clothing. Dirty or complex is antithetical to this aesthetic.

Crispy. Tropical. One of the best they have done for hot weather. An electric ⚡️ tropical fruit slushie. I agree with the review below, there are ghost rhubarb and guava notes that actually sit front and center. The pyramid and breakdown is misleading. Feels super familiar if you know this lineup, like CK Summer 2019, 2021 & 2022 all mixed together. No menthol here for me, works wonderfully with my body chemistry. After a run with this on I smelled of Juicy Fruit.

UPDATE 8/17/23:

It's great still. The only thing it may be guilty of is being a little too derivative of the former versions. Don't get me wrong, I'm loving their beverage-inspired summer releases. I just sort of wish for CK to go off the rails and surprise us for once with the annual release.

It's basically CK One topped with huge amounts of pink grapefruit/guava/rhubarb and pineapple ingredients that gives a fizzy sparkling and sweet tropical soda effect. I can't detect any ginger but there's limonene lemon vibe that can be passed as ginger here. As mentioned by some others, menthol freshness is there too. I feel like marketing teams often try to come up with less common or trending notes and here is a very good example. The last decade can be marked with "as little notes as possible" era in perfumery. I mean look at CK One and now this, but if you check the formulas I bet they share at least 50%. And how in the world grapefruit, guava, rhubarb not mentioned is beyond me.

You can also safely assume all the notes your nose have registered from CK One can be found here. That fresh floral body lotion-ish drydown of CK One will be what you are getting.

It's a playful and tropical juicy twist, a good flanker and for 30 eur no one can complain. There are so-called niche houses that would shove this for 100+.
A very fresh, citrus, ginger opening. I smell some menthol aswell. As it sits on the skin, is smell a sweet guava note. The frag ends of very musky. It's not the best, but also not the worst
at first it smells fresh like a mojito but on my skin it turns musty/sweaty :(

Citrus notes and ginger are main players here. I feel some lime rather than lemon. It is a nice frech flanker. Curious about the Eternity Reflections version with absynth and chocolate notes that seems a bit more challenging.
Ice? Is that menthol?

Ice note?? Tried this on skin blind without knowing the notes, reminds me of a less citric CK Everyone with a tropical summer fruit tinge. There's the same ozonic artificial air freshener vibe that CK Everyone has. Dry-down is very fluffy musky and laundry-fresh. I'm truly surprised the notes don't mention something tropical.
What does ice even smell like? Sounds like there will be 1-2 hr of longevity?
Really interesting... ginger, lemon, tea and cold vibe ..something like iced tea maybe🤔 ? ... hopefully🤞
How the f*ck do you even have an ice note?
This , in my opinion, sounds really quite nice, quite cool. Will absolutely try to grab for the Summer of 2023.
@thomkallor - Yes, this is this years CK One Summer 2023. CK will also release two new ‘Eternity Reflections which is the Summer 2023 releases.

Alright stop, macerate and listen
Ice is back with a brand new invention

Mid note: ice, I can tell right away, without even smelling it, that with a note like that longevity is non-existant :))))) Just put some mint and lemon slices in water for an hour and you get ck fragrance :)))
Does this replace the Summer 2023 edition?

This is a really nice, everyday scent. It’s like one of those traditional “aftershaves” that your dad used to slap on his cheeks at the end of his shave. Very gentle and manly smelling. I think anyone could wear it if you want a fresh and clean smell.
I have this perfume, it's fragrance is really awesome
If you don't want to offend anybody, wear it. It's fresh but has no longevity and projection. You're not going to be noticed unless the person gets really close to you.
Very pleasant fresh scent for summer day time but quite weak.. CK could be among the best houses if they could make their scents a little stronger..

To be honest I really like this fragrance. In my opinion it's better smelling then azzaro chrome but lacks the quality. The longevity is extremely poor with a minor sillage. I wear this to school quite often but I always take a small bottle of this(5ml) so I apply it after every hour or so. As far as compliments I get some only when people hug me right after I've applied this scent. Hope there's gonna be a good reformulation.
I owned a tester bottle, and it was free. Free of scent is more like it, you f'ing kiddin' me? CK fragrance is now f***ed up, I'll never buy them again. Shame, it smelled nice though.
Put few drops on. Smells absolutely amazing. I love it. Scent completely disappeared after 30 minutes......
Avoid! Avoid !! Avoid !!!

This scent lacks in everything!! I even wrote a letter to Calvin Klein and they in turn forward the letter to Coty which is the company that makes this garbage. Can you believe that Coty had the nerve to tell me that their fragrances have about 2 year shelf life in one sentence then in the next tell me "but our fragrances don't actually have an expiration date". Well which is in Coty? Bottom line Coty would not accept any responsibility for this terrible creation and neither would Calvin Klein! AVOID this one!!

This scent lacks projection, but it turned into a skin scent that lasted on my wrist for 7 hours in testing. I quite like the scent, and would describe it as a Lite version of Azzaro Chrome. It could be very useful when one wants to wear a subtle scent that doesn't annoy anybody. I've added it to my meagre collection of such scents (which includes Bvlgari PH and F Ferragamo).
Regards.
horrible... The moment I sprayed it on I was searching for notes... It's that much light... I guess it does smell like water!
this perfume i use to spray on my bed only

It's a cheerful mix of citrus (more pineapple than manderin) water notes, and mint - a lot like Lacoste Essential Sport. I rarely find men's colognes cheerfully sweet, but this one is. Another good thing is it's not medicinal like the regular CK Free.

i want 2 believe this perfume is a prank.i tried my best 2 get a scent at d perfume shop and it was like water.dis is truly watery.i believe most people just post comments in order 2 feel they know....cos i didnt smell wot u guys r talking about,what a tragic glass of water
is it categorized as "men"? I thought it was unisex..
It barely lasted on my skin for 20 minutes. Longevity... what longevity?. You are getting a very expensive bottle of water basically, which you can't drink.

Agree with Antonpan, it is 99% similar to Azzaro Chrome, except it is really weaker version! Sharp lemon citrus at first blast for about 10 plus minutes, and then pretty linear for the rest of the notes of a very mild herb + floral scent, in facts is too light until you need to sniff 2 or 3 times to get the notes, mind you - extremely weak, 1 hour after applying it, I can't barely detect any trace of it, projection is nothing, superb diluted poor quality fragrance, the ads does give you some hints, it is very water-y! But not aquatic scent!

Very disappointed with this one, CK Free already a weak one, this is even weaker for the same price, where is the CK frag that we used to know?

Another one "modern" advent of Azzaro Chrome (and apparently of the regular cK one). CK Free Blue is much, much lighter than Chrome, without metallic notes, but at the same time it has an awful longevity and average sillage.

product_name: Eternity 25th Anniversary Edition for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Listen man, for that price point, specially if you can get it on a discount, it's a decently good fragrance for the gym or after a shower, you will smell good, not bad, not amazing, just good enough to stand out from anyone not wearing a fragrance I guess, this isn't a compliment getter though if thats what you're here for.

product_name: Eternity 25th Anniversary Edition for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This fragrance is the smell of the 90's for me. Its the reason why i bought this anniversary edition; pure nostalgia. It doesn't disappoint either; it smells exactly as i remember it smelling. I love to wear it during warm summer days, the heat seems to make it project better. I would class this fragrance as having moderate longevity and silage becoming a skin scent after about four hours. I think i will always have a bottle of CK Eternity in my collection. Its what i think is a classic summer daytime fragrance in a bottle that also looks classy/unique. I'm off now, to continue my 90's nostalgia by listening to Pulp's Different Class album.

product_name: Eternity 25th Anniversary Edition for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I am wearing both, well just 2 spritzes of this one to compare it with the regular Eternity. I think they smelled basically the same I just found a little more intense settle down in the skin from this anniversary version, maybe because is newer and my big bottle from the regular version is about 3 years old or 4, not sure. But I think this fragrance remains in the top classics from Ck and still can be considered as a modern easy to wear fragrance.

product_name: Eternity 25th Anniversary Edition for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This frag is underrated one. My ex-girlfriend liked it over Bleu de Chanel. I think the bottle design well shows how this smells like. Some spicy and glittering(?) scents have been added to the original eternity. It is like Aromatic scent+Abecrombie Pierce.

product_name: Eternity 25th Anniversary Edition for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Substantially the same as standard edition Eternity. Does seem a bit lighter in terms of longevity and projection than standard. Bottle is interesting - "see-through" silver. May be worth a buy if you had Eternity in the past and want a relatively cheap trip down memory lane.

product_name: Eternity 25th Anniversary Edition for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: did they alter the original fragrance of the classic in this anniversary edition?

product_name: Eternity 25th Anniversary Edition for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Ok tested this today.. Very good a fresher citrus top version of the original eternity

product_name: Eternity 25th Anniversary Edition for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Is there any differences between this and the normal ck eternity ?

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2016 Calvin Klein
review_content: This was love at first sniff many years ago. Compliments galore. Smells great off the skin. Strong and piercing. Discontinued getting harder to find

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2016 Calvin Klein
review_content: The best eternity summer!!!! Smell like sea salt, lime, amber and coriander... heavy coriander.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2016 Calvin Klein
review_content:
Got a decant of this. I like it but after wearing it for a couple of days it I just didn't love it. Don't get me wrong this is a good scent. But started to sorta make me a little sick by the end of the day when wearing it.

On me this is a sweet type of fragrance. Definitely unisex. Fruity and very pleasing. But a whole day of this got to me a little. However I would recommend this one for anyone looking for a summer scent.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2016 Calvin Klein
review_content:
Bought this blind based on the praise but unfortunately was a scrubber for me.

I got a very light aquatic base with a lot of florals on top. Didn't really detect much citrus. A very boring fragrance for me and quickly started to bother me.

I didn't care for CK One Summer '14 and really disliked this one. I like Eternity Aqua but these CK summer flankers aren't working out for me.

Update: Tried it again to be sure. The florals in this are just stomach turning for me.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2016 Calvin Klein
review_content:
I finally got the scent that i ever wanted before.....
After a long journey i have found it atlast
Very nice smell and lost lasting scent

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2016 Calvin Klein
review_content:
Finally own a bottle! But it really smells like masculine version of Oxygen by Lanvin.... Hmmmm loads of flowers!

2017: WOAH! Long lasting on my husbands skin and projects well on him. Three sprays in the morning at around 7am and gets home at 8pm and it still smells fresh.

On my skin, I only get an hour or two.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2016 Calvin Klein
review_content:
Such a fantastic smell!

A blast of fruitiness & freshness that drys down to the iconic CK Eternity smell with an aquatic & fruity twist.

One of the best & true "summer" fragrances.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2016 Calvin Klein
review_content: Stunning! A Summer flanker with a great structure and an amazing drydown. Certainly the best Summer designer fragrance since Kenzo Homme Fresh from 2006 & Cerruti 1881 Eau Fraiche from 2007! This is well thought through, well crafted & blended and I got a compliment 5 minutes after application from the very first person I met. At the initial spray you could say its nothing more than a nice citrus juice but the further the dry down goes the more herbal it gets maintaining a yummy exotic vibe without becoming sweet or generic. Brilliant job!

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2016 Calvin Klein
review_content:
I don't give this a high rating because of its sense of adventure or unique, surprising artistic freedom, but rather because it captures the scent of a summer cologne so perfectly. It has the sea salt and aquatic character that one would anticipate, but it has a wonderfully dialed-up, tart citrus that lasts much longer than I expected.
I'm new to perfumery (in a passionate, researching sense), so it's possible I love this because there's more to learn. But I haven't bought an actual department store bottle in a long time, and this was worth it!

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2016 Calvin Klein
review_content: Eternity summer for men 2016 had me begging for more after one spray!! I haven't fell in love with a fragrance this quickly since I was introduced to the original GIO sometime ago .. Eternity summer is truly summer in a bottle , felt like I was walking through a garden of flowers freshly bloomed followed by the unforgettable scent of spring rain

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2016 Calvin Klein
review_content: I tried a spritz yesterday (this lady was spraying anyone at Macy's) I must say it smells really nice! It lasts a long while as well. Very "masculine" citrusy, but some other note that I can't pinpoint dominates...
So fresh! Will definitely buy a second bottle!
Started like summer in a bottle, however within 3 hours, medical musk prevailed. Also citrus became overpowering, so it ended up smelling like most summer fragrances - fresh, clean and sporty.
Stregata da questo Summer 2010. Devo prendere gli ultimi 2 pezzi in circolazione...

It's a softer version of DKNY Be Delicious... simple and clean enough for me to want to wear to work...

Edit: Kinda boring.
Yes..I agree...a lighter version of Moment. A very nice, safe, etc. fragrance..for those who like to blend in and not stand out. ;-P

This is a very pleasant, non offensive perfume. I agree with this fragrance being described as "safe".

It's feminine, clean, and fresh (without strong citrus notes or extreme green notes).

If you want a nice light summer perfume without tropical fruits a super aquatic scent this one is for you.

Just don't count on it lasting more than 30min.

Unlike original, Eternity Summer is pink scent. Not kind of girly scents which are sugared and imposed. Summer is calm and gentle floral. I followed the peony and lily of the valley from the very first notes playing in citric air. Even though at the moments I had a felling that this is boring perfume, from the underlying creamy musk I could read the Eternity signature. And this made me see summer edition in new and improved light.

Summer is likable, not long lasting, cheerful perfume. Good chances are that many people will like this as well wearing and smelling on others.

I don’t think that any Eternity edition came no way near to original`s beauty.

Yes, for me also it's similar to Eternity Moment.
But quite weak, didn't smell much of it (only some citruses and peony), until the musk appeared in the drydown ...
Nice bottle, but stying power isn't good.
lovely, lovely, lovely.. reminds me of eternity moment a bit.. staying power is great too.. I'm definitely buying this :)

Very shockingly for a summer fragrance, this is actually an eau de parfum!!
Smells wonderfully similar to the recently discontinued Premier Jour by Nina Ricci as well. Very impressed with the smell, although not entirely sold on the bottle design...
If someone has this and wanna swap - please contact me

I received a sample of this and was prepared to dislike it (not -another- cheaply mass produced musk heavy item created to capitalise on a name..). To my surprise, this one is actually quite nice. It -is-musk heavy but manages to have an original angle with the plum & wisteria notes on top of the predominantly musk base. Has a lightness/airiness to it and some interesting, slightly pungent note (perhaps the listed red pepper) which creates an interesting contrast to the softer floral plummy notes. I also pick up on the elderberry which is a nice twist. Not bad but still a mass market product.

Eternity Night reminds me a bit Cavalli Paradiso Assoluto.
Both scents contain wisteria and red pepper and this may be one of the reasons.
I must admit to this one a great tenacity, the grip on my wrists is noticeable.
Exclusive little inflated perfume, it goes well with good scents are spread this current (spring) season, imo.

Mid summer hit and humid here 2017

Wow I am really glad I got this, I blind bought, which doesn't usually work out well for me.

This is a creamy fresh warm berry floral, it may have some vanilla hidden but it's not one of those types of fragrances. not s sweet berry or sweet fruit, but that's fine with me.
It's a bit wet I guess, not dry. There might be an odd spot of rubber molecule or that could be the ( clean) shirt. Just showered.

Quite pleased with this, it's innofensive, not a real powerhouse type. I'll update when it's been on a few hours

Now this is unexpectedly nice to me and I am surprised because Jasmine and Frangipani don't usually hit me in my happy place. :) This is incredibly strong on first spray and I made the mistake of spraying once on each wrist when I was at work and was sickened by the white floral powerhouse radiating around me. This will knock you and everyone around you out if you foolishly overspray, but what I discovered is that putting it lower on my body (back of my knees) makes the radiating sillage just right. I fell so in love with this once I sprayed behind my knees and the scent started to rise up with my body heat. This is a full-bodied white floral with gentle whispers of Wisteria and Sandalwood as it starts to dry down but the Jasmine and Frangipani remain the main players throughout the life of this fragrance. I do think this fragrance is aptly named and imagine it would bloom beautifully in moderate summer evening heat, but again, restraint must be used because it is surprisingly strong.

This was on clearance so I thought I had to give it a try. This is all floral. Strong Frangipani and jasmine. I see why others smell tuberose and or gardenia. This is nothing like the original which I like more. Has a punch to your nose as far as the floral part goes...this I think I will return but I will give it a day or two or three before I decide.
ETA: I returned this. Too strong of a floral for me :/
This smells great but unfortunately the longevity is disappointing. I spray it on my sheets.
Unexpected lovely scent, so love the blend of plum aquatic notes. A little similar to the original Ck Eternity (my first perfume back in high school). So Like!Thumbs up!!!

I have been searching for a very plummy scent and now finally I found it! perfect all the way...not too sweet, not too overpowering, but not light or fresh either, just perfectly balanced. go for it if you are dying for plum in scents like me
Gardenias fighting with tuberose for the spotlight. A bit of musk, white flowers overdose, reminds me of some 80's powerhouses, like Carolina Herrera.

Lovely scent. Strangely I get tuberose, musk and aquatic notes even though tuberose and aquatics are not listed. The perfume is kind of a beachy scent and actually reminds me of Lilly Pulitzer's Beachy (blue bottle).

This is very musky and sweet, somewhat synthetic and not anything special. It is not one I will repurchase. I impulsively bought it at Ulta but mainly because I have liked other Eternity scents. Best thing about it is though is that it has great staying power.

It is nice but I don't think it is anything special!? I find it a bit sharp, and gets generic quite fast...I detect a sharp edge throughout, not sure which note it is...if I were given a bottle,I would probably wear it, but I won't buy it..just plain to my nose..or missing something!?
Lots of creamy sandalwood in this bracing white floral scent. In a certain way, it reminds me of Secret Obsession.

Urban, sweet and feminine. I have tested this a few days ago and I liked it. It is very plumy and just a little dark which makes it a good fragrance for night wear. The floral notes and the musk are well balanced, all in all - a perfume well-done that makes you feel chic without trying too hard.
I must add this has nothing to do with the original Eternity, it has it's own personality. I don't understand why people voted it to have poor longevity, on my skin and it lasted a few good hours. Definitely on my "will purchase" list.

I sprayed this on in ULTA today, and I really wasn't prepared for what I smelled. This is a fresh but heady scent: ozonic, green, aquatic, musky, and woody. It brought to mind the first, intense stirrings of adolescent lust -- seeing cute boys on the beach and daydreaming. There's a little bit of a swimming-pool smell in this perfume, in a good way.

I can add that this is my new favorite Eternity*, not that I've smelled them all, but I love the summer 2014 flanker as well as the original. I will be stalking the discount stores for Eternity Night, most definitely.

* The Night flanker doesn't smell a bit like original Eternity to me, by the way. It could easily have been marketed as a CK One flanker.

At first it was really charming! Good scent for a party - I thought. I could feel it was sparkling! But after some time it has started to be a typical nightclub scent - cool, trendy and musky.
Well, if you like this type of fragrance, you should try it. It is not typical of me.
les notes ont l'air très intéressantes impatiente de le sentir !!!!! :)
I want another bottle... One of the first bottles I bought... Back in 2010s... Nostalgic ✨

I was lucky that I got this beauty, at discounted price, too. Masculine and very elegant with great longevity, and surprisingly it is office appropriate which I appreciate. Air conditioned environment, mild cool weather and cold weather staple. It's not a beast mode and will not offend anyone, it just sticks with you and completes your elegance.

a wonderful scent still has that same intoxicating euphoria base but adds a dark smooth and sultry amber note to it along with a warm woody/oud depth. Still fresh and spicy with the aromatics and ginger, pink pepper, and sage/lavender combo but has an addicting smooth warm body. A wonderful take on the OG euphoria that I feel is perfect for winter and colder weather. Despite its deeper vibe it still is airy and light with average performance. A great pickup especially with the discounted prices widely available.

In my mind, this is the best fragrance from Calvin Klein. Sweet, peppery, dark, syrupy... If I got three wishes from a genie, one of those wishes would be to smell like this all the time.

Why did CK discontinue this wonderful scent when forgettable, generic trash heaps like CK 'Be' or CK 'One' are still in production? I know the answer, but still... Awful decision making.
Very nice scent, one of the best scents I have ever smiled but the performance is not good

One of my favorites, Its an absolute beast, Solid 8/10 for a EDT.
Great Nighttime scent

This is very similar to the now insanely overpriced Issey Miyake Nuit D'issey Pulse Of The Night, almost identical to my nose. I'm not terribly fond of either but that may just have been the combination with my skin chemistry, I can see why people would like it though.
Best cologne ever

A gingery dark ambery yet light fragrance that is subtle but very appealing the type of scent where you walk past someone and have to take a second whiff and end up having to ask "What are you wearing?"

Performance is not a beast but you do get a good 6 hour with this. Sadly with all CK line they discontinue all the gems :(

I have 50 & 100 ml sealed boxes available, can contact me here or for the fastest response my IG is :FragvistaCA and my email is Fragvista@proton.me

Bottle Design 10/10 smells like the perfume itself
Scent 10/10 smells like burnt marshmellow after the dry down
Longevity 7/10
Sillage 7/10
Overall 9/10

Really good fragrance for the price , scent is dark sweet and sexy only problem is the projection and longevity

The scent from the bottle - 10/10
Scent - 9/10
Longevity- 5.5/10
Projection- 4.5/10

Overall - 6.5/10

Very solid fragrance for the money. I wouldn't say this one is a masterpiece, but it's really solid as there's a charm to it that is hard to explain. It's quite generic but in a likable way very representative of the era when it came out. Sweet but not too sweet. Kind of get a banana smell with this one. Overall this isn't mind-blowing or anything but very likable in its own charming way. 8.5/10

I loved the original for several years. I finally got the hard-to-find Intense and was able to wear it.
It is interesting.

It retains the basil note of the original, but the pepper is gone and replaced with a melon-like note. It also contains even a black orchid-like sweetness, and the solid and bitter that was present in the original is thin.
I did not get oud on my skin. I also don't get the bitter-chocolatey stuff.
What I get on my skin is sweet melon, basil, ginger, and amber.
It's great how they created a deep sweetness and darkness without completely destroying the spiciness of the original.

If you like this,
I also recommend Pasha noir by Cartier.
I think you will like it very much.

Heads up, great sleeper Calvin Klein fragrance. Not sure what everyone is on about, but I get Oud right after the top has lifted away with ambers and woody touches. Tom Ford Oud Wood is one of my favorites, and when I don't want to apply that at $8 per spray or whatever it breaks down to, I go with the CK Oud alternative, Euphoria Intense. A rich fragrance that stays pretty simple after it dries down.

The top is something that is not mentioned in this site and is described by CK as “Ginger pepper cocktail, Raindrop accord and Sudachi (similar to a Key Lime)” - it really is more than just ginger and pepper.

This is really an amber-forward herbal that has a backbone of oud wood. It does lack the sophistication and staying power of OW. Calvin Klien's attempt at a friendly, wearable oud.

Longevity:

Above average; 6+ hours.

Sillage:

Slightly above average, it projects well.

Gender:

Leans male enough to where I don't think this could be mistaken as a unisex fragrance.

Price value:

Just okay

This is an evening fragrance that you can wear any season. This wouldn't be my first pick for daytime wear, no matter the weather. This scent is by no means boring or overused, but I would go with another fragrance if you're looking for a cold weather fragrance. It just doesn't smell amazing. I find myself barely reaching for this one as it's not that impressive. It does everything a fragrance of this type is supposed to do, but just isn't that fragrance that's going to "wow" somebody.
not for the tropics. great sillage in aircon rooms

Nice scent.
It not suitable use during summer.
Be careful when you spray on your shirt, since it gives marked on it.
7.5/10
It gives me more compliments than Sauvage or Y, it smells like a more masculine and mature Black XS

I like to look at this one as a hidden gem. Euphoria Intense actually keeps the original fresh Euphoria DNA, but with amber to make it sweet, and oud to make it rich. a good 2 sprays makes it wearable in the summer, and a full dose of 5 is perfect for the fall and winter. A very versatile fragrance with 8-10 hours on my clothes. I do believe that CK fragrances are overpriced though.

Absolutely hands down my favorite cologne of all time. It's spicy, but not overwhelming like spice bomb. It's warm, herbal, spicy, woody, a little gourmand, and still fresh somehow. Complex and alluring like versace crystal noir. It makes me want to cuddle and jump some bones simultaneously... even after 6 years of smelling it, I'm still obsessed. 15/10

Not a bad one, but too spicy for my taste. Opens with a very long lasting and very harsh gingery-peppery notes. Usually the top notes fades away in 10 minutes, but when we talking about this perfume, this time is around 1-2 hours. The mid part is nothing special, I sniff some slightly woody-soapy effect, but the spicies still detectable. The base is the best part, the amber+oud combination is beautiful, but the strong myrrh not fit in the composation.

- classic cold weather scent, better suited for night time, but wearable in daytime too

- sillage and longevity are average, longevity is around 6-7 hours on skin

- safe blind buy (maybe)

Scent (open, top-mid): 5.5/10 (x2)
Scent (drydown, base): 7/10 (x2)
Sillage: 5/10
Longevity: 6.5/10
Uniqueness: 7/10
Versatility: 6.5/10

Total: 6.25/10

I don't know where these people came up with these notes at....
I get ZERO amber and ALOT of fresh spicy. I smell tons of nasty basil up-front along with ginger. Not a good combination whatsoever. At first you think it will be a nice scent (starts off smelling reminiscent of a bowl of Fruity Pebbles cereal), but then the basil and fresh spicy aspects take over and it smells totally different after about a minute or 2. I am selling my 98% full bottle because I have tried to give it time but I just can't enjoy it. The girlfriend has also stated she is "really not a fan." I bought this over the original which I smelled in Ulta, thinking it was similar and I don't think they are very close. This was a fail for me. I give it a 5.5/10 overall.

I write my reviews for my own future reference.

Opening was somewhat alcoholic, but underlying pepper and maybe ginger. After the initial opening I got a clear amber tone with warmth and the slightest, tiniest, note of spicy. I put the regular on my left arm and the intense on my right arm, and this one had character while the regular didn't have much to say. Not in longevity or silage but just in personality. Definitely if choosing between the regular and the intense, the intense is the way to go. At the same time I found the intense to monotone in its character, resonating a mostly Amber and slightly oily smell that I feel needs more to truly be what the name implies. Thought I would like this more, but left feeling uninspired.

Follow up: I'm blind testing this a few months later and the opening was not as alcoholic as recalled. It was more sweet, with tiny whiffs of banana, and the oily element made me think I pulled out a tropical leaning fragrance. As it dried down it leveled into a softer amber with a bit of spice. At the price point it offers something, beyond that not much.

So, I came across this uninspected as they were a great deal and
I quite like the wording "Euphoria" so I go ahead blind buy.

Upon initial usage, It seems like I found another cheapie gem that I really like a lot, almost can say, love.
So, it shares characteristics of my other favorite fragrance YSL L'Homme without citrus.

It starts where YSL L'Homme left off with Cedar and Vetiver in the middle note.
It shares Warm Spices & Fresh spices like Ginger, Basil and Pepper.
and utilizing Amber and Patchouli to increase the stronger silicate and long-lasting.

I would say if YSL L'Homme decided to go down with the Amber route
instead of Lavender Aromatic you could probably get this one.

The first blast - I get a sweet smell tricked me to think of Watermelon but it is not a very fresh one.
I think it is because of the Amber + Fresh Spice.
when it starts to dry down the freshness is almost gone leaving the sweet smell with mild silvery woody aromatic.
It lingers in this phase for quite a while before turning into darker deeper smell of sweetness almost chocolatey.
However, when it becomes a skin scent it fails quite flat all it gives is mild dark mushy wood with a tint of sweetness.

Given the name intense, This works more like normal EDT.
Quite strong (6-7 hours + ) with moderate silicate (45 cm. from a person).

I see the versatility of use in a lot of cases.
It can become one of your staple or dumb reach easily if you like darker-sweet seductive woody spice aromatic fragrance.

It can be wared from Day to Night, Casual. It has a unique profile that reminds a of the smell in the modern day.
However, I would not choose this as a specific purpose frag

as Professional fragrance (a tad too sweet but workable).
Nor a Club frag (Too shy to announce but dark enough) or Summer frag (a bit too heavy, Ambery).

It fit a unique profile like the Casual & Day to Night scenario, workable in others but has much better options.
It will be given you a more refined youngster fun playful guy, a master of the plan. Alluring but still somewhat good.

In my honest opinion, I think it is quite worth a sniff.
Maybe you might get another budget-friendly frag.

Solid 8/10, like it a lot almost love it.
=====
Edit 1 (Dec 16, 2022)

I write this review early on the journey, for now I feel like I start to fade away from this euphoria.

There is strong woody-amber here, the top is pretending to be sort of melon but I think it just strong Amber and some ingredients trick me to remind me melon.

I think the part I start to feel that it effected the fragrance the most in not a good way is Black basil like it's kinda have nasty smell to it.

I don't really know how actual oud smell like, but I realize I don't like the feel of wood in the dry down (I starts to know my taste that I prefers tonka, sandalwood, teakwood or vetiver).

It's so bazaar just a few months in the journey could change the way you smell a thing.

Current score 6/10
Personal preference 5/10

A very oud, pepper and ginger.
You can smell the faint oud, however this does not last long so I suggest to over spray , or bring along with you if possible to reapply.
The scent is lovely, and definitely unique for it's time. Theres just better options, but not at this price point.
8/10. Would wear on cold or chilly days for an uplift
There's nothing intense about this fragrance, the performance is less than acceptable. The scent is great though.

Euphoria Men Intense, the first male flanker of the Euphoria line, hit shelves in 2008 and its fragrance was also created by Carlos Benaim and Loc Dong, responsible for the fragrance of Euphoria Men, in 2006.
Euphoria Men Intense was released in Eau de Toilette concentration, which didn't take long to change in the fragrance industry, when stronger versions started to be produced in Eau de Parfum or, at least, Eau de Toilette Intense (which is when the percentage is on the limit to not be taxed as EDP).

I don't really know if the ghost of the makeover occurred, but my bottle dates back to 2011 and the performance was never completely unsatisfactory. I agree that taking into account the olfactory path of the fragrance – oriental-woody –, it was to be expected a greater trace. But Euphoria Men Intense had its highlight at that time, also because it was one of the first creations within the Designers segment to bring the OUD note in the composition when no one cared about such an ingredient, nor did it use its commercial value to embellish press releases.

The olfactory pyramid lists notes of ginger and pepper, the same rain accord as the previous version, and sudachi, which is a citrus fruit originating in Japan and is a hybrid version of tangerine, although it has a similar appearance to lime. Then, the central part brings notes of sage, cedar, and basil, while the base carries notes of amber, OUD, labdanum, patchouli, vetiver, and myrrh.

On the skin, Euphoria Men Intense tries to demonstrate kinship with the original version but is not very successful in this task. That's because, as soon as it touches the skin, the fragrance brings a spicy freshness that has similarities with the previous creation, indeed, but this moment is very ephemeral. In a matter of minutes, the sweeter side emerges and dominates the entire evolution. The sage is very evident, but the mix of amber and myrrh is unbeatable.

The more time passes, the more balsamic and resinous the fragrance becomes. We then have a warmer and more sensual smell, which for many starts to resemble a chocolate accord. And that's not unusual because we have OUD and patchouli together in the background.

Going back a few steps in the evaluations, I must say that when compared side by side (one in each arm, for example), the relationship and the way in which both fragrances evolve is very evident. However, when worn at different times (which is normal), there is the impression that the DNA was not respected in this intense version because the freshness of the ginger, basil, and pepper notes of one does not seem to exist in the other. And the truth is that it exists, but it is smothered by the ambery content that was employed here.

Revisiting the fragrance these days, I confess it was a good nighttime version for fans of the original. If you, by any chance, still have both versions in your collection, I invite you to take this comparative test. So, we look back and see that much of what was said and replicated was not 100% real, but the result of a recurrent prejudice with the fragrances of this brand, which still has good surprises in its portfolio.

Visually, Euphoria Men Intense came in an amber-colored bottle and the metallic finishing gained shades of a champagne color, which is not quite a bronze. After this, more flankers were released on the market.

Calvin Kline, Intense Euphoria I like Calvin’s fragrances, back in the day he was one of the designers that you could depend on for a good quality fragrance. I loved Escape and original Eternity and today I love Eternity Flame, not as impressed with some of the other flankers in that line. So, here is my opinion on IE, first the bottle, not to impressive but from 3 feet it looks awesome, up close kind of cheesy but it’s the juice that counts. So this has a great opening, no huge alcohol blast, very pleasant, on me this morphs through many changes. It starts off a little spicy but not to much then it gets a little greener, and finally the woods kick in and the Oud is not animalic, it kind of goes in a sweeter direction, but pleasant not over the top sweet. On a 10 scale the opening is a solid 9, but overall I would give it q 7.5,

Very solid and refreshing offering from Calvin Klein. The ginger and pepper pairs well, aromatic and inviting opening. The cedar, sage, basil and vetiver in the middle is a combination that provides maturity with sensuality. Finally on the dry down the myrrh and labdanum add complexity and a bit of uniqueness. I think this is a crowd pleaser, can be dressed up or down. A bit mature, but not so much for someone in their mid-twenties like myself. Longevity could be better, but the projection is fine for the majority of its life. A cheapie that's as good as more expensive offerings. 7.5/10

Really deep and natural smelling. Sweet but fresh, slightly aromatic, slightly herbal amber oriented fragrance. Consider layering l'occitane Eau De Baux with Boss Bottled.. But this one is much more transparent. Suprisingly high quality.

It would be among my favorites, if not for the relativelty weak performance.

But don't be discouraged, Dior Homme Parfum is my signature, so anything that I can't smell whole day is weak for me :) Performance of this will satisfy you if you like light, refreshing, and sweet fragrances.

This is an improvement on the original Euphoria and I like this very much. It performs well but it's not a monster. It smells sweet, a little powdery and a touch of woodiness to it too! This is a compliment getter that everyone come close to it will appreciate it. It's far from being offensive and overwhelming and I can be worn by anyone at anytime. I think it will perform better in the summertime. I give this a 7.5 out of 10 which is my par for the course when it come to Calvin Klein Fragrances as in most cases performance is average to slightly above average! A lovely scent though!!!

So I was really thoroughly surprised with this one. It has one of the best openings that I have come across from any of the cheaper designer brands, and even including some higher end designer brands this holds it's own. I also don't have any issues with performance as I've read on so many reviews below. I got a solid 7 to 9 hours every time I've worn it so far. I really, REALLY liked it the first time I wore it. I enjoyed it even more the second and third times I wore it. However, the last time I wore it, and I also experienced it just now while applying the fragrance, the artificial oud that's used in this can come across as body odor. And this last time it even started to give me a bit of a headache, and that's not a problem that I normally have with fragrances. Now I'm an oversprayer admittedly, and maybe that's why I picked up the body odor issue, because it's only during the first 20-30 minutes of wear that I pick it up. Everything smoothes out thereafter and on the whole I think this is a very solid fragrance that doesn't smell the least bit dated even though it's closing in on being 15 years old. Maybe it truly was ahead of it's time because if this were released today it would be above average, especially compared with most releases from the past year.

This is solid....

I wore the original euphoria for years back in the day. I’ve had it in my cart a number of times, but never pulled the trigger. Out of blue I found it at
A Burlington’s, $30. Had to grab...

Something in the opening reminds me of a lower
Quality Black Orchid. Just a slight resemblance...

This is pretty nice... Even if you liked the original,
Not sure this flanker would be a guaranteed like for you. Initial blast is a bit sweet and synthetic,
But after a couple minutes it settles down and starts to open up a bit. Amber, Patchouli with a
Nice Myrrh note..

this is safe flat scent for safe guy who always shake his head to agree on everything to satisfy people the " Nice guy " in bottle

the dominant note I get is Cacao, this is cold weather fragrance

rating 6/10

The notes sound like it could be a Serge Lutens scent, but as you might have guessed, it's nowhere near that kind of composition. It's not terrible, basically a CK version of a Lutens scent. I have an older bottle so perhaps it's different now. I got fairly good longevity with a couple sprays to the chest, but projection is not all that strong, though decent. This might be a good introduction to more interesting scents for a guy who has only worn fresh/sport type scents. I'm glad it's not too similar to the original, which has a note clash for me.

This was my signature scent for a long time. It used to read a lot richer than it does now. Still, I received a lot of compliments on it. People often asked what it was. It has a lot of deep amber character beneath the oriental notes. I still find it deep and unique, if no longer rich. This one has always been overlooked and under appreciated.

That one was my first love to Amber note (DG the one was my second) they are very similar in my opinion but this one is more fun and youthful it's ginger opening is so cheerful.. Kinda reminds me of that bubble gum sweetness trend in modern perfumery - acqua di giờ absolu for example -
But overall I love this one over the one, the ginger and patchouli add deepness and class to it.. And since both are mediocre performs then euphoria is a winner for me

Also.. How the hell do u smell oud in that guys?? 😄

A fresh spicy scent with a sophisticated, mild, fruity sweetness.

The spiciness is that of black pepper, ginger, & basil. A bit sharp, a bit herbal.

The fruity sweetness smells like a woody mango accord. I believe that is the amber-ginger friendship here.

As it dries down, you are left with a woody spicy (minty) scent with a touch of ambery sweetness. It reminds me a lot of Hugo's Just Different, despite the different notes. Like one could be a flanker of the other. A lot will find it redundant to own both.

And yet again, no oud. Zero. Yet, it is still voted as the top 3 note. Not the first fragrance to suffer from this, not the last. A lot of people on this website vote for notes they do not know how they smell. Do not try Euphoria for the oud because it does not exist here.

Back to the fragrance. Bluntly saying it, you don't think of Calvin Klein fragrances when you think of sophistication. They smell nice but are not formal event scents..

..Euphoria Intense is the exception to that rule.

Still, like all of Calvin Klein's, this suffer performance-wise, despite the "Intense" label. You'd get ~2-3 hours of decent projection, then it is a skin scent for a few more hours.

The scent is versatile but cool nights seem to be its ideal time.

Euphoria Intense remains a very good scent at a very affordable price, that is worth trying.

"Love"

I think that slapping the 'intense' label on this fragrance is quite misleading. In my opinion, this is not a super-powered version of the original with better longevity and sillage; this is an entirely new fragrance altogether.

Euphoria Men was a fresh/spicy fragrance with a wake-up call of ginger and pepper in the opening, that dried down to a subtle woody scent with a touch of suede. Intense Euphoria Men
is different. Very different.

It opens with a scent that can best be described as a mix of rich, earthy soil and dark chocolate. As things progress, it heats up and turns into a cup of hot chocolate made of only the finest quality ingredients, with an undertone of dark woods. The wonderful thing about this fragrance
is that it doesn't come off as very sweet or cloying, and never enters gourmand territory.

The more I smell this, the more I like it. Intense Euphoria Men is without a doubt a hidden gem in the fragrance community, and one of the best that Calvin Klein has to offer.

Much like the regular Euphoria, this is a subtle skin scent that I would think is best used for intimate encounters. I think you know what I mean.
No one else is going to smell this but you and them. And you'll both like it. A lot. Maybe you and them and them if you're into that kind of thing (and who isn't? lol)
To my nose, this is similar to D&G The One, minus the tobacco note.

i got this one as a gift, this amazing sweet perfume is suitable for winter days. trust me you don't want to wear it in summer. i like the mixture of amber and oud with the patchouli and the pepper they are so notable. i will give this one a 7/10 its great but there is better :)

Intense Euphoria for Men is a very fun, mature, dark, and sensual fragrance.

Opening: Unique blast of watermelon for the first half hour with minimal musk

Drydown: This is where EI shines! A beautiful gourmand sweetness shines through. It smells like strawberries covered in dark chocolate- a combination which many women will love! The sweetness is noticeable but not overpowering, as there are woody accords and strong musk to balance it out

Performance: Performs strongly for the first 1-2 hours and then sits closer to skin. Not bad performance, but not the best. Will ultimately be decided by your skin type.

OVERALL: This is a very dark, yet sweet inviting fragrance that is unique. It is for anyone who has grown tired of fresh/citrusy fragrances and needs something darker and muskier, but sweet as well. 8/10

I can appreciate other who like this, but sadly I feel a little let down by the positive reviews, considering I just blind bought this today because of them. It was between the original and intense version, and the reviewer below me suggested that this was the better smelling version. I can’t attest to smelling the original but I will tell you what disappoints me. The opening smell is great as with most Calvin Klein scents, but I could tell right away that this was going to have performance issues as after 10 sprays and 20 minutes later it wasn’t radiating, it was sitting too close to my skin, almost a skin scent by 30 minutes. What makes me slightly salty is that I overpaid for this at a department store. I paid 65$ and I later found that I could have gotten it for half price on one of my favourite online cologne stores, lesson learned. It’s opening is fruity, and slightly boozy to my nose, almost like Encounter by CK, minus the rum. It’s slightly sweet, and I appreciate the honey in this. I was expecting to smell the oud, but I don’t pick up any at all. I thought maybe I was suffering olfactory fatigue but I had my gf smell me and she could barely smell it also. And to all of the Calvin Klein white knights that will defend this and come back at me about scents smelling stronger on other people’s skin and PH stuff, I lent the bottle out to 3 other friends and ALL of them said the same thing (30 minutes, and then a skin scent. To the folks saying in their reviews that the performance in this is great, please try and be mindful of others who are looking for a new blind buy, your reviews need to be responsible and should try to avoid exaggerating scents. It’s more my fault though because I didn’t go deep enough in the reviews, some of you told it straight. This gets a 4/10 for me. Just below average. This is a shame too... As I love CK scents and praise a lot of them.

I own both Euphoria and now Intense Euphoria and judging by the opening this blows the original out of the water. I almost think this is what the original Euphoria should have been or that it could have been the Eau or Eau Fraiche version to this. Both are good in my opinion and this one is for sure an intense version to the original. This one is sweeter in the opening, overall darker and lasts longer. This would be great for date nights and for attracting women. I give this a 9.3/10

As many have mentioned, there is a little bit of a watermelon vibe at the start. It's sweet and there's noticeable amber and ginger. As it dries down, the woody notes intensify and a sort of fruity/chocolate vibe develops. It's a very nice scent and in my opinion, can be worn in all climates and settings.

On my skin, sillage and longevity leave a bit to be desired. Smells good and strong for about 30 minutes and then fades. After about 2-3 hours, it's barely detectable. Improved sillage and longevity would make this fragrance even better.

Ratings
Sillage: 5.5/10
Longevity: 5/10
Scent: 7.9/10
Spicy amber, myrhh and a touch of chocolate. The opening is a little sweet but within 20 minutes it's a lot more pleasant. Beautiful but somehow generic. Average performance.

Euphoria Men- Intense is a very good dark masculine sexy scent.

The opening is a lot of watermelon, but the dry down (after the first 20 mins) is where this shines.

The dry down transforms the scent into a dark, chocolate-covered strawberry scent. Ladies love this! It is sweet but very masculine because of the dark warm scent that accompanies the sweetness.

Everyone's skin chemistry is different. On me the longevity is good as is the projection. On others it may be great, while others only may get decent longevity and projection.

The ideal time to wear is fall/winter. The ideal occasions are a night out/casual times. But if your outfit and mood need it, this can be worn at any occasion/time.

OVERALL: 8.5/10

Bad smell (Only Amber) very sweeeet and sharp

Dislike

Well, I have a boyfriend who wears this and it kinda floored me. The spice and sweetness mixed with his dark skin almost sent me over the edge. All I want to do is put my nose in his neck and take deep breaths so the scent gets in my memory and stays there. Yes there are better mens scents out there but sometimes they just mix perfectly with someones skin and its amazeballs. This one has the ability to do just that.

Smells like Halston Man Amber with lots of sweetness added. The myrrh and Amber stand out, with hardly any of that beautiful ginger from the original. I do not like it. I was hoping for a more powerful version of the original, which I love, but is way too weak. Sadly, this one isn't for me.

That being said, this isn't a bad fragrance! I'm actually surprised it's not more popular among the snobby part of the community. It has a nicheness about it.

This isn't a review since I've only worn this twice, but I smell a distinct similarity to Polo Black, with that melon / mango vibe. Anyone else?

If you're on the fence about blind buying it, I would say have a sniff of Polo black and see how you feel about it. But personally, I wouldn't say that Euphoria Intense is a dark fragrance - more of a sweet and fruity one. And as far as romantic scents go, there are better options out there. Just an opinion.
i think this is appropriate for old men.

I'm probably on my own, but upon initial spray I get melon, a mixture of watermelon and rockmelon. Weird I know, but hey I smell what I smell.

Upon dry down it becomes a warm spicy amber scent, with a sweetness that's not too pronounced, unless you over spray. I think the ginger adds balance to prevent it from being cloying.

I love the bottle design!

Nice scent and incredibly cheap. Not my style, so I wouldn't repeat buy, but I'll definitely use up the bottle.

Dark,super sweet opening, can get a bit cloying.
Dry down is better a little pleasant.

@seemon you are absolutely right this fragrance is too sweet and smell like sharp strawberry, fruity stuff just too heavy on my nose, try before buy.

Scent 4/10

This is a nice scent, its got one of the best openings I have in my collection, this probably makes it popular with people when sprayed on the skin/tester in store.

Rich spicy opening with a fruit underlay, its dark, peppery & dense and I can clearly detect chocolate. Reminds me of a more refined Angel Pure Havane,which I love.

Typically with every CK scent I have tried or owned, the performance is lousy! It seems CK are getting something fudamentally wrong with all their scents in this regard. I haven't come across one (admittedly I haven't tried all of them) which is mildly detectable later in the day either on the skin or clothing. If memory serves the original Euphoria performed better than this one? I last own the original when it was released.

I can't understand why a brand like Chanel for example, athough not cheap, (I tend to think of Chanel as a gold standard, like a Longines or Omega watch) can produce frags that consistently perform well, Chanel only have a reasonably small line up of popular mens' high street frags and everyone one of them performs exceptionally, so reformulation agruments just don't hold up. I just wish CK could follow this example with their more mature frags such as some of the Euphoria line, I wouldn't mind paying more if they performed well.

Love the bottle especially in a 100ml, chunky, pale bronze metal rimmed cognac coloured glass, heavy and substantial in the hand. Still one of the best bottles on the market.

CK obviously have some great perfumers under their employ. Perhaps CK are happy making most of their money from the abundance of CK citrus scented water frags so popular amongst young people; CK One & Be and their countless variations.

Apart from CK Euphoria Liquid Gold, which I still want to try and will probably never get hold of now, this may be one of the last CK frags I try again.

Sublime scent ruined by zero performance....what a shame!!

Spicy, sweet, and comforting. This is my go to winter scent that pairs well with many warm scents. I get a nice spice upfront and a mild sweetness on the back end. It's warm but inviting, I love it, my wife loves it, so I'm happy.

I wanted to like this one so bad! I bought this as a gift for my BF after smelling it in store. At the time I thought it reminded me of sushi and I was into it. The ginger notes were strong and it felt very unique. CK is one of my go-to brands and I enjoy their particular style of American Minimalism. But at home, Euphoria Men Intense smells kind of generic. I don't know what happened!

On me, it smells sweet and spicy. Almost like a spiced pear. I was surprised there are no fruit notes listed, as there is a cool and cucumbery element that reminds me of apple or a watery, fresh fruit. I think the reason it seems so run-of-the-mill is the notes list isn't out of the ordinary. Many of the components are found in other popular men's fragrances, and the way they combine is sort of standard. That doesn't mean Euphoria Men Intense is poorly made, as it's actually pleasant and not as obtrusive as men's fragrances usually are. It feels modern and cool, and very on-brand for CK. But there is something missing here from making it truly great.

The bottle design is minimalist and not trying to be a car part or anything silly that companies dream up when they try to make it appealing to men (like a gaudy gold bar, for instance). But, my arch nemesis Labdanum is present in this fragrance, and as a result, it isn't something I want to wear. Which is unfortunate, as my BF doesn't wear it either. A lesson in buying fragrances for other people!

Even if I can't seem to force myself to enjoy this scent, it is not without its use. This is a perfect cologne for men who want something to wear to the office or date night. It could easily be a staple or signature and is no doubt appealing to a wide variety of people. It's not trying to be overtly sexy or masculine. It's just there, a little extra piece to complete the puzzle.

This was another gift I received. I hadn't had much experience with this one until recently and I must say, I do like it. Upon first application I find it's a strong woody/fruity combination. I think what gives it this fruity characteristic is the amber and ginger combination. At the price point, this is a great fragrance. Performance is ok. I got this in a gift set with the aftershave. You can forget about the longevity on the aftershave. It's like 30 minutes.

Actually, I just got a compliment on this as I'm writing this. A female co-worker just walked into my office and said, "It smells so good in here!". The scent and the price are great, the performance is average. Nothing but good things to say about this stuff.

I can see how people could like this and at first sniff this seemed promising but sadly it just didn't impress me or even persuade me to use this a dumb reach.

It starts out kind of fresh,slightly spicy and sweet and isn't great but kind of nice but once it dries down it kind of reminds me rotten fruit with spices. Again, it's not horrible but it's certainly not great and my girlfriend did NOT like this. ( but to be fair she hates most of my frags and is into fresher scents)

Performance was decent.... it projects really well for 30 minutes (with 3 sprays) but quickly dies down to pretty much a skin scent. It does however last 6-10 hours so this might work as a good work scent if it works with your skin chemistry.

Overall rating--- 6 out of 10 ! An ok scent with decent performance and this is super cheap now days so that's also a redeeming factor.

Great fragrance and would be perfect but for performance.

Calvin Klein Euphoria Men Intense is actually one of the only fresh spicy blind buys of late that I intend on keeping. Intense, Gold, and Essence each seem to be reasonably popular and now reasonably-priced, so this is the first one I got my hands on.

The fresh spicy characterization is accurate---Euphoria Men Intense's spiciness can probably be most attributed to pepper but I don't get much pepper (or much overwhelming spiciness) at all from this, as it's mostly subdued next to a woody/sweet mix that seemingly involves some sandalwood or cedar with a synthetic fruit (perhaps cherry) vibe. In that respect, it ends up seemingly like a distant relative to CK One Shock, but not nearly as well-blended.

Projection and longevity are nothing special, but at its price ($32 for 100ml on FragranceNet), it's hard to complain.

Longevity - moderate
