How is Strawberry not listed among the notes? My nose smells mostly strawberries.

Anyone who says this has poor longevity probably isn't detecting some of the aroma chemicals in it. One spray to the chest lasted at least 17 hours for me! I like this one but in some ways it's "anti-niche," meaning that the notes are blended tightly and there isn't a lot of depth. However, there is just enough depth to the drydown and the smell itself is really good, though if someone were to say it's a bit "synthetic" I wouldn't argue the point. For a designer scent that is selling now for around $35 per 100 ml new, what's not to like? The original was too fruity for me, and was also too "synthetic" to my nose, but this one may be in my rotation for a long time to come. Note that the sillage seems to come in wafts, and it may be best not to try and make it stronger by spraying more, because then I'd guess it would be too "synthetic."

Euphoria Intense is an interesting scent that I’m glad I added to my collection. There was a bit of back and forth between whether or not I wanted this fragrance. I told myself if I found it cheap enough, I would get it. I found it at TJMaxx for $29 for a 3.7oz bottle.

First Impressions: My first impression is that it was overwhelmingly spicy. When I first sprayed this from a tester onto a paper strip I literally said “yuck” aloud. As I continued sampling other scents, I went back to the paper strip and actually liked what I smelled. Before I left, I sprayed a shot on each wrist.

I was immediately met with that overwhelming spicy scent. Once again, I was back to “yuck.” After about 30 minutes is when the true beauty of Euphoria Intense begins to shine.

Mid/late notes: After the extreme spicy smell dissipates, I am left with a great smell on my skin. Rather than trying to dissect the pyramid of notes, I can best describe it as a dark chocolate cherry smell with a peppery kick. After an hour or two I start to get a bit of an unexpected clean/fresh scent that really evens things out.

Spray Count: Before I jump into my projection/longevity ratings, I think it is only fair to mention the spray count. I go pretty heavy with this one. I usually to 6-8 body sprays and possibly a few on my clothes depending on what I’m wearing and how long I will be out and about.

Projection: I feel like Euphoria Intense projects fairly well. There are times when I feel like the smell has dissipated, only to be smacked in the nose with a reminder that it is still very much alive. I do feel that the projection goes down quite a bit after a while. After about 5 hours, it becomes a skin scent that can only be detected within my personal/intimate space. However, it is very much still there! Also keep in mind that my olfactory sensory neurons seem to adapt faster than the average nose. I would give the projection a well above average rating of 8/10.

Longevity: Euphoria Intense seems to last a long time on my skin. I can come home from a 12 hour day and still faintly detect it on my wrist and forearm. It’s one of the few fragrances that I can detect making transitions throughout the day. I am actually wearing it right now and I can smell a difference on me from just a couple hours ago when I arrived in the office. Overall, I give longevity an 8/10.

Compliments: Unfortunately, this is where this cologne sort of falters. I haven’t really gotten a ton of compliments with Euphoria Intense. As a matter of fact, my wife hates it. She always makes a face when I wear it. To be fair, she only smells it when I first spray it and I’m already on the road when it start transitioning to my favorite notes. I shall also note that my wife is a big fan of the fresh/clean/aquatic scents, so there is some bias. I do get compliments from time-to-time, but not as much as other, and not as much as I expect.

I will mention that I let a friend borrow this for a date. He said that his date loved it and he also got a couple compliments from strangers. I know he is a heavy sprayer (this is coming from someone that sprays this scent about 8 times) so that may have something to do with it.

On the compliment factor I give Euphoria Intense a 6/10

Usage: This immediately jumps out as a perfect fall and winter fragrance. I would also use this on a dinner date (if only my wife liked it as much as I do). Since my wife isn’t a huge fan, I usually stick to wearing this around the office. It seems to be a perfect fit.

Overall: I think Euphoria Intense is a great surprise from Calvin Klein. It is definitely one of my favorites from them. Just remember to try and get passed the initial aggressiveness of this fragrance if it comes across as a “spicy mess.” I am glad that I gave it a second chance. I’m even happier that I found it at a discount. I’m not sure if I would pay full retail price for this at a department store. However, I am proud to have this as part of my collection. My overall score is a 7.5/10

As many of you may know, I do average joe type reviews with no commentary on notes. So here it is, spray_and_pray's review of Euphoria Intense:

So I bought this at TJ Maxx tonight in a gift set that included a 3.4oz bottle of juice and a bottle of after shave. I paid $40 something for the kit. A higher price range than usual for a blind buy, but I like living on the edge sometimes. I sprayed two sprays and this juice definitely reminds me of Curves Appeal Pour Homme. I think Euphoria is more refined.

It also has more bang for your buck compared to Curves Appeal. The first two sprays project of the skin pretty decently. I'd say more than a foot of projection. Euphoria Intense projects good give or take 2 hours, then it wears down to about 4-6 inch projection. After 3 hours, it becomes a subtle skin scent. The scent is so amazing though, I am not upset with two good hours of projection honestly. Call me crazy, but this is one of the only juices I would deal with re-applying to maintain this scent. It is goddamn good. At the same time, I would not pay full retail. If you can find a deal on this for $45 or less, then grab it up.

Scent: 5/5
Performance: 2/5
Cost: Not going to rate, it depends on your budget.

Euphoria Intense has been a pleasant surprise. I bought it on impulse when I saw it cheap on sale online without too many expectations but oh Boy!! It is pretty darn good. Starts off very fruity ( there are no fruit notes listed but I get a watermelon like note, no idea what's happening there) and then the Amber comes in. It has a kind of Oud note in the dry down but does not smell like real oud, some kind of synthetic note so dont get this looking for an oud frag. Overall I would call it a fruity Amber fragrance with hints of spices and it's really nice in cold weather. Stays strong for about 5-6 hours and probably lasts a bit longer as my clothes were still smelling of it the next morning after a night out. Probably would work best as a night out/ clubbing frag for autumn/winter. it's too playfully cheerful for the office or formal occasions for me but you could definitely rock just about any night out with this. I love it. 8/10
possibly calvin klein's finest moment

I had this scent back in College, and decided to buy a new bottle when I started working.
In my opinion the scent conveys the following:
1. Mystery
2. Masculinity
3. Elegance
4. Sex appeal
5. Intimacy

Perfect for evening wear, and night-dates. I wouldn't recommend using it daily (or during daytime)'coz it may offend other people.

Absolutely love this one. I blind-brought this for my father because I loved the notes and so did he. It's just so spicy and smokey, it's classy and sharp but still a little rugged. Love it, will buy it for him again when it runs out!

Got a sample of this from Sephora simply because I had never seen it before. I had NO IDEA this fragrance would be so creative, quirky, playful, sexy, seductive, unique, and quite literally... outstanding. It lasts for at least 12 hours, and its projection is perfect. Oddly enough, upon very first spray it smells rather generic (I'm glad I never spritzed this on paper), but then, moments later, the wearer is treated to a deep, intense marriage of chocolate-coated strawberries, tropical melon and yes, perhaps... even peaches; all with a woody, masculine, delightfully restrained spiciness lying beneath. This is the scent of seduction. And YES, it IS quite euphoric.

Overall: 9/10

Truly a diamond in the rough and a rare, hidden gem in designer perfumery. Far and away Calvin Klein's best "male" offering, and a unique and special treat for the wearer as well as those around him... or her. I'm so glad my fiancé picked a bottle of this up for me for our anniversary yesterday. We've both adore it, just not nearly as much we adore each other. :)

Smells very good. A spicy dried-fruit scent that isn't overwhelming and tart, but rather subtly sweet and comforting. Unfortunately, it's relatively weak in terms of projection/sillage. I can douse myself with 6-8 sprays, and it doesn't seem to get picked up by others. I will say, the longevity is pretty good; you can detect hints of it on your neck for the whole day.

Good for a subtle, inoffensive perfume that you can wear on a regular basis without knocking people out around you.

This is a very sexy Fragrance. Dark, smooth, velvety come to mind as well as sweet, powerful, gorgeous. It is one of Calvin Klein's best. I spent a long time at Macy's counter when deciding whether or not to purchase this against a whole bevy of nice colognes. I wanted something different but dark, strong, velvety -- think burgundy and leather, a nice glass of red wine and some jazz...some Spring rain and nighttime...this screams evening comfort...it's nice.

This is one of Calvin Klein's best. It is a mysterious and alluring fragrance that boasts powerful amber notes. Where Euphoria is subtle, light hearted, and pleasing, Intense Euphoria is dark, ambient, and full of sex appeal. Imagine an upscale hotel room with dark wood furniture, stainless steel accents, and dim lighting. On the floor is a trail of clothes, a fancy suit jacket, pants, and tie. Carelessly draped at the edge of the bed is a little black dress, and a pair of stockings thrown over the lamp. The occupants of the hotel room appear to be absent, but you can hear that the shower is on. A fine cigar smolders in an ash tray near the bed, and an unfinished glass of scotch is leaving a ring on the night stand. This is the essence of Intense Euphoria.

I have to say I love this. It is a notch up from the original, both in quality and in depth. There are those who probably reach for the myrrh, ambergris, labdanum, and oud in this... and there are those who probably relate to it as Cherry Chapstick. No matter. I think the more you wear it and get to know it, the more you discover its depth. It's a great everyday go-to when my favorites would seem a little too heady.

I haven't really been interested in Calvin Klein fragrances since my teen years.
Occasionally I sniff the new stuff that comes out, some I like and some not, but none have prompted me to purchase until Euphoria Intense came out.

I think it's a good intro to the world of OUD fragrances for all age groups, without the intensity, smokiness and heaviness of most of Oud based scents that are out there.

Euphoria manages to be fresh and lightly sweet/woody, with some of the exotic spice that you want in an Oriental composition. But it's easier to wear at school, work, or out on the town, without overwhelming people you come in contact with.

I personally love heavy oriental scents that scare people, but I don't always wanna be that guy, so Euphoria is a nice, in-expensive and less-offensive alternative.

I do not really know how to describe the notes on this bottle. But what can I assure is the smell almost are exactly like the fragrance counter. Personally I really like the smell. But the downside about this fragrance are the longevity and silage at average side even though I sprayed it 5 times.

Out of Ck's fall/winter frags, I have to give Euphoria Intense a very high rating. This frag will join the classic's being a PHENOMENAL juice. Out of all the different notes that I pick up, OUD is the first one I can detect a real woodsy base. The frag has a smokey aroma which awakens your senses to the dif notes you can smell.
Euphoria evokes a mystical enchanting far east aroma with ginger, pepper also blended with sage, amber and myrrh giving it a real balmy warm/spicy scent.

Longevity, if you spray it twice your good for 8-10hrs.
Sillage is just enough that you can smell it about 1ft away without it being heavy.

Overall opinion,
I have several real spicy frag's when I want to wear it for evening or to attract someone's attention.
Euphoria Intense is now part of main frag's I will use. It has a unique blend with a smokey/woodsy blend and layered with a warm/spicy notes.
OUD attracts attention being a VERY SOPHISTICATED aroma. I have had several women complement me on this AMAZING FRAGRANCE.
I found that this frag has a touch of sweet scent from labdanum/myrrh which women enjoy the aroma. After several hours you can still pick up the aroma.
In my book, this is a no brainer...perfect from late fall/winter....10/10

I really love this perfume. The first time I bought it in London back in 2008. I just loved it. I have so far bought 3. Both Euphoria and Euphoria Intense are lovely. The latter one is heavier, and therefore, more suitable for cold seasons. I think it is a perfume for all occasions, for office wear, for evening waer, etc., and for all edges. I beleive that both young and mature men would love this perfume. This is a very spicy perfume but it does not disturb you at all, no matter how much you wear. I really love it! So a lot of things has been said about this juice. I can only give my opinion to my surroundings and experiences in regard to it.

My first experience was when just browsing some scents in a store with a friend. I asked her to smell a few card and give her opinion. The first few she smelt and wasn't overly excited about. When she hit this one her eyes lit up and she told me to get this. A few months later I did manage to get it and I haven't looked back since.

To me this a magical fragrance that captures something in women that still surprises me every time. I've asked a few ladies of varying ages 19-45 what they have thought if it and the replies I have make me smile and laugh all the time. "You smell delicious", "i can stand here smelling you all day" was from my boss, she never compliments my smell and she wanted a bottle for her husband. My fav one was a one word answer from a lesbian "f*ck".

It's a powerhouse of a fragrance it lasts all night when I take it out, lots of compliments, and it has never failed me. Only downside is when it's really hot it will evaporate pretty quick. 10/10 for me.

Trying to put my finger on it, but the overall impression seems lacking. Fooling you to believe a thrill awaits but it never quite delivers on the promise. Also, quality feels out of line with the price (should be knocked down a couple Andrew Jackson's).

Yes, I understand where some find the opening a tad sweet but don't let that put you off. This is not girly like. This is Calvin manly (but not in a boorish macho way). Patchouli and amber in the base give it some heft.

While sillage was ok the longevity factor was poor.

With time the sweetness mellows and I feel that the scent gets more complex and decidedly more masculine. My wife LOVES chocolate, so I was pleasantly surprised when a few hours in I caught a whiff of chocolate. Yes!! I'm going right after her pleasure triggers!! If your significant other likes chocolate...go get this, they will love how you smell but most likely wont be able to tell you why. Have fun...LOL.

too sweet for my liking. It lasts a long time which i give major props for that. But initial spray and even in mid notes it get to my stomach and nostrils. Don't get me wrong it has good quality but it is a bit on the sweet side

It's funny - I got into fragrance years ago...it's amazing where taste goes. I bought this and wore it a few times and thought - wow, this is definitely "Intense" and very sweet. It was on blind recommendation - I actually don't wear current CK scents (only Vintage of the classic originals), as I find them too mainstream and mass-marketed synthetic juice, typically. My wife and I actually use a couple of their feminine scents as room freshener (not kidding, but LOL any way). I got this for a steal (under $25), as I went off a lot of very positive reviews. No offense, but this is high-school/college and maybe up to 30 party wear that lasts only a couple of hours. Probably not long enough to get a girl into bed - and then you smell like a sweaty candied frat guy who has no freakin' taste.

It's a rainy day and I went for a massage today. It grabbed the corner of my eye and I put some on for the first time in 18 months - 2 years. I paused and laughed. Someone on here mentioned it smelled like strawberry syrup ice cream. I get their point - before reading that and coming on here, I said..."I smell like a stack of blueberry pancakes covered in strawberry and maple syrup!" This is NOT an oriental woody! This is, at its closest, a gourmand - but sickly sweet and cloying as hell. I would actually like to refrain from saying anything too negative, because for about two hours, I was smelling very sweet...too much for me, but others liked it. Go figure.

Personally, I wear scents for me - not other people. If I offend you with an 80's powerhouse fougere that has a rich oakmoss note, that is your olfactory issue, not mine. This would work fine for the cast of Jersey Shore - or anyone who wants to be like them or have sexual relations with them. I don't - they are obnoxious. I can only imagine how they must all smell together after getting ready for another night out at the clubs that they've already shared bodily fluids with all the rest of the people who you will see them with. I think I found what that smell is...

And, for those of you, learn something about fragrance before making comments on olfactory notes. There is NO ACTUAL Oud in here - this is all synthesized juice and syrup. Get real people. I buy my wife Oud essential oils from the Middle East that are infused with only complimentary notes - rose oil, jasmine oil, etc. I will only wear this again to make fun of myself or the people I am hanging out with.

My rating is a metaphor - I give this One syrup-smeared Snooki swingin' around in a sex sling over 10 drunk guys from Jersey who want to get inside her panties.

I absolutely loved this scent from the get-go. I usually test them on my skin several times, at least 3 to 4 times but this one I instantly knew I loved it. Great longevity, I get7+ hours....
I would't suggest purchasing regular Euphoria... its quite boring to my taste. This one is darker and makes a statement. It is unique to me, it's quite versatile also.

A sweet fragrance that starts out with a lot of dark fruits and then through time, develops into a dark chocolate fruity scent in a very pleasant way. I don't know, but the notes listed here definitively are not present on my skin!

Imagine a bowl of strawberry syrup ice-cream. It is so rich, so sweet and the first mouthful is delicious. However, once you get half way through, you start to feel sick. Every mouthful becomes an effort until you can’t eat anymore.

That is how I feel about Euphoria Intense; delicious at first, but sickly in the end. I just can’t wear it.
When I first sprayed this on my skin I thought of Nautica Voyage but it's a bit better and a little sweeter. I think it's ok but not great.

Just have one spray on my wrist an hour ago, and all I can say is how similar it is to Thierry Mugler A*Men with the strong herbal but sweet oriental-like patchouli. It is not as sweet and strong as A*Men. As a result, Euphoria Intense is more wearable but also doesn't seem to last as long. I feel like it won't last more than 4 hours on me as it already begin to fade. However, it seem to get a bit powdery too. Way to attract women, I think!

Euphoria Intense is not spicy nor really woody. It is a rich, heavy, alluring sexy, and definitely sweet. It is not so generic, and it requires some getting used to. Oh I don't recommend this as a gift or blind purchase. Try it first!

Intense Euphoria is a definite improvement on Euphoria. It loses some of the sweetness and adds a darker, warm amber tone. It's a masculine scent, but not too aggressive or industrial. It would be good for a man who is easy-going, kind, affectionate. It's not particularly sexy, there is nothing "dirty" or even exciting about it. It's a comfortable scent, broken-in, relaxed, mildly enjoyable. Perfect for a certain kind of man.

I am a big fan of Calvin Klein fragrances. I have many of them. But unlike the others, I can say that Euphoria Intense is a sophisticated and sensual fragrance at a time. It is perfect to go to social events at night and also suitable for work. The best of Euphoria Intense is that it has a sweet fragrance, but intense at the same time. And finally, passing the hours, the scent gets better and sweeter.

well basicaaly i think it smell the same as the previous version, but the dry down is different. The dry down for this one is a little bit stronger and sweeter. The longertivity for this one is much better.

i got the feeling that the drydown for this one is similar to Dvidoff Cool Water Game. Only cool water game will smell fresh at the begining and euphoria intense smell more sweet and woody. But the dry down for both are the same.

I love IT so much!!!

So sexy an rare!!!

100/100

The definition of understated elegance & charm! Finally, A seductive masterpiece by CK! Its the sexier brother of the original euphoria which IMHO is a day scent aimed for office executives. I applaud the tinted amber bottle design which creates an aura of the mystery man. The befuddling effect it has on ladies continues to baffle me.

The opening notes remind you of blissfully sweet & rich fruity muskmelon with subtle spicy tones that captivate your senses. The dry down is pleasantly woody and dark chocolate. It may appear very sweet but it is not at all feminine. Don't douse yourself with it though.

It has an amazing projection and great sillage. I have no issues with the longevity either (6 - 8 Hrs). It's primarily an evening/night scent and shall definitely work better in winter/fall.

I have 3 OUD's in my collection... M7, Dirty English and CK Euphoria Intense. 1st one is formal, 2nd is casual and 3rd one is seductive... so if you are looking for a younger OUD, very wearable then CK Euphoria Intense is highly recommended... silage monster with 6+ hour longevity... perfect combo starts of passionately with GINGER and spices. Take on the woods without any soapy feel that leave a sensual trail that in the end blends well with AMBER and OUD without affecting its sensuality...

Euphoria Intense is oh, so manly! What else could one possibly expect from such an array of rich, woodsy and masculine fragrance notes in such an alluring, cube-shaped bottle.

Euphoria was one of the first male fragrances I tried and for many years it held a strong place in my top scents for men. Euphoria Intense has surpassed the original by far, bringing with it bolder accords and a hell of a lot more sexiness.

I was immediately struck by all the pepper, woods and resinous oud that wafted so beautifully around me. It is the scent of a man, a man that is conscious of smelling good that is. Despite being clean-cut and well-dressed, there's that underlying sense that he doesn't mind getting down and dirty every now and then.

There's subtle hints of spice and soapiness that immerge occasionally throughout the composition, that are somewhat dark and arousing. There is also a strange sweetness, possibly the ginger and basil, that give this fragrance a delicious yet masculine feel.

Euphoria Intense is a great fragrance for men in the way it is absolutely captivating to the opposite sex. It makes a man appear mysterious, charming and classy. The sillage and longevity are certainly better than the original Euphoria and everything about it seems to be drawing me in. I'm actually craving a man right now so I can douse him in the stuff.

I initially loved this fragrance, got reprimanded (in a nice way) by one of my female colleagues for putting too much on one time. In the end though, I got bored with this fragrance in the same way I got bored with Euphoria Intense, as I developed a better nose for what fragrances I like and dislike, I felt that the attraction of this fragrance just faded and ran out of steam. I gave it away to a friend. This was one of the few fragrances that I have ever gotten bored with.

WOW!!! Gobsmacking scent, instantly beautiful.
If you're unsure of Euphoria due to the low silage or projection, go for Euphoria Intense.
The first spray immediately has the ginger bringing out the absolute sweetest any of these notes can offer, the first 30 seconds I relate to Jo Malones Pomegranate Noir, it smells nothing like PN but it very quickly cools to a still very sweet and exotic, oud/floral intensity.

Scents like Eternity and Crave had me losing faith in old Calvin's taste and outlook, but Euphoria intense is one of his better releases. Much stronger than CAlvin's normal creations.

Although not completely out of the box, this scent is very unique to me despite my hundreds of tests, I'm so glad an Intense version was made for Euphoria!

Now If I could just get hold of a deo stick >-D

Not a bad fragrance, but has poor longevity even thought it is INTENSE. But I don't expect much from Calvin Klein's fragrances they are just names on different, interesting bottles. If you need lasting stuff, look at Carolina Herrera, Jean Paul Gaultier, Dior and even Paco Rabanne.
This smelled like a woman's perfume on me after less than an hour. Lasted for 2-2:30 hours at the most.
The best part on me was in the very beginning and then it started changing and I don't like it. At least I didn't buy it but I sprayed a whole lot of it on me at the mall. So this is how I know. It does not have good silage and projection is a little bit below average.
I hope I don't regret what I'm saying but I think I'm never going to buy a Calvin Klein cologne again. I just got MAN by Calvin Klein and lacks of longevity, projection and silage, I really hope it will be better in the hotter days! I don't want my money to be wasted.

I wanted to love this soooooooooo badly as I can’t get over the women’s version of this fragrance. It just didn’t happen though. Its definitely a play off of the womens one but it smells like the made it with leftover materials. The spice of it does something to my throat that I just don’t prefer to experience in the morning…or ever. I tried and tried to like it but I didn’t. sorry.

When I smelled this on paper for the first time, i was blown away. smells like 1 million, but calmer and probably a little better. BUT, it doesn't do that great on the skin. It dries down to a pretty dull scent-
was almost great, but falls short.

Having full bottles of both, I dare say that CK Euphoria Intense is the closest thing to what would be a poor man´s Tom Ford Noir de Noir. Of course it lacks the Oud oil concentration that Noir de Noir (or any other EdP perfume with oud oil offers) but I still think CK is a worthy example of the genre without falling into myrrh or incense abuse as it happens with Gucci PH1. Along with YSL M7, Euphoria Men Intense is the only option for those who want to enjoy these exotic earthy tones only Oud oil offers without spending a small fortune on a bottle of perfume. Highly recommended.

Lol OMG! This is so great! At start its like 'cigar' with chamomiles. Later it becomes more rich, I can catch caramel- like note if I smell close to skin. It's really nice, a bit sweet and comfortable. I recommend it. It doesn't have too much sillage tho. But stays quite long.
Lol @ guest xD
Very sexy and hot fragrance. Fully a frutal and oriental scent. The BEST. I love, love, love.

Like my review for Versace Dreamer, my only relationship with Intense is clear : I wear her, she advertises me.. Neither love or hate her, it's a deal. Definitely 100 times better than its original trashy scented water, I still don't get why women go crazy on this one. They tell me this is ten times better than Versace pour homme for example, which I find impossible to believe...

Sillage : good
Longevity : 3+ hours (poor for an intense edition)
Feeling : hot!!
Feedback : people like to be around you
Recommendation : A Winner

Yes, it does last longer than the original Euphoria, but it is ways different from the original Euphoria. It start with ginger and spicy peppery scent, minutes later, it turn to something very dry, thick and oriental scent for hours, it kind of too intense until I get light migraine wearing it (kind of remind me Davidoff Silver Shadow). Dry down is mild woody scent.

Original Euphoria smell smoother, more sexy and less aggressive than this one.

Both of them are totally 2 different group of scent, choose wisely. I will give 5/10 for this as I prefer the original Euphoria a lot more.
This is way much better than the original. Richer, more spicey, and more depth. And I love the darker bottle, looks much more luxurious!

The sales lady said to me that it smells like "dark chocolate", and so I bought it even though hadn't smelled it as wanted a new scent.

I really like it, it does remind me of dark chocolate actually.... and if you've smelled that Lynx Dark Temptation chocolatey spray stuff, they are very very similar.

It's pretty masculine, but sweet-ish and heavy, great for autumnal or wintoral days!

this is so much a better improvement on the original Euphoria for men. the intense version meshes nicely with the fragrance theme and packaging of the womens.

i have a feeling that originally they wanted to go with this version but instead choose the light fresh scented original.

it is a market shame that two fragrances now exist under the same name and theme - talk about confusing the average customers. my thoughts drop the intense from the name and discontinue the original and have this replace it!

Really nice, although it seems a bit as if CK were unsatisfied with the original Euphoria. One gets the impression that the original Euphoria hasn't been ready for release back in 2006, but rather rushed out. They surely improved that with this one two years later.

Nevertheless, one definite mixture instead of two scents that are essentially the same would have been a better idea.

****
High quality cologne, my favourite CK along with Truth for Men. All in all very high in ranking.
Very Sweet and sexy. No doubt this is the best from Calvin Klein. Smells expensive and extravagant. Love it!!

Dont be fooled by the CK brand name.

This perfume smells amazing and smells expensive. i bought it on 50ml and use it very sparingly.

Best worn with suits or when going to somewhere formal.

One of my favs.

Sweet,Sexy and wonderful.
Highly complimented. perfect for partywear and young generation.
much much better than its predecessor.
I like it very much.
I give it 8 out of 10.
pungent and sweet , thats about it , i liked it though , if u can tolerate it then ur doing just fine but be careful , this is not heavy , its pungent which makes it hard on a sensitive nose

like many ck fragrances it has great opening. watermelon with some spices. unfortunatly after those great opening it only becomes worse (but of course it is still good). dry down is only sweet vanilla on my skin. so it's typical evenign/winter/fall scent.

Surprisingly good amber oriental. Starts out quite sweet but becomes drier and more interesting as it progresses. Drydown is a nice cedar/musk. Smells both sexy and cozy. Good one to try if you're looking for a soft oriental.
I get compliments all the time when I wear this one. Euphoria Intense is unique and sweet, but still masculine. It has an impressive opening that leads to a pleasant and warm drydown. Great scent!

This opens smelling a lot like Euphoria, stronger, even better. But then on my skin it turn to this disgusting salty smell. Finally, there's only suede, suede, suede, literally, it smell like you're smelling suede with nothing added to it. Not a pleasant experience!

I was excited when i saw this. The original Euphoria was very low quality and didnot last on my dark skin. Also it was getting 'feminine scent' comments, so i stopped using it.

I thought that the intense version would last much longer, be a little manlier and would be a stronger scent with added perfume extract.

Well this turned out to be a very big disappointment for me. I found a much worse scent than the original. This is just as average quality as the original. Doesn't last, flowery feminine and synthetic.

I found the notes and composition of Euphoria fantastic but the quality was extremely low and it turned out to be a huge disappointment for me. The phases of the fragrance were complete in half an hour and the rest 1 hour was all about a cloying sweet smell. After this experience i swore to wait at least 1,5 hours after testing a fragrance and before buying it :)

I wondered if the quality was better with Euphoria Intense. Again the fragrance mesmerized me the moment i smelled it on my skin but faded to a sweet-sour smell in half an hour and made me want to wash it off immediately. This time i was wise enough to wait to see how the fragrance would evolve and did not waste my money :) I really miss the old CKs.

I love perfumes with cedar. They remind me of ancient epic times. My husband bought it recently, and whenever he puts it on, I feel as if some hero from previous lives popped in to say hi.
I like the introduction of the fruit-like flirtation, and then the firm and not too gaudy statement it makes. Some perfumes to me seem more eloquent than others. This one doesn't use many words, but the few it does, have an exclamation mark at the end.

I'm wearing it right now, and everytime I wear it I get so many compliments. On the opening it does smell kinda sweet but I tend to wear sweeter fragrances better than musky ones, but it drys down to a sweet vanilla type deal. This review has been approved by CYSM

I think it is way too sweet for a mens scent, even in todays trend. First blast is so filled with sugar, with a watermelon type fruity feeling, later it tuned down to a biscuit cacophony. I was looking forward to find the oudh out from it, but the patchouli overkilled everything. Unbalanced IMHO.
Hmm... The opening is sweet enough for me,but it is not as sweet as paco rabanne ultrared. It is getting spicier 5-10 minutes later. 2 thumbs up for the longevity!
This cologne and Guess Suede seem very similar to me. I have a hard time telling the difference. What do others think?

My new fav scent and I can't wait 2 own it! It smells incredible! It's very earthy and completely different and unique from anything that's out there right now! I love it so much more than the original Euphoria for men! It's a must have! I'm gonna stock up cuz sadly it is a limited edition!
a little similar to YSL l'homme but more intense.
great smell!
Smells absolutely amazing at night. Dry down is very sweet and youthful. Longevity is terrible though since it is very intense so you can’t spray very much but what you do spray radiates.
Obsessed is your typical modern sweet fragrance, built around that artificial vanilla that’s everywhere these days.

Fruity, spicy, sweet, woody and aromatic.
Maybe a bit more on the synthetic side.
Either it performs really bad on my skin or I get nose blind to it after 10 minutes. Probably a bit of both. Seems very intimate to me. Not an option to me due to its weak performance.

First impression is that this is Calvin Klein's equivalent of something in the genre of Paco Rabanne One Million. It's a lighter, less sweet version. Not a bad smell by any means but it doesn't move me in any way. And I'm not looking for niche craziness either. I love a standard mainstream fragrance, but first impressions are that this doesn't do anything for me.

This is incredibly underrated, everybody's crazy about the intense version but this is to me a better scent, I have the first batch from 2017, 125ml and I'm selling as i have 2, so send me a message via profile if interested.

So this is not like OG Obsession for Men, Night or Dark Obsession. This is its own thing. Add a little spice to Y EDP, Dylan Blue with CK Eternity and CK One DNA hidden down under. It's a wonderful scent I truly think it's an all year scent. Clean, fresh some blue but not flat like BDC or super Ambroxan like Sauvage EDT or EDP, it's very nice!! I got a 4 oz bottle lightly used for $40 after browsing and putting in offers. For a Calvin Klein collector like myself thats a good deal because this is discontinued. OG formula Obsession for Men will always have a place special to me with the cinnamon, amber, spice, creme brulee and so much more. Dark Obsession is so alluring and unique and wonderfully chocolate/vanilla with oddly some nods to the original obsession for men. Obsession Night is alone a calm scent heavy Pear, not blue, not green, just relaxing and unique. There are 2 you love or hate, Obsession for Men, Obsession Night for Men. Dark Obsession and this Obsessed for Men are 2 that are more universally accepted as anywhere from ok to fantastic. Anyway if you like Dylan Blue, Oxford Blue by English Laundry, BDC EDT, Y EDP and small amount of Ck One and CK Eternity you will like this. Won't blow your hair back but it's very nice. Sits close to skin like a lot of CK products, spray a lot, spray your clothes. I don't agree that this is some kind of winter or fall scent or super spicy. Trust me on the comparisons. Don't pay attention to the list above.

As a lifelong Obsession wearer I was surprised to discover this new scent only a few months ago. The longevity and performance of this fragrance is superb when compared to Obsession. It has a citrus and spicy opening which projects quite well. It is quite strong at opening, but it does smooth out in about 30 minutes. The musky and vanilla notes remain on my skin for about 6 to 8 hours and I could smell it on clothing about 12 hours later.
Mocked abit when released.. Always liked this one, but now rare?? Glad I bought a few bottles when they were about $30 full size.... Nice to see a market for obscure scents 👍👍 Ciao ambroxan 👋👋

Unisex. It´s ok, nothing mindblowing. Pretty Sweet. Long Lasting with Strong Sillage. Unfortunately it´s something in it, not sure what it is but it getting me a small allergic reaction and I get a stuffy nose. Reminds a bit of Valentino Born in Roma. Never using it tho.

Smell 5.5/10
Longevity 8,3/10

Versatility 6,5/10
Uniqueness: 5/10
Value and Quality 9/10
I couldn't wait for the dry down, had to wash it off, but after that it started to smells good lol, something like vintage Lagerfeld Cologne.

A blind buy. I'm usually not one for sweet fragrances, especially those with ambroxan. Yet when I saw this available for a good price, I thought why not? I've never met a CK scent that I absolutely hated, plus I probably needed at least one sweet scent in my arsenal (now that my Cool Water Intense is gone).

Not bad. I concur with most of the positive comments here. The vanilla never really comes through to me. It's an unusual blend of slightly candied citrus and amber, with a ghost note of fig (?). The ambroxan is noticeable and ensures this will be an occasional reach for me, never a regular one.

Beautifully minimalist bottle, with a great feel.

Recommended if you like sweet fragrances, and are not expecting for this flanker to resemble the original legend in any way whatsoever.

Certainly not bad for the price tag. It doesn’t feel as modern as it should nor is it the homage to the OG I was hoping to experience since that was such an epic release. Especially for its time.

Haven’t been able to find the intense version so can’t speak on that.

It’s a pleasant woody citrusy vibe that projects pretty well in the first hour or two then fades into something uncomplicated and nice. Just a little boring for my taste. Or maybe I was expecting to be wowed when I realized one of my favorite perfumers, Ilias Ermenidis was involved. I’ll gladly use up that 2ml and move on lol.

Like my other CK fragrances it's a pleasant office-safe fragrance for day-to-day wear. It's also inexpensive so part of my daily rotation when I am WFH or in the office.

I am baffled by some of the fragrance notes above though, vanilla dominates for me.

An excellent value cheapie for daytime wear, but wouldn't make the cut for a night out. The bottle looks great on the shelf too!
A very sexy crowd pleaser

Sweet, with some spice, and a distinct touch of clean/fresh. Nice and cozy in the early stages, but drydown fairly generic. I’d avoid wearing it on hot summer days.

[07/27/22 Update: This one has fallen out of favor with me. I no longer like it at all on my skin. I had to wash it off after 30 minutes last time I put it on. I don't dislike the scent itself. I just don't like it on me. I sprayed some around the room as air freshener and didn't think badly of it at all that way, so that's what this bottle will be used for from now on until used up. Or maybe I can find the right combination of fragrances to layer it with.]
Spicy grapefruit and ambroxan with the weird sourness I've smelled in most CK fragrances. 5/10

This has so many notes I normally dislike: cardamom, lavender, leather, labdanum, ambroxan, vanilla, amberwood. In normal cases, these notes would automatically cause my review to be negative.

HOWEVER, Calvin Klein Obsessed for men is one of the rarer instances that I actually kind of don't mind despite many of the notes aforementioned. It's very strong, for sure, and lasts and lasts, but there is something smooth about it that I can't afford to dislike. The blend is done satisfactorily, and the bottle is really lovely. The opening is especially remarkable, really fresh and citrusy, and when it dries down, it's less impressive but still decent.

The dry down has a clear vanilla plus ambroxan scent, but on my skin, I don't get leather that much. Maybe it works differently on others?

I don't think this has much feminine vibe at all. I wouldn't imagine this on a woman.

Update: I just had another sniff at this and I think I like this one less than before. The ambroxan is too strong for me. I've moved this fragrance to 'ok' as a result.
I like smelling like this. I like the Amber, it is quite subtle and out there at the same time. But it definitely is worth for the money.

I love this one on the opening it's very citrus and very creamy and pleasant, but then it dries down to a Dior Sauvage kind of vibe, although it doesn't smell the same as Sauvage I still get the pepper smell like sauvage... I like it
Does anyone get hints of Tom Ford Noir Extreme or am i going Nose insane?

A very pleasant, basic, formal cologne. It has a soft warm vanillic ambery base. And has a sweet slightly vibrant candy like Twizzler scent from its projection. It's weird, Obsessed smells youthful and kinda old timey at the same time. It's like if you brought a 17 year old from the 1950's to present day. Yes they're still youthful, but they feel like they have very old-school values. Obsessed is what kids today would describe as "mid" (average or ok) It's like the Ford Fusion of colognes. A very basic product that's going to get you from A to B, that's not going to overly impress or offend. I find myself only wanting to wear Obsessed in cordial setting like Church or Work. Where I don't want to offend, but don't want to smell bland either. It's a respectable cologne. Not a must have however, it's easily substitutable.

I got this fragrance for almost a year and what I can say about it is this: It's not a Sauvage clone (way far from it) although, I can get the smell of ambrox and pepper. The vibes of leather and vanilla are also prominent, but the citrusy from the opening is, somewhat, faint. What bugs me is that most people say there's a pinneapple note on it when there's none. I recommend this fragrance on a warm weather during the day or afternoons.
About longevity, this one last about 7 hours on my skin( given or taken) and the projection is no more than an arm's length.
Obsessed is a nice and plesant fragrance, easy to wear on casual dates, office or daily basis, but if comparing a Sauvage edt with this CK fragrance I'd say that Obsessed is a firecraker, but worth buying it

Note: I've recently layered Obsessed with Molecule 01, and it was the kick that really need it. Iso E Super was the note that was missing, haha

Tried this at Kohl’s before heading to work one night and instantly thought it’s the same as every other oriental vanilla fragrance however I compared it to my Versace Eros and truthfully side by side they are very different! This one has an amazing dry down and on my skin and clothes lasts at least 6 to 8 hours strong. It’s sweet, sexy, vanilla perfect for dates, night outs and just fall and winter all around. It’s even sexy and light enough to wear in the summer nights as well. A great well blended fragrance. I haven’t purchased it yet but it’s next on my list for sure! The amber and vanilla with the fresh woody notes blend amazingly and make for a super sexy lovable scent. Definitely worth the buy.

When I first tried Obsessed, I loved them fresh opening, and there was an almost creamy vibe as it dried down. I've worn it a few times but rarely gone back to it after picking up other fragrances. I recently started wearing it again, but found the fresh creamy lemon and woody smell quickly fades away and turns to a skin scent after around an hour or two for me. Can pick up the ambroxan later down the line but it barely comes off the skin at that point. It's a scent I like the smell of, but it just doesn't stick around long enough.

Calvin Klein Obsessed For Men EDT opens with a moderate projection of very sweet, spices, and fruity accords. The opening is aromatic, dense, and very pleasant. The vanilla is a base note but it comes up as soon as the fragrance is sprayed creating a sweet and aromatic note; the grapefruit, lemon, and pineapple are opening aromatic citrus and fruity notes, the pineapple is more prominent than the lemon and grapefruit; the pepper and cardamom add a spicy touch, similarly, the lavender adds a soft floral touch. The leather that initially was a whiff starts developing, nothing bold, but projecting and aromatic; similarly, the cedar and labdanum join with fragrance with fresh woody and sweet, ambery accords respectively; the ambroxan also joins the blend with its ambery and powdery projecting note but not as strong as the vanilla; the cinnamon joins the vanilla with a sweet-spicy touch. The patchouli and geranium are support faint notes. The most noticeable opening to dry-down changes in this fragrance is the very fruity and citrusy opening, these notes are at the top closely followed by the spices; as the fragrance dries down, these fruity notes significantly dissipate, and in their place, the fragrance brings the sweet resinous touches of the labdanum and cinnamon, projected by the leather, vanilla, and ambroxan. Once Calvin Klein Obsessed has reached its full dry-down, it can be summarized as a very sweet, resinous, and leathery fragrance with woody, spicy, soft floral, and fruity accords. The fragrance feels casual, comforting, delectable, dense, gourmand, inviting, mature, mild, inviting, masculine, modern, leathery, resinous, rich, sweet, syrupy, warm, woody and very pleasant.

BATCH REVIEWED: 2020.
WOW RATING: 8/10. A very pleasant, sweet, vanilla, leather, spicy, and woody fragrance.
DISLIKE RATING: 1/10. The leather is a soft projecting leather note.
UNIQUENESS: 7/10. The combination of notes creates a pleasant fragrance.
MASS APPEAL: 9/10. This is a fragrance that most people will enjoy.
PROJECTION: 3/10. Moderate to low, about 3 feet around the wearer.
SILLAGE: 4/10. Moderate, about 4 feet behind the wearer.
APPLICATION: 4 atomizations.
LONGEVITY: 4/10. About 4 hours, it projects well for about 2 hours.
SEASONS: Winter, spring, fall, colder days, and climate-controlled environments.
OCCASIONS: Formal events, outdoor gatherings, office, casual, holidays, romantic, dating, clubbing. This is an office-friendly fragrance.
VERSATILITY: 7/10. A versatile fragrance for the cold or mild days of the year.
GENDER: Masculine, the leather is soft but leans the fragrance to the masculine side.
AGES: Any.
RECOMMENDATION: Calvin Klein Obsessed For Men EDT is a very affordable fragrance that delivers a pleasant scent, ideal for colder weather, this is a great buy.
BLIND-BUY: Yes but only if you are familiar with its main notes.
SIMILAR: These are examples of fragrances in the same genre. Animale “Animale” Men EDT is an affordable sweet, woody, and fruity fragrance; Azzaro Pour Homme Intense EDP contains warm spicy, woody, and mild brandy delectable notes; Cartier Pasha De Cartier Men Parfum is a great woody, spicy, and ambery fragrance, but it contains a particular note; Carolina Herrera - 212 Men EDT is nice citrus, green, warm spicy and woody fragrance; Hugo Boss - Boss Bottled Private Accord EDP contains warm spicy, cacao, sweet notes, and coffee; Paco Rabanne Black XS EDP is a close relative and it features citrus, warm spicy, balsamic, and woody accords; Parfums de Marly Oajan contains delicious spicy, cinnamon, and honey tones; Thierry Mugler - A*Men Angel Men Pure Tonka is another great semi-gourmand fragrance featuring spicy, sweet, cacao, and balsamic tones; Tom Ford Noir Extreme EDP is another close relative and it contains spicy, cardamom, nutmeg, and vanilla delicious tones; Calvin Klein Obsessed is a great and affordable, very sweet, resinous, and leathery fragrance.
SUMMARY: A very sweet, resinous, and leathery fragrance with woody, spicy, soft floral, and fruity accords. The fragrance feels casual, comforting, delectable, dense, gourmand, inviting, mature, mild, inviting, masculine, modern, leathery, resinous, rich, sweet, syrupy, warm, woody and very pleasant.

What's with all the note's , idiots at fragrantica adding lot's of note's again that don't exist in the official note breakdown. The fragrance itself is quite linear there's a nice opening which reminds me of vanilla popcorn . Then I get a coconut smell in the mid then it's just vanilla which is all the way through the fragrance. it's a skin scent that last's a moderate amount of time on my skin.

the smell is amazing
sweet citrus in opening then vanila and leathery scent is dominated
the good points is:
this longevity is good... i can detected after 6 hours from my skin.
projection is.moderate
and the price is CHEAP!!!!! yeahhhhhhhhh

I have to say I really like this after testing a couple of time. It doesn't blow me away but there something about it. It gets better in the summer heat, the grapefruit comes through better. Nice vanilla in the background, not too much. Youthful and loveable. Balancing between masculine and feminine, making it unisex smelling.
Great scent for daytime-lasts a ling time and gets compliments-some may say boring and generic but to me so is sauvage and BDC.

Generic, crowd-pleasing citrusy-vanilla scent. Sweet, modern, light, with below average projection… It is little bit boring, but I still like it. It doesn´t bother me in any way, it is really nice to my nose, I like these sweet contemporary scents. However this one I will not buy again as it is really too generic and low performing on me. I see it as a day scent in spring / summer on a guy 20 - 40 years, it is definitely for the younger crowd. Not a clubbing scent though.

I find it too sweet, quite unbalanced and cloying. No character at all. It has got hints of coconut milk in the worst possible way. I never smelled a Calvin Klein fragrance that I liked or thought was good.

I got this as a sample, and purchased one afterwards! It's unisex and fits perfectly for anyone! Very sweet! Wearing it on casual events like school or a walk in the park, during cold days. I recommend this for men because of its harmony and sweetness that'll charm your surroundings!

Very sweet fragrance, not the best longevity. The projection is strong during first hour or two, than decreases. Although it is "For Men", I would consider it unisex as I would not mind if a woman would wear this.

Obsessed is another "crowd pleasing scent", with sweet-bubble gum vibe, which we all know from "Invictus" "YSL - Y" "Armani - Stronger with you" "Diesel - Bad" "Azzaro - Wanted" "Rasasi - Hawas" etc etc. Very good scent indeed, but generic! If u like this sweet-bubble gum vibe, which seems like is very modern nowadays, u will like it for sure.

A clear, glass rectangular oval flacon which goes with the brand's unisex image.It has the rectangular shape depicting masculinity but rounded smooth edges showing a softness too.

The clear white bottle gives the impression that this fragrance is apt for summer and day wear.

Although the bottle says "for Men" this is not a very macho fragrance and can be worn by ladies too!

It is a Warm,Oriental ,Woody and Spicy perfume .The opening notes are sharp Spicy and Cedar for me,it then settles to a sweeter but not overtly Vanilla and AmberI do not notice the other notes palpably.

Moderate staying power.

I find the 'reminds me of' section to be very interesting. I, personally, would never have thought of some of the listed fragrances but I guess with a very determined nose...? The association can be seen. Not exactly a leap, but not at all obvious.

The scent itself is perfectly lovely. I'm really glad I bought this. It's definitely very synthetic and vanilla driven, like a lighter and less scratchy Stronger With You. Sort of. Medium strength, 7-ish hours of longevity. Does what it says, more or less. Watch out, though. Can be a tiny bit sweet.

This one is very sweet on me. I know the pineapple note is rather far down in the main notes list but I get a big blast of it when I put this on and that pineapple note sticks around for a good while. That's not a bad thing at all but was surprising. On my skin this stays sweet for the whole duration (@ 6 hours) and ends up a nice vanilla. I'm aware that's probably not the results others may be getting but that's how it behaves on me. Overall I really like this one but it's possible some may think it's kinda boring. That may be so but at least it's a good smelling boring! I had trouble with Dark Obsession containing a note that went very floral on me (I don't like florals) and it made me wary of this one but Obsessed doesn't have that issue, thankfully.
A more well-crafted scent in the line of the Calvin Klein's...Has a nice intense bouquet and medium strength and longevity...scent 8.2/10 strength 7.0/10

this gives me migraine when someone else wears it

interestingly it is being used to trap tigers in India ..

It was really good the first few times I wore it, I am getting a little bit sick of the sweetness combined with the pepper though.
Before you buy it, get a sample and wear it a few times because you really do love the fragrance right away but trust me the pepper and sweetness gets a bit overwhelming after a while.
Longevity 4 hours
Projection good for 2 hours
Silage average
Notes: I can only smell sweetness and pepper

Very interesting scent, it is clean, sweet and quite feminine in a way, feeling like pleasantly spiced clean laundry.
The pure magic with Obsessed is when you get a whiff in the air, and it really garners compliments. I thought it does not perform well, but I got compliments by the end of the day after around 6-8h of applying 3 sprays.

Tested today and I really like the smell, it has a delicate fruity freshness throughout and a nice sweet amber note mixed with light spice (pepper, cardamom & cinnamon).

It is very unisex in my opinion, in fact I think it leans (slightly) more feminine, it's something that I'd find very appealing on a lovely lady.

Update: I'm quite impressed with this fragrance, seems like low/subtle sillage & projection but it lasts for a long time on my skin. It's going on my list as a possible future purchase to go alongside my (much loved) CK2 and One Shock recently purchased bottles.

6/8/2018 i was had no choice but to spray both the female and male versions on skin because i couldn't find a test strip available and i didn't bother asking the SA for one. Ok now moving to the important stuff, the review and first inpressions:

This is what imagine it to be a siblings release (what do you mean?) I can see a brother buying a bottle for his sister and vice versa because the two scents completes each other.

And if I'm not mistaken and my memory doesn't betray me, the men's version smells something like CK One and CK Free.
is a simple sweet fragrance.no citrus.only amber,vanilla pepper and a hint of ambroxan.i feel a note of nutty.longevity 12 h. low sillage. vote 6/10 pass.

I basically came on here to find out if this Could Be unisex. I was on the CK website and when I read the notes cast of this fragrance I almost bought it before even looking to see if it was for women or not. I'm glad to see that a lot of people indicated that it can be worn by a woman. I'm basically writing this because I'm also constantly on the search for something that smells like original vintage women's eternity. That was my favorite perfume in high school in the late 80s. I haven't worn that in many many years and recently purchased a new bottle of it and I was shocked at what I received. I thought that it was a fake. It resembles what it used to smell like but it's not the heavy hitter that it once was. I miss that strong beautiful opening and the green notes in eternity. Where in the world did all the green notes go? That's what made the perfume Beautiful. Anyway I know this is not a review about eternity but this seems like the group that might have a clue about this. I don't know how to describe precisely what I'm talking about. In fact just understanding that it's the green note in eternity that I'm missing is brogress for me. Oh and I also saw that they are selling something called eternity intense. I'm about to look that up to see if it is something better than the fake eternity that they're selling now
Not for men at all. Way too feminine. I wouldnt want to go around smelling like this...the opening is good but when it drys down it gets way too feminine

Dont listen to GRAF this smells absolutely nothing like sauvage, sauvage is utter crap and massively overrated. Wish everyone would stop comparing everything to it, the only fragrance that smells similar to sauvage is Prada carbon and that's just the opening. People really need to stop pretending like they know their stuff and actually get a clue. Like CB23 says it's completely misleading and idiotic.

On the other hand this is a very nice fragrance, refreshing and unique but like all CK frags quality is questionable.

Very pleasant warm spicy scent with some freshness from the  dominant  ambroxan. It feals like a cousin of the mighty Dior Sauvage. It could be a flanker of it.

Dominant notes are ambroxan, mild vanilla, pepper, citruses (mainly grageftuit), smooth & mild cardamom, lavender.

Performance is very good for a CK scent. Moderate sillage/projection and moderate to long lasting longevity (somewhere between 5,5-6,5 hours). Very good versatility, a mass appealling spring/fall daytime fragrance. If you feel that Dior Sauvage is too much or harsh for you, this is an alternative. Well done CK.
While the scent itself is nice, performance is poor, longevity around 2 hrs mainly a skin scent.
On my (female) skin this fragrance evolves around the lavender note. It becomes less and less aromatic, until the warmth of drydown that's heavenly.
alabangcute...how can you moan about masculine scents being feminine and overly sweet when you have armani code profumo listed as your fav scent ? lol

Best release from this house in a generation. Other than the paper thin simple box and cheap plastic top, presentation is excellent. The scent is fantastic and the quality as good as any release from the house, ever!
Why are all new men's cologne sweet? Do women prefer men to be feminine or masculine? Hahaha.
another unoriginal overpriced product. Smells very generic and weak on my skin. Ck needs to move on!

Calvin Klein obsessed takes the same route as Montblanc legend night. Sweet and vanilliac with a citrus spine. In this case, the citrus coming from pineapple - which makes a really interesting mixture. With a close sniff, it gives it a pungent twist - which I think is good! Overall I would consider this to be 70% similar to legend night - and I would say they are both on the same level in terms of overall smell. I’m surprised this one gets so much dislike - but hey, more of me wearing it and less of you! I’m very pleased with this scent - and I can see this one being grabbed often for all occasions.

6/10

Amazing soapy opening that mixes well with some sweetness, cardamom, and the leather. It has an effervescent feel too it, it smells very fresh and sweet.

Then after about 30 minutes it dries down to what I consider a "date" style scent. It's a smooth, sweet, warm, resinous, vanilla, scent that lasts for ages. In this stage it is sort of like Eros with that fresh, woody, vanilla thing going on. It smells very much in line with that trendy modern sweetness.

I am fairly averse to ambroxan, but this one comes off more like a classic amber unisex soapiness and fades to the background of the fragrance within an hour, but lasting as this subtle base note until the next day. It's nothing like the god awful ambroxan found in Dior Sauvage or the Prada Luna Rossa line, both of which make me nauseous.

There are some drawbacks to this one for me, I am not a fan of the patchouli that comes in the dry down, it's very strong. And it's a tad bit generic/boring.

Right off the top, Obsessed hits me with that trademark CK freshness - citrus pop infused with a tastefully light lavender touch, rounded out with a subtle spicy edge. Fantastic to my nose, being one who enjoys both fresh and spicy scents.

After a good 15-20 minutes of that delightful opening, I definitely start to get the comparisons to Jazz Club - rich, natural leather with a rounded ISO-e (cedar) edge, sweetened ever so lightly by (I guess) geranium and pineapple. I do not pick up the sweet notes individually, but more as a collective, there to keep Obsessed from getting too dry.

As the hours loom, the heavy hitters emerge, but not in a way that you'd expect given the stated notes. What I get is a lot of rich, creamy vanilla with ambroxan and patchouli playing so far back that you might not even notice they're there, except for the occasional tell-tale wisp. Smoothness and taste in a modest but persistent scent bubble. Just the way I like it.

Overall I get liberal sillage for the first few minutes only, followed by what I'd consider to be arm's length for maybe 2-3 hours, drawing back to about 12" after that. Total duration is longer than I initially expected, no less than 5-6 hours with only a moderate application (3-4 sprays total, neck and wrists). It's a bit on the sweeter side, but in a way that to me reeks of confidence and class. Wife loves it too.

EDIT: Over time, this has come to strike me as imbalanced and really cheap smelling -- cloyingly sweet and just a mess. It's one of those rare beasts that starts out great but wears out its welcome. Can't stand it now.

There is an undeniable "Calvin Klein DNA." From the original Obsession through Eternity to Contradiction, from CK One Shock to CK Be, Calvin Klein fragrances can usually be counted on to include a core of lavender, amber, bergamot (or some other citrus), and (usually) cedar.

This Obsessed release contains the lavender, amber, cedar, and citrus notes which mark it as very Calvin Klein.

It opens with a very bright citrus sweetness (heightened by pineapple, but sharpened by pepper) that lasts for a very long time. After a half hour or so, some floral shades start to appear, still topped off with the lemon and grapefruit notes.

As the final dry down approaches, the cardamom and lavender (grounded by a soft vanilla base) rise to the top and begin to stand out as compliments to the cedar and citrus, and the bouquet becomes extremely reminiscent of YSL's La Nuit de l'Homme (which also prominently features cardamom and lavender). I was rather taken aback by this similarity, and found it very pleasing.

There is very little connection between this fragrance and the original Obsession (or its flankers), but there doesn't need to be. This juice stands up all on its own.

The projection and longevity are both above average (I'm still catching fairly strong whiffs nearly 8 hours later), and this is a welcome change from recent Calvin Klein releases.

Thumbs up to this one. I'll be using it regularly during the warmer months.

I like this less than the women's version... but that isn't to say I dislike it. It's nothing groundbreaking but there's something chilly about it, sort of like a spiced sorbet? It's a little sweet, very spicy and the vanilla just makes it quite creamy.

I honestly think they nailed the 'I'll wear yours, you can wear mine' sort of thing with this.
I have a sensitive nose and taste, but the vanilla is so sweet and calming in this. Love it!
I sprayed this on liberally at the perfume counter and found it to be a clone of Eternity Night! Too bad. I thought it was a reformulation of Obsession. A cK blockbuster in the 1980s.
I like that the grapefruit note isn't as sharp as it usually is
It is very similar to Roberto Cavalli Uomo.

First, let me say that as a female, I’ve always been drawn to “male” fragrances with sweeter bases. They work nicely with my body chemistry, while “female” sweet fragrances usually turn intolerably, cloyingly sweet. I’ve been on the hunt for a gourmand men’s cologne for a long time, but unfortunately, this one isn’t going to work out for me.

The top phase was sweet vanilla, citrus, and leather. One of my first thoughts was “My goodness! This is so well-blended!” Then, the pepper came through and added a lot of personality to the vanilla note. This part of the wear reminded me of a spicier Dr. Pepper … really interesting! Unfortunately, I caught a few whiffs of what smelled like stale, citrusy orris, which was very off-putting. Most of the wear for this fragrance is heavy, masculine spice with an undercurrent of sharp, powdery vanilla. I get the slightest touch of ambroxan, but I can’t smell the cedar note at all. I also can’t pick up on the cardamom, but I suspect it’s just blended in with the pepper.

Good longevity and sillage; what you would expect from a traditional men’s cologne.

Unfortunately, this fragrance became too robust for me after about 2-3 hours of wear; too strong, too powdery, too sharp. It’s just too potent for me to feel comfortable wearing on a day-to-day basis. This is definitely unisex, though, and I know there are plenty of women that would love this fragrance.

The comparisons on here tell you everything you need to know about this site.

Ultra Male? YSL La Nuit? Ferragamo Black? Carolina Herrera VIP 212 Wild Party? Invictus?

Honestly it doesn't smell like any of those and none of those even smell like each other. FFS if you don't actually know what you're talking about it's better not to mislead others
Still waiting for the day I get told I smell "generic" or "safe" by the opposite sex.

I don't have nose like bloodhound, but to me it is almost 1:1 copy of Ferragamo Black. And by default it pretty similar to YSL la nuit de l'homme. Does not smell great, but can't say it stinks either. OK- scent, with decent longevity.If You are after uniqueness- You can pass that.

I wasn't expecting much from this, but it took me by surprise. In no means is it a masterpiece, but it's a good scent overall. Simplistic. It reminds me of a CK from the 90s or early 2000s. I like the touch of vanilla. It is definitely a skin scent.

Nice fresh ambroxan scent that
is very much unisex as well, one
of the better offerings from CK in
a while, very modern scent from the
house, i really like this one the more
i am wearing it the more i'm loving it.
The scent is 99% similar to 212 VIP wild party limited edition. It's a fashionable sintethic noze drilling fruity accord. It's a dupe.

Not a bad offering in the wonderful Obsession line; as a frag head who doesn't rate CK frags, my one exception being the original Obsession which was a heavenly creation (every rule has an exception right?), I am always going to check out anything from CK with the 'Obsession' moniker in it's branding.

This is a classic feel-good, sweet and sensual fragrance - no challenging notes or awkward layering here. It's like a less powerful course of Ultra Male by JPG. If you like Obsession Night or Creed's Virgin Island Water, you'll probably like this too. This is an ideal feel-good holiday scent when you're relaxing with a nice rum drink alongside your partner and you have a fresh white shirt on - good times!

Very impressed on this one. The oppening its very syrupy citrus juice. Remember me a candy or a ice cream. Its mixed with the cardamom. Dont like it that much. But after 1h i get a much more sweet woody thing that came for the vanilla and ambroxan. Very pleasing. Nothing new but its good. A solid 7/10.

It seems that after some risky things (Encounter, Reveal) Calvin Klein finally got their bestseller.
Shockingly in that beautiful transparent bottle I met a clone of JPG Ultra Male. After the first wearing I can't say there are any differences between them.
Obsessed is sweet, ultra sweet, super sweet fragrance with that bubble gum super fruity sirupy and a bit spicy dry down that is typical for Ultra Male. I got some iris in Obsessed that makes it closer to Zara Gourmand Leather.

That a good news for those who complain Ultra Male is discontinued or out of sale somewhere. Obsessed will be a right replacement. Like it.

As for womens Obsessed it smells almost the same as CK One. Quite strange duo to my mind.
It's not unpleasant, I'm struggling to see the actual notes in the fragrance if I'm honest, it is very feminine. Nice, but unoriginal.
perfect combo of freshness and little sweetness. Amazing mainstream juice. 8+/10. This juice smells like good wok from calvin Klein house, very pleasant, comfortable and sexy, that's all my folks

This is done right. From concept to scent. Funny how people are saying this is basic but those sane people wear CURVE AND FIERCE. Two of the most basic "bro" scents created. I think they achieved exactly what they wanted to with this. Currently have the full line now. From Shower gel to edt to aftershave . I can't wait for this to hit discounter. When it does it will be an even greater value. Hehe you don't have to agree. People online always want to dissent and hate . I'm cool with that . But try to let this one develop. It's a twist on vanilla done well.

Everyone is so quick to slag off Abroxan but I think it's a very interesting base and can be put to great use in these modern scents.
After wearing it became apparent this is fragrance of three distinct phases.
Obsessed is a strange one really because it opens very nicely with much of the Calvin Klein freshness and the intriguing charm of things like Crave or CK2. Unfamiliar, fresh spicy notes of kumquat or starfish or some crap like that but never the less very nice. Then it becomes abundantly clear that it might just be one of these confused, messy generic fragrances, a dud of little significance and quickly dismissed like many others and I don't think this is entirely down to the ambroxan. Anyway....Thankfully and quite inexplicably that subsides and Obsessed has a 'third act' so to speak which adds another twist to the tale, in the form of a creamy vanilla type warmth and maybe just maybe... the Labdanum listed in the notes? If you read my reviews you might know that I'm huge fan of that resin and although I can't place it in here as such, the base does have a nice cosy drydown so I'm not dismissing the possibility. Now normally the fresh, unusual, hard to place, top notes, coupled with a crowd pleasing generic heart and a warm (or 'sensual' as they will market it as) vanilla/synth amber drydown sounds like my idea of a horrible frgrance trying to be all things to all people and doing none of them right.
However, I quite like Obsessed. I kinda wish CK had the bravery to make a pungent, masculine call back to the original Obsession, now that would've peaked my interest.
I'll have to wear this again but the opening was very pleasant, I have no issue with abroxan and the boring aspects weren't too boring and the creamy drydown is nice....so it's a like from me.

Guys this 95% Prada l'homme intense. I am wearing them on both hands and they smell similar. Ck obsessed opening is much better thought the dry down is the same. Prada l'homme intense has a better performance.

I agree with the review below mine. Neither version of obsessed for men or women is anything that really stands out. I personally really like thus version for men far more than obsessed for women. I think it's rather unisex. Very fresh with a CK be/CK one vibe. My boyfriend loves CK one, I think he'll really like obsessed. I just ordered him a bottle, so we'll see. If he somehow ends up not liking it, which I'm positive he will, I'd keep it for myself.
another unnecessary fragrance ... better than female version, but that's all, nthing special. If you want to be really obsessed get original Obsession wich is far more better than this Kleinvictus :)

I begin with a disclaimer. I did NOT want to like this men's cologne, Obsessed. To my way of thinking, the last decent thing CK offered was "Truth," in 2002, and even it has fallen by the wayside. So, with a mind full of jaded skepticism, I went into Belk and sprayed it on. Wow! I was intrigued. Went to look at the notes; I was impressed. Waited for the scent to settle in; I was excited. It's UNlike ANYthing out there right now, and in a good way! It smells as transparent as it looks (which is clean and simple), but the transparency is, you "get" the notes. Blast of citrus, then woods, then a solid base of ambrox, patchouli, and an amazingly male scent friendly vanilla note. One of the cleanest frags I've sprayed in awhile. Definitely worth having in your rotation; plus the price is reasonable. Oh yes, there WILL be "haters" out there (some folks hate for the sheer joy of hating); but if you give it a fair hearing (smelling), you will want it, for sure. Along with "Sauvage Really Cool Spray," one of the best newbies out there.
I'm sorry I love this . Perfect for summer. Obsessed with this. Fresh sweet and masculine. Love the minimal appearance of the bottles and the packaging . A win for CK. Current signature scent!
Borderline feminine scent as its so fresh and sweet. Would work as a night time date scent and has good sillage and longevity, but its such a strong, fresh scent, its definitely not for everyone.
So I guess ambroxan is the new "must-have" fragrance note now?

I have to say I like this, nothing to do with the original 80's obsession concept. This scent takes on a whole new modern concept of the idea of obsession and the attraction of musk.

Bottles and packaging is nicely done. Wished the original kidney shaped bottle concept was used for the women's bottle.

I actually really enjoy this. I can for sure see this as a fall staple but it's not too heavy where you can't wear it in the summer. On my skin the vanilla is well done . This is a scent you throw on after a shower when you want something light but still with depth and character. This is also unisex. A woman can for sure wear this too. Great release from Calvin Klein
We just got this in store. It smells like water. It's so light and fresh :/ reminds me of a lighter euphoria.

@fausto74 what's wrong with you man? To "gay" really? There is no fragrance that is made with the intention of it being "gay". And so what if it was. Your comment sounds ignorant and homophobic. I don't know you so I'm. It going to say you are those things but when you but gay in quotation marks in kinda makes it look like you are. Try again buddy.
