from CK website

I'm imagining something like Luna Rossa meets Bleu de Chanel

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2014 Calvin Klein
review_content: Sooooo much better option for either Eternity Aqua or Air. The thing is, this smell better and last longer on me than it on other people, at least in my family (everybody said so). Or maybe it's just because I don't really have body odor? IDK but this is good! I'd say definitely unisex. I've smelt more masculine scent on some women perfumes than Eternity Summer

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2014 Calvin Klein
review_content: This, Sun Java, Reaction (and flanker T-shirt),and Curve Appeal made up my "summer of watermelon." Of the 5, I liked Sun Java the best due to the vanilla note. But this is also a good fragrance. No need to do a big breakdown as others already a done so. It is indeed watermelon and clean linen sheets. Throw in a slightly weak pear note and you've got this scent. The watermelon is somewhat weak as well but still noticeable. It's not bad at all and a perfectly good summer selection. Not unique and Calvin Klein has even released similar fragrances to this one in different years. It doesn't project very well and I'd say it lasts 3-4 hours so only so so longetivity. This is starting to sound negative but it's a good summer scent overall...at it's price point! I paid @$20 and at that price I'm pretty happy. A good one to throw in the summer lineup for a changeup.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2014 Calvin Klein
review_content: My 1st adventure with eternity summer. This 2014 edition was something I blind bought due to its bargain price and interesting notes. Huber had it right on his review. Watermelon and a fresh linen aquatic is what this cologne is. The watermelon is synthetic though. A light musky, woodsy accord appears at the dry down but the fruity vibe is still there. It's projection and silage are in the "average" range for a summer aquatic. It lasts a few hours before disappearing. For its price, it's a good value.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2014 Calvin Klein
review_content:
First, the bottle looks darker "in person," and it has a rainbow effect as well, sort of like horizontal stripes every other inch or so (thus the picture may be for a different flanker). Anyway, there is a rather standard woody amber base, but it seems a bit less generic, perhaps because some sandalwood aroma chemicals were added. It's a little fruity, a little herbal, and with a touch of spice. The musk is mild, and it doesn't come across as especially "synthetic," though the depth and note separation is as your would expect (clearly not "niche quality"). It's not especially strong but it's certainly "nice," and I guess many would call it excellent as a casual or gym scent. I'm on the fence about keeping this one, because I have the more interesting Cactus Shot by Everlast, and I don't wear these kinds of scents often.

UPDATE: The aroma chemicals finally got to me with this one, so I returned it. I think if I sprayed the air and walked through it, it might be okay, but I've got so many scents I hardly ever wear I didn't even want another bottle taking up space in hopes that some day I might like it.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2014 Calvin Klein
review_content: Not bad.however I donot smell any watermelon. I do smell watermellon rind but not the sweet meat. Very citrus. Not sweet.Nice summer sent. Good for the beach or outside work in hot temps.I live in florida. work at a sport complex so I use it sometimes at work in the summer.my guys tell me I smell like a citrus grove.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2014 Calvin Klein
review_content:
A welcome summer edition of the original...has a watermelon/candy-sweet/aquatic/bubblegum scent that dries down to the smell of clean laundry.
Light and short-lived, but it is a summer scent after all.
I say if you have $20-25 to spare and are somewhat of a collector as I am then snag a bottle. Else you can stick with any other light/summer scent that fills that place in your lineup.

Given the scent and price point, no complaints here.
Good casual scent for school, gym, out of the shower, errands, even office. I sometimes wear it to bed because it simply smells light, refreshing, and soothing. You could douse yourself in it and still not overwhelm a room, so that's a plus since I'm a bit heavy-handed. :-P

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2014 Calvin Klein
review_content: It's a nice, clean generic fragrance that kind of brings back simplicity in the many complex fragrances currently in the market. If you just want to smell good and not be overpowering or intrusive to the personal air space of another then this is for you.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2014 Calvin Klein
review_content: Generic but still good, i will still buy it.. It's perfect for summer! I can't wait to wear this on my vacation to Phi Phi Island, Thailand :D

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2014 Calvin Klein
review_content: By reading some negative reviews about this perfume on the internet, I thought it was a bad idea to buy this pefume. But I really wanted a cologne for summer. So I decided to try it on my skin when I went to the store. And I have to admit that, although not a powerful fragrance, is very good, pefect for hot days. It is soft, nice, cool. I really like it. Regarding longevity, it's good for a summer cologne, I could feel the smell present 5-6 hours on my skin.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2014 Calvin Klein
review_content:
Smells great for like two seconds. I sprayed 2 to the neck, 3 chest, and 2 to outer wrist.....after an hour very faint... very poor longevity and projection.

I wear it like axe, and keep the bottle in my briefcase.

I do love the all 3 phases of this juice.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2014 Calvin Klein
review_content: Great fragrance I bought the 2013 version for a discounted price wish I would've waited cause I like this one a little better the watermelon and apricot kind of give it a bubble gum type of smell but it is extra fresh and so clean its a nice scent to add to your summer fragrance lineup its affordable too

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2014 Calvin Klein
review_content:
kind of sweet,but very fresh amazing projection
and longevity for a calvin klein,got a lot of compliments that truly i did not expect frome this
cologne.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2014 Calvin Klein
review_content: Like a bubblegum I used to chew when I was a child... too much sweet and girly... not a scent for me...

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2014 Calvin Klein
review_content: I have both of them of the Summer 2014 line for men. I like this one as well. Both are just like having sunshine and summer in a bottle. This one gets compliments from the first spray. I work in a Department Store and am constantly in the Fragrance department sniffing around. I smelled them both before we got the sale bottles from the Vendor. This one is great, lives up to the Eternity name and will definitely get you noticed in a sexy subtle summer night way. This is what a Nicholas Sparks beach romance smells like.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2014 Calvin Klein
review_content: Tried it today. Fresh, sweet watermelon fragrance. Actually a good surprise I liked it. Probably will choose this one over the CK One summer 2014 :)

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2014 Calvin Klein
review_content: I wanna try this, when does it come out?

Smells really good and classic, an evergreen scent. Be warned that the performance on this fragrance is next to nothing. Its only suitable for short errands where you're not really planning to meet/see anyone.

I have loved and worn this scent on and off for over a decade. It's fresh, fruity and quite light. Its perfect for hot weather. Though it seems that the longevity seems to have reduced over the years, it still offers good value for money.
Very nice, very simple. If youre looking to gift someone a basic and agreeable, but still nice fragrance then this is a great choice.
reviewer_name: Number one La Beu Pg hate

review_content: It's still a hit today. My 18-year-old son smells fantastic when he wears this perfume. It has good longevity and projection. Great value for money in terms of quality. The success of this creation by Alberto Morillas had such a huge impact on the global market that, within a few years, people started to consider it generic. The first reason was that almost everyone had been using it since the mid-90s, and the second was the large number of imitations that appeared. Despite this, it has stood the test of time and here it is, better than ever. Enjoy!

O cardomomo e gengibre lembra o CK ONE, pelo menos na minha pele!
Sei que cada pele traz uma percepção diferente, e assim são os sentidos.
Still a classic that I reach for. Definitely cool undertones that evokes professional and calm.

clean, fresh, citrusy... nothing special honestly, it's unisex and it's nice, i owned a bottle previously but i would not repurchase. i just think there are so many better options nowadays for a fresh and clean perfume. also, i don't think i like citrus scents. :(

Unique smell, a lot of notes, but it is actually very simple. I dont feel this on others ever, so I wouldnt worry of its popularity. As a female would like this smell on a man equally, very fresh, woody but fresh out of the shower smell
Easy and light, after all it is a toilette, so keep that in mind. Although it will list moderately it will only be intimately felt (and that is if you have the type of skin that retains smell well)
Youthful but its suitable for all generations
If you wish for a light energetic dash of smell, especially during spring, this is a solid choice

I dont understand the CK1 hate? Its a fresh and clean scent that obviously doesn't last the longest, but im not sure what you expect from a cheaper perfume.
Other than how long it lasts, i dont have any problems with this perfume. Its calming and refreshing, and sometimes thats all you need from a scent!
Overall a beautiful and clean jasmine.

Would genuinely rather go for a mile run without deo on and have to sit in that smell all day than smell like this cloying inhuman bs. Sorry but the 90s and 2000s set perfume culture back and we are still recovering
Smells similar to Quercus penhaligons
Smells like my grandma house lmao....
ی شاهکار جاودانه و ماندگار و اثر هنری از آلبرتو موریلاس و برند کالوین کلین

Got it as gift from an unc who didn't like it after he used it half way down the bottle, I was 14 anyways and didn't know whatever this was lol.

Somehow I liked the way it smell, so I wore it on morning after showers but that was all, nothing memorable and fun to have the huge Ck logo bottle around.

Kinda silly to hate on it.
Peppery, green, citrus top that almost makes you feel like you've layered 4711 on a modern, woody unisex.
The only pineapple fragrance I can wear. I have to be super hot and sweaty to even detect it slightly.
The florals are nice and toothy, all complimenting the semi-astringent earthiness of the rose, while carrying the freshness of that laundry musk.
The green tea and synthetic oak moss really help keep the cedar and sandalwood from smelling like a typical off-brand unisex.
I don’t know why would anyone like this perfume in 2025. Unless you already love the smell , Don’t buy it. There are so many better perfumes
Generic synthetic green citrus smell. Pointless and boring.
cheap smelling; in the first minutes it reminds me of overspraying deodorant and cleaning products; then it transitions into a bland lemonish smell of cleaning products
Clean Laundry (Musk dominant). Sprayed on clothes it gives that 90s clean clothes smell.
a good unisex perfume, pretty citrusy. can’t really smell the woods notes but it does have something in it that makes it smell like not a pure citrus perfume. good price too

Smells really nice fresh and citrusy at the opening, drying down into a pleasant floral scent. Perfect for daily wear, the gym, or after a shower. It’s unisex, budget-friendly, and works well as a grab-and-go fragrance. The only drawback is that it doesn’t last very long on my skin.
Fresh fresh fresh. Does NOT last. Zero sillage. But great smell.

A beautiful timeless freshie with quite a long lasting power.
It is a true pleasure to wear it. Don’t bother with “niche” fragrances with crazy prices when you can get this very nice scent for peanuts.
I love it!

It’s impossible to not have smelled this classic vintage citrusy scent before. Yes it can be unisex though it stays more on the masculine side in my opinion. It lasts long enough and the price is good.

CK One makes me feel calm and changes my mood slightly towards zen. It is the best fresh & clean scent, when you wanna make everyone around you comfortable. It especially is great for working in social & healthcare, where I do work.

Anyone wanna know what cola without soda smells like? Buy some and smell it lol

6/10
It is a wonderful creation. Unisex (works really well on all genders), proyects enough for a fresh scent and the price is fear.

A pleasant enough scent, lemony up top and then powdery with a hint of pepper. Elegant, fresh, clean. I keep a bottle on my desk and apply it liberally four or five times a day and before I go to bed. It just doesn't last longer than a couple of hours. I get a vibe from it similar to Tabac. Not the scent profile but the sense of wearing a fragrance that's "nice" rather than distinctive. I'm all for that.

I had inherited by dad's bottle from the 90's in high school and re-bought a vintage bottle to revisit it. Off the bat, it smelled really cheap, almost like a sunscreen or a boy's shower gel. After spraying and sitting for a day, it really showed its true colors- warm, soapy, spa-like. It's definitely green, but not in a room-spray way. It's wonderfully subtle, and a fragrance I'm excited to smell on myself during the day rather than for others to notice when I enter the room. It seems like it was made to be personal- hence, not much projection. I really see this working well right out of the shower, letting that freshness radiate through the day. The citrus initially is a bit sharp in an almost cleaning fluid way, but the longer it's on you the more it softens to a refreshing soap. Didn't get any scent memory from using it in high school, so maybe the formula gradually changes after opening?

citrusy nostalgic bomb for all yall fragrance uncs out there. is there any reason to get this in 2025 except the nostalgia? no. there are 100 better basic citrus fragrances out there also the longevity is bad. projection is ok though 👍 i will not rate it as its more of a nostalgic scent for people than something they will actually wear everyday. also, my dad wears this too cause of, quote, the nostalgia

Its must better to just take your $40 and buy mont blanc legend spirit or Lattafa Khamrah or even Rasasi Hawas, not worth it imo.

CK One by Calvin Klein is a timeless classic, and the one that started it all for me. It’s more than just a fragrance; it’s a time capsule. One spray and I’m instantly transported back to high school: late nights watching infomercials for Pure Moods (the CD set not sold in stores), early mornings, and Nas’ “It Was Written” playing in the background as the soundtrack to my life.

This was the scent that defined my high school years, and it’s hands-down the reason I fell in love with fragrances in the first place. While others were into Polo Blue, Clinique Happy, or Hugo Boss, I was all in on CK One and Cool Water.

For years, CK One was my daily signature. Clean, citrusy, and effortlessly cool. It struck the perfect balance between fresh and noticeable, just a solid fragrance that always delivered. Even now, in 2025, it still holds up as a gold standard for everyday wear. I’ve owned more bottles of CK One than I can remember, and I always have a bottle on hand, including right now, in 2025.

Wearing it today floods me with memories and reminds me why I started this fragrance journey. CK One isn’t just a scent, it’s my foundation. A classic. And for me, it will always be the one that started it all.

Such a clean fresh fragrance and such an iconic, classic 90s scent! I smell citrus and vaguely floral notes. It's def unisex, I can totally see either a man or a woman pulling this off. I'm kinda sad I just pulled this out today as summer is ending because it's such a perfect hot weather scent. Definitely cooling and refreshing to smell.
Projection 10 minutes then disappears, it is not a perfume for outdoor use, it is just after shower or to enjoy it at home, or toilet refresher, that set.
A nice light scent that is perfect for the office, a hot summer day, or the gym!

Fresh citrus and green aromatics, with a bit of a soapy undertone to it. The projection is nice but it projects the soapy accord way more than the other stuff. I got the 15ml of this, and I will definitely use it up but afterwards I probably won't repurchase.
Ultimate nostalgia. The smell of my one and only heartbreak (we both wore CK One). Shout out to the L Word for introducing me to this back in the day.

This one opens straight-up window cleaner, then settles into a soft, soapy, white floral citrus scent. Light, breezy, clean. Fresh laundry with a floral twist.

I assumed this would be a simple citrus-forward scent. But once I sprayed it on skin, I was surprised at how floral it got. Soft floral jasmine, and a soapy lily of the valley note. I've learned my skin chemistry really pulls florals forward, even in fragrances that aren’t marketed that way. (Same thing happens with Club de Nuit Intense Man and Acqua di Parma Colonia Essenza. On paper, citrus bombs. On me? Floral central.)

It’s nice. Gives white shirt on a spring day. Clean, safe, inoffensive. It doesn’t project much, so it’s a solid choice for overspraying without offending noses. But personally? I could live without it. It smells good, sure. But doesn’t wow me or feel essential in any way.

Supposedly citrusy, yet it embodies the masculinity that this fragrance actually inaugurated. I wouldn’t treat it as competition for fresh scents. CK focuses on the horizontal plane (not vertical) and doesn’t provide a truly uplifting quality.

So, in its lightness, it remains a scent striving for manliness, not for freshness.

Smells good but, sadly, not for me. I find it relaxing but don’t see me reaching for this in hot weather since it’s oddly cloying to my nose. I can’t quite put my finger on what it is but there’s an oily quality that puts me on the edge of nausea.

I will be reluctantly returning this.

It's the first time using this eau de toilette. I bought it because I needed a fresh scent to use during the summer, that would feel okay to spray on my skin all day long, and I'm very glad I did. After reading reviews, I don't get the hate. It feels like a flagship, timeless fragance, and the fact it was never discontinued speaks volumes about how popular and well-rounded it is from a perfumery perspective. The sillage is correct. You can take this one to the office and public transport. It won't bother anyone with a strong scent, but it will sit nicely on you making you feel fresh and clean. It reminds me a bit of shower gel, which only adds to the freshness and cleanliness of the scent. To me, it's sharp, and citrusy, with some soft florals. It's perfect for summertime and the heat. As for longevity, it depends on everyone's skin, but it lasts over 6 hours on me. I applied it before bed and woke up this morning and I could definitely smell it yet. This was a staple for me a year ago to the point where I wore it almost religiously. Back then I felt like the woody and green notes were so prominent, I did not feel like I smelled "manly" but I did not feel it smelled too "feminine" on me, but I loved it as I felt fresh and clean. I stopped using it after I finished a bottle and moved on to Tommy Girl.
I decided to revisit it after a year- I grabbed my mom's bottle and sprayed myself. Now CK One smells super floral and fresh on me, more "feminine" leaning than before.
I do not know if this is just a change in my skin's pH, influenced by the current weather, me becoming a bit "nose blind" to certain notes after using it for so long, or if the formula changed. And honestly? I don't really care. I loved how it smelled back then and I love how it smells now.

Ignore those comments saying this is "tiring" as everyone and their mothers used it. Who cares? If you want a fresh, clean, classic perfume, this is almost 100% a safe blind buy. I have never heard anyone in real life complaining about smelling it too often, about it being overdone, cloying, too "90s" or "highschool reminiscent". Enjoy this perfume for what it is and what it smells like to you.

A Tragic Tale of Citrus, Identity, and a Love That Couldn’t Last

Ah, Calvin Klein CK One — This is the OG unisex fragrance, created in a time when people thought sharing a cologne was a cute relationship milestone, right after making a mixtape and slightly before getting matching denim jackets.

Spraying CK One is like stepping into a citrus cloud that's been filtered through a Gap commercial from 1994. It opens enthusiastic citrus “HELLO I’M AWAKE,” followed by some floral notes that whisper, “But I’m also emotionally available.”

The dry down? A soft, warm, just-a-hint-of-musk and spice, skin scent that clings like a hug from someone who says things like “Let’s just vibe.” It’s the fragrance equivalent of drinking sparkling water in a linen shirt while sitting on a windowsill, contemplating your next spontaneous road trip to nowhere.

Lasting power? Let’s just say CK One likes to Irish goodbye your skin after about 3–4 hours. But hey, it’s not ghosting — it’s mysterious.

Final thoughts: If you want to smell like a fresh breeze flirting with a spicy citrus tree, CK One is your jam. Just be prepared for at least one person to say, “Oh my god, I used to wear that in high school!”

THE BREAKDOWN

Longevity: 4–6 hours — like your last situationship: light, fresh, and gone before dinner
Projection: Moderate — people will notice… if they’re close enough to borrow your hoodie
Smells like: A citrusy blast of 90s nostalgia, clean laundry, and unbothered confidence
Best for: Literally anyone — your girlfriend, your roommate, your mom... yourself.
Rating: 7/10 — iconic, but not gonna pay your bills
Vibe: Genderless angel sipping lemon water while ignoring drama

u spray it, it smells pretty good, its gone. Tis the life of CK one. Wouldn't go out of my way to buy this nor I recommend doing so unless u wanna blind buy it for your stinky pre-teen. I felt compelled to leave another review, since the fragrance is working perfectly with my mood and today's bright, sunny day with beautiful flowers blooming at 13'C. This is a masterpiece indeed. There's no other way to describe it. There is a good reason why modern releases from niche houses get inspiration from such masterpieces from the old days, because they know these are great scents. If you've been looking down on it because of its low price and the label or your association with your youth, you need to get rid of your judgments. This scent reminded me how good of a fragrance house Calvin Klein was and still is... I am going to get a few other bottles from this house.

And this is a unisex fragrance. Both men and women would enjoy this scent... Thank you Calvin Klein.

banning myself from wearing this ever again, not because it’s bad but because it smells like me during a specific 6 months of university when I had a sample bottle of this, my dad, and also an ex of mine, all at once. absolutely classic fragrance though, whenever I get a whiff of it from someone it’s like seeing an old friend.
Good but basic starter cologne, great for kids and teenagers just getting into fragrances. Good for after the gym or in class, quite the boring smell though.
Free hotel shower gel.
androgynous prostitute (positive)

I have a bottle from 2024, and it smells as great as older versions of One. I was afraid that the latest reformulation might ruin it, but it turned out the scent is wonderful. It truly made me feel grateful to be able to get such a great cologne at a great price. The classic stays classic.

Opening is heavy but uplifting citrus, made me smile. On my skin, the initial dry down is powdery and smells just like the paraffin wax hand/feet dip that my mom and grandma were obsessed with back in the early 2000s. It's a very nostalgic scent to me. As it develops I'm getting some spicier and woody notes. It smells like Johnson's baby shampoo. Over all I am happy to have a 15 ml of this for Spring, we'll see if I want to keep to keep it around long term. I'm not sure if I like it enough to wear on its own but I think will be easy to layer with other scents.
5/5 is really a great fragrance

A fragrance that - in my opinion - has become a classic thanks to its simplicity and universality.

It’s primarily made up of green notes and refreshing lemon, but also jasmine and gently woody undertones. Marketed as unisex, I wore it a bit in the past, but I found it leaned more toward the masculine side, so I gave it to my boyfriend.

A great summer option, simple and effective: a fragrance that easily suits all occasions and all ages.

This just smells like bitter lemon peels and cold water, dont let the notes fool you, and it lasts just like if you put water on skin, 2-3 hrs and no projection. Timeless and influential cologne but not worth getting in 2025.

this smells like lemon water. it’s just a “your skin but better” scent. when i imagine rich 20-something’s, i think of this smell. i think it’s just a good smell. versatile. friendly, but still with an air of “i’m better than you”.
If you're going out somewhere and don't know what to wear, just wear this.

muito sem graça no momento que eu passo, só dá para sentir o amadeirado, na minha pele o citrico nao aparece. depois ele sai e o floral entra mais em cena e o perfume fica mais interessante. caro demais para durar tão pouco.
One of my started fragrances. Smells sugary lemon with some baby powder. I'd say there is better fragrances at this price range .bad side it lacks progection and longevity no more that 2 hrs

Nothing screams 90s to me like this one. It was the beginning of the supermodels, Levis 501 jeans and that time everyone smelled like ck-one. It was the first unisex fragrance we used back then, it had such a moment, and had a massive cultural impact. This was used both by men and women-not shocking now, but unheard of at the time.
I know based on todays options this is no longer very impressive but in my mind this changed how we approached fragrance, it encapsulated a cultural moment. It is a fresh, fun, and light smell, but also a synthetic mess. But still, will always have a special place in my heart.

This fragrance is definitely not as complicated as it looks on the notes. Like all of the comments below me said if u r going to be outside for more than 2hours this is definitely not worth even spraying. Its a nice comforting woody fresh citrusy scent that unfortunately doesn't last long. ı found this fragrance ideal for the gym and probably only that. any other occasion and its basically the same as not wearing any fragrance at all.

This is a classic , simple perfume .
Don't bother looking at that crazy scent profile this smells like lemon and some wood with a huge alcohol smell in the background , very manly and old smelling , if it had a better longevity it would've cost 10x because its genuinely so nice and comforting .
Buy this for gym/regular day to day use -> if you know you're out for more than 2+ hours don't put this or layer it

It’s hilarious to me that their extremely minimalist packaging and the crazy number of ingredients are so at odds.
Regardless of any mismatch, this is a wonderfully wearable and refreshing fragrance--I think I will return to it with small bottles from time to time. Not too long lasting but sophisticated and casual at the same time.

Fairly sharp citrus smell at first, then simmers down into a balance of floral and powdery smell. The sillage and longevity is not great, but for the price its fair.

Overall it is simple and clean -is the way that you're making me feel tonight-.
Your average greedy citrus fragrance. Not different at all.

Perfect unisex fragrance that doesn't offend your coworker's nose. My go-to fragrance when i don't know what to pick but still want to smell good if someone comes close. Very safe pick. Clean & Fresh.

Something about this spring made me curious about the 90's flowery scents. Something smelling like light clean bouquets, with a twist that i mostly can't find in current designer perfumes. While i remembered the name of this perfume, the last time i smelled it was as a teenager ten years ago.

It was about the time to try this well-known thing. And it was exactly what i was looking for. Very lightly floral but complex smell, a little soapy and powdery in a way that makes you feel freshly bathed. In the base i smell a hint of oak moss, sandalwood and green tea. Sits beautifully on the skin and people around me found it pleasant too. Clean, office-friendly scent.

Now I understand the work that goes into fragrances and I try not to crap on them because for every group that doesn't like it , there's a ton of other people that find it very good.
For Me: I went out and smelled this at Macy's when it came out. To my nose it smells feminine. Not overtly feminine, but this isn't unisex.

If you look at the heart notes described above it's plain as day that they're in there..... a lot of Florals. A thumbs down for me.
In fact if I'm correct this fragrance started the whole unisex vibe. And it was a very very slowwwwww start back then. Today you have unisex fragrances that are neutral, which I am definitely cool with.

****Revolutionary wise, creating a new unisex category in the world of fragrance I give it a 9 for historical purposes, but other than that. It's feminine, mehhh 🫳
Powdery old man scent. Terrible performance and sillage.
A pleasant smell, definitely more spring and summer, but very average performance and projection but a very safe fragrance
Reminds me of the smell of a clean bathroom

To all the haters, get over yourselves. There are many better fragrances (although personally I like this one - think of it as spring/summer cologne-style) but very few ever become as iconic. This fragrance was groundbreaking and has cemented it's place as a hall of fame. Consider how many fashion or fragrance icons you can own and wear daily having such an accessible price.
How or why iconic? Consider that his was the first fragrance properly marketed as unisex; in fact it's aim was to be a fragrance for all. Quite a mission brief but it is pulled off with simple apolomb. Consider the then revolutionary, almost brutalist, industrial packaging with the opaque glass and metal, with its simple logo stamped on. It was born in the 90s an era where gender started to free itself from the traditional lines. Men became Metrosexual, Kate Moss became the ultimate supermodel, grunge and counter culture became popular. CK one cut across all these lines and boundaries, and let me remind you how hard it is to accomplish such feats.
Like Chanel No 5, it doesn't matter if you like it or not, it has moved beyond that. It is a defining statement

Fresh, citrusy, simple. It's not something you buy to stand out but something you can rely on time and time again. I love this for day-to-day wear in the spring and summer. Will have to reapply after a few hours but it's also really good value so.
If you only need something to smell nice this is good but it’s way too generic and simple if you want to stand out at least a minimum

Freshly cleaned, washed and ironed white t-shirt. That's what comes to my mind if I think of CK One. Someone else mentioned before it has a creamy nivea feel to it. I think it comes quite close, though to my nose ck one is way more pleasant smelling. Has a green-citrusy opening and maybe after 1 hour goes closer to the skin but sometimes still smelling it around me. Fresh, herbal, soapy in dry down. People say this is not long lasting. Of course it gets weaker after a while but I was wearing it yesterday again and it lasted easy 7 hours plus. Close to the skin, not projecting too much but still there. I like it for what it is and as casual wear at home or to the gym. Solid 7.5/10. (I'm male if that matters)

Synthetic. I do not recommend at all!.

Does not worth the price at all, I smell citruses yes, but very synthetic.

صناعي جدا جدا ، لايستاهل سعره على الاطلاق نظرا لضعف النقاء، بساطة العطر ، ضعف الأداء بشكل عام

عطر ضعيف ، يمكن كان قوي قبل 10 سنوات لكن اخر اصدار منه سيء وضعيف جدا

Very light, fresh and inoffensive scent. This was my Mom’s signature scent back in the day and it just reminds me of her, so that is my main reason for liking it.

As some of the other reviews mention, the hate is 100% unwarranted.
I feel so embarrassed, but I'm tired of pretending I don't like this 😭 This smells really good...on absolutely anybody else except me.

It smells like citrus and floreal, very good for summer and spring, but the performance is very weak as an alternative i reccomend lacoste 12.12 that has a similar scent but better in my opinion and last 6 hours, a better ck perfume is ck reflections that is very fresh.
smells like piss, generic 4/10
Kristen Stewart with a mullet vibes (honorific)

STRONG green citrus opening that in about 15 minutes fades into.....almost nothing at all. grass clippings and laundry? smells athletic, showering at the gym kinda scent. the drydown barely travels one inch beyond my skin. boring on a cis man, kinda cool on anyone else

Signature scent of poor financial decisions and phoniness. This is a scent that I cannot separate the fragrance from the people who I always encountered wearing it. From high school to when I was a bartender, I knew immediately the type of person to expect when a scent wall of CK One entered the scene and slapped everyone in the nose on its way past. I wish I didn’t have such biased associations with it because its description sounds lovely.

My dad used to wear this back in early to mid 2000s. I remember seeing the glass bottle on the shelf and wanting to touch it because it looked so sophisticated! Citrusy scent hiding the slightly powdery surprise that resembles a pristine white sheets. Very clean, very sharp. I can imagine it as both a casual and a professional scent as it’s not offensive or polarizing. Maybe not for colder days as it can get off-putting. Not for me (as much as I am still drawn by the cool bottle at the store!!) because I prefer sweeter, more exotic scents that my dad doesn’t really approve of, but if you want to smell like crispy cool with some garnish of cold sliced lemons, I can assure you this is the way to go!
I absolutely hate fresh and citrusy fragrances and this is as fresh and as citrusy as they get 5/10.If i liked fresh scents I would have rated it a 9.5/10.

My mom's signature scent throughout my teenage years. I recently bought her a full size bottle for her birthday. She only had a mini in her bathroom and hadn't worn it in years. She was thrilled and immediately doused herself in it. Her smile was beaming. She was in the recovery center at the hospital at the time and had made quick friends with two other ladies there. She showed it to one and she asked her kids to get her a bottle for her next birthday. It smells like a well rounded approachable person. I may need to buy a bottle for myself, so I can bring my mom to work. She's a freaking cool lady.

Back to this scent after a break. A while back I collected a 200ml bottle for £27 ($34), but at this moment, can be acquired for £23.76 (bargain price) via Amazon Subscribe & Save. Like I thought back then, and many years before when I first got it, the hate for this fragrance is completely unwarranted. I've seen comments ranging from 'it's disgusting' to foul to garbage, etc.

I honestly think those who make those comments need to have nasal surgery because their ability to smell is not in working normal order. Seriously...

This neither smells disgusting nor the best fragrance ever. What it does smell like is a fresh inoffensive great summer fragrance. If you are heading out somewhere and want to smell good or just freshen up without caring to spend £255 for Louis Vuitton's Imagination or Pacific Chill and still achieve the same results, you can't go wrong with this.

I like other fragrances more than this one (most of them are considerably more expensive than CK One), but I still really enjoy this and like it significantly more than some other more costly ones, too, and can appreciate the perfumery at a great price.

i love when I smell this on my man. It’s fresh, aromatic, and soapy.
There’s a hack ( or meybe a secret 🫢) in the Gulf countries of the Middle East where they add a few drops of a good quality oud oil to the perfume. I haven’t tried it or smelled it , but I see it a lot on TikTok and they said It gives a touch of luxurious
Let me know if you try it
A cologne to wear when you dont want to wear cologne. Perfectly unisex, inoffensive, and classic.

My favorite right now, especially to go to school. There isn't much of a sillage but I feel like that's better in a learning environment, but I still get compliments every day for how I smell:) It's a very fresh, clean scent that I feel is mass appealing. I don't know about other people but it lasts pretty long on me?
It's alright. Like nice hand soap

A monument to my youth. This will forever evoke visions of dodgy Caesar haircuts, plain white tees, buxom blondes and malnourished models. A sentimental favorite that I will always keep around and a scent that continues to remain relevant despite the tides of trends and time. You can still spray this on and feel like a sexy boy. And not in any way, however, like a boy toy.

7/10. I always doubt the notes on this site cause no way in god damn hell does this cologne have all those notes. This is a soapy powdery fresh slightly spicy smell but overall pretty generic bro. Honestly almost smells like a lotion or suncreen lol. Like it's pretty good but cmon bruh y'all be making shit up.

CK One is a perfect, sweet, refreshing blend.
Sugary rose is prominent, but the lemon citrus note keeps the sweet, powdery, floral elements from becoming too much like candy. Deep, herbal tea bass notes keep this from being too flat. It is a little soapy and fresh, but still feels modern and not overly nostalgic. Both masculine and feminine in equal measure, which is quite an accomplishment.
This is not a powerhouse in terms of projection and endurance, but I find it stronger than others seem to. I also would have no problem carrying a small, decanted spray bottle of this around with me in the summer to reapply every now and then.

Dont know if it sounds believable or not, but this lasts for like 5 minutes and then vanishes.
You have to smell up close to find the scent but otherwise its as equivalent to wearing absolutely nothing.
decent but lasts for 2 seconds

I was at Sephora looking for a perfume, and decided to smell CK One for nostalgia, and to see if the formula had changed. It has, and it smells putrid now! It used to smell fresh, citrusy, slightly musky and good! It smelled very fresh. The reformulation smells nothing like the old one. It is a totally different and disgusting scent that smells musty and sick.
I’m just smelling this for the first time. Incredible and the hate is unwarranted. Sure it isn’t the strongest but this is well blended

Good for the price but it last as long as i do in bed. Its not worth the money even do its cheap. I would save that money to buy something a bit more expensive.

Other than that the smell itself is very soapy and fresh, nothing crazy but its cool.
4-5/10

Very, very green, Almost like grass.

The citrus is soft and disappears really quickly (as citrus tends to do) but it's nice to smell on the initial spray

The rest of the fruits / flowers / woods are only there if you're looking for them, not very pronounced.

Really cheap price tag though and overall a good frag

I vividly remember when this fragrance came out in the 90's. I've adored it for years. That being said, it seems like the formula and notes have subtly changed over time. The citrus seems softer and less pronounced than it used to be. I still love this perfume though. It's so fresh.
Summer, young, sun, nature,...
Personally my favourite perfume for years. Its great for everyday wear, as it has a simple, clean and citrusy smell to it. Good for pairing body mists if youre like me.

CK one is one of mi favorite fragrances. I'm not very objective about this scent, since I've loved it since I was a teenager. Started to wear it back in the 2000's, at that time there was a lot of advertising for the Calvin Klein brand, on television and specifically, a lot of advertising for this fragrance. I started using it when I was in high school, and since then I have always had a bottle, whether in its original version or some of their summer flankers, and other flankers that they have made. I find it so timeless and it looks so good on any skin. It's not the most long-lasting fragrance, but due to its cost we can apply it without suffering for the price. At the top, what I perceive most are the Citrus notes, I am not able to perceive the other fruits. As it dries, what I notice is a set of green, floral, and woody notes. When it dries completely, it leaves a musky and powdery feeling. It is a fragrance that has given me many compliments over the years from both men and women.

The hate for this fragrance is way unwarranted. I don't think it smells outdated or like dryer sheets at all, it's pretty synthetic though. This is a great cheap citrus fragrance with mid longevity (as you would expect). If you need something light, youthful, and fresh for a cheap price this checks all the boxes. It isn't unique but it's as inoffensive as it gets and does what it's made to do.

Do people really know HOW, WHEN or WHERE to wear fragrances???? This is definitely a summer, daytime fragrance!!!! It's not for long performance. It's a perfect perfume to wear outdoors or in warm to hot places. It's not for clubbing.
This is a very nice perfume for spring and summer but leans more masculine side

Oh the days where I had a 200ml bottle of this, and would wear this everyday in spring and summer. This fragrance was a hallmark for me in my mid to late teens and even early twenties. The upvoted pros about it being a carefree, optimistic fragrance that brings about positive feelings might be inherently because of the 2nd most upvoted con: it reminds people of high-school era. The scent is nothing special, but I do recall getting complimented a lot while wearing it. It's a bit like a Labrador Retriever: a great safe choice as a first fragrance, loved by many, always happy to see you, hard to dislike but also will never surprise you.

This is a classic that a lot of people love but I unfortunately cannot get myself to like it. It smells like mens deodorant to me. The citrus is too bitter and weirdly powdery. I find it to smell quite nice on men though.
simple and cheap scent,very light very fresh, green and floral everyday frag, lasts 3 hours maximum, ofcourse but what would you expect from a calvin klein

If your looking for a cheap clean smelling fragrance that wont offend anyone this is your best bet. Just smells like a soapy clean frag. Most would say this is a summer/spring frag but I personally loved the way it smelled during winter more than summer. Probably wont rebuy but still worth trying. Perfect for a first fragrance or even to give to a kid.

6.0/10

doesn't project for long but for how cheap it is you can spray a lot on,

Are you afraid, that you would hurt someone's feelings by wearing the wrong scent? Here's CK One. No risk whatsoever, pure powdery cleanliness that doesn't have much of a performance. You feel clean, but I guess that's the thing with this one.

Used to be my cousin's fave perfume and my mom bought it for me. To me, it smells like those wet wipes you clean your hands with after eating seafood, when it dries down it's like a bitter soap. It's alright but not what I want to smell like

About 12 years ago, I picked up what was already considered to be an old BNIB 200ml bottle of the stuff and just pulled it out of storage today to actually wear it. The bottle is likely from the early 2000s and is the only reference point I've got for what this fragrance smells like. How radically different is the scent profile and potency of the juice that's being pumped out in 2024? Is it really noticeably different from the original? How so? Has the note profile changed?
a very fresh, light, non-bittery scent. Bought it for my boyfriend, but I love it on myself more...
