On a positive note, it doesn't smell as bad as DH and, to be honest, the fact it is such a weak performer is good news. It lacks originality, does not smell good, and is not very well composed IMO.

Overall, shame and disappointment await anyone who samples this less-than-stellar fragrances. The only Eternity worth considering is Eternity Aqua on the men's side IMO. On a positive note, I got to sample CK One Summer 2018 and I'll be picking-up a bottle when it hits the deep-discount market.

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: This fragrance had gone within 30 minutes!! The longevity is 1 hour on my wrist.. I think should have been called "Eternity Office" It's very closed and serious environment like the office scent.

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
This should have been called "Eternity Office". There is nothing intense about the fragrance whatsoever, and I really have to wonder what they were thinking when creating and naming it.

That being said, it works very very well as an office scent for me. There is a somewhat unspoken no-fragrance policy where I work, and I've actually been sent home by my boss to shower off my fragrance before. Eternity Intense is so powdery-light and unoffensive, that I have been wearing it to my office the last three days and no one has said a word. I'm not sure if they can smell it, but I get whiffs off it every so often. I don't mind having my own personal fragrance bubble at work, and then spraying on some more serious stuff when get off.

So while the name is absolutely bizarre, the fragrance itself is pleasant to me and is serving a great purpose.

If you want something similar but with bigger projection, more longevity, sweeter iris, and more complexity, check out Eternity Intense for WOMEN. It's everything I originally wanted from the men's version, and is absolutely unisex.

**5/15/18 edit**: Welp, so much for all that. Two sprays on the chest and one on each hand this morning. Boss walks into the office and flips out on me saying I'm smelling up the whole place. I can barely smell it. One co-worker confirms she can smell it well throughout the office. Weird.

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
I bought this one at my local retailer at a discount and here is what i think of it:

Pros: This scent is perfect for a very closed and serious environment like the office. It is inoffensive and not cloying at all therefore no one will complaint of headache. It has a soapy smell like dior sauvage and i can say that it is a mixture between Dior Sauvage and Dior Homme Eau. The poor longevity and projection is also not a problem for me during work.

Cons: I will never wear this to any evening occasion. The smell is just too boring and 1 dimensional. It is not seductive, exciting or playful at all. And the poor longevity and projection is a problem when I’m out and about in the evening

Conclusion: i would not call this a bad fragrance. I just think that it is not versatile and only serves for work and not anything else at all. For me there is no such thing as a ‘bad fragrance’. Every fragrance has its own strength and purpose.. well.. except for Secretion Magnifique..

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: It is a joke. Gone in 20 minutes. It is all about iris root + some citrus and wood. Great scent for an office with "no perfume" policy. Smells ok but does not last at all. Skin scent. Overpriced. Safe blind buy (wont offend anyone). I have an official sample from Macys.

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
An Eternity of Intense Horror. I can tolerate this scent as an anti-perspirant deodorant. And that's it.
Probably the worst thing i've owned. Compared to this pathetic entity Allure Homme Sport and Chrome Intense are true epiphany.
*(****)

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
Reminds me of Axe Orion.

Not bad, light enough, simple, and ideal for work maybe...lasts 6-8 hours at most.

7/10

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: I found hint of Bleu de Chanel and Dior Sauvage, Lasts 3-4 hours on my skin. Projection is moderate. Overall not so good but not bad either.

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: CH 212 similar ? Are you fuckn reterded ?!

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: Simple pleasant fragrance that actually resemble chanel Bleu and Dior sauvage it ain't bad just nothing new or creative it's a likeable pleasant fragrance that will not offend anyone nice office or work fragrance but sometimes and for some people simple is a good thing I have a lot of the top designer fragrances by chanel, Dior, Gucci, Burberry, Versace,etc that actually doesn't nearly get complimented as much as I'll say my azzaro Chrome's,cool water, nautica's,CK one,curve, issey miyake etc. I'd say check it out spray it on the back of your hand let it settle in and see if it works for you and I used to wear the original eternity and it got me plenty of compliments as a kid in HS I no longer wear that one but I do own the aqua and I think summer 2014 or 15 version only thing about those versions is they don't last long but they smell good.

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
Had to do an actual review on this. A few comments below i said this smells like a right guard deodorant i wore 20 years ago, as an insult and a dismissal. That was a few months ago in much cooler weather. This scent is an absolute let down in the cold months, even if its note base and scent profile read otherwise.
So today, I'm just in the mood to buy a fragrance. Im at the mall, trying to convince myself to get Dior homme eau. Love the original, but have balked at homme eau. It is "too much" to me. Too much iris, and way too sweet in its presentation, especially when it is considered a warm weather fragrance. Ive tried to buy it but just cannot. I then thought of eternity intense, its poor performance, its note breakdown, and then thought: "it has iris in it but is not an overpowering iris, nor is it sweet. Perhaps it makes sense in the heat of summer".
Put a few sprays on, walked around for a bit, and ultimately bought a big bottle. I know this thing is getting its teeth kicked in by reviewers, but i am going to make a case for it for those interested. Powdery iris and citrus, smoky in the opening,nice spice, floral, you get a sense of the original for a moment or two. Citrus burns off and the iris, bit of smoke, woods, and soapiness, and that is where the scent sits for the duration. Where i found homme eau to be a bit obnoxious, intense is calmer, more wearable, and very versatile. Just a really nice fresh, clean, soapy scent that does not over project and will not offend anyone. I have actually gotten a few compliments wearing it already.
I paid full price but I am sure you can wait and get it for much less. I'm okay with paying full price for this. I can wear this at my job, my wife loves it, i cannot overapply, and it deviates from fresh citrus and isn't part of the ambroxan army (although i love ambroxan scents) and sits very comfortably in my summer wardrobe and will become a dumb reach. I just dig it. Give it another try, wear it on a hot day and i think it may surprise you. Calvin Klein is very hit or miss, much more miss than hit, but now i will go ahead and buy a bottle of the original eternity. These both serve as nice counterpoints to one another.

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
Gone the days of CK being creative, innovative and leads the market. After the released of Eternity Night, now comes Intense > a smokey "Night" version wt a splash of peppery and cirus woody scent for the base.

Any good? Longevity. 3-4 hours on me.

Any bad? The scent is pretty flat, last 3 hours on my skin and honest speaking it is very ordinary smokey warm winter scent.

Any Eternity influences? Little bit - the lavender and some flowery notes lingering behind the smokey scent.

Any more? No. It is a big let down - CK obsession wt the flankers now officially turned to complete madness.

2/10 from me, sorry fans, CK need to do much more in near future!

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: It smells exactly like a right guard deodorant I wore 20 years ago, so there's that I guess...

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: This is really bad. I wanted to like this, but it is so cheap and does not last long at all. No one is exaggerating here by saying it does not last longer than half an hour. I can't imagine anyone wanting this. There are way better options that this scent is trying to rip off, like Dior Homme Eau For Men.

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: Lasts for 0,5 hour... Is this a joke? Not worth a single penny.

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: Walking through Carsons yesterday, decide to walk over to men's fragrances just to see if there's anything worth looking at. Immediately assaulted by a sales clerk that I managed to shoo away with a stare. Saw Eternity Intense sitting there and figured I'd see what this new concoction is from CK, "hey maybe they made something worth sniffing," Sprayed some on the arm and right away thought, "hey this is pretty nice actually, but let's wait a few minutes and see what the drydown is like". Walked out of the store and had my wife smell and she said " I can't smell anything". Huh? I put my nose to my arm and it was gone! Completely! 10 minutes later! A sad testament to the current state of CK. An absolute joke of a fragrance.

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: I have to say, I actually like this one. It took me a couple of applications to warm up to it, but what it lacks in originality, it makes up for in quality. Spicy, smokey, powdery. Take the most distinctive aspects of Sauvage and Dior Homme, and you have this interesting concoction. 7.5/10

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
Tried today at Macy's. Sales lady thought I should buy it after smelling a card. It was ok at best but I told her I don't buy unless I test it out for a few days to see how it performs overall.

She said "Then spray some on and try it now". By the time I left the store, the smell was gone.

Boo!!

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: I had bad experience with CK fragrances,got collection of 5 different CK fragrances and none of them last longer then 10 minutes with ZERO sillage,,To me Chinese fragrances last longer then any of the CKs...I don't care what ever they make now i will never ever buy it...Recomend to all not to buy CK,save money for something you never tested before,there is millioins of fragrances we never tested...

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: i sampled this because i love the note iris but my god this has to be one of the worse fragrances i have ever smelled. Every once in a while CK house surprises me with a semi well made fragrances but you can tell that absolutely no thought quality or care has gone into this piece of garbage of a fragrance. i fee like CK owes me money for intentional infliction of emotional distress.

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
Woah, Sampled it today and just waaay too much Iris. So much Iris, like WTF is it with everyone putting Iris in mens cologne. It is the epitome of girly.
It was fine with Francois Demachy did it in Dior Homme to break a little more ground but enough already. Prada, YSL, etc, everyone stop putting Iris in mens cologne. If you wear this one you might as well just grow a vaj.

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
The very first blast smells like Denatured Alcohol only for about 5 minutes and then settles down into a Mr. BURBERRY/ OLD AFTERSHAVE COMBO. I kid you not.... Do not blind buy...... You'll thank me later...
STAY CLASSY AMERICA.....!!!

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells not even remotely close to joop!! It smells like he Eternity Night Flanker they had last year with something else added. It's very spicy and not something I would ever wear unleaded I had a super hairy chest and wanted to burn a hole through a door with my fragrance . Major pass!

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: Wow does this really smell like joop? I've got to try this i love joop. Want to see the CK blend.

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: Surprisingly, this is a very nice fragrance! Smells nothing like the original, though.

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
Just got this in the mail, first
impression is not very positive, to
me this smells like a salty floral
fragrance with no sweetness at all,
not a very plesant smell but
who knows some may like it, anyway i
can not recommend it as a blind buy, this
does not project neither does it last,
to me its a failure, but do try it just
don't blind buy this trust me.

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: what the hell is wrong with you people? its not even out yet.. releasing in December 2016, you morons!! stop voting and comparing..

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: why so many dislikes?? while I dont like the original eternity, I LOVE this new release! so hot....

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: How does IT smell like then?

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
A typical new release hate, without trying it out, like always, what a lovely portion of community...

I am not a lover of CK, but this one is really good, the dry-down is really pleasant. Performance was unexpected, thought it is was an EDP, seemed very oily, lasted all day.

product_name: Eternity for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: wtf is this? people are already comparing it to other scents and its not even out yet.. come on omg
I blind bought a big bottle of this and while it’s not terrible, it doesn’t smell good on me. I use it as a bathroom spray and it’s awesome for that!

ck all brings a punchy, yet light, fresh vibe to the party. It’s just really clean. Like dryer sheets or febreeze. You could probably not wash your laundry for a few months and just use this instead, scentwise you’d probably get away with it too. But now, “clean” isn’t a scent, and most dryer sheets are scented. So what does it actually smell like? There’s a somewhat sweet/spicy citrusy after-scent. Besides the citrus, I can tell there’s something green/floral going on, but the only thing I can really pick out is the jasmine. (I’m normally not great at distinguishing my flowers but I have this really strong jasmine oil roller that smells similar so I’m gonna assume). I know this is supposed to be a unisex perfume, but there is also a slight musk that makes it seem to lean a little on the masculine side, however, I am very biased. It makes me feel… aroused? Like my boyfriend just came out of the shower with his hair slicked back, with nothing on except the perfume. Yeah. I like this one. It makes me feel clean and sexy and refreshed.
Overall rating: 8.75/10
I like it and it's pretty long-lasting, but nothing crazy. 2-3 spritz should last the whole day without being overwhelming.

Alberto "The Freshmaker" Morillas of Office for Men fame remakes his 1994 hit "CK One" for modern audiences. generally, this smells a lot like that fragrance but with less 90s musk/powder and with more 2010s zest/soap. as a massive CK One stan, this was a shoo-in for me.

beautifully cheap in a jumbo size, CK All is a top candidate for uncomplicatedly hosing yourself down with before anxiously grocery shopping during peak hours because you need green onions, going to the cinema alone to see a bad movie based on a kid's video game franchise, running to the smoke shop at midnight because you forgot you smoked your last paper yesterday, or any other sort of low-stakes situation where you want the cheapest of the cheap, the lightest of the light, the dumbest of the dumb reaches.

to do more service to the smells of CK All than "it's ck one but more newer lol," it's primarily a citrus and white floral fragrance with a giant focus on clean. simple, all-gender freshness. the opening is a blast of incredibly strong and sharp citrus, like ZAP! BANG! cleaner citrus. after the opening chills out, the citrus sourness sweetens up and smells a bit like tearing your nails into a warm orange peel in the summer, which i really love.

the mid is a white floral affair with a little bit of grapefruit (and some rhubarb maybe?) adding a little zing to keep things from going too soapy or old school. at this stage, the fragrance is doing a balancing act between a "shower gel fresh" fragrance and a "hotel soap fresh" fragrance. the floral notes here are pleasantly clean and a touch sweet. there is also an understated greenness that feels like a vestigial trait left over from CK One's DNA. has a little bit of an "italian neroli summer fragrance" vibe around this mark. toward the bottom, the citrus cools off a little more and the musk starts to warm things up a bit.

drydown is sort of just a vague mélange of soap florals and musk with the ghost of some grapefruit rind. if you've ever smelled a Nivea for Men product, it smells like those after the lotion has settled in. there's something barely woody about it if you put your nose right to the skin.

projection on this stuff is negligible and it lasts for about as long as the Alan Smithee broadcast re-cut of David Lynch's Dune. (i had to find a way to namedrop him in here, god rest his soul) when i said "hose yourself down," i was not joking, i go 6 sprays with this stuff without even thinking. from the notes and the description, you probably inferred that this is best in the summer days, and you'd be right. in fact, i recommend it most when it's boiling hot because someone might actually be able to smell it on you. this is the second most unisex fragrance i've ever smelled besides CK2, which i guess makes sense because they sorta carved out the unisex fragrance market.

and that's your approximately 3 hours wearing CK All. (or CK One Sport Eau Fraiche if Calvin Klein was your average european designer house) For the 20 bucks i spent at Burlington on a jumbo of this stuff, i could not be more pleased. for a hot weather turbo-budget number, this is surprisingly unique and fun without being challenging or complicated in any way. warmly recommended to any fans of clean, simple, citrus-forward fragrances that are looking for something a little different than normal.

4 flask bottles with optional atomizer cap/5
@ibullard this doesn't smell anything close to 212, you might wanna blow your nose

Fresh citrusy clean men's cologne which can easily be worn by women
But only during the heat
Reminds me of some perfume that is popular these days, maybe someone could spot it?
What if even LV Imagination, huh? :D
Or maybe 724 by MFK?
You to judge :)

Very fruity and fresh, the opening is slightly more masculine imo but the drydown after sometime makes it rather feminine.

Nonetheless still quite solid for the price range
I give it a 7.5/10

CK All is a fragrance I’ve had for some time, but to be honest, I don't use it that much. It’s fresh, clean, and very easy to wear — the kind of scent that's perfect if you just want to feel light and comfortable without overthinking it.

It opens with a nice burst of citrus and soft florals that feels really modern and relaxed. I appreciate how versatile it is and how it can work for almost anyone, any day. But for me, it’s not the kind of perfume that leaves a strong impression.

It stays quite close to the skin after a while, and even though it smells good, it doesn’t have that "wow" factor I usually look for, especially when I want my fragrance to stand out. That’s probably why it doesn’t make it into my rotation as often.

That said, I still think CK All is a solid choice if you’re after something minimalistic, casual, and very "easygoing." It’s just not the scent I reach for when I really want to make a statement.

I mean, it's alright. Won't buy again. This is synthetic and generic smelling. Slightly feminine leaning. Performance is alright though. Great for the gym and under high heat.

6.5/10

For the longest of times I've always been a stickler for avoiding CK Fragrances as a whole- never thought I'd get on with them. Recently though, that's changing. It started with CK eternity - i received a little tester of it with a perfume purchase, immediately fell in love with the ruggedness of that scent. Then the other day, I realised I forgot to wear a perfume, nipped into my local Savers, and saw CK All on offer, around £15 for 100ml - thought that's a fantastic price. Went to sample it and by golly, was it a pleasant and wonderful scent.

It's sweet, it's smooth, it's unisex, it's comforting, it's relaxing, it's electrifying. Any perfume that has been handled by Alberto Morillas, is like an elixir of the gods. Always fantastic scents from Mr Morillas, and this is no exception.

The nice tart opening from the citrus, to the smooth and mellow middle Jasmine and Rhubarb (they dominate in the middle) all the way down to the basenotes of Musk, Amber and Vetiver. It's a very relaxing and calming scent- like being enveloped in a blanket of pure comfort and safety.

Very much so unisex, some people say it leans more feminine and i do somewhat agree with that statement. But it develops and works beautifully on my skin. It's not a perfume that will get you attention, it doesn't scream attention, it screams class, and sophistication. People who are in close proximity will smell this scent and they'll be intoxicated by the subtle nuiances of that perfume. Perfect blind buy fragrance- and for the price, it isn't bad at all.

Perfect for the warmer weather we have coming up in the UK, so I'm excited to test it out fully in the heat of the UK sun. Overall, I reccomend this perfume to just about anyone.
The most unisex fragrance to have unisex fragnanced. This is what a robot without genetalia would wear. Its very safe and smells like the 2000s. Something you would wear to Sensation White.

I've had this fragrance for over a year and I can say the next:

It opens synthetic with mandarin and bergamot very citrussy, which although it's synthetic, I still really enjoy it.
Then you get the white florals which is where the line is drawn to where it shows this is a unisex fragrance. Some people say it might be too feminine. But to me it's how feminine you think white flowers are. To me they don't have gender.
As it dries down you barely get any amber and musk.
The sillage is not crazy, I always put 3-4 sprays and can say this is not enough to make yourself loud. However I always found out that most people actually enjoy just simple not loud fresh fragrances. So this the one I've had most complements with.

Simple fresh citrus unisex fragrance. For men, only if you think you can pull off flowers and sweet citrus. It projects decent up to 3 hours, then skin scent lasting up to 6 hours on my skin. I like it a lot since it was my first ever fragrance. 8/10
this is not a unisex fragrance... its non binary

Nice orange citrus fragrance, very clean smelling. Has a little sweetness and a soft white floral note on top of a generic men's cologne kind of base. Pleasant and refreshing but more soft than crisp or biting. After a few hours it reminds me of a generic deodorant smell on the skin. It's not necessarily bad but not very distinctive. Not too strong. Very unisex.

This is in the same ballpark as CK One but is definitely its own thing. I remember CK One having a more biting citrus note and more complexity overall.

This fragrance reminds me of summer, it feels good, this fragrance reminds me of a lemon basket i would probably use it for summer days, beach days, or when we go out in the hot sunny days and this fresh fragrance helps with it, i would consider using it only in these days otherwise no, in winter it’s not good, the fresh lemon could maybe help, but no it feels alot like citrus, wouldn’t use it at all if it isnt only for summer days, i give it a solid 5.

It smells like an old woman = white soap and white flowers. As a man, I wouldn't want to smell like this, or be with a woman who smelled like this. This foray into one-size-fits-all androgynous gender-bending nonsense is beat. How about make men's and women's scents??

First off, it's a very light scent. Definitely unisex. This fragrance will not jump out at you from the bottle, and it may not turn many heads. Still, it's incredibly good; it delivers white florals and citrus with an undertone of syrupy sweetness. The scent profile reminds me a bit of Dunhill Icon.
If you're on the fence about it, I'd buy it, because it seems genuinely impossible that someone would hate this fragrance, unless only for the mediocre performance.
This is marketed as unisex but it does have a feminine floral aura. It is rather soft and subdued. I think this will do better in warmer weather.

If an AI had been tasked to "do" a Jean-Claude Ellena (not the Ellena of Cartier's Declaration as the prophetic one, for a spell, of Bulgari's Thé Vert), this is what it would smell like.

Everything in CK All feels sharply synthetic, from the sour candied mandarine through the flowery center and its plastic rhubarb down to the vetiver that was born in the lab and evidently never set foot in Reunion or roamed Tamil Nadu. It is radical in its simplicity, bracing on first whiff, certainly inhuman, inarguably unisex: On those rare occasions when I now wear it, I feel like one of Jeff Koons' Balloon-dogs, ready to bark in autotune.

If I had money to waste and did not already own a bottle of CK All, I'd ask Koons to make me one in white, a dog that is, which to my knowledge he never did.
I can understand why it’s a unisex scent, but it leans more feminine to my nose, though it can be a great gym scent.
Smells like a woman , period.

Bit similar to clinic happy so not that unique though i do love this fragrance. My mum bought it for me and i usually use it at night.
Recommend if you like vibrant fragrances.
Longevity not bad.
A better VPH? This one impresses me more every time I wear it....and surprisingly long lasting.

Clean, somewhat flowery sweet scent that is delicious. It's sadly not recommended to drink perfume no matter how tempting it might be. I think it's unisex but that depends on how manly flowers are to you lol. Happy, friendly, spring vibe.

Some reviewers call it creamy and I'd agree. 10/10 when worn with bright clothing.

This is one of these scents you personally need to get your nose on. At first, I was hesitant about it. Reading the comments here on Fragrantica and the reviews on YouTube. I got my nose on it and it is really unisex. Nothing to Feminine or Masculine about it. It opens very zesty fruits, you have florals and some musk and amber. It's very inoffensive and you can over-spray this one. I use this for casual days/nights or just for the office. Performance wise, I get around 2 - 4 hours on skin and I'm ok with that. Spray in clothing and your clothes will smell like a nice luxury softener, it smells good.

Very synthetic and a harsh opening it leans more towards girls definitely a hard pass for me gave my bottle to my sister idk how tltg reviews could wear this the original ck one is better than this in my opinion
This is definitely way more feminine leaning. Not a fan and not something I’d ever wear.
Despite the positive reviews on youtube, this was too feminine for me and there was just something in it that was irritating to my nose. Gave it to my mom and she loves it.

I like it. I think it smells decent. It is definitely unisex, maybe leaning slightly on the feminine, but it is pleasant. The longevity and sillage are pretty good, but it isn't something that I would wear that often.

Overall, I would give it a 7/10. It could be better, but it is definitely something that I like. I would recommend this to someone who is into super citrusy and zesty fragrances in warm temperatures.

Warm, pleasant, smoother version of the CK One DNA - kinda far from it already. I find this the most non-cloying version among the three (CK One, Be, All). Its white floral notes are smooth, and creamy although the citrus note in the opening is still sharp.

Starts off sharp and lovely, certainly unisex. Initial dry down leans creamy and masculine. After an hour it becomes more feminine leaning. It continues to transform from first spray on, something I find rare in most fragrances and am really surprised about with this one. I really love it! Easy wear, well blended, complex, actually lasted all day on my skin and certainly my clothes. Good projection. 6.7oz bottle was $30.
A unisex, clean, floral scent. Smells good. It doesn't last long.

This is Not half bad, opens up with a pretty nauseating Air freshener kinda smell but after about 5 mins it dries down into a bit sweeter and smoother smell, I just keep this in my gym bag if i just want to spray something real quick that i know i will eventually shower off anyway, performance is maybe 3 hours maximum, and sillage is very skin intimate but Its an EDT so that's expected.
For a Gym smell its not bad at all but there are still so many better alternatives for this price range (if even less)
if you're thinking about using this as a Main smell during the summer
6/10

This is a really good fragrance! I picked it up cheap at a discount store. I really enjoy CK One, and some of the summer flankers as well. I can’t say anymore about it that the other reviewers haven’t except that when I sprayed it in my car on the way home because it smells so good to me, about an hour after I returned home, I ask my husband to grab something out of it for me and he came back inside asking me why my car smells like donuts??? I went right out there and yes it did indeed smell like donuts😂 so there’s that. I smelled fresh and citrus like, but in my car, donuts🤷♀️

A great combination of 4 white florals gives this a fresh, slightly creamy feel to go along with the citrus brightness & amber sweetness. I'm not a big fan of Calvin Klein or summer fragrances & was surprised how much I like this. Will definitely get a lot of wear in the spring, however, like so many CK fragrances the performance could be a little better. Still, a 9/10 scent for me.
Smells simple yet pleasant. But somehow it reminds me a lot to a bug spray that I use a lot at home

The perfect gym fragrance! It's cheap and inoffensive, so you don't have to worry about spraying too often. It's clean, fruity and a great back-up fragrance to throw in your backpack for the last classes of the day or for the afternoon workout. Don't expect an incredible compliment giver, but it's great and simple for what it is!

8/10
Smells like nivea products. Super clean and inoffensive.

It has the CK One vibe but it's like a stripped version, more creamy floral, much less musky; kinda smells like a moisturizer when it dries. I like it for sports and exercising since it's super non invasive, you can go wild with the sprays, and lasts about three hours which is nice longevity for physical activities. I prefer it on fabric and on the air (room spray lol) than on my skin since it's crispier ☀️ and the florals go a bit sour on my skin.
Very strongly focused on the trio of white florals. A nice composition, and leans feminine to me.

It's an amazing fragrance and I love it a lot.

Quite different than CK One, imo. CK One has a very distinctive and domineering jasmine note on top of all the other floral notes in that one. I can't really detect that jasmine note at all with CK All despite it being listed. Instead, CK All smells very generically super "clean" and fresh. As if you were getting freshly cleaned laundry right out of the dryer that had been treated with a fresh smelling fabric softener + dryer sheets. It's almost too fresh smelling; there's a bit of artificiality in this overwhelmingly "clean" note, but I personally quite like it.

Basically turns into a skin scent after about an hour, but I find that the scent lingers on the skin about 1-2 hours longer than CK One.

I agree with another reviewer who said it smells like a better Versace VPH. I can detect some similar notes beneath that "clean" note that reminds me of VPH, but overall the scent profile with CK All is much more pleasing than VPH to me.

Beautiful clean fragrance that makes you feel so fresh, well-groomed and put together, super palatable and non-offensive, Very well blended and natural scent that's perfect for very hot days, the office, travelling etc. as it adds a touch of flowery/musky freshness without overwhelming. It's like cK One cranked up to eleven and rounded out in a more warm and smooth way. Love it.
PHENOMENAL - Grapefruit blossom.

Review after months:
Perfect fragrance !!!

1.Super cheap
2.Super fresh orange-white florals-soapy
3.Optimistic, energetic, summery
4.For everyday freshness
5.Better than overpriced snobs fragrances

Citrus fresh, feel good unisex scent that I really enjoy. I am old enough to have been part of the original CK One craze back in the day and I loved that scent profile. This is for sure like the original, but different enough to my nose to enjoy each of them in a different way. I would say they are from the same family if that makes sense. So perfect on a summer day, appropriate for many occasions when you want to smell good but not overpower anyone. Glad to have it in my collection.

The citrus really pops in the opening, with the mandarin taking the lead there. The soft white florals and the musk kick in almost immediately and it's really a smooth pleasant combination. The rhubarb and jasmine work really well together in the mid and I wonder why more unisex fragrances haven't tried this combo. The citrus pushes really well through the whole wearing for the fragrance, which is unusual, especially for a less expensive scent. The drydown is a little muskier, but the citrus, jasmine-rhubarb and amber keep the sweetness strong, but not cloying. This was built for smelling fresh and sweet in the hot weather, and it is really good at that. I get a strong 2 feet of projection and 5-6 hours of wear out of this, and the warmer the weather the better with no top end to the temperature. Perfect for the gym, an afternoon drink at an outdoor bar, or a walk along the beach or through the mall.

Admittedly, I've enjoyed many CK fragrances with this bottle shape over the past three decades, and this one did take the concept in a direction close to the original CK One, but more modern and smoother. It's a shame this one didn't fare better in the eyes of the company, but still I think this influenced some of the CK One summer flankers for the better. My favorite in the line is between this and Summer Daze... I think that kumquat in the Summer Daze still puts it over the top for me, but I will get a lot of use of this one this summer.

The quintessential white tee fragrance for men and women. The combination of mandarin orange, bergamot and grapefruit blossom is brilliant. It invokes a Mediterranean feeling and makes the fragrance feel much more expensive than it really is and would probably make a perfect vacation scent. From opening to base, the fragrance is incredible smooth and pleasant. This type of perfumery reminds me of the way Chanel does citruses where it there is a creamy undertone that makes the fragrance alluring and invites you to come back for more. Performance is pretty solid, I get a good 5-6 hours of longevity with good sillage. Contrary to what I've heard about CK fragrances performing badly, this was a wonderful surprise. IMO, this is better than Lacoste Blanc and on the same tier as Legend Spirit. Overall, this an alluring summer fragrance that lives up to its hype, very happy with the purchase.

CK All I think is a forgotten fragrance. It is forgotten as it is overshadowed by CK One and CK Be as well as its eventual replacement CK Everyone. Unlike CK Everyone, it did not get a flanker. CK All was a fragrance made to be like CK One, CK Be and CK2 where it was another unisex fragrance. That said it is a good one.

CK All comes off as a fragrance that smells like CK One but I think simplified, cleaned up and smoothed out. CK All opens with a mix of grapefruit with some bergamot. The mid is jasmine and I love jasmine. The base really is just musk and some woods to me (maybe a sandalwood as that can be musky or give a clean musk scent.)

CK All is a fragrance that can be worn in many occasions except dressed up or clubbing for spring and summer. Performance isn't that strong, but I wouldn't say it is a total negative as this is a clean fragrance.

CK All when found in discounters which is hitting a second wind in the rack stores for some reason is really a good buy. I can say it is unisex and works as a clean fragrance. I rate CK All a 7.6 out of 10. I do personally like Chrome and Pitbull Cuba Man better for similar fragrances, but this isn't a bad option and you could do much worse in the CK___ line. I'm personally looking at Everyone and Be.

First of all - love the simplicity of the bottle. Hate the screw-on sprayer that doesn't fit aesthetically. It looks like a random sprayer you bought on Amazon that doesn't exactly fit the bottle but works "well enough". If I could I would paint it white.

Smells fresh, like a cool summer morning when the dew is still on the grass. You walk through the grass in your sandals and your feet get a little bit chilly but the warmth slowly creeps in the air. It's not too sweet. It's crisp. Like a cousin of a green apple without any of the artificial appleness. Rhubarb in the middle notes saves the scent from being too flowery
The perfect balance of unisex for me. Can imagine it being a signature scent that fits both my girl dress days and boy plaid shirt days.
Smells like febreeze mixed with snuggle.

Identico ao ck one mas com a saida mais alaranjada e frutada da mandarina e um leve toque mais doce. Na minha opiniao é compartilhavel e um tantinho puxado pra feminino. As notas de saida sao uma explosão de frescor citrico laranja, muito bom gostei. Não projeta muito e é preciso repor durante o dia ; quem trabalha em hospital , com idosos e crianças ou sofre com dor de cabeça essa é uma boa opção pra estar perfumada

The weather turned 80 today in my neck of the woods.
T-shirt and shorts. Citrusy, floral, super easy and fun to wear. Definitely unisex, maybe slightly feminine. Feel good scent! Blind bought this and loving it :)
Probably one of my first perfumes. It's a classic. Smells really fresh. Perfect for summer weather and for lighter places, like meetings, gym, etc.

What a nice and uplifting scent!! Great for spring and hot summer days!! Fresh and clean, an easy grab and go fragrance.. Well done CK!! 👏🏻
And for me, the BEST gym scent hands down!

The love child of CK One & CK Be- its really smells like a blend of the two, and in my opinion it is the best out of the three, also last the longest. it seems a common thing to describe a scent using a color: so this is a very 'white' fragrance, it is fresh, clean very soft and slightly powdery. its so subtle and inoffensive, it can be worn first in the morning, without making anyone nauseous. wear it only throughout the summer, it wont make much impact in cold weather
8/10 for me

I can’t get enough of this one… it is one of the most beautifully blended citrus/florals out there and I find it absolutely intoxicating. The fragrance opens with sweet tart citrus. Essentially a mandarin and grapefruit smell (grapefruit blossom + tartness from rhubarb create the tart grapefruit smell). After about 5 mins the white florals come in to add depth and elegance to the overall scent. Luckily, they are all the best white florals- jasmine and lily which blend so easily with the citruses and actually provide a bit of sweetness to the overall scent.
Imo, it is almost perfectly unisex if not just a touch feminine (particularly after the first 5 minutes when the florals start to come in). The Vetiver and tart rhubarb continue to add a touch of masculinity throughout the life of the fragrance. If you are looking for an addicting, versatile and easy-to-wear aquatic, sweet citrus/floral scent this Spring or Summer, I highly recommend CK All. (CK All > CK One)
*An added bonus, is that it is fantastic for layering! Simply layer this to any fragrance that could use some citrus- it blends really well with a lot fragrances I own.

It's a clean very citrus ambroxan smell the opening is nice and strong with good sillage only issue I have is longevity for me just isn't there it turns into a skin scent quick. Great scent for warmer weather and it's masculine enough for any man to pull off women like the scent too.

My second bottle.
First one few years ago, and after buying a recent batch I can unfortunately say ; this has been reformulated.
Still smells fantastic but tiny bit different maybe more synthetic and projection and longevity are weaker.
I used to absolutely love it.
People were asking what I was wearing.
Now I just like it a lot.
I'm gonna give it a bit more wearing now, few months after buying
Maybe it has matured in a bottle.
Just sprayed it on my forearm and decided to write this review.
It is a beautiful composition
Smells like I'd imagine garden of Eden smelled.
Morillas is a true master perfumer

I love CK One and it was my signature when it first came out. CK All is different, but just as wonderful (maybe better). Starts off fresh, clean and slightly aromatic, then dries down into a delicate floral. To me it is more masculine in the beginning and ends a little feminine, still a great fresh-out-of-the-shower scent for both sexes. Longevity could be better, but do not let that stop you from trying this!!
Sexy hot summer day smell but unfortunately it lasts only 3-4 hours.
Don’t like it. Smells like cheap air freshener. I usually like citrus perfume but this one is a no for me

Sweet summer citrus orange and lemon

Hard to go wrong just safe all round unisex

got the citrus opening and floral musk, reminded me of ck one... nice smell, definitely unisex but not too feminent.... if you like ck one or any of the ck one summer flankers, you're gonna probably like this ... i will have to wear it more often and during the warmer months to see how much i really enjoy the scent... so far, thumbs up

Got this as a gift, clean sweet dominantly musky citrus, another one of those out of the shower scents, which is totally up my alley, agrees with my body chemistry, projection is strong for the 1st 15-20 minutes and it gets weaker after an hour, if you have a allergic rhinitis, this could trigger that if you overspray...lasts longer on clothes, i will repurchase :)

I think this a great perfume, but I don’t see how it’s unisex whatsoever, much less masculine. It’s totally 100% feminine, and that is not at all a bad thing. I just don’t gravitate towards feminine perfumes for myself at all. I gifted this to my teenage niece, and she smells heavenly with it. It’s very inoffensive.

3.5 stars out of 5 stars.

I havent smelled this in a long time but i do recall liking it a lot. I used to keep it in my car to freshen for something if necessary in an emergency. I used to put some in my hands and lightly run through my hair too.

Scent : 3/5 ( Citrus , Citrus And Citrus, Well Blend & Smooth )
Longevity : 2.5/5 ( Max 3 - 4 Hours in Skin)
Projection : 3/5
Versatile : 4.5/5
Uniqness : 2/5
Great, inexpensive floral musk. I'll wear this year round as an out of the shower clean scent. It definitely reminds me of my youth. Unisex, leans a touch feminine, but I'll happily wear it
Musthave! Smells great

Ordered a sample this.
It is very zesty and reminds me of Irish spring soap.
Projection and longevity are good.

Great for those who want to smell clean.
Its nice!

COMPLIMENT MAGNET. Smells extremely modern and extremely good. This is a MUST TRY fragrance. Around $20 on discount sites, the price/quality cannot be beaten. I love ck one but IMO ck all is better. Ck all smells very energetic, its more sour, more citrus and more mass appealing; while ck one is more floral and laid back.

Although this is a collaboration, it’s another beautiful creation from Morillas, who was the creator of the first CK One perfume. This was a blind buy but I knew I would have loved it, I always tend to trust Morillas creations. This is a lemony, citrusy and creamy soap, imagine Dove creating a citrus soap and you get CK All. It starts fresh and sunny and it develops into a creamy, almost cashmere-y scent, a fresh-out-of-the-shower soapy scent that makes you feel ready for the day. So sad that it doesn’t last very long on my skin, I have to spray it on clothes to be able to feel it for few hours. Will keep on spraying some more.

A lovely, soapy, inoffensive everyday smell that works on the body and clothes. Sweet, slightly tart citrus opening, followed by white florals, mainly grapefruit blossom, enhanced by Rhubarb and fresh jasmine. I like to spray it liberally, especially after a shower, and I prefer it over CK One.

Edit: It also has pretty good projection and longevity for a fresh citrusy type of fragrance.

CK all is a very good every day casual fragrance, smells very pleasant and easy to like. Suprisingly I actually get okay performance from CK all, around 5 hours. This is a perfect after shower/work/gym fragrance that could work for anyone. Overall I give CK all a 8/10.

I have now smelled several unisex and men’s scents to find a fresh citrus flavor. This is just perfect "almost too masculine" for myself. When I use this, I feel very energetic and confident. I’ve noticed that men’s scents these days can be very sweet and women’s scents, in turn, contain traditionally masculine notes like lavender and cedar. Calvin Klein is the first to take a step in this direction and this line is a classic that deserves attention. I love rhubarb, in this scent it can be clearly distinguished. Full summer score from me.

S'ok. The amber and mandarin orange notes it shares with CK One Summer 2020 must be why it reminds me a bit of it. This is very mild, for very hot weather and office only. Got a 50ml for $19.99 at shoppers drug mart. It isn't worth more due to the subpar performance. It is very feminine too; moreso than masculine for being a unisex scent, undoubtedly due to the flowers in it. So your takeway is citrus flower skin scent. Wouldn't buy again, but won't waste it either.
Just okay. Citrus woody musky floral. Just wish that this lasted longer - will gift to a friend.
Modern unisex. Floral and clean. To my nose, it leans a bit feminine but I don't mind. I will use it casually.

Sweetness, Citrus with florals, green notes, musk and vetiver and some amber in the background. Leans more feminine to my nose but not overly feminine. Think I paid around $35 for a 6.7oz bottle. Don't think i'll wear this again til springtime. Average performance.

It's a nice fragrance thats an easy reach in the right situation and weather and more daytime use. Is it groundbreaking? No.....but definitely pleasant smelling.

This is a scent which is just easy and clean. Yes it leans feminine but only in the opening. The dry down is this sweet musky white floral that I imagine the angels smell like.

Has this been discontinued as others have mentioned?

A true unisex fragrance that smells like the Garden of Eden.

I kid thee not; this is the scent that I imagined how the Garden of Eden would smell like.

It is truly beautiful. I loved it from the first sniff.

It's very hard to describe how it smells like, but I'll try.

I don't get a whole lot of citrus from this one. It's unlike the original (which I also love) in that it's not sharp at all, but it also doesn't have any tea note in it.

It smells very smoothly and somewhat creamy... like a bouquet of white flowers but with lots of jasmine. I bet the rhubarb is there to stop the white flowers from being too sharp, thus making it smooth and heavenly. Personally, I get a fresh floral aquatic vibe from it.

CK will be damned if they ever think of discontinuing this. They made the wrong decision discontinuing CK One Platinum (2018) and kept the scentless CK One Gold for no reason. If they're throwing CK All to trash, then they really have extremely poor marketing analysis team. And what did they just come up recently, pray ask? CK Defy?!? Ugh...

Back to CK All. I think this is a fragrance masterpiece - proudly sitting side-by-side with CK One the original. I wouldn't say it's a citrus fragrance but I would definitely catagorise it as white floral aquatic. It's truly unisex and everyone should at least try it, especially if one likes floral fragrances. Of all the CK One flankers that I have smelt, this one takes the cake.

Always.

When I was growing up in the 90s CK One was the big citrus fresh thing during my middle school years. I couldn't afford anything but my friends who had wealthy parents would wear it and I enjoyed the scent second hand. As an adult who could finally buy fragrances, and the fact CK is cheap now and doesn't cost $100 a bottle like it did in the 90s, I tried CK One and CK All. CK All is leaps and bounds above CK One to me in every regard. Don't get me wrong One is still good but it's not the same as I remember. All on the other hand is a lovely citrus/rhubarb with a touch of florals that pull it all together into a happy sunny scent. It's not your typical white floral and it's not your typical citrus. It has this almost juiced drink like quality to it that reminds me of a citrus punch. Something like a lemonade meets limeade meets orange juice alchemy. I'm pleasantly surprised by how well this fragrance actually works because so many of the CK offerings are shadows of their former glory these days. I get pretty good longevity as well off a few sprays which is nice. There's no cloying, overly sweet, or overly offensive qualities either.
Perfect for the gym or pool, can't offend anyone with this stuff!

surprise surprise!! this is the only CK frag that lasts on my skin for more than 12hrs (i sprayed more than 20 round my neck and nape) LOVEEE the citrusy and floral combo in this version of CK One...I thought I could smell some CK Be dna in this too! and other times CK Eternity would peek in by drive-thru window. MOST EPIC CITRUS SCENT BY CK EVER!
nothing to complain about this one, fackin' cheapy with most fantastic citrus-floral-musky scent ever!
The best of all the CK One flankers. If you can find this discontinued gem, I would definitely snatch it up. Perfectly unisex, light, white florals and citrus. Also, fun fact: Masego wears this
Smell better than CK One in my opinion. The longevity and projectivity are pretty much the same though, that is average and poor.

Forgive my rambling, I will get to the point, I promise.
Some of my earliest scent memories are talking sniffs of my dads CK Be “sample” that he wore for very special occasions. This was way, way back in the 1990’s. I loved that scent and thought I would be the coolest guy at my school of I could wear Ck Be.

Flash forward almost 30 years… now a fragrance enthusiast, I had tried wearing CK Be, but the new formula has muted what I loved about it, or perhaps the rose coloured glasses of nostalgia warped my expectations. I saw Mr. Persolaise do a 60 second review of Ck All and was intrigued. Blind bought it and fell madly in love.
It is like Ck One and Ck Be had a love child. It’s the best of both worlds. I get a slightly transparent, and joyful mandarin opening, crisp tart rhubarb, followed by creamy white florals. It’s a relaxing scent, a comforting scent.
I spray a little heavy, with this I’m not afraid to, and have received nothing but positive feedback. Ck, you made a beauty, thank you.

It has a really great smell I must say.

It's clean, fresh and not another generic summer scent. I don't remember smelling another fragrance like this and I can understand that it is vein with CK One but it's a whole other fragrance. I feel it as somewhat more modern but not one that could be perceived as outdated in a few years.

I feel the rhubarb and white flowers the most but I can also feel the presence of something bubblegum-y that's true.

Despite all that I've said unfortunetely there's a catch... its projection and durability on my skin is just so weak...
Within an hour tops I can't smell it anymore... In a couple of minutes the smell is very faint on my skin.

It's a shame because it's such a delicious airy fragrance that it could be so much more than it actually is...

A CK original with flowery creaminess and fresh, crisp and ripe rhubarb.
Better longevity and silage than the original.

Fresh, young, clean and uplifting unisex fragrance.
I´ve lately returner to CK and all its flankers and I´m in heaven with this one.
Value and excellent quality for every penny.

I love that scents like this, in my opinioin never out of style.
Can be worn at any occasion, any outfit at any time of year by anyone.

Always bear in mind that fragrance is all about personal preference, and can be different to each person due to different surrounding circumstances (country, city, personal experience, nostalgic, etc)

I've smelled few high-priced frags, and some mid and low-priced. What I can tell is still, a matter of taste and preference. I like some expensive ones, and hate some others. Likewise for the mid and low priced ones.

CK All is one example for the low priced frag that got me surprised. In fact, I'm in love with this one. Seems like it has all what I (and maybe most of you) need:
- really affordable
- nice scent
- at least, decent performance. You know, we can overspray and re-apply without worrying about the money. In fact, CK All performs really well on me
- complement getter. Yes, almost everyone around me gave liked this and gave me genuine complement

So I say, always give a try. Get a decant if you can, try it yourself and see how your skin your nose and your feeling react to the scent.

My summer go to fragrance, absolutely amazing wiv the refreshing opening of rhubarb and orange wiv the florals not making it an in your face floral. As it dries down the fruits are still there, but they balance out perfectly with the florals. Very long lasting can still smell on my self after a shower and a long day, another thing I love bout this fragrance is that it has a slight gin and tonic scent to it and I love gin. It’s deffo unisex cos this is coming from a male who only really wears female fragrances and at first when you spray it, yes it can be too strong and overwhelming, but it where’s down perfectly within 15 minutes, so that it’s no suttle and also not headache overwhelming and strong. Deffo 10/10 💯💯
I got the 200 mil @ a dirt cheap price so I'm not afraid to overspray. It's so easy to wear. I LOVE the scent but longevity is just pitiful.

Lotta frag snobs here I see. Judging this fragrance on previous Calvin Klein standards. I bet most of the people bad mouthing this had their minds made up about it prior to trying it.
Sure, Calvin Klein has released some pretty dull boring fragrances.
BUT and I repeat, BUT, this one is fantastic. It's a perfect summer fragrance for day time wear. Great for day to day stuff, going to the beach, leisurely weekends, brunch, you name it. A great summertime dumb reach. And for a summer time fragrance this performs well above average. It's always in my rotation alongside some bigger designer names. Probably even slightly above.

Give this one a go guys if you are open minded and not a frag snob. This stuff is not the usual disappointing CK fragrance.

hmmm... I kinda like this.

It reminds me slightly of Issey Miyake LD Wood & Wood.

Exchange the woods with florals and you get something similar to CK All. CK All is a more unisex fragrance for sure, while Wood & Wood is a touch more masculine. Not a bad fragrance, something appealing about it.

The only good thing about this is that it doesn't cost much.
I love the original ck one, it smells really clean and fresh, I have ck2 which I enjoy, not as much as ck one, but I wear it.
Ck all however... Smells like a man wearing cheap perfume accidentally spilled a big drink all over himself at pub, and then fell asleep on a friend's couch. The not so fresh smell of him the next morning when he wakes up, that's the smell of ck all. And that's not what I want to smell like as a young(ish) woman working with kids.
3/10

THE GOOD: light, androgynous, very good for bright and sunny days although it can be used year-round. Citrusy, a bit floral, and has a great sharp edge added by the rhubarb
THE BAD: could be a bit longer lasting
BLIND BUY: Yes, if you like citrus scents and nothing that leans too feminine or masculine
RATING: 9/10

This is my summer guilty pleasure fragrance (and CK one shock for him for fall/winter). Quite a breakaway from Bleu, Sauvage, and Gio that populate the crowd right now. Very loud, catching yet not so offensive. One flaw is that the projecting longevity is only 2-3 hours strong. BUT, the bottle is huge so decant it and you can always smell "fresh out the bottle" for a whole day if you want.
TLDR: Super Fresh Affordable Quality Release from CK house, worth buying in 200ml bottle. A Hidden Weapon to go against Bleu, Sauvage, and Gio.

Got this cause I love Gin & tonic. It smells like icy Gin and tonic with lime, then sweet flowers come out but the freshness is there all the time. Simply clean and white, fresh and green, really lovely, really lovely, the best of CK collection.

Even though it does really smell like somebody poured a whole glass of Gin&Tonic on you right after the application (as one of the comments mentioned), this scent has surprisingly gotten me the most compliments ever regarding perfumes (from men and women).
It might be a great fit for women who don't like classic sugary 'women's perfumes' but also don't want to smell like a dude, as it is fresh enough but still flowery.

Clean and Easy to Wear

This fragracnce open with blast of mandarin orange, crisp and bright, citrussy with some floral and creamy & dry woody notes behind. Thoose Floral notes (paradisone, jasmine,lily,etc) was quite feminime in the drydown. Luckyly it was blended well with amber and musk on the background.
A new unisex classic. Simply one of the best! I enjoy this alternating with CK One.

I purchased this not very long after it came out in 2017, I was starting to really get into fragrances and I used to mainly wear The Body Shop Fuji Green Tea and a cheap CK One dupe, I was one of those people that wanted to wear a fragrance but didnt (at the time) like wearing fragrance, so for me, those were a very good way of easing me into the world of fragrance.

I still have my 200ml bottle that I purchased in 2017 and I still love and wear it, albiet I wear it during times of olfactive fatigue, not wanting to wear anything imposing and during my down periods, since, it always perks me up.

CK All smells shower gelly, clean, bright and true to its target market, it smells androgynous and has the perfect balance of masculine and feminine. The begamot and mandarin are the most prominent notes on my skin with rhubarb, amber and musk sat in the background rounding off the overall composition.

Its office safe, daily wear safe, perfectly suitable for the gym, its just a good, fresh, all rounder.
Longevity and Silage are decent, silage is soft and close to skin, longevity is, on my skin, excellent with an 8 hours of wear.
Fresh, clean and reasonably priced too.

This is a great frag to sprits on once you're fresh out of the shower and in the mood for some serious Netflix and chill time.
Emphasis on the chill.

It's clean, crisp, refreshing but not without personality. I smell this fragrance and the words 'cute' and 'fun' immediately come to mind.
Its longevity is surprising decent.
And I believe its totally compliment worthy. Especially for the 'clean' scent lovers.

I could also see this being a staple gym scent.

A likable well-rounded unisex fragrance that's not going to break the bank?

CK, all-right!
Gak mirip sama sekali dg ck one. Tapi lebih enak ini. wanginya refresing banget.

I LOVE THIS SCENT! This is my first Unisex scent i brought and i feel like right after the first spray it mostly feels male, Its all citrus, but after a few mins the floral notes come in and blend perfectly and it gives it the feminine touch. So its perfect for anyone really. Definitely for summer days and nights but you could probably use it year round. I personally would save for Dates and special occasions. I wouldn't recommend this to any guy that prefers mature scents, this is a very playful, guy in his 20's scent imo, but for women, any age is fine! My sister (26 y/o) and mom (57 y/o) really liked it. (im 27 btw)

Longevity 9/10
Silage 7.2/10
Projection 8.5/10
Performance 9/10
Price 10/10

Overall 44.7 Grade- S

Overall, I really like this!

At first, however, it smells like someone spilled a whole glass of Gin & Tonic on you. That disappears after 30 minutes, and you’re left with a mouthwatering, fresh scent. It’s citrusy, a bit tart, a bit flowery. I agree with others, it’s definitely in the youthful and feminine territory. Inoffensive, but not boring or basic.

Great for the office, as a casual daytime scent or to wear during exercise. Decent sillage, okay longevity (4ish hours).

Oh how awesome!!! I only "like" CK One and CK Everyone, they don't necessarily snatch my up and make me go 'Ahhhh...' like this one (but all of the CK freshies over the years have been decent). I do love this one and favorite it.

I won an almost full bottle in a very generous giveaway, I'm so very grateful! I'm not allowing the free gifting to influence my review however, as I remain objective.

This is a little more feminine than One ot Everyone, and I think it's that way because of the rhubarb tartness blended with mandarin and white florals. Many people think *all* citrus is masculine, but I disagree, I think the oranges lean ♀️ It really doesn't matter though, they're all unisex, and even if they weren't, a confident person can get away with wearing most things in the bulk of the male/female continuum.

This one is a little flighter than One, and doesn't have as much protection. However, it performs decently for an EDT and the price point is reasonable enough to overspray, or re-up throughout the day (plus you'll want to on hot summer days, it's refreshing). These CK bottles are some of my favorite even if they're slightly uncreative (and I've always liked CK's vibe anyway, minimalistic and tomboy). It would be easy to tote this around and it's sturdy.

Ironically, I won this, but it's the safest blind buy candidate in my entire collection. I truly would recommend this to anyone of any gender, age, profession or whathaveyou. I will tip my hat to CK because I do think they deliver on their marketing message, and that their fragrances do suit *everyone* or *all*.

I don't know about the name. I can't see my grandpa or my dad wearing this fragrance. It leans a little more on the feminine side and it's a little sweet. It's kind of a youthful bubblegum fragrance for both men and women. It's for sure unisex. It's also very floral and citrusy fresh. I think this one is pretty good. I like it better than CK One. It's a good everyday, everywhere type of scent. I would wear this in the warm weather and to the gym. I don't think this would be ideal for winter but I think you could make it work if you wanted to. I love the solid white bottle. It will look good on your shelf or dresser. Another thing I get is an almost childish type of smell which is interesting but it's slight. This isn't for the mature man and if you like mature and masculine fragrances stay clear of this. I'm glad I tried this one. I give this an 84/100.

Really nice, it was a big surprise for me! the opening is fresh, crystalline, like a light summer wind with flying flower petals... feel the youth and all the unique modernity in this perfume. Ck All is very versatile! Very nice, i love it!

Sillage: 6./10
Longevity: 7./10
Scent: 8./10

Overall: 8./10

An okay scent. Not sure, not really a fan of this. I can smell the CK one DNA but don't really smell the same.
It was noticeably weaker than Ck one on my skin.
Citrus and Floral all I can get from this fragrance

Overall a 6.5/10 not bad, affordable, but I prefer the CK one

After spraying: Smells similar to CKOne, with extra note of bubble gum.

After one minute: Green Tea Lotus from Elisabeth Arden!! (the same sweetness, bubble gummy note of lotus flower + green tea) + CK One. It is a little more masculine version of Green Tea Lotus.

After half an hour: more citrusy than CKone, not so spacious and airy as CKOne, more dense. Smells like Fujiyama Succes de Paris (more "compact" "creamy" copy of CKOne) and Green Tea Lotus - something in between. Grapefruit/Lemon with leaves + marjoram + green tea + trace of bubble gum.

The rhubarb with an apple-like smell stars the show. In that tone the fragrance will project for - unfortunately - a very short 30 minutes at most. Afterwards, it sits on the skin on a delicious mix between rhubarb and the floral bouquet dominated by jasmine. The fixation is also a sad 2 or 3 hours (afterwards, it DISAPPEARS from the skin), and this in perfect climatic conditions. Another "impotent" masterpiece aroma from CK. One, Be and All: a masterful trifecta. By the way: One, Be and All are 3 very different perfumes and I believe it to the point of concluding that there is no aromatic conflict in having all 3.

Pleasant fresh fragrance. Inoffensive, a bit sweet. A good option if you’re looking for a relaxing summer scent that is not too citrusy or fruity. It’s not groundbreaking but it’s nice.
Safe blind buy.
Final note: 7/10

Fresh, citrusy zesty opening. But sits close to skin in 10 minutes and vanishes in one hour. In india, ac environment. Practically useless. Don't expect anyone else to notice your fragrance.
Poor sillage, poor longevity. Synthetic cheap fragrance. Better to go department store or generic perfume.

Yet another solid modern release from the Calvin Klein house, I really don't think their scents in recent years get the respect they deserve.

To me this feels like an updated version of CK One. CK All seems a little 'fuller' and a generally stronger scent but they are most certainly of the same ilk. As with CK One, CK Be and the rather brilliant (but quite different) CK2, there's a calming, relaxing, almost cosy side to this fragrance but at the same time it's very vibrant and uplifting.

Although with CK One still around (plus it's dozens of flankers) I'm not sure this one was truly needed (doesn't really bring much new to the table (unlike CK2 for example) but CK All is still a great 'easy reach' and safe kind of scent, an extremely versatile people pleaser, probably a little more feminine than manly (as with CK One) due to the floral notes used but as the name suggests anyone can rock it!

Decent performance for a freshie, around 7 hours.

Initial burst is a masculine musk (not a huge fan of it), but then the gorgeous citruses greens and rhubarb come out. Also has a fresh linen vibe which I really enjoy, overall I love this. Poor longevity is the only problem - therefore not sure it's worth full price... I'll keep a lookout for eBay discounted bottles.

**Anyone who has a bottle of this and would like to get rid at a discount let me know!***

Blindbought this based.on the reviews saying it's similar but more long lasting than CK One.
I do not find the similarities,for me CK All is more on the feminine side. I feel citrus notes at first,then after 30 min the citruses become more faint, leaving place to flowers and some powdery notes till drydown 6 hours later.
Sillage is moderate, longevity around 8 - 10 hours. I feel a vibe of floral soaps from the 90s.
Good for office and professional environment,but nothing to make me buy another bottle. Imo CK One,despite not being such long lasting, has more personality, is more uplifting and fresh.

You know... I love the original but I wouldn't purchase it because the reviews claiming that it's too weak. I decided to buy this one instead. Summer fragrances are not my favorites. I rather like a strong, strange, challenging winter stuff. It was a blind buy, and hey... the best blind buy ever for me. It's rather masculine -girls' reaction- and I don't know how it does that. After the opening of the mandarine it is just florals. And whenever i sniff this on me i am right up in heaven..... for this price definitely give it a try if you're not an "allthetimealphamale". It is just so fckn beautiful. If you're not into summer frags but want something unique... give it a go.... floral bomb with some citruses... compliments? If you want that go for some amber bomb. This is something else, for your own pleasure. I think i've found my summer cologne

- CK One , top notes citrusnya terlalu asam dihidungku, malah tercium seperti sabun batang cucian

- CK Be , walaupun wanginya lumayan bagus, tetapi longevity sangat buruk sehingga kualitasnya menjadi murahan

- CK All , ini yang terbaik dari ketiganya, top notes citrusnya lebih enak dari ck one , memasuki fase kering aroma floralnya sangat segar , longevity juga lumayan 6-7 jam
harganya juga murah, layak dibeli buta .

This is in my top 3 CK frags. At first I didn’t know what to think, as I got a variety pack and had never worn CK one, and was a bit overly cautious about wearing something labeled unisex. I’ll say that while CK one seemed far too feminine for me (for a 30 year old man, it’s not a bad scent though) I almost wrote off CK all as well.

I tried this one a few weeks later, and I love it. It seems to me to be the PERFECT daytime casual scent: fairly light, very pleasant and energizing. Bright and citrusy, yet super fresh and clean, not too sweet. Smooth floral notes balance out the citrus elements, and it really is an incredibly uplifting and refreshing scent, almost edible. I detect lemon or oranges, grapefruit, white flowers, refreshing tea, and light musk and some greens. I feel dumb for ever writing this off simply because it’s unisex.

Edit:
At first I felt CK All leans ever so slightly more towards the masculine side than CK One, and is just overall more pleasing to me.
After repeat wears and tests I am not so sure about this, they’re both a bit too feminine for me to wear constantly, but again, pleasant and well made fragrances.

This is the true worthy successor of the legendary CK One. It gives the same vibe but less musky/woody and more powdery maybe, that comes off as more feminine than the original CK One. The CK Be was a departure from CK One and the One Shock flanker felt more like a Be flanker. CK2 wasn't anything like CK One either. CK All could have been a CK One flanker or the successor CK2, but regardless of the names and lines, CK All is a great scent on it's own. It does seem to last a little longer than it's predecessors which isn't saying much but it's appreciated. This took over CK One as my favorite warm weather CK fragrance (One Shock is still my favorite for colder temperatures).

The smell is good, longivity and projection are not bad
the problem is the cologne smell feminine more than unisex on me.

CK All is an amazing cologne, it's got the fresh zesty Mandarin note up top, that settles into a creamy base. It smells really good and is bound to get you compliments.

Unfortunately, the major problem with this cologne is that it does not last in tropical summer high heat and sweat (it disappears after 2hrs, from the skin). On a cooler summer day or tropical springtime when outside temperature is around 28-30degC, it may perform well.

A very creative composition. Fresh but not soapy. Surprisingly, it lasts a long time on my skin. My wife wears it too, but it's not the standard floral for women. It was a blind buy, and I'm happy with it. For me, it's jeans and Tshirt kind of scent, but it can be an office scent for men and women either.

Update: it is the complete opposite of transparent. And it has a kind of stickiness quality that becomes annoying after a while.

The quintessential unisex crowd pleaser. I got some samples of this and gave them to my partner, as I'm not much of a CK lover. It's a very strong grapefruit scent on his skin, very refreshing and suitable for the hot Spanish summer. The projection is soft, but it lasts around 8h.

6/10
Easy-going, unisex

Very good fragrance from ck.. so far i like ck one shock, and eternity aqua from the house of ck.. overall the house is an ok house.. now back to ck all.. its very refreshing summer fragrance that most suitable on hot days out.. it lasted quite long for a fresh fragrance.. 6 to 7 hours but the sillage is minimum.. project good for 1 to 2 hours.. its not feminine and not masculine.. so for those who dislike unisex fragrance maybe pass on this one.. i sometime use ck all as a top up on my bvlgari aqua amara.. i know aqua amara is a beast mode fresh fragrance but the drydown can be a bit harsh.. so i layer ck all on top of amara drydown and i worked very well.. i get a more masculine version of ck all..

I'm liking CK All a lot. CK Be is a weak okay for me, I rarely reach for it. CK One I've always wanted to like but found it to have an unpleasant harsh edge. CK All is a winner for me though.

It's a fresh, clean floral scent. I think it walks the unisex line well. Very pleasant and easy to wear. It lasts a long time and has a soft presence. It doesn't smell strange or groundbreaking but at the same time it doesn't smell like anything I've worn before.

Very beautiful and actually fairly unique release from CK which is rare !

This opens up with a very bright mix of mandarin and florals and then quickly dries down to a scent that still has that citrus and florals but then the rhubarb comes in giving this a slightly spicy twist and the amber really comes into play making this creamy. I wouldn’t have guessed this was amber though as that creaminess reminds me a lot of coconut.

CK ALL is a great scent but unfortunately on my skin it comes off more feminine than I would like. It strongly resembles L’imperatance by D & G which is probably why I think that but even L’imperatance is more masculine. Still all in a great scent and I’ll have to wear this more in the summer heat for further testing as I’ve only recently worn this in colder and semi warm weather.

Performance on this is great for a summer scent as it last 5-8 hours but only has moderate projection,

Overall rating-7 out of 10 ! Very nice release and it gets points for uniqueness but it’s not a love for me.

I knew I would like it but I didn't expect to like it that much. It really is unisex, I can't say it's more feminine or more masculine, it is just in the middle. The opening is really fresh and citrusy. It really is a happy scent in the beginning. In the drydown, however, I really feel the warmth and creaminess of the musk- that's probably my favourite part about it. My boyfriend and I got a 100ml bottle to share but I think I will be getting myself a 200ml when I finish my 50ml of that one.

Very beautiful and clean fragrance. Loved it,
Better version of ck one and be.

This is BE's brother and ONE's cousin.
Personally I have a the young atmosphere of BE, but more luminous and blunt.
It is soft and more suitable during the day.
Even more masculine than unisex as for the other two.
smooth and honest.

Opening is Fresh, Fresh, Fresh!
Zesty Mandarin then gains a slight creaminess (perhaps this is the Jasmine note coming in).
Soft amber, wood and musk notes then follow.
But mainly this is all about the citrus.

As I live in a hot and humid climate in Australia I am always on the look out for fresh scents and this fits the bill for me. Love it :)

A clean, fresh, scent that starts off with an amazing, sparkling, burst of zesty orange and bergamot before settling down to the warm, subtle, scents of white flowers, warm amber and musk. There's a distinct woodiness in the dry-down too, which I'm assuming is the vetiver. It's a beautiful scent, and not at all too sweet or overpowering. It's the perfect anytime fragrance for anyone who likes it, male, female, old or young. It's also the perfect candidate for a signature scent, in my opinion.

CK all is a very beautiful fragrance. Extremely pleasant, clean and refreshing. Modernized and better, higher quality version of CK one.

Main notes are: mandarin, bergamot, white florals/jasmine and musk.

The opening is probably the best and most natrual/juicy mandarin openings you can get in a designer category. The great quality you get for the price is unmatchable.

For 200 ml at around 30 $ you get more than what you pay.

The only disadvantage is the poor longevity and the weak sillage. 1-2 hrs and it is just a faint skin scent so get the 200 ml to enjoy respraying the amazing opening.
This is a clean, fun, fresh, easy to wear scent. It's an everyday fragrance and it is not too strong. Great value for money.

you hate ck one?fair enough!so do I...i get headache from the cloying florals and the vetiver/metallic notes.this how ever is so so so good...i LOVE this fragrance, so good...it smells nothing like ck one..its as good as john varvatos artisan pure...minus the top note...beautiful fruity notes like orange, rhubarb and kinda like melons....with beautiful florals and musk...anyday in summer bang on...great scent for work and everyday...easy to wear...and lasts a LONG time for this kind of fragrance...who says ck sucks in their performance???
a perfect ten for beautiful bottle, monstrous sprayer and amazing juice...must must buy :)
10/10 yesssir a hidden gem...needs more love

A clean citrus and floral fragrance with a little sweetness. Great unisex fragrance for spring-summer. If you liked CK One and Be, this is a must buy.

8/10 Scent
7/10 Longevity
7/10 Sillage

One thing is wrong! Citrus notes are not the core backbone of this fragrance — don't be biased by other people voting madarin and lime.

Base notes — Unisex white floral mixed with soap & hand cream feel.

It's a super non-offensive smell, truly unisex. Girls will love to be around a guy wearing this as it's soft and welcoming scent and girls would just nail this smell. It is more on the notes that people relate to feminine scents, but, times are changing — people are coming back to oldschool way of just recognising good smells.

Scent: 7/10 (High quality Unisex scent)
Performace: 6/10 (Not a lot of sillage)
Versatility: 8/10 (Non-offensive)

FYI — If you want a citrus Unisex scent go with CK2 — that's a great choice too.

CK All is a nice fragrance from Calvin Klein, especially since he has a huge fragrance line. A lot of people are comparing this to CK One. I have tried CK One and never really been a fan of it. I never understood the appeal of it. This is nowhere near CK One, and I'm thankful because like this one. CK One was just to aromatic and clean smelling, this one has a more citrus floral clean smell. It is more on the feminine side, but guys can pull this off.
