I think it's more feminine considering CK One was more on the masculine side. This is probably supposed to be the more feminine updated counterpart. CK All starts very citrus and bright. The orange and bergamont blends in nicely while it transitions to the white florals. The dry down is where the bright citrus' and florals tone down and it becomes more warm and masculine smelling. This fragrance lasts for hours and projects decently. A nice summer/spring fragrance.

I bought this for my husband who's a massive fan of CK One. To be completely honest, it doesn't remind me of CK One, it's different, which he immediately liked. It's very refreshing and it smells more like aftershave, we both really like it. I think CK All is stronger, more manly and it's a perfect Summer fragrance. Just lovely

This is a real masterpiece; on me the main notes are jasmine and amber. Wonderful indeed.
My "THE ONE" I always want to keep in stock, a little bit of an ace up my sleeve.

I am actually so, so disappointed with this fragrance. I fell in love with the fun citrusy opening that I just didn't care about what follows it. But soon enough, this fragrance has developed into some kind of a dull, lifeless smell. It also has a synthetic smell to it I couldn't ignore once I realized it. I am unsure about whether I am satisfied or not for buying this perfume - the opening is synthetic but just so fun and fizzy, youthful and bright; the rest is like... what?...

soap, soap, soap...
cheap, cheap, cheap...

DO NOT blind buy this.
Very good fragrance for the spring-summer! Very cheap.. great!

I have a sample of this. To me, CK All is like the non-identical twin sibling of CK One, which I owned back in the mid 90s. I did wear and love CK One for a brief period, but when I tired of it, I ended up finishing the bottle as a room spray to mask the smell of cigarettes in my bedroom. I was a naughty teenager ;)

Anyways, CK All to me is a blast from the past, which I enjoy smelling for the nostalgia, but wouldn't want to wear today as a woman in her mid thirties. I'm just into other types of scents nowadays.

I also personally find it to be too masculine, and so gave my sample to my husband, who likes it and will no doubt wear it, secretly transporting me back to the 90s every time he does :)

This is a clean, fun fragrance. I understand what CK wanted to do. CK One and Be were awesome in their own way for that time, but have lost touch with the younger crowd.
This reminds me of CK one, but with a lot of white musk and less fruity. Refreshing and oddly works also in the winter.
Lasts surprisingly long.
I would have been happy if there was some more depth in the fragrance (added notes of patchouli, menthol etc).
wheres pineapple note and papaya note that I can vote...? its top is more stronger troprical vibe than original...

A wonderfully done unisex fragrance .A very ,soothing fresh floral fragrance,slightly spicy.

The Rhubarb note in the perfume is so nice and the DNA of CK one exists. An all season, daytime fragrance for the young men and women out there.

To me this fragrance opens up very citrusy and strong but that dies down to a beautiful scent. The rhubarb note is unique and done so incredibly well in this fragrance. When you smell this scent it makes you think of the color green, not in that way that it's earthy but in the way that it's fresh and alive. This can be worn all year long, in my opinion. It's at it's best in the summer though. if you like ck one you will love this! it lasts very long for being a fresh scent. silage and longevity are surprising. Starts out bit masculine and gets more feminine as it dries down.

well well well, this is the 1st perfume from CK that I really like it since 90s.... very fresh, soapy and citrus smell.... Good option for the daytime and good perfomance, I got a bottle of 200ml in $52... I think this is a very good price.
A little similar to CKone but absolutely CKall is more citrus and the sillage is better.

I know it's dated, but I really, really love Ck One. So I was excited to test Ck All. Longevity and sillage are quite impressive. I easily get 8 hours out of Ck All and from time to time I get a strong whiff of it, e.g. when I move my head.

It is certainly a pleasing scent that will not offend anyone and will even get you some compliments. When I tested it and got home my mom said "you smell really nice!". The opening smells like mandarin/orange. I really like this mandarin/orange note. The scent stays quite linear. You will get the orange all the time but mixed with a very strong amber note throughout. It smells like some creamy orange dessert. I love the opening, but the amber is too strong for my liking. I like that Ck All lasts so long, but I prefer the refreshing citrus/green tea feeling with the floral and musky drydown of Ck One.

I think Ck All would be perfect if the drydown wouldn't contain so much amber but would be rather floral/musky, because the mandarin opening is awesome. Maybe it is worth a try to layer Ck All with Ck One?

If you are looking for a long-lasting orange-amber fragrance - here you are!

Not a complete copy of CK One but very Close. I agree with @bhaskar.dangat, there is something sweet when you first spray it. Is it the grapefruit Blossom? My first wearing today,lets find out what its all about :)

A youthful CK, beautiful as always. Opens with beautiful bergamot, dries down to a beautiful juice with citruses! It reminds me italian garden full of citruses and flowers lol. It looks like sligthly the old CK One but this is much better in terms of smell and performance. It must be the strongest of the CK One line and one of the strongest CK scents ever made. It's not a beast that some say though.

This is a nice strong perfume, I had Ck One, CKin2U for Her and this one, CK All.
All sprayed on blotters within minutes of each other.
The next day, 24 hours later, I can still smell CK All.

Got myself a 200 ml Bottle, Other thank Ck One It does resemble to one of the Fragrances that i have come across in the past, not sure which one, First day of wearing it, feels good, It has been on me for a few hours, It has a better longevity than CK One, a mix of Chrome(soapy) and One, Plus some sweetness.

nice opening of Bergamot, Orange and there is something sweet which is nice about this perfume.

I can smell the Vetiver after 5 hours, So far Its good.

An all season fragrance. Thumbs Up to the new flanker it doesn't disappoint. :)

Fantastic fragrance smells amazing one of the best ck fragrances,, smells so fresh lasts long and draws compliments,, so good I'm on to my second 200 ml bottle and just ordered another at the great price of £30 at UK fragrance shop for 200 ml instead of £59

I'm not quite sure why this has so many dislikes.

I'm not a fan of amber, but I barely detect it. What I smell is a rounded, slightly creamy citrus. It's not too sweet, and that's a plus. It's fairly linear. The top notes are present throughout, and never really fade.

As for longevity, this is a 12+ hour fragrance on me, but fragrances in any form usually last a long time on my skin. A woman at work liked it. It is somewhat similar to CK One, but it's stronger. I'm not completely sure about projection, but it seems fine.

It's the type of fragrance I enjoy, clean, fresh, citrus, slightly creamy but not too sweet.

I have a 15ml splash, honestly say, I love it more than CK One or CK Be, top note is easily gone on my hands, middle note is lovely creamy musky and flowery vibe, and dry down is ambery and vetivery, overall I love the scent, more sophisticated, good blend and good performance, surprisingly it last 7 hours on my skin, worthy for money, great made by CK, yes I will buy the 200ml very soon
ALL the best and fabulous of the scent disappears in a minute... not a penny worthy.

Very much like CK One with the green notes toned down and amber subbed in to be the star of the show. So you can detect the CK One dna, but it's got a very Sauvage-like vibe going on too. Also firmly unisex.

I think I prefer the scent of original CK One better, it's a bit more refreshing and subtle. Also, I find that as All develops into the skin scent it leans a bit too feminine for my liking.

It's got good performance and I haven't even reached the end of its longevity. I mean, I can smell this on my skin 1 inch away a full day after applying and then its time for my next shower.

got a chance to sample this on paper two times already and, I must say that I disagree with most comments for this fragrance.

The first time I sampled this I immediately liked it. It has a strong yet nice citrus/floral scent that develops into a semi-sweet powdery scent. I guess it was due to the fact that I also got a sample of Eros on that day and must have combined. So I gave it another try. The strong citrus/floral smell was still there and will continue to be there for at least an hour or more. I was waiting for it to settle into a 'warmer sauvage' or aqva amara but it never happened. It was the same citrus/floral scent all throughout. I also disagree that it lasts long. Not sure if I easily got olfactory fatigue or it really had longevity issues.

Overall I still think it's worth a try. Best try it out before buying. I also think it leans more feminine. But whatever, people should wear what they want regardless of what gender the perfume is for :D


(PS. If I had to rank CK One, Be, and All, this would be second next to CK Be)

This CK All bring me back my love to CK One. I used to wear CK One here in Indonesia because it's quite warm and it keeps me fresh, a good mood to start your day.

CK One last only 4 hours but CK All performance is great , it can perform 7 to 9 hours.

It has fresh Vibe of CK one but it more mature. It is safe for blind buy.

Great Job Calvin Klein.

Nice but average. you will not offend anybody with it, so it is safe to use it in most of the situations. More for women than men. Good performance. All said.

Scent: 6/10
Performace: 7/10
Versatility: 8/10

I tested this at Boots yesterday and really liked it! Only today it hit me that i was getting a little of CK IN2U for her and mixed with the CK One.

Its still smelling strong on paper. Quite impressed with this fragrance.

CK All instantly transported me back to when I was 12 years old (12 years ago). A guy I was playing tennis with must have been wearing CK One. The Paradisone molecule must be reminding me of Hedione... Definitely a Spring/Summer Daytime scent I don't know who would ever wear this in winter let alone at nighttime. Just before the second stage of the fragrance I caught the smallest touch of ambroxan for only minutes and then, after the musky florals, it became a fruity cocktail with my nose picking up Pear, Apple and even Passionfruit (might be the rhubarb or Grapefruit Blossom though). In the final stages of the scent I am left with musk, in quite naked form, I did pick up on a dirty kind of Vetiver at this point but it has a very short life. Throughout the entire life of CK All the Paradisone and Amber notes make frequent and, at times, intermittent appearances. I would say it lasted around 7 hours on my skin which is amazing in comparison with the new CK lines. For me on the skin it is feminine but the projection/sillage has masculine qualities.
this fragrance would be my signature scent.. this is masterpiece now and ever.. you would never regret to try this

I remember smelling this on EVERYONE in the early 90s, not a bad thing because it was really something different then. I had a hot tub and put (specially-made-for-tubs) scents in, and there was a copycat scent for CK One which smelled so freaking good in that water. This smells very close to the original with maybe a bit more brightness, heft, and citrus at the top. Love the white bottle. I put it in my husband's drawer, but he doesn't seem to be reaching for it, so I took it back. I will look for it as a lotion and shower gel. I am not getting the sillage that others seem to be though.

Refreshing citrus top notes but weirdly "chemical", "80s car fragrance" vibe in the drydown on my skin. (Does anyone remember "Going Steady"?)

Bought a small bottle after trying the fragrance and just smelling the top notes. After that, I learned how to take my time before buying a fragrance. So disappointed.

I have to admit I'm really pleasantly surprised! CK fragrances usually smell good, but are really poor performers. Not CK All. Very good performance and it really smells great! Actually really reminds me of Dior Sauvage in the drydown! Blind buy, and couldn't be happier. I know this is a unisex fragrance, but IMHO, it is way more masculine than feminine. Safe blind buy guys. Smell great, and be blessed! 9/10 overall for me.

Scent 9/10!
Longevity 7+ hrs

Just an update:

I've been testing this for over a week now, the opening is a richer CK One,
Then transform into a warmer sauvage then ends up like Bvlgari Aqva Amara!
6hrs on my skin, 10hrs+ on clothes!
Just got my 6.7oz bottle today, upon first spray I immediately get that classic ck one dna but as it develops the ambroxan/sauvage vibe creeps in. More testing needed ☺️

I'm not a fan of CK one but I kinda like this new CK all.

I find that the mandarin in here is very realistic and close to the real fruit (also the main reason I like this fragrance), and then I smell strong amber all the way.

It is a clean orangey somewhat warm fragrance overall, and it can also be quite strong with good lasting power despite being an EDT - I can still smell the scent 5 hours after I sprayed on my arm.

-----

EDIT: Sadly, I'm not very into this anymore. It smells very warm with strong amber and jasmine note throughout the fragrance which is quite overbearing for me somehow.

...also, this thing is quite potent for the first hour or so, so those who don't remember the juggernaut the original One was and are used to today's diluted version, be a bit gentle on the sprays. guess 4 is enough. leaves a very nice scenttrail and smells like One was and should have remained.
Great stuff.

Thank you Klein.
Thank you Coty.
Great one, to fall in love all over again.
It's not so much a flanker as a reimagining and update of One that goes back to basics adding a bit of amber and, I gues, ambroxan to "modernize" it.
At first sniff I was transported in time to the very first try of One, which went to be my favorite for a decade or so. It is that similar (and that good) to the original One formulation. A little masterpiece.
The snobs will of course dismiss it as "generic" and "for the masses" but this is a first and foremost pleasant smell for both the wearer and its surrounding.
Longevity and projection are good to excellent, in line with the first One formulations.
Would you say it is a flanker or it is other line like ck one, ck be and now ck all? reading some of your posts i get the idea is a flanker from ck one, i do no know, i haven-t smelled it yet.

I recieved this at work today and I must say - I'm pleasantly surprised!

This fragrance is definitely an amber bomb - it's there from beginning to end - however, mandarin and jasmine also take front row. The opening is a soapy citrus blast, and I immediately thought it would be a carbon copy of CK One Summer (like, one of the eight hundred editions..). However I was happy to find that on my skin, the jasmine and amber pushed forward and harmonised beautifully with the citrus, giving this lovely warm scent. After a few hours I am still catching whiffs of it, and I can definitely smell some grapefruit blossom and maybe some rhubarb?

All in all (heh) I find this scent to be fresh yet warm, light yet noticeable, masculine yet feminine. Yes, you can definitely smell the homage to the classic One, but it's like One grew up and is wearing a knitted sweater in a park in Spring. Fingers crossed this can begin the revival of the Calvin Klein fragrance brand!

Definitely give it a try on your skin, and don't be so quick to judge!

I much prefer this to the original CK one! - All's heritage is noticeable but I'm loving the mandarin and the amber notes, I always love a combo of warm and fresh notes.
It does seem to have more staying power than One too. Although, as much as I like it I'm going to be staying loyal to my beloved CK one gold & CK2!
To be fair I was only born the year that CK One was released so I wasn't exactly there for the massive hype and I'm sure this can't begin to compare. I would imagine that for a CK One lover this may feel like a poor imitation.

Something else to be aware of, with this new fragrance CK are planning on raising the prices to take the brand up a notch and give more of a luxury feel. So if you wanna stock up on CK One, or Be then I'd do it now as it may become more tricky to find them at great deals soon!

Smelt it at work today... Was so excited I nearly blind bought it. Unfortunately not for me, I'm not saying it's bad but it's very feminine in my opinion. It will remind you of ck one that's for sure but it's kinda like ck one with heavy Jasmine or some floral note, and candy like orange. Pass for me

What an awesome flanker - I've bought 2ml sample and I felt in love already.

Smells very citrus/orangey at the beggining. I can feel the vibe of CK One.

Ignore dislikes - people voted for dislikes before these perfumes were even for sale.
In my opinion it has a clear inspiration in the success of Sauvage, I can detect a similar vibe in the background.

Dear KonKok; We'll assume your a teenager girl then.

Been wanting to pick up this juice, is it worth the pricetag???

Finally picked this up summer 2019. This is a very well done scent from CK.

Scent:8
Longevity:5
Sillage/Projection:5
Unique/Industry First:6
Quality:6

I'll definitely keep this 1 in my rotation......

Was not expecting much, but had hopes because of Alberto Morillas, and it is really good, longevity too.
One more test and probably will buy it, besides it is not expensive.
Just so everyone knows, I bought a tester of this on ebay for $27 in the USA, Also FragranceX has this for $42 that's the price after the 15% off code.

Finally a Ck one flanker that smells as a flanker, not the other scent. A modern, better made CK one.

It has that soapy/floral vibe of Ck One/Chrome, but got a velvety/irisy vibe, became less citrusy and edgy, more creamy and sophisticated. That way Ck all smells closer to Prada L'Homme than to Ck one.

A good fragrance.

Its mid march now and i still have not seen it sold anywhere in UK shops for some reason .. i know people always trash CK perfumes but i love them .. especially ck summer line and im really looking forward to smelling this when i can get my hands on it

I agree with La DameDeNoir. A suntheticy underlying note most definitely, bearable; but honestly show me a perfume from Ck line that doesn't have that synthetic feel, even if the notes change. You know what you are going for.Generic as well, but yet again, I cannot imagine a ck line fragrance not being generic and appropriate for all.

It is definitely long lasting and projects well for the first hours when it is more intense. When the scent tames, the projection is softer. Apart from the synthetic aspect, I'm not disappointed by the blend.

Amber does pair well with the citrus and it is very prominent for the first hour. After that it's all white florals with some citrus and less amber. Now the jasmine surprises me; it's supposed to be animalic, but the jasmine is just a little fleshy, just enough for the millenials, it's there, it's there, but you have to try hard to get it.

Warm and crisp at the same time. Alberto Morillas did not fail me even this time; I was expecting a much worse juice of what I got. Above average and appropriate for teens or young adults who want a simple scent with "that something" in it.
Been a big fan of CKone since it came out and I am really looking forward to getting a bottle of CKall for the summer.

great citrusy opening for hot climates ...
I wonder who has clicked on winter bar ...?after the Rhubarb stands out...
continue...after more than half an hour citrus fruits are reduced and reaches an explosion of flowers, I feel very freesia on all first ... then comes the power of jasmine and finally comes the lily ... always on a basis of citrus but less strong ... so the scent does not lose its citrusy freshness and don't becomes cloying ... all this after one hour and more...,two hour....this parfum is a bomb...

after more than two hours here vetiver to dampen somewhat the always very strong citrus tones and some moss appears but Amber feels only a timid ombra.la floral part is always present.
I am sure that the votes to individual notes have been given at random. there is no sweetness from amber in this perfume !!!
In conclusion it is a beautiful renovation. compared with ck one, this performance over 12 hours and is more floral than green. very citrusy but a citrus that I like because 'accompanied by flowers from rhubarb and vetiver.
Instead ck be very different from that he had a lot of lavender and musk.
It may be the smell of summer for those who like strong citrus.
I do not find synthetic. Longevity: more than 12 hours. sillage: fills a room and more. for me is unisex. final grade 9/10 and for me it very much because I do not love the citrus.

My only fear with this is hat it pales to the original CKOne that was a citrus powerhouse. And even that has been reformulated to something other than its original edition. I don't see CK capturing audiences with this one. Also CK2 was a stellar tel saw that I enjoy and love and it flopped. It was the perfect fresh inisex scent that was innovative a real departure from the boring releases of today. So here's hoping that this will be a hot and also the are billing this as a pillar fragrance and not a flanker which is kind of hard to do being the branding of the CKOne line is littered with numerous flankers. How are they going to make sure gisbstand apart and out? Time will tell

It says it will be released in Feb, but i see many people saying (voting) that it lasts very and has enormous projection

Not to mention votes about main notes, there are loads of them ..

Is it already released somewhere ?
How can people tell all of this
mix of CK one/ CK be / CK Red / and all the CK
stop disliking before it even comes out ugh geez people !!!

@anitaoolong I think they could just publish an article related to the upcoming release rather than adding it to the directory before the fragrance is officialy released.So visitors would get informed for the upcoming fragrances and won't be able to vote. In that case I can't understand why would people complain.

In all honesty, one of the problems with the voting seems to be that it is way too easy (on mobile), to slide the longevity and sillage meter as well as accidentally hit the love/like/dislike and summer/winter. That may be where the issues are coming from. I highly doubt that this will be a "night" fragrance based on the notes and previous experiences with CK One. Fragrantica should maybe look at modifying the voting interface... It could be just as simple as that.
Well people who vote before the fragrance comes out are as stupid as Fragrantica editors who add a fragrance in the directory before its release.
This never ends...

It seems everything old is new again...what is older (or more ubiquitous in perfume) than citrus, jasmine and amber? However...cK has been bringing their "A game" as of late and I hope this wafts with the same simplexity (complex simplicity) of something much more expensive.

As farr as citrus + oriental goes Lord's Jester Helios is in my no. one position but it is patchouli dominant and I HAVE been on an extended amber kick these days, so...I will be hopeful and osmagine the best, but remain guardedly cautious.

After one, be, one shock (his AND hers) one gold and, most recently, cK2 "a fragrance for all of us"; cK All seems to complete the cycle. We shall see (or in this case) sniff!

smell swell & be well...
GP

Esta es la tercera edición de verano de CK one que compro. De acuerdo, aún no los he probado en mi piel, pero fuera de la botella, todos huelen muy cítricos y son muy similares entre sí. Si bien es un perfume catalogado como perfume unisex. Siento que es más masculino que femenino; diría 70% masculino y 30% femenino.

In my opinion, this was the best CK One Summer flanker. It smelled aquatic, fruity, and had a musk note to it.

The bottle was stunning. It looked so beach-ready!

This is a good summer scent! The evolution is quite smart: if you spray it on in the afternoon, you'll be refreshed.
By the evening, when the air cools off, you can enjoy the cozy musky dry down, that says: I've been out in the sun the whole day, I've swum, dried up in the sun, I moved and I rested, my body feels completely satisfied and relaxed, now I'm ready for some late night contemplation. It's nice! Not in an oh-my-god-what-the-hell-is-this-spiritual-experience kind of way, but it works very well nonetheless.

My father gifted me this from his collection in 2013/14 as one of my first perfumes. I used semi-regularly throughout the months of spring and summer. The notes here are all very good and smell like summer from what I remember. I do recall it being weak in terms of sillage and longevity, but at the time just kind of threw it one. So perhaps this is just modern me thinking that, and if I were to smell it again would think different.

My Mom bought me this perfume at a mall in the summer of 2013. It reminds me a lot of my high school years. I haven’t come across any other scents quite like it yet. So nostalgic!

“Summer” describes this scent perfectly. Very fresh, very tropical.

I bought this while traveling in the summer of 2013 in a London airport. I smelt it and loved it. It was my first actual "expensive" fragrance my parents bought me for my birthday. I loved it so much a few years ago my mom bought me 2 more bottles and I fear I'll have to open my last one soon because I haven't found anything quite like it. It brings up so many memories and goods times! Sorry I can't give more info into the actual scent. It just feels fresh and clean like a tropical spa. I'd love to find a dupe for this!

I owned a bottle in 2013. I still vividly know the smell of it. It’s the Giant Granadilla the dominant note in this perfume which is not mention above. Giant granadilla fruit is like the shape of watermelon with a passion fruit seeds inside its like a giant passion fruit.

If Hawaiian Punch was to release a fragrance, it would be this. The watermelon, cucumber, citrus and water notes make this smell like something you'd want to pour into a cup and gulp on a hot summer day.

I liked this when I was in my early 20s but not so much now. It smells good - fresh, vibrant and youthful - but in a cartoonish sort of way. At 30, it's just not what I prefer to wear now. Definitely a spring/summer scent.

Mouth watering splashy gourmand thanks to the fruity notes. Fresh like out of the shower thanks to the watery notes. Very safe and decent summer fragrance. I remember falling in love with it at a duty free shop although i am not a fan of the original One.

Best ever! i find it very similar to 2008 edition.
I wish if they continue this edition soon so i can buy many of these!
A piece of heaven. Bought 6 bottles at the time. Now using my last one. Cucumber and watermelon. the bad thing is that it doesnt last long. also low projection.

The scent is actually good. However I don't find that it projects so well.
The cucumber destroyed the scent in my opinion it's intensive and doesn't work so well with the melon.

You ever come across a product and just think "There's no way the raw materials cost anywhere near what they're asking?" Well, obviously that's business, but I mean you just know when something is a serious ripoff.

Anyway, I usually don't care about synthetic smelling stuff, I'm not a top dollar kinda guy, my tastes are too simple. Cucumber melon aquatic? Wow, I should love that. However, there's something about this that just makes me think "cucumber melon hair spray." Don't know if that's a thing, but if it is, I bet this smells just like it. It just melts right off my skin in the summer too, barely noticeable in no time.

I just knew I was going to love this. The notes seemed to be everything I typically like. Blind buy. Don't love it. Don't even like it. I credit this fragrance with showing me what too aquatic and synthetic means. I couldn't leave it on long enough to know what the longevity is. This is the first fragrance I rushed to wash off after 30 minutes or so. The bottle is the most gorgeous blue. I wish it had worked for me.

I love aquatic fragrances, so as soon as I saw the notes on this, I decided to blind-buy it. I'd actually decided not to buy any more CK perfumes because I either don't like them, or they smell too similar.

This is the fourth perfume I've bought in the CK line. I loved CK One until everyone started wearing it. Escape was much too strong for me and I simply can't stand Truth.

I'm so glad this Summer 2013 edition did not disappoint me.

The bottle is beautiful. I love the color blue and the water drops add a lovely element to the bottle. As was the case with One, I like having the option to dab or spray.

This is quite a citrusy scent. With citrus scents, some perform better on my clothes rather than on my skin. This one opens, develops, and dries down beautifully on my skin/pulse points. It's clean, fresh, and inoffensive, as long as you don't use a heavy hand with it.

The longevity wasn't as great as I expected, but then again I used a light hand. That being said, I advise against spraying liberally to make it last. Buy an atomizer and lightly top up your wrists during the day.

Since you wash your hands a few times during the day to include your wrists, you're pretty much washing away the fragrance. Use a fragrance-free (or lightly fragranced)hand lotion then spritz your wrists. The scent will perform at that fresh, sprayed-in-the-morning level.

I don't ever re-spray any other part of my body during the day as changes in body chemistry will change the way the fragrance performs and smells.

Overall, I like it and plan to use it this summer, but I don't see myself re-purchasing it.

Blind buy here in Atlanta after reading all the reviews. Not disappointed with this one. I love the fragrance and the bottle, but the longevity only seems to be about 4 hours on the skin. This is definitely a layer/mixer fragrance.

Scent: 6.5
Longevity: 4 hrs
Projection: Poor
Sillage: Good if applied heavily
Season: Summer
T.O.D.: Day

#mrford

If you want a casual, light, simple spray n' go to get you through the hot summer months while you smell fresh and energized then you can't go wrong with CK One Summer limited edition for 2013. Considering it's unisex it would be perfect for summer holidays where you could take a one bottle and by doing this you save space and share it with your loved ones it's like killing two birds with one stone. Now that's what I call a hell of a review, now shower me with your balloons.

This is the third CK one summer editions I've bought. Granted, I haven't tried them out on my skin yet, but out of the bottle they all smell extremely citrusy and they are very similar. What is up with that?

OMG love this!!!! Best unisex scent I own. Not very masculine at all like many CK unisex.

I smell mostly citruses and maybe cucumber/water notes but no watermelon. But this is perfect anyway and I'm in love with it! Considering wearing spring and winter even! I like this so much I'll wear it every season
Grapefruit.... Not very complex but smells nice. I let my little girls wear this when they want to wear perfume. Definitely unisex.

First initial wearing : So this is my first wearing of this and so far I must say I'm a little disappointed if I'm to be honest. It does smell ok but compared to other CK One summer scents this 1 is probably my least favorite.

This opens up watery, with semi- sweet fruit notes that are also slightly sour. It is nice and I can see some people enjoying this but this scent didn't really catch my attention like the 2014 and the 2016 version did ( The 2016 version was amazing!!! ) Out of all the CK One Summers this is also the 1 that smelled the most feminine which I didn't really care for. This smelled like a body mist my mom used to wear that I always thought smelled like rotten raspberries. So maybe it was my skin but it almost came off like a synthetic mess but not quite.

Performance on this however is really good so far ! It's been 4 hours and it's still going fairly strong and I can still smell this when I walk. I could see this lasting upwards and into 6-10 hours.


Sidenote--- The fragrance this smelled like was Cool Water Woman !!!

On me longevity is OK, so as sillage. For 4 sprays I get around 4-5 hours in a tropical country. For the price, I have no complaints. Scents is what it is, summer, fresh, safe for the day. Not my signature but I enjoyed it.

I have 2013, 2014 and 2015, this one has the best longevity and sillage by miles!! It's brilliant, get 24 hours with this and people can smell me from about 2 feet away. It's scent unfortunately isn't quite as lovely as the others but still a good buy! It opens very watery with a hint of citrus, i don't think the citrus notes are very strong. It then dies down with a very masculine watermelon, not a juicy one!
Very masculine scent, couldn't imagine a lady wearing.
Scent-8.5
Longevity- 10
Sillage- 9
Why buy this one if you have other options like Hermes Un jardin sur le Toit & Acqua di Parma Blue Mediterraneo.....very poor longevity and silage,not satisfied at all
Cucumber!!!!!

Fresh and aquatic. Reminds me of Davidoff Cool Water Summer Fizz 2006 edt for men. (Unfortunately there's no review about that one on Fragrantica.) And I find something similar to Clean Rain too.
Bottle is lovely. This gives a fresh boost when you spray it. It's a bit on masculine side for me at the beginning but I'll use it anyway. Later the flowers come out, I think it's most water lily on me.
i like it a lot, but doesnt smell like expensive perfume at all. i appreciate longevity, but i smell something synthetic in it. i think i wont buy it again.
An excellent summer fragrance ... Mid silage but it worth the money
summer breez
Everything is fine except cucumber notes, this note is not good, it must be replaced with something else.

I am obsessed! I can't wait to get a boyfriend to share this fragrance with, haha (since it's unisex).

At first it's kind of fresh in a very strong way, when you've just sprayed it onto your skin. But after a while when it's had some time to sink in it's just pure freshness, and I can't tell you how much I love it. I basically have a thing for all aquatic, citrusy fragrances, but this one tops the list. Love to CK for this!

PS. I'm obsessing over the raindrops on the bottle design as well...
Guilty as charged: I bought because the bottle. The color of it more precisely! Well, I think Aleccsei said it all. And that's it. ":¬P

An amazing bottle design, turquoise with the water droplets covering it, just great summer vibe bottle. I didn't really care about the juice just wanted the bottle!

The scent is nice not a stand out frag but a nice light fresh fruity aquatic with a subtle musky dry down, it's no game changer and many will turn away due to the fact its a flanker or slightly generic. But i believe the CK One summer flankers are good and they always seem to change it up each year and are affordable and well done! there's not much too dislike! it's a pleasant unisex scent just to wear casually in the summer heat and it's good for that.

Longevity is poor 3-5 hours max projects well for 1-2 hours but overall a crowd pleaser and a solid summer flanker. Get it 2013 or not 7/10

I only tested it in the store... and at the beginning, I loved it. You can feel the apple falling down the waterfall accords - which is an incredible scent. You kind of fall in love with the fragrance.

But then, after you get home, after around 20 minutes, you realize that the apple and cucumber have mutated into a cheap soap from the 90's.

This 2013 is the same as the much valued 2008 scent. Ive had both...they are the same. The 2008 scent was the most sought after scent in the CK One family going for over $100. Save your money and buy the 2013 version. Very different from other summer scents. Its not my favorite, but still nice to smell. One of my favorite colognes of all time is the 2012 Summer CK One and the reason why I started getting a lll the Summer CK ones. 2010 is another great summer scent if you like oranges.
This scent is much more masculine than feminine. I would say 75% masculine and 25% feminine.

its hard to breath with it
very bad
for male only. definitely not unisex
Very refreshing and light yet catching, it reminds me of lying on the beach in a sunny day. I'm definitely going to add this one to my collection.

The notes listed do not reflect what I sprayed on my wrist to test. It opened with a fresh tart burst of grapefruit. There is short lived heart of aquatic notes with very little ozone and a vague fruitiness. The dry down is an underwhelming, run of the mill iso-e super base. Mediocre at best. It bares almost no resemblance to the original CK One fragrance.

I enjoy the cucumberishness of this, the suggestion of an aftershave, yet it defies that limitation. You keep catching other things in it, sometimes the watermelon, sometimes the musk, it takes you off guard. I bought it on impulse, and haven't regretted it. I suspect it will be a mainly summer thing, however.

I'd like to think I didn't find my new favorite scent; it found me. I had wanted to try these limited CK One Summer scents when this year's edition caught my eye in a display at Macy's. It drew me in, to the tester, and from the first spray it had my heart in a way that very few perfumes have. It must have known that it would be right for my body chemistry, because it develops so perfectly and stays on so long. It seems I have had more success with it than a lot of other reviewers, because I never got a hint of that synthetic or musky shampoo vibe that people have been mentioning. For me, it's hours of watermelon and cucumber that don't even really change, they just fade slowly. The citruses are a sweet, slightly feminine citrus, never sour or bitter. It is a little bit sweet but all cool, shimmering and dewy-fresh, as if the hotter the weather the better it will get. Though definitely not for fall nights, I wouldn't even call this a scent that's OK for spring, because it's almost begging for wear in the heat, alongside oceans and cool drinks. I could not get it out of my mind until I went and got two bottles, and I can see myself getting even more so I never have to worry about running out once they stop producing this edition. How lucky I feel to have taken the chance to try THE scent of the summer. I hope others will too.
very refreshing and aquatic feeling but not as long lasting as i hope.........

I love the CK One Summer scents. They just look so 'happy' and 'drinkable'. This one smells pretty nice too, a nice, clean, fruity youthful scent for going down to the beach with some friends or family.
This is very synthetic. It smells like a man's deodorant... Not unpleasant, but not what I was hoping for. I had high hopes, but the cheap musk really kills this one for me.

The review by Michael.J really can't be topped, his is authoritative and comprehensive and needs little more embellishment. Suffice to say Ck One Summer 2013 is a shocking return to form of the classic earlier Summer releases in regards to longevity, which had steadily declined in the late 2000's and peaked with last year's release to an all time brevity that undercut its beautiful top and excellent blending of cucumber and citrus.
Ck One Summer 2013 lasts between 5-8 hours with moderate projection. Unfortunately the scent itself is not as rewarding or organic as last year's. The synthetic waterfall accord extends itself from the initial blast well into the dry down and creates a very generic, watering down of the brighter elements of the blend, leading to a rather linear and insipid development between citrus and fruit to a bland musk and water lily dry down. This is a decent commercial unisex release that exudes fun and youth, but could have been much more enjoyable and effective if the blending would have been more professional and thorough, allowing the watermelon, citrus and cucumber to evolve of the skin without the clouded masking of the entire blend by the cheap, synthetic waterfall accord that ultimately makes CK One Summer 2013 extremely boring after just two or three wearings. More for collectors than those looking for a truly enjoyable, fruity, citric blast for summer.

For 2013, the opening watermelon is really intense, and the intermediate dry-down is pretty good, sweet and pleasant. Once the fruit has been licked away, however, the base notes of musk and moss hit the floor with a dull, lifeless thud. They are painfully inert and clumsy compared to the dancing fruit and water notes. Moreover, they smell heavy and slightly rancid, like the interior of an automobile in the summer if you've left some stale jelly doughnuts baking in the sun on the dash for a few days. I've tried this on skin, fabric, paper, other people, and I think it's a combination of cheap synthetics (I have no problem with good synthetics) and inexpert mixing. I think different base notes could have played a more harmonious role (e.g., something more resinous or balsamic. Even the oak moss could stay if the cheap musk were replaced.). I wanted to like this so much because the opening is so seductively juicy, but the fragrance ultimately doesn't deliver on its promise.

This is one of those perfect unisex scents- it really doesn't fall on one gender over the other. That said, it smells exactly like a deodorant or cologne my other half had years ago- we can't place which one, but that aquatic with citrus and cucumber combination triggers our memory of something he had before. It's very fresh, clean and sporty. It has moderate staying power, I spritzed it on before I left the house around 3 and could still kind of smell it on my wrists when we came home around 1 in the morning. It's a great summer smell; I'll definitely use up my tester, but I don't think I'll actually buy a bottle. There's nothing that really stands out to me and screams "you need me!" Especially since we know we've had something like this before and weren't attached enough to it to remember what it was. Bottom line: If you're in the market for a trendy summer scent and you really like sporty/aquatic fragrances, go for it. If you're waiting for something special, keep looking.
This reminds me a lot of Bonds Coney Island.

J'ai essayé ce parfum aujourd'hui est je dois avouer que je suis déçu. En général j'aime bien la ligne Calvin Klein mais CK One 2013 m'a réellement donné des hauts-le-coeur. Sans donner ans l'analyse complète des tons et des bases, c'est immédiatement une senteur de bonbons qui nous viens au nez. Pas désagréable dans une confisserie, mais au soleil à 28°c, ce n'est pas un must. Je l'ai trouvé agressant. Cependant, pour un adolescent ou un jeune homme, cette fragrance devrait donner tout autre chose.

Je considère qu'il n'est pas un parfum fait pour les plus de 25 ans.

Love at first smell.
I like this perfume, and I don't think it's too masculine.
The dry down is actually more on the feminine side.
This is really refreshing, I get the citruses and the cucumber the most.

But this smells like an ice cold fizzy drink to me. Very sweet, very bright and very fruity.

I'm eyeing this one.

Smell like cheap perfume , smell like bvlgari marine,

Unisex on the slightly masculine side, but I think it's a great scent also for girls on hot summer days. Starts off with a good, aquatic melon, moves on to a musky phase which very nice. Good sillage.

If I lived in a hot country I think I would get this, but I don't think rainy UK will do it justice. Would still be a good allround scent for guys I think.

(Edit: Damn you oakmoss! This was swell on my skin until 2,5 h when the oakmoss started to take over... had to scrub it off. Bad chemistry).

I am quite impressed with this years ck one summer. The bottle design is brilliant, the colour and the water drops are spot on. It is quite a unique summer flanker fragrance and in fact really reminds me of bvlgari aqva. It doesn't really smell the same as it but for me it has that kind of feel to it.

It opens up very refreshing and aquatic citrusy but not in a bitter way. It then proceeds into a more oceanic woodsy water scent which reminds of bvlgari aqva possibly a less mature, less masculine, more synthetic, younger version of bvlgari. The watermelon and cucumber are very dominant here. On me it fades out from here.Although unisex I would say slightly masculine but still unisex.

Lasts for hours 10+, projection is moderate. Pleasant, unique, safe, great value, better than average in all departments must try. Great for summer and plenty of other occassions.

Just bought this today. Walked by it in the mall and thought it was a cool bottle I took a smell of it tried it on and then pulled out my wallet. It's more of a cologne than a perfume but the feminine quality of it makes women really love it! If your a female don't buy it ! You will be let down it's way you masculine! If you're older than 30 don't buy it it's too young ! But if your a fun loving guy who wants something just right buy it ... Now!!!

good for summer

His this one coul work wonder in fall and winter. Clean , vibrant , woodsy , long lasting. Great sillage as well
it's gonna be a hell of a summer
I can't wait to buy this one !!! <3
Can't wait!!!!!!!!!! They are finally bringing back the watermelon note circa 2008!!! So excited!!!!
Always love the line. Still gonna buy this as another flacon
Seems similar to the 2008 edition if yes then this will be received well!!
Ck One Summer has been the best from Calvin Klein!!!
omg this is so good!!! i love aquatic scents because they remind me the ocean and the beach! I want this soo much!

For me this is right up my alley. This is a must have for 2013!!!! I can already tell you without smelling this. Most likely this will smell very similiar to Ralph Lauren Cool, I'm already in love!!! product_name: Deep Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content:
I had a strange experience with this– when I first got it, something in the opening notes (i think the lily?) was too sharp for me, it almost had a peppery character. It was a shame, cause I loved how it dried down, but I couldn't stand that opening. I put it in storage with the intention to maybe give it to a friend who would enjoy it and promptly forgot about it lol.
Now, a few months later, I tried it again and I don't experience the same sharpness at all. The florals seems more soapy now. I don't know if it's the perfume that changed, my sense of smell or something with my skin but I kind of love it!
It dries down to a gorgeous, woody scent that could read as more unisex. Will absolutely keep wearing this!

product_name: Deep Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content:
It is nice, so refreshing in the opening, a bit floral
But damn, in an hour or so - you'd be left with something masculine
Like a men's deospray with heavy woody base
And it's nothing like Deep Euphoria EDP (completely different smells)
It could've been a good spring-summer scent, but those notes ruined it

product_name: Deep Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content:
Almost decluttered this because I haven't reached for it in years. I remember the og Euphoria being a lovely fragrance, but I always felt too young to wear it. I knew I had liked this one better, but it had been so long since I'd sprayed it, I forgot the fragrance.

As I was prepping to list it, I realized that I had put a good sized dent in it. Surely at some point I reached for this often enough. I decided to test it out and my, am I glad I did. My nose has changed a lot since 2017, and I have developed a deep appreciation for chypre and floral aquatics. Deep Euphoria EDT is a beautiful blend of both.

Now, I don't know what current batches are doing, if this is even still in production. My bottle is from the year this scent was released. I know CK is notorious for reformulations that are mere shadows of fragrances that are still warm. I wish they would leave well enough alone. In any case, the bottle I have is not a light fragrance by any means. It is fresh with strength to it. The aquatic quality comes across as deep artic waters, fresh and turbulent. That is softened by the air of water lily and the watery sweetness of fresh pear.

This is followed by a deepening freshness from lush, dewy, and full red rose... green and sweet. Finally peppery driftwood and a touch of salt from a soft and inoffensive musk settle the storm. The bottle doesn't match this scent at all. This should definitely be dark blue instead.

Unique, long lasting, and beautiful, I can not believe I almost let this one go.

product_name: Deep Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: This is so light and pretty. Definitely an aquatic feeling coming through but also that beautiful rose. The pear I think adds to the watery nature because it's such a light and watery fruit. I like this one especially for warm weather. Performance is not great but it is an EDT so it can be forgiven.

product_name: Deep Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: Something about the EDT in this scent (I haven't tried the EDP) is scratchy and gives me allergies/makes me feel itchy. I think it may be the waterlily which is prominent; I had hoped for more rose in this scent.

product_name: Deep Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: Cute clean rose with 1 hour lasting power on my skin

product_name: Deep Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: The fruitiness stands out the most for me. It's syrupy but yet light and playful, a "happy" fragrance. Great for spring and summer.

product_name: Deep Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: Calvin Klein perfumes are affordable and available and I’m always buying them for gift purposes, but somehow when I have to buy for myself I generally shy away. One reason is because the scents are usually very generic and I don’t find them standing out in a crowd.. Deep Euphoria EDT was one that I truly liked and I would buy for myself once the price goes down a bit. It is light in a beautiful subtle floral way, and not too sweet or strong like the original. I love rose, woods and musk and this one delivers them in just the way I would want to wear.

product_name: Deep Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: Nice, velvety rose scent that is also very fresh. It's full of contradictions. It's subtle, but sexy and alluring. All in all, it's true, deep summery euphoria, perfect for almost all seasons.

product_name: Deep Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: I love the way I feel all day

product_name: Deep Euphoria Eau de Toilette Calvin Klein
review_content: I tried this one. It is much lighter and fresher than the original Deep Euphoria. If you found that one too heavy or sweet, this may be a good option for you.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2017 Calvin Klein
review_content:
After about an hour it transforms into a fresher and not so deep version of Dylan Blue. Really really good!
Even the performance is better than most of the summer CKs.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2017 Calvin Klein
review_content: This is the perfume that made me buy a 3 backup bottles from every perfume that i love because at the time i had it i didn’t know perfumes gets discontinued and i didn’t know this is a season release so when i knew that i’m going to miss this one for ever i learned to buy backups. This is one of the best summer perfumes i had.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2017 Calvin Klein
review_content: I really love this. I finished up my first bottle and never had the chance to get another. It is really sweet and I love it so much. It is kind of woody which is the kind of scent I'm into. Woody but sweet but not overly masculine. Probably my favourite to wear at that time

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2017 Calvin Klein
review_content: One of the better Eternity Summer releases that I've tried. It's a bit heavier and woodier than most of the rest of this line; the violet leaf and more prominent base notes give it a bit more oomph. Projection isn't very strong, and longevity won't go beyond three or four hours unless it's really hot out, but that's pretty expected for this kind of fragrance. It's best suited for casual daytime use, and like most of the newer Eternity Summers, it's dirt-cheap online so there's very little room for wearer's remorse.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2017 Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells really good, reminds me of a summer in the caribbean. bright and fresh. main notes that you can smell are lime, coconut and sage.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2017 Calvin Klein
review_content: Whoa this stuff smells good! Very uplifting in the top, the mid is very fresh, and the base is a musk tinged with hay and sandalwood. Smells better than it sounds! If this was bottled at its base as a Musk I'd buy it just for that. I don't get the coconut note, but no matter I'm very happy I picked up a 3.4oz blind at Khols for 37.50. I picked up the female version as well, but honestly for me this is something I would wear or like smelling on my husband so either way I'm happy.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2017 Calvin Klein
review_content:
Smells rather natural and pleasant for a ck release IMO

I smell black currant , a tropical feel and an aquatic nuance.

Overall this is very nice for someone new to fragrances for 20 dollars or so. Longevity is 2 hours and projection is poor on me. I am sure the ISO-E super hangs in there for a while longer though.

However, this does smell slightly feminine to me and cannot find myself wearing it.

For the serious or experienced Fragrance lover this is a pass and nothing special.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2017 Calvin Klein
review_content:
An extremely herbal affair, CK Eternity Summer the 2017 edition is very fresh with the violet leaf asserting itself and being given an earthier vibe with the vetiver and sage that I can only describe as coming incredibly close to replicating the smell of clay in the mud quarries I used to visit in art classes on how pottery is made.
The sandalwood and coconut give this a bit of smoky sweetness and despite the negative reviews here, I find this somewhat original and more of a risk taking venture than usual for these seasonal CK releases. 4-6 hours has been the norm in warm weather for me and moderate sillage the first 1-2 hours before becoming soft and more subtle.
Not a remarkably attractive scent, but different and unusual and deserves your consideration for at least a test in the department store. It won't appeal to everyone because the violet leaf does clash a bit with the sage in the heart for more sensitive noses and the bergamot quickly gives way after the top and allows the violet leaf and vetiver to dominate.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2017 Calvin Klein
review_content: Stepdown from 2016 edition, skip this one maybe next year will be better

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2017 Calvin Klein
review_content: I am not sure if the majority of the people reviewing are actually reviewing the fragrance after testing it on their skin. If you spray this in the air or on a tester strip, i will admit it is not very pleasant, i smelled this on the tester and was not too fond of it, but i bought it because I like to collect the limited edition summer fragrances, i wore this for the first time today in weather that was 80 degrees plus. It was so different on my skin, its been about 3 hours and i can still smell it, and I really enjoy this, its kind of musky and citrusy on my skin.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2017 Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells like one-part Eternity and two-parts Eternity Aqua. It lasts 3-4 hours and sits very softly on my skin. Not terrible, but not very good...there are just so many better options out there for Summer. Heck, just pick-up a bottle of CK One Summer for under $20. A big, "Meh" from me.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2017 Calvin Klein
review_content: No disrespect, but it smelled like a car air freshener to me :(

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2017 Calvin Klein
review_content:
Well, I had given up hope that Calvin Klein would ever have another great smelling fragrance. Sure, some of them have been okay. But it has literally been decades since they have had a scent that I really got into. This is surprising since year after year another flanker is released from CK, and every year I yawn.
Except this year. I sampled this one today and I will be going back to buy it. I love this one. At first it comes off migraine inducing synthetic but give it a few minutes. I know that sage is listed as a top note but I think it comes out more with the sandlewood after it settles. The sage becomes much more apparent once it settles but man, I love it. I thought it was just okay until I wore it for a while, but it dawned on me after a few hours. No chance of this one getting nauseating. I have to say though, as much as i love this one, it's like an exaggerated version of being stuck in the 90's, but in a good way. Sort of like if Patrick Nagel created artwork in the 90's. It's like you've stepped in a time machine and you know you've gone back but you can't pin point which decade you're in.

Finally CK, you have a hit! Too bad I just can't say the same for this years "One"- Summer flanker.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2017 Calvin Klein
review_content: Why does every new review that I have today has Aventus as "this perfume reminds me of"? What's going on?

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2017 Calvin Klein
review_content:
Tested this and ck one summer today,
i was almost a bit shocked at how
much i enjoyed this scent, i absolutely
love it for what it is, after the huge
letdown of eternity intense this was a
nice suprice, i cant wait to buy it.
Beautiful bottle too.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2017 Calvin Klein
review_content: I just picked this up at Macy's today, i have some hook ups over there who tell me when the new stuff is coming out, and i am proud to say that I am literally the first own a bottle. Too bad its still cold where i live, I wont get the max aroma from this until June-August when it really heats up. It does have woody sandlewood aroma, its kindof sweet and I smell coconuts, I only sprayed some on my wrist to test it out, with it being cold where I live i havent gotten maximum usage out of it.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2017 Calvin Klein
review_content: Tried this new release at the macy's counter... light, enjoyable summer offering but very similar to ck2 (which I already own and love). The coconut is not overly sweet here. Not bad at all, but due to light performance in regards to both longevity (about 3-4 hrs on my skin) and projection, I would recommend staying with ck2, which is already available at discounted prices.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2017 Calvin Klein
review_content: Because this is a summer release you can bet that the most prominent notes are probably going to be coconut nectar, bergamot, ginger, and maybe the violet leaf. I'd be knocked over with a pin if the vetiver, jasmine, and musk actually came through. Regardless, I'll give it a sniff when it comes out. Calvin Klein's recent summer releases, since 2014, have been better than the years prior.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
At the opening, you can really smell the pepper strongly, but always with the sweetness of the coconut. The only thing is that at first you can feel more of the freshness from the lavender, and then as it dries down, it smells of coconut — but very softly, it’s not a deep scent.

The longevity is rather poor. I put it on my hand at 5 p.m., and by 10:30 it was barely noticeable, even close to the skin. By 1 a.m., it was practically gone. It lasted me about 3 hours.

The scent is nice, but it fades away really fast. I can justify the purchase if you really like the smell or if you can carry it with you to reapply every 3–4 hours when you’re out for a while. Or if you just want it for a dinner or a short outing. But even then, I’d always recommend carrying a travel-size version to reapply when the scent fades.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Too much coconut and milk for me.It smells like sunscreen and coconut milk rice.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Just got this in the mail for a decent price and was thinking I missed my main window for wearing it (summer), but I actually think this smells more like a cool-weather-scent for me.

It's super sweet like candy with a vague coconut tint. Fits into the realm of something like Boss the Scent Magnetic for me as that one smells like candy too.

Performs well.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: After a few months of owning and wearing this perfume, I have to say, my opinion has gone down. Don't get me wrong, this perfume is very good, but considering the pricing, maybe you would be better off going with one of the JPG Le Beau fragrances if you are looking for this type of scent. The opening is very juniper heavy, makes me sneeze every time, and after comes a very sweet coconut. Although it smells nice, I didn't see myself reaching for this on hotter summer days as it very much does get cloying and doesn't even last that long in the heat for me.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: A more mature Le Beau thats not sickly sweet. Opening is slightly synthetic but nevertheless great value.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Person below is crazy: This smells nothing like Santal 33, not even in the same fragrance category and it definitely does not smell like pickle. Luckily, most people don't have that person's "senses". This is a nice aromatic coconut, lavender, and cardamom fragrance. Very reminiscent of JPG Le Beau. Long lasting and decent price for what you get. 👌🏻 good for casual wear in the summer. I get complimented every time I wear this.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Does not smell like Le labo which is leather and sandalwood and some green papyrus.... the notes are not even similar at all. This is definitely overload of coconut, lavender, juniper and cardamom.... I simply don't see how anyone thinks this smells like santal 33, the only note they have in common is cardamom. And I can tell you that they smell completely different not even similar at all, santal 33 doesn't even have any sweetness in it where as this is very very sweet in all the ways I personally enjoy but may be too sweet for some people. Luckily because this is so sweet the aromatics actually gave it a good balance and the lavender helps cut through that sweetness. This is a great fragrance, beast mode performance, huge compliment getter, smells great!

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Nose Note #448

I absolutely love OG Eternity, but this has absolutely nothing to do with it. This is just awful. I'm surprised with the ratings. I didn't expect it to be a twist on the OG, I didn't expect anything at all. And I didn't expect it to smell like freaking pickled cucumbers... It's not coconut, my friends, oh no. It's a strong pickle, very strong and too sweet. If Le Beau smells anything like this, I'm having none of it.

3.5/10, I'm getting a strong Le Labo Santal 33 on this one

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I like this a lot. Great summer fragrance for multiple occasions. Last and projected well for me. Not to sweet like Lebeau Not bad for a CK fragrance

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I know this is all very subjective but my take:

This = JPG UM + Boss Bottled Pacific.

It’s nice and it’s super strong just like UM. The coconut here is dry like that of Boss or Creed VIW. It’s not the sweet, green coconut of any of the JPG variants (no, not even PG).

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Very nice, aromatic, smooth, coconut, and creamy. Shares a similar DNA to JPG Le Beau. I prefer this over Le Beau. It is a bit sweet but not overly sweet or cloying. Overall I give this an 8/10.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I tried this just because i was bored but hoooooly, this is amazing. Creamy, sweet but still masculine coconut, even has some freshness to it. I was really impressed with this release, super enjoyable, even my dad liked it and he hates sweet fragrances. def give this one an oportunity, liked it even more than any of the le beaus from jpg. and also its absurdly cheap from discounter, i bought like a 3 piece set for $50, really put a smile on my face.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Opens up sweet in my opinion .. and although there's no vanilla but it gives me the vanilla icks .. after a while it smoothens a bit into an aromatic lavender coconutty sun tan lotion whilst retaining some sweetness .. alnost like a bounty bar smell is the best way i can describe it ..

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Edit: I don't know why, but suddenly occured to me to try this on one arm and bad boy cobalt elixir on the other...
Cobalt elixir is smoother and less sweet in the opening, which I prefer. That said, they are very similar and if you have one, you don't need the other. If you have none, this is a great summer evening fragrance, but I definitely prefer cobalt elixir. It's smoother, less rough in the opening (less intense/sweet coconut), and in a side by side comparison, it seems of much higher quality. That said, this is a cheaper, nearly as good alternative to the same DNA and well worth it.

I've had this for a while and like others, the first few times I wore it, a saccharin sweet, almost sickly base was hard to grit through. A few months later and it's summer and oh man... The overly sweet facets have mellowed and there's more woods and lavender in the opening and dry down. This is now a killer summer fragrance. I don't know if my nose changed or this thing actually macerated, but if you felt like this had potential if not for the headache inducing sweetness, give it a few weeks or a couple of months and try again. Maybe it's just me, but the last few times I wore this, I was completely taken back by how good it is and how little it resembles what I remember it originally smelling like. Don't give up on it too soon!

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Tried it on my wrist. Aggressively bad. Had to scrub it off. Yuck.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Well, I blind bought this fragrance since I like coconut notes and there were good reviews about it. I have JPG Le Beau Paradise Garden, Xerjoff Shunkoin and Creed Virgin Island Water.

I can’t say I don’t like it but it is overly candy-like sweet and it makes it smell cheap. I expected stronger juniper, lavender and cedar notes to make it smell like more a freshie than a candy.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: As of this moment, one the best smelling fragrances of all time for me and I've smelled a few over the years. Similar to Le Beau Le Parfum and Paradise Garden, but different. The scent of this juice is utterly intoxicating. Love it!

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
What delicious is this, really really good, smells more mature if you compare this one with any jpg so that's my way to smell
I have boos bottle pacific and I can smell the difference on this, I like same rich coconut but pacific is salty and fresh
9/10 for me jpg le beau le parfum 9.7/10 boss bottle pacific 8.8/10

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Notice how it's only men that say this is bad? girls love this stuff on themselves and on men too. Absolute woman magnet this stuff.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
It smells nice, let me start with that. As an aquatic scent lover, I tended to avoid sweet perfumes, so Eternity brings something new to my collection. That coconut is just insanely strong, and not in a bad way.
However, this was the first perfume out of maybe 100 that I tested, that made me suffocate and really irritated my respiratory tract, especially when being sprayed on the chest-neck area. Therefore I cannot call this an easy perfume to wear. I'd rather just smell it on someone else and let them deal with the breathing part.
I am however still considering it.
Later edit: bought it.
Even later edit: Pro tip: don't spray it on your chest or the front of the neck, unless you want to suffocate. Also I walked in a shop wearing this, got dates with both sales ladies.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: A great update on the original Eternity, fresh and sweet. Does not smell like Le Beau or LB Paradise Garden to me, those are more complex, this is simpler yet no less elegant. Great for spring or summer day or evening wear.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Clean, creamy, coconuty and a bit sweet… great beach/summer vibes and lasts 6-8 hours.
Definitely recommend!

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This is anything but tropical or secret find. Imagine Bacarac rouge mixed with cool water. Rank, absolute beast in terms projection. If your buying this thinking its going to be on par with Le Beue your mistaken

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Overspray if u want performance and projection, otherwise a good fragrance, coconut drydown similar to Le Beau, juniper berries in the opening

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: i genuinely don’t know if it was from a bad batch, but i tried this fragrance on a tester strip at the mall and i instantly backed my face away from it. the smell was actually obnoxious, and even though i like sweet fragrances, this one just smelled like literally just sugar in an aggressive and exaggerated way, nothing more than that. based on my experience, i would not recommend this fragrance.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: It actually develops to more of a leather type scent. Perfect combo for me. Get 200 ml.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This one project like a monster on my skin. I found it very close to CK DEFY PARFUM (very good too). They share similar vibe but CK DEFY PARFUM is more of a winter version ... Longevity is very good too. On skin 10+ hours, on clothes - DAYS! :) Very good CK one.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
for some reason the opening reminds me of clive christians rock rose, while the mid and drydown smells like jpg le beau parfum

a good alternative if you like aromatic fresh spicy fragrances

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Not more Calvin coconut stench made by coty.jog on

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: The smell is very synthetic, but somewhat pleasant i’m the dry down. If coconut could slap you across the face then this would be the fragrance to allow it to do so. I will say, i think this fragrance could be versatile and an all year round scent. (don’t come after me). the scent is very strong at first but it gives off a fresh, clean coconut-black peppery scent.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Highly underrated.

Imagine if the notes and the vibrancy from Fusion d'Issey extreme had a lovechild with le beau's smoothness. Well executed, the bulk of the performance tapers off after 5-6 hours.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: this scent is revolting, headache inducing and offensive.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Versatile scent with depth.in fact I got more compliments during winter with this fragrance.my Friend complimented me once saying : woww this scent is cozy and suitable for winter days.
I think it's because of the cardamon that gives it some depth and spiceness,but still being a great freshie.
It has moderate longevity.for this typa scent it gets the job done beautifully.
I haven't smell le Beau yet to know if it's close to it or not.but in my experience this scent made me feel happy wearing it.i really suggest u to try it out

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I love coconut scents for some reason. Coconut soap , shampoo or candles,I like all of that. Especially coconut mixed with some vanilla and or some tropical fruits. People online call this perfume a hidden gem so I blind bought this on a sale. I like it . Cant really compare it to anything else but this scent has just enough coconut scent not to be annoying or misstanken for sunlotion. Its very " airy" and fresh and it also smells very tropical. Its a perfect scent on hot summer days at the beach or for vacation. It kind of reminds me of a blue shower gel mixed with some coconut. Its nice and I like it. I just got it so I'll be back with an update later if anything changes.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I'm sure 90% of the negative reviews have never tried this frag. This stuff is a banger summer time scent. The coconut is perfect. I got a sample of it from CK. I immediately bought a 200ml bottle just after testing it for a couple days. I spray myself down every time before going to my community pool. The hottie lifeguards approve - can't argue with that lol

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I don't regret that I bought only the 50ml perfume. It was on a good price tho. Smell is between Jean paul Gaultier - Le Beau edt and Issey Miyake - Fusion Extreme.

Not as sweet as JPG, and not so animalic (or I dont know how to say) as Issey Fusion Extreme wich is both good.

Coconut, juniper berries and lavender are the main notes I get. I expected a bit more woody smell, but it is OK, thankfully its not so very sweet. I am waiting for the Summer (and Spring) to wear because its fresher than to wear it now in -1C°. Sillage and longevity is still under testing.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
The "pickle brine" accord and suffocating akigalawood note from Kenzo Homme Intense strikes again.

I'm honestly sick of the Quentin Bisch DNA. It's taking over the way everyone copied Olivier Cresp's signature DNA from Thierry Mugler Angel and Dolce&Gabbana Light Blue.

Issey Miyake Fusion
Kenzo Homme Intense
Kenzo Homme Marine
JPG Le Beau Paradise Garden

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I honestly can't believe how good this is for the price. This fragrance is slept on by everyone. It has a beautiful creamy coconut note that's not overpowering and never comes off as being synthetic. Its exceptionally well blended with all the notes working in harmony together and the dry down is wonderful. It puts my boss pacific in the shade.
I blind bought a 200ml bottle for 80 bucks and have zero regrets. In fact I might just by another while it's on sale as I live in the tropics and this may just be my new signature given no one knows about it.
Longevity is perhaps 6 hours,but with a 200ml bottle, just reapply as you please. A solid 8/10 for the fragrance and surely a 10 for value. Possibly the best fragrance CK has ever made.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I feel that CK knocked off Paco Rabbane with this one. Smells damn near identical to victory elixir

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: What a gorgeous all year long fragrance. It's creamy enough to be worn in winter and fresh from junipers to be the ultimate summer banger. Much better than JPG Le Beau, holds eternal on skin, not strong projector but you get whiffs for a whole day. You can get a 200ml bottle for $60 which is insane deal. The rating is a joke. This is 9/10 easily and probably the best CK ever put out

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Coconut is one of the notes that I hate THE MOST, but this one is not that bad. Much better than Le Beau edt and Paradise Garden. People would go crazy if this was a jpg instead of a CK.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Too much coconut.

This does not vibe with my taste at all, very hasch opening, too sweet and crazy.

Makes me think of a foreign taxi driver that overdoses in generic oriental evening perfume.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Nice and summery, coconutty (but it’s not too much), a bit sweet. Really liked it on my husband during summertime. Coconut note lasts long. Better in my opinion than the women’s version.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Moderate to good lasting. Great opening but the coconut note irritates in time.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I don't like coconut fragrances. This one is interesting and successful but I don't like it. I see why people like it because it is striking and projects but to me it's a far-fetched blend with the strong cedar. Take the handsome Azzaro Visit and ruin it with chemical coconut.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
After reading some of the reviews here I had high hopes on a blind buy ahead of a tropical island getaway.

At first I was a little disappointed but on the dry down it really comes alive. This is my first fragrance with a coconut note and I genuinely love it. Not too sweet and doesn't smell synthetic or like BO in my opinion. The juniper berries definitely stand out after the first couple of hours but the coconut also lingers.

Received two compliments my first day/night wearing it, with one of the waitresses now wanting to buy it for her partner.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Creamy coconut with a bit of backbone from the juniper berries, pepper and cardamom. A perfect mix of sweet and fresh.

If this was in the JPG Le Beau line folks would be purring about this one but in al honesty it's even better than them because it never once comes across as synthetic.
