9/10 if you like creamy sweet fragrances this is a no-brainer and performance is great as well.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Updating my review. I have used this a good 10+ times by now. So this is a dark green velvet creamy coconut fragrance. But in a not so thick way. It is definitely a coconut forward fragrance and surprisingly keeps that note throughout. To me it's light pine , coconut husk, coconut oil , slight creamy. I don't really get the pepper or much lemon. Slight lavender. It leans more aromatic than sweet which I do like . It's not a youthful fragrance in my opinion. It's more for a 30+ man . I liked it more and more . But I can totally see why some people wouldn't like it. Performance is great. I was able to smell it on me for about 4 hours. So I was probably projecting for a good 5 or 6. It was on the skin for a good 8. I was able to smell it on my clothes the next morning. If you want coconut but not too sweet I suggest giving this a try

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Ridiculously downplayed here and at Parfumo, because it outperforms the competition. Only 226 votes? No, that's bs. Just tested it, absolutely gorgeous, and clearly the best with coconut. 3.91 is a joke, this is a 4.91. Not even extremely expensive perfumes with coconut come near this one. Perfume prices are such bs. But you can buy a 200 ml bottle of this for less than 100 dollars.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I bought this for my husband and it`s really delicious. Very potent, creamy but masculine without the typical pinching notes in perfumes for males. The coconut is also well done, it`s definitely present but it blends perfectly with the other notes into a creamy and sweet fragrance. Sillage is also very good, when he walsk around traces are noticeable in the whole house.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I actually own Le Beau and I prefer this: although Le Beau smells fresher and higher quality, this one last way longer and sweeter. Very good 😁

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: If you’re looking for a coconut fragrance but don’t really dig the Le Beau line, GET THIS. It’s very good. It would be full bottle worthy if I didn’t already have 2 in the jpg line. Underrated big time!

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Love this. Bought because I really like the opening and mid of JPG Paradise Garden but can't stand the cloying drydown. The opening on this is not as speactacular as Paradise Garden, but very nice, fresh and bright, the mid is very similar to JPG PG and the dry down , for me, is way better , as I dislike the drydown in Paradise when all the best notes have disappeared.
CK Eternity for Men Aromatic Essence is a great summer fragrance, but I expect I'll wear it any season. It's fairly linear, but a great fresh, yet warm, sexy, smell. It's the only CK I own as I don't like the smell of CK 1 , Eternity etc . This one is something special if you like coconut and green vibes.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I've had this a couple of months now and I'm a fan. I'm wearing it this evening and have stumbled upon the realisation this is like a lighter, fresher, summer flanker of PDM Layton. And I'm glad to see I spotted at least one other comparison in the reviews. Obvious comparisons to the Le Beau line but I'm not so sure now. Of course the coconut is there with a good bit of sweetness but this has a cleaner, more easy going profile and is much less synthetic.

There are crossovers with Invictus Victory Elixir but thankfully CK doesn't dry down with the same playdough vibes. I owned both Le Beau Le Parfum and IVE and went on to sell them because of the aspects I didn't like or tired of quickly. I felt that CK gave me the best parts of both, removed the negatives, and added its own thing. Now I've got to know this one better and picked out the Layton-esque vibes, I'll be wearing this one a lot more. It performs pretty well on me too and I'm more than happy to overspray it without risking overdoing it due to the nature of the scent. This hasn't been hyped other than being called a hidden gem, so I'd really recommend trying it out.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This site should be rid of the voting. People hate on things even if they like it or havent even tried it.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Very nice summer fragrance. Man oh man is that coconut note prominent. When I first smelled it I knew immediately what it reminds me of ALMOST 1:1. Azzaro chrome pure. Redundant to own this when you can pick that up for $35

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I like it. Very aromatic scent for sure. Masculine in a modern way. Main notes are coconut and lavender, but other notes are well blended and there are not single note that is significantly stronger than the other. Nice for warmer weather. Great for office or casual.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Definitely comparable to le beau, invictus victory elixir and anything similar. I’ve only sprayed one spray from a sample vial and it’s LOUD! Projecting heavily and probably going to last quite a while. I’ll give it a full wearing and see how it goes.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: A cross between pdm layton & boss bottled pacific.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Coty’s response to Puig group. Understanding people comparing it to Le Beau, but if you have tried or owned Paco’s Invictus Victory Elixir, you will find that this one smells even closer to IV Elixir.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Nice! I usually have no expectations when it comes to any CK fragrances, although out of curiosity I picked this one up at Notino and was overwhelmed - coconut with some smokiness, probably from patchouli. I don't love JPG Le Beau as it seems to sweet to my taste, but I could try wearing more coconuts with this one

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
no lemon, no juniper, no pepper, no connection with the OG. only sugar and coconut. bloody awful. even worse than the sticky le beau.
and only a lunatic could wear this in hot weather conditions.
1/10

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
i love this coconut, smells like butter popcorn and lasts long.
Reminds to le beau but without that caramel sweetness

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: As someone who loves coconut fragrances I love this, The scent is wonderful and works well on my skin. The coconut really shines a couple hours after spraying where its just a really creamy coconut. The sillage is very good and the longevity is between 5-6 hours overall good performance. Only issue is the price definitely a little expensive but I got the 100ml 40% of so at that price its definitely good value. Mostly a spring scent but could very easily use in summer.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I never thought I'd say this about any fragrance, but smelling this makes vomit rise up to my throat, I'm not exaggerating or joking, it literally almost makes me puke. I know there's bad fragrances that make you go "ew", but this somehow triggers something in my system that literally makes puke rise up my troath. I've smelled it multiple times, and it never fails to almost make me create a mess on the floor of the store.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This fragrance actually surprised me: I'd go so far as to say this might be the best Calvin Klein fragrance. Aromatic, fresh, and sweet. Everyone keeps on comparing this to JPG Le Beau and while I get that, I think it's a bit closer to Le Male. I do agree that this is better than Le Beau, though. Definitely check it out!

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: To me this is super similar to invictus parfum esp in the drydown, I am quite surprised this is nice stuff!! Good projection and longevity

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells like a direct competitor to the JPG Le Beau line (more so the Parfum version). To me the coconut in here is stronger. IMO the dash of pineapple as well as the performance in Le Beau EDP gives it the edge over this. Therefore I can’t justify a full body of this. It’s really nice though, and if you’re on a budget you can save a decent amount of money going with CK here.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Very green with some lavender & citrus in it. Surprised there isn't any herbs listed like rosemary or basil

This is not a tropical/coconut fragrance...this is a "green/aromatic" fragrance with coconut in it

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
It’s very similar to Le Beau edt but a bit darker and not as fresh, the coconut is very prominent
definitely blind but worthy if you like Le Beau. Im also picking up a phantom perfum smell on the dry down even my wife thought I was wearing it. Overall a great fragrance for $79 aud

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This is the first CK fragrance i simply had to have in a few years. What a pleasant, unique imo, aromatic summer frag

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Wild Berry Skittles with a hint of lightly toasted coconut. Quite strong and long lasting, lingering sweetness. Not sure this is a summer fragrance.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I'm a bit flabbergasted with this one, honestly. I went in store to get something and the lady there (whom I'm now on second-person basis with) told me they got the new Eternity in and I'm not a big CK fan so I was a little indifferent and she said "it's a better version of JPG's Le Beau!" and as a big JPG fan I obviously dismissed that statement... until I got a sniff. This is stellar!

It does open with Le Beau EDT's coconut note but without the pineapple from the EDP this is much less sweet, much creamier while the juniper brings freshness and lightness as opposed to Le Beau's much sweeter, heavier DNA. I don't smell pepper here to be honest. The drydown is where things are very different to my nose. Whereas Le Beau is very linear and stays very sweet, Aromatic Essence dries down woodier, drier and smooths out, taking it closer into fougere territory with gourmandish inclines from the creamy coconut. I honestly have a hard time believing what I'm smelling here. CK often don't disclose their perfumers but this was obviously done by a very skilled perfumer. Perhaps Frank Voelkl who did the Parfum not long ago? Let me make this clear: this doesn't reinvent the wheel. It's a familiar DNA but refined and more mature. Even though I'm not the type that's after compliments, this obviously will be a compliment monster.

It's got good longevity on me (a good 6-7 hours, probably more in the heat) and thanks to that woodier drydown it probably won't be as crazy sweet and overpowering with warmer weather. This is perfect for spring, probably will be for summer as well (although not on stupid hot humid days) and is very office safe if sprayed sparingly. After the disappointing Reflections which left me completely cold, Aromatic Essence is very surprising outing from CK and will be getting a lot of use in the coming weeks.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: It bears no relation to the DNA of the true and unique Eternity released in the 90s. This is a completely different perfume. Nocturnal, sweet, heavy, suitable for cold weather and for those who enjoy these sugary, cloying fragrances.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I am getting Layton vibe during the opening.
The fragrance itself did not last long on my skin.
Overall it is ok.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Dammn, I'm so in love with this fragrance. Yes, it's not revolutionary but it's sure unique in its own way. A fan of coconuty fragrances and this here is top-notch, one of the best if not the best coconuty fragrance in my collection. I actually prefer this to my Le Beau le parfum, which is on the edge of too sweet & juvenile for me (though not a deal breaker). This is just a sweet, creamy, more mature coconuty concoction in a bottle.

The performance on my skin is great (10-12 hrs). The projection is loud for like 2-4 hrs, 6ft-10ft, definite room filler (choked a colleague out who was seated in an opposite room, doors open with 5 sprays). It still does projects even after 8 hrs because I've recieved comments from 2 different colleagues, on 2 different days, both said they could smell me walking down the stairs from the 1st floor while they were on the ground floor (at the end of an 8 hr shift), that's insane. Could still smell this on my wrist even after 20hrs.

All in all, really happy that I was able to get a 3.4 oz/100 ml tester bottle for $43 & at that price, it's a steal. It punches way above what you'd expect from am eternity flanker.

Smell - 8/10 (not unique but smells awesome)
Longevity - 8.5/10 (for a CK 10/10)
Projection - 8.5/10
Sillage - 8.5/10
Versatility - Spring, Summer, Autumn 8/10

Ps. This is for my skin, these results may vary for everyone else.

Finally, wear what you like, when you like, how you like.
Happy spraying!

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells like fatt and butter dont buy it. Its ass!!

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
A sample came with another order.

Surprisingly pleasant, carries a ton of detail. I perceive it too sweet to be decisively masculine, rather unisex, and something a bit juvenile about it as well. Yet, it's great.

Unfortunately, the longevity seems weak🙁 On my skin this is a candle that goes from bright to dim really fast.

This is expensive in my place.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Final review.
Eternity Aromatic Essence has nothing in common with the original Eternity from the early 90's, just the name.
It turns out, this real is everything I was expecting from Le Beau, but this is so much better.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This stuff has no right being this good. Surely not, it's an Eternity flanker, right? Holy moly, this was a full-bottle immediately. Destroys my Le Beau frags (too sweet), makes Boss bottled Pacific whimper with fear (too weak). Zanzibar is running for the hills (too...something), as well as any other 'coconutty' or tropical fragrance I have in my collection. Why? They have managed to somehow wrap those aforementioned things into this fragrance, whilst adding an aromatic/green/herbal nuance to it in the drydown that is awesome. I don't care what the name on the bottle is, this stuff is getting a lot of wear this spring and summer. A lot. This, for me, personally, is one of the best releases I've smelled this year. So far, on my skin, both longevity and sillage/projection are moderate to strong. Paradise garden is good, but it didn't 'wow' me like this one has. Just my opinion, YMMV

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
A very surprising fragrance in the Eternity line. It definitely doesn't smell like any other Eternity flanker nor like the original. It starts off sweet, a fresh baked cake kind of sweetness. But it's not a dense or heavy type of sweetness, more of a fresh chocolate with some musk (but nothing like Axe Dark Temtpation, don't worry). This part reminds me of Bad Boy Extreme which gives a very similar gourmand style scent sensation. As the scent develops the sweetness stays but is acompanied by more fresh notes in the backgroud.
It smells really good and extremely wearable. Best release from Calvin Klein in years for me. I can't separate the coconut note but I'm sure it could be a part of what I describe as "cake".
It's definitely worth a try. The only bad thing about it is the price, which is pretty high for a CK scent but from my experience CK scents tend to drop in price quite fast so it's probably better to wait a bit if you like it.
PS: not similar to Bvlgari Black at all, there is none of that burnt rubber or dark vanilla smell.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I got a sample of this the other day. It's not bad actually. Not what I expected from an Eternity. I like the coconut for sure but the Juniper gives it a bit of a chemically twinge. Just a little bit tho ...

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This is what the women's fragrance should have been like. It's warm, tropical and delicious with a toasted coconut/lactonic note that is mouth-watering. The women's one is a damp squib in comparison! It does remind us of JPG Le Male, and after a while my husband finds that a bit too much for him. While it is still masculine-leaning, it might find it's way into my fragrance collection in the future... Just sayin'.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Thank you BornToDolt, you confirmed what I was thinking.
I think it kicks LeBeau's ass.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This is sexual! A 50ml blind buy as I love coconut... I wish I'd bought the 100ml! I have both JPG LeBeau's and if coconut is your jam, 'Eternity Aromatic Essence' eclipses them both. A creamy, spicy, coconut, aromatic scent.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I think this is what Le Beau should have been but isn't.
I don't think it's groundbreaking as it shares familiarity with many fragrances, but it's great for what it is.
It opens with a nice spicy juniper berry before settling into a creamy warm wood.
I find it very addictive. The opening seems familiar, but the dry down really shines.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
My first impression.
The opening reminds me somewhat like Le Beau Le Parfum, but the good aspects of LBLP without the horrendous iris note. The dry down is creamier too with a woody cedar, while LBLP has Iso-supe e instead.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: As I've written somewhere else, I find these three new releases to be cousins, CK Eternity Aromatic Essence, JPG Le Beau Paradise Garden, and CH Bad Boy Cobalt Elixir. They scratch a similar itch. Compared side by side, CK is the least sweet of the three, especially in the drydown where the other two sweeten up, but, though I usually gravitate towards sweeter scents, this one appeals to me the most. It's a blast of coconut in the opening that's more satisfying than the one in JPG, little less aquatic than that one, too. It's still slightly sweetened coconut water, but it's a bit thicker compared to JPG. Gradually, it turns into a pleasant, mainly aromatic scent, with a bit of sharp woods. Overall, a success.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Fruity and tropical due to the coconut scent. Not my fav coconut scent, I would go for JPG Le Beau instead for a more masculine yet fruity. Juniper berries is a thumbs down for me for my personal taste.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Fresh, light, clean and minty.

Opens sweet, fresh, cool. (Only a touch aromatic in the beggining, so the name feels apt.)
Feels modern. Has an airy, minty aspect.
Has some citrus (grapefruit?)
Then sweetness, possibly from honey. Smells a bit like peppermints.
Overall it's a light fragrance.
Becomes creamier with vanilla alongside a clean musk.
Has some vetiver in the base (could be juniper?) and these spiky notes do become a bit "vinagery" off of my skin after a few hours.
Smells a lot nicer in the air than directly off the skin.

Suits men more than women. Guys aged 25+. All seasons, daytime best though.

Performance is ok; good projection first hour and a half(ish.) Longevity as a skin scent is 6-8hrs.

I don't think it's that close to the original, reminds me more of "Reflections." And also reminds me of "Mont Blanc Explorer: Platinum," in the far drydown.

Misleading notes IMO. Didn't get loads of coconut until I saw it listed. Thought I could smell it then but that could be the power of suggestion?

3 Note breakdown is for tourists not Frag-Heads! Come on everybody!

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Received a full bottle of this fragrance to review, will start of by saying it reminds me a lot of paco rabanne phantom parfum after doing a side by side comparison. The most prominent notes are sweet coconut, lavender, cardamom, patchouli & cedar. It’s an all round nice fragrance & lasts a long time on skin. 10+ hours easy with loud projection for the first hour then medium projection for another 2 hours before turning into a skin scent for the duration of the fragrance. Overall it’s a 7 out of 10 for me. Be warned, only get this if you like sweet fragrances.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I see coconut I enjoy

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: What peaked my interest about this one was the note breakdown and the fragrance concentration. It's a "Parfum Intense", so hopefully the performance is strong with this one.

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
MisterD, it is indeed the new Eternity annual, or summer, release. It feels like they are stepping away from the "Summer" moniker for both Eternity and CK One for the past couple of years, as they have nearly 20 years of "Summers" with nothing to set them apart other than the release year and bottle design.

Eternity seems to update the classic to what the modern take would be while staying true to the DNA, which you can see in the juniper and lavender with the very trendy coconut in this year's blend. Looking forward to getting my nose on it, but not going to pay the full $150 asking retail when last year's "Reflections" can already be grabbed for $50.

My guess is that they are doing away with the "Summer" theme for their yearly releases entirely, so it can sell year round

EDIT - Sampled at Macys and I was let down, as much as I wanted to like it. Too sweet and cloying for Florida, and a near dupe of EDT le Male, without the JPG DNA. CK is sadly turning to mainstream after years of avant garde futurism

product_name: Eternity Aromatic Essence for Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Not a review, but a question for others who may know-Is this intended as this year's Summer edition?

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Very sweet white floral amber with a unique flavor to it that is slightly herbal. Batch code 6284.

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This is very off-putting on first spray. A medicinal smell mixed with pine sol. The dry down is a lovely vanilla scent.

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content: So much Patchouli, ugh... Not one for me.

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
I bought this perfume in Dubai 2 years ago. Not sure if you can get it still as I was told it was a last bottle in the mall where I bought it. Its pity CK is not producing this liquid gold anymore.
Nasomatto has made a similar perfume in 2018 and called it Nudiflorum - which is available everywhere. I have both these perfumes and they are 90% similar. Nudiflorum is a bit stronger and heavier on wood and leather, leaning more masculine - but very similar. Try it guys. Pure gold is sweater though but as powerful as Nudiflorum.

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Neroli and leather are very strong in this, you must love those accords or this will be a bad blind buy. You can really smell the sugary dates, too. Could be unisex for men that enjoy sweet scents.

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I smelled it in the bottle and loved it. Sprayed it on and it smelled different, maybe a little green or earthy, and very strong. Possibly unisex. Didn't like it. As it reaches dry down it changes. The longer I wear it the softer it becomes. It always changes for the better. The difficult scents all disappear but it is still a bit strong. Eventually it becomes a beautiful floral scent with a bit of something else thrown in. What ever it is I love it. At this point it is very female fragrance not at all unisex. Sometimes it even smells a bit fruity. I don't have Euphoria Gold to compair it to. Just put it on and wait a while.

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content: The Neroli should have been the Stay Away Tip of the year!!!! I cannot stand this perfume. Smells nothing like Euphoria Gold. I will be returning the boxes I bought thinking it was as good as the regular Gold, they are nothing alike, AT ALL. 😕

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Leathery dates in a vanilla-benzoin syrup, with some sticky floral sap in there too. Very sweet, very rich. Smells like a Middle Eastern dessert. It's longevity is impressive. I can still smell it hours later and my skin tends to eat fragrance up. This isn't really my cup of tea ... anyone want to swap a travel-size spray decant for this one?

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
If Lanvin Me and Salvatore Ferragamo Signorina Misteriosa are battling it out for dominance, it would be CK Euphoria Pure Gold. I love how the smoky accord here which the leather and dates create is so similar to the blueberry - licorice accord of Lanvin Me. This is just a tad sweeter due to dates are naturally sweet compared to the fresh bluberry of the latter. This smells exactly like floral agarbatti (incense sticks). I find no challenge wearing this since I love strong and incensy perfumes like Yves Saint Laurent Opium and Dior Poison.

I am wearing it in the high summer heat and it is just divine.

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is a very unexpected deviation from CK’s Euphoria and a rare instance where CK successfully goes off the beaten path. Pure Gold keeps the Euphoria DNA but gives off a completely different vibe. It also leans more unisex than the original. Frankly, I am just now realizing how many flankers of the Euphoria line there are. I almost mistakenly left this review on one of the other gold flankers, and I wonder how closely Pure Gold aligns with the notes in those. I have the Amber Gold flanker, which I do NOT care for, but smelling them together I can tell they most have some key things in common.

I really like Pure Gold's dry, sharp, linear leather note, and how it contrasts with its delicate, fruity sweetness. I cannot identify the actual fruity notes here except that they are light and not overwhelming. In addition to the fruit, there is a soft and well-blended undercurrent of almond, vanilla, and orange blossom running throughout the life of the fragrance. I cannot smell the patchouli or gardenia listed in the notes.

I was surprised to read how many people hate its opening – I loved it at first spray. My least favorite part of it would be the dry down, where for several hours the leather is the most prominent smell. I like it, but because it is so sharp it can be overwhelming and veering into sour territory, which I guess is what keeps others from embracing it past that first spray. It was anything that would prevent me from wearing it regularly, that long leather heart might be it. At the end the leather just leaves completely and I must say the sweet fruit is very refreshing as it bursts on the scene quite abruptly in the end.

I am on the fence about whether I love or like this fragrance but I think I am in love and I am upset I did not try this earlier. I am already planning to buy a second bottle for backup, and I can’t see myself not always having a bottle on my vanity at this price point, which is literally a quarter or even 1/16th of the price of some of my other fragrances. Pure Gold smells way more expensive than it is. But it's just another good old, affordable Calvin Klein staple and what’s not to love about that?

Calvin Klein keeps most of its fragrances in production, but I can see fans of the OG Euphoria being really turned off by this abberation. Therefore i would not be surprised if this is the first to go if and when CK decides to pare down the Euphoria flankers and I need to do some doomsday prepping for that!

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content: i'm a pretty big fan of the euphoria fragrances, but this one is sickening & nasty smelling. i've never hated a perfume upon first sniff until now. i tried giving this fragrance several chances after a blind buy but i decided it would just be best to return it, i'm not a fan. i feel that the leather and benzoin is most prominent in this perfume and that's my problem with it- this fragrance is akin to a randomized concoction of notes that are not at all complimentary or flattering. yuuuck!

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
I had so much expectations about this perfume, but it is just horrible! Blind buy based by reviews and notes that looks attractive. In reality Pure Gold is just a combination of notes that do not exist in harmony with each other. It starts with sour green accord that has weird nauseous undertone, then evolves into benzoin bomb with almond and red hot iron note (similar to those you can feel in Liquid Gold) and finally ends with sticky dirty cheap amber-benzoin base. Lasts forever. Impossible to wash away. Do not blind buy!
And by the way it has nothing in common with Euphoria Gold that I really love!

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This is absolutely divine! I can smell a tiny bit of oud as I spray, maybe it is the benzoin, then comes this dry sweetness of the dates - and it lasts until the scent dies. The dates are the stronger note on my skin, projection is strong but this is not sharp in any way (like the original, IMO). Its a very rounded perfume, unisex and delicious. I couldn`t smell any leather, unfortunately. Longevity is amazing. Highly recommended!

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Meh. Not better or even as good as the original. It's a very warm, deep amber scent. I also detect a bit of a honey note even though it's not listed. I normally like amber but I think the leather combo is not right for me. There's a bit of furniture polish smell that I just can't ignore. It's also a bit too masculine for my taste.

Later - had to scrub it off. The dry down turned into Lysol.

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content: There was a fragrance by Oriflame called M Marcel Marongiu. It was released about a decade ago and is sadly discontinued. It was a beautiful incense and dates smell mixed with roses and balsams. I missed it so so dearly. Ahhh what happiness it is to discover Pure Gold! It reminds me of M Marcel so much just without as much incense. It is so lovely, oriental, sweet and leathery. A worthy blind buy!

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Edit: I don't smell that strong of an oud note anymore! Maybe my nose played tricks on me! I still believe it's there, but more subtle than I initially thought. I get that this is not for everyone, but you certainly need to give it some time, it might actually grow into a love ;) I've received compliments wearing it! My original review under:

Nice! Pure Gold smells like a fruity floral OUD.

It certainly does open with bright and floral accords, in addition to that fruity sweetness. But it is like it rests on a rose oud that gets stronger by the minute and that ends up dominating the heart of Pure Gold (thankfully the rose is not very dominant). So far from what I expected! That missing oud note explains everything in the comments though, from burning tires to how it can be a challenging and very middle eastern perfume!

What I love the most is the ylang. The wafts you get of this gorgeous yellow flower after a while is beautiful and what makes the scent special imho. It creates a polarity where you get this strong, almost pungent accord and at the same time these lovely feminine flowers that hover on top of it. Fascinating effect, because what you smell up close and from afar is quite different. Actually, Pure Gold reminds me very much of Fidelis from Histoires de Parfums, but it's more floral and feminine, not as warm and spicy. Still very similar for a good part of the ride, but I might prefer PG because it is easier to wear - owning both is a little redundant, but who cares when they are both such beautiful creations!

I only get a little bit of almond, but it is a great addition when it does peak through! Drydown is lovely with more emphasis on warmer notes of soft leather, benzoin and vanilla. I have no doubt believing that this smells heavenly when it lingers on a scarf or a piece of clothing! Yum

Absolutely great and unique find! Recommended 👍

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Instant love with this one! Dates and leather, freshened up by solar note. Not overly sweet, unique, powdery, and elegant. SPL are just perfect.

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
IMO...CK Pure Gold for Men and this are for sure...."related".
I layer them together for great results.
Pure Gold for women...IMO....has a sweet leathery vibe....and yes,dates. I guess the "solar" notes are the new version of aldehydes...????
I do get the neroli, ylang ...orange blossom and almond-ish notes in this as well. But those notes are "blended" in with the others...and patch/musk for balance on the bottom.
This performs better than the men's version on my skin. It is brighter/sweeter and "punchier".
Although not remarkable....and there are other current scents that follow this vibe,I do enjoy this scent so far.

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Wow, this perfume is intense! Definitely unexpected. I'm not entirely sure if that is in a good or bad way. I don't know what to make of it and I will need to probably wear it a few times with some rests in between, but this review is for my initial thoughts.
I was picking out what scent I wanted to wear from some Euphoria flankers (amber gold, gold, pure gold) by sniffing the atomizer. Pure Gold stood out to me as it smelled a bit sweet and pleasant. Today is a chilly spring day so I wanted something comforting and cozy. I quickly spritzed the inside of each elbow and 2-3 spritzes on the front of my blouse.
I immediately had instant regrets. "Cripes! What have I done?!?!" It was SO extremely masculine. The leather and benzoin was quite strong. I felt like I was stuck with this man scent, but my heart kept whispering, "Give it a chance. Wait for the dry down." So, I went to busy myself with other tasks to take my mind off that I smelled like my husband.
(Which I will note that the opening does smell like it would be fantastic on my husband. It smells great, but is not what I care to smell like. I prefer more fruity/gourmands, but I am open to trying new things.)
Now that it's been an hour, this scent has calmed down quite a bit. Sometimes that leather comes up strong and hits me in the face and other times, it's rounded out by soft florals and a sweetness from the patchouli. Every now and then I whiff of something that sends a thrill up my spine and makes my chest leap in a fantastic way.

I'm reading reviews saying that it's very Middle Eastern which makes sense. This does smell strange to my very "western" nose. It is a beautiful fragrance. I'm just not sure it's *me*. Hats off to CK for making something more out-of-the-box, complex, and different than their usual. Sad to see it's discontinued, but that explains why I got such a cheap price.
While I blind-bought this, I would definitely say it is not a good blind-buy if you like more sweeter, mass-produced perfumes. I don't think others around me would appreciate this scent. I could definitely see some people finding this offensive. I will probably wear this a few times at home before I gather up enough courage to wear this out (likely to the market during these pandemic times).
I look forward to getting to know this fragrance better. I'm glad I stepped out of my comfort zone today.
I'm not going to vote on it, yet, as I still don't know what to make of it.

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Saw a video by Mona Kattan recommending this and I took the plunge. It’s is very middle eastern! I had never owned a perfume this potent and at first I doubted myself. Gave it time to grow on me and now I can’t imagine life without it. This opens up almost immediately leathery or maybe it’s the benzoin (something Smokey apologies I don’t have a trained nose), it’s sweet from the dates in a modest amount, a little nutty from the almond and a walloping indistinguishable jammy bouquet of sweet flowers. All the notes in the base are heavy hitters and this fragrance punched me right in the nostrils on the first spray 😂 what converted me though was accidentally spraying this in my closet where I keep my perfumes. The minute I walked back into my room, I smelt it for what people within my radius would experience. STUNNING. INTOXICATING. The type of fragrance that stops you in your track. Silage and performance is a 10/10. An extreme hard hitter from CK of all houses who would have guessed! It’s a grower, but I have never had more compliments from any perfume. Keeper. Underrated gem. Also I don’t think it’s a good beginner oud frag because it’s potent and coupled with patchouli, benzoin, musk, leather (I know like WOW so much going on) but it’s gorgeous in the air. But if you’re confident, this ones a beauty.

Ps. Also to those who say it smells like burnt tires, I literally smelt that the other day (it was horrendous) and this perfume smells nothing like that 😂 Smokey yes, tires NO.

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is a great find for me. It was pure coincidence that I should have found this, yet I somehow did! Match-made-in-heaven!

Stunning perfume.

Smells very similar to the now-discontinued Mac Ruby Woo - the same leather, the same development. Another favorite of mine. Simply gorgeous.

It's a crime both of these perfumes have been discontinued. This prominent leather note found in both makes these decidedly gender-ambiguous in the drydown, but the sparkling nature of both makes them still come across as feminine and opulent.

Pure Gold opens with an initial burst of strong sweetness, but that phase surprisingly disappears fairly quickly. Beautifully sensual. I wish perfumes like this were more popular with the mass-market.

This sort of leather infused compositions have truly become my ultimate favorite of late.

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Pure Gold has a strong vibe of leather and powder that reminds me a bit of a Shalimar flanker. Then it adds an unexpected sweet note with the dates and a wallop of solar.

Admittedly, this isn't an easy fragrance to love immediately. It starts weird. I can completely understand this as a release designed for a specific market where scents are bolder, bigger, and stronger. The notes are a bit discordant at some points, and it can be a bit too much - too much solar, too leathery, too sweet, too weird. This is _not_ one to blind buy.

Updated to add:

After I tested this, I tossed the bottle in a drawer and forgot about it. A few days later, a friend stopped by, and I loaned her a wrap because she was cold. When she returned the wrap, she insisted on knowing what perfume was on that scarf and where she could buy it. I sniffed it and couldn't recognize it. What was this gorgeous scent? We spent the next thirty minutes spraying bottles trying to find it. Finally, I remembered that I'd worn that when I tested Euphoria Liquid Gold, and that was the scent.

While I'm not a massive fan of the top notes, the dry down is a sweet, natural date and some Shalimar-esque leather and powder. It's beautiful in the bottom notes, and it lasts forever.

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Hello,

So I’ve orders this today is Wednesday I’m so excited 😆

I will give an honest review look out for my post in 2 days time.
Friday I’ll get it and review how long it stays on if it smells nice ect !!
I blind bought this so wish me luck and I’ll let you know if this is worth the blind buy.
:)
———————————Update——————
**************************Results************************
**********************************************************
—————————————————————
It took me so long to update this!!! Being stuck inside during coronavirus, I’ve finally found time !
So this was NOTHING like what I expected (Opium YSL/ Shalimar Vibes)🥃💥👑👸🏻

It was confusing because instead of smelling leather notes, it confused my Nose to smell ‘Smokey, almost a tobacco opening..
So how does this smell on its own? Strong, for a evening where you want to be ”THE WOMEN” (1-3 sprays is more then enough) in the room like no other women, will stand out !!
This is for an ALPHA female in a gorgeous evening gown either white or black
Winter for sure, there is no other season this will suit.
If you want to smell like “ bitch mode” class or “ “unique” Smokey heavy Date bitter almond this is the one for your collection I wish there was a little sweeter I sometime feel layering it with viva la juicy gold can change it into a more seductive scent but not a cozy cuddle me fragrance

Independant women mode 9.1/10
Head turner 9/10

Universal crowd pleaser 3/10 you will love or hate this
Compliments 8/10
Silage /performance 8.9/10

Girls under 22 compatibility 3/10
Age 22-65 (not for older skin or younger )8.7/10
Hope this helps lovelies

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I have a soft spot for Calvin Klein fragrance, so every time there is a new flanker I have to get it. Unfortunately, I couldn´t get a sample, so I decided to blind buy this frag and it was a huge mistake. It turns my stomach. :-( I can´t even identify the notes in it, all I can smell is burning rubber and benzoin. Maybe there is some neroli somewhere far away. The notes were so promising but the reality is just horrible. I will give myself few more days and try it again. If it doesn´t work, it has to go. Anyone near the Czech Republic who is brave enough to adopt it?

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content: ...I've finally come to the conclusion that I enjoy this fragrance very much! It's kind of like a bad first impression, but then finding out that even though we are different, there's much to be enjoyed with the personality of this fragrance. It is now a really fragrant orange blossom and vanilla musk on me, with a brightness that ends up making me happy. This is NOT my usual style of fragrance, so I'm pretty surprised, especially considering the beginning, which I thought was pretty loud, heavy and screechy, but now, not at all. I don't know why now, I'm appreciating this fragrance so much? I think this is a wonderful change for my usual fall/winter wardrobe. This is heavy enough to suit me, but in a completely different way. I don't know if it's the neroli or the "solar" accord that tips the scales on this, but it is not my usual dark, serious fall type. Even though it is still pretty thick in composition, it somehow still keeps a playful happy accord to it. I like it, I really like it. :-)

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I got to test this at an airport and despite not being listed in the notes my first impression was of a strong oud over rich vanilla. I thought it worked well in the composition though, being very luxurious. It settles down to a be rather thick and heavy scent, similar to other recent releases but unique enough to tweak my interest. I'd say it had good longevity just based on the fact that the scent has stayed on the tester card for over a week.

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I want one of this so much. I am in Portugal. Where can I get it ? Who knows?

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I'm fascinated by solar notes, and I like/love all the perfumes I've smelled with a date note. Going on my want list!

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Wow, I can't wait to get my nose on this. The notes look very masculine. I hope it is worth owning.

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I have tried it, i am already in middle east, nothing worthy ladies

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content: @Whit: who cares...the Liguid Gold (same looking bottle btw..) was meant only for the Middle East, too but you could buy it everywhere in online shops in US and whole Europe without problems....so this will be the same, dont worry

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Just for the Middle East darn...well they will get a special treat in the Middle east.

product_name: Pure Gold Euphoria Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Not a review, but I read on a couple sites where this is marketed just for the Middle East. Bummer, I'd love to try it; it sounds so nice!

Category: Floral, fruity, slightly aquatic

Notes: Sprays on super fruity, I’d describe it as a sweet grapefruit that quickly intermingles with a very fresh and distinct rose. Within 20 minutes a slightly powdery undertone emerges, I’d say likely from the amber. A bit of spice from the freesia as well. The scent remains floral-heavy throughout and is never overpowered by its base notes.

Vibe: Koi pond and water lilies. Rose petals. Luscious curls. Freshly showered. Fresh spring rain. Monet paintings. Phoenix. Pink and green. Visit to the florists. Wedding day bouquet. Goldfish aquarium. Gazebo. Romance.

Sillage: 5/10. Decent sillage, definitely noticeable when you get up close but not offensive and stronger than a skin scent. In my opinion this is the perfect kind of sillage.

Longevity: 5/10. So far it has lasted me about 3 hours. I’ll add an update later.

Wear: Day or night, all year round. A really beautiful everyday scent.

Overall rating: 6.5/10. This perfume is that fresh-out-the-shower scent wrapped up in a bottle. That might just be a fancier way to say it smells kinda like shampoo actually. It’s floral and fruity, and incredibly feminine. There’s a slight powderiness that appears after it’s been worn for a while that I personally don’t appreciate but it’s not at all overpowering the scent, more of an annoying background noise. This is a lovely perfume, just not for me. If I had to describe this fragrance with one word it would be romantic.

Who would wear it?: Angelina Jolie (current, not during her sleaze-era) or Ingrid Bergman maybe.

I'm surprised to see this being sold for expensive prices on eBay. I was gifted this almost 20 years ago when I was wearing Eternity religiously. I don't like it. It's sharp then, the freesia note comes in which I despise.

I seek but, cannot find Eternity's rounded DNA in the base. I've used up at least 2 x 100mls bottles of the original Eternity for women. I was a fan. This flanker made me avoid all the others, although I have just bought Enternity Moments to try.

Super squeaky fresh n clean, very strong like Estee Lauder's Pleasures. I get mostly white florals n some roses but the freesia always ruins it for me... But get it if u r into the fresh n clean ones!

I have it I have it I have it! Finally after 9 years I've managed to bag myself a tiny 15ml to treat myself with. And you know what?! My memory has failed me, because it's just a more intense version of original Eternity! Still love it, but it's not how I remembered it.
meh. it is all I can say for this fragrance. one of the most boring and linear I've ever came across. just roses,sweet roses and it is gone..

It's the 'Shirley Temple' effect: take a little ginger ale and infuse with a touch of grenadine. Plop a cherry on top. Keeps the kids happy; lets mom and dad swill their grown-up drinks in peace. 'Eternity' has not left the building -- it's still the most prominent aroma in Rose Blush. I get the feeling that there was less of a blending of fruit and flowers into the original than a handsome dollop of them over the whole composition. It's not bad like that. I do miss the swoop of heliotrope in the original, but welcome the fruit and the extra sandalwood in RB.

In the end, harmless, sweet and diverting. Feel free to wear it whilst crammed onto a commuter jet, holding onto the straps of a loaded subway, or leaning over the cubicle of the most allergic girl in the office. CK Rose Blush speaks no evil. Will not take you to the heights of your olfactory sensibilities, and it smells like you could probably actually drink it if you wanted to. Sometimes I like smelling so ingenuous. I mean, who doesn't like a little 'Shirley Temple' now and then?
Very synthetic and pharmaceutical. No body or roundness. Poor sillage and mediocre longevity. I adore Rose scents, and can tolerate the original Eternity, but find this awful.

Waterlily mostly then sandalwood at the end. Not enough depth, character or prettiness. Plain and a bit brash, then just boring. It leaves me wishing for something more. More rose, more layers, more personality, I'm not sure what, but there needs to be more.

I got three mini bottles of this, tried it, didn't like it, sold two of them and then, when I tried it again, I liked it. Ironic. It is soft and the rose scent doesn't come through as strongly as I would like, but it is there, with a sort of soft spiciness behind it. I'll likely want to get some more when I finish off the mini I have. Unless I change my mind about it again. :-)

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
Absolutely stunning beauty.
I was just lucky to get a 125ml tester(w/o cap though) at a price of ~20$, and never expected it to be so good.
I also get a beautiful and prominent sandalwood note too which is strangely not listed.
It is a must-have!

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
About 10 years ago, i walked by my brother who wore an interesting scent. I told him he smelled good and we left it at that.

A couple of months later he hands me a bottle as a gift, and i fell in love with it so bad that i quickly used almost all of it up. Now 10 years later, i still have the bottle, with probably 3-5 ml in it, but i never use it, i just like to look at it and cherish the memories.

Phenomenal masculinity and uniqueness in the scent profile. What a shame to discontinue a gem like this.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
Date night, dressed up, cooler days and evening banger.

Why did they stop making this?????

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
@Dark Owl It's not limited but sadly discontinued. I was lucky to get 2 bottles for the old price last year. Will it show up again, don't know. Price is high as f on some markets.
Awesome fragrance and "weird" for CK type of fragrances.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: I have the first batch from november 2017, 125ml, if anyone's interested, send your offers (msg via profile)

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
I love this. Gave myself a rare treat of a wear of this today, why rare? Because for some reason it's not easy to find, I don't understand Coty/CK with this fragrance, surely one of their best in recent times yet seemingly a limited release (although not officially a limited edition), strange as it could've been a big hit.

Fantastic woody oriental scent with strong sillage and long lasting power too.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: Yes! The rumors are true! It smells like Black Afgano to me lol! I pick up sweet rhubarb and grapefruit, but done in an elegant way. Performs well with 8+ hours. I'm so glad I have a 125ml bottle of this. Great pick up for lovers of Black Afgano who don't want to break the bank for a measly 30mls lol!

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: There is definitely a very prominent note in Black Afgano that is present here. It's more muted, but it does color the fragrance and it is (to my nose) identical. What exactly it is, I am unsure, as they don't share ingredients on paper. This is my signature, the only scent I keep a backup bottle of.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
Ok, so I got this and I like it a lot. The first thing to hit me is the sweet rhubarb and grapefruit.

Then, the cashmeran and cedar come through. It is powerful with the vanilla which will overpower everything else but the balsam which comes through at the end along with the amber.

For a Calvin Klein fragrance, I'm impressed. This is a good fragrance and the longevity on me is about 7+ hours with moderate sillage. This does NOT Remind me of Black Afgano; no way! This is its own animal, completely different.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: I like it , IT DOES NOT smells like Black Afgano !!!!!!! Lol .. is a very nice scent ,,, scent profile is more similar to “Joop Wild homme “ is a cheap parfume but smells refined and nice , but DOES NOT! smells like BLack Afgano at all , i have it and nope not to my nose , who ever started this rumor needs to stop .

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: Wow! DEFINITELY a surprise'r coming from CK (in a good way)..... 1st time wearing it; will update review by end of day(edit: 1/16/22.. will get back to it). I will say this, the notes are blended very good so far.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
This mysterious scent blew me away... but in a totally opposite direction from the majority of the fragrance aficionados here.

It's pungent. It's overwhelming. It's cloying. It's powdery. It's an ambroxan and vanilla bomb. Those are just the qualities of fragrances I normally avoid.

If you like those qualities, you'll likely be able to appreciate this.

Despite the fact that I can tolerate the EDT, this EDP is a different animal. I sprayed it once in my bedroom and I still remember how I suffocated in my own room.

In my opinion, the best thing I can say for this fragrance is its bottle design. Such a cool-looking bottle!

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
Since I've been interested in fragrances Obsessed for men EDP Intense has been the biggest mystery I've encountered. It's such a stunning scent that it really blows my mind how Calvin Klein/Coty decided to release it with little fanfare and seemingly as a limited edition (although this isn't noted anywhere). Whenever anyone trashes CK frags I suggest giving this a try. This stuff competes with ALL the heavy hitters and smashes most of them IMO.

Obsessed for men EDT was OK but honestly quite forgettable to me, this EDP is a totally different beast, a totally under the radar gem that needs to be experienced to be believed. Maybe CK/Coty should re-release this stuff as a standalone scent with the name CK Mystery, keeping the sleek black bottle or maybe giving it a mirrored effect as with Obsession Night.

I don't know anything that smells similar to this (many say Black Afghano though I've never smelled it) but perhaps imagine a combination of CK Encounter and with a touch of L'Homme Lacoste Intense and hint of Azzaro Amber Fever (edit also a little like Euphoria for men Intense, this is way stronger though). Performance is extremely good too, very long-lasting and it creates a beautifully mysterious and compelling sillage. High quality gem from CK.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: @Giskela you have commented on here no less than three times complaining about people thinking this smells like BA. clearly it does, and many people agree. why does it bother you so much? get over it.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: One spray at the time, or the guiac wood will hit you in the head. For me, this was a steal. You can never go really wrong with Calvin Klein, and "eau de parfum intense" sounds like value for money. But does it smell nice? I was looking for an Amber-Woody successor to my Halston Amber (Amber + Oud) and this one does a marvellous trick. It's a beast for sure, and absolutely NSFW. I sometimes use it as a base layer for Burberry London for men, they are both Guiac Woody, and the tobacco in Burberry London enhances your presence, if that's what you want. Fot those who didn't know, guiac wood is also called palo santo, and some energy workers burn this wood before a session.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: I find it similar to PDM Galloway. Love the smell.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: People who say this smells like Black Afgano should have their head examined (please don't kill me I'm only joking so take no offense) this to me smells like hair shampoo and it's ok but for a younger crowd for clubbing and similar occasions. Well, that's just my two cents, so please do try it yourselves.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
Short and sweet review! CK Obsessed Intense is a real good smelling fragrance and it surprised me how really nice this scent is. The Projection & Longevity are excellent (but no beast) which is surprising for a CK scent. Most of them(I have around 30) are at the average mark but Obsessed Intense does go further. Not massively but enough to notice a difference.

I really do love this fragrance but I have to go easy on it because it's not that cheap and I heard it has been discontinued but not sure about that. . Three squirts is more than enough to get you noticed! All in all a 8.5 out of 10 for me👌👍😍🍻!

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
since adding Black Afgano to my collection and doing a side by side comparison, I must say the two are strikingly similar. it's that sweet, plastic, playdoh note they manage to create while not sharing any notes.

CK opens up much brighter due to the rhubarb and grapefruit, and stays that way for maybe half an hour. soon after, the cashmeran and guaiac wood peak through, and this is where the likeness to BA begins.

with low prices (despite discontinuation) and great performance for a CK, I think I would choose this over BA. it's more wearable and mass appealing.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is my initial impression of CK obssesed intense.
The sparkling grapefruit oppening instantly remind me of issey miyake noir argent, but then after 2-3 min latter, they both went into different direction. In noir argent, the insense became more prominent. on the otherside,Obssesed intense went into slighty sweet and balsamic scent. The gurjan balsam smells very similiar to succan absolute notes in Davidoff amber blend.
I think this is more polished and wearable version of davidoff amberblend, i seldom used amber blend because it way to loud, and dont mixed well with high heat.

I will put this more often in my rotation to see how it develop in my skin.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: Yes, this is really similiar to something... I came to conclusion that it is really similiar to 1 Million Prive by Paco Rabanne but more soapy.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: I just don't understand how some people say that this smells similar to Gucci Intense Oud and Black Afgano Nasomatto. I had Gucci 2016 batch and I had a decant of Black Afgano and I have an official sample of Ck and there is absolutely no connection with Gucci and Black Afgano. It is ok scent a bit feminine, reminds me of shampoo but it is not even in the same ballpark with Gucci and Black Afgano, not even on the same planet.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: Very hard to get hold of, I have a feeling this is discontinued? Damn!!

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: excellent longevity and compliments from this. It lasts a long tome and was a great blind buy.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
I've owned a bottle of this for a good while now, since late spring/early summer last year. More extensive 'review' to come but honestly this is one heck of a mysterious (and exceptional) release. Calvin Klein knocked it out of the park with this, extremely high quality, a smash hit waiting to happen yet they don't market it???????

The world (and so the Calvin Klein brand's marketing!) is strange, this is a masterpiece in comparison to most designer releases in the last 10 years. A must buy!

If this does one day get some Youtube hype I can safely say that for a change, the hype would be real.

Dang, maybe I should've kept this a secret?

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: Much like the post before me, this smells REALLY similar to another frag and I am going nuts sniffing bottles here... The opening is like a slightly more gourmand version of Man in Black, but it might just be the pepper giving me that vibe. Encre Noire comes to mind as well, but with less of a piercing cashmere note, and more on something sweeter like the grapefruit/rhubarb/vanilla combination. Or as someone else said, I can agree with, it even makes me think of La Nuit D'Issey. La Nuit is "darker" and spicier, but this scent DOES have evocations of La Nuit. The dry down is quite woody, and pleasantly smooth. The notes mix quite well, do not seem to fight one another, and I am a fan of this frag overall. It does not have any "chemical" smells to the composition, so that is a plus in my book. I love when a blind purchase turns out good!

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
I recently picked this one up in a New year sale.
For me it's a fresh and spicy scent. Very pleasant and wearable but nothing ground breaking or unique, in fact it reminds me of something else I can't quite put my finger on.
Would work well as an office scent or as casual wear.

Longevity is excellent I get 7 to 8 hours easily.
It opens with the grapefruit and rhubarb which fades quickly and then it's pretty much a spicy, woody affair.

Clean, fresh and spicy and overall a very nice fragrance with great lasting power but nothing new or innovative, in my opinion.
Nice one to have in the collection as a simple scent to reach for when you just want to smell pleasant.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: WOW...CK has really come around in the last few years....killer scent and longevity if off the charts for me which is rare. great for cooler weather.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
If you want a scent in the same vein as Afgano and Cuirs without breaking the bank, this is it. This is a beast. Lasts all day and into the morning - at least on me.



9.5/10

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
Finally I found this at a duty free shop in Ireland, I was beginning to wonder if it even existed. Why is this stuff so hard to find??? Mystery to me.

This was just a quick test but Obsessed Intense for me is completely different to the regular EDT version in the clear bottle, to my nose they don't have a lot in common at all. This however is a truly lovely, refined and sumptuous fragrance from CK. Such frag snob s will snigger at that statement and this next one- the house of Calvin Klein continue to surprise me with decent releases (CK one shock for men, Obsession night for men, CK2, CK Obsessed) that soon it will no longer be a surprise but an expectation once again.

Definitely a smooth and dark spicy/oriental gem of a scent this one.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: Not woody, not Animalic not even close to Gucci Intense Oud or Black Afgano. This smells like clean sweetness with a bit of spice, it reminds me of a hair shampoo

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
I found a great deal so I bought a bottle. The "dark" fruit at first is nice as well as strong, but doesn't last long. Then it's rather weak, but the blend is pleasant. I can't think of anything it smells a lot like, but at least it doesn't seem too "chemical." There's a touch of sweetness and obviously some mild musk. And it's not "lavender overload" country. I used two sprays so I'm surprised others think it's strong. Next time I'll use more sprays and report back.

UPDATE: After a couple hours, it started to "bloom" and was at its best. The far drydown is similar to Derby Club House Ascot.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
I picked Obsessed Edp up blind after reading all the favorable reviews. Sadly I'm not too impressed by it. I was expecting an exotic incense scent but it is just another fruity, sweet, spicy nighttime scent. It's quite similar to several others in my collection like Bogart Club 75 and Nuit D'Issey but I like those better.

It seems to have good lasting power but it doesn't project much on me.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
I was quite surprised by the quality and depth this fragrance had to offer. Obsessed intense is of niche quality and I think it’s one of the best underrated fragrances of 2018. It’s not subtle it’s dark, mysterious and loud but very well blended

I clearly smell the comparison to Black Afgano, but I also smell this dark vanilla and dark amber from Fahreneit Le Parfum.
Great job Cälvin Cline

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
Im surprised it smells great on me. Very lasting on my skin.

I has some resemblance of Amouage Epic Man and Black Afgano Nasomato. Niche!

Worth trying this spicy insencey smell. Quite a rare release by CK to my opinion.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: I'm getting a lot of compliments on this. Great winter fragrance with very long lasting longevity. Thumbs up!

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: That's the way,i like it.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: A great winter fragrance! Fruity spice with great longevity! Not a fan of obsessed..but really enjoy this one.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
What’s great surprise
This is a great alternative if you want a more wearable black Afghano .
Check your local tjmax or Marshall’s
34 for 2.5 EDP you cant go wrong ,this is one of those perfume that time will increase the value
Obsessed has the same vibe as Carner Barcelona cuirs,Black Afghano and Gucci intense oud at at fraction of the price

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
This smells like a very sweet mix of Byredo's Baudelaire and Fortis by Les Liquides Imaginaires. The dry down is very similar to the beautiful Fortis.
Funnily enough my only hesitance for buying it is the branding and packaging which is a bit cheap looking and uninspiring. It is also way too sweet and the materials seem very chemical.
Or I have just become an insufferable niche perfume snob...

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: Calvin Klein obsessed For men intense.. wow I must say on first couple sprays I was overwhelmed by an intense perfume and it was very fruity it was very incense Laden and it was pungent and it lasted up 6 hours on my skin....Also sprayed on my shirt sleeves and still smells as intense as the first Initial sprays.....I really like this scent as it is really rich is very aromatic I have to give the scent an 8.5 strengthen longevity 7.0....The Smell just slightly reminds me of Polo red extreme or Polo red in some ways

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: Start out as a creamy fruit based scent and evolves into a powdery synthetic woodsy all too familiar generic fragrance, it showed promise until the dry down stage, the scent lingers on for about 4 hours then goes into a close encounter skin scent, overall O.K. for night time events .

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
Starts good, then turns bit sour and everything else is Ambroxan.

I can't detect anything else, except sharp to mild turning ambroxan.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: I never cease to be amazed by CK and their steady output. Even more surprising is just how many I really like among them. This stuff is nothing short of superb, evoking some very notable scents along the way. The opening is a tart, fruity note, not immediately recognisable as rhubarb but settling to it after a moment. This just frames the scent as the main body is one of deep woods and resin, but fruity evoking a little of CdG Floriental. You can really get the smell of guaic wood and cypriol softened in the drydown by vanilla and amber. Obsessed Intense is a very dense leathery oriental in the style of Carner cuirs, Palo Santo or Nasomatto Pardon but slightly cleaner, cheaper and more mainstream. It's hard to pin this stuff down, I think there were several other fragrances it reminded me of, all of which were niche, which I think speaks for itself and tells you where this is going. I want it. I thought it was excellent, kinda messy and all over the place but more thought provoking than most releases I've tried lately.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
Helooo my lovely fragheads lol

Got this as a birthday present late February 2018

Its a delicious raspberry & incense smell and is a beast longevity wise.
Doesn't project in a big way but enough so that it's noticeable that you smell gooood!

Similar to cristiano ronaldo private blend in many ways(I own it too) just a tad more sweetness.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: Certainly one for longevity ,very deep and woody/spicy ,not as expensive are making out ,in the uk you can pick up decent sized bottles for £25-£30

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: In 2 or 3 months they will launch Obsessed Acqua or something like this.....just wait.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: I bought this because it's new and it's an EDP. There is nothing spectacular about the scent,it will probably remind you of another fragrance but there is something about the longevity and soft smell that stays with you allday without being too noticeable. It's sweet and I think using too much would cause nausea, however it keeps you feeling scented. Overall a good everyday scent. This will be my new signature on the strength of its longevity

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
Tested this today, it was an ok scent
more spicy and dark than the original,
i still think i prefer the original but
it was ok enough to make me wanna buy it
at some point if i can get it cheap, it lasted
about 6 hours with avrage projection.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
Had a quick smell of this today, wasn't yet for sale but the SA had a bottle in his little secret cupboard, caught me off guard as I didnt even know it existed.

Just a quick spray on a card, very rushed first impression just "OK", little more warmer and richer than the EDT nothing radically different.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: d-d-d-drew welcome to Fragrantica. Lol !

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: I hope this one performs well as the notes look like my cup of tea.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
Rhubarb and Vanilla? I wonder if it will be similar to Mugler's newly released AURA.

I'm glad they removed the Ambroxan. It reminded me too much of "laundry" in the initial release of Obsessed.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content: rhubarb will be the breakout note for 2018. well be seeing more of this since Aura Mugler's success.

product_name: Obsessed for Men Intense Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is a welcommed fragrance as in the past 2 years, Calvin Klein is showing a trend of presenting better more complex fragrances instead of "easy" fragrances.
I just tested a sample and I liked it a lot. I never considered buying the original Obsessed but I do want to buy this one.
The dark dry down dominated by Vanilla, Amber and Brazilian Guayac (Pau Santo in portuguese) is fantastic. The Rhubarb opening is very nice as well.

This is delicious! I’m so happy I found a bottle at an amazing price! I was worried this might smell a little dated, or synthetic or not well blended but I was pleasantly surprised. This smells like it has incense notes like a sweet myrrh, and vanilla. It’s sweet and spicy, unisex but fem leaning to my nose and the longevity is above average. Reminds me of Dries Van Noten Rock The Myrrh minus the green note or Valentino Donna Noir Absolu but a touch sweeter and richer.

No cinnamon or sandalwood for me. Basically black orchid and alcohol.

Meh.

Okay…. I am not getting what others are saying. I purchased my bottle from a person selling on Poshmark. The batch codes dates it back 9 years. There is a slight sweetness and I smell a pretty woody, orchid or floral note but that’s it. No cinnamon, no real sandalwood either. There’s a definite warmth to this and something “Tom ford” about it but it sits so close to the skin and has terrible performance. I wish this was more challenging or interesting. I’m glad I didn’t overpay for it.

EUPHORIA with a dash of cinnamon & sandalwood...

Opens with a warm-spicy burst of cinnamon & fruity-florals, that deepens into a floral heart of black-orchid with near-violet, creamy, sweet, fruity & warm-spicy tones, resting on a sandalwood base with trace patchouli. Overall what I get is the original Euphoria Calvin Klein, with a thin additional layer of cinnamon-sandalwood. It's as if the listed fantasy note of 'black orchid' is code for the original Euphoria Calvin Klein. The longer it's on the skin, the more the cinnamon-sandalwood combo comes out. Personally, I would have liked the original Euphoria to be dialed back even further in this composition, but I'm still enjoying it. Enjoy!

Expensive for a blind buy fail. Not cinnamon for me so far. Oddly vegetal. At least it's not too sweet for me, like Euphoria Amber Gold is. Or too fresh-solar for me, like Pure Gold is. I do wear Euphoria Gold now and then: a pleasant, summery, citrusy floral with an appley honey note that I don't find particularly clever. I am happy to stick with the pillar fragrance, thank you.

Update 5/29/23: I'm going to end up liking this. Euphoria is such a phenom. Even her flankers seem to do no wrong. Even when I think I don't like them.
It smells like a freshly baked cinnamon bun! 🤤 it lasts longer on cloths than skin but it is a delicious scent

My favorite so far, i never imagined that i would love a perfume made out with cinnamon. That was a surprise for me, but then I love Tom Ford black orchid and I saw in the reviews that they often found this perfume had Tom Ford's quality in it. My husband loves it, my sister told me that to her it smells like something new leathery my mom hates it so don't buy it blindly. If you manage to find it though.

I have bought this one blindly for ridiculously little money, and I fell in love 🥰. For me, this is not strong. At all. Very delicate, elegant, mysterious, spicy caramel. Mainly caramel, less spices, a hint of vanilla creaminess. It is so pleasant for colder months, I find the dry down somewhat similar to Byredo : Bal'd Afrique. I could bath in it. I am surprised it is described as oriental fragrance 😳 I do have oriental perfumes, this is far from them. Oriental perfumes are jam-packed with notes and aromas. Whereas this is light cloud around you. I will wear it now during cold autumn 🍁🍂 🎃👻 and winter ❄️🌨️☃️.

I am happy that I have bought this discontinued gem 🎁💎😊. Now no one can smell like me👍

Its almost impossible to smell anything past the stink of the sickly sweet vanilla in this perfume. And it will stink for about 3 hours, then you might smell cinnamon, but its very light. You dont smell anything woody, theres no sandalwood, and no floral. Its just cheap vanilla. Absolute waste of my money! And it was expensive!
I love this one, I've never owned anything like it and can't wait to wear it on an appropriate night. Last year for the holidays I wore L de lolita and this year I will be adorned in liquid gold.

For me this is Christmas time in a bottle. Vanilla, cinnamon, spice bomb. It isn’t for the faint of heart but if you like the Intense version of every perfume you own then this is your fragrance! For me living in the Middle East I can easily wear this as heavy as I like♥️

I sampled this yesterday from an assortment of decants sent to me by a friend.

I thought it was another scent and sprayed liberally according to the other scent's low projection and wow-zuh! Do. Not. Over spray CKLGE! Do. Not.

It was too much because I overdosed. After it settled it was a beautiful quite masculine sandalwood fragrance. A man could EASILY wear this and he would smell fabulous in it!

As for me I will try another day and not over apply by accident. Sandalwood lovers should try this one!

Dec. 2021 - I've been wearing this now in the coolest weather and I really love it. I found an inexpensive body cream with sandalwood (Bodycology S'mores something) and it pairs nicely with this CKE version. I love the lingering scent of this perfume on my sweater.
I still hold to what I said that it is unisex and in fact has a masculine edge to it. In my experience my last few wearings don't seem as strong. I think that is because now it is winter and I am used to wearing my heavier perfumes, so CKLGE doesn't come across so strong to my nose.
I do think all the different names of these flankers get a bit confusing but that seems to be the naming trend we are in currently. I've been reading recently about the last kings of France and making sense of royal lineage rather reminds me of trying to figure out the offsprings of perfumes!
