It has a certain something that makes I can not break the nose of the wrist. My man also really like and promised me bottle . Downtown is different and - I am not able to compare this to any other known to me the smell . Something beautiful.
Bottle minimalist but I like it.
Persistence many hours .

I haven't paid attention to CK perfumes since Euphoria, but this is nice. It's not harsh and too clean or sweet. I get a soft floral with a background of woods. Much like mixing a warm men's cologne with your perfume. I wouldn't have noticed it at all if Sephora hadn't thrown in an extra sample with my order.
it is pleasant scent to me. Like it.

Maybe it's because a French blogger raved about this scent, but wearing this perfume makes me feel like I'm in Paris. It's playful yet has that classic feel of Calvin Klein. It smells woodsy yet the incense and lemon notes gives a city girl type of feeling.

There might be a hint of citrus at the opening of Calvin Klein Downtown. But overall it's a vague, milky fluffy blend of gardenia and pear to my nose, and it stays quite so until the end. Towards the end, when the floral aspect becomes less distinct, it kind of reminds me of berry vanilla combination of CK One Shock, but a bit smoother and less cloying.

The sillage is soft and the longevity is around 9 hours. It's a sweet, pleasant and inoffensive scent that could do well as an everyday fragrance or a safe gift for those who aren't that into perfumes. But I don't think I would particularly recommend it.

I tried this out in the store and rather thought I liked it enough to buy a small travel size bottle. It began with a very sweet citrus smell, but the longer it was on my skin the stronger the florally gardenia and musk came into play. So much so that it ended up giving me a headache and had to be washed off. When I got home and my husband smelled it he said it smelled "to old" for me. I'm 27. I was very disappointed.

I use this perfume when I want to smell pretty, elegant and casual. It does not really stand out, but is a nice touch to overall visage. It does not bother anyone,and although woody/sweet, it is not a headache maker. However, it is not as unique as some of my favourites.

What I smell on my skin is a lot different than on the paper strip. I cannot detect citrus at all - Downtown is not a fresh splash scent for me. But somewhere from below there has something bergamot-y in it when you overcome the first and quite intensive powdery musky feeling. For me - powdery, woody, sweet (but not heavy) with a slight citrusy and floral touch in the background which is more detectable as the time passes. I actually really like it, it comes out as a nice calming fragrance.

My immediate sense was one of pleasure. This is a scent that hugs you and just makes you feel comfortable. Unfortunately, it's similar to many others on the market today. Is it the pear or the plum again that makes it another common scent that's flooding today's market? Come the dry down, the pepper mixes in delicately to make this a soft fragrance perfect for any age, wearable to the office and perfect for day wear. It's a good relaxing perfume, one to go to sleep with, to spritz your pillows and dream. There's a fruity composition to Downtown and it makes the name a misnomer for some who might have been expecting something else to live up to this name. But, people should learn the name and the face that pushes the fragrance shouldn't matter about what's truly in the bottle. What is important is how a perfume reacts with your chemistry. If it makes you feel good, then it works. Downtown works as another fruity blend of 2013, adding the pepper with a dose of musk. If you don't already own this type of fragrance, certainly give it a trial run. If you do, sample it and see if it's one you'd like to add to your stock. Nothing special, nothing to write home about, nothing to remembered by. Just something comfortable, like an old favorite sweatshirt. Regardless, another one chalked up to the perfume annals of Calvin Klein.

FIRST IMPRESSION

As some of the reviews said, this may not be anybodys signature perfume, but it is a perfekt busy day perfume for busy women who want to smell nice and not overwhelming in work, while driving children to school and at luch ect. It sill is pretty and the musk makes it quite sensual but the pear and lemon create some freshness about it. I guess what I'm trying to say here it's a universal perfume, and I quite like it, and that'sa big deal cause I normally don't like any perfume without Jasmine in it :)

UPDATE

Sadly after a couple of hours neither the sillagde nor the smell itself passed the test. Somehow all I can smell now is the pear, but not the fresh pear, more like a fermented pear. I can swear something close to vanilla also. All the freshnes is long gone so its only sweet and musk now and I dont think someone looking for a hip city type modern perfume, that this is advertised as, would apreciate it.

I like this. It's simple, pleasant, and easy to wear. I would mostly wear it to work, church or on a picnic. Some daytime event. It is nice and springtimey to me. Very clean. The pear and gardenia are well balanced and the pink pepper and incense add a bit of spice. It's not fussy but sometimes fuss isn't called for.

This fragrance is hard to put into words. I tested it tonight at my local Sephora, and concluded that the scent dried down very quickly between the top and bottom notes. It opened, I could smell a little pear and bergamot and lemon, but at the same time it was very musky. Not a true floral. Not fruity-floral the way EL Pleasures Bloom, Versace bright crystal are.. I was expecting more brightness, sharp florals, more citrus. None of that brightness. If this was a color it would be gray fading into dark which creates a musty smell. It dried down to a leather smell, except there is no leather. Kind of reminded me a little of fan di fendi (leather accord) and Vera Wang Lovestruck (musky dry fruit). This is a very dry fragrance with little juiciness from the fruit. I smell almost no floral. It is not a scent I would pay a whole lot of money for, because I don't love it enough to use it. Do not go off of what it smelled like in the magazine strips, but actually test it yourself.
Basically all 2013 perfumes are pear fragrances.... so boring....

As someone mentioned before Downtosupermarket would be the more suitable name for this one.
Yet another generic fruity/floralish with some incense in the base for good measure.
CK stopped to exist in my life soon after Obsession, with just a short period of Eternity that was new and original, but also aggressive and killed my nerves in 2 months.
On first sniff ALL I could smell was pear, a big big, ripe and annoying PEAR. I'm partial because I hate pear. It kills everything and makes any perfume smell like a joke.
This is just my personal taste, of course, but the opening was not inviting. The rest of the perfume is simply pleasant in a very generic way, it could be put in the safe&inoffensive category, if it ever really existed such a category. It doesn't exist in my book, but it seems that a certain class of perfumes have become so common and acquired that people just don't make a fuss about them.

This is not bad, if you don't mind pear, it's easily wearable, you just dress up in the morning, spray some Downtown (what a name...) and enter the big mechanism of everyday life feeling more or less fit for anything or at least in the stream and not disturbing. Unless you meet a pear-hater on your way, but that's not important based on statistics. Almost everyone wants to smell pear earluy in the morning on a packed train! That "almost" is me. No matter.
Someone will give you compliments, because it actually smells pleasant.
It has a good lasting power, but the price is too high and the bottle looks like those copycats from street vendors.

I felt like I should review CK's Downtown just to defend it from all the bad reviews. For all the nay-sayers out there keep in mind that every perfume has a time and place, and for Downtown it's the everyday.

To me this perfume epitomizes the modern working woman who wants a perfume that makes her feel confident, modern, maybe even edgy, but can also be appropriate for her busy day-to-day life. The incense and musk in this (which is what remains after the top notes are gone) give it an edge, while being discreet enough to wear to the office, to go pick up your kids from daycare, to come home and cook dinner, and yet sensual enough for when your husband leans in at the end of the night for a kiss.

Many complain about longevity... on me this actually lasts a good 8 hours, but because the sillage is so soft (I can only smell it on my hand) it may appear as if it dissapears quickly.

If you want a perfume that you can wear with confidence no matter where you go, or if you want something more discreet (for those of us who let our personalities do the talking and not our perfumes), then this is for you. If that's not what you're looking for, then move on.

I liked it more than I expected to. Frankly, I expected this fragrance to piss me off because lately I've encountered a lot of fragrances with notes I like that smell like... nothing.
Well, Downtown is hardly exciting, but it's not bad. The gardenia is VERY mild, but it smells like gardenia. The fruits aren't overly sweet. It's quite airy because of the violet leaf.
Nothing particularly Downtown about this fragrance, but it's nice and safe and definitely fits right in with the minimalist Calvin Klein concept I grew up with (90's).

I smelled it even before it came out on the market as I was in a perfume shop and a representative from Calvin Klein was showing it to the shop assistant, explaining what to tell to future buyers in order to saddle them with this. She gave me a generous spray on my wirst and I rembeber thinking 'how can they possibly have come down with this totally uninspiring, boring and average perfume?'. Nothing to add, as a lover of Euphoria this is a total letdown.

CK's Downtown is an inoffensive fruity floral with a pinch of green in it.
This makes a perfect gift, everyone can enjoy it (I dare say, if they are not too much into perfume in general).
It's rather light, and fades quickly.
Perfecty fine to be worn at a business lunch or in school.
There was just no WOW for me.


However on a personal note, I can't help but smile over the fact that everything about this is so perfectly falling in to place, the shallowness of the scent, the uninspired bottle, the plain-jane name, the "bland new star" representing it- I mean (I'm getting a little off-topic here but, campaignwise) look at this, and then take a quick look YSL Manifesto, exciting scent, intriguing name, elegant bottle, and the glamorous (crazy talented) Jessica Chastain?! Well, now actually that would be worth a review.

First impression with this one was "HUH??".

1) I don't get most of the notes listed.
2) I agree with everyone saying the hype about this is much ado about nothing.
3) The bottle is just...awkward.
4) This is like every other sweet, generic, boring Floral out there (Modern Muse, I'm looking in your direction, dear).
5) The price tag on this is ridiculous.

Calvin Klein and Estee Lauder...Please, PLEASE, for the sake of us Perfumistas who do appreciate your brand and a lot of your work, JOIN the 21st Century :/ Please?

In a nutshell...this is yet another safe, floral, short lived scent that is absolutely forgettable and like Modern Muse, I'd recommend this to shy women who are uncomfortable with being noticed(genuinely, I don't mean any offense by that as I understand there is a market for it).

This one wasn't worth the wait, Sorry.

Decent perfume. I like it. The only thing I don't like is the bottle top. It moves around a lot. I wear this when I'm just going out to the drug store or when I forget to put something on before I leave home I use the rollerball I have. I get multiple compliments throughout the day from customers when I wear it to work. The dry down is much more pleasant and floral which I like (I love strong florals). When I first spray it the fruit is too strong but goes away fast enough. I don't wear it nearly enough for a full sized bottle like I bought. A lot of people get carried away with the reviews. Let's calm down with all the "WORST PERFUME OF 2013!!1!" Talk. It's not that serious! Don't be so negative. People come here for their hobbies or passions and it's a drag. If you don't like it, you just say you don't care for it. Problem solved. All in all, if I ever run out (I don't use it enough to run out anytime soon) I would definitely consider getting it (in a much smaller size) again. It's a fun around the house fragrance.

Boring, bland and totally uninspiring.
The name makes you think of excitement and fun but what you get is 'trip to the supermarket'.
Why did you do this? How could you think anyone would be interested? Parfumery is a different thing/k. Mainstream parfumery is dead.
Bland.

It is a fruity floral with noticeable pink pepper. My husband has a very fussy nose, said "it's not bad"' which is a stamp of approval coming from him. I will admit it isn't super unique, but there's something I like about it nonetheless. I certainly would not consider this the next euphoria. It is an everyday soft fragrance in a boring bottle with a weird cap (there's no top to the cap, not sure what that's all about).

My first impressions of this fragrance - very soft, delicate and warm. As it develops on my skin over few hours it becomes stronger and warmer. It is a day parfume, very comforting, makes me feel grown up and feminine in a non-defensive and non-offensive way. At the same time I could imagine it wearing in bed. As it is very soft and close to skin it is suitable for work, school, as well as for intimate holiday with your buddy. Only the lucky ones who get close to you enough, can actually smell it. And I like it a lot!
old, sweet and boring..exatly like the ad. nothing special or remarkable just zzzzzzzzzzzzz. not worth of purchase

Downmarket would be a more appropriate name. This one is a letdown for sure. Imagine a very bland, preditable light fruity floral celebrity-type scent in a bottle that looks like something you'd see on the table of a street vendor. The lasting power is also extremely poor.

The name may be misleading...as many have described, this is not a super-charged urban mixture. It's sweet, soft and gentle, which suits me just fine. I happen to love it, and was delighted with the extra smaller bottles that Boscov's is offering right now. And you need to have a purse size with you, because it's not long lasting, as others have noted, so spray away!
I find this to be fruity but NOT singularly, and not run of the mill. It's not a typical scent in any way...understated but unique. If you appreciate soft, delicate fragrances, I recommend Down Town!

Just tried this yesterday in a department store and hadn't heard of it's release before. I just happened to see it, along with some other new perfumes, at the end of some of the perfume shelves, and not because the bottle is particularly eye catching or pretty ... it's really not!

The perfume is just OK ... a fairly bland, generic fruity / floral and I'd have thought it might be a bit more interesting and perhaps sexy. I can't even remember if I sprayed any on my arm (I tested several perfumes, as usual when I'm browsing perfume departments!) but if I did it didn't stand out from the others in any way. I did test it on a Down Town perfume card though and although it's pleasant enough I suppose, there's something about it that I find slightly annoying ... I have no clue what it is but I'm not crazy about it to say the least! Oh, actually (just checking the perfume notes above!) it may be the Tunisian Neroli and the incense ... yuck!

Unlike a couple of other reviewers, it doesn't remind me at all of Champs Elysees or CK One Shock, which are both much nicer perfumes in my opinion. Champs Elysees is much more classy, elegant and expensive smelling and CK One Shock is much more gourmand, sassy and likeable. What Down Town does remind me of though is some of the Paris Hilton perfumes ... generic, fruity perfumes that smell kind of cheap, like fruity body sprays!

As for the commercial for Down Town ... Rooney Mara is an odd choice for such an underwhelming, relatively bland, generic perfume! She's quite edgy and a bit quirky I think and this perfume is neither of those things! I'd have thought someone like Katie Holmes or Reese Witherspoon would be more suitable 'representatives' for a perfume like this.

Overall, Down Town is just an overpiced, OK'ish perfume in a dull bottle with a designer name plastered on it. I'll definitely give it a miss!

ANOTHER farty white flower, mixed with something sweet, scent...

Feels like I have smelled this like a thousand times before.

But hey, at least they left out the todays standard patchouli this time!
I love it! What I would like however is fir it to last longer. It is also a bit priceyconsidering its staying power.

Downtown starts as a sweeter floral with the pear, plum, and neroli. Within minutes, the violet leaf, incense, and musk melange join the party. It is such a pleasant sweet floral fragrance! The lemon and bergamot well add to the freshness of this perfume.

I find Downtown a lovely aura scent, in that it is not made for the nose pressed directly on the skin. When I sniff on the point of spray, there is something odd and bitter underneath that can be described as slightly herby or spicy. This may be from the musk, incense, and peony fruits.

Overall, it is a light, sweet, and pleasant fragrance. It's noticed more easily in the closer range, so when my friend wears it, I take an extended sniff during our hugs. :) Downtown definitely has longevity, however, it is a bit lacking in the projection department.
Dull bottle, dull perfume, just dull, dull, dull.
Tested this today. I think it is boring, does not develop much on the skin. It smells synthetic and cheap in my opinion, like plastic doll-head. Disappointed :(

I really would like to be able to wear Calvin Kleins perfumes, there is no one of them that suites me. When I got a sample of this one I got happy and tought that maybe....maybe will I be able to wear this, but no.

It´s a sweet floral fragrance, the longevity is poor, the smell is nothing exeptional it´s a rather plain scent. When it faded away I could not remember what it was like.

Well I for one liked it and got the rollerball, as the store doesn't have the regular size bottles yet. I thought it smelled urban and modern, just like the description. Not your usual old-lady floral.

Ugh! Biggest letdown of 2013 for me! I was so excited that this CK release was being compared to Euphoria. Euphoria was unique, strong, quality! Downtown is generic, weak and cheap! Its not gross by any means, its pretty...but its a very watered down, standard fruity floral. This could have been great...so so sad.
This one has left no impression on me. Not a good one, not a bad one either. Like I've already forgotten trying it. It is so unremarkable. Such a pitty for Calvin Klein!
What a dud! I can't imagine how they went forward with this...there is nothing to it. Drip, drip, drip......

I like Downtown. I don't love it.
The opening is a citrus burst, which I am not too keen on, but then comes this cloud of sweetness with a hint of spice. I can't smell plum and pear, I just smell candy floss sweetness with a hint of cracked pepper and incense. This is the part of the fragrance I really quite enjoy. I have to admit that I keep sniffing my wrists, it is kind of addictive. Unfortunately the longevity is pretty weak.

I expected something edgy, modern and feminine. All I got was a light fruity floral, totally forgetable with no sillage what so ever. The bottle does not appeal to me either. It is just plain. What a letdown
Just tryed it on. Smells like 212 VIP. Fine bottle.

I really like this, almost love it. I suppose it might be because, for some reason, this incense note is very prominent on my skin, which makes it lovely and spicy as well as fresh, and less dull than some people have said.
Sweet and femenine, a less classy version of Champs Elysees. Wearable, young, but not edgy, as the name might suggest.

Smells ok if you like overpriced body spray. I've smelled this scent a number of times in much cheaper forms. Don't waste your money on this when you can get a cheaper version that lasts longer for a couple bucks.

Very disappointing, generic, synthetic scent. Not offensive, but very little longevity, just a topnote of citrus and deep plum. This smelled very plasticky and synthetic, like it was mixed up in a test tube and some fake smelling chemical stabilizer jumped in and took over the scent profile. The drydown becomes more plummy but softer so that after 3 hours it isn't bad at all, but then it fades so quickly after that it's rather sad.

For me Downtown is first fresh, I can smell lemon easily, also pear`s sweetness comes out. Middle notes gardenia is only one what I smell. Incense is one of my favorite notes and you really can smell that last. Longevity is moderate. It`s nice every day fragrance. Not my favorites, but not bad at all.

Poor longevity and no sillage imho. Smells so reminiscent of just about everything else being shoved on girls nowadays that it couldn't be recognized in a blind test. Reminded me of Vera Wang and DKNY's multiple releases that all smell vaguely the same...fruity/floral/spicy and weak.

this one kind of remind me my grandma's kitchen spices cabenet, I can smell some spicy note there, I could say that this one is less stinky, Obseesion and euphriao, and most Calvin's smell terrible , like old lady. not a fan of his. sorry.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Oh my god, why does this brand of perfume not last long?

This is probably my favorite scent in the CK house. It smells so refreshing. Every time I get out of the shower, I spray it on myself like crazy and inhale it like I'm inhaling coke. Haha. I love how good it smells, but I hate how quickly it fades.

7.5/10

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Citrusy, fresh and not too complex. Has the personality of a person that gets along with everyone. Had sprayed it on my skin to test and was immediately in love. The scent got better and better after a few hours. I bought a bottle a few months later.

The black band on the bottle makes me giggle. Because it's CK. They make inner-wears. And they put their signature inner-wear band on the bottle. Simple but fun.

Everyone really would have been my every day perfume but it doesn't last that long . Maybe I'll try another batch soon.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
C.K. Everyone EDP (2022)

On paper, the citrus really sticks out here; however on skin it’s the vetiver and tea that take most of the focus. Soft, slightly fruity, subtle, comforting. Perfect for an office or school setting, as well as lounging or bedtime. Longevity is slightly above average, and projection is pretty good.

Scent wise, this fragrance is definitely at the top of my list of favorites in the entire CK One line (along with Ck One Summer 2010 and Ck One Essence 2024).

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
I've blind bought this fragrance around 2024 and I have to say it's a safe blind buy and very suitable for office/school setting because of it's inoffensive and fresh smell. Whenever I smell it, it has this uplifting and stress relieving feeling that I get and the smell is also nostalgic, prolly because I used it in our trip to Japan around a year ago. With that said, the downside is that, it's performance is not the greatest.. It's inconsistent, sometimes it's short lived, sometimes it's long lasting. And another is, my skin reacts badly especially when I apply it in my neck areas. This prolly might be me since I also get irritation when using certain skin care products containing lemon.

Anyways,

Performance: 4/10
Scent: 10/10
Versatility: 7/10

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: This actually smells very nice. Fresh comforting easy to wear scent that I got on discount at Ross. Huge 200 ml bottle for like twenty bucks. This is a fresh linen citrusy office friendly fragrance that anyone can wear. I little more creamy than the Ck Everyone edt. Really enjoy this one. Don’t believe the haters. Try it for yourself.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: It's an ok fragrance. The opening is very green, sort of like leaves and grass after rain. After the citrus kicks in, it develops into fresh lemongrass on my skin. This perfume is nothing challenging - a simple, green citrus scent, slightly masculine leaning in my opinion, but still very versatile. It's the longevity that's the problem - it seemed to evaporate from my skin within an hour tops, so I see no point in buying it again (especially since there's so many more interesing fragrances available on the market).

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: The fragrance offers a more pronounced freshie character, reminiscent of the crisp and invigorating tea notes found in Azzaro Chrome United. This deeper interpretation brings out a blend of vibrant, refreshing elements that evoke a sense of vitality and clarity, while still capturing the original essence of a fresh, clean scent profile.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Nice fragrance.... More of a ripe sweet orange than a fresh one.... Lil bit of tea.....

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: 큰 기대를 하지 마세요. 흔하디 흔한 저렴한 샴푸의 향기가 납니다. 초반의 감귤류 향기만 좀 괜찮습니다. 지속력은 정말 나쁩니다.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Doesn’t smell good. It’s just the black tea smell and it doesn’t last very long. 3/10

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Very good.
I honestly really like this, it smells very pleasent and super easy to like and wear i think its great for the spring and summer, bright orange with some clean undertone vetiver, i think it deservess a higher rating but ofc fragrances are subjective and different on and to everyone. smells really really nice and doesnt smell cheap to me at all.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
My first fragrance and has a nostalgic feel for me, scent profile isn’t anything special but is quite nice, it’s simply a fresh tea fragrance with below average performance especially for an “Eau De Parfum”, better alternatives for cheaper than $50, notes are: sweet ripe orange which has a almost orange peel zest vibe, fresh green tea accord and a fresh spicy but dry vetiver base,
Longevity 3 hrs
Projection 3.5/10
Scent 5.5/10
Season: summer, spring,

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: At first It seemed very strange, but then something daring and sexy appeared in It and I liked. I was very surprised and glad that there are only three notes - it is not overloaded like many perfumes and still works perfectly and multifaceted. Definitely worth the price.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Haters gonna hate… I find this perfume to be one of the easiest going fragrances that I’ve ever owned. It’s versatile, inoffensive, light and it has medium longevity and sillage. It works very well all year around, but it feels a bit misplaced and odd in the dark and cold december nights. It would still be more than wearable even with Santa knocking on the door, but it would just feel a bit misplaced.
That’s the thing with Calvin Klein’s “Everyone”, and lots of other CK offerings, they are so so easy to pull off!
There’s not ONE single occasion where this fragrance would be outright horrible or weird. Even in freezing temperatures this smells decent, but just out of season.

I have several fragrances that outperforms CK Everyone, but one is superior for Christmas only, some for fall and winter, yet others for date nights and romantic events, and then you have the fresh and good citruses, but they are to intense, or contains certain notes that makes them inappropriate for office, dinner at your father in law or whatnot.
Because of this, I’d classify CK Everyone as a very easily wearable fragrance and for that reason alone I’ve ran halfway through a 100ml bottle in just 6 months. I reach for it on a regular basis and with good reason.

So, as I sad, haters gonna hate. This fragrance is not out of this world in any sense, but it’s a great dumb reach for 7 out of 10 occasions. To me I find myself in love with several of my fragrances, but still this one is the only bottle I got with a dent that grows in a pace where you can actually notice changes from one week to another.

It’s not at the level of Nishane Ani, the love of my life, nor is it as beautifully delicate as Dior Homme Intense or as fluffy and clean as JHAG Anyways. Still it’s the one whom I have to repurchase most frequently. That’s alone says a lot!

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Very light. Initially, it seemed somewhat fresh and good 🌬️, but after an hour, I started to get a very boring cucumber scent 🥒 that lingered until the fragrance faded. It felt linear with no significant change or development in the scent. You could say it’s aquatic and leans towards the unisex side, but it’s boring and not distinctive at all. It feels more like it would suit a room freshener spray rather than a personal fragrance. 🚫💧

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
It starts of fruity and slightly green and then turns a bit more dark less fruity and more green.
Its soft with soft performance quite close to the skin so needs a bit more sprays ids say 5-8 ussualy.
Great spring scent very inoffesinve easy to like and wear!

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
First impressions: green, fresh, grassy and citrusy but not in a super masculine way, very soft and nice. Fresh and lovely, im usually not a green perfume person but this smells so cmoforting, i want to cover my room in it.

Eventually it mixed with my body heat and.. altough i clearly can sense that typical deo scent that all cK products have, its not overbearing within this one. Just a hint of i just showered and ive been to the gym type of fresh, but mixed with the femininity of sitting in a park drinking a juicebox.
I wish the top notes lasted longer, as the base notes are of that an average cK, but its definetly one of my favorites.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Just got a sample of it, dis thingy smells like soy sauce. I dont like it :D

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Evrytime wearing it i got compliments it's clean smell makes who smell it happy
Buy it ... it's cheap and fresh smell

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: clean citrus and smooth tea fragrance for summer. Terrible performance lasts around 1.5-2.5 hours with bad projection.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
It dry out tho, i cant smell any base note.
But it not cheap enough to "not complain"
So it's mid, not very good but not very bad

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Lol, I remember actually waiting for it to come out because I liked both CK One and EDT Everyone thinking EDP will simply perform better.

It didn't, at least on my skin. Very forgettable, I could only feel citrus and small bit of tea on the opening and then it faded away in a matter of two hours, as if I applied nothing. Ironically, even EDT seemed to perform better on my skin? I only tried EDT at perfume stores, multiple times, but comparing them side by side made me feel like I lean much more towards EDT, which is kinda sad because I waited out for the EDP bottle release thinking it will be EDT on steroids. Shame, but it is what it is.

Also, from the marketing side, very cool branding and campaign built around this line, spot on with what seems to be trending from visual perspective and agenda pushed by it being genderless.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Fresh and soft opening that quickly settles into a scent akin to just coming out of a swimming pool, a LOT of calone on the dry down, I don’t especially appreciate this.

Lasts for at least 5 to 6 hours on my skin, not a lot of projection though, but it's very noticeable up close, good for a daily driver and can be found for dirt cheap.

I reach for it often now in summer, but keep in mind it's not very unisex despite CK's effort, the EDT might be a better alternative.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: To me this kinda smells like cucumber?

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: I tried this on my skin for fun while passing through the fragrance section of a dpt store, and on the way home in the car a few hours later my mum said "omg what is that scent?? It smells so refreshing!" She tried the toilette and said she doesn't like it as much, so it surprised me when the reviews here said it was better. Just bought the parfum yesterday so I'll update this later, but right now I can say its long-lasting (at least on my skin), unisex and green.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Imagine a beautiful summer day, with natural water bodies running, fresh greens around you. It kinda makes you feel you're cool, calm and eased out!

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Sprayed this on, then said "OKAY!" with a big smile.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
My bottle of the EDT was running dry and as more of an EDP man I was quite excited for this. Sad to say I’m disappointed, I expected the base notes (or should I say note) to be more prevalent in the EDP but I didn’t realise it would be an entirely different base. The top-middle notes are where the EDT really shines but you really can’t smell much of the them in this. This is really quite bland.

Honestly I would skip but I’d recommend the EDT, it was a daily for me due to the fairly low price point and versatile scent. It’s suitable for spring, summer even warmer fall days. Most definitely for any gender but I personally think it leans feminine despite the consensus. This on the other hand definitely leans male.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: The warmer the body is, the more projection of the more masculine smells appear. And it smells so much better.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Just imagine a hot summer sunny day and suddenly there’s a downpour ..
the perfume of raindrops mixing with hot earth..
And washed Green grass with exotic flowers n herbs..
this fragrance can teleport you to the most exotic rainforest in one whiff !
It is not just a perfume .. it’s whole set of nostalgia in bottle
Great work by the perfumer !
Not the performance but it’s the experience that counts !

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: I thought this one would be good for me. I like orange, I like Vetiver. But there's something more medicinal than fresh that turns me off. I have several fragrances from Calvin Klein and they range from likes to loves but I just don't find this one an attractive scent.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Don't get the awful reviews it smells very fresh and clean to my nose, however the projection is weak at best and it barely ever lasts
Edit : now that im used to more fragrances i definitely get a soapy vibe after ~5 mins

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
I have ck everyone edp and edt. I can say this two very different. In the basenote, thanks to edp, now i know i really hate the smell of haitian vetiver (i don't know what it is) but this the only ingredient edt doesn't have.

Now i buy another bottle of edt because i love the edt more than edp.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: below average frag. bad performance and smell is like every cheap freshie ive smelled

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: This made me gag. It wasn’t that revolting but it sure made me gag. It reminds me of stagnant water and rotting logs.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Not sure, perhaps there is something wrong with my old “sniffer” because I am not seeing (hating) what most people see here. I find it bright and crisp and fresh with some feeling of a tropical (not sweet) fruity vibe.To me it comes off as definitely unisex, perhaps leaning a bit more towards the guys but can equally be worn by all genders, hence “everyONE”. I find that it smells similar to other CK fragrances which makes it not very unique. But I’d hold off on saying that it’s generic. After reading and hearing all of the feedback about this EDP, I never, ever expected to like it like I do. As I said, maybe it’s by nose. “Everyone’s” (no pun intended) nose is different. It’s all subjective I believe.
Cheers and Peace.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Wet and stale and green, like stagnant pondwater cloaked by a green mantle of algae. A place of warty toads and muck and mist.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Big no from me has that awful seaweed/metallic note that’s in many mens fragrances

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
I can see the Aqua Di Gio comparison with the opening. Very soapy with a hint of citrus. Pleasant and mass-appealing...if a little generic. However after the opening...the scent fades really fast, I can't really detect any base notes at all.

Unfortunately this one is super weak...even by CK standards. Whilst the scent has a great and versatile opening, its dreadful performance makes it redundant. Skip it for sure.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: I'd rather smell nothing than this.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Got this as a free sample sent to me so no clue about the price. Off the top, it does give a similar vibe to Acqua di Gio but that fades within like 30 minutes. I wouldn't go as far as to say it smells like an air freshener but I can see where that comes from. It is a pretty easy-to-wear, dumb reach fragrance that most if not all people will find pleasant but don't expect something complex that will evolve in an interesting manner. The longevity is moderate, I got about 4-5 hours on moisturized skin and ghost smells the day after. But it doesn't really project and sits rather close to the skin. On a positive note, it's not super harsh on the nose, I wouldn't say it smells extremely high quality but it's not crazy synthetic either. Leans masculine but can definitely be unisex or even a tad feminine depending on how it reacts with your skin.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: This one is interesting. It smells like an abstract drawing of something like Acqua did Gio EdP. It's fresh, faintly aquatic, vaguely green or even almost ozonic. It doesn't go far in either of these directions though. It's kind of everything and nothing at the same time. A curious scent yet it doesn't really smell unique. You could do a lot worse than this but no one will be blown out of their minds either. It also doesn't last super long, similarly to the original EdT.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
This literally smells like a Glade air freshener. The EDT also has the same air freshener vibe as a note in the background. But this somehow manages to smell more like an air freshener than an actual air freshener, which would have some additional scent like flowers or vanilla. This is just the ozonic part of an air freshener in condensed form.

I definitely recommend this to people who want to smell like walking air fresheners! I bet this'll do a great job in covering up any trace of how you naturally smell. Which is very ironic for something advertised with individuality and naturalness.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: This is a dumb reach fresh gem. Surprisingly good quality. I don't see how you could hate this one. Contains 77% ingredients from natural origin. Contains responsibly sourced ingredients. Vegan friendly. Uses Naturally derived alcohol. Not your typical blue DNA. Longevity is not a problem because its a bargain. Easily a unisex frag.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: It is an okay scent. Very green and fresh scent. Leans more masculine. Easy to wear.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Am actually a dude,but I feel like wearing it.
The notes are incredibly amazing for a sniff👃

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
I've only tried this once but I liked it, just as with the EDT it wasn't a 'love' at first sniff but I like it. Longevity was surprisingly good on my skin with two quick sprays. I find it paradoxically laughable but sad that CK fragrances get such a bad rap in 'fragcom'. Especially when there are such fine under the radar gems to be had such as Obsessed for men intense EDP and CK2.

For me this one isn't going to rank up alongside the two aforementioned scents and I don't think I'll buy a full bottle but that's mainly because I'm not so into this type of fresh 'green' scent. It's pretty good though and I liked it more the longer I wore it.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
I'm writing this as of 17th January 2022, when this fragrance receives an overall rating of 2.14 out of 5 with 7 votes.

I looked into the fragrance's news page in the comments section and can't help but wonder if the low ratings are actually from the people who did smell this fragrance and truly disliked it, or those who hold things against Calvin Klein fragrances, particularly CK One and its many flankers.

Interesting. As of now, I'm refraining from voting because I haven't smelt it. I have high hopes for it though as tea is one of my favourite notes, and transparent/white fragrances are just my thing.

product_name: CK Everyone Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Just got a sample of this. Fresh and green, and very clean. It reminds me of Lauren by Ralph Lauren. A refreshing unisex light scent. Perfect for everyday use.

product_name: CK IN2U POP for Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Same as aramis life. But this one fails.

product_name: CK IN2U POP for Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Cucumber and mint, nice

product_name: CK IN2U POP for Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
I already commented on this one (see below), but considering the comments that came afterwards I would like to point out that I think that this one is underrated.

Remember, boys: a scent has to fit to your environment, and even a synthetic one can be the right decision if it suits the situation. Take a look at the name of this one: "Pop". So, what do you expect? Pop by its very nature is only seldom about authenticity, rather it's about cheap thrills and in this sense synthetic. And that's exactly what this fragrance is about!

****

product_name: CK IN2U POP for Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Strange that a cucumber note can make this a good fragrance, because cucumber is so "no smell". It is a good summer fragrance, good for going to the job or walking on the beach. Staying power not so good tho.

product_name: CK IN2U POP for Him Calvin Klein
review_content: This fragrance is very good. A little spicy, but perfect for the summer nights.

product_name: CK IN2U POP for Him Calvin Klein
review_content: not bad but not special. smells so generic. if you like this kind of smell, try cheaper version like Friends pour homme.

product_name: CK IN2U POP for Him Calvin Klein
review_content: nothing original nothing special starts with a nice fresh green top notes rapidly dries down to linear aquatic notes. below average sillage and longevity. i give it 6 out of 10.

product_name: CK IN2U POP for Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
It smells nice, but as mentioned below, also a bit synthetic. Which means it's really good on days you wear synthetic textiles.

It's the perfect scent for polyesterdays, so to speak...

***

product_name: CK IN2U POP for Him Calvin Klein
review_content: its got a nice scent to it, a lot better than ck be but still a bit synthetic and nothing original

product_name: CK IN2U POP for Him Calvin Klein
review_content: I like this fragrence its good for everyday use but it barely lasts 2 hours on me which is more than dissapointing for the price i payed for it

product_name: CK IN2U POP for Him Calvin Klein
review_content: very similar to the original. the same boring avergae scent that is very short lasting and gets no compliments at all. I would buy a full size of it only for $1!

product_name: CK IN2U POP for Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
A very simple and pleasent woody-muscy fragrance, it reminds you of somthing you have smelld before and im sure thats the concept behind this fragrace, that you like it because you know some notes of the fragrance. Nothing very exiting but as a all day fragrance ok.

06 out of 10 Points

product_name: CK IN2U POP for Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
why make this version?? very similar but in a wrong way to ck Man, wich is an standard-good fragance.

with this new pop, ck go into a plastic fruity base oriented to teens..

My favorite too! I agree, smells like the OG Summer one. I am trying to get the purple wisteria one, & these Ebayers don't know the difference & sent me the 2019 version AFTER I specifically asked....I hate it! Love this one tho!
Bought this as soon as it came out. Bottle lasted 3 whole summers. The best version in my opinion.

Strange
Strange opening, medicinal and white floral

Floral stays put, white as white, not thick, not light, a tad soft bitter mid notes with the flowers.

Rounded fresh white floral

Lasts several hours

If you loved the original fragrance (2005), as I do, you should love this one too. It's really similar. Other flankers are different.
It is a fresh lily of the valley and jasmine scent with a soapy or sunscreen note. It has good sillage. I usually get compliments when I wear it.

This perfume smells horrible, like Vapor Rub

Basically lots of spice mixed in with florals but mostly it smells like spice which makes me sick
Just found this on my hidden box its the best like the original 2005 version
I wish this smelt how the reviews describe it. On my skin it smells like sunscreen or insect repellent. Headache-inducingly overbearing and chemical.
where in South Africa can I buy Eternity Summer 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013. please.

I bought one today at Marshalls on my way home, untested, just because the package was so pretty and it was Calvin Klein. Loved it so much that I specially drove back to store and picked up another bottle. Wonderful scent and, apparently, still available in discount stores.

Update: My mom loved it too and wanted it, so I gave her my bottle.
This is beautiful, romantic and I'd love to have it in my hands. It is a wallflower, but a wallflower can bloom and shine in the right time and place.

Just got this one yesterday! :) On the very first sniff I was like "Okay, not that good..." but along the day, I couldn't stop smelling my wrist. It's sooo good, reminds me my grandma's garden, full of flowers. Fresh is the word for this fragrance. Using it every day now. <3 I'm in love, too bad is limited edition. stocking this at home! If you're lucky to find this babe, buy it and you will not regret! :D
Simply one of the best I ever had !!!!!!

This is my first lily of the valley perfume as a main note & I'm loving it! Very pure, feminine & romantic. The freshest floral scent ever!!! It's mild coz its sorta powdery, nothing sharp. I think this perfume has dimension. I srayed it on my wrist & sniffed- I smell lily of the valley, jasmine & gardenia + musk.

This is limited ed & just like you, I'm one of the luckiest to HAVE this in my perfume collection(IT'S ALREADY APRIL 2012 & LUCKY ME GOT MINE THRU A LOCAL ONLINESHOP).


Will I repurchase? Too bad it's limited edition but if this gonna be permanent, definitely yes!

Yes,I love this!Too bad it's limited edition!I finaly found it in "Parfume World" in the Mall and told my husband it's the only parfume I want and he gave it to me for St Valantine's Day.
The scent is flowery,clean,fresh,all I expect from a perfume.Love it!
I love it,just bought second bottle..if looking for a fresh floral perfume without sweet and sticky notes,found it!!
I have to get it!

My daughter and I have already tasted " Eternity Moment " and " Truth by K.Clein . Both are marvellous : fresh, feminine, pretty .The perfume of real happiness. You are never tiredof them ... Unfortunately, I have never come across " Eternity Summer " yet , but I hope so ...

Honestly, I have never smelled a perfume like this before.

It smells exactly like being in a flower shop or a greenhouse - it's absolutely fantastic. I can only repeat what several reviewers have said before me: I'm normally not a fan of floral scents at all, but this one is spectacular.

It's a very nice floral fragrance. I bought it without smell it before.
I really like it but my boyfriend said I'm smell like spice. I don't know why it turn out that way on my skin. He hates it! I've never worn it since then. LoL

This scent reminds me of walking through a garden in the Summer, as the first note I immediately detect on my skin is floral, violet and lily. In the dry down, however, the scent becomes more powdery, with a soft soapy smell. Very pretty, romantic perfume, and perfect for those hot, summer days!
I love this it is on my want list. I love powdery scents.

Hmm i actually expected something better than this!
I made a blind purchase based on the reviews but It's such a disapointment for me :(
Very synthetic, soapy and powdery

Wow. I'm not crazy about florals lately, but this is with no doubt very well done and outstanding. It smells like a flowershop, or a big bunch of flowers. Hyper-romantic, just look at the bottle, ask yourself whether this is how you want to smell and if the answer is yes, don't think twice and buy it!
I must say the whole Eternity Summer range is exquisite! They are aristocracy among mainstream summer flankers.

A very nice floral, lightweight and soft. It's not a sharp floral nor a soapy Calvin Klein classic, not childish nor cheap smelling. It's rather sweet, very gentle and safe, not too sexy but still fun. It's great for work but I've had it on a few dates and it suited just fine.
Purchased this yesterday. I really love it. This is the best floral scent ever!!! :)
Beautiful summer fragrance. Lilly of the Valley really stands out on my skin. Sadly, it did not last on me at all....about three hours tops.

Dear all,

As I've heard lots of good things about this gem from you guys!
I went ahead and got it finally! :)

And I love it so much that I even included it in my "top 3 summer scents video"!

I'm gonna get another bottle just in case if the 2012 version is not as good as this one! XD

Thank you guys! You guys rock!:)

P.S. Oh, here's the video code for my video review on YouTube if you're curious, and pardon me for my poor English XD:

v=k5PyLrAP7Tk

xoxoFiFi.

lovely..great im looking full floral in medium delicate smell & the best is long last effect..
i can smell lily of valley top note & remind me into a floral garden will bring fresh mood,soft,feminine..yet elegant..oohh all the best word for you..

My boyfriend picked this up for me at duty free the other day. It is exactly that kind of fragrance: an impulse buy that's kind of rewarding, rather than something you'd seek out. A seasonal flanker, in other words!

The smell is somewhere in the middle of the continuum of Lovely to Boring - it's inoffensively pleasant; ie I can't imagine that someone would hate this.

I'm looking forward to wearing it on those hot, hot Spanish nights, where it's still 30 degrees at 2am and you just need to smell something fresh, soft and pretty...

In my opinion....Smell like a lighter version of Flower by Kenzo
Love it!

A very pretty, fresh and light fragrance for Summer. Very different from the original Eternity. Floral but nicely blended and not at all heavy with a very slight hint of musk in the base. Makes me feel really feminine and Summery! Good staying power too.

Really nice!Fresh,feminine and romantic.It is indeed an Eternity,a lighter interpretation of the original,I'd say.I also love the clean feeling it gives making perfect for hotter weather.The lasting power is quite good,I can still smell it after four hours.Everybody in the family agreed that it is perfect for those who like inoffensive,soft yet elegant fragrances.A really pleasant surprise,especially after last year's awful summer edition!

I'm not a fan of Calvin Klein, but Eternity Summer is a pleasant surprize. The only thing I can smell in this is violet. "Summer" is a gentle, creamy perfume and as soft as the first star coming out at twilight. This is too feminine for the office but would be great for a summer wedding, moonlit walk on the beach, or an afternoon stroll through a garden(don't forget your parasol!).

I was fortunate enough to stumble upon this fragrance recently, which was a limited edition flanker of Eternity, released more than 7 years ago. I own the original Eternity, and while I like its crisp, white freshness, it's nice to experience different takes on such a popular scent through its flankers.

Eternity Love is a very 'pink' fruity floral. It's not an overly unique composition, it's something that is easily in comparison to other fragrances, however it has a prettiness that I can't deny.

It opens with juicy orange, pink lotus and magnolia. At first it smelt a little bit like Lanvin's Rumeur 2 Rose, which I own in a shower gel. It has that clean fruitiness that is ever so present in shampoos and bath products. I found it quite uninspiring.

However, once settled, Eternity Love becomes more floral and sweet. The rose and peony stand out a lot, making this fragrance quite rosy and pleasantly tarty. At times it smells like a bouquet of pretty and delicate blooms. Very romantic and feminine.

Unfortunately this fragrance is extremely light and airy. It became almost non-existant on my skin which soaked it up in seconds. The lasting strength isn't particularly great either, just managing to last four hours. For the sake of this fragrance being rare, Eternity Love still has me captivated, however it's not something that has me overly thrilled. I would most likely recommend this fragrance for wear in Spring and Summer.

Nothing to write home about. For me it's not memorable, just a very mediocre fragrance, like a million other florals that I just would not find necessary to rave about. Well I still would not completely slam-dunk it. It's OK if you like ordinary.

CK ETERNITY LOVE is one of a plethora of flankers to the classic CK ETERNITY. I'm somewhat surprised at precisely how indistinct this composition is, given that Calvin Klein frags tend not to smell like anything but themselves!

ETERNITY LOVE edp is a gentle fruity floral which is neither too sweet nor too floral. The fruits and the flowers do not stand out as individual notes to my nose. ETERNITY LOVE smells nothing like ETERNITY, but it does smell a lot like many other frags. This is an inoffensive and even pleasant bouquet to be sure, but since I find it similar to about a dozen other fruity florals, I'll not make any effort to procure more.

ETERNITY LOVE has low sillage and is remarkably evanescent compared to its namesake, which is aptly named, for it does indeed last a veritable eternity. Perhaps this is a cynical statement about the mercurial quality of love?

a classic Celvin Klein perfume, combines the sweet flower notes with the freshness of the clementines and lily of the valey flower.is a fragrance for playfull persons as well as for the serious ones. the perfect day perfume.
Judging by the notes, I really thought I would love this. But it smells like a dentist's office to me. Weird.

My review differs a little from the previous reviews. I really like this perfume.... I find it more masculine than feminine even though it is unisex, on my skin (feminine) it has an evolution very similar to a "" male” and I have to say that I find it fantastic.... different from the usual perfumes I wear (sometimes too feminine). It gives me the sensation of a fresh, aromatic fougere aftershave.... I can't wait to let my husband try it to hear what he thinks, seen from a male perspective... I wear it to feel fresh and invigorated, as if I had just finished taking a shower, in short it makes me feel really good! I think I'll buy it again, I'll stock up on it, my androgynous side makes itself felt thanks to this delicious summer perfume, the only flaw if we want the duration, it doesn't last on me for more than 3-4 hours... too bad, it means that I will spray it several times throughout the day, its hint of lime pepper and maybe a light cucumber are wonderful as far as I'm concerned.

This has a sharp opening that quickly vanishes and turns into a fresh cucumber smell with just a hint of spice from the pepper and ginger. I find that it's too masculine smelling on my skin, but it works much better on my mom so it is now in her dresser.
Don't understand the hate on this one? Year round CK banger,...I'd bathe in this if I could!

Yeah, I love my niche and high-end designer perfumers and generally have trouble finding designer scents that appeal to me these days...especially these citrus, aromatic, aquatics types. But damn I love the CK One Summer flankers because they are fun, cheap, bring a smile to my face, and a dumb reach on those hot Summer days. I buy the latest and greatest bottle each and every Summer.

Sadly, 2017 is the ONLY CK One Summer flanker that I did not like. Basically, I detect sour cucumbers when this one hits my skin...no fun...no refreshing blasts of citrus, no aromatic or aquatic tones...just shame and stench. Sad, but true!

In a nutshell, there are plenty of really great CK One Summer flankers out there...this isn't one of them. Cheers!

I work full time, 12 (more like 15+) hour shifts as an RN (registered nurse). I wear scents that smell clean, fresh, and feminine, but nothing too floral or sweet as it turns my patients’ stomachs.

CK One Summer (‘17) is perfect for work. As it settles, it has that CK base of musk and a slight woody note, but in this version, it’s soft and blends nicely with the other notes to keep it fresh and summery. I never overdo it - just enough to smell clean.

Longevity - I can still smell remnants of it at the end of my shifts. Sillage is not as long lasting but my patients comment on it when I’m close completing my assessments. They like it - none have ever shared it makes them nauseated as what I first wore when I started as a new grad and wore strong sweet florals. I think it because it’s close to what clean linens would smell like after they’ve been on the clothesline by a salty ocean.

I can see this being a good one to spray on when it’s just skin-to-skin, right before an intimate moment, because it’s so clean but it’s got that wood-musk base. I’ll let you know if I ever find a date - lol - I think maybe I’m working too much but I digress 😁

It makes me die of laughter. It seems to scream "cucumber" from all sides. Cucumber covering all other notes, maybe only the file manages to re-emerge. If it was a person, this scent would be just a clumsy clown that makes jokes and games with cucumbers (believe me, I'm bursting out laughing while I write it.) Where is the saffron? Where is the pepper?
I do not know, but if something makes me laugh it's because I like it (its meaning but not the fragrance) then promoted but rejected.

This one is really cloying and I bought it before I knew much about fragrances. It is very sweet with a peppery background which makes it very shallow. I paid way too much for it and will never wear it again.

These types of perfumes are all great for countries that have long dry summers. Wear it here in the UK and you are likely to get a headache. This is what a wet and cool summer does to you. Wear it in Greece on the other hand and you´ll feel revitalized, clean, sexy and ready to rock!

I love Ck One and it's flankers, but this one smells very unpleasant on my skin. I just smell pepper and a little bit of cucumber. I like using unisex or even male fragrances, but due to the harsh pepper note I find this fragrance super masculine.

The bottle looks awesome though and longevity is really good. I wanted to get rid of the smell and washed my wrist with soap and could still smell the pepper!

I am looking forward to Ck One Summer 2018. Hopefully it is something coconutty!

I got it this by my dear friend yesterday.

Citrusy in a bottle :)
It's fresh, casual everyday, summer scent.

Main composition is citrus, lime and lemon, its linear and stays that way. The whole character of this fragrance is citrusy. You get very synthetic lemony lime vibe.
Cucumber is not existent, maybe the first 2 minutes at the beginning, but than completely gone. There is not even a slight resemblance to Polo Blue or Eternity Aqua, None!

I find it very, Very similar to Tommy Hilfiger Jeans for him.
The longevity and sillage is medium to soft.
I like it for everyday summer use and the bottle is great, sunny rays across.
I quite like it, the most masculine of all editions I can think of, very strong in the cucumber department, fair longevity, not much sweetness, but nice.

I purchased the 2017 edition of the ck One summer edition for myself but more so for my girlfriend. I wore it a few times before giving it to her formally since I have too many. I'll leave this in my collection because it is at her apartment. This is my longer form review after she has used it as well.

I get a peppery unisex Ralph Lauren Polo Blue/Calvin Klein Eternity Aqua for Men with this. Lots of cucumber and pepper in this but not much else at all. That said, those are notes I do like. I think it is a bit better on women than men honestly, especially with the pricing. Women wear it bit better, especially my girlfriend. It is good while it lasts about 4/5 hours tops similar to most accounts of the modern Polo Blue and maybe CK Eternity Aqua for Men if you can't carry it. This is man or women and it is a light summer scent. If you want a more peppery take on Eternity Aqua (for Men) go with CK One Summer 2017 men. Ladies, go with this for a summer option that isn't overtly tropical or overly sweet.

Other than the length, I think the main issue is the retail pricing. I got it for less than half of Kohl's $54USD for 100 ml and honestly, I wouldn't pay much more than $30USD for it. Now I think I've seen it in Ross now for a bit less. I say this as the CK One Summer scents often have similar box designs so I wasn't sure but my girlfriend thinks it was. Whatever CK One Summer scents I saw in Ross were $19.99 USD for 100 ml. So if this box design is what you see, get it for that price and don't think twice.

Rating wise, I can't give it good for men, maybe 6.8 out of 10 for a bit common scent. Especially considering Calvin Klein has Eternity Aqua for men for a lower price. I do like it though. For women, I think a 7.5 is in order as to me it seems a bit more unique though not strong performing. It smells great on my girlfriend but just OK on me due to the obvious similar scents.
Very manly, soft spicy scent, fresh, summery, relaxing. I like it but I prefer scents with a drop of sweetness.
This smells like my boyfriend who just got off his motorcycle in college. Outside. Ozonic is a perfect description of this. A HARD "no" from me.

Meh, when did this line become so synthetic? I know, someone might say “since forever!” but it seems to me it used to be a kinder, friendlier synthetic. I still have some of 2011 left, and it smells as it’s supposed to, whereas in 2016, and now 2017, some harsh chemical dominates so completely as to make notes irrelevant. 2016 smelled 95% like window cleaner and 5% like juniper, and this one is the same, except the 5% is cucumber. Too bad, because it’s a lovely cucumber, and the bottle is gorgeous.

Still, if you liked 2016 (and don’t hate cucumber), you might enjoy this one as well.

This is already hitting the shelves at discount stores in the US. Picked up mine for $19.99 at Ross. Similar to the 2015 version, but not as syrupy sweet. I'm not getting the cucumber or "pepper trio" accord at all though. First spray actually reminded me more or Dior Homme Sport 2012. Big blast of citrus and what feels like ginger to me, but maybe that's the saffron and pepper. Thr Dior-ness fades away pretty quickly, leaving your skin smelling like a boat drink. That isn't necessarily a bad thing :)

It's as non-offensive as all the others and slightly more versatile than previous years. If you can't find it at a heavy discount yet, give it 30 days or so. By July of last year, Kohl's had already marked down the 2016 version to about $13.

I have 3 other CK One Summer editions and I always bought them blindly with high hopes for freshness. Every one of them was an uncomfortable sour citrus bomb. The other day I was at my local perfume store and I saw that the 2017 edition was out. I smelled it, but didn't hold any hopes. And surprise, this one actually smelled nice. I bought it and I hope my first impression was on the right track.

Forget any of the poor reviews on this cologne, to me, this is one of the best CK One colognes in a while. Its super fresh, and a great summer cologne. If I had to try and explain how this cologne smells, think Acqua Di Gio and Ck Crave.. If they had a baby, this is what it would smell like. Granted it's not the most potent cologne I own, but it out preforms some of the more expensive colognes I have too.. This frag really shines when it gets stuck in your clothes, and it stays there for at least for a couple of days. I've gotten tons of compliments with this one..

Had it for over a week, and the added pepper/ginger notes make it a win for me. It opens with a lime fresh citrus, then settles into a creamy spicy fresh scent with a longevity that you don't usually get with CK One Summer flankers. The fragrance is going into my spring/summer rotation, and I'm really looking forward to the hot summer nights where I anticipate it being very lovely indeed.

Sprayed this on in the Department Store walked into another store and 2 ladies working there both complemented me on my fragrance both asking what I was wearing. They said I smelled so fresh and clean. What more can I say but I totally agree. Fantastic for the summertime.
I don't understand all the hate. It's not a special scent but I like the way it smells on my wrist. Very fresh, a great inoffensive daytime fragrance.

Agreed. the bottle is pretty nice contrast with the blue & orange..but the scent itself, deff. not pleasing to the nose like previous years.. this has a smell reminiscent of cleaning products.. 2013 is still prob one of my favs

Tried this one at Macy's today. I'm not impressed with this one at all. The bottle is pretty but not as appealing as previous years.
As far as the scent goes its very light, lemony, a tiny hint of pepper and best described as sweet glass cleaner.
I loved last year's Ck one summer but this one I wouldn't recommend.

Wow this is a perfect clone of Aventus,
ok i was just kidding, they share no
similarity whatsoever this one does not
smell very strong, im not sure i like
it, ck eternity summer was way better,
but not to bad either, just cant feel anything fresh in
this supposed to be summer scent, at least
its different than the other ck summer flankers.

I have it and I have to say pepper notes are really strong. At the moment I can't truly appreciate this because it's freezing outside but I'm hopping that the sun will do wonders for this fragrance. Fingers crossed for refreshing notes and woody accord!
Also, I say it's more on the masculine side, my boyfriend says it's feminine and that he wouldn't wear it. :) Anyway, I guess I just have to wait and see if this unisex creation has the power to counteract scorching summer sun...
Sorry, I hate cucumber
Looks like nothing new, Cucumber was also in the notes of the 2012 and 2013 versions
Ohh, cucumber! I miss this perfume accord and I hope it will be good. Definitely want to try!

The bottle looks alright and the notes look good, nothing initally that would make me turn my nose at it but then I see the note of cucumber. Cucumber was the note of the time back in the early to mid 2000s, with Aqua Eternity and Ralph Lauren Polo Blue. Hopefully this won't be a watered down clone of those two. This is a "summer" scent so I expect the emphasis to be on the top notes. Today is January 31st 2017 and the summer flankers are already here; I am not surprised.
Notes seem interesting.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I blind bought this having really high expectations. I love a good fresh coconut scent which I thought this was gonna be since its being compared to JPG le beau and others. Its not bad but its definitely not your typical coconut freshie. As some one else mentioned there's a liquorice type of scent in the background which I'm not that fond of. It's a lot sweeter than CK aromatic essence and not at all alike. Still it's a good and rather unique scent for summer if you don't wanna smell like everyone else with their JPG.
I'm going to try another coconut scent perfume and if that doesn't do it for me then either a dupe of jpg le beau or Ill just stick to a straight up coconut scent. This scent is pretty close to Lattafas badee al oud honor and glory but lattafas is much better in my opinion.

In conclusion it's an okay scent, a little overpriced because you now that CK frags don't last that long. It's best at its dry down which becomes a skin scent only . At least it wasn't a total failure.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells wonderful ,sweet coconut candy with a vanilla twist

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This is an underrated, feel good masterpiece! SUPER TROPICAL!🏝

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I bought this thinking the coconut note and CK Eternity formula might blend in perfectly together but it does not. I’m not letting this macerate for any amount of time to get more well rounded like the previous reviewer did. Let it macerate in the sink is what I’m gonna do ‘cause this is sink drain worthy to me and God knows I love CK Eternity so it pains me to say this. Tried to hand it down to my son, wouldn’t take it. Offered him money if he took it. Still wouldn’t take it. Smells grandpa-ish to me. Hey. What else can I say.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I feel like you have to let this one macerate, as I found out after letting it sit for a about year it's gotten alot more well rounded and smoother not that it was bad when I first got it though.
It's a gorgeous powdery tonka bean and coconut scent with subtle sweetness from the vanilla, it's great for most seasons in my opinion.
The performance is not terrible, I get moderate to good longevity and projection but I'm also an over sprayer.
Eternity Now is a love for me.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
this one was really good actually. this is how vanilla and coconut is done. thanks to patchouli and ginger you could wear this even during hot days.
a good one!
7/10

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Applies fresh blue with nice depth that’s appealing, if generic.

Milky coconut builds up mid with mild cedar adding tasteful dryness. Star fruit brings unique sweetness. Ultimately uses coconut in the way fragrances use wood, which is curious and impressive.

Well balanced musky coconut, supported by wood/faint patchouli, and sweetness. Not getting vanilla (which is good). Spicy tonka bean takes a while to build in dry-down, countering coconut well.

Fine to try, but didn’t click.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
CK Eternity Now, This was the fragrance that started my journey. It is sweet and very likeable, only if it lasted longer it could be an amazing scent but unfortunately it lasts like an hour max. The projection is very weak. It is worth the buy if you can find it; you just have to respray a lot to make it worth it. Price-wise, it is really affordable so that means buying a big bottle if you like this stuff because it won't last.

Scent: 8.5/10 Summer time scent Well blended Poor longevity.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: this is really good stuff except the projection is weak. having the dominant coconut would make you think it's for summer, but it's a very warm comforting coconut (think malibu rum in hot chocolate), and the vanilla and tonka in this really make me push this to being for fall and winter. enjoy!

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Opening is pretty standard fresh spicy. A coconut accord in the background, which smells more like some sort of essence of the smell of coconut rather than a smooth creamy pina colada coconut. Drying down to a salty aquatic musky, almost aldehydic note. A little bit of synthetic "arabic" woodiness, which develops more as time goes on, but it's not that bad. Smells a little bit fruity too, a general fruity tropical note but there's like a "nail polish remover" cherry note there too. It's alright. I imagine it's pretty nice in summer.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Perfect for the beach on a warm breezy day...

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Good tropical coconut with vanilla, smooth on my skin not offensive, can be worn in cold weather but works best in warm, cheap and unisex beach fragrance.
Overall underrated cheapie.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Gives le Beau a run for the money! Best not to be wearin' this in any situation where you want to be taken seriously, this is not a commanding scent but a calming coconut.

They even changed the Eternity bottle for this one and this one only, with a rather unfortunate cheap-feeling plastic cap instead of the ready-to-spray classic open trigger.

Side note: This fragrance was used as a part of a pop art exhibit in 2015 - Sylvie Fleury created a large green neon sign "ETERNITY NOW" in the brand's font and everything, to sit atop the Bass Art Museum in Miami. Simple and effective, she claimed it was to evoke the feeling of the two words and not much to do as a promotion of the company. Kind of like Andy Warhol's Campbell's Tomato soup can. You gotta look it up to see what I mean.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Not good for people in warmer climates the fragrance gets more sweet. It’s got a delicious smell no doubt but isn’t woman pleasing if that’s your intention. This could be a hobby scent

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I love the smell of this one! Very sweet scent, and a very budget-friendly fragrance overall. Unfortunately, it seems like the quality of the atomizer is very bad. It broke very easily on the bottle I have, and now it just squirts out the fragrance instead of a mist. Because of this, it's very difficult to judge some things of it.

Sadly it seems like the fragrance is discontinued, since I don't really see it being sold anywhere anymore. I might be wrong on this one, not 100% sure.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I really like the character of the fragrance but am sad it’s so faint on some wearings.
But I am always wishing I’d find a great coconut scent and I usually only like them in theory. This has a great blend of the sweetness, the wood and the spice. No one component is overpowering.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Too sweet and I don't really smell the coco . I mix it with D by Diesel

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: My boyfriend wears this, and it must work really well with this skin chemistry because I cannot get enough of it. I love it when he wears it

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
This fragrance is a definite like for me. I get vanilla, fruit and sweetness. I don’t get much coconut out of this myself. It’s a decent casual scent. I could imagine it being a little too sweet for some people. It is a little too sweet for my personality and taste. However, I do enjoy this and will probably use up the bottle but I can’t imagine buying it again.
_______________________________________________

Update April 9, 2023:

Unfortunately I’ve come to dislike this over time. I think it is just a bit too sweet and synthetic for me. I can see how someone might like this and part of me likes this. I’ll be giving away my bottle.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Excellent tropical with a vanilla twist. Oh my goodness, this is good!

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Much more summer edition scent than the Eternity Summer series.

Coconut and vanilla scent.
I do detect a slight saltiness on my skin and
The aqua note is not voted, but to me it smells like the ocean.
At the base, Eternity for Men is clearly there, and it hasn't strayed from the series.

Like watching distant iridescent clouds on the beach on holiday in a sunny summer. An optimistic scent, I don't think about work at all, all I hear is the warm sun and the sound of the waves.

The scent of unpretentious freedom. Recommended for holidays when you don't want to do anything.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells like Tahitian Treat

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: As previously mentioned... this is perfect for a day / night at the beach.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
My uncle had this years back and I was looking for something cheap, versatile and handsome. I thought of this and bought it at Walmart for 30 bucks. This is heavily slept on, I believe it’s discontinued but you can find it easily.

It smells oriental, coconut, mango, vanilla and it has that balsamic vibe. Very pleasant smell, leaning on the masculine side. Very versatile, too weak for winter. Great quality for a cheapie. Solid fragrance, no compliments but I guarantee you’ll smell pleasant

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I like to wear this fragrance when I go to the beach in the afternoon, it has a pleasant smell and the coconut note gives it a fruity vanilla tropical vibe that is so befitting for the beach .
