It is quite different to any of the other fragrances I have in my collection. The picture I get when I smell this fragrance is: "relaxing with a Malibu & Pineapple in a sunny afternoon by the beach".
Lovely and different.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: From what I can smell is it just smells like an unripe mango with a vanilla and coconut hint. If I had to rate it out of ten I would say a solid 8.5/10.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Delicious sweet tropical fruiet juice with coconut...if they served this in a glass with brunch i would drink it all up and ask for more. Summer here I come.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Late to the game, I got this recently on a pretty good deal: $25 for 100ml, which turns out to be just fair.

It's a very smooth and enjoyable scent all the way through from the very opening. Tonka, vanilla, coconut is the overall theme with ginger, cedar and patchouli around the edges. I'm not sure I can tell there's star fruit in here, but there's a sort of freshness that tames this otherwise crazy sweet scent along with the help of cedar both in the heart and in the base. I think it's safe to say that the scent itself doesn't evolve much and stays somewhat linear. Longevity and sillage are only slightly better than your average CK due to the amped up sweet notes that push out.

This is by no means a formal scent--this is the kind you put on when you're going out for a brunch or meeting friends for a drink. I'd categorize this as a cool-weather scent, so pretty much good to wear anytime in the spring and fall, and fine for cooler summer evenings, but I don't necessarily put this on in the dead heat of the summer as I'd imagine the sweetness would overwhelm me, and others around as much as they can smell this.

Lastly, I have to say there's a certain elegance to the ultimately simple bottle presentation. I have a feeling that the round edges mimic the smoothness of the scent itself, and the color of the juice resembles its vibe.

All in all, I think it's a worthwhile buy at the heavily discounted price, but will I buy another bottle? Perhaps; I'll see if I can find something better in the same category when this runs out. Also a side note, my bottle is made in the US.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I buy today made in Spain juice
A new different juice than made in France I have
I prefer the France made edt
Avoid the Spain product

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
This has got to be one of the most puzzling juices I have ever had.

Step 1: Tested on my wrist. I was extremely disappointed to find that the coconut smelled very synthetic: coconut was a major reason why I had wanted this perfume. On the wrist it smelled more and more disgusting with every hour, though I realized that could be because of unintended mixing with other smells.

Step 2: Tested on a piece of cloth. OK at first, nausea-inducing after a while.

Step 3: Wore it in real life conditions, under the arm and around the neck. To my surprise it felt considerably better than in steps 2 and 3. I applied it late morning and went out spending hours outside under conditions that were both humid and rainy. The fragrance held up well under such conditions.

Longevity was weak; at the end of the day it was smelling vaguely like incense.

So after all those tests I still can't figure out whether it was a good frag or not. I am probably more disappointed than pleased with it. I had the chance to get Eternity Flame for cheaper, maybe should have given it a go despite negative reviews.

Within the CK catalogue the Euphoria collection probably suits me more than Eternity, at least based on samples I tried in-store. And for a similar price range I wish I had bought Pepe Jeans Celebrate For Him instead (was too late already when I discovered its availability in my local store).

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I think I don’t like coconut in fragrances, that’s it..

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
It's 3:34am and your weary self just walked into a 24hr donut shop. The donut guy is in the back baking fresh donuts. Ahhhh the aroma of the entire place! Well, that's what you get with CK's Eternity Now. If you like the smell of hot, fresh baked donuts in the morning, then this fragrance is for you.

It smells like vanilla-coconut custard. Not synthetic, not like suntan oil or shampoo or spray.

Excellent value and a rare scent among men's fragrances. You can wear it all years long. The sillage is weak, but not too weak and the longevity is low to moderate. Definitely worth having a bottle.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Personally, I don't think it's that Arabic.

The blurb for this product said it was an 'Oriental' fougère fragrance for men, with exotic woods. I get a rather unique summery creamy coconut-y vibe from it than the 'oriental' whatever they advertised. If this is indeed an 'oriental' fragrance, then it is one that I can somehow tolerate.

What I get is this: a layer of coconut and vanilla over a very strong tonka bean base.

Normally, I'm indifferent to coconut (as a scent - I like to eat them though) and I hate vanilla and tonka beans. HOWEVER, somehow in this fragrance, those notes blend together well enough that I don't mind smelling it. Nevertheless, I would still not be getting a bottle of it - it's just ok for me. I don't mind smelling it on people, and I don't mind wearing the remaining bits of the sample I have left on myself occasionally (if I'm in the mood), but I don't see myself liking it to the extent I'd get a bottle. If I get it as a gift, sure, I'd not mind keeping it, but I won't be spending money on it.

To sum up, if you expect a full-blown 'oriental' fragrance, you'll be sorely disappointed. (I'm glad it didn't smell like that but whatever.) Instead, expect a summery coconut-y creamy fragrance from this one.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This is one of my best recent buys - got a 100 mL bottle for $20, and it smells insanely good. Still a bit of the underlying Eternity woodsy DNA to it, but with coconut and strawberry layered on top. Really nice sweet option for guys

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is a good one! Powdery tropical coconut with liquored starfruit, vanilla and tonka keep it warm and cozy.
Very summery and pleasantly fresh, sticks to the skin and clothes for at least 5hrs.
Definite dupe for Le Beau by JPG, and a respectable 'cousin' of Creed's Virgin Island Water.
Will definitely have this in the summer rotation.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This is one fine fragrance. Soft, smooth a little fruity, and sweet. It smells like moonlight in an Arabian desert. The coconut water and vanilla combination is just very relaxing. I like it

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
This one starts off kind of heavy but smooths out. It is a nice, safe, smooth vanilla/coconut daytime/summertime fragrance.

It's inoffensive and pleasant and something I'd suggest, to wear on the warmer/hotter days, given the fact that it's a smooth, leaning on the lighter side, type of fragrance.

Another thing I should point out, it doesn't last long. You get about 3 hours or so and then it just becomes a skin scent...even if you put it on your clothes.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
15SEP21 (1310)
Just picked this up from Burlington for $21.
Testing it on a napkin now...so far I only smell alcohol alcohol alcohol and some kinda floral notes.
*confused*
Where is the coconut!? I mean, don't get me wrong...this smells very nice...but I'm here for the coconut...lol.
(10 mins later...)
Okay...Definitely smells better after the initial "nuclear-alcohol-blast" spray dries-up some. That made my eyes water...yeesh. Now that it's dried down and the alcohol has mellowed out...I can smell more flavors in this...though none are specifically "Coconut".
(15 mins later...)
Okay, now this smells like what I was expecting...soft, creamy vanilla smelling with a hint of woodiness and a hint of CK-ONE DNA in the background...and I think I can just barely smell a hint of coconut in there. BUT then again, this was a napkin test.
Ah well...I will wear it on skin when I go out tonight and update after I return home...

UPDATE: (0000)
Just getting back in. Applied "NOW" to body and shirt earlier around 1832.
3 shots on chest, one on each side of neck and rear of neck, two on shirt-front.
Left the house smelling like nothing I have ever smelled before...
This fragrance smells AMAZING on skin!! Oh...My...Goodness...
This was the first time that I have loaded up on sprays and my wife did not complain the whole time we were out! No complaints, but also no compliments from anyone...but that could be because she was with me. I'll see how it does in the morning.
The body sprays faded after about 4 hours...around 2200, and the shirt sprays lasted still!! They're STILL smellable (to me) from about a foot away....amazing! Now that I know it lasts longer on my clothes than it does on my skin, I can load up my shirt with it and spray something else that lasts longer on my skin...

16SEP21
Layered this with two shots of "Bentley - Azure" today. I sprayed about 10 shots of "NOW" all over...neck...chest...shirt. And nothing...
Nothing when I went out for breakfast, nothing at work, nothing when I went out for lunch but by that time i couldn't even smell it anymore.

Now I know why my wife didn't have a reaction to this cologne...there is ZERO projection!
Usually when I go out, I either turn heads because they get gassed out by my cologne, or I turn heads because someone likes my fragrance and asks me what I'm wearing.
But with this weaksauce...no reaction anywhere from anyone. Now I understand why this frag has such a low rating....no one can smell this cologne!
I think I have this cologne backwards...it's not something you use as a featured scent...IT is the base layer and you put something better on top of it. So I had my mixture backwards this morning, I should have used this stuff as a base layer and put something else on top of it!! Welp, I guess I don't need a second bottle of this...it's not a winner. This would be in the donation bin or given to my son if I knew of a better "Coconut" fragrance... =[

UPDATE: WOO+!!! Layered this today and got a compliment from the wife!! I base-layered my chest and upper arms with "Oxford Bleu", then shot about 5-6 sprays on my shirt of "NOW" and one shot of "Himalaya" behind each ear. She said I smelled like a pina colada...lol. PERFECT!! Also got a compliment at the gas station this morning.
No scent remaining 2 hours after I arrived at work...all left is the Oxford Bleu and Himalaya. This gets put in the backup bin...there has to be a better coconut fragrance than this "Hide-and-go-seek" mess...

NOTE: This fragrance WILL stain on light colors...but they will disappear after washing.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Believe it or not, this is not only my cheapest fragrances but also one of my most complimented. The coconut in the opening is excellent and the dry down with vanilla and tonka bean is to die for. Such a smooth, sweet, and somehow both cozy and playful scent that has good projection and decent longevity. I also think this is a very versatile scent that is for both night and day as well as every season except potentially winter depending on your personal preference. I really struggle to find a major flaw in this fragrance especially with the price—would 100% recommend!

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is somewhere between Kenzo Homme Night and Diesel Only the Brave Wild but brighter fruity.
No complaint on its performance, though CK Reveal Men is several times stronger.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I love this, it sweet and tangy... The coconut smells lovely and the dry down is leathery and manly...my fav calvin klein mens fragrance.. By a mile...

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: DustyMemphis is the kind of guy who posts angry comments on YouTube whenever someone doesn't share the exact same opinion as they do. Maybe you just like some mediocre shit, and regardless of whether or not that's true you need to learn how to not get butthurt when people inevitably dunk on the fragrances you like.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Eternity Now for Men is yet another Eternity for Men flanker from Calvin Klein that is mis-marketed. I don't see this as a "now" fragrance similar to Tommy Now. What is it with "now" fragrances not being current? Now don't get me wrong, I don't hate it. I know people dunked on this, but I cannot. Well other than it being CK release and the typical CK fragrance performance issues. IMHO, if you ignore the performance issues, most CKs are good releases and some have good performance and are good releases (Reveal Men, Euphoria Gold Men.)

Eternity Now is very much a tropical Virgin Island cologne smell. I wore it this morning and honestly I got an alcoholic smell to it that I previously didn't detect. It is a bit rubbing alcohol, but due to the tropical notes, it comes off like a mojito or maybe a pina colada as it settles on the skin. I think the coconut gives it the tropical cocktail feel to the initial rubbing alcohol blast. There is a spice from the anise and the ginger too. From there, you get some starfruit and a little cedar in the mid. The base is very vanillic and somewhat tonka beany. I say that since by this point, you need a summer breeze to really carry the scent to your nose.

Eternity Now is very much a spring and summer scent, though with the spice you could pull it off for fall. I think Eternity Now is a casual and vacation scent. Due to the alcoholic vibe, I think you shouldn't wear it at work. Eternity Now will get you about 4/5 hours. Maybe 6 if you are lucky.

Eternity Now for Men I got on the back of the two Eternity Summer for Men releases I got (2019 and 2020) and I really think this should have been a Eternity Summer release more so than its own release. I think it got unnecessary dislike but it isn't a great fragrance. I say Eternity Now for Men is a solid 7 out of 10 like Eternity Summer for Men 2019, because of the uniqueness, even if I do love the smell of Eternity Summer for Men 2019 better.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Amazing cologne and my signature scent of 2020, wore through two bottles in a year and never failed to reach for it, appropriate for any occasion and any season. Don't let the negative reviews stop you from smelling this yourself, in my experience Eternity Now has been a compliment monster. Coconut, Ginger and Starfruit dominate this fragrance creating a strong, manly smelling tropical scent that is irresistible to women. I compare it to Virgin Island water as the non alcoholic more effervescent counterpart to VIW.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I really didn't think i was going to like this when i bought it. It was just a blind buy after something else was surprisingly cheaper. Its around 23C today and currently wearing this inside as a work scent. And I really like it on a summers day with its coconut opening. This is a very very pleasant smell. Its not sweet but definitely spicy gourmand. A discerning partner would think you are edible.

This is not for the flashy extroverts. Its not a statement scent. Its just very much a very workmanlike summer scent. I didn't get Eternity in the 90s, but i can see why the buzz was there now. It reminds me a tad of Versace Dreamer, which is a lot more flamboyant.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Just got this yesterday and I legit don’t understand how some people can call this a “meh” flanker or just overall mediocre. It’s smells smooth and relaxed; it has a great trifecta of sweet, tropical, and creamy but with a manly twist. It’s honestly—now—my go-to for these hot summer days. It makes the day feel and smell like a beach day or a vacation. I’m not much of a “sweet & creamy” scent kinda guy. The only creamy scent I’ve ever liked is the Chanel Allure Homme but THIS, this is creamy tropical coconut magic!

I HIGHLY recommend you blind buy this if you fuck with coconut.

Scent: 9/10 (the coconut 🤌🏼)

Longevity: 4-6 hours

Lasts 1-2 hours during a sweaty workout if you’re looking to smell good at the gym and after the gym.

Silage is within arms length

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells so damn good. I don't have anything like it in my collection. Lacking in longevity and not a very good projector. Maybe it's my skin chemistry. If this lasted and projected it would be one of my top fav scents

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This fragrance has a pleasant coconut note without smelling too much like suntan lotion. It also has a nice musky smell on my skin.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This is a very fresh coconut and vanilla scent creamy and light, nothing really heavy or to gourmand. The dry down makes it even better as the cedar and patchouli kick in. I didn't get much star fruit as I do with st. Kitts by Tommy Bahama. This is great for a warm spring/summer's evening. Great smell and vibe for a function or venue will get you compliments. Sillage was great for about 4-5 hours while I was out. After that skin and you can still smell it radiating. I smelled it well into this morning on my skin. This is actually a great blind buy, especially if you don't want to be grouped in the usual summer citrus juices. As always! Try it for yourself, everyone has different DNA!!!

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Coconut with a light, creamy vanilla. Warm, mildly spiced, yet tropical. Don't expect suntan lotion. This is not as heavy, and slightly more elegant than that.

Tip: You want to feel like a walking summer vacation or pina colada for a good six hours? Layer this on top of freshly applied cocoa butter/ coconut lotion. It enhances the scent and makes it last a solid 3/4th's a day.

Good for summer days. Even better for summer nights. I enjoy it.

Rating: 7/10

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Like "mikestro" skillfully wrote below, here the coconut vanilla blend is warm and spicy. The woody aspect of the scent is subdued but present throughout it's life. I find Eternity Now an innovative but coherent and probably the most successful entry in the Eternity line, considering the likes of Aqua, Air, or the summer editions.

I use this fragrance in the spring and summer, day or night, I find it's performance to be astoundingly good, where you get at least 4 hours of moderate projection and at least 12 hours as a skin scent. I also use this perfume during the winter doldrums after the shower as a reminder of the better times to come.

I wholeheartedly can recommend this perfume to all those lazy sunbathers who are into coconut fragrances, but desire a warm, woody, manly twist into it.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Good for the beach, mall, train/bus, living room or when running errands. An energetic start for the day. It's very clean and easy on the nose, inoffensive, fresh out of the shower type of smell.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This one is a really nice tropical sweet vanilla scent. I love wearing it

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I would consider this a gourmand of sorts because of the warm, sweet milky coconut; the vanilla, tonka bean and the licorice-y spiciness coming from the star anise. i don't really smell any fruitiness from the star fruit as listed in the note breakdown here on fragrantica.

I really like this scent, I've never smelled coconut done like this. This to me is not a tropical, bright summery coconut but a darker, lightly spiced coconut whose scent evokes more of a late spring early fall vibe.

I can't see this being a dead of summer scent, its too cozy smelling. Another facet of this scent I'm really digging is the subtle but noticeable patchouli in the late drydown; this earthy facet augments the warm spiced feel of this fragrance.

Lastly, is the performance. i give this a 6 out of 10. i get decent performance from this, about 6 hrs and probably 2 or 3 good hrs of projection. All the people who are saying the longevity is terrible, i dont know what to say, i have really oily skin to start with and i moisturize the areas i apply fragrance to. I rarely find a fragrance - including the cheapies - that i dont get a minimum of 4 to 5 hours of longevity.

I am not wowed by this fragrance but it is a strong like. its great layered with fruity fragrances for a brighter more tropical vibe.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I love this scent. It is magical and reminds me of my childhood. It is sweet like cotton candy at first glance, then dries down to a sugary lemon. It is a gourmand frag for sure. There is a drink called a "chocolate cake" where after you take the shot, you bite into a lemon covered in sugar and it tastes almost exactly like chocolate cake. This stuff smells just like the first second you taste the cake in it. The bad side is that it doesn't last for more than 2 hours. I use this as a bedtime frag to cover up the disgusting smell I make from being an alcoholic. 2 sprays and my gal thinks I sprayed on Christian Audiger's 1958 and not sank 1/2 a bottle of rum. Win!

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Stays quite long, several hours, on my skin, I like it.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Good sweet coconut based scent, but the longevity is embarrassing.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Simple tropical and sweet summer scent. Smells like a very sugary summer cocktail. It's okay!
Average performance.
Complement getter.
I really enjoy the drydown.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Get the best result of this one in early spring. Tempreature between 10 to 20 is good for it works. This is not versatile cologne.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Coconut opening, which I like, is so short, then it turns stenching cedar. Not worst one, but what the f*** is wrong with designers? Is it so hard create masculine scent without base/middle note cedar?

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Does someone know a niche version of this one!? Or something similar but with better quality!?

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: It doesn't smell at all as the original Eternity..and for my nose it is a very good thing. I don't like Eternity much, but this flanker I love. In fact it's the nicest out of all CK's I've smelled so far (together with Shock). Yes it might be generic, that's not always a bad thing tho'..I think it's fresh easy going and shouldn't offend many ppl. A really nice summer/spring frag for me and I'm a bit surprised that it hasn't recieved more love. My first 30ml bottle is almost done for so I'm currently ordering a new 100ml. For the price I found online I will be paying 300 sek for 100 ml, it's about $32..and for that price this frag is an absolute no brainer in my book! Ok it has not the longevity you would want, (even tho' I've had far worse) but for that price I can live with it.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Smells great for the first 30 minutes and I’m not joking, but within 45 minutes it’s a skin scent. I bought this at a department store, checked the batch codes and this is legit. Judging from the moderate longevity scores I am going to assume that there was a major reformulation because the performance in this sucks really really bad, this falls into the poor performance catergory on here. To test if this was a skin issue for me I lent the bottle out to 2 other friends and both said the same thing. The coconut nectar and ginger in this one are just beautiful. I am not impressed and a little salty because of the waste of money on this one. Even some Zara scents I have outperform this one. This is below average to me. Save your money.
Scent-8/10
Longevity-3/10
Sillage-3
Overall-4/10

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Summery, fresh, exotic, and sweet!

Opening: Fun and sweet with noticeable tonka bean. Sweetness will get you noticed and complimented, a very youthful type of sweetness- not gourmand.

Middle: Sweetness dries down to reveal very prominent woody note

End: Minimal Sweetness with a synthetic boring woody note.

Performance: Projects strongly for a solid 1-2 hours depending on skin but then sits close to skin for a sensual and fun drydown. Ultimately, performance will depend on your skin type.

OVERALL: 8/10 This is for those who tire of constantly smelling spicy and dark men's fragrances. It is fun and youthful with a "night on the town" type vibe. Recommended for all ages looking to add variety to their collection.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Idk why but it reminds me of Joop Homme. As if it was a diluted and more wearable version of JP. Nothing to write home about.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Interestingly, it opens up with creamy coconut and vanilla, and gets lighter as it develops into a starfruit-and-coconut milkshake before fading into a tonka bean drydown.

It's indeed pretty synthetic, but not unpleasant. The longevity is poor though, it projects for maybe an hour on my skin.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I love the scent. Fresh vanilla and ginger toned down with the coconut water. Just a hint of the original DNA in there. Great quick summer fragrance. It has a nice trail when sprayed fresh. Longevity is weak for me. Moderate sillage. Priced cheap enough to allow for multiple sprays throughout day. My wife enjoys it. I would say it could be unisex but just a hint more masculine.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Stuffy, heavy, synthetic and cheap. There is nothing nice to say about this one. Do not even understand how this can be related to the fantastic Eternity classic.
If you like to smell like Piña Colada go knock yourself out:)
You already now find it in the discount section and in 2 years it will be discontinued.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
this is a generic fragrance, smells very sweet and sexy, this is not a sweetness that will hit you in the face, it's a very balanced sweet fragrance, many girls love this one and thats amazing! , it last for 6 hours which is ok

overall it is a good fragrance, I wish it lasted longer.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Eternity Now for Men is the second frag. I’ve ever owned.
- amazing opening! Full of masculinity and freshness, very intriguing and fun! Will def get you noticed !
- over the next few hours dries down to a more boring somewhat synthetic & woody scent
— overall average sillage and projection
— If you’re looking for a manly frag. that’s not super dark/musky then THIS IS FOR YOU
— I’m into having a wide variety of fragrances: this is a lighter, sweeter, fruitier but def masculine frag.

Give it a try, definitely amazing ! OVERALL: 8/10

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I really like it. It's my favorite Calvin Klein flanker. Coconut and vanilla that thankfully avoids being suntan lotion. It is sweet but my chemistry somehow tones down sweet scents so I can enjoy it but others may not. You know, when to wear it is a good question. It is probably too sweet to wear out in the heat (summer) yet with the coconut that's exactly when it should be worn. So, I'd say wear it in the summer when you expect to be indoors most of the time. Works where I'm at (the South) because as much as we all like to talk about being outside during the summer down here, the truth is many, many Southerners spend the ungodly hot summers in the A/C. If I'm outside I'll be on the jet ski or in the lake and won't bother with fragrance anyways. So there you go. It's an indoors summer scent. Or, a summer night scent depending on the heat.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
To describe this perfume as an oriental is to stretch that word to the limit.
This is an oriental for millenials, a likable water down version. Having grown in the 80's, I still have memories of cloying car rides where the likes of Opium reigned.
Still, Eternity Now is attractive, mellow and soft, feels like suede. Comforting and not intrusive.
The coconut nectar ( whatever that might be) is the main character, some flimsy bare noticeable citrus note lingers for a few minutes. Then is Woody, clean.
To me this is an office fragrance with a little more personality.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I have to say this was a disappointment for me. I was looking for a beachy/coconut scent but this doesn't have that at all. I don't smell any coconut. I agree with the person who said it reminds them of 1 Million. There's a scent here that I describe as "brassy" and this Eternity Now has a lot of brassy going on. If I were to compare it beyond 1 Million, it would be to Chanel's Egoiste Platinum, that too was supposed to be a scent I would love but whatever is causing the brassiness is in it as well. I very rarely wash a scent off but I had to with this one. I believe this, the Chanel, the 1 Million, all have their places but it's not on me.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: amazing/beautiful scent,i get the carambola,coconut,citrus and patch from this.delicious id say, nice bottle too...simplistic, good for summer and both genders but the one big prb is longevity, you gotta respray every two hours, its really nice and fun to wear this on a casual day, good for vacation perhaps.i got a 7ml mini, may be will get the full bottle.they should make an intense version

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This is a really peculiar gourmand scent, the opening is amazingly unique and in fairness that’s true of many Calvin Klein fragrances, they open well but then become less obscure, more familiar and uninspiring. I can only attribute this to the fruity opening of star fruit, another thing CK tend to do is use unusual fruits in the top notes, normally I’d say they smell a bit like apple or tangerine or grapefruit but they usually smell very much different to normal fruits which is a nice attention to detail and leads me to conclude they really do resemble the exotic and rarer fruits. I have actually had a star fruit before but I can’t remember what it was like? Anyway then comes a powerful and almost niche sweetness which is already building a big Tonka Bean and vanilla base. As it delveops the candy floss sweetness and a very nice coconut note which isn’t ridiculous and sun lotion like, I’d say more dark, remind me of Only the Brave WILD a fragrance I thought was cheap and throwaway but actually, strangely enjoyed. It starts to loose itself in the drydown becoming more generic and annoying Tonka based, overly busy, messy stuff. When it settles to a very low skin scent after several hours is just a sweet Rochas Man but not as charming or subtle. I actually thought I’d buy this for the over sweet and unique opening alone but as the notes developed the composition just became more and more jumbled

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: It's good, but painfully mild. It smells mostly like that Tahitian Treat/Tahiti Treat fruit punch soft drink. Get for cheap! I paid $24.99 for a 50ml and I think that was too much! lol Also, to be a(true) flanker, you'd think this would bare 1% at least resemblance to the Original Eternity. Maybe worthy of a class-action lawsuit! ;)

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Eternity now definitely shocked me but not with how good it smells but for how it smells. With coconut listed I was expecting something along the lines of Tommy Bahama or even something similar to the CK One Summers.

Unfortunately this is just another sweet but fresh,bubble-gummy type of smells along the lines of One Million,Polo Red, and Eros. ( I’m so sick of this genre)

This does add a different take as the coconut and star fruit make it unique,and I liked what they did with this scent but it’s to immature and sugary sweet for my taste. However, I’m not going to say this is a bad scent but it’s personally not for me !

On my skin this smelled very similar to a girly Pina colada air freshener 1 of my exes used to have in her car.lol

Performance is 3-6 hours with moderate projection. Typical Calvin Klein performance.

Overall rating — 6.5 out of 10 ! Decent scent but it doesn’t suit my own personal taste

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: just went to the store for random shopping , i tried this loved it so much so bought it instantly . sadly i don't like the regular eternity , but this is lovely ,perfect foe summers & office use .

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This is a gem.. I instantly loved it, it has a tropical coconut smell to it.. I thought is smelled young, but I was informed by some co workers that is more of a dad smell.. Which I was extremely shocked by, but I still love it regardless.. I'll rock this dad smell anyday.. Also check out Halloween Man by Jesus Del Pozo and Sun Java for men, and Thallium.. They smell youthful for sure and get good compliments

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: It's alright at first it smells like 212 VIP Man then suddenly smells tropical like a pineapple flavored blunt hehe

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Wow, this is actually quite nice. I was quite expecting to hate it, but I wore the original back in the early 90s.

Starts off overwhelmingly sweet and gourmand and coconuts everywhere, but eventually starts to morph and adopt some of the more classic lavender/vanilla of the fougère original...although no idea where the lavender note comes from - a combo of other things? This is an admittedly modern, sickly sweet fougère but a fougère nonetheless - and quite well put together, or even dare I say it 'balanced', in the notes somehow, despite being so sweet and coconutty.

Important to note, this fougère development happened to me on a test strip after two hours, so on skin I'm sure it would happen quicker, and might be why many turn their noses up so soon if testing on paper.)

I'm not sure I'd wear it now, though I'm sure young men would love it.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This fragrance has a brilliant and unique opening owed to the carambola (star fruit). It's brilliance and uniqueness gradually fades away into a cliche pina-coladic scent; then finally comes to an almost annoying pineapple hault. I really wished that the opening remained linear. Quite disappointed.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
My husband probably accidentally bought this one instead of Eternity which he bought for years, until I asked him to try something else, because he was wearing Eternity at a time when everyone else was wearing it all the time too and I just grew tired of being surrounded by Eternity for Men.

I'm glad he accidentally bought this fragrance, because I love orientals, Eternity Now has Tonka, vanilla, cedar and coconut, which are all notes I love. The fruity notes aren't detectable on my husband or maybe they evaporated immediately, because he applies it at the same time as his aftershave, right out of the shower, in a steamy bathroom.

Eternity Now seems like it's best for cooler weather, but knowing hub, he won't stop wearing it until the bottle's empty, even if if lasts him into next Summer *sigh!*.

It's masculine and not in a heavy overbearing way, though with so many people being fragrance phobic today, I'm sure someone at a family gathering or work will complain.:(

Hub just sprayed it on before driving out to a buddy's HAM shack, so I can't say anything about longevity. If the other HAMS don't lilke the fragrance, then hub might be able to get a radio and computer all to himself.:D

While hub didn't put any thought into this purchase and just grabbed what he thought was the only Eternity out there (I don't think he's noticed flankers and wouldn't understand the term) for me, this is a win and the first men's fragrance from Calvin Klein, that I've liked for years!:)

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This one can not be judged without trying it on. On scent strip it is almost froofroo pina colada. But once you try it on, the masculine spice jumps in and steals the show. You still get that subtle hint of coconut, which reads fresh fall fragrance. Appropriate to wear in winter somewhere that does not get 4 seasons.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Remind axe hot fever.
Coconut trees verry intens...
Soft..

Fragrance for day in spring or summer..

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This is Chanel Allure Homme minus lemon

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
This does not smell like Axe Fever.

I have both and I've reviewed both.

Axe Fever has this powdery, dusty "dirt" smell with a topload of citrus.

No way similar -- AT ALL -- to Eternity Now for Men.

Nothing mainstream market smells like CK EN for Men. The only thing I could say that Eternity Now smells like is a coconutty, vanillic hair conditioner.
*See my review below from January 18 2016*

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This scent reminds me a lot axe hot fever,same tropical smell!

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Got to update my previous review where I said my wife and I liked it but it didn't last. Previous uses of my sample just didn't last, but was intrigued by the nice smell.

I was about to finish up my sample and for the first time I used it in the morning right after my shower. Well 7 hours later I was still smelling it. Put on later in the day it didn't last, but when I put it on early, it stayed with me.

bought it!!!

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: The opening is amazing but is short lived.. then turns into a synthetic vanilla coconut scent.. the sillage smells pretty good but not so nice up close.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I have to admit I'm quite attracted to this fragrance. There's nothing cheap about it except for the price tag. To me, the scent and the packaging are both great. My husband got it last year and it has become his new signature since then..I really love the smell whenever he wears it and I just can't stop smelling him when he's wearing it..

Unlike me, he isn't a perfume snob or a perfume collector, he doesn't care for expensive fragrances and only likes to own one cologne/scent at a time. That's just the opposite of me, which I find it pretty adorable. On the day we picked up this fragrance, I smelt tones of other male fragrances, only this one got my immediate attention. Because to me it smelt fun, modern, unique and sweet. It's a sweet masculine scent with some fresh tropical notes in the background. It smells like vanilla with star fruit and coconut. The notes are quite balanced in my opinion. The great thing is he likes it, too. He was going to get his old time favorite, Eternity Summer, but we were glad to come across this one instead.

I'm not very attracted to something too spicy or citrusy nowadays. In the gym, on the train or in the shopping centres, I'm just not a fan of those in your face citrusy male scents or super spicy stuff. Too me some male frag can even smell sharp or dated.This one is subtle, fresh, sweet and creamy. The opening is quite nice and strong. It projects well for a good 3-4 hours and then becomes a light skin scent.

Overall, I really like it and after half of the bottle it's still going strong. I haven't had enough of it yet, so I hope he might get another bottle of it once he finishes this one. ;)

By the way, he recently gifted me a 50ml CK Euphoria which looks lovely next to his 100ml Eternity Now. Unfortunately Eternity Now for Women doesn't work for me, too floral and sharp. But Euphoria is a total different story. Although I was never interested in it before, now I own it I think it's such a classic and sexy fragrance which shouldn't be ignored by me all these years.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Years on and almost everything smells so much alike. Anything related to Eternity is barely detectable, perhaps a faint citric note in the begining. But in the end I get a less sweet, less cloying, and a better, in general, Burberry Brit Rhythm. Impressions are not always the same, and can change. It was fresher on paper strip.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Smells nice. My wife likes it. To me it was different and unique.

Just didn't last long enough to be considered as a viable candidate for purchase.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
i fall in love with the scent instantly.. very addictive and great scent.. i love the combination of coconut and vanilla.. brilliant!

unfortunately, i just love how it smell.. the projection, longevity and sillage is bad! really 100% bad.. it will stay on your skin and clothes like an hour or less and poof! disappear like a magic! smell nothing after that..like 0% nothing left!

why CK, why?? Calvin Klein released a very addictive and great fragrance this time but the performance just sucks.. unbelievable! i would purchase a bottle if it's perform like the brand.. i mean Calvin Klein is such a huge brand.. very let down and disappointed.. i know some people would still buy it just because they love how the perfume smell even it is weaker in performance.. but for me it's not worth it!

10/10 for the scent
0/10 for the projection and longevity

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I think this should not carry the name of Eternity, which may be misleading - there's no resemblance to the original Eternity at all so TRY FIRST BEFORE YOU BUY!

Very sweet - almost female fragrance but I kinda liked it and loved to find a hint of coconut in the male fragrance. Personally this is for winter wearing - not summer.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I like this much better than the ladies version. Pm me if you would like to swap for the ladies version. I don't use it all.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: ...MORE LIKE...ETERNITY WWOWW !!! A FINE DELICATE CLOUD OF PLEASURE....8.5/ 1O......MILD TO AVG STRENGTH..HAPPY BLIND BUY!!!

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Nice, sweet, light, vanilla-coconut combination. Wish the performance was better.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This Fragrance is absolutly an Summer fragrance, you think you are at the beach when you smell that pretty awesome Coconut and vanilla this combination makes it so good. When you walk at the Sea on an Sunny day you still smiling the hole time it gives you aa feeling like you are in Holidays :) and the Second thing that i like about this Fragrance is that my Wife goes crazy when i Wear it :D She says thats a Fragrance that´s shows her me :)

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I read a lot of reviews talking about coconut as the first thing they smelled. I just spritzed and all I smell is carambola and ginger. So it starts fresh and citrus. A few minutes passed and I smell ginger and very little coconut, giving it some creaminess.
Less than 10 minutes passed and citrus has gone and coconut is more proeminent, like Ralph Hot with some hints of wood.
This one could be labeled "unissex".

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I just got this and this smell great, this could be unisex.
this is one of the best scent ever.

The only problem is the projection is kinda weak.

Calvin Klein should make a Intense version of this fragrance with a heavy projection.

This fragrance with great for young guy and up.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I just got this and this smell great, this could be unisex.
this is one of the best scent ever.

The only problem is the projection is kinda weak.

Calvin Klein should make a Intense version of this fragrance with a heavy projection.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I agree with those who view this as unisex. If you like sweet gourmands I think you'll enjoy the first half hour or so. After that it doesn't seem to be as complex, which isn't uncommon, but I also begin to pick up a "chemical" quality, though it's not that strong (unlike some other recent CK scents I've tried). It comes across as a "synthetic" wood note. I don't understand why some "cheapo" companies can avoid this and yet still have good longevity (for example, Insurrection Wild II or whatever that Pure Havane type scent is called), but CK can't. Do they want this as their "house note" or are they too lazy to formulate properly, or is it just the cheapest way to go? Anyway, it goes in a cherry pipe tobacco direction, but it feels like the sweetness prevents that from ever developing, if that makes sense. A woman who thinks Pure Havane is too masculine might like this one. Perhaps I've just sampled too many of these and my standards have been raised substantially, but it's not a "bad" scent if you are seeking this sort of thing. I am, but I've already got ones I prefer. I'm not sure if I'll keep my 1 ounce bottle or swap it, but I'm leaning towards the latter. Note that I got none of original Eternity for Men here, though of course they share some ingredients, as is the case for 99% of other "masculine" designers.

UPDATE: That wood-ish note lasted more than 24 hours, but it's a bit screechy, probably because all the other notes were gone. Again, why load up a scent with such an irritating aroma chemical in a composition like this? I would have liked it without this harsh note - "addition by subtraction" is a lesson they apparently need to learn!

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
CK can do better if just rename this to CK Now, nothing resembles the Eternity. It started with dusty citrus for 10 min, it evolve to strong powderish tonka-patchoulli scent for hours later. Projection is good, silliage is weak, stay close to your skin.

CK seriously need to end the endless flanks and start new evolution line of fragrance that capture the market once again.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Meh. I can't decide if this smells vaguely like laundry soap or some forgettable beachy-tropical scent. Too generic, too mass-market.

Creed Virgin Island Water? Sort of. More like water.

Boring.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I like this. Not much to add to what's already been posted here but I will say that there are other fragrances that are VERY similar for less money. Joop Homme Wild and Enrique Iglesias Adrenaline come to mind.... Not that they're identical but definitely similar.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
juicy sweet yet still masculine and fresh...

I do pick up starfruit more than anything then comes the coconut mixed with fresh ozonic accords that remind me of really ripped abs by bodman when it dries down nothing extraordinary but still a pleasant smell

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Best ck cologne out right now all others smell like cheap drug store colognes this defiantly has a slight similarity to one million and the coconut in this is like creed virgin island water safe scent and can be worn pretty much every season 7.5/10

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I ran into this new Calvin Klein Eternity Now at Sephora so I sprayed some on the tester strip to see what it is all about.. This is just my first impression of this fragrance.. Eternity Now opens up very fresh & fruity! The coconut is noticeable immediately and it is one of the prominent notes in this fragrance.. The star fruit adds a nice fruity touch which together with the coconut gives Eternity Now a bit of a tropical vibe.. As the fragrance progresses the scent begins to warm up a bit & get sweeter.. In the dry down notes of tonka & vanilla begin to take over.. Eternity Now is fresh, fruity, & somewhat sweet.. It is a very pleasant scent, although it does smell a bit synthetic but that is the usual for Calvin Klein fragrances.. I detect a bit of a similarity to Yves Saint Laurent's new Kouros Silver.. Eternity Now is a bit more fresh fruity & tropical whereas Kouros Silver is a bit warmer, & woodier but nevertheless the two share a similar vibe..

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: A cosy, sweet floral musk with sugary lemon... and the obligatory dash of One Million which many high street perfumes have in their DNA now. I still like the original Eternity but don't like this powdery concoction.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: To paraphrase: Smells nice, but I don't like it. LOL

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Have you ever smelled a fragrance and thought to yourself, "Now THIS would be MY SIGNATURE scent... if only I didn't have lots of other fragrances!"

That's how I feel about CK Eternity Now. If I didn't have 60 other fragrances, this would be my signature scent.

Something about it is so familiar but it's wholly unique for a men's fragrance. It's sweet, uniquely fresh, and clean. When I wear it, I feel confident and approachable. I feel friendly and inviting without being inappropriate or trying too hard.

It's very sweet, but it's fresh. It smells like a shampoo or hair conditioner but doesn't smell "soapy" which is a good thing. It's completely linear with this coconut nectar note being the dominating accord. This coconut nectar is the scent of the juice and not the flesh. A woman could easily wear this thing, it's that versatile. It's an every season type of fragrance. The vanilla cuts through arctic air of winter and the coconut nectar keeps things fruity and light in the summer.

I highly recommend this. Some days I wish for simpler times when I only had 1 or 2 fragrances. If I still lived in those times, Eternity Now for men would definitely be 1 of those 2 fragrances.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Wore a sample all day today. It is nice, but essentially I get a mix between One Million and Gentlemen Only. I'll take a pass.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Smells, at least to my nose, almost identical to Paco Rabanne's 1 Million.

Not quite as strong and overpowering but the smell is about 90% the same.

Pass.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Ainda não sei se gostei.
Comprei e pouco usei.
Marcante e persistente, daqueles perfumes q vc sente o cheiro o tempo todo mas, algo me fez sentir q estava dentro de uma fábrica de doces...sei não...

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Indeed a cozy warm and casual scent that combines the epic notes of Paco Rabannes 1 million and YSL la unit de l'homme. A whole other take on the Eternity line with their yearly summer edition and several flankers.

In the latter years CK have not dropped their defences and tried something new and avant garde and some of the recent newbies like Reveal is somewhat a scent that doesn't matter to most people.

As a scent it is good for winter and late autumn and the longevity is above average.

Rating 6/10

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
This reminds me of the scent of 1 million
These days, most perfumes are similar

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Coty again leverages on the Eternity name to come out with a forgettable, generic fragrance. Why it's Eternity Night in this latest iteration of EternityNow! Yuck. Don't bother with this one. It's not a collectible like the original Eternity.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I prove it today and it was very sweet and i think its like valentino pour homme exactly.i dont know why all barns have same scent in this days?!!!

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Finally an Hypnotic Poison for men!

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is sweet fruity frag, and for some reason remind me of or has similarities to One Million Cologne. I think this is not bad at all, but if you don't like sweet frag then no reason to look for. I think this one also perform very well on my skin.
This can also be used as UNI since this a good sweet fragrance.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: So fruity at first! It reminds me of a sort of incense that you could find by the shore. But the dry down smells very similar to Swiss Army Unlimited! This honestly is great for a September day, Put it on in the day time, the beginning notes mix well in warmth, then the dry down mixes well with the cool weather of the evening. 7.5/10

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Paper samples do not do as much justice as the real perfume in person, however, I will comment on what I found in the sample which is a definite unisex scent.
Great on first sniff. That's a plus. But no gorgeous, heavenly scent....but remember this is paper.


It's clean, not soapy. It's mellow rounded mild coconut and not vanilla, but fresh cream. No piercing notes at all. It hums gently.
Not quite a warm scent, more like lukewarm, if one can understand what I mean.
I will pick up on this as soon as I sample it properly.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Oh my days this is absolutely gorgeous, a milky, coconuty vanilla, feels exactly right as a Summer flanker, but it's somehow different. I got about 3.5 hours out of it, after some liberal spraying, which is a little disappointing. If you want something different this is great, definitely unisex.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Dominant notes of vanilla and coconut create a very delicious and warm combination on my skin. Very different from Eternity and it's summer flankers. It's well done and very likeable. Decidedly targeted toward younger men to spray some on and go out for a night full of fun!

Moderate silage and staying power. Overall:6 out of 10.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: in my honest opinion: it smells too feminine! the coconut note is really strong

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This doesn't have much to do with the original Eternity. It smells powdery, sweet, vanilla-like and slightly fruity. Clearly CK trying to muscle in on the fad for modern smelling types like Invictus and Jimmy Choo. I think I prefer Now to its peers but sadly as it is a Coty product it doesn't perform well.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: start off with a tropical blast for at least an hour and dries down to a linear and decent woody fruit based cologne,must admit I like it alot, good job on the notes for this fragrance, on the skin at least 3 hours on your clothing 4 hours ,typical by today's standards of scentwear,but it's a likable fragrance overall.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I don't want to be too negative but for me this latest release from CK is disappointing. Its very sweet but that's about all. Try Versace Eros for something similar but better as both are high on tonka and vanilla, the only difference being this one has a more spicy/fruity vibe. If you are into sweet fruity fragrances you might like this until you find out about its performance issues! Made to measure gives this bad boy a run for its money.. A young mans fragrance for sure. Smells nice but meh. Sorry.

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Tested this today....Drum roll........
This of Calvin Klein's best !!!
The first sniff is soooooo awesome..
I get tropical..but NOT suntan lotion tropical....Fruity...yes.. sweet...very light hint of coconut...not a vanilla coconut...and finally...woody ...
This is love at first sniff for me. However...the sillage and projection is only average....sound familiar??
CK has this constant problem IMO. But...this one is still full bottle worthy for me. This type of scent seems to be the current "vibe" or "trend" now. I just bought Boucheron Quatre pour Homme....awesome scent..and is in the same vein as CK Eternity Now....they don't smell alike...but are in the same vein...weight...air. Also ..I could include Dior Homme for me is in this vein, and maybe Lanvin L'Eclat Homme..and even CK Reveal. Give this one a try !!!!

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Eternity Now, much elegant bottle

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: has it came out already? this will only hit the market in July! why do people vote on sillage and projection???? so stupid and sad...

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
@lulu169 check these perfumes!
Virgin Island Water Creed for women and men
Ferrari Silver Essence Ferrari for men
Only The Brave Wild Diesel for men
and ...

product_name: Eternity Now For Men Calvin Klein
review_content: @foreignshores - "Calvin Klein launches a new fragrant pair ETERNITY NOW that will appear on the market in July 2015" It's right there in the accompanying article.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Just a wrist test. It has a delightful fruity-floral opening that is very inviting. It is a gentle shimmer of a scent and I cannot discern the parts even looking at the notes. Maybe just peony. It is soft and feminine. Very likeable. Clean, gentle and watery. A gentler Happy by Clinique.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I don’t normally like floral smells but I genuinely like this one. I didn’t realise this till today but I think I will be wearing this quite often from now.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This is the perfect scent for times when you’re not sure what you want, or need to find a scent to wear that won’t really draw attention to itself or be obvious or offensive to others. I’m on my second bottle, which is almost unheard of for me as I rarely repeat. I have always had a small love of peach fragrances, but otherwise most of what I have tends to be woody, patchouli/sandalwood based or fig. I love this for a good basic that I can wear anywhere and anytime, noticeable but staying in the background. Has decent lasting power on me, maybe six hours or so and for me that’s great.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This smells like zebra stripe gum to me, such a nostalgic scent.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Bad, weak and smells like a toilet refresher. Blah on my skin it's lemon in a sharp way. You use, smell it for 5 seconds and poef gone with the wind. Maybe i have a fake one i don't know. The bottle has a code so i think it's genuine but my lord what a weak perfume. Even weaker than a body mist. So in the bin with this one won't even sell it.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
The peach is present right from the start. It’s mixed with a very soapy scent. Reminded me of a shampoo I used in the 90’s.

30 minutes later it began to turn very bitter and sharp.

Two hours later it had disappeared by at least half. It smells a lot like Clinique Happy.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
CLEAN (TROPICAL) & FRESH - Neroli & Peach-Blossom. Opens with a burst of quince sorbet supported by litchi with the granular texture of sorbet. That deepens into the neroli heart with clean facets rounded out by peony & peach-blossom bringing a velvety peachy feel, resting on a floral support base of cashmere-woods, ambroxan & musk. Neroli here is more forward than the notes would suggest, and to my nose this is overall a neroli & peach-blossom scent, which come very close to evoking an orange-blossom. Performance is average or slightly above average for a light summer wearing experience. Overall: clean & fresh tropical/peachy neroli & peach-blossom scent. It's a love for me. Enjoy!

Contrast to Burberry Brit Sheer 2015:
These are different, but similarities with peach-blossom and a fluffy-musky floral-fruity. Burberry Brit Sheer 2015 has a more forward pineapple note. Eternity Now had stronger performance initially, but now they're roughly equivalent.

Contrast to Island Hawaii Michael Kors:
These are different, but there's similarities with the clean, orange-peachy floral. Island Hawaii has a more forward clementine-orange and orange-blossom instead of neroli. Eternity Now has better performance.

Contrast to Quatre Boucheron:
These are different, but there's a similar vibe with clean fluffy-musky floral-fruity. Quatre is louder, bolder with a more distinct jasmine note. Quatre has stronger performance.

Update 05/25/25: I'm noticing something more salty-musky in this today which may be the musk-cashmeran. Because of this it's reminding me of the Olympéa range today, specifically Olympéa Aqua & Olympéa Aqua EDP Légère although it's not a dupe. Still the delightful fluffy, clean floral-fruity vibe in the top. Love it.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Very weak juice doesn't last nor does it project. The smell is a bit dated like something from the 90's. Pretty bottle at least.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Kind of pinky-white floral with a little bit of powdery citrus. Reminds me of some polite quiet lady that works in your office and makes sure to say bless you every time you sneeze.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
ASSISTANCE REQUIRED:
I blind bought the lotion because I love peonies and hoped that would shine through. It's slightly too fruity or too something, I'm not sure what. Can anyone suggest what perfume to wear on top of this if one doesn't own the actual CK perfume? I looked to see what "this perfume reminds me of" and I don't have any of those perfumes listed. Don't get me wrong, it's a very lovely scent and though I can't see myself buying the actual perfume itself unless it was dirt cheap, it seems like a safe blind buy. I'd like to wear something on top that compliments it and doesn't clash while also not highlighting whatever that "too muchness" is lol
Any suggestions welcome!
Edit - I do really like this.. I think the too muchness is the fruit. Something sweet. Might work best for summertime, bet it would be delicious in June/July/Aug, but it's middle of winter in Canada. I might try DKNY Be Delicious on this come spring, but for now I'd rather pull out the powdery soap and florals.
Edit#2 - Oooohh I sprayed JLo's Glow over this and I am now in love with both! What a wonderful combo! I haven't touched Glow in years and something told me to check it out, glad I did because I've forgotten how lovely a clean scent that is, especially since most of her others were failed attempts for me. On top of this Eternity Now lotion, they both sparkle. So clean, soapy and fresh... and peonies! Ugh love it.
Still open to suggestions for anyone who has layered with anything else.. I'm open ears (and wrists!) 😆

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Good scent for wearing to work. Clean, fresh and suited for summer days. Very fruity.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
There is an explosion of almost fruity gun powder that hits you when you first smell this. This is refreshing, fruity, a bit brisk because of the explosive notes within the fragrance gun powder which reacts almost like staccato notes within a music composition. (Flower Bomb Nectar is another perfume that has this same type of explosive floral type composition).

I think I would have enjoyed this more in junior high school, high school, college - than now... although this is truly an ageless and timeless scent - it does lean more towards the juvenile end of things...but this is probably similar to Burberry Body (the original) where someone's energy could determine whether they could continue wearing this later. I can see a few women pulling this off, very well. It would definitely have to fit your personality.

I initially ordered this sample hoping that I would like the quince fruity notes as much as I did in Avon's Incandessence Lotus, but this is a different interpretation of quince, I still prefer Incandessence Lotus.

-----------

My first impression was that Eternity Now is very similar to the same type of chemical reaction that happens in perfumes such as Burberry "The Beat" perfume - and Burberry "Body" (the Original) - (although Eternity Now is much louder and brighter going into an almost sharp type expression compared to Burberry "The Beat"). This could also be compared to Ivanka Trump's signature perfume which is more of a pink lemonade type perfume, but Eternity Now is more explosive, brisk, and loud.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: If you mixed one half laundry detergent and one half peach juice and shook the bottle all up, you'd get the very fresh, uncomplicated, and pretty Eternity Now.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Like a clean/freshie scent that was made before they really mastered how to do that. It smells like laundry soap with only the slightest bit of soapiness. I'm not mad at it, but I don't know that I'm ready to commit to it either. Nonspecific fruity-floral balanced for mass market appeal. Thankfully not over sweetened or overly deep. Wearable.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: There's something about this perfume that's just "off" to me. I'm not sure if it's the ambroxan + fruits or the particuular combination of the fruits, but I don't like it after the first 10 minutes or so. I much prefer the floral Eternity Moment over this one and thankfully I only invested in a rollerball that has since been donated.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
I am not getting what others are but maybe it is just due to personal preference.
It is meh in my opinion, but I have an issue with the top notes.
Immediately after spraying I like it, there is something sweet and appealing.
After some seconds it becomes disgusting!!! Something about it is just off, I think it is one of these, Quince/Sorbet/Litchi (one of them, I am not able to identify which one)
Some time after the disgusting phase it becomes better since it is not as sharp and it is more like a sweet floral. However the disgusting still lingers and I can not get my mind off it.
Okay overall, but definitely not something I would reach for …

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Stunning!! It’s very much an aquatic fruity floral fragrance which I thought I wouldn’t like but I actually love.

Longevity is terrific! Lasts forever on me. My bottle is old though, from 2015 so that might make a difference.

Bright and clean, it makes me smile when I spray it on. It is strong tho, so don’t overspray (I did it once by accident and almost choked on it). One spray is enough, even two was a lot for me.

I get a lot of litchi and neroli in this. The opening is rough so give it a minute before you judge.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This is a very nice, happy and bright perfume, the opening is clean and sweet, is a very pleasant sweet nothing too loud, after some minutes you can smell the litchi in a better and clear way. This scent has that spring fresh vibe, which make it very likeable and super girly but once it dries down is a little bit more mature floral fragrance, you can feel the neroli very strong, then with the back of the cashmere is elegant and pretty, I just do not know why for some reason this perfume smell similar to La vie Est Belle Eclat to me once is settle... silage is decent and projection okay. I have had this scent for quite sometime now, but I would be giving it away to my mom since I do not use it as much and even tho is a beautiful one, I feel I am past this type of sweet and floral scents. You can blind buy this one safely if you have not smell it before specially if you love pretty floral perfumes.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This is really pretty and feminine. Litchi seems to be showing up in several perfumes of late, at least that I've got my hands on. I'm enjoying them all so far. This one is a smooth, mature, slightly sweet floral. Pretty classic in nature, goes anywhere and anyone could like it. I like it very much.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Simple, fresh and feminine, this frag is delightful. Peachy but not too sweet. Somewhat “coconutty” to my nose. If this fragrance were a colour it would be nude rose beige. Ladylike and never overpowering, yet identifiable, this would be a good signature. Ok for office or just swirling around in your favourite dress.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
I remember being in Ulta when this first came out. Something compelled me to buy a small bottle right then and there that I kept in my slight rotation. It was never memorable enough that I felt the need to repurchase it though because I found my now nearly empty bottle at the bottom of a drawer recently. Maybe I felt that Eternity Now was too boring. Maybe I got caught up in wanting to explore bigger and better options. But now after that long neglected first spritz, it’s all coming back to me why I liked this so much.

Like a lot of people here are mentioning, this is a clean, fresh, sweet, salty, slightly aquatic scent. It’s very common and yet there is something that sets it apart from the multitude of scents in this category. I’ve never heard of a sorbet note in perfume before. It makes sense though. It starts saccharine and dries a little sour. The quince adds the zest and citrus. I really want to believe that I am an independent thinker but my opinion was swayed when I heard shampoo. Yes!!! This definitely has a sudsy, air-dried shampoo vibe. Think old school, rose hip Herbal Essences. I know that sounds generic especially considering how many options there are today but this had me wanting more. It was criminally affordable for a brand new 100 ml off of EBay. Longevity is surprisingly incredible. I could still smell this way after the standard five hour mark. Sillage is very quiet and intimate. It does become a skin scent. If there’s any fault I can find with this one, it would be that I wish that whatever note is bringing the saltiness was amplified and helped it to stay intact during the drydown. Not a big deal because this is still really delicious but that would really make a small improvement. It’s not overly sweet, cloying or in anyway obnoxious which can happen with fragrances like this. I often see the comparison of perfume to a cozy sweater or a white T-shirt. Likewise, Eternity Now would be that Lycra/spandex/viscose tee that knows your body and fits you like a second skin. You are wrapped in familiarity, comfort and cheerful optimism. Nothing exotic, of course. You might feel like it has run its course after a while but there’s still no denying that there is something a little soothingly special here that would compel you to come back every now and again. I am glad to have this in my collection again.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This smells like a lovely spring/summer floral fruity body lotion. Why body lotion? Because it has some creaminess to it, but not too much. As someone already said, it does smell a bit salty too! :-) Really uncomplicated floral scent, safe blind buy as an everyday simple feminine scent.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Fruity yes! Wasn't expecting so fruity after the elegant floral and spicy experience of the original eternity! Very wearable, similar to the original in mood, not scent. Warm, intimate, but pure, mature and elegant. Especially for a fruity scent, which can often be overly sweet. Wouldn't describe this as juicy either. Genius perfumer. Am I fan. To me it's a casual, everyday scent to wear at home - when you share it with someone special 😉

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Tea, herbal tea and some more tea.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
It was the first fragrance I purchased with my own money when I came to Europe on a study abroad program in 2015. So there is a lot of sentimental value I have towards this fragrance.

It's a nice floral smell with a little bit of sweetness from the litchi. But the sweetness is more watered down because of the neroli I presume. It's a very easy to wear fragrance throughout the year, anytime of the day. It lasts on my skin about 4~5hrs.

Over the years after trying many other different perfumes, I kind of fell out of love with it. I finished my bottle today. Don't think I will repurchase this but I do have a lot of fond memories associated with Eternity Now :)

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I really like this perfume, it’s creamy peony and bitter from citrus zest , and it’s not sharp at all to my nose rather rounded, I thought it would be sharp as seen sorbet on the top note , I never smell anything like this before , I think this is beautiful soothing perfume and last at least 4-5 hours on my very dry skin .

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I love it. Its unlike any other perfume I've smelled or had. But unlike niche perfumes that are unusual, CK unusual creation Eternity Now is perfectly wearable. It has this wonderful pink soft yet bitter scent to it which is present through and through. So it is linear, being a bit fruity at the start and a bit woody at the dry down. Bright, pink fruity floral but not sweet and with a pretty bitter note.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: A very intimate fragrance sitting so close to the skin no-one will notice you wear it. Eternity now has citrusy and litchi sweet opening. Once it settles it smells floral, fresh and with just enough sweetness to make it pretty. Later developing heavier cashmere musky tones. It's ok for summer day at home scent.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Very fresh and light! To my nose there is a minty, herbal quality, and quite a dose of what seems to me to be lavender. The floral aspect is very very faint to me, and there is very little sweetness in my opinion. Just fresh, maybe even woody. I have tested it twice with the same result each time and I even went back to the website where I purchased the sample to double check it was CK eternity now for women that I had ordered, because my impression seems to be different from what others have written. But everyone’s different! 😁 Final thoughts: I like it but don’t love it. I wish I could smell the fruity notes- it would add so much :)

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Yikes... To my nose it smelled like air freshener so I think that’s what I will use it for...

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Nice rollerball scent.

Fresh fruity scent, indistinguishable floral notes, warmer musky base.

Good for office /t shirt / casual wear, unless you are on top of someone I doubt they will notice

Terrible in terms of strength or longevity. I must have applied 15 times today, rollerball all over wrists neck and cleavage, for a very mild scent.

Basic but lovely.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I don't smell any of the distinct notes described but yet it is still sharp--like Ralph Lauren's Romance and slightly powdery. The initial sweetness disappears extremely quickly. On my skin, it gets more peppery and slightly plastic-y. It reminds me of some body care or hair care product of the 90's. I do think this perfume feels rushed and unfinished, but not in a minimalistic way.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Bling bought it. Loved it. Its a little bit sour, fresh, floral, sweet. I love any sour fruity fragrance!!! This is a little artificial smell but I still like it. It is nothing I have ever smelled before. I usually love fragrances that are very sour - citric and sweet like Bright Crystal, Light Blue, DKNY Be delicious, etc. Very satisfied with ETERNITY NOW.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: even worse than the original! so powdery and headache inducing.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I purchased this for cheap at the duty free shop. I would say it is very fresh (without being aquatic) and fruity. I mostly get peach - it somehow reminds me a bit of Tresor in love but without the rose note. I have not worn it for a full day as it is very cold where I live right now - I think this would be better suited for spring and / or summer. From what I recall when I tried it out at the airport, sillage was moderate and longevity was quite short lived. I didn't pay much for it so I don't mind that. I am happy to add this to my growing collection.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I tried to be friends with her but she's too cool and cold. I was looking for a cozy or musky side but she stick her tongue to me. I said oh well you pretty little thing you must have your own fans out there.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Very nice fresh fruity scent - great to wear even on a summer day. Office appropriate.

Reminds me of Chanel Chance Eau Tendre EDT, but if I had to choose between the two, I would choose Chanel in a heartbeat - I think that one has more charm. Eternity Now is like the shy younger sister of Chance Eau Tendre - nice in its own way, but not quite as beautiful as older sis', sorry!

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Got a tester of this and it is this sweet fruity scent on my skin. Very similar to other fragrances I have. It makes for a great office scent. I personally don't think it is full bottle worthy but that is because I already own other fragrances that are similar and I love them more.
