Longevity: 4 hours
Sillage: very close to the skin
Recommend: If you don't have anything like it
Office appropriate: Absolutely.
Purchase: Nope. I won't be buying it.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
I bought this on a whim shortly after I started wearing MJ’s Daisy Eau So Fresh (which I LOOOOVE but dies to a whisper after half an hour on me) and I was definitely feeling more of the fresh fruity floral vibes as opposed to the cloying floral powder bombs that I’ve been obsessed with in the past.
I’ve never been a fan of CK, I wouldn’t have touched it but the sales assistant was optimistic so I thought wth and sprayed it directly into my wrist.. WOW!! It was an instant YES for me, the sparkling hit of lychee instantly lifted my spirits and I’m feeling the neroli love during the mid. The base notes are soft but there’s just enough muskiness to feel womanly, fruity fragrances are usually too saccharine and girly for my taste.
Yes, it’s inoffensive, it’s not groundbreaking or niche. It’s an everyday fragrance for sure but I can live with being ordinary (most of the time)

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
For some reason I got a whole bunch of testers of this during this spring time's perfume shopping. Only recently got into giving it a good test drive as my after gym/pool perfume (love samples for that purpose, cause they don't take up any space).

I have no clue what that fruit is which the main note consists of. There is no translation of it to my language it seems.

Anyway I do really like that peachy/fruity floral yet powdery opening burst. It's really very 'there' for the first half hour or so. It doesn't smell sharp or too sweet on me at all. But mind I live in a very hot and humid climate and most scents are a bit muted down by the heavy air here. It does settle though quite quickly to a peachy floral and within 3 hours it's mostly floral and musky.

I can imagine this being a cozy scent for any kind of climate. It would fit with a turtle neck cashmere sweater just as will as with a blouse or polo shirt.

If you're going to meet people who are sensitive to perfumes, maybe spray it an hour before meeting them. The beginning definitely has an 'oomph' but after an hour I can't really imagine anyone being offended by it.

No big wow here, but I really do like it. If I see a good offer anywhere in store I'll definitely grab myself a bottle.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This parfume smell like a cheap parfume. Its odour is ordinary.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
I've got many samples, Eternity Now is one of them I test sometime in office.
To me it's litchi and musk. At some point there's a beautiful salty vibe in it, similar but not identical to coconut milk, that unfortunately for me disappears in the drydown. It's smooth, simple but pretty, delightful indeed!

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Nice sharp smelling fragrance. I seem to smell coconut through it for some reason, Slightly sickly, but overall a pleasant safe choice. Would class as day wear. Would not buy it again.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
It smells sharp and not so great to me when just sprayed, to the point that it makes my nose itch. But once it settles, it's crisp/cold and fresh, almost soapy. I don't smell any litchi or peachy notes. On me, neroli becomes more dominant than anything else. It has got an attitude of a headmistress who is not so approachable and scares the kids to be on her bad side.
I'd give it 8/10 for longevity and 6/10 for sillage.
It's a great to wear in the office or even casually if you like to keep weak people away. It's not warm or mushy at all. I'd wear it from time to time but never make it my signature for my nose's sake.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: My newest blind buy. My initial reaction is, it smells like Paco Robanne Olympea, (which i strongly dislike as it makes me nauseous)..... Eternity Now, however, has a different dry down, and i can see myself reaching for this one occasionally...... The peachy note is more mellow than in Olympea.....

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
my bad, I didn't spray it on my body when I bought this parfume. it was good when I sniffed from the bottle.
the first time when I sprayed it on my wirst, I was like "ew, this is bad" it did smell like Tokyo by paris hilton; I agree with a comment above.
maybe it's from the lemon, but it's too sharp and makes me a bit dizzy.

the day after, I gave it a chance and well the dry down smells better than Tokyo and maybe I started to like this.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I started wearing this again with a new found love. It is peony and neroli with a woody base. Sweet, sour and a tad bitter all seamlessly blended into a masterful concoction that with only a couple sprays projects a clean and fresh veil of scent. This is quality. This is a grown up classic and a refreshing change from all of the new gourmands out there that to me do not project. This is not a skin scent but the fragrance seems to float around you. I would call it a fresh powerhouse.It only takes a couple of sprays so do not overdo.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Very very similiar to Paris Hiltons "tokyo" smells very spicy and fruity, would wear every now and then.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Eternity Now is a fresh, citrusy floral best suited to Summer and Spring. It has an almost shampoo-vibe and brings to mind the Incanto range by Salvatore Ferragamo, which share a similar fresh fruitiness on the skin.

I wore the original Eternity for Women when I was still a university student. I loved its laundry-fresh scent during the warmer months and it was a fragrance I could either dress up or dress down. The subsequent Eternity flankers have honoured the crisp, fresh aroma found in the original by adding more floral notes or centering more on the citrus aspects.

Eternity Now is a bright, sparkling burst of yuzu, litchi, peony, neroli and musk to my nose. It's more fruity and citrusy than floral, however I must admit that this appears to be in its favour. Eternity Now is sure to appeal to those women that live in a humid, warm climate as the scent's longevity keeps you smelling fresh and clean for hours.

Unfortunately Eternity Now is not my personal cup of tea, however I do understand its appeal. It's one of the better flankers from the Eternity range, although it shares very little in common with the original.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: To my nose this is a combination of original Eternity and Eternity Moment with a touch of fruit, although I don't find it to be as nice or as interesting as either of those two perfumes. The dry down is closer to Eternity Moment, but much sharper. It's an OK perfume, but I'm glad I only purchased a rollerball.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
I curiously reached for the tester and at first spritz I found it simply horrible..even after half an hour I was wondering who would want to even bother with this fragrance or what occasion would it suit..Only when a good bit of time elapsed did I start finding it familiar, and it dawned on me that I had something similar in my younger years..as I started thinking I realized it was Moschino Cheap and Chic..Maybe they`re not similar otherwise, but on me - hell yea.
It`s nothing like the original Eternity or Eternity Summer, this is probably a brand new take - although it`s not quite my cup of tea I must say it would make a good summer perfume as it isn`t too sweet or flowery, more sour, unlike most of today`s perfs, which is really refreshing these days as there has been too much sugary going on..So if you are in need of something a little different than all the candies - try this one of the days this summer. Or if you ever liked Moschino Cheap and Chic (black-white-gold bottle) it could be a top notch for you.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Love the opening
Not amazing longevity, but ok, fresh sweet clean, juicy.
NZ is expensive but maybe in the USA much cheaper

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I didn't like this at first. It reminded me of Bounce dryer sheets, but the more I smelled it, the more I liked it. There is a tangy fruitiness with just enough sweetness to make it pretty. It's very fresh and inoffensive. I like a fragrance I can wear anytime, anyplace. Eternity Now is subtle enough to wear to church, but special enough to wear to a party. Very versatile.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
My quest for a Summer heatwave appropriate fragrance continues - and this is definitely in the top 5! My tastes tend towards heavier florals and orientals, however these just don't work in Sydney weather right now.
I wanted something bright and refreshing, like a frozen margerita to wear, and this is perfect. The opening is fizzy and fruity without being sugary, and the musky drydown stays tingly, but a bit cheeky at the same time, and with a surprising depth.
Brilliant for hot summer days and balmy nights.
Unmistakably Calvin Klein.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Don't understand why so many dislikes. Luckily I didn't rely on votes here, for a blind buy/avoid.
I'm a bit of a sceptic when it comes to CK perfumes, they don't go well with me, but this one is different. I'm wearing it for almost 6h now, loving the smell. It is freshly sweet, not too little, or too much of anything. Just right.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Eternity is a fragrance dependent on body chemistry; for me it’s a fresh, soapy, clean smell initially then dries down to a sweet, fruity, fresh and musky scent. It has a better wear on cooler days in the spring in my opinion. It lasts a while and the sillage is decent.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Too floral and it smells so bad on my hand that I really want to take" a shower to get it off ... This could be anyone's perfume.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
I find this COMPLETELY different from anything I've tried before.
I smelled it and "BANG", The perfume that I was waiting for. Unique, sexy.
However, I have to be in a certain mood to wear it. but it's amazing. The men version must be also great, have to smell it

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Starts with fresh, sweet fruity smell. It lasts quite long and it's very nice.

Unfortunately the base is all cashmere wood. And there's somehing about cashmeran that bothers me. It's so wet concrete on my skin and reminds me of moist cellar. So I can't use this anymore.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Love it. It's fresh summery and a little musky. I find with the exception of the original that a lot of the Eternity fragrances (the flankers) have terrible staying power. This however has great longevity and also projects quite nicely. A definite keeper.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Hmm, upon first spray, this smells like a combination of Victoria's Secret Love Spell, musk, and dryer sheets. I like it! It is very fruity with the main fruit note being peaches. It makes me nostalgic. I think I had a toy cleaning kit as a child that smelled like this. After a while, it becomes much more musky and dry, and even more reminiscent of peachy dryer sheets. It also somewhat reminds me of a fizzy bath bomb. Very wearable and inoffensive.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Just bought this little gem at Kohls yesterday., this is my very first purchase of any CK fragrance as I took an utter dislike to CK One and the old Eternity of years ago, plus, I am a French Fragrance lover.
I was happily testing away when my hubby said "smell this one "I really like it"!
I sprayed a card, and immediately smelled Grapefruit. I sprayed on my elbow crease and went to the Hanndbags.
About Ten minutes later I smelled a fresh, sweetness with that grapefruit still prominent and knew this was for me.
Eternity NOW is different than all the fruity and shallow new fragrances out there. It has a deep mysteriousness that is confusing but lively and lovely.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: L-O-V-E!!! I find NOW very sheer and pretty, without smelling like anything else I have worn in the past. It is fresh and feminine with just the right amount of cream, floral, and musk scents all mixed together. I feel like this is what I might also describe as a dry floral scent too. I don't typically love florals, but this one works for me. A great everyday fragrance for spring and summer!

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This perfume is very strong and smells so good. I have nothing else that smells like this. I detect floral and grapefruit notes. I

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
There's nectarine blossom and neroli again. In addition some peony. This is a complicated composition for me, too fresh and sharp, kind of in your face.
It's not the worst of the worst but I would rather not wear it.
There's some sweetness coming along after a few hours. But it doesn't change the fact, it's not very unique and not very good.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I like this. Soft smell. Not make my nose sneezing after wearing it.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Wow. I really do not understand the negative ratings. I have noticed that often times fresh light fruity/florals get a lot of bad rep on this site, whereas sweeter, heavier more complex fragrances seem to get a lot more fan love. Maybe I am an odd bird, but I generally gravitate towards the lighter fresher scents. Easy-going, fun-loving. They usually seem to resinate more with me. They are just more "me" somehow. Lighter, fresher scents make me feel comfortable in my own skin, like me but better if you will. However there is something extra special about CK Eternity Now. I think it is the Peach blossom and the Sorbet that make me go completely gaga over it :)

Granted, I also appreciate many sweet and some heavier scents, but sometimes they make me work for their love, whereas with perfume like CK Eterny Now things are just easy from the get go. That is what I love about this scent. It actually smells AMAZING and I don't have to take time to get to know it or understand it. It's just plain good, from start to finish. No hidden agenda. What you smell is what you get. I love that.

Some might say that this is not a masterpiece. That it is simple and linear and that there is no complexity to be found. Those to me can be positive qualities in a fragrance. To me that does not equal this being a "bad" perfume. It means that this is the PERFECT every day scent. The complex and heavy hitters are not the beginning and the end in the world of perfume. They are not all there is. We can have variety. In my case the heavy hitters are surely also appreciated but they can wait for special occasions. I don't want to smell "complex" every day. I want to smell approachable and just plain nice and that is exactly what Eternity Now does for me :)

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
After being thoroughly impressed and instantly liking with Eternity Now for Men, I was eager to try Eternity Now for Women.

Unfortunately, this one is not as unique or original as Eternity Now for Men. Eternity Now for Women smells like so so so many other floral-fruity-musky melange fragrances out for women. It's safe and bland. It does nothing different or nothing new. It opens as a bright, aqueous floral with a wisp of something fruity. Eventually it becomes a floral musk.

Ladies, skip this one and check out Eternity Now for Men. That one is unique, original, fresh, and entirely unisex (much like CK Reveal for Men is entirely unisex). Eternity Now for men smells like a delicious tropical/summer themed hair conditioner or lotion. It's sweet and milky nuance make it truly addicting.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: My hubs just got this for me recently. I like it but didnt fall in love with it. When i first sprayed this i only could smell fruits. Im not a fan of fruity note unless its mixed with floral notes. I like perfumes with much flowers less fruits. I had to check fragrantica for notes. Floral? I dont smell floral or musk..maybe a fade weak floral...maybe. strangly i could smell peaches although its not there. im dissappointed...it doesnt hold up to my other fragrances. i will use it to freshen up after morning showers.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This is very powerful and juicy perfume. Sweet, but not vanilla kind of sweet, but very sexy. Added on my wishlist!

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Not so much musk or floral - to me this is monstly sweet fruit (peach or apricot). And it is not a bad thing at all if I feel like wearing a sweet and fruity perfume that day. It is quite an optimistic fragrance, great for summer. The longevity is ok, I can smell peach on my skin for hours. The other notes - not so much though.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This fragrance is so terribly flat. You basically don't smell any of those fruity starting notes, it surprises you directly with straight into your face peach blossom that doesn't develop much throughout time. To me, it's an uninteresting scent, where the base notes don't come into a game whatsoever.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Delicious! Adorable! Lasts and lasts and lasts and doesn't change on my skin which is perfect in the world of rapidly fading maistream fragrances.
Cheerful fruity coctail for sulky morning. Refreshing, invigorating. But it is more than a simple fruity one, because has depth and boosts your selfesteem.
A beautiful woman in comfort wear, with small, sophisticated pieces of jewellery.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This is sour-sweeet-powdery. Way too powdery for me. I love original eternity a lot. I don't notice anything similar between both, but I still do like it.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I love this, it's light, sweet and fresh. A happy scent I feel more for warm months probably will wear in winter on occasion to boost mood.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
This fragrance has a lovely fruity top note that stays with you for roughly 30 minutes then you get to the real beauty it smells absolutely delicious warm and delightful. I've bought the 30ml blind and I'm going to get a 100ml back up that's how much I love this fragrance. Doesn't remind me of the original eternity. Would highly recommend you test this on skin .
Top Notes
Lychee, Quince sorbet
Heart Notes
Peony, Peach blossom, Neroli
Base notes
Cashmere woods, Ambrox, Musk

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Well this is a very chemical fragrance. Initially i get peach, peach and more peach with some sorbet and peony. But oh..beware do not smell this to closely, don't get your wrist up to your nose it can burn your nostrils hairs! HARSH! very weird ammonia or burning plastic smell! yuck!

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Nice very nice, and idk about now or later but I enjoy the same scent by my kitchen cleaning spray detergent. I honestly hate these cleaning products companies that beat designers. Too late CK, Ive already associated in my brain this scent with cleaning spray.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Delicato e confortante, un dolce sorbetto di frutta adagiato sopra un letto di fiori. Nelle note di fondo lascia nun velo cipriato sulla pelle davvero gradevole.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: So I found a tester of this, 100mls size for 39.99 on my fav website :) I just got it, and I noticed this site says it's an EDT when the box says EDP. Either way OMFG it's so nice! Hands down new fav!

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This is stunning! I was blown away honestly! I kind of like eternity moment and a few other from this line but not any love for any of them, this however was a major love. I'm not sure what notes stand out, but it's very fresh, very soft but bold at the same time. It's the type of grown up woman scent, but a grown up that doesn't have to be too grown up all the time, someone fun and flirty. Love this! Sad that it's so bloody expensive! Saw it for 98 dollars, and. I doNOT pay that kind of price lol

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This smelled like a fruit salad on the verge of rotting. Something is just 'off' in this composition to me. Another disappointing new release...

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Wooow, what a weird sensation to smell this for the first time! It's so artificially fruity - like a strawberry in the middle of winter - with more preservatives than the fruit itself:( And so generic! In no way does this correspond to the whole Eternity range which is a legendary one, it smells more like a low-shelf EDT for schoolgirls below 10. Not that it's very bad but totally out of place and time - like some "Moomin" or "Alice in Wonderland" sort of thing - childlish-psychodelic kind of sensation... As if someone entered the perfume lab and experimented there for the first time without any knowledge and eventually came up with this with a big smile on their face! No offense, but this was my first impression. I think I'll give it another chance some day but rather reluctantly.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This is lovely fruity powdery and long lasting the eternity flankers are so mixed i feel this could of belonged more to the downtown line.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
As going to buy me a staple I've been missing today....Versace Versense.
I might have just bought me this instead !
I was so surprised over Eternity getting a fresh family member .
As a contrary to most of the earlier reviewers above me, I really liked it !
It was fresh and juicy and lovely , perhaps cause it was this type of perfume I was aiming for this time...
Today I was persistent and bought my old staple for the fourth time,
as I am soon to leave for summerholidays.
I think this is no where near detergent and one of us here , cant count it out so soon...you just wait....
Well done , fresh juicy and potent - not an easy thing to do !

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Another Juicy Couture without the cute bottle.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
let me say, I love Ann Gottlieb.
But, this perfume is a disaster. It is a smell, that hit your nose when you enter place where cleaning is done generically. It is this cheap spray or aroma that keep you feeling dizzy and wanting to get out of there as of Now. Sorry, just a disaster.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Peachy scents are often quite nauseous to my nose and this time it hasn't been any different. I can smell a lot of peach blossom and barely any other note. Eternity would be a disaster with such an unhealthy scent.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I discovered this today, it overpowered any other perfume I sampled it's quite nice but way too strong for me- very long silage. I have a feeling if I spent more time with her I would come to like her better.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Grapefruit!!! That is what Eternity Now screams at you right at the get go. The "sorbet" is just an icy sweetness dulling down the sharp tang. The florals never really have a chance to sing because the soapy muskiness masks their beauty, and instead really has a BO scent that rears its ugly head in about 3 hours. No one wants that. Another disappointment from CK in their women's line in my opinion. The unisex and men's cologne are generally far more pleasing.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I love this perfume! I tried it in a magazine and fell in love as soon as I smell it!

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
I found it for a decent price on eBay, and I got a decent fragrance...let' s just say I expected different..seems Ann Gotlieb has a thing for juicy light fragrances..first notes are very bright, juicy bright, like a tropical cocktail, nice, the quince sorbet gives it a different edge,almost like a grapefruit vibrant scent, but the dry down falls flat in my opinion...it is a bit warm, a bit musky, nothing great...i
I don't think it is like Eternity Moment, but it isn't in the base radically different. I kind of prefer Moment...
Calvin Klein is for me a hit and miss, at times, brilliant creations, most of the times, purely mainstream and a bit forgettable.
Eternity Now is just a flop in my opinion, it will never capture the beauty of the original,Eternity Now is more like an Escada, in its fruity cocktail character.

product_name: Eternity Now For Women Calvin Klein
review_content: An update for eternity moment? that one is being discontined but this one seems very similar even the color of the juice is similar. I shall wait & see if this ever made it into the local stores so I can compare the two of the eternity versions.

For those who miss this perfume, I highly recommend DS&Durga’s Steamed Rainbow. The scent is nearly identical - though Steamed Rainbow is more refined and has better longevity. I’m really glad I discovered it, because CK One Summer 2006 holds a special place in my heart, and it’s amazing to be able to smell it again through Steamed Rainbow.

This was my first "real" perfume back in high school. Given as a birthday gift, this meant I was no longer limited to the body sprays and splashes of my classmates. This was around the same time I got my drivers license, and a car with no working air conditioning in the Pennsylvania summer. So to me, the sunshiney citrus and bright greens evoke the nostalgia of wind blowing through my hair and the freedom and hope that comes from just starting to grow up.

I wish I could find this or a good dupe
Had this one in the large bottle, oh how I loved it, best ever summer fragrance.

Just picked this up today for about $17, about 90ml left in the bottle. Some of the reviews, such as the one below this, made me go out and find it. I smelled lemon and cantaloupe right off the first few test sprays. After about 20 seconds, I went nose blind to it. Couldn't really smell it anymore after the first half-minute. I'm sure it's very nice for other people to smell it on me, which is one reason to wear it.

I searched for this for 9 years! A female friend wore it in 07 and I asked what it was cause I LOVED it.

Sadly, all she said was 'calvin Klein' so I searched and bought anything CK 08 or before so basically purchased all eternity summers and realize none were what I woas looking for. I also bought CK summer unisex 07/08 and nope, so I KNEW it had to be CK summer 06!

Sadly, NOBODY had this for purchase until I found it on eBay! Yayyy and got it cheap considering it's discontinued. I love this, very fresh and citrusy. A bona fide unisex fragrance. My wait was worth it :)

Works really good on my skin, the opening note of melon and citrus combine to create a fresh cucumber/honey dew type scent with sweet and salty undertones created by the musk and incense it is a really sexy and nice fragrance for males that women will be drawn to.
Had this back in high school. It was a blind buy. Too citrus-y for me. Some days it's refreshing, some days it made me cringe. I don't know. All I could recall now is just the headache I was getting.

This one was a gift when I was much younger.It brings back all the memories of my immature days.Quite nostalgic I must say.I really adore this scent.Unfortunate I finished the juice years ago but still keep the bottle for memories sake.Would love to buy another bottle if given the chance.
This one is the best out of all the CK One Summer, very zesty lemony, fresh n lovely. Really bringback memories... LOVE LOVE LOVE.....

This is my favorite cologne, aside from all the memories it carries. It is very simple, a soft citrus smell that not too lemony/limey, very good blend. I get migraines from smells so for me its longevity is good as well as its projection although for others I can understand it might be too soft.

I really wish they would re release this smell, or recycle it in a future ck summer

I have this in the 3.4 oz EDT. In my opinion, this is a horrible fragrance in the bottle and on my skin. I think it was a blind buy, or I just thought it smelled good at the perfume store. Either way, I absolutely hate it. It's very strong, and almost has an alcohol scent. It's manly in a bad way. Maybe it's the cedar and incense notes that ruin it? I just can't bring myself to like it, so would not suggest this to anyone.

But I do keep it, because the bottle is very pretty, and looks nice on my makeup table. :)

I am the kind of person that loves unisex perfume so much especially CK one Summer line, and of course I really like this bottle of CK one Summer.

I would say it's perfect for summer, opens very fresh and citrusy, but sweet and tender enough to be a feminine perfume. I love it from the top to dry-down where it gives a very warm and tender feeling of Musk and Cedar.

I would say that it lasted quite long on my skin, I thought it does not last at all, but I get off work at 6 in the evening and I can't smell anything anymore, yet my co-workers says I smell so lovely so I would say it last about 8 hours, which is good enough for me, although I would say that it has average sillage.

Bottom line: it's a good summer perfume, very uplifting.

At the time this came out my mother loved it, but I thought it was a little girlie (not that I don't wear femme scents it's just there were so many other mens scents I wanted for my collection) so I passed. Now I wish I'd got it and she won't part with it...DRAT!)

It begins with a melon and petit grain top, fruity fresh and green. The heart is floral-green with the unique sourness of rhubarb and a twist of lemon, quite refreshing. The base is where it got strange for me peach (usually appears earlier in the development)and musk and incense dance around a cedar core that mellows it slightly. I must admit: this one is quite different and while it is marketed as unisex it leans toward the feminine while finishing with a sweet masculine fruity yet aromatic whisper. This is the kind of thing I look for nowadays and there is nothing like this. Three or four years ago I was more worried about how OTHER people thought about how I smelled than with my OWN preferences and pleasure. Learn from my mistakes, I sure did!

Sillage: average
Longevity: decent for a summer
Overall: 3/5

This is not the sweet beach party/fruit salad kind of summer it's more enjoy the fresh crisp scents of nature in your own backyard/early summer type of scent...amazing!
this is the exxence of summer for me, super sweet, wildly over the top and totally unpretentious! my favourite for days on the beach during the long australian summer

this one is rather sweet just match for casual day, like other unisex collection this is too feminin for those who expect masculinity, but it gives warm and safe feeling when around women. its defenitely an everyday cologne for me

Not even vaguely as interesting as the notes would indicate - light and juicy lemon, and THAT"S IT lol good for what it is, at any rate.....and disposable, as CK seemes to create a new edition each summer....
This unisex fragrance would smell great as a perfume and also, it's not too sweet or feminine to be a cologne. Highly recommended for a hot summer day as either a perfume or cologne.
I just rediscovered this fragrance. It has been stored well and still smells exactly as it did in 2005! Twenty years ago! The performance is great too, it outlasts some recent EDPs I own.
A photorealistic frangipani flower leads the way into a summer scape of bright fruits.
Oh gosh, I really wish I had the chance to smell this once again in this life...

Beautiful uplifting happy summer scent, sweet and fresh at the same time. It’s been almost two decades since I had it and I still haven’t forgotten it. And the bottle…oh my gosh…I just love everything about this product! I hope CK brings this one back to life some time soon, as it was truly their best summer scent.

Nice scent, Orange, kiwi, frangipani. its opening smell is floral and orange, from 30 minutes it feels a heavy tone of fruit and flowers. Perfect for the beach. Found it brand new and sealed in a vintage fragrance store.

I haven't been able to find this vintage in a few years, kinda sad actually. As we can all tell, this was one of the best years vintages of CK one summer ever. Everything you wanted in a summertime scent, day or night, was in this bottle. So many other designer scents, and more recent vintages of this scent have copied it. It just smelled so Friggen amazing, people actually you'd walk by them on the pier, or in the gas lamp district on the street, and they'd come back after you just to get a smell of this juice. Fun times, just wish I could find it again.

Scent:10 One of the best scents ever made
Longevity:5
Sillage:4
Unique/Industry First:10
Quality:7
If only could find a bottle of this piece of heaven again....ah nostalgia...

Finally found it.. But it's not something i love, but still i like it. Lovely like all of CK One Summer... CK is my favourite house

New Review: This perfume is growing with me, now i find this very beautiful, love in a bottle, i love it...

the best ever version of CK One Summer...like a field of orange trees in explosion of joy...and golden summer memories for me, like a fiesta,like a ray of sun,like an endless summernight...a magical one,indeed
i like the scent, like a tropical fruit. a good and must have perfume for man and woman who likes freshness in the air.

From my other cK 1 Summer reviews you may know that I got this shower gel and thought it went with a different version. The reviews below compare this to shampoo and since I only have the body wash maybe I did not miss much...

The shower gel is fruity while I use it, but leaves a tropical floral scent (hibiscus) in the bathroom. It leaves just a hint of musk on my skin when its dry so it can pretty much be used with other versions...

I have a chance to test this and the words come in my mind is "shampoo" It's kinda smelling of detergent and tropical fruit mixed.I think this one would be better on a girl, more feminie than musculine and for every casual sporty day.

I ordered my dad to buy me a specific perfume while he was abroad, but he got the wrong one, which is this one. :p But I like it though. I wouldn't have thought of buying a perfume like this, it's more masculine than my other scents. But it can work for me too, a day I'm feeling sporty.

It's fresh and orangy. I think it can be worn both in the summer and in the winter. It's not heavy.It's a sweet but not too sweet floral perfume, with a fruity tone added by the citrus.

I think it's great for casual everyday wear and it's rather inoffensive. Smells good.

CK One Summer 2005 is quite close to its previous edition. It starts with really strong notes of orange and peach, but it soon becomes a heavy floral (at least on my skin). I can detect the frangipani note, one of my favorite flowers.

The base is almost identical to CK One Summer 2004. Overall, a really nice and summer fragrance.

i just love the scent...it's fresh, not too strong...mild and it doesn't give you a headache..
it made my man fall for me.. it's just the perfect scent for the summer.

The smell is sunny and fruity.
Beautifully for hot and also cooler days.

Der Duft ist sonnig und fruchtig.
Schön für warme und auch kühlere Tage.

nice scent. i'm wearing it during... winter coz it makes me feel like on the beach during hot summer ;]

after using it for about 2 months:

i still like this scent but i find this a little bit synthetic... it reminds me some kid of good shampoo

I blind bought this because of such nice reviews, but this to me smells so soapy! Not woody (that I was hoping for) or floral… it’s aquatic and “fresh clean sheets” smelling, but I must admit that I’m disappointed.

I had this fragrance in 2017, from kohl’s on sale (I think another commenter said the same) and OMG I loved it. I bought the 3.4 oz and used it with reckless abandon…because it’s Calvin Klein! Who would’ve thought finding a Calvin Klein fragrance would be hard?!

Anyway, it WAS hard. I quickly realized how hard it was to find after 2019. Recently, (in 2022!) I finally got my hands on brand new bottles and stocked up.

The middle aquatic notes are so very Calvin Klein (who made some of the most iconic scents in the 80s and 90s)…but something about the bergamot and desert rose top notes, and the saffron middle with sandalwood and musk base notes make an enticing exotic elixir that satisfies my nose and soul.

The aquatic notes appeal to my "coming of age in the 90s" heart, but the added saffron in the middle, musk, and spice base notes makes it an alluring sexy adult summer scent.
This perfume really blooms overtime. The desert rose and aquatic notes work well together, culminating in an ethereal yet slightly sweet scent that's perfect for casual daytime wear.

My all time favorite perfume. I did not expect to love this, but after trying it one time it lingered for several hours and the scent kept getting better and better. I wore this through all of 2017. Now I bought two bottles and I will see how long they will last me. This scent is just absolutely beautiful. Fresh, Tropical, spicy, aquatic

Love, love, love this scent. This just smells so summer to me and is light but gorgeous! I get a ton of compliments when I wear it! So sad that I can't get it anymore so I am hoarding what I do have. If you ever see this I highly recommend!!

Came across this in Khols yesterday half price 34.50 for a 3.4oz. Figured what the heck! Glad I went for it. Got the Men's version as well.

So its a typical CK. Great smell, but sits closer to the skin and can be worn in hot weather or in close proximity to people you wouldn't want to offend with your fragrance. Even though the scent is light it lasts! I sprayed it on my hand last night before bed, and it has withstood numerous hand washings! Scent is an aqueous slightly spiced woody subtle floral. It is somewhat reminiscent of the desert as the inspiration point. However I live in Florida and in the humidity I think it comes off quite beachy. At its base its a lovely sandalwood salted musk. Trust me that smells better than it sounds. Another kill for this bargain hunter! Whoop Whooo!

I had to buy a bottle after just one spray. The description indicates desert, but I get a beachy vibe. I grew up by the beach and this instantly reminds me of home. Salty air and driftwood, but light and fresh enough for the hot weather. Probably won't work in any other season, but this smells just like summer to me.

+1 to everyone talking about the woodiness.

Definitely woody with florals and freshness. Citrus is there but not dominant as the fragrance develops. Feminine. Unisex. Slight cleaning supply fabreeze smell.

4 hours longevity on me.

At the right price this is a quality release... But not safe for a blind buy.

I don't agree with the main accords in the above order, they are should read:
Woody
Fresh
Floral....
Then whatever else.

Not a favourite by any means, but one to temper down any sweeter fragrances that you've grown tired of.
If you've got other flankers then you don't need this, unless woods work for you.
If this wasn't so cool I think I might like it more.
It's a light everall fragrance but wood heavy.

I tried it today, and it smells very nice, contrary to the other versions, this one is bright, packs a punch too, it is quite floral, in a summery way...fresh also..I detect a hint of a tropical spicy vibe , not overdone, this is feminine, very wearable too...I find it smells better than the other versions...it is also more grown up, whereas other versions were rather simplistic..I need to try it again, but so far, quite impressed by this pretty feminine scent .

Hi
This is very woody to me.
Bvlgari woody.

It has fresh notes along the same strain as others from the eternity summer line.
It could be masculine, especially to someone just starting to try fragrance. I wouldn't say it's a safe blind buy.

Fro me, one would have to layer this with another, I thought maybe Gucci flora, I have that on and I dislike the end sweet notes of it.

Wearable yes, for any occasion or season, no.

Yeah, very woody, floral, fresh.
Nothing sweet or warm about it. Which is also an ok thing.

One of the best summer fragrances on the market this year if you ask me. Very fresh, feminine, elegant and lovely mix of summery notes that create an exquisite scent for the hot days and months ahead. A must-have buy for me, definitely! And it does not fade away that quickly either (as many airy fragrances unfortunately tend to do) which is a huge plus factor.

I just smelled this at Ulta and I'm wondering if these notes are right because I swear this smells similar to CK Eternity Night for Women! This smells like the daytime tropical/beach version of Eternity Night in fact and I love it! Eternity Night is a heavy white floral, but it has a lot of appeal for me; Eternity Summer 2017 has a nice tropical twist added. Even my mom, who isn't into fragrances, said it smells really good. Projection is nice and it's lasted for a few hours so far without changing much on me (another plus since my skin can do some funky things to perfumes). Will definitely be buying a full bottle of this for daytime wear!
i plant that desert rose. Never notice it has smell.

Hopefully the watery notes aren't so prevalent because all the other notes look quite nice. The olibanum, saffron, and sandalwood sound quite promising, but then again this is a "summer" release as well.

The ordinary Eternity is not my cup of tea at all (the kind of screechy scent that gives me headaches)
But this one… so different from the original.
I really like it. Soft iris and make up.
And yes, it is similar to Lipstick On which I also have and love 💜

I don’t know why I looked at the notes and proceeded to buy this. It’s iris. I don’t even like iris. I know I don’t even like iris, and I bought it anyway.

For what it’s worth, I actually quite like this. It smells like powdery Parma violets to me. Not the most seductive, and it’s certainly a world away from Eternity and Eternity Moment but it’s nice enough.

It lasts a couple of hours of me. I won’t get through a whole bottle so I’m giving it away.

I liked it and it was that. Used a 30ml bottle and that was it. But sometimes I thought about it somehow nostalgic, do when they now three a batch on the marker I bought 2 big bottles. They came and I was somehow dissappointed, the smell lacked szparkę, was kind od mediocre. I let it sit and sprayed my elbow at home to get na idea od nie to wear it. AND GUYS.... today is a rainy autumn dark grey damy, when I usually wear chopard casmir at home and that was that. I layered them both and it was magic. The mediocre eternity gained sweter vanilla and spices from Casmir and became a bad sexy bitch. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THiS COMBINATION.

Why I didn’t look up the notes of this before purchasing is beyond me. My personal preferences are not for anything iris or orris or powdery. This is a sweet powdery floral musk. I don’t really see any of the original Eternity’s characteristics. The dry down is slightly more likable to me, although the synthetic sweetness isn’t something I enjoy. I think I was roped in by the deep topaz glass bottle. I’m a sucker for that, and usually find them to hold warm sexy fragrances. This is not that. I admit, I’m just not into this style of fragrance. It is not my personal taste in any way. There are those who love iris, and those who don’t. It’s a pretty polarizing note in my opinion. I regret this purchase, but will find a happy home for it far far away from my nose!
100% Parma violets.

I love a powdery, earthy iris scent - and the notes on this looked so promising. Unfortunately I find it to be quite a dense, sweet powder note that dominates in this perfume. It lacks the dry, dusty, otherworldly characteristics of orris that I love.

It's not a bad scent, and for sure it is more appealing to me than the original Eternity, but it also lasts about an hour max even on clothes, so it's a bit disappointing in terms of performance.

Straight up its marshmallows. Strong, almost overpowering with just one spray on one arm. After 2 hours mellows a little to a nutty, powdery scent. After 4 hours, its the sooty, slightly burnt bottom of the pan you have cooked caramel in.
After 5 hours, a softer vanilla and still powdery but now that just one spray is a skin scent. I have had for about a year, and rarely reach for it because of the very strong opening. Definitely a winter scent.
I have to agree with the other reviewers. Way too powdery! It starts off with a strong floral bergamot scent, but then smells like baby powder. Not impressed & would not recommend it.

I find this scent heavy and perfumey. It has a vintage quality to it... it makes me think of showgirls or stage performers from old movies. I can imagine them spritzing this on as the final touch after they've finished their hair and makeup. It's feminine, grown and formal. I wouldn't say it particularly smells like iris to me, but maybe that's just because it's a different iris than what I'm used to. A better one, to be honest! I've never been a big iris fan but I don't mind this. Overall not bad, but it's a bit too dated for me. I like some of the associations it evokes, but it's not something I see myself reaching for that often. It's for who it's for. Not a bad scent, just not fully my taste.

One of the best irisis I ever smelled. It's a refined scent that reminds me of chloé nomad a little bit... but it is definetly not a fresh scent, I would reccommend this more for women between the ages of 30-40 or so.. or for elder ladies.
Too powdery, unpleasant dry down and Week lasting. Not worth any cheep price
This deserves a much higher numeric score. Call it the poor girl's Misia!

This one is actually one of the best irises I've smelled, closest to the bottle I could see myself buying. A buttery, make up bag iris, lipstick, a little synthetic but, definitely iris dominant, no violets, just that touch sweet, smells like a boudoir and i am here for it. Even has that touch carrot seedy earthy vibe which I LOVE in these style perfumes, and a touch of rose always puts a lovely romantic twist on such a perfume. I really like it, lets see how long it performs, I could see myself owning this and wearing a full bottle over the next years! Drydown a beautiful aromatic spring floral. Love it.

This is more of a note-to-self rather than a review.

Yes, it’s synthetic and cheap-smelling compared to my go-to fragrances, but lipstick usually smells synthetic anyway so I don’t mind.
I reach for this when I’m in the mood for a (mostly linear) makeup/lipstick scent that has prominent iris and orris notes, but doesn’t have much complexity or “sophistication” going on -I use Lipstick Rose for that. This smells like a beautiful woman getting ready for an occasion with all of her makeup open and spread on her vanity. When I first got this, I did get the weird banana scent; now it’s been replaced with a bright albeit slightly synthetic raspberry. For the price, this is a lovely option to scratch that makeup scent itch.
It smells nothing like OG Eternity and it makes no sense as a flanker, probably why it got discontinued which is a shame, as this is much more interesting than that entire lineup.

The original Eternity was my signature scent in the 90s, and this is a deeper yet more playful iteration. The opening was quite similar to the original, but once the aquatic note dissipates and the base notes unveil is when this one really shines. It is sweeter, and the dry down is beautiful, with the osmanthus shining through.

A creamy , buttery orris in the opening that is soft and settles into a beautiful makeup-y iris . I like that it’s not too sweet , and on my skin I get mainly a make up scent. Wish it projected more but it’s beautiful and worth it for the cheap price .

I wore this to bed last night, and whoa! Iris galore! But it's not sickly sweet, and it has an intense chocolate note along with lots of lovely orris root. I can't believe how good this is, and I think it's a pity that it was discontinued. I find it much more interesting than any other recent Calvin Klein scents that I can recall. It probably wasn't the best bedtime scent because it didn't seem to fade away, as I expected--it intensified over hours into a delectable iris-chocolate-rose-vanilla sandalwood concotion. It's a real trip, and it seems to behave nicely on my skin (which I prepped beforehand with unscented body lotion, contributing to the longevity, I'm sure). I will buy another, bigger bottle if the price is right. I wish they would just rerelease this under a different name since it smells nothing like Eternity or any other CK fragrance I can think of.

As others have noticed, it has a pronounced makeup-powder scent, like old-timey luxury makeup, with an almost photorealistic "lipstick rose" effect, only it's suffused with iris. It reminds me a tiny bit of my beloved Misia because it's such a good makeup smell, but it's a lot weirder. I see why it's listed as being comparable to Alien--so many of my favorite scents are--but that one is all about the jasmine, and this one lets the iris dominate (along with the similar, more powdery orris). I don't think I have anything else in my collection that carries quite such a Golden Age Hollywood face powder vibe. Just to indulge in some mild anachronism here, I could imagine Rita Hayworth wearing this, but I could also imagine Jeanne Moreau or Simone Signoret wearing it. To me it smells glamorous and melancholy, like a rainy spring day in Paris. It smells like a deep violet dusk. Spectacular!
My bottle no longer has that bruised banana smell. Guess it has to sit for it to turn lovely. The orris comes through nicely.. this would be great on a man too
It would be a love for me if it lasted longer.

I cannot wear the original Eternity. Too aquatic. But these notes look just lovely and I adore a good iris. So I was pleased to see Sephora carrying such a promising looking flanker. Could this be the Eternity for me?

NO!

I want to add that it is an excellent fragrance. The notes are strong and have good sillage and smell feminine, expensive, and modern. It is not particularly unique, nor do I smell iris, but that's non-essential. As a fragrance it is quite presentable and even a good value considering the poor sillage and longevity of many a brand name release.

But.

Do not attempt to wear this thinking that it has no aquatic nature. I don't smell a 'watery note', but the aroma chemical 'calone' is here in abundance. It reeks on me, as 'calone' always has. No complaints on the right skin, obviously.

One note: I'm rather surprised to see these notes listed. I almost smelled the sweet orange blossom/pear note so popular right now with a hint of purple (the elusive iris?!) rather than anything else. But regardless, this is a decent and powerful perfume. ONE spray lasted long past 3 doses of hand sani...

A familiar lipstick-y waxiness and powdery cold raspberries open up this fragrance. Noting the comparisons to my much grieved Lipstick On, I was excited for it to unfold on my skin. So I waited and waited for the opening to blossom into a warm, powdery iris and vanilla.

It did not.

It simply weakened until it vanished.

This is my daughter’s perfume ( given to her by an admirer) and I just tried it at her house .

I’m a bit spoilt being a niche perfumer lover so on first blast, all I thought was synthetic , sweet vanilla notes .

Very girlie based on the sweet vanilla notes yet mature at the same with the powdery , Orris notes .

I find a lot of mass produced designer/ performers/ cosmetics companies manufactured perfumes just don’t smell like quality ingredients .

Saying that , it’s a pretty scent and I can see it’s popularity.

I blind bought a 1oz bottle of this because I recently discovered I love lipstick and makeup scents, and this was a cheap find. The opening isn't the best - I dislike watery notes, and mixed with the orris, it's a bit too sharp and gives off wet cardboard vibes. But the water dissipates quickly and a wonderful lipstick scent emerges. I appreciate the addition of the osmanthus note in contrast to the raspberry that's often added to lipstick fragrances - this makes Eternity Intense softer and not so tangy. I wouldn't call it powdery - it's not even comparable to perfumes like Valentina Poudre or Putain des Palaces, which I also enjoy - and I don't get any Play-doh or banana like some others have smelled. To me, it's a soft, slightly sweet lipstick scent, and since that's what I was hoping for, it's a keeper!

EDIT: When I wore this the other day, I realized I smelled like Dr. Pepper in the absolute best way possible. This definitely got sweeter with some time, but I'm not mad about it at all!

My first whiff of this was really off putting to my nose. A strong chemical smell that was just awful. I’ve allowed it to dry down and it’s ok I suppose. Nothing to write home about and I don’t know if I can stand putting myself through the initial blast long term. Not a safe blind buy at all. For some reason it reminds me of the colour purple. Strange scent.

Edit: The dry down is actually nice. Soft, powdery & musky. You wouldn’t know it’s the same perfume compared to the initial blast. Not long lasting or strong.

Edit: Just came back to it again and no, that opening is just nasty. I’ll be giving this one away. It’s not worth me keeping it. Really disgusting olfactory experience for me.

Sweet and a bit powdery scent with a hint of ripe and dried autumn fruits. Reminds me of the aesthetics I discovered and adopted when I was 18. Comfortable yet excting and poetic evenings at a conservatory while practicing piano. Warm purple colours of sunsets in a city. A fuzzy sweater. Maple shedding the yellow leaves on the street in front of my school. Bohemian and decadent, I was savoring the moments and seizing the days like there was no tomorrow 🙂

A blind buy and an interesting addition to the CK Eternity family. The first hit I get overwhelmingly is overripe plum, with strong undertones that took me a hot minute to recognise what I can only describe as " Eau De Play Doh".

This was quickly followed by Parma violets with hints of dark chocolate and this continued throughout as a top note. The overall impression I get is of some sort of thick syrupy melange that dries down into the sort of vanilla tobacco that an old boss used to puff on in his pipe back in the days when smoking was allowed in offices.

Sounds terrible but Eternity Intense is not unwearable - pleasant enough and not displaying enough sillage to offend others around you. If anything, sillage is almost non-existent from the get-go - I have to clamp my nose over my wrist to smell it almost as soon as I've sprayed it .

I enjoy a warm skin scent, which I suspect this one will turn out to be, but right now I'm unconvinced about it as a whole. I may grow to like it, but there is a bit too much vanilla in it for me to totally fall in love with right now.

Update: Three hours later and the vanilla has vanished. I am left with Parma violets and similar chalky sweets - a rather pretty skin scent only discoverable by others if they are in close contact with you.

Got it because of Yana from The Scented and it's much better than Lipstick Fever. Smells like a modernized powdery iris. Has a woody and clean smelling drydown.
BTW, I don't get any banana smell

Of course this bears no relation to the original at all but it's a great perfume on its own merit. The opening has one of the most realistic pear notes I have ever smelled. It captures the essence of a perfectly ripe pear - without any syrup on it. Then comes the lovely violet and smooth creamy iris. Again no added sugar - it's much more a classic fragrance. It's quite cold until the very end of the drydown when the warmer earthy base develops. The lack of sweetness might put some people off but if you want a break from 'sugar rush' fragrance this is perfect. Personally I love it - especially for Spring and Autumn. Good sillage and very long lasting.

I have been waiting a few weeks now, to get this from the mail. Blind buy, of course, as usual... 🙄 I bought it, because I have heard from so many, that it resembles Lipstick On from MMM Replica. Not really... I have
Lipstick On, and love it so much. Was so happy at the thought of having a dupe for that one, since it is discontinued. But this is unfortunately nothing like it. To me, it is almost a little wimpy. Still, it is a nice fragrance for someone who like soft fragrances, a little bit fresh. I like both soft and fresh fragrances as well, but not this one, so much. I suspect and hope that my best friend would like this, so I will give it to her as a birthday present.
It will be a very good unoffensive random
every-or-any-day fragrance.
I think it was quite pricey for such a soft fragrance, but that was probably because it is not so easy to find anymore. But I think - if my friend likes it, the money will be well spent on her. Because she's worth it.

P.S. And I do not agree that it is powdery at all. To me, first it is too cold and sharp, and then it dries down to something nicer and rounder. With a sillage of one inch from my wrist. Too bad it is not Play-Doh, cherry chapstick and soft makeup, lasting all day, like Lipstick On.

Edit, a few hours later: Having read about some individuals here, who sensed a touch of banana - I began to feel that too. Banana jam, to be precise. So I started to like it better, accepting that it is not a dupe for Lipstick On. I realized that I also can layer it with some ylang-ylang fragrance, or some spicy tropical, to enhance that effect.
So I took a shower, oversprayed this one happily and liberally, and then added a small touch of Le Couvent Aqua Nymphae on each wrist. Now I can sleep well, and dream nice dreams about a caribbean island. 😊
No more bad consciense about wasted money. And I will give my best friend something else, that I actually KNOW she will like.

the initial spray made me giggle. It reminded me of a banana shake. That banana scent lingered for a good half hour. then the perfume transformed. it is a " cuddle weather" type of perfume. It does remind me of other lipstick-like perfumes, but this stands good on its own. It is not as sweet as lipstick fever, but the powdery makeup accord is present. I would consider buying this if I found it for cheap!

I had bought a 1oz bottle of this perfume awhile ago. I liked it, but it just either wasn’t my vibe or the right time of year, so I never wore it. One day my 13 year old daughter and I were going through my fragrance collection and she fell in love with this! Previously the only one of my perfumes she ever wore was Hypnotic Poison, but she started wearing Eternity Intense every day, and it smelled wonderful on her! It was fresh and youthful and it just fit her somehow, I ended up giving it to her, as it is now “her scent”. I recently noticed that she was running low, so I ordered her a 3.4oz bottle. I just received it in the mail today and sprayed it on my arm to test it out and it smelled so off to me, I thought I had got a bottle that might have gone bad. I went and grabbed her other bottle and sprayed it on my other arm to test the difference, BUT to my surprise, it smelled the exact same!! I don’t know if it is just the way it works with my body chemistry, or maybe my nose is off, but I can’t believe the difference in the scent on my daughter compared to myself.

She has been told by a few different people that she smells like Dr. Pepper, which is funny because that is her favorite soda. And I can see that when she wears it now that it’s been pointed out
When I sprayed it on my skin it has a weird cardboard scent.
I don’t know what the point of this review is, since I’m not really talking about the notes in this fragrance. I guess just to talk about how different scents smell different to everybody and reacts differently to a persons body chemistry.
I was going to wait to give this new bottle to my daughter for her birthday, but now I’m going to have to have her test it just to make sure it hasn’t gone off so I will be able to return it if it is bad.

The first time i sprayed it, ughhh! I thought i was struck by strong chemical blast of artificial iris and violet. I waited for a couple of minutes, then i smell some overdoing berries. So lipsticky, syrupy, and almost head-aching. But of course i gave it a chance and glad that i did it!

It became more velvety and elegant after around 20 mins. It has seductive and mysterious vibes in it. The drydown is lipsticky, deep and powdery iris, violet, with strong hint of berries even though they are not in the notes list. Just beware not wearing this in a hot humid day, or otherwise you might kill the human next to you.

I tried this at the store and I liked it enough to buy a full sized bottle online; but the bottle I got was weak and similar to other reviews where the scent seemed nonexistent after a few minutes. I used to own Eternity, and this "Intense" version was an Iris bodyspray vs. how much sillage Eternity has when first sprayed. I was expecting a stronger lipstick scent based on what I read, watched on YouTube, then smelled at the store. I expected this perfume to have a much higher projection, sillage, and performance that matched the current reformulated original version. Oh well, it will go on my everyday work/inoffensive scents shelf. The scent does linger on but weakly for at least 5 hours running errands on a sunny morning if that helps. I have smelled Lipstick on and it's similar (just vintage lipstick), but I would recommend more powerful flowery makeup/lipstick scents in this order: Red Door edt, Fred Hayman's Touch, Charlie Red, and the original version of Gloria Vanderbilt. I'm not into spending much on perfumes with heavy violet notes that still smell like makeup, since it reminds me of violet spray cologne and bodysprays sold in Miami, which I enjoy but that scent is normally smelled in my environment.

This is one of those cases where the flanker is, for me, so much better than the original. This has the original Eternity DNA, but instead of a blast of white florals, this opens up with a subdued, powdery iris, some soft amber notes, and slowly begins to morph into a beautiful sandalwood dry down that eventually gives way to hints of dark chocolate. For me, this is the epitome of fall, but I can see wearing this in any season. It's relaxing, subdued, subtle, powdery and beautiful.

this smells just like lipstick at first with a carrot-y iris/orris. after 5 or so minutes, i get the osmanthus, rose and vanilla-adding a fruity-floral aspect to the lipstick note. it dries down to a creamy osmanthus-vanilla. such a pretty perfume, i can't wait to try this in spring.

givenchy l'ange noir on budget, if you love powdery iris n lipstick, you need to try this :) amazing fragrance
10/10

I wanted to like this, but on me this reminds me of the way a wooden popsicle stick smells after you eat all the popsicle off of it. Quite woody, some sweetness, and powdery. The drydown is great but I can't get over the popsicle wood smell, so it is leaving my collection.
не препоръчвам да търсите общо с нощния ангел на Живанши. ако харесвате ириса на монтал и подобни, ще ви допадне
The orris is the main note and then it settles to a woody musk scent. Very lovely, I just wish the iris was more present. This scent is super woody with very little sweetness, which I like.

Love this. This takes me back to the 90s. I had Insolence from Guerlain and they do share the same DNA, a powdery iris and violet scent. I am buying the full bottle as soon as I finish the sample. anyway... I just have to comment on the bottle: it is totally ugly and does not represent the juice very well.
====
update: I am not getting the full bottle of this, I realize I only want the iris note without the lipstick scent, so I will try out other fragrance with similar vibe. Been eyeing Insolence by Guerlain.

As an orris/iris fiend, I saw this was avail on fragrancenet for $25 and jumped at the opportunity... I've already rehomed it. It's not that I didn't like it, I just didn't love it. Where I wanted it to go more orris/iris, it went more vanilla. Feels more in line with Black Opium than it does Lipstick On. I def get that lipsticky note in the initial spray -- i mean like literally first 2 mins of wear, but it fades and I am left with a very designer gourmand-type smell; not one I dislike, just nothing noteworthy.

If you are looking for an inexpensive dupe for Replica's Lipstick On, look no further. This is extremely close. I love it. So glad I've listened to Shana J, my number one fragrance reviewer on YT. She has great taste! Love this one. Beautiful Iris scent. I also get the slightest hint of tobacco in the background.

It was a blind buy because I love powdery scents and I love iris. This caught my attention because of the make-up/make-up bag/lipstick scent comparison. I have been really into baby powder/sweet, soapy talc powder perfumes with iris being a prominent note in most of those, but recently I decided to explore iris in different forms and so I purchased this, as well as Prada Infusion d'Iris. With Eternity Intense, I can definitely see why some people mention that lipsticky/makeup scent in relation to that, I can definitely smell it. :) But it's also fruity (someone mentioned bananas/berries there and I can only agree with that). Very nice fragrance, not a typical drugstore floral, nor an entirely sweet smell. :) It also shares certain similarity with Infusion d'Iris (obviously becaue of that iris note that reminds me slightly of pencil shavings, too). Very affordable and good for daily wear.
It's an amazing fragrance. It's about orris root, some fruits. I like it and recommend it to you.

OMG, first a bunch of candied violets, than baby food smashed bananas (panade, bledine), then tons of palpable iris to urgently affirm we’re still pretending to be adults. The candle waxy iris is long, comforting and absolutely delicious. This stuff is addictive. Fist compliments got after only 15 minutes and in my country people aren’t often mentioning your parfum at all. I want one or two back up bottles right now.

Blind Buy not bad for the price however I don't expect I will wear it much.Reminds me of Guerlain Insolence or L'instant Magic.

Dry down smells like regular Eternity to me just softer. Sweet and powdery Eternity not bad for the price.

I expected to like this one, but I can’t say I do. Something about it reminds me of banana moon pies. Sweet fake banana smell, vanilla laced marshmallow, and soft (stale) graham cracker. It’s both powdery and waxy. I’m mentally being taken back to my childhood. As it dries down, I find it more palatable in some aspects, but the parts I like are too soft in dry down and I have a tough time getting past the intro. Maybe I will learn to love it. Doubtful, but I like a challenge.
Update: Performance is disappointing. The iris is so soft on me that I feel it doesn’t live up to the 1st place listing in the accords listing on here. Maybe it’s just me. Very disappointing because those it works for have raved about how gorgeous it is. Unfortunately, I can see why this one was discontinued.
Parma violets!
cantaloupe (or melon assortment) and whip cream.

Oh my God! This perfume is divine! I simply love the iris, it is one of my favorite flowers. It smells so nice, it's so well made, a little creamy... a must have for Iris lovers like me. It smells like a niche perfume. I'm so glad I got a big bottle. I found out about it from Angel Lately's YT channel. So thank you Angel! You need this in your life, believe me.

I only bought because one of the perfume blogger said it smells like bananas. Honestly for the price Im surprise its good. Not omg good but good enough to have all the combinations to make this perfume stand out. Silliage and longevity is great. There is the green bananas smell in it but the powder kills me. I dont prefer powdery scents in my perfume I prefer smoother! But people might like it. 6/10

I blind bought this because i love powdery floral scents and because of some reviews here that they can smell iris in this. I have a lot of perfumes with iris in it. Yes it is definitely powdery but all I can smell this hot spring day is a powdery sweet type of vanilla smell. one spray on my wrist. I can't smell the "banana smell" a lot of the reviewers here were talking about. I could not even smell any flowers. on me it is just sweet powdery vanilla. I have the original eternity and theres nothing similar between them. they are totally different from each other. I'll try again at some point and update.

Oufff I almost put a vote for "I hate" in the first few minutes after the first spray because it was ohhhh! Green banana peel, yuck! But I waited about 15 or 20 minutes (maybe more) and the smell of green banana gives way to a nice powdery smell of iris and other flowers and vanilla. Let's say it gets better over time but I still struggle with the first half hour, this period is almost painful but it'snice after that. Finally I think I will keep it but certainly I don't like the beginning at all but the phases are very distinct and it changes a lot during drying. A very changeable fragrance that's for sure. Doesn't end as it looks from the start and that's a good thing.

Big iris lover here, and in my quest to collect all of the best irises, I thankfully stumbled onto this lovely. The quality here far outweighs it's price. Eternity Intense is beautiful, deep and cool, with iris in the spotlight throughout. For me, it's smoothness and depth blows right past the sharper Prada Infusion d'Iris, and Commodity Orris seems thin and cheap now in comparison. I prefer it over the more candied iris of Bvlgari Iris d'Or, and consider it on par with my favorite irises, Houbigant Iris des Champ and Dior Homme Intense. Maybe the most successful blind buy I've ever made.

In love with this Eternity... initial spray I got Longan fruits skin and all. Longan is a popular south east Asia fruit with brown skin and white fleshy meat similar to lychee. E.I is simi sweet and earthy, powdery and so sheer. You can say it's smells like cosmetic powder but I prefer to go the yummy route 😋 This fragrance is really soft 2 full blast and barely a skin scent. I happen to love Longan and it's natural smell so I don't mind. Plus this is so cheap I can go trigger happy 😍

OMG, another make-up bag fragrance, suedish powdery scent. Pure love on my skin.
It has some sweetnes of overrippe fruits but tammed down with powdery suede note. Comforting etheral beauty.
I would never think it's Calvin Klein Eternity flanker.
I recommend to test to all who love scent of make-up/ lipstick.

A bargain priced beauty - I love it and I am not a fan of overly sweet fragrances. However, this is sweet in a powdery, ethereal cosmetic vibe kind of way. I think it depends on whose skin it’s on, but there is a similarity between Eternity Intense and Chloe Love.
Great every day option and a comforting bed time scent.

Am I the only one who thinks that this smells like baby powder (aka talc)?
Not that that's bad, but I wish someone had mentioned that! I was looking for a Love, Chloe by Chloe - sort of powdery cosmetic scent... and to me, this just isn't it. This is much more demure, very innnocent powder, nothing womanly or sexy in this, to my nose. :/

Edit:
After a few months of owning it.. it has definitely grown on me. I use it as a workplace scent, it makes me feel confident and fresh.
This is a really hard scent to describe but on my skin I would say this is: very strong osmanthus opening but that goes away in 20 minutes and then I'm left with powdery human skin scent. It's bizarre!

Edit2: I totally changed my mind about this perfume, I love it now! I wear it a a bedtime scent usually because I find it very comforting: it's an iris/orris and rose 🌹 powder cloud ☁️🤍😍 ! The 'aquatic' facet adds interest, makes the scent airy (so the powder doesn't become too heavy/ cloying, which is great.)
I think it too me time to learn to appreciate this scent because it is so unusual. But yeah, definitely love it now! 🥰🤍🤍🤍

This smells just like green bananas, just how I like them! I see that its considered powdery, so that must be in the drydown. I just sprayed this and I smell nothing close to powdery. Sometimes iris scents can start off very fruity and then dry down to powdery, so time will tell

15 min later, I'm starting to smell powdery bananas. I'm liking this. I enjoy perfumes that change

I jsut received this fragrance from FragranceX. OMG This fragragrance smells so bad. its like wearing a lint sheet and febreze plug in on my arm. Its not lovely., the scent is not something natural. It smells synthetic. I had an idea about what this would smell like and it does not. I will be returning it.

This is really well done. I don't have a lot of perfumes with iris that I can think of and this fragrance is very unique. It has a fruity scent, at first I thought cherry but it could equally seem like plum or grape. It's sweet and just a bit tart with bergamot. Vanilla definitely and I get a bit of the musky sandalwood base. It's so good!

As a Iris lover, I'm willing to blind buy almost any fragrance with Iris in it, and that was the case with Eternity Intense.
I'm shocked that i haven't discovered this fragrance sooner as much as I'm on here browsing for another fragrance to fall in love with.

So about the scent! Upon the first spray, i get a sharp sweet Iris, but it's not harsh to the nose. It's almost candy like, but not in a juvenile way. As it settles, the Iris softens and the vanilla kicks in. As it dries down, the Iris and vanilla is still detectable, but it's accompanied by a hint of sandalwood, which i can barely smell. I can't detect the other notes listed and that's totally fine because the Iris is so amazing in this fragrance. This sweet-tart Iris note reminds me so much of the Iris in The Only One by Dolce & Gabbana. As far as performance, it's very moderate. It's starts out strong in sillage and becomes a skin scent after a good 4+ hours.

I recommend that Iris lovers give this a try.

Scent: 9/10
Packaging:7/10
Performance: 7/10

Just received this and have to agree with reviewer before me ... all I get is PEAR ... a lot of pear !! It does quiet down a bit but that's mostly all I get. Have not worn it out for a full day yet so cannot speak for its longevity. Will update my review later on.
приемам и размяна

It's not listed in the pyramid and hence not used in this fragrance probably, and I may be the only one sensing it, but I'm gonna write it nevertheless... what I feel in the opening very strongly is... the pear. A lovely one btw. Sort of the one with which Poirier d'un Soir by Miller Harris starts. It's here for about 10 minutes and then it fades. This is when other notes (normal ones:D) start to surface. Absolutely intoxicating iris flower and orris. At the end it settles down to a cosy musk and sandalwood with a hint of vanilla. It does smell niche and it's not a crowd-pleaser imho. I'm so glad I added it to my collection. Blind buy at the TK Maxx and absolutely worth it!

Lovely perfume, a dry iris with a lot of make up powdery notes, chic and easy to wear. Reasonably priced while it smells way more niche.

Not an Eternity kind of perfume by any means, but who cares. I am tired of trying to explain marketing choices. This could be called Serenity or Sincerity or Protection and it would work just fine.
I'm giving ideas here people! Ha, I would wear sth called Protection. We all need it.

It smells exactly like Williams pears !!!
Unless i own a fake edp !!!
What a hidden gem, I love it! So misterious, powdery, leathery, cozy and sensual. It has a clean laundry effect but also a dark sensual side. Give it a try, even if you dislike eternity.
I like this upon the dry down. It's a lovely orris heavy fragrance which is of the same vein as Jo Malone orris and sandal.
Мега усилена база на bois d'iris the different company
On me, it smells poire William (thé alcool at the pear !)

This opens with an unconventional combination of clear watery notes and powdery iris. Unfortunately, on my skin, this comes off as plasticky, as others have mentioned.

The watery notes fade away in a few minutes and leave behind a sweet vanilla-iris combo. The drydown is pleasant enough, but the opening isn't great imo.

these perfumes are really extraordinary. every time I whispered a hand that is breathed, I would feel a different aroma, and I like it more and more. even though the first hunch is poor for me, later comes a more delicious aroma. , so, this perfume is already in my collection

I love Iris and Orris. And here I get Orris, bergamott and Iris. First minute it was all about playdoo-plastic-smell, but after 8-10 minutes I got Orris and Bergamott. A come-and-hug-me-scent. Lovely indeed. For a daring man I say - try it, if you're into orris-scents. I like it alot. Not in your-face-strong, more like a teasing ghost circeling around you.

OMG the powder in this one ...
The Iris note smells almost like candied violets...
Eternity Intense I adore you.
Heavy powdery, feminine and beautiful Iris, followed by orris, vanilla and musk.
Clean, comforting and very sexy in a non screaming way...
The beginning is very out there and the drydown is more subtle.
Classy, modern and elegant.
Longevity and silage is average.

I find absolutely nothing aquatic about this fragrance.

Wearing Eternity Intense brings to mind kissing a woman wearing a thick coat of face powder & vintage lipstick who has been heavily drinking both red wine and whiskey all night.
Ooooh, I love this one! Reminds me of Guerlain and Chanel at the same time! Very, very elegant! Eternity? No... not at all. Class? You bet! Iris for the GAWDS, honey.

So disappointed once again. I started wearing Eternity for women back in 1990 or maybe a little before and it was the best smell humanly possible. Years later I bought a new bottle and it was not at all the same as I remembered it. I figured out what was missing mostly was the green notes that made it so beautiful back then.
