It's as if they took everything great out of Eternity and left us with some shell just enough to remember what it used to smell like for a second. The Vintage eternity also lasted all day long. What they're selling now as eternity doesn't last an hour. Anyway enough complaining but I've been on a mission for a long time to find something that smells like it. I thought I was going to get lucky with this. Why not bring back real eternity and call it eternity intense? Makes perfect sense. Of course that's not what they did. I don't understand. Where has the Beautiful special eternity gone? And since they know that they have destroyed what once was a beautiful perfume why would they not attempt to bring it back even as one of the flankers? I bet it's not possible to find one single person that would prefer the fake eternity that they're selling now over the real thing that they put out in the late 80s. If anybody knows of any of these Calvin Klein fragrances that resembles real actual eternity please tell me what that is.

I picked up a 1oz at Marshalls for a good price, and I wish I would have bought the bigger bottle they had because I really like it! Its earthy and sweet. It is powdery, but in a good way. This is one I suggest smelling for yourself. My Husband and I liked this so much we wanted to get the Eternity Intense for Men, but when we smelled it we didn't prefer it. I think we should try it again, because we were sampling too many fragrances that day. This reminds me of the "invent your scent" collection The Body Shop had in the early 2000's. They had 8 different fragrances, and you picked two and sprayed them together to make up your own signature. What two it was is kind of moot, because they discontinued it, so hopefully CK doesn't do away with the Intense any time soon. Try it, hopefully it works for you.
*****UPDATE 7/3/18****** Just got a bottle of Lacoste Natural and it smells like a sport version of CK Eternity Intense in the dry down. CK Eternity Intense has become one of my favorite fragrances, and my Husband also loves it! I think its pretty unique and I haven't smelled it on anyone else.

Wow. I typically have trouble wearing iris, and most Calvin Klein scents don't agree with me, but this is actually pretty good.

This opens with osmanthus and doll skin musk. The vanilla is creamy and ever-present and keeps the iris and orris from going powdery and soapy as my skin likes it to do. Occasionally there is a fresh bergamont note or sweet sandalwood. There is a candy sweetness that comes and goes.

This is fascinating and I will definitely be playing with it in the future.

After applying from my decant, I had to run right here to figure out if I had one from a really old bottle, etc. It appears the consensus is this is an odd one, so here's my take from my sample.

The first two minutes were dead on for my grandfather's barn -- which is actually a scent I crave, but did NOT expect to find in a Calvin Klein release. Before you get too afraid, his barn was full of old hay and alfalfa (a very fragrant, sweet grass), dust and never had animals in it. In the first minute or so, blam, there's the dust and hay if you sniff hard enough. Then it vanishes as the alcohol fades and the iris and vanilla slowly turn up. There's a point where it seems like there's no scent at all between the hay and the iris/vanilla. Just wait. It'll get there. When it does, it's fine. It's nothing special, not necessarily worth the trek through the barn unless you dig that sort of thing.

Needless to say, this is not the scent you spritz on *just* before your big job interview. (Unless it's at a farm supply store.)

I can't speak to a comparison to Le Fin Du Monde, but I can see comparing this to a creation of Etat Libre d'Orange. The level of experimentation is way beyond the usual safe zone of Calvin Klein. I'm surprised this made it past all the marketing focus groups, etc., that it likely had to go through and really wonder if there isn't some chemical "time bomb" of sorts that turned or altered before all the bottles made it into the distribution network. But that is just a *completely uneducated* guess.

I really like this one. Feminine but not too flowery or fruity. This reminds me of something I already have though...Avon Attraction. This is kind of like a better blended version of the Avon perfume. I like it though!!! It is sweet and woody and with a bit of musk. I probably won't buy this one since I have Avon's version, but this one is really pretty :)Floral is the second listed note for this, but I don't get very much floral out of this at all...

Now for something different! This smells like the inside of a suede purse with lipstick, face powder, a used mini bottle of vodka and a travel tin of cocoa butter all rolled into one warm, unusual fragrance. Not for me in the least, but this smells so different and sophisticated, I might be willing to give the sample a try on skin (I smelled it off a clean cotton pad to get a general gist of it).

I love the original eternity for women, but it's winter here in Australia at the moment, and I think it's a summer fragrance.
I tested Eternity Imtense today amd I really liked it very much. It is soft, powdery, classy and a bit different. It lasted about 4 hours and I'm happy with that as it's inexpensive from My Beauty Spot.
I was wondering if it would layer well with the original eternity?? What does everyone else think?

After wearing this more, it gives an illusion that's it's an EDP. It's heady without going cloying. It has some weight and you'd expect it to stick around. Only, it doesn't. After the 4 to 6 hours mark this will fade. Granted I live in a hot and humid country but this one definitely performs like a cologne or EDT. It's a shame because it is a gorgeous scent. I still enjoy it though.

This is just such a lovely warm comforting fragrance to me.
Not 'screechy' sharp or sickening sweet, it is definitely a skin scent with my body chemistry.

Love the opening & it's transition to the heart & base notes is pretty swift...I wish the longevity was there & am disappointed about the misleading 'intense' sale pitch.

It probably needs just one or two more notes/chemicals to bring it more to life & an intense level, but all the same, it is gorgeous & I just have to keep reapplying throughout the day to get my 'fix' of this scent.

It is not in the slightest bit related to the original & they could have called it something else entirely new.
Not as unique as REVEAL, but still something different than other current releases out there, especially for lovers of iris/violet powdery freshness with underlying creamy vanilla.
All in all, a beautiful wearable scent, for all seasons, all times of the day.

Chocolaty, plummy with a slight coffee aroma. I know this is supposed to be Iris + Orris + Vanilla but I get a toned-down boozy quality that may taste like coffee and chocolate.
This is of the night but not dark, midnight or pitch black. It has a dusky quality that I enjoy.
I've noticed how young perfume users will recoil but experienced fragheads will like this or at least acknowledge its uniqueness.
Probably underrated.
This isn't a sledgehammer. It has average longevity and amazing initial sillage that will taper down.
I didn't care for the male version.

Eternity intense

Tried again today on a pulse point not layered.

What notes are in the top and heart? Tell me please.

I get straight alcohol, not as in the cheapie frags, but actual vodka, that taste of a vodka shot, not the burning, the flavour.

The end notes are what I would like the scent to be, then and only then do I get the main accords.

Try before you buy, not safe blind buy

Bug spray opening, I thought yuck straight off, it was like a plastic.
But now is woody, warm, dark vanilla, powdery, yeah not bad

So... medicinal opening perhaps, with woody overtones, I layered it with eternity now just because it was on the same shelf in the shop, that helped to lift it.
Not a pretty girly or intense light sort.
If you're exploring woodsy, or medicinal but not huge sillege sorts, check it out.

Hope that helps

Got to test this today, on paper and skin. It was rather nice on paper first, definitely got a lovely iris/orris root powder scent. Sprayed on my skin (one spray to wrist), it unfortunately fell short of expectations - mostly synthetic vanilla and 'water'. Put me in mind of sunscreen, beach etc. Longevity and projection are quite good - I could smell it without lifting my arm to my face for about 4 or so hours.

Tried it today. I collect the eternity line so I've been waiting for this very impatiently. The sales assistant past me a square of paper with a spray on it and it smelt unusual but all I could smell was the paper. I applied it to the back of my hand and all I could smell was the paper again. Obviously that wasn't the paper I was smelling. I was getting a deep warm sweet caramelly vanilla all hidden under a starchy paper smell. I was very disappointed. "Different" the sales assistant commented. I had to agree. I've nothing papery in my collection. Feeling deflated I returned to work where one co worker hated it and the other loved it. I wanted to love it too but it just wasn't happening.
An hour or so later I reached up to scratch my face and got the most beautiful soft vanilla fragrance, which some 4 hours later still remains, having withstood several hand washes.
So it seems maybe I do love it after all.

To my surprise, I am in love with this! The first moment of this scent are like a soft, sweet tide taking me. :) All I can say is for me this fragrance is a total feel-good perfume. Sweet and strong and warm, the first instance a big surprise (check the notes and try it yourself, it is a unique combination, trust me). On me, vanilla is the most powerful after some time. Totally love it. Must have it the sooner the better.

It is goooood! Strange,but nice. The first few moments are the best. Powdery, sligthly earthy iris. My favourit. After a while it becomes sweet and mild. For me this sweetness is a little bit Cherry flavoured, and not the listed simple vanilla.

A strange fragrance.
I almost washed it off my hand because the first (and second, third, etc.) sniff was like being slapped or running into a wall. I could not even identify what it was but I did not like it. I am guessing it was the orris, but I found it unpleasant.
Now, luckily I was quite busy with work and I started to sniff something pleasant after a few hours. It developed into a lovely clean vanilla scent that is just now fading after about 8 hours.
I do not see much in common in this scent and the original one.
However, in total I gave it a "Love" rating because how pleasant it turned out to be.
I am just not quite sure what I could do to rush through the unpleasant first hour (or so) of its development.
I was sure I smelled some blackberry or cassis in this yet none are noted in the ingredients above....nice smell to my nose, (but again I'm smelling different notes than are listed).....

Tried it at the store, walked around for a bit, I thought, oh my, this is different! Not your typical Eternity flanker...it has a bit of the original, in the Chypre undertone, some orris, some sea notes give it a different edge...so yes, I bought it because it simply smells not ordinary!! I like the warm Iris too...the dry down is more basic sweet, not too much..I don't know about the intense part though, it isn't real bold, it doesn't project greatly...but it has depth, this isn't a boring generic flanker..I like it, very feminine...pretty vanilla/ Iris combination.

i like the fact there is something unusuall, less often seen to this. however it is very, very sweet and afer a while it becomes quite dull. the first oment is interesting and it is not jst the iris, there is something "weird" in a good way to it.

I tried this one today!!! Love it!
Smells like fizzy playdo ????
Its sweet its powdery and I need it!

Syroupy, juicy, not overwhelmingly sweet, with the right dose of fruitiness and sophistication of iris and osmanthus. Totally wearable not only for special occasions. The overall impression is that of a dark berry jam with powdery, suede-ish edges.
Intense iris & vanilla scent, very syrupy, not bad though. It's just far too heavy for me.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
I bought this when it first came out because I liked it. I still think it was one of the best of its kind, aquatic floral or cucumber/melon/calone summer freshie. Not usually my cup of tea, but this is really good.
At the time, I wore the original Eternity every day for about a decade. It was a perfect workhorse or highly functional fragrance, I loved it, people around me did too, it was cool, comfortable and with incredible longevity. Many people still associate it with me. But, after more or less a decade, I was not the same person anymore.

This came from the time when CK ment quality. I have two handbags, about 15 and 20 years old, that are in mint condition. Worn a lot, but pretty much indestructible. I payed for a bottle of Eternity 15 years ago twice what I would today. I haven't finished it yet. I don't wear it much, but when I do, it's even better than I remember. So what happened with this brand? How it became cheap instead of just reasonable? Did reformulations destroy perfumes I knew back in the day? How about clothes and handbags today, certainly not as fashionable as they were, but how do they behave?

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Wore CK today, ran errands.
Clean, fresh, a little floral, & sexy.
Like a flowy sundress on a hot #lady.
Thought it faded by evening, but still pulled a compliment walking into a store!
Silent but deadly kinda scent.
Should’ve bought the bigger bottle.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
About now when spring is just right around the corner with summer coming up not far behind, you are probably looking around for your usual staples for spring and summer wear. For those looking for this scent, you might have a problem finding it and if you do, the price is exorbitant. Here’s an option for you but I highly suggest you try getting a sample of this first to see if you have the same result that I do.

…and just what is that result, you ask? That DKNY Be Delicious Fresh Blossom is very nearly a dead ringer for this scent. I have both and for the most part, I can’t tell them apart. They both have several notes in common. So, if you can’t find this scent, give DKNY BD FB a go. I don’t think you will be disappointed.

Another scent to try is Beautiful Magnolia by Estée Lauder. I find it to be even closer to being a perfect match. About 95% I think.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: It’s very oceanic and salty, which I love. Has lots of depth. Last hours and hours on me without a touch- up. The perfect Spring/Summer - or even snow ski - scent.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: A fresh and inoffensive smell. My boyfriend says it smelled like dawn dish soap. I can smell the cucumber in this one.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
I came in with low expectations but I was pleasantly surprised! Although it is a little sweeter than I would usually go for, I find that it has enough "freshness" to it to still balance out into a pleasant, refreshing scent. Also, it performed WAY better than I expected it to- I got a full day's wear when I wore it to work (office setting), and it was still projecting pretty well by the end of the day!

It smells like a sweet ocean breeze to me- perfect for the summer! It will also generally be my office scent because I usually lean towards dramatic and imposing where this is a good balance of being strong, but not intense. It's definitely what I needed to diversify my range. It's also a major compliment-getter. I will admit that it's not the most unique or impressive scent out there but it's a lovely perfume if you take it for what it was intended to be and set the highbrow standards aside (coming from a former "snob" who refused to go anywhere near sweet florals).

Would highly recommend, especially for the summer or if you live in a tropical area.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: So... i thought I would love it and maybe my expectations were a bit high, but it just smells like air freshener to me...

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I've been hoarding the last few sprays of my large bottle since this has apparently been discontinued. I've gotten so many compliments on this fragrance, as many as when I wear Libre, I'd say. Between this and Insolence being discontinued, I'm peeved LOL.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: A very nice, refreshing summer fragrance however longevity is quite disappointing. I get approximately 30 minutes wear from this then it just disappears. Even though it’s pretty inexpensive I’d rather save my money for something longer lasting.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This definitely reminds me of aqua bella by la rive which is supposedly a dupe of aqua di gioa which I currently don’t have. It is also a softer light blue and a sweeter cool water. This has a mix of those perfumes mentioned above. It is a pleasant sweet citrus scent that is inoffensive and can be perfect for officewear. I wasn’t really blown away with this because it already reminds me of perfumes I already own. But this is still a nice buy if you don’t have any citrus fragrance yet.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: sharp, offensive, musky. It might be my skin tho

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I am surprised at how much I like this. It is clean and summery, very refreshing but without that bathroom cleaner harsh side that I find Cool Water to have. I wore it for the first time today and went to the store at the end of the day and got a compliment within 5 minutes of walking in the door. The scent had all but faded away to my nose but apparently not to anyone who hadn't been living in my skin all day (lol). I will be enjoying this a lot this summer and wish I had purchased a larger bottle. Two thumbs up here.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Upon first spritz, before evaporation it's watery and cucumber heavy, but once it's settled its very floral. I can smell most of all the dewy decadence of fresh bloomed jasmin, with hearty notes of white Musk and mellow sandlewood. It's unusual not to smell any citrus in an aquatic perfume, but it works. I think there may be a dash of lemongrass in there, though. It a has mild, sweet, grassy allure to it.

A wonderful fresh soapy scent. It's incredibly clean, but I wouldn't say unique. Growing up in the early 00's there was a lot of aquatic perfumes from Disney Princess EDT to department stores own like Next. This reminds me of a fragrance I got for my birthday from the above mentioned, Next. It's very nostalgic, and I feel its impossible to be down while wearing it. It's very uplifting

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This is an easy reach in spring and summer. Makes you feel fresh all day long. Calvin Klein does this type of clean, aquatic genre well. Its fresh, floral and very feminine. Just pretty. A bit of musk and woody notes ground it. This is a flowing sundress on a hot summer day.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I have just realised that if you are looking for the long discontinued limited edition called so! by givenchy (light pink square bottle) then looks like a good replacement. The top 4 notes are identical in both. Cucumber, peony, magnolia and musk. In this the red apple replaces the raspberry in so. Interesting.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I can't live without it during summertime....It's clean,fresh and very pleasant to wear and to smell too!

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells so fresh! I always get complimented when I'm wearing it! Just finished my first bottle and eyeing to get my second.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Very pretty & fresh but nothing unique. It also has terrible longevity & very low sillage. It is pretty enough that I can see why people like it. And it may be worth respraying a lot to some but not to me.
I dont think this is anything like Light Blue. I really did not like Light blue at all & the cedar sceams in it. I think Eternity Aqua is better & the cedar isnt stupid strong in it.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This reminds me of Armani Aqua di Gioa eau de toilette. Fresh, lovely scent, but nothing unique...I feel spring and summer and I like to mix it with one arabic oil which has a bit more depth...I think I will give it to my friend soon or sell it...but definitely a nice fragrance...on clothes it´s perfect , but it´s not a typical save blind buy option, because many people have skin which can make this scent a bit soury at the end...it´s not my case, but on one of my friend it started to smell terribly after a while...on clothes it doesn´t change and stays fresh :)

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I feel that this fragrance is under hyped, I love it! I am a 24 year old Australian girl and it is going to be my summer scent! It is incredibly fresh and ozonic, iand has a carefree and welcoming aroma that I love. I will be wearing this fragrance to picnics, to the beach and everywhere else in between over summer! I also feel it is similar to Dolce & Gabbana Light Blue, except this is lighter. Highly recommend!

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
GREAT WOKR BY CK!

So, I did some blind test on my wife and so the first impression she got was — uh that's nice and has a bit of masculine side to it. I smiled because it's women's version. She then said that yeah it's sort of unisex like CK2 (She loves that one).

Then later I did another blind tests with two samples — Aqua for men and women. She had a total turnoff for men's version as she said it was just very intrusive with the strong peppary note on top of it.

In the end Eternity Aqua for Women (not men's version) is a great smell for ladies and millennial lads too.

I personally like both version's of aqua, but the guy's version is just too needy and offensive at times. This one is just a great smell for any human to have

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Fragrance -Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
Bottle from - 2015

Eternity Aqua is a gentle,sensual,clean,aquatic and non-offensive scent.It is a nice blend of clean cucumber,apple and florals with a hint of cedar and musk,and a wisper of apricot.This fragrance has a calming effect on me,and I like him.

Longevity - 5/10(5+ hours)
Silage/Projection - 5/10(moderate projection and silage for the first 1-2 hours,than sits closer to skin for the duration of the scent's evolution)
Weather - best in spring and summer
Age - 18+
Compliments - 7/10
Scent - 7/10

Main notes according to me - cucumber,magnolia,apple,apricot,flowers,musk,cedar.

The drydown is nice and gentle and i get some -woodiness,flower notes and musk.

Emotions - fresh,gentle,pleasant,calming,sensual,clean,relax.

Occasion -for more or less any ocasion,perfect for casual activities,scholl,college and office.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Putting my nose to my wrist I really enjoyed the freshness an floral notes. Until from a distance I cought a wiff and absent mindedly thought "What smells like cat urine?" The perfume started to smell sour and a wrong kind of sweet. It just doesn't work for me.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: If you're in the cool air conditioning, 15 minutes after spraying this on, you will not be able to smell it. This blooms in the heat. This is great for outdoor events like picnics, barbecues, being around the pool or at the beach, on a boat, etc., this is where this perfume shines. Lasts about 6 hours on me starting from cool cucumber and juicy apple to a floral heart and then woody musk at the end. Some have said that the cucumber and apple sours on them but I haven't experienced that on my skin. It stays cool, crisp, and aquatic until you reach the base notes. Been wearing this every summer since it came out. I've tried many CK fragrances over the years and I have to say that this and Eternity Purple Orchid were the best.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This was nice for the first three seconds, but it turned stale pretty quickly. The cucumber smelled like plastic and wax, and that kind of ruined the experience.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: The initial impression is fresh and aquatic, nice, but with drydown, the freshness is lost and smells more like original Eternity. And you can feel the drydown only if you apply it generously, since the sillage is unfortunately very poor. Even it is nothing special, still quite nice, but poor performance make it no buy for me.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Eternity Aqua is not the FRESH aquatic fragrance that I expected. Instead, it stays closely to the Eternity line from CK, and somehow reminds me of L’Eau D’Issey. It is cool and relaxing and flowery at the same time. Nice to wear when you’re feeling calm and beautiful

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Very fresh-floral scent. inoffensive

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Because I am the fragrance addict that I am, I'm leaving yet another review!!! Ya know it's funny, being from where I am from within Canada, I am very limited in places to buy perfume...mostly Shoppers Drug Mat and Sears, which are both outrageously overpriced....so I always love going to the USA on a shopping trips because there is Kohls, Marshalls, TJMAXX, Ulta, Sephora, JCPenny, and that's just to name a very VERY small few of the stores I venture to while on said trip...so ya know, tonight I was out-supposed to be Xmas shopping- and I realized that holy crap there is a Winners in the city I live...its on the total opposite side of the city from where I live so that's why I assume I never even thought to look there! WELL WELL WELL MERRY CHRISTMAS TO MEEEEEEEEE!!! Hahaha I found this in a gift set for $29.99- it had a 50mls bottle 15mls bottle (bother of perfume)and a 100mls of the lotion. Holy crap was I pumped lol

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This is my hot weather fragrance I wear to work for a professional, yet cool sort of feeling. I live in a coastal beach area in Western Australia. I would describe my fashion sense as classic, stylish yet has a slight undone look. For example, white crisp linen shirt with a crumpled look paired with a professional looking pencil skirt. Hair kind of messy from an undone bun and skin golden from the summer, but I always have a YSL or Chanel lipstick. Caring and carefree, like this fragrance. It's about 40 degrees today so I was using this a few times in the day to fresh up and give that clean shower feeling. I like how it doesn't last day because it wouldn't have the "ahhh" experience all over again.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: good unisex juice....

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Nothing spectacular, smells normal and like a teenager fragrance. There are lots of aquatic fragrances here that are cheaper and smells the same so I did not like this one.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: It's nice, aquatic, subtle but on me it has zero longevity so I rarely wear it.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
I'm not sure what it is with me and summery scents but my skin just eats them up and my nose can't detect them. Or if it does, it doesn't smell anything special.

I have been looking for a light summery "holiday" kind of perfume, I liked the look of the notes and so I blind bought this.

At first sniff i smell cucumber, apple, and some generic summery florals. Pleasant enough but half an hour later it's gone, and when I sniff my skin close up, all I can smell is cheapish generic "smelt it all before" kind of smell. I kept reapplying this throughout the day and still could barely smell it. And again, when I did there was nothing special. I'll probably use it up on holiday or chuck it in the drawer at work to reapply throughout the day but overall it's disappointing. Nothing special at all. Meh...

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Beeyooootiful!!!! Gorgeous, scrumptious perfume! Oh Calvin, you've done it again for me! I'm in LOVE with this! It's so fruity, (I can smell the apricot very strongly, as well as the pink lady apple - so yummy, mouth-watering!) florally (all those fabulous white flowers! Oh, so delicate, so fresh, yet very strong) and warm woody smells. It is so fresh and uplifting, clean, watery, like I'm floating in a beautiful cool calm sea, with a slight breeze wafting around me full of delightful scents, the sun gently warming me, and the lovely lovely blue ocean stretching as far as the eye can see, and smell. Oh, just wonderful! Blissfully peaceful and calming. A truly perfect perfume. Fantastic longevity (15+ hours, and very good sillage). One of my very favourites! And I love the style and elegant shape of the bottle, and the gorgeous blue of the perfume! (although it's probably the bottle that's coloured? I haven't used enough of it yet to be able to tell! I'm sure it won't take me too long though!) My husband loves it too, and he is very fussy! He thinks it's very nice!

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I love CK fragrances, they almost never disappoint me. I wanted to get this for a long time and finally I did! I love to wear it to the gym or in summer, its very fresh and powerful, kinda artificially fresh but at least it lasts. I love apricot and cucumber and peony, which is what I can smell strongest in this. The bottle is adorable too, I love the shape and the color. I already own the original Eternity which I love (has nothing to do with this though) and the Summer Version 2014 and Eternity Purple and Eternity Night - they are all just perfect and my favorietes from the Eternity Range. This is my Sport Flanker, which doesnt say it would be less important to me, since I´m professional Athlete and use perfumes more often for workout than anything else and wants only the best for this!

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
To me Aqua is rather L'eau Par Kenzo/Un Jardin Sur Le Nil water than Davidoff Cool Water. Still and calm lake water not the ocean at all.
This perfume is very summer one. It needs warm sun heated skin to be opened. In winter season it hardly speaks but in summer it's the most delightful dewy floral garden.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I tried the Eternity Aqua about 3 years ago and thought it was nice, but I did not buy it. Now, in the dead of winter, I bought a one once bottle at a great price. I sprayed and my enter body, not just my nose responded with, "lets have more of that" as if I were eating a cookie! I really do like it. It's a crisp floral with extra freshness (cucuumber?) and a sexy, seductive quaity that must be the cedar and musk. this is definately a unisex scent (strong masculine quality - a turn on for me) and yet is pleasantly floral. the aquatic aspect is in the background (nice and will be appreciated in the summer months). All and all, it is different from the other aquatic ozionic fragrances I have (cool water, Paradise Blue or Avon's Instant Vacation scents) Eternity Aqua is fuller and richer than the rest. I am able to smell most of the notes and the blending is very good. I have personal problems with smell these days and am not able to smell many scents for more than 30 seconds and only part of the composition. this leads to screechy scents in many cases. this perfume seems very full bodied although I have sprayed quite a few times and can feel a headache from overload. I am very happy to have this in my collection and will be wearing it tomorrow after my shower for a more intense evaluation. I am very pleased.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
The other fragrance the salesperson suggested when I asked for a "fresh, not sweet" fragrance. Sprayed on the top of my other hand.

It is indeed not sweet. On me, starts very aquatic and a little woody, with not much fruit or flowers.

This would have pleased me, were it not for an unpleasant note which I suspect is the cucumber. Unfortunately, most cucumber notes get unpleasantly artificial and odd on me.

As the cucumber note disappears, around 1 hour or so from spraying, becomes a woody aquatic fragrance, and dry like a dry wine. Almost what I wanted, only a bit too linear. There's some clean musk there too.

Not buying this one either, because of the cucumber and because I still hope to find a wood scent that suits me more.

It seems nice and office-friendly if your skin handles cucumber better than mine.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: It is what it is, an aquatic ozonic splash with a pinch of sweetness from the apple note. I find it like Gap 655 for Women but not as harsh in the dry down. It's generic but a good example of the genre. I'll happily use up my sample this summer but won't be buying anything bigger. My new summer favourites don't have that ozonic note.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Omg! So I found this at Costco for 50 dollars for the 100mls bottle. Now, I LOVe the new eternity now, I like eternity moment so I thought why not try this....this is absolutely stunning! Omg I've died and gone to aquatic perfume heaven! I will say aquatics are my favourite so maybe if your not into those this wouldn't be for you, but wow if you are give this a try! I will be smelling myself all day!!

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
this perfume works really well with my skin chemistry and it produce a very gentle, fresh fragrance. oddly enough, i never personally smell it on me, but others always remark how lovely it is when i sit near them and they caught a whiff of my perfume.

triple thumbs up!~

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Eternity Aqua by Calvin Klein is a very fresh, summery aquatic that people will either love or hate. Floral aquatics are possibly one of the hardest fragrance groups to wear as many women can't get past the oddly synthetic nature of such scents. Admittedly I don't wear many aquatic scents, but I do appreciate them come Summer, especially seeing that I live in a very warm and dry climate.

This fragrance has a crisp floral aspect intermixed with sea salt and a blast of refreshing ocean air. It is very Summer appropriate and would make an excellent choice for anyone that lives in a particularly humid part of the world.

The watery cucumber note in the opening of Eternity Aqua smells really pleasant on my skin. As I already own the masculine version of Eternity Aqua which also shares this note, I am very fond of the cucumber accord. Towards the heart the floral notes come into play with tons of peony, jasmine and magnolia. The drydown is predominantly a soft mix of white musk and salty woods.

I do enjoy wearing Eternity Aqua for Women, however I must admit that it can't hold a candle to its masculine counterpart Eternity Aqua for Men. I find the female version just a touch too floral for my personal tastes.

Eternity Aqua is a fragrance along the same lines as Davidoff's Cool Water and Issey Miyake's L'eau d'Issey. If you like those fragrances, you'll surely enjoy Eternity Aqua as well.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: The cucumber on my skin smell not very good, like the cheap face cleaning, and it cause me headache

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
I absolutely love this! Eternity Aqua is such a clean and refreshing aquatic fragrance!

It starts with a splash of fresh and crisp cucumber and apple-apricot note, and then mellow down to soothing floral notes like gardenia, magnolia, jasmine etc and light musk.

The scent doesn't change too much though - it is a very weak fragrance which barely lasts for about one hour max on my skin (sometimes just half an hour!). Overall, if you like something fresh and aquatic with crisp fruity top and floral base that doesn't offend anyone, try this out!

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Before buying this preciosity I read most of the reviews I found here and a word caught my attention: CUCUMBER. I´m a huge fan of cucumber scent and I got crazy to buy this perfume. Also I like aquatic fragrances and what a beautiful name to allure me! Now that I finally got the perfume (a blind buy as you see) I assure you that Eternity Aqua for Women is on the top of my favorite fragrances list! I can´t stop sniffing myself! lol

Something says that men love to sniff fragrances like that on a woman´s neck... Just saying! ;)

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Oh yeah, much better than plain ol' Eternity. my first day wearing this, and I am truly enjoying it. It starts with a bold water scent to me, very little cucumber, and none of the other top notes listed. Just water water water, and i love that. it's one of my favorite scents in summer. Then as it dries down I get a watery honeysuckle scent that catches my attention on occasion. Finally, after about 5 hours, all I'm getting is honeysuckle. Again, not on the list of notes, but at this point I don't care. I guess I could call it jasmine, but it's not like that to me. I love both flowers, and this is very specifically honeysuckle. Mmmm. I am still catching whiffs of it through this last, 6th, hour, from one arm. I truly like this one. Finally!

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is one of those scents where I pull myself together in order not to judge and just say that I'd have to wait for the heat to kick in this summer to actually give it a chance. The 'nasty' heat!


Edit: I smell like a perfumed cucumber that jumped into a swimming pool full of ice cubes.

Very VERY refreshing. Got it for cheap at tj maxx.

I wish the other notes would say something to me, especially the apricot.

Only cucumber on me. But for a 50 ml of freshness , I won't complain.

It's stifling where I live!

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: very fruity(cucmber and apple) and then aquatic

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: YES!! I love it. My very first love of CK was CK shock for her and this is my second CK perfume that when i test it on my skin, i go, hell yeah! Its so fresh, its floral, its ozonic, its just perfect for summer!Saw this on sale at TJMaxx for 20$,so I had to grab 2 bottles! I will be wearing this all summer long. I love it. :) Longevity, 4-5hours. I am not complaining!

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
I love this scent. It smells so pretty. I usually have bad luck with CK fragrances but not this one. It's pretty, light, and unique! I'm an office girl and can see myself wearing this again and again year round :)

I still love and adore this scent, but I've recently found that it triggers headaches :( Such a shame, since I think it's very wearable and adorable.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This does smell like surf laundry detergent, but not in a bad way, more like in the wash. Fresh, clean. I get about 5 hours out of this which is perfectly fine for the beach or pool etc. I much prefer Aramani Acqua di Gioia to this one though, now that one is real nice and has more of a citrus and sugar fresh scent rather than the clean laundry of this one.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: There is a dominant note right from the beginning that smells like Surf washing powder, it lingers for close to 4-5 hours. :(

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Like most water-themed scents, this starts out nice but easily morphs into sickly-sweet old lady perfume because of the cedar note.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
i love this stuff. I know there are a quite a few people here that arent impressed, but I am the kind of girl that prefers lighter, easier to wear scents for the most part. This one is fresh and clean, aquatic but not too crisp, all without being soapy. Its light enough to wear in the summer in Florida heat and humidity, which is hard to find in my opinion. (I hate when I can smell someones perfume from 10ft away... ugh.) The drydown is nice and soft as well, not overly musky (I also dislike most musk scents- too heavy and oppressive.) This is my staple scent throughout the year... (except the few cooler days in FL when I can wear my heavier, creamy caramel based smellies without offending everyone on the block.) ;)

If you are looking for an easy to wear, light, fresh, aquatic- you will probably like this!

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I get lots of cucumber and apple, obviously...its lush and it is ozonic and airy. Not as good as the original only because it isn't as unique. If you are wearing this, you could certainly confuse this with a handful of others. A better ozonic is Bvlgari omnia crystalline edp in my opinion. But it is fresh, and it lasts a few hours. And if you don't already own something similar, it is a giid edition.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Eternity is my signature fragrance but, when it comes to Eternity Aqua, all I can say is - no, no and no!
And this, pretty much, applies to all other special editions as well.

I often compare them to Issey Miyake which is my 2nd most favourite fragrance- I love all versions of that perfume. The designers have, somehow, managed to keep the base intact and play with the character. Moreover, every single version echoes the name that it carries- floral, lotus, Absolute...
I can't say any of this for Eternity versions. From the perspective of a happy customer of Issey Miyake special editions, I could say that something seems to have gone badly wrong with the variations of Eternity- I just don't feel the original notes anymore. I don't find Aqua at all aquatic. The aquatic version of a ozonic/aquatic fragrance should, IMHO; be lighter and more airy than the original. In this case, it's an almost green, an not at all light. It has no character either. What I find to be soapy in a positive way about the original, turns into a dish-washing detergent soapy in this version. And, I'm pretty sure that I wouldn't care for this detergent either.
I'm having trouble detecting the base note that spoils the fun, it's not Cedar but it is something woody.
I just don't like it. Besides, it leans towards a man's cologne.
It definitely doesn't match the price.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells soapy clean. Just like a bit lighter version of clinique happy heart.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I like it !!! And I'm looking forward to wearing it even after the end of summer :o)

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This and Davidoff Cool Water supposed to be fresh and airy but some flowery note is blowing into my nose and i feel sick. Jadore and so many flowery fragrance in the same way. I wear Poem easyly but Eternity Aqua seems heavy to me. Makes no sense. Any idea what note it can be?

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Not as good as the original one in my opinion, actually I was a little disappointed.
I really don't enjoy that cucumber mix with peony. It's brings slushy kind of freshness.
A clean scent, but could possibly cause headaches.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: On the paper it smells more intensive than on my skin. It openes with grapefruit on my opinion. I like it.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
This was a nice cool and light scent. Perfect for the warm summer weather and very casual. Initially you get a burst of apple, but once it mellows, the floral notes are much more evident. It has a somewhat powdery scent once it mellows. It did fade really fast
The bottle conjures images of the cool ocean, and looks very modern and pretty. Over all, while not a perfume I would wear often, but it was nice

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
got a sample at Sephora, and I usually will spritz my wrist then sit at computer looking at this site, and wait for the full effect of the perfume. So far, I get just a clean/sharp scent, almost masculine on me. I prefer more sensual, soft, musky amber vanilla scents so this is far from that. To me it smells like men's cologne and it kind of gives me a stomach ache the more I keep sniffing it up close. But when I wave my arm around, it smells nice and fresh. Might be a good one for hot summer days. I prefer my VS Bombshell though.

Update: I always like to sample perfumes again, because maybe that day was different. So decided to try this one again. I get the same effect as before. Very sharp on my skin. When I get ones that are too sharp they remind me more of a house cleaning product like windex rather then perfume. Not my cup of tea for sure.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Just smells juvenile to me. Like all the things I hated about Curve in high school.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: In a blind test: dupe for cucumber melon hand soap ~ $2/ 7.5 oz. Smell like you just washed? Your call.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: What you need to know about this perfume is simple. Do you want to smell of cucumber and nothing but cucumber? If yes, this is for you. If not, give it a pass.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
On me, this is a cross between DKNY Be Delicious and Chloe EDP minus the rose. Fresh, clean, and perfect for spring and summer. I find this more of a day scent and is appropriate for work or casual wear. It doesn't draw too much attention to yourself although people do notice it when you walk by, even when you think the scent is gone. So the longevity is good at 6+ hours and so is the sillage although not overpowering. Glad I picked up this perfume.

Update: Make sure your skin is well moisturized. This, I've found, has a very high alcohol content that can dry your skin making the fragrance not last very long. Argan oil helps tremendously.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: guter Sommer und Frühling Duft. Frisch nicht aufdringlich, für jeden Tag. Langlebigkeit niedrig. Keine Blumen spürbar nur frische.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I really like this, smells very clean

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This scent had a very familiar quality to it, and then after awhile it hit me. This smells like an aquatic version of VS Bombshell, in the sense that they both smell like bubble bath rather than perfume. I wasn't very impressed by the longevity but I can see how this might be a good choice in very hot, humid weather when only something light will do.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This fragrance is best for the summer heat. You cant smell it much in the winter! Its one of the very few peony containing fragrances that I can stand as I really dislike the strong peony in Eternity Moment. This fragrance has the right balance of florals and fruits and is still quite unique. These scents are my types! Dont discontinue this one CK!

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Feeling the heat? Too busy to get to the pool? Why not try a spritz of Eternity Aqua!

It takes me right back to my teen years and carefree days at the pool... lying poolside on the closely mown grass, surrounded by well-tended green hedges with white flowers that have been warmed by the sun to release their sweet scent, and statuesque tall trees around the outskirts providing welcoming shade. The promise of instant refreshment from the sparkling turquoise water.

A clean, fresh floral fragrance that I love to wear on a hot day. Beautiful.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: My friend wears this, and it's wonderful on her. It's light, slightly fruity, and floral. Cucumber is prominent in Eternity Aqua. It's a very pleasant fragrance to sit next to. It doesn't work well for everyone, but it lasts on her!

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
I've been looking for a floral aquatic that's also feminine. This is it! In my search I've tried Acqua di Gioia, Davidoff Cool Water, And Ralph Lauren Ralph, and this one is the best one!

I had originally planned on getting myself a bottle of Acqua di Gioia because it smelled pretty good on me, but Eternity Aqua worked much better on my skin, it has some elegance to it that I didn't get in AdG. Eternity Aqua lasts a bit longer too.

This scent is great for everyday, casual use. It'll be my go-to scent during the weekends and possibly for the office. I can't imagine it offending anyone.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: A true Aqua it smells really like water/ kind of swimpool/tapwater. fresh really fresh.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: People, I wanna buy an perfume! This one is good? Smell's like sweet or much more aquatic? I can smell apricot fruit in me? Thank ;)

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I find it quite similiar to Davidoff Cool Water. It is a clean, aquatic scent, perfect for the summer. Reminds of of the sea breeze, white sand beaches and relaxing, lazy holidays. It is a pleasant fresh choice for everyday, even though not very original. Have a go!

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
i'm wearing this perfume today and i must say i am very much so enjoying it on this hot summer day.
very light, fresh, clean, and refreshing perfume.
i cannot see anyone complaining about this fragrance.
i can smell some aqua notes with fresh florals. very nice and pretty.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Very clean scent for summer , citric and sweet, also very similar to acqua de goia but a little bit sweeter.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Not that I need another perfume... but I bought it anyway. It was on sale at a fantastic price (which is rare for Australian retail!) and I just could not resist because the thought of this scent lingered in my mind since first trying it several weeks ago. To me, this is just lovely. Not a "wow" type of fragrance, but more of a "mmm delicious, I just want to whiff my wrists" type of scent.

Eternity Aqua is clean and opens with a refreshing cucumber note. Not in a tangy or irritating way either (ever notice how some scents just get right up your nose and almost burn the skin inside your nostril from their harshness?). Not this one, this scent is well bodied and rounded and soothing from the first moment of application. This scent has both gardenia and magnolia, which are my favourite flowers-their blooms are beautiful and smell divine to me. There is almost a sweetness to the floral and aquatic notes, which hits the spot with a gourmand lover like me. I find this perfume to be a really great base to layer with sweeter perfumes. The scent doesn't change too much during the drydown for me, other than for the crisp top notes mellowing down to softer and warmer versions.

To me, this is a grown-up take on Cool Water Woman, which was my signature scent as a teenager years ago. Definitely love at first whiff. This scent takes me away to a happy place.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: It's a very clean, fresh scent...suits for everyday wear on all seasons.... It's more of a casual wear!!!! The bottle is so fabulous!!!!

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This perfume is very fresh and clean that has a safe distance from smelling like a detergent thankfully. I think it smells too masculine for my taste.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
I was so excited to try this - it's been a while since CK has wowed me with something and that despite me being a big time CK fan in the early and late nineties. So this I had high expectations for.

Let's just say, for something with the name "Eternity" on it, it sure falls short. Very short. It's nice, yes. But that's just about it. Nice. Inoffensive. Ok.

I'm missing thart je ne sais quois, that splash of freshness, that mmmmmmmm effect I was so hoping for, instead it's just blah. Kinda clean, kinda nice. To say I'm disappointed is an understatement. Maybe a little less floral and a little more citrus or wood would have made a big (positive) difference.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Lovely and fresh, but I can dupe this with many aqua scented shower gels. I enjoyed my test spray, but it falls short of being a signature scent. I have been using Method Hand Soap in "Sea" and that is a perfect dupe, and lasts as long. I would enjoy smelling this on a man, to see if any masculine woods come out to play.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: very nice and long lasting

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This is a really beautiful,fresh smelling perfume.i love the way you can smell fruit and flowers together so feminine.smell does not last very long but hey keep a bottle with you and you will be feeling beautiful all day long.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
A very dry and crispy scent. There is a sharp note in it that seriousely bothers me like rotten apples or something. Also, the cucumber here isn't very great. It actually turned sour on me. Overall i don't think this is a feminin scent. And personally i don't want to smell anything like this, for fear of offending anyone near me with the smell of sour apples.
Longevity: 4h+
Projection: leaves a trail so be careful if it turns sour on you.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
I'm a big fan of the freshness of "aquatic" and "ozone" fragrances, and haven't really hit anything as good as my old 80's favoriate "New West" by Aramis. So when this was advertised, I was really excited and couldn't wait to get my hands on a bottle!! I love CKone, but it was a little too ambiguous sexually for me, I have been holding out for something special for a long time, making do with "Acqua di Gioia" in the meantime. So you are getting the picture of the fragrances I like...

Eternity Acqua is nice. Just that, nice. Even when you first spray it, the fragrance isn't strong at all, it just smells astringent. After two or three minutes, you get a vague scent of ozonic sea mixed with green wood. Then that's it. Done. It's got less staying power than a 16 year old boy on his first date!!! Honestly, by the time I've sprayed it on my skin and clothes, brushed my teeth and walked down the stairs the fragrance is gone. Even layering with the body lotion doesn't seem to give it any more staying power. I have to ask if anyone likes it, and they have to lean in and practically rub their nose on my skin to smell anything!!! The answer is usually "smells fresh, like soap or laundry softener". Not the effect I've been after So, I'm back to Acqua di Gioia - which at least I get compliments on!!

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I bought the yello summer edition because i fell in love with it instantly. i didnt smell this one because i know im not a fan of ocean smell (somehow it makes me nauseos) but this turns out like a perfect sweet, young adult ocean scent on my skin! so thats two purchases from Calvin Klein Eternity summer this year :)

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Love the ocean smell, but doesnt last very long at all. I should think it would be very disappointing when wearing in the summer .

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Like after a bath, fresh, clean and nice smell

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I can't tell what's special with this frag, it reminds me of many other fresh, summer fragrances out there. Yes it's nice, a crowd pleaser, but lack of personality. Safe for office yet will never make you stand out in the crowd. Though way cheaper, AA Green Tea Essence has more robust personality than this one.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Wonderfully light and refreshing on the paper strip. I really liked the apple and cucumber top notes. Unfortunately, it smelt like refined and expensive toilet spray on my skin (though luckily for me it also disappeared after about 10-20 minutes) Beautiful if used on the right person, but Eternity Aqua is not for me.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: This one is on my wish list for summer!...it smells real nice, fresh and radiant....I agree with those who linked it to L'eau par kenzo. It's close to the flanker l'eau 2 par kenzo, but instead of sweet ripe pear (which i didnt like in l'eau 2) there is this crisp yummy apple. I think Eternity Aqua is a go-to everyday scent, pleasant for the wearer as well as those around. Must try!!!....

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: i can smell pineapple somewhere in the middle...its so damn refreshing! love it!..totally recommended!yeahhh!

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: it leaves a beautiful path ahhh wonderland :)))

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Really nice and fresh. I love it!

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Eternity Aqua definitely smells better than the Original. It reminds me of a cologne. I like the men's version better though.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I'm usually not very much into "ozonic" scents but this one is a little different, i like that it's sweet, the cucumber is great too.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content:
Its ok not great but ok .if you want something subte
and fresh you might want to give this a go.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: The cucumber-y freshness of Eternity Aqua really reminds of the freshness of L'Eau par Kenzo with a modern tinge. Strictly speaking Eternity Aqua smells like one of those L'Eau Par Kenzo flankers.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Very fresh and aquatic. It reminds me of this cucumber water they serve at the salon I go to. It is very "spa like." I like it alot!

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Calvin Klein Eternity Aqua for women is refreshing, cool, and clean! Sweet apricot, crisp cucumber, fresh cedar, and juicy red apple to a dry down of light woods, peony and subtle hints of magnolia. Since I bought the 3.4 oz bottle they gave me the most adorable matching tote bag. Eternity Aqua is excellent for those hot summer months and the perfect aquatic scent for women! Love it!

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: Ok I guess. I like it more than the men's but that isn't saying much. Been there, done that a million times before. Oh well. On to the next one Calvin. : )

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I'm in love with this perfume! Fresh, clean, pretty and perfect for day and summer. Lasts all day.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: I was able to test this jem in the Mall yesterday and was quite impressed.A very nice, clean, aquatic scent,not a marine,though.It starts fruity with apricots and apple,but is not exactly juicy,the cucumber gives freshness,while the apple instead of making the composition crispy,gave it a little tartness,which makes it quite unique into my eyes.Then the white floral came out .I sprayed a lot of the perfume on me and also sprayed on a piece of paper.Well,it mixed quickly with my body chemistry,so after may be 10 min.I wasn't able to smell it any more on me.But the scent remained on the paper.I can actually still smell it from it.Apparently it is mostly the drown-down which is a very pleasant cedar,mixed with woodsy motes and not too much musk.I am planing to buy it,but right now is quite pricey-$54 for 1.7fl.oz and $74 for 3.4.I'll wait for a better offer or if they decide to make sets.I love the perfume,but in this bad economy,I'd rather shop wisely.

product_name: Eternity Aqua for Women Calvin Klein
review_content: It looks like it's gonna be a very nice,clean,crispy,white floral perfum.I am so looking forward for it!

product_name: CK One We Are One Magnets Calvin Klein
review_content:
i bought it today and i shocked because the saleswoman she not tell me its ck one just in different bottle..what does this mean?
its mean i waste 17 kd (61.2$) for nothing.just for silly magnetic balls inside the box.
and still i have ck one 200 ml
wtfh.... i felt i get punked but not from Ashton Kutcher its from Calvin Klein

product_name: CK One We Are One Magnets Calvin Klein
review_content: Calvin Klein CK One opens with a sharp clean scent of lavender, lemon, pineapple, and bergamot. As it begins to dry down you smell more of the freesia and mandarin with cedar. The base is a deep green scent of tea, nutmeg, and soft musk. CK One is the best selling unisex fragrance since it debuted in 1994. The notes have a way of complimenting every person who wears CK One in a unique way that fits them. I really like CK One, it’s an excellent fragrance!

product_name: CK One We Are One Magnets Calvin Klein
review_content:
I saw this in Kuala Lumpur, I didnt try it because they said it's still the same CK One, only diffirent bottle. But there're totally diffirent notes here...(!???)
Also, there's a little cute gift that comes with the fragrance! I'm not sure what it is, but it's kinda metal chains or something!

I thought i will get a vintage green cilantro peppery spicy scent ( which i hate } ended up smelling a soapy plain floral fragrance that smells like it was released in 1996
No spicy carnation that’s weird but absolutely not bad im actually shocked it smells pleasant

A delicate, fresh, elegant, classic, aromatic, musky perfume that evokes a feeling of freshness and cleanliness, like after a shower, perfect for this upcoming summer. An old perfume, created in 1988, but completely timeless. Eternity is a type of perfume that has evolved and aged very well.
A perfume that has a sweetness of cleanliness and white floral notes very present here. It's a floral, with an aromatic opening, with green notes, which doesn't bother me at all, as it's all very well done. And then comes the white floral note, which I'm completely in love with, and which takes over this perfume, with lots of jasmine, freesia, and lily. This floral note gives it the characteristic of a clean, transparent, fresh, slightly soapy, and very striking perfume.
A perfume that earns compliments and is totally versatile, to be used on any occasion.
It's a beautiful, brilliant, perfectly balanced, cozy, and very pleasant perfume. And the name itself says it all, Eternity, eternal and beautiful to this day. I'm delighted!

This fragrance hold a lot of sentimental value to me as it was one of my mom's favorites, and it comforts me and makes me think of her when I wear it. I feel like the greenness of it might smell too sharp to some noses, so I haven't worn it out in public, only at home. I like to apply it right after a shower as I feel like it compliments the smell of soap and shampoo.

Smells like floral soap. If I encountered someone wearing this, I wouldn't find it dated / vintage, though. It's surprisingly inoffensive and just... "clean".

It I wanted this effect, I personally would pick Cerruti 1881 over this, however.

I hadn't smelled this in so many years... I went to the store today to smell it again. I'm so surprised at how much this is a rose bomb. I can hardly smell anything else in it. It's really beautiful... but definitely has a 80s vibe. It's a spicy herbal rose. Very nice but a little dated... if you're really into vintage perfumes you have to try this one.

Very floral scent with a vintage vibe so it won't be for everyone. You also have to wait for it to dry down to fully enjoy it. Personally I like it for spring or early autumn rainy days. It is like a wet bouquet of flowers. It is surely not a versatile summer or winter frangrance for me, but there are some times I appreciate it.

Back then this was a beautiful woman’s signature perfume-who I knew. 20 years ago I wore this because of her. I didn’t like it, but nowadays I bought a new bottle of this. It really reminds me of dauer water. (She was a hairdresser😃)

I absolutely love this fragrance. It’s a beautiful green, clean floral that makes me feel so fresh and happy whenever I wear it.

The violet is super prominent on me, it gives off such a lovely powdery vibe to the perfume which makes it feel softer and not too floral. I saw some other reviews say it has an almost tea scent to it which I totally get! It’s an almost green tea note somewhere mixed in and it’s so pretty. I wear this as a daily perfume a lot as it’s perfect for daytime occasions, I’m not too sure I would wear this as an evening fragrance though as I don’t think it suits that vibe.

I highly recommend if you are looking for a fresh, floral fragrance that is perfect for everyday wear.

Mexican Bird of Paradise! I have never ever smelled the scent outside of the actual plant. Until Eternity. Wondrous!

Didn’t wear this in the ‘90s and wish I had. Has the distinctive, fantasy universe, fruit and flower tea base that is Sophia Grojsman’s trademark. She rules that domain. Eternity adds fresh, sweet-green, citrusy, round, lush, and miraculously spicy to her magical tea thing. The mix is beautiful.

This fragrance deserves way higher marks than it seems to be getting here — trends don’t interest me, just art, interest, fun, and beauty and Eternity checks those boxes. Enjoying the hell out of wearing this. It’s fun, a lot of fun.
Difficult to imagine a woman or girl wearing it nowadays, but it could be cool.

Lembro da minha mãe usando quando eu era criança. Hoje, é um perfume que nunca fica de fora da minha coleção, até o último ganhei da minha mãe mesmo. Cheiro de limpeza, me traz uma paz com sofisticação. Eu amo!

Loved it. Had to buy some chemist-store perfume in a hurry and this was the only one that stood out and was not sickening (like the celebrity pongs). Reminds me a little of Tommy Hilfiger's unisex fragrance for some reason, the citrus I think.

I have both the OG formulation and the new one. I shall describe them thusly.

The original Eternity is the OG Karen of all the vintage fragrances. Loud. Entitled. In your face. Smelling of citrus. Demanding attention from the management. She requires extra lemon in her water. Then, she morphs into some kind of weird, sweetish pipe tobacco smell that lingers for days on your clothes or whatever zip code was invaded during her visitation. In the end, no flowers detected here, only vitriol.

The new iteration is an elderly version of Karen after she broke her hip and went to the nursing home. She can’t wander freely about the premises, but she can still run her mouth, make demands of the staff, and guilt her children and grandchildren into visiting her. Whereupon they will once more smell the weird tobacco essence, just less strong and now accompanied by a vague white floral-ness.

OG Karen is insufferable. Elderly Karen is much nicer to wear. I’m not at all sorry that this has been reformulated. Regardless, I hate them both based on my personal preferences, but I must say the OG version was truly a revelation in its time.

The opening is crisp, citrusy, almost dry. Over time, it softens into a lightly floral, perhaps subtly powdery direction. While its gentleness may guide the composition toward feminine notes, to me, it's a unisex scent with soft projection, moderate longevity, and a high level of wearability that feels safe for any setting.

This is definitely not my scent profile. Very heavy florals. To my nose it’s incredibly screechy. Reminds me of something I cannot put my finger on. Got it as a free sample, hopefully will not have to smell it on myself or anyone else :)

Eying with this one from time to time, smell it again, not buying, considering again cycle.

This is a bouquet of ice-cold flowers, timeless and elegant. My observation is that is smells better below 20 Celsius, more edgy, it falls flat in heat.

This was my first ever perfume, and one I find myself coming back to often. It's a bit dated, but with fresh, white florals, it's a great layer perfume. I find it brings a level of sophistication and age (in a good way) to some of my more niche perfumes. be careful to not overspray, as it is a powerful one, but I love it all the same.
Something in is so off to my nose! It's simply awful, i tried it twice, i even asked my mom about that and she said "oh, i never liked eternity! That thing reeks", so i guess it runs in my family lol

One of my mom's signature fragrances, it has a really strong sillage and longevity, surprising for Calvin Klein. The florals are a bit too harsh for my taste, it gives me a headache. But if you do like the scent, it's a great buy because it will last on your skin and clothes forever.
Oh, I like this one. Normally, I would never gravitate towards something like this, but I got a sample of it as a gift and woah, I like it. Fresh, green, citrusy, not too sweet

I love Eternity, I love its refined melancholy, its silent and ethereal atmosphere, its bouquet extraordinarily balanced between life and death, between earth and water. An exciting perfume, rich in contrasts, amplified in the last decade by Christy Turlington. A sort of modern Ophelia wrapped in the floral torpor of this leaden, magnificent creation.
Alas this does not work for me. I smell sad dark energy bug spray. Odd.

Spring florals. Lots and lots of spring florals. It's like you are wearing a spring floral bouquet on your skin.

It's not like 24 Faubourg, which also smells like lots of spring florals. But 24 Faubourg smells like the inside of a florist shop and quite hyacinth heavy. It has green stems in the scent profile, which Eternity has not.

In comparison Eternity has more of a freesia and carnation dominant floral bouquet scent profile (rather than hyacinth and green stems). So it's equally mega floral, but more of a floral bouquet rather than a flower shop (as it doesn't have that cut stems note).

Very lovely, very appropriate for spring and summer. It has a lovely freshness to it.
If you don't mind gardenia (which can sometimes come across as "vintage" smelling) and you'll love spring florals then you'll love it.

Floral perfumes are one of my favorites so I had to try this one obviously. Unfortunately, it’s too cold for me and has a note I cannot describe that is off putting. Kinda a sweaty skin smell? It was weird, I felt like I haven’t showered for a while, a bit embarrassing.
Carnation and freesia are really strong in this one and leave a noticeable trail.
To my surprise, it’s a beast mode floral. I haven’t met any other floral with such a great longevity. After 12 hours I could still smell a cloud around me and that’s impressive.
Apparently my skin chemistry and Eternity don’t work well together, so I have to give it off.
I recommend checking it out anyway if you like green, fresh florals.

finally found the fragrance that my mom wears to all the special occasions. so aggressively floral. still a bit traumatic for me since it js reminds me of hot summer weddings, graduations, and sunday mass. projection is very strong.

This has been my #1 Fragrance for 30 years. I compare everything else I try to it. I have a handful of other frags that I enjoy, but keep coming back to the OG Eternity. Super sad the reformulated version is a figment of the OG. Of all the flankers, I enjoy Rose Blush the most. Getting tougher to find as it was discontinued years ago

This scent is fresh, clean, light and breezy. This is clean girl aesthetic, tennis skirts, sitting on the lawn of your college, sunny spring days. I personally use this as my job interview perfume. It can be layered very easily. It lasts around 3-4 hrs for me.

This didn’t just belong to your mom. It belonged to everyone’s. Which automatically etches it as “momsy” in my scent memory and makes me wanna flinch a little.

It opens like an overzealous florist’s shop at 8 a.m. on Mother’s Day. Carnation, freesia, violet, heliotrope, God knows what else. All so fresh, loud, explosive, borderline unhinged. There’s a vintage-dusted spice beneath the florals too, and it grabs you by the blouse and doesn’t let go.

It’s the kind of fragrance that owns spring, but on a hot and humid summer day? It doesn’t wear. It smothers. 💀

It’s drama. It’s volume. It’s Calvin Klein convincing women they could have it all, including a migraine in a bottle.

Would I wear it? Hell no. But I respect it for what it is: a powdered relic from the cocaine-chic decade when video killed the radio star and Sophia Grojsman said, “Florals? Let’s go nuclear.”

∞/5 — a classic I’ll eternally not crave.

This vividly reminds me of my childhood, like sunbathing in the garden on a summer day without a pool. Just putting on sunscreen, lying on my stomach on a towel, and absentmindedly ripping dandelion leaves because sunbathing is kind of boring. I don’t enjoy smelling like it, but it brings back some good memories.

This caught my eye based on the notes combination, tried it on the skin and i'm in love!

It's the kind of a fragrance that forms a soft floral cloud around you. Super ethereal. A bit powdery. A bit of patchouli and woody notes to form a base for the beautiful airy bouquet. Smells like walking through the garden, well balanced, this can never go out of style. My new go-to spring x summer office siren scent. Price is amazing for the longevity. Truly iconic.

Smells like pickled olives to me. Makes me crave feta, pickled green olives, and fried pickles from Buffalo Wild Wings. I'd hate to smell like this, but whenever I have that craving for acidic comfort food, I dab this on and feel better.

Smells like you dropped a jar of pickled green olives all over the flower arrangements in the wedding aisle and a bit of it got on the bride's dress, leaving a yellow-green stain that's just green enough for people to know it's not urine. Maybe that's the green notes in this, cuz believe me- it does smell green. The sourness of the olives, from the juice, and in the face of the furious Bridezilla dominate this scent experience, but there are definitely some pretty flowers in the background, sullied by the splash. Acidity, flowers, and disappointment on a big day.

Still comfortable and cozy though. I give this a 5/10
I just came here to say that jaguarundina’s review is on top 3 of the craziest reviews of all time
I loved this, smells so clean and it reminds me of rain and expensive shampoo. Amazing for layering too, with cloud by Ariana grande it smells divine. u either love it or hate it

this shall be a strange story. but I'll give explanations where I can. I know this perfume well. my perfume career started in 1974 and in 1980 I was 23 years old. so I have lived the 1980s to the fullest. which means, for the queer half of a twin with my straight twinbrother, that he loved gent's scents and I immediately decided they were nothing for me, in 1974 that is. now when the 1980s started this would prove for me the most prominent decade of perfumery (while I wasn't aware of that then). now Calvin Klein offered in 1985 one of the three baddest hookers of the infamous 1980s Obsession. she was accompanied by Chanel Coco, Dior Poison and Giorgio Beverly Hills. these were my kind of perfumes. and my mother loved them too, to the detriment of my poor father with his excellent nose... Eternity then came in 1988, in 1989 'Giorgio Beverly Hills Red'. also in 1988 you had Estée Lauders Knowing. further Moschino parfum de toilette, Chistian Lacroix C'Est la Vie, YSL's Opium (1977) and Paris a sharp rose perfume (lovely). I could go on with name-dropping but this is my purpose: these were not perfumes but chemical warfare. these were code 4 Alarmist Presentist perfumes which took up the space and asphyxiated everyone. and so did Eternity and I loved it. but things can go strange. I smelled it then, but with the overload of perfumes which I actually bought and used, and bought for my mother, Eternity somehow managed to stay out of reach. I loved it but found it also as strong as it was, 'unchangeable'. then Calvin Klein launched Escape while Dior launched Dune, which I both didn't liked so much.
