Something struck me with this perfume, it was as though i had smelled it before, but no idea where or on whom. reminds me of a perfect late summer night by the sea with love in the air. purchased it today after smelling it on my wrist all yesterday. The sillage is perfect, not too much and not to little, just as a perfume should. Even though its not powerfull, it lasted 15 hours on me!! absolutely love it

It smells very similar to all the different Eternity summer editions which is not bad. I always like it anyway. It's fresh and calming at the same time. The bottle is beautiful. I think it's a tiny bit nicer than last year's edition but maybe I just think that because I haven't smelled it for a year..:) I wish they would bring back Eternity Purple Orchid. That was wonderful.

I was looking to purchase this online and noticed Sephora says it has Japanese Pear, White Peony, Comforting Musks. Looking at above notes and comparing, I am REALLY confused. Has anyone smelled this and can they tell me if they smell pear? Osmanthus and Wisteria do not equal peony. Any input is appreciated.

Although the listed notes are different,this edition reminds me a lot of their 2011's edition,just without the spicy coriander in the top notes.Very nice and fresh,long lasting and great projection.Would be perfect for the hot summer days and nights.It gets love from me.I'll buy it soon.

In my personal experience, CK be comes across as a lackluster and uninspiring fragrance. I can't even say that I dislike it; it simply falls flat, with minimal development on the skin. The floral notes within it feel artificial and lack vibrancy. Furthermore, the combination of ingredients fails to create a harmonious blend. Considering these aspects, I believe the decision to discontinue its production was more than justified. However, to provide a fair assessment, I must acknowledge that CK be is not an exceptionally terrible composition. I've received even worse fragrances as gifts (incidentally, also from the Calvin Klein brand), but that discussion warrants a separate post.

My rating: Not recommended. (3/7)

Aromatic, lavender, fresh green and citrus. Smells like high spring in a bottle. Generic cologne kind of vibe haha.

Performance gone in 20 minutes
It smells like a weak version of White Musk Tesori d'Oriente

I have for sale the sought-after vintage formula of this, 100ml, only tested, you can tell by the different logo. Can post only within the UK. Take a look at my profile, I'm downsizing my huge collection, lots of discontinued gems!

Bought this 3 years ago, forgot about it, found it again. Now I'm gonna use it on my sheets. It smells like a boy that just got out the shower. Longevity sucks but its fresh and nostalgic for when I'd try to hide the smell of cigarettes and weed coming home after a night out when I was a teenager.

Scent is not bad. Very unisex, mild, easygoing floral fragrance. But performance is an insult to the industry. This is pretty much scented water. I have MANY aftershaves that last way longer than this. I seriously doubt this is even at EDT concentration. Needless to say, I won't purchase again.

I'm not familiar with the Calvin Klein line, except for one or two bottles. The notes and accords looked nice, and people said that it was a safe buy, so I wanted to give it a shot.

I'm kinda disapointed. It's difficult to pinpoint or find the notes, honestly, even the basic mains ingredients. For a good hour, until it really dries down, it smells like sunscreen spray, then it smells a little bit more like flowers and lavender, though still with a weird odor over it. Maybe it's an old batch, who knows.

The longevity is, as other people said, atrocious, but this is definitely an amazing fragrance for summer and hot weather. It's also very accessible on discounter websites. 30$ for a 100ml is an amazing deal if you want to expand your collection or simply try it out.

Maybe it's my skin, maybe not my type of fragrance, but CK Be isn't rocking it for me, sadly.

Hate to see the hate for CK Be. It is a lavender lovers dream and so much more than some of these reviews.

The longevity sucks but that initial spritz is something to behold. As good a retro blast as you're gonna get.

If you are showing hate for this based on the smell alone, you are nasally-challenged and need to have your life choices questioned!

Extremely low-key after around 30 minutes. Around 1 hour later is like you have forgotten to spray it. Kinda useless at current formulation. The scent profile itself is good, classic smell from the 90s. The performance is a shame. Not worth over 10 bucks, there are cheaper colognes (EDC!) that perform way better

Nose Note #464

One of the lousiest flankers of anything ever. It smells almost like nothing at all right from first spray. Stays like that for decent amount of time (skin level, i.e. absolutely useless). Really, really, really vague a little sweet green scent...

5/10, it's pleasant smelling, but I despise the performance
This shit sucks... but if you leave it fermenting for 3 years you'll notice now you have an excuse to throw it away 👏👏👏

Rating: 8.0/10

My everyday go-to for years. I've gone through two 6.7 oz bottles of CK Be over the years, which should tell you just how much I’ve worn and enjoyed this fragrance. For a long stretch, this was my daily wear. It was easy to reach for, versatile, and clean.

I still remember the commercials when it first launched as a 6th grader. LOL! The commercials were moody, artistic, and full of that '90s minimalist cool. It really felt like the next big thing after CK One. To me, CK One was king, and it leaned a little sharp and citrusy, where CK Be always felt a bit warmer, and more personal.

It opens with a soft freshness that doesn’t scream for attention, then settles into a cozy, slightly musky skin scent. There’s nothing offensive or polarizing here, just a solid, comforting scent that manages to always feel modern to me.

While it might not be a performance beast, It’s subtle, and it’s perfect for everyday wear. If you’re looking for something low-key, fresh, and warm, CK Be is still a great option 30+ years later.
My friend had it it smelled like gardenia, horribly cheap womens gardenia fragrance

Just bought a new bottle. Appaling...it has hardly any smell at all...why CK why? Returned it to Amazon. Bought another from Perfume Click.....the same!!!
I am disgusted with this so called reformulation.

I purchased a vintage mini bottle a few years ago. It's a very bright, pleasant scent; kinda spicy-sweet. If I was just starting out without a huge collection, I would go full-sized bottle because it really is very nice.

One of my favourite clean fresh musks...or it would be if it had any form of longevity! It's truly a freshly laundered but hung out in the Mediterranean sun to dry type of musk. Clean, but in nature. I hope the O Boticario comes close to this because I NEED a dupe.

I had this a couple years ago lost the bottle and just bought another one because I’ve been craving it for summer. Found a 3.3fl/100ml bottle at Burlington for around 20 bucks. I love the lavender in here it’s not an essential oil lavender which I like but don’t want to smell like it’s more like a clean laundry airy lavender musky crisp linen to me. I live in east tn and it’s starting to get so humid and hot the only thing I can stand to wear is ck one and this 😭 the silage isn’t the best but I prefer that as I’m a daycare teacher and prefer skin scents or near skin scents when I’m at work. I can wear this and smell it on me throughout the day. I usually reapply every 2/3 hours depending on my breaks and it works great for me.

One of my favorite light and layerable non offensive fragrances. This is not only a good unisex fragrance, but versatile enough for all seasons and for people of different styles or different occasions. Its very fresh, but not super green, more fresh in an airy or ozonic kind of way, safe for mostly any occasion, but might be too light. Not at all sweet, nor does it have any particularly strong notes, if anything I would say the mint, lavender and juniper are the most noticeable.

The only thing that this perfume lacks is in its performance. Its appropriate for most all seasons but it doesn't seem to last long enough in the summer, and its sillage is probably about half a foot lol. Perhaps it also lacks in performance due to its ability to not be an offensive fragrance and a generally acceptable one, its almost too non offensive that its actually kind of unnoticeable at its strength. I feel it would massively benefit if it was stronger.

This is more of a personal take, but for some reason gives me a churchy kind of feel. Imagine an abandoned church in the deep forest, but its at night during a snowy blizzard. The air is fresh, cold and slightly dry, you could smell the trees but its subtle. The smell of the old church's and its incense is weak, but mixes in with this fresh cold air as it flows through its broken windows... maybe its just me but I feel like there is a tiny hint of incense that blends very well with everything, very subtle, unnoticeable. Perhaps this would be a good summer wear for any goths.

After feeling that CK One Shock had a scent that I liked, I finally decided to buy perfume from Calvin Klein again, yes CK be.

The smell I got when I first sprayed it was mandarin orange, with a touch of lavender and mint. This kind of fragrance is very similar to what I smell at my uncle's house, so when I wear it, some memories take me there.

I didn't expect more from this perfume by CK in terms of SPL, but I found that the longevity is very good, 8+ hours on skin and clothes. For this price, some perfumes like Versace Blue Jeans and some clone perfume brands like Armaf, afnan, rasasi or lattafa are more worth considering.

This is the definition of a basic, lavender fragrance that used to be popular in the 90's. I remember it from that era just because of the absolutely perfect advertising with Kate Moss. Never had it back then but my friends did. Bought it last year at the airport in Helsinki for a ridiculously cheap price. I will never understand its phenomenon. Pure shit that lasts as long as a short breath after a too intense run. Doesn't last even for an hour. Thank you, bye.
I had it 6 years ago, slightly elegant woody and floral. It was ok fragrance but nothing special. For starters in fragrance world is good.

Picked this up at the airport duty free on a total whim; I like it but I find its longevity and projection pretty frustrating and disappointing. I’ve heard the original formula was much nicer so it’s a shame that this new one just doesn’t give as much oomph as I’d like it to. Still, for the price point and how easily accessible it is, it’s a perfectly nice and inoffensive light spring/summer fragrance (it might be quite nice as a topper or to layer to be fair, I haven’t really tried that!).
This stuff would actually be pretty nice if it performed better. It's the worst performing fragrance I've ever had.

Got a bottle of this discounted for less than 20€.

The smell is ok, floreal and fresh.. the lavender and some green notes are what i get. It's marketed as unisex but it's probably more for men.

It really lasts just 1-2h though.. shame, i actually enjoy the smell.. it's kinda 'sophisticated business man'.

I think this is more suited to hot weather than cold.. at least you get some sillage out of it.
All time favorite for my husband. Please help me find a similar fragrance yet different 🙏🤩

A fragrance released in 1996 from the good old days that brings back memories of the past with nostalgia, even if you didn't live in that era. Suitable for all times and places, it is classified as unisex but leans more towards men's fragrances.
A harmonious fragrance rich in ingredients, blended with great craftsmanship so that no one aromatic ingredient overpowers the other.
The scent here is rich, creamy, fresh, fruity, herbal, woody, and smoky. A magic you won't find anywhere else. A simple and uncomplicated fragrance with many ingredients, you wish from the first moment that this scent would last with you forever.
Never ask about the performance; the performance is somewhat average, but it is compensated by the magic and depth of the scent.
Pros:
- Subtle and safe fragrance
- Sophisticated drydown
- Pleasant and reliable scent
- Easy to wear and won't offend
Cons:
- Poor longevity
- Short-lasting fragrance
- The bottle design is very primitive
In my personal opinion, if fragrance liquid were put in a niche bottle, it would sell for many times its simple price.
I don't usually buy fragrances twice, but there's an exception to every rule. CK BE is one of the fragrance I've bought several times, and every time I use it, I get compliments as if I'm actually using it for the first time.

A very serious and dark fragrance. Great for business men and serious men in general. If you like the smell of lavender then you will absolutely love this. It’s a dark fragrance with a bunch of lavender. When I say a bunch of lavender I really mean a bunch of lavender.
smell nothing like original fragrance, and it barely detectable, ie super weak, it's a shame....

costed me 25 in savers

good for quick trips outside instead of having to use a more expensive fragrance

Love this one for a long time. Great gym frag, very clean. Many are correct though, longevity and projection are an issue here. If anyone knows of a very close comparison or even a dupe, I'd welcome hearing your take on what it is. Original Mugler Cologne is in the neighborhood-ish, and maybe BLV pour homme, but I'd love to find something closer to it, just stronger. Message to Calvin: There's enough popularity with this one to re-introduce it in a parfum!🙏
parfümü sıktıktan 15-20 dakika sonra koku kayboluyor. şaka gibi. bana hediye edilmişti.
Reminds me of a movie called Gone in 60 seconds!!! 😂

This fragrance in particular is a fragrance i would personally wear to a pool party on a hot summer's day. The scent is of freshly cut grass it's got a very clean fresh out of the shower type of scent. However there are some performance issues present in this fragrance as a whole. For starters this fragrance is very weak : do not expect any compliments. Others will only be able to smell this if you come up to them personally and ask them to smell you. Secondly the longevity is just incompetent to make this a beast mode fragrance. I would give the scent a decent 6.5/10 but the negatives outweigh the positives in my opinion. Only but this fragrance if your trying to get a blast from the past. Thank you for reading yours sincerely fragheadkp9

Smells like a 90s teenager (in a good way). very fresh and pleasant, more homme scent than Unisex, the performance is not that bad as mentioned in many comments here. actually, it's better than Eternity Aqua and Euphoria in both longevity and silage. Buy 200ml bottle for $25 and enjoy it.
if this lasted past an hour or two it would be a banger but it still smells great 7/10.

Like Gendarme or Jean Naté, perfect after shower scent for bedtime or on a hot summer day. Definitely have to overspray bc it's super light, but it's one of the cleanest fragrances ever. Been a user since '96. Citrus, lavender, laundry 💛

Fun story on how a newbie learnt about maceration.

I got this gifted by a cousin and on the first spray I found it nice and safe but shit projection and sillage. I somehow managed to lose its cap, and due to its performance I put it at the back of my closet. Recently when I started getting more perfume, I just saw a CK logo shinning in the closet and took it and sprayed it.

CK Be had become a different person! What fragrance, what performance, what sillage. Feel in love with aromatic fragrances right there.

At first, I only smelled a somewhat green scent that disappeared in 10 minutes. However, after some months, one day I used it to go to the gym and discovered a really comfortable creamy musk scent that I loved. Surely, people around you won't probably notice you are wearing any fragrance, but you will certainly smell clean and fresh and I think that's the purpose of this perfume. If I find it with a good discount, I will probably buy a 200ml bottle for everyday use or the gym. It isn't anything mind-blowing, but it's nice and convenient.

Not one of my favourites at all, very chemically smelling, I feel like they put way to much alcohol in this and the longevity is so bad, I had this as a first time fragrance and almost quit buying because of this. I thought the reason I wasn't getting compliments was because I wasn't attractive enough to get compliments for a fragrance. Although after I got JPG Le Male and Afnan 9pm I learned it was just because the sillage on this fragrance was absolutely terrible and when I smelled my clothes to see if it was even still on after a few hours it was barely there. 2/10 for me.
decent, great for daily wear

This was my first Official Retail purchase, I bought this after smelling it at sephora and i quite liked it then, i had no idea about any of the notes or any of perfume related terms. I did use it for some time, it's a very mild , floral and fresh perfume that i thought was manly but smelt more feminine after prolonged wear, i still feel it is more feminine. I have given it to my mom now, cuz she likes it.

Picked this up for $20 and its a classic scent to have, its not strong at all but the smell is pretty good.
Only unisex I own easy wear not a statement one but clean uplifting no fuss easy chill scent. I adore Be.

this is the big brother of CK One more dark-ish vibes
but sadly the projection is weak i recommend wearing it after shower or just spray it in the air

It’s a great Fragrance, but I only use it for sleep because it doesn’t last long.

Smells good of course...i wish the projection or potency was a bit more long lasting....

More or less the same as CK one, only that this one is less nauseating

I’ve recently revisited this after buying one bottle and getting rid of it. But I decided to give it another go and subsequently fell in love. Leans masculine. It’s warm and sensual with hints of CK one at its core. This will not offend anyone, no matter how much you overspray. Which is something I encourage. In fact I think it’s mandatory to fully appreciate this one. Someone below mentioned that it smells like a Sharpie, which honestly it sorta does at the beginning. This opens a bit harsh. But patience is the key because the dry down is where this stuff shines IMO. Comfy cozy lavender. Musky clean linens. A hint of floral sweetness. All with that melancholic 90s' edge. Oh and performance is monstrous. Lasts all day and then some. Near eternal on clothes. I really don’t get the hate for this one.

It smells a bit fresh and a bit green and a bit floral, and it is very quiet. In the office, women can easily apply that and smell nicely. For men too, but, it is a bit unspectacular. This one has very good manners, nobody would be annoyed by it.
Green shower gel.
smells like a brand new sharpie

Finished this bottle in a hurry as it was not one of my favorites. It has a pretty strong lavender scent and although I love lavender, alongside all the other notes in this perfume I just don't think they worked well together. Starts off strong at first and then fades away somewhat quickly. I don't think I would purchase another one ever again as it was simply not my cup of tea.
It's alright, nothing special

Our first "expensive" perfume back in 1997 with my sister. Guys this juice has a wow factor. Someone like Marly or Dior must take this and reinterpratate into something with better quality and ingredients. It's a warm, clean( not too much) sweet( not too much) strawberry like, with beautiful darkness scent. Not for kids but with youth, with life. Interesting, not one of the same.
Some reformulations were too powdery or metallic and bad.
The magic in this fragrance is so fragile that a bad batch can ruin everything. I had many bottles. The best was a 50 ml 2005 batch. Low longevity and projection but pure beauty.

It was frustratingly weak when it came out and it’s frustratingly weak now.
But god I adore it.
Warm, cozy, spicy, fresh, flowery and enticing.
It’s the olfactory equivalent to a brief but deeply loving hug.
20+ sprays on your clothes is where it’s at and you’ll offend absolutely no one. You might think I’m mental for suggesting it, but really… 20 sprays and actually consider even more. Bath in the stuff, it’s gentle enough and dirt cheap.
Gorgeous.

It gives me a Iso E Super kind of impression, timeless, nostalgic, kind of lost in time, light smell.
Lovely green and flowery, not overly citrusy lavender with warm woody undertones.
Good projection, worth it for the price. Highly recommended.
The smell reminds me of old shopping malls during the 2000s, masculine leaning, very chic!

EDIT:
Unbelievably longlasting despite comments. After 13hrs I can still smell the perfume on my throat. What a lovely warm lavender!

To all who says about weak projection and longevity:
Yesterday I sprayed one time on my hand. I took two showers and washed my hands multiple times and CK Be still smells and projects like crazy.

For some reason, this is such a melancholic scent to my nose. It transports me to a liminal place where time stands still, like when you are hit with a wave of sadness for no reason. You are in the a crowd and yet you feel removed. A sheer ghostly presence. Your heart is cold and frozen long ago but also fragile like glass. No one knows of the deep thoughts in your mind, but they can somehow sense it. You are mysterious, but not because you try to be. This smells to me like cold midnight air looking up at the stars against the blackest night over mountain peaks. Longing for something out there you can't reach.
Fresh, soapy and weak lasting. Would not reccomend for a fragrance.
smells like soapy sunscreen its aight

This is my summer fragrance for the past two years and I just can’t part ways with it.Yes there are probably much better fragrances considering the duration but this one just feels nostalgic for some reason.Its like going outside on a hot summer evening during the 00s ready to make memories with your friends.
Its alright the smell is decent it smells like an 80’s soap bar worth the price the longevity is real bad though
This is alright its prety good

This one smelt so good 25 years ago, but now? Nah.

#53 review

Just mid frag in my opinion ck shock or one are more interesting in my opinion. Parameters are weak. Scent is simple fresh but fast goes away.

It’s the lighter love child of Rives by Ellis Brooklyn and Obsessed for Women by Calvin Klein that also lasts much shorter than either of the parents. It starts out somewhat tart with a tiny bit of sweetness before turning powdery. The lavender note isn’t quite as strong as the one in Obsessed but it’s still somewhat noticeable. It’s the closest dupe of Obsessed for Women that I’ve found so far, but unfortunately it is discontinued.

A classic for myself, was the first cologne my mother ever bought me when I was probably around 10-13yrs old. Have been through bottles and bottles of it.

Personally, I find that the musky notes, green notes, magnolia and cedar all come off most prominently on my skin. It's not a projection beast by any means, but that's not really what this is meant to be. It's an office scent, a casual scent, a lunch date scent. It's clean, brisk, sophistocated with a TOUCH of sweetness. I've worn it for everything from casual to formal to work, but that's because it's a personal favorite and I'll probably never put it down as long as it's available.

Excellent smell - sporty, green, refreshing, citrusy, a little "shampooey bubblegummy".. Smells quite unique to be honest but has terrible longevity and zero projection.. DOES NOT LAST.. Lasts only for about 10 minutes if sprayed on skin, 23 if sprayed on clothes...

I was a teen when BE came out. I remember the campaign with Kate Moss in the magazines "Be good. Be bad. Just be". I kept thinking it was a darker version of ONE which I never actually liked as I am not a fan of citrusy fragrances. They remind me of a toilet refresher. Bought BE last year on my trip to Finland, it was super cheap, like 5 quid for 30ml. It smells like... nothing. It's weak, it's not unpleasant, it's not pleasant either. It's generic and boring. Smells like an old man maybe. Anyway my iconic memories of this fragrance are now gone.

A freshie with floral notes, defo unisex towards feminine side. No real lavender more of a woody citrus with feminine flowers. Very nice. The dark design is very misleading, it's a unisex if not feminine.

Smells nice. Though to be honest, it was bought for me as a gift, and I mostly use it as a room spray. There are far better perfumes to gift for the same price, but just because you know that, doesn't mean your mum does!

🫧 The closest to bar soap that I've ever come across. Vintage formula.
🧼😊

Bought a bottle of this for nostalgia really as when it came out I lurrrrved this fragrance - and it used to last for days - literally, on clothing particularly, you could smell it 2 days later.

Sadly it's a pale, pathetic shadow of its former glory. Lasts about an hour, maybe 2 tops. Lacks the complexity (though I appreciate that's going on nostalgic memory!).

Not sure why they are even bothering to churn this out still tbh - certainly isn't what it used to be
I like the smell, but it’s barely noticeable even after 2 hours already. Therefore I think it’s slightly overpriced at msrp. Would only recommend it at 25€/100ml or less.

The worst fragrance i've ever owned. Bought it on sale for $30 and now i see why it was on sale. Very poor longevity and fragrance is not impressive.
Do not recommend you try this unless you want to use it as bathroom air freshner (i've smelt better fresheners i'll have you know)

I felt in love when it was born. One of the most rare fragance of the world, and one of the most inventive Calvin Klein creations. Saddly those masterpieces are disapeared. CK nowadays makes flankers and generics.

If you grew up in Poland in the 90s you might have had your mum rubbing in a nettle serum/extract (glass bottle) into your hair, like my mum did haha. This smell reminds me of that. It's green herbaceous citrusy with a good dose of musk, what Soleil Blanc is doing on this list I have no idea. (I have the original formulation with small C). Only buy this for the nostalgia if you're 90s kid, can't see this impressing Gen Z or Millennials. It's very shampooey.
Short lasting fragrance, but its smell is very nice. Its aromatic, woody and green and sums it up perfectly. very casual fragrance, but nothing more to it.

For someone who wants to buy this fragrance, here is my honest review.

Scent/Notes: I call it a fresh, aquatic and neat and clean scent. The notes are quite good like it feels really clean to be honest. (I don’t smell powder in this any how)

Longevity: I believe 2-3 hrs on clothes maximum. (Weak)

Projection: Doesn’t project past 10 mins (Very weak)

Wear: Its a casual wear fragrance/Not suitable for parties or any type of causal gatherings

Season: Performs best in Winters

Overall: I wouldn’t recommend purchasing this perfume at all because the value for money is quite less. You can get other alts for the same amount or even can get an original one for even less.

Rate: 3/10 (To be dead honest)

Not that worth it for buying but smells ok, its green and woody, lavender and orange, the mid notes is floral thingy and for the base notes its woody musky and ambery longevity not that good need to respray everytime solid 6/10 i appreciate it tho because my mum but it for my birthday
This is what it smells like when you don't wash the soap off in the shower.
All I'm getting is sunscreen spray.

This scent is an absolute joy. It's complex, green, and inviting. However, its longevity is disappointingly brief—like a fleeting moment. In fact, it has the worst longevity I've ever encountered in any perfume, bordering on absurdity. For me, it doesn't even last an hour. If only it lasted longer, this perfume could easily become a classic.

➡️ "CK BE' by Calvin Klein

Concentration: Eau de Toilette
Trend: Unisex
Seasons: Spring/Summer
Occasions: Everyday, work, narrow spaces
Average cost

Among the many "designer" fragrances it is never easy to find a good quality-price ratio, given that too often marketing deceives the buyer's expectations.
In this case, however, we are faced with an item that has been on the market since the 90s, and has therefore been a must for enthusiasts ever since.
Mostly unisex, floral and fresh perfume, suitable for wearing after a shower or before going to work, perhaps in closed spaces where you don't want to stand out but just have a very pleasant and relaxing smell for those around you.
Its projection is in fact quite weak, as is its duration.
However, excellent for this period, at an extremely accessible cost. Passed overall.

Bottle: 6 ✅
Projection: 6.5 ✅
Duration: 6 ✅
Fragrance: 7.5 ✅

Final rating: 6.5 ✅

FOLLOW ME ON IG ➡️ @ilProfProfumato

Okay scent, smells pretty fresh and green but wears off fairly quickly.

Good for a cheap every day scent
My son said that this smells like a dishwasher pod. Funny because it’s true.
Green, fresh and woody, not dated despite being from the 90s. Nothing special. Ok for a cheapie. Very bad performance, wouldn't buy.

I wanted something unapologetically 90s, and I got it, and yet...didn't quite get it. I actually think these CK fragrances are incapable of ever smelling dated, because this has a timelessly clean quality about it that won't ever fail to inspire an uptick in mood upon spraying. But, it does have almost a soapy feel, and it reminds me of things that I smelled when I was a kid. Or, maybe I did smell this specifically at some point.

-

The opening is grassy, limey, aromatic, fresh and extremely clean. It verges on soapiness. This is a little more masculine than One, Ck All or CK Everyone (but I found Everyone less inspiring personally). There will totally be a large amount of women who probably wouldn't want to smell like this, or at least smell like this often, and that's ok. I'd like to be clear about this because people should know what to expect, the "lavender" (it smells like an indistinct herbal note, not necessarily lavender) tips it into traditionally masculine territory (though I always say - 'Who cares? Wear what you like!'). I'm totally OK with it though, and I admit that I have a massive spectrum of perfume types that I enjoy wearing. This doesn't step outside of what I'm comfortable with.

Yes...as others have said, longevity is lacking. But price is a big factor and you can usually find this at outlets for a large bargain, so spraying generously isn't a deal breaker. Also, it's just begging to be worn in summmer...I think it'll be amazingly refreshing, and so the act of spraying in the heat is cooling. I actually welcome reapplication in heat. All this is to say that i wish longevity was better here, but that with cheap summery frags I forgive easily.

People hate sentimentality in reviews. I don't care, you can read someone else's opinion and skip this; but I gotta say, as this dries, I'm hit with a rare, wistful, emotional response that I specifically try and seek out. It reminds me of... something. Boyfriends? Maybe someone earlier? Friends?...maybe not.

It's more like a first crush. And as weird as that is to admit online to internet strangers, I'm gonna say it anyway.

Fragrances are so special because they can unearth echos of memories that you didn't realize you retained...as this does here. Something about the musk and greenness makes me ache with nostalgia, and I love it.

A bit more masculine than CK One but still unisex. It is a 4/10 for me and only because it reminds me of the 90s and early 2000s. I'd give it an 8 if the sillage and longevity were better. It lasts about an hour on my skin and the sillage is abysmal. It's a shame because the scent itself isn't bad.
The nauseating torment of a 1990s bully. CK Be invades your brain and presses on your pain reflexes. Nothing good can come from it.

much better than ck one but the performance is absolutely trash. you need like at least 7 sprays with this. the smell is nice and pleasant though.
hyper mainstream odeur 53. underrated. overachiever.

There's a reason I wore this perfume for over two decades. While I can't pinpoint any particular note in CK Be, the soup of all the notes together make for such a pleasant, comfortable, wonderful scent. I understand why people find it boring - it's like the oatmeal of perfumes, the boiled potato of colognes, the buttered toast of scents. I can't imagine anyone being offended by it; it's probably the safest of all perfumes out there, ever.

The only bad thing about CK Be - the ONLY bad thing: it doesn't last. Not even at all. But it just smells sooooo good.

My favorite fragrance and signature. Its simple and clean but I like that especially bc it is in a perfect way. If you take the comparison of aqua di gio to ck one, this CK Be would be like the CK version of aqua di gio profumo.. the dark aquatic but smooth and rounded lowdered florals (that faintly smells like the incense in it but floral) without harsh metal or oceanic notes.. This one is just me.. its what ive searched for for years even after smelling it just to come back and stay. Perfect.
This perfume is not long lasting. I don't think it's worth the money, the scent is also nothing special.

The Mandarin Orange, The Musk and it lasted a long time on my skin! That's what I remember! At that time, back in February 2011, I had no idea it was unisex. Would have love to share it with the one I love! But maybe I'll surprise him this year for his birthday!

Top 10 but no longevity. Powdery, soapy, clean genuis in an almost one note vibe despite all the many notes/accords used and it doesn't smell like you purposely doused yourself in perfume before work like someone wearing perfume often comes off as having done- more that you just happen to smell clean without being able to pinpoint if it's soap, powder, laundry detergent, a bit of sunscreen, ironing starch, etc. likely won't garner comments as people will assume you're just clean and fresh but I've had one or two in the past who were surprised it was perfume, one wanted to know what sunscreen it was.

Clean, sharp and ambiguous. There is almost a restrain in character, a calm opaque surface that prevents you from seeing inside. Androgynous, very 90s minimal, intentionally casual.
If it were a color: pale purple.
It was my first fragrance and i will forever have it on my shelf for the memories.

Powdery but sharp. Green and cannot think of any other words to describe it. Possibly for older people as I remember disliking it a lot when I was young and it was popular but I think I was comparing it to ck one and I have a complete new appreciation for it. It’s edgy but safe. Suitable for office wear as it’s not over powering. Most people who smell it will comment or enquire about it in my experience.

The safest of the safe. Reserved for day time casual gatherings, errands, or work in an office because it can’t be differentiated from a lot of soaps or body washes. To me it smells very clean and spicy. It's nice and inoffensive but doesn’t really leave an impression or transport me anywhere or conjure any images. Despite that, I do turn to this one during times when I can’t be bothered. We all have those days. Because of that (and because I have those days), this remains in my collection.

this cologne honestly confuses me. it is not offensively bad, like cremo Palo Santo, but it is a scent that in my opinion, is boring and not appealing. if i smelled this fragrance on someone i didn't know, i would think of them as someone that cares little about what fragrances they are using. this fragrance probably won't scare the hoes (no promises) but will definitely not make them want you

Ahhhhh , the classic "Be" . It's one of those scents where you just can't go wrong. It truly a classic and excellent for those " I don't know what I want to wear today but still wanna' smell good" occasions. You can basically wear this scent anytime anywhere. The only negative is that it doesn't last but that might also not be a bad thing. Its very neutral and non offensive, yet you could still pull it of and wear this for a classy occasion in a emergency. It's fresh , it's exciting,it's versatile. It's a must in ones collection.

I used to wear this back in 96' , I liked it then and I like It now. Just as good for a newbie as for a veteran. An excellent cheapie (sometimes) well worth its price. CK is an underrated frag brand in my opinion. They have actually created a few timeless classics if you think about it, long before all these 200$ scents became popular. I'll definitely try to always have this in my collection.
nice for cheap fragrance for man and woman, i preafer for men the lattafa asad or club de nuit intense man

At the end of the 90s, the chimera of the super top models is now just a sweet memory, the collective imagination shifts and is immediately catalyzed by a new concept of beauty; which consists of androgynous forms, pale skin and emaciated features. “CK be”, in the context of commercial perfumery, represents perhaps more than anyone else that precise cultural and aesthetic passage. A perfume that almost gives a tactile, clean, floral sensation but surrounded by an aura of dark, artificial ambiguity.

I brought this knowing the longevity wasnt the best but surprisingly its very good, its been 7hrs and i can still smell it on my wrist.

I was a valet at the time I found this. Like literally, found it in the parking lot of the dealership I worked at. It was my first experience with cologne, and I really don't remember having any complaints about it.

It smells like when you first get out of the shower and your body wash scent is still strong on your skin. It's pretty refreshing for hot temperatures.

Not bad.

CK Be by Calvin Klein:
My first ever fragrance, a masculine-unisex green, floral and citrusy frag suitable for spring/summer with some nice woods at the base. Inexpensive, around £20 for a 100ml so you can afford to overspray and you will need to since despite its very light and doesn't last at all. More suited to younger generations and a good gym/office scent or blind buy. Shame on the performance and longevity though :(

Top Notes: Fresh green grass, crisp citrus from the orange and bergamot, touches of lavender.
Middle Notes: Delicate and floral mainly from the magnolia, orchid and jasmine.
Base Notes: Lighter woody notes of cedar, sandalwood along with some amber and light musk.

3/5

One day I suddenly remembered I used it in my college days and started missing this smell so bad and bought this bottle last week.

Some say this has been reformulated but I felt it still has the same smell I sniffed from a sample which had been glued in a page in the old fashion magazine issued around 1997.

Freshly green, soapy and sophisticated.
The fabulous scent goes away so quickly, I know, but I really love this smell.

I used to like it when I first had it. To be fair, this is a complex perfume that develops as it dries down, I like the smell, too. But as I use it, it fails to create an identity for itself as it changes into different type of scent. That, I could understand. But all of that complexity is short-lived as only you, as the wearer of perfume, is the only who's gonna smell that. The projection is so bad, it dies within an hour, if not a few minutes. This is a skin-scent perfume. Use it on a lazy day, preferably if you're staying at a house and you want to feel cozy. As much as I want to like it, it fails its potential to be a great perfume. I think Ck one as well as Ck all is better than this.

I like this stuff. It's my bedtime fragrance. I love to apply it to myself and to my bedding before I go to sleep. I think that it's the only real use I'll ever have for it - it's very pleasant, but it's literally gone within 30 minutes of applying. I can't imagine wearing it anywhere, as I don't think anyone else would be able to smell it. Still, quite enjoyable for the purpose I've given it.
I sprayed this on my hand while I was at Walmart, it had a nice scent but by the time I checked out the scent was gone.
Love it! I think I’ll always have this in my collection.

Steamy and clean, like a warm piece of clothing straight out of the washing machine. Makes me think of my tomboy cousin. Not sure what makes it smell "aged" but I'd recommend it to the kids that want to know what the early noughties might've smelt of. Truly cannot tell any of the notes apart, which in this case could be a blessing, since lavender can sometimes make me feel a little nauseous.
It was a waste of money even though its price is cheap. It doesn't fit into any category. It is just an air with not identity at all. I bought it last week. I'll stick to CK One.
It's ok for people who like clean scents. Smells fresh, like you just took a shower. I wear it to bed.
I love this fragrance. The powdery smell of it refreshes me every time I wear it.

Always have I regarded this one as the Celine Dion of fragrances, it is a 100% safe gift to anyone but also the recipient will get so tired of it that it will end up at thrift stores in numbers. To me it is a sweet toddler toothpaste with added sweeteners scent that I like at first but quickly forgot, I remember not being impressed.

the bottle is some of the worst ever designed, looks like some kind of mini hard liquor bottles, why is it solid black? you can't even see the fluids let alone the colour. This doesn't look appealing at all on your vanity. It is the lowest of low, even the Harley Davidson and Axe grocery store editions look better than this. A fragrance buff like me didn't even want to collect the flask, into the bin it went. The name is pretty bland either, just 'be'? Might as well call it '@' or 'me'. Doesn't capture at all the pure magic of Eternity and it is as if they made it all dull on purpose so that Eternity stands out.

scent 2
bottle 1

colour 1

Smells nice but not spectacular, first minutes has that alcohol blast, but the dry down is soothing and refreshing. Clean and unisex but with a really bad projection that only lasts maximum 30 minutes then it just sits close to the skin. Literally had to spray more than 20 times from 8 a.m till noon so i could feel it. This is perfect to wear around the house after taking a shower or go grocery shopping.

My lavender, I like it much fresher and more tangy than this gentle herbal infusion.

An absolute delight of a scent. Complex, green, welcoming. It has the longevity of an eyeblink, though. The absolute worst longevity I've ever experienced in any perfume, to the point of ridiculousness. In my case, it does not last even an hour. This perfume could be a classic were it only more performant.

This did not go well on me. I think it's the lavender, mint, and opoponax.

I do like CK on occasions, but sadly, this one is a straight no for me. It's way too masculine.

I'll stick with CK One, CK One Platinum Edition, and CK All, thank you.

For its price, it is pretty much perfect.
Objectively specking, weak sillage, and poor longevity, but hey, you can over-spray or keep supplementing it with zero burden on your wallet, so not really a problem.
Very suitable for newbies in fragrances and boys that need a versatile dumb reach.

It is such a nice aromatic and grass smelling scent. The green notes are what carries this scent and it smells decent at best, it is definitely not a head turner or mind blowing scent but it does the job. The performance leave a lot to be desired though. We are talking 2 hours longevity on a very good day and that is why I would never recommend this. The scent is okay and the performance is very bad. If you need something for the office or you don't want to offend anybody with your perfume, then this is the scent for you. It is cheap though so you can respray after every few hours.

Perfect dumb reach. Fresh, floral, musky. inoffensive. I can see this being used for most occasions. The fact it doesn't last as long as it's desired is okay for me, I just simply respray if needed or use another fragrance.

I just love love, CK be. It must be my all-time favorite unisex fragrance.
It sways between a masculine, herbal green opening to a more feminine, delicate floral heart, but then settles as an exactly unisex fragrance in the base.
It is mostly a lavender musk scent with some vanilla and woods in the base. The top notes had me thinking it would be very green and sharp, but on the contrary, they are just emphasizing the herbal aspect of lavender with a tad of citrus. The florals wipe out any sharpness, and it is mostly smooth and velvety. The musk is a clean, powdery, soft one reminiscent of the musk in Johnson’s baby products very soothing and calming.
The good sillage in the opening reduces very quickly to a very close scent-bubble, but I disagree that the overall longevity is bad. I have a relatively new bottle purchased three years ago. The longevity ranges from 3 to 4 hours which is expected for an EDT. However, it needs some movement, breeze or air draft to be sensed. But I am an over sprayer and I usually spray my hair and clothes as well, so take that into consideration.
You can improve longevity by using a matching lotion. I think that the aromatherapy line from Bath and Body Works (like Lavender Vanilla or Vanilla Eucalyptus) would be a good match. You can also use lavender scented Johnson baby oil as they have similar lavender musk theme.
Overall I find CK Be a perfect fume for the friendly introvert. It is relaxed but charming, subdued but also elegant and classy. It is mellow yet still spicy and sensual. It is the unisex fragrance for me.
Pour some water on your cloths and your skin...there you go, you smell like ck be :))
No wonder they give you an absolute fire hose for an atomiser because yes, this stuff doesn't last long at all. Typical calvin klein. Great clean scent anyway. Recommend spraying on clothes
First fragrance bought it from tregt is served its purpose was good and fresh kinda dark. I leveled up so I wouldnt get it again but its decent good for starters and even for gym or outdoors.
alright smell with negative longevity

Let me preface this by saying if you spritz a bit of this on a tester strip or anything besides your skin, you're going to get that sharp, bright, soapy impression of a lot of these 90s musks or aromatics. On the skin, it introduces itself sharply but mellows quickly, too quickly. It isn't long before there's hardly any impression at all. I consider myself someone with a sensitive nose and I don't pick up hardly anything after two hours. In those two hours though, it lingers with a light impression of bright wood, musk, and green notes, the confluence of which strikes me as a kind of green tea accord. It's very elegant and beautiful, bright, clean, and very unisex. Unlike One, Be seems to really meld with your body's natural scent and accompany the skin, opposed to generating this perpetual forcefield of scent fluctuating over it. Those fleeting impressions bear the aesthetic hallmarks of sleek, modern, refined minimalism of CK at the time.

I'm inclined to believe the formulation was stronger at its inception, for CK to continue something that has historically been so weak is unlikely. I hear some people say similar things about CK One, but the longevity on that one is like a radioactive isotope decaying, it'll be noticeable on clothes for days without a wash, and sometimes that's not even enough. My expectations were neutral for this one after reading other reviews mention how light and weak it is, something I cynically chalked up to incessantly impossible-to-please crowds of perfume enthusiasts who are either offended how projecting something is or are lamenting it's barely there. But here, the crowd was correct. It's barely there.

I'm saddened it doesn't have a little more longevity. The lack of projection doesn't even bother me that much, I'd be delighted to even be the only one smelling this as I catch wafts from my wrist as I rest my cheek on my palm. But it seems eager to sublimate from your skin as quickly as possible. From a house that produced iconic 90s powerhouses like Escape and One, I expected a lot more from Be. On the topic of One, I note that it and Be flirt with similar themes in perfumery and the general aesthetic impression they're aiming for. They both are aiming at that bright yet mellow, clean, unisex vibe of the later 90s. Be is more calm, One is more intense. Be has escaped the fate One would meet in becoming so popular that its scent was mimicked ad nauseam in dupes and other house's formulations. Be, on the other hand, smells familiar, as it participates in popular fragrance themes of the time, but sits in its own niche, a little more refined and subdued than One. If only it would stick around as long as it's older brother.

If you see a honkin 200ml of this laying around at a discount store or perfume site for CHEAP (extremely common) go ahead and pick it up. Spritz yourself when you want to wear something tragically fleeting yet calm and refined, or when you might wear something later you don't want to put on now, Be will definitely be out the door by then. Be is a conflicting fragrance to me, but I can't help but coming back to enjoying it for what it is, in all its deficiencies.

This is so great.. It is a whole experience. It is a fresh and mysterious scent. It may not be strong but it lasts long on my skin. And it lasts more than one day on my clothes, it is wild. This is also 50/50 perfect unisex. I wear this on rainy days, on cold winter or foggy days. I even wear this when I go to bed because it reminds me of someone I love.
I bought a 200 ml bottle for 20€ so the quality, the price point and the mixture of notes is splendid.

It's a soapy green aromatic fragrance with lavender and mint in the opening that dries down to a slightly floral, musky base. It's perfect for summers and hot weather.

The scent profile is quite simple, yet quite unique; this is one of the most inoffensive fragrances that I've ever smelled & I can't imagine anyone would dislike it. It is also quite unisex & literally anyone can pull it off.

The performance on this is quite weird. In my opinion, this doesn't last over 4 hours max. However; the last time I used this was in 2017, when I was in college, and did about 5 sprays with this, as it is very light. About half the day in when I assumed it was completely gone, a chick in my class told me I smelt amazing; so perhaps others around you can smell it on you. Either way, it's a nice nose cleanser, if you will, after smelling dense fragrances for a while.

Quite a strong alcoholic smell at first but settles down to a fresh, soapy lavender scent. Gives the impression of a clean person with freshly washed clothing. Suitable for everyday.

Downside. It doesn't project well even if you overspray it. I recommend spraying this on your clothing as it will fade on your skin very quickly. But for a ~$30 fragrance don't be afraid to spray more.

purchased the 3.4 oz bottle and used half in two weeks. the equivalent of buying vaguely fragranced water. made me sneeze somehow? awful formula, i suppose. a bit of almost sour powdery lavender on the skin that fades within literally 15 minutes.

The new batches are even more full-bodied and rounded than the previous ones, making the fragrance even more captivating and full in its roundness and also gaining in duration and sillage! I like it even more! 😍
dont spend your hard or even your not hard earned money on this it just smells like nothing but a bit of alcohol and some (only if you fricking inhale it) moss and green notes

The smell is violet colored, dark as a evening in a garden ,soapy floral, fresh and mysterious.

Its one of those perfumes which you hate for its longevity and will always keep a bottle to sniff often just to please yourself.

I would name the perfume
CK "regret"
smells really good. fresh and clean and somewhat earthy i prefer spraying it on my clothes because it lasts for a very small amount of time on skin.

Over 20 years ago, I used to layer this with Classic from Banana Republic. The resulting mixture was a beautiful scent that could be worn by any gender and lasted longer than either of the two components worn alone.

Very clean fresh mysterious metallic lavender thing going on. It's a good scent, but it just does not perform. You could go crazy on the sprays, and it still will only last about 2 hours tops. Good for the gym I guess.
Very soapy fragrance not that good..!

If this perfume only last longer, it would've been one of the best fresh fragrances. I love the smell so much because it's very clean, soft, and very inoffensive. But it's inoffensive to the point that it's gone after 2-3 hours.

This has to be one of the most beautiful scents I have ever worn. Calvin Klein put so many notes into their fragrances and everything blends together so well. It's one of those scents were you'll continually smell your wrist just to enjoy the heart warming smell.

Absolutely anyone could wear this. The best way to describe the smell is green; fresh and uplifting.

Sadly this is were the positives end. It has virtually no longevity and cannot be enjoyed by anyone around you because there's next to no scent trail.

This is why you can pick it up for so cheap; there's always a reason.

If only Calvin Klein increased the strength I would have this a signature scent. But that's just wishful thinking.

6/10

CK be is all time fav. I started on my first bottle like 8 years ago. Through all these years never once have I stopped liking this fragrance. while for other perfumes my taste fluctuates a lot. Sometimes when I pick up a jacket and smell something really pleasing, I would try to figure out what it is then I realize it was the trace of CK be remaining on it. This frag is the only one that really relaxes me. When i wear it I feel Im not trying to please anybody. Just immersing myself in this soft green aroma. I bought a 200ml bottle today while I still have over half of a 100 bottle. Just in case it discontinues sometime in the future.
Has undergone a terrible reformulation. There is almost no trace of the original smell 🤦🏻♂️😨
Yeah nah smells like soap water. 15-20 sprays after shower and they only last about 1 hour.

Lovely scent.
Reminds me when I was in secondary school.
Longevity around 3-4 hours..
8/10

I recently bought a deadstock bottle of the original formulation from 1996. I was instantly transported back to the feelings that this wonderful fragrance brought me all those years ago, when it was my signature scent:

Young adulthood. Independence. Living on your own. Establishing your own identity. Making friends. Discovering your sexuality. Living in Boston, New York, DC, or Chicago. Being effortlessly, gloriously thin. We were broke but carefree and sexy. You only owned one perfume.

Am I making sense? Well, in any case, the fragrance itself is a journey back in time. You know you've picked up a 90's fragrance when you see FREESIA listed in the notes. Did they make anything without freesia in the 1990's? CK Be's most notable accords to me are: minty-lavender; dewy green freesia-magnolia; a sexy peach skin; and lashings of clean laundry musk.

Vastly superior to CK One - though both were hugely consequential for bringing the concept of "UNISEX" fragrances into public awareness.

5/5
On me this lasts for about 8-9 hours. The major problem though is that it is sitting on the skin and doesn’t project (that’ll say it you’re the only one who will smell it)
I don't like it, it has a fresh shampoo/soap-like scent.

I wore this when it came out, and just bathed in it.

Recently picked up a bottle for the nostalgia, sprayed it and was immediately met with a flourishing rush of clean, fresh, lavender citrus. Then, just as fast as the fragrance came on, it disappeared completely. I tried several more sprays on paper and skin and couldn’t get the smell back.

Just soap, and that’s with my face all the way shoved into my arm. Anosmia, I suppose. Kinda sad, really.

Picked this up today for 19 CAD. It definitely is a “white soap” fragrance. Almost reminds me of sun tan lotion on a beach. Very delicate with low silage. I def can see this being worn after a shower or for bed to freshen up. It’s ok in that regard but I would have been unhappy paying more than 19 bucks. Still I add a soap fragrance to my collection.


Addition : I wore this to bed last night. Still a lingering skin scent as I lay here 10 hours later.

CK fragrances are a hit - or miss with my chemistry, really. Eternity makes me weep, Euphoria is screechy, Obsessed smells like someone is obsessed with hygiene products (not in a good way)... This one smells like a male version of Women, which I love. I can almost smell that eucalyptus note, which is probably juniper. It has a calming effect. Totally unisex and unpretentious.

Such a 'no brainer' on every level for anyone who enjoys feeling clean & fresh, I personally love the neroli-like scent on my skin & scent bubble. Most all cheapies come with the obligatory alcohol blast opening to some measure - not this. While it does not smell expensive, it certainly does not smell cheap, which is unbelievable mindful you can get the big bottle 6.7oz / 200ml for just over $20. It's my 'around-the-house-daily-driver'.

Extremely versatile cosy freshie, smells like you just got out of the shower. Really comforting and not overwhelming. I have a 200ml bottle of this that I blind bought and I wear it every night to bed and it is absolutely PERFECT for that purpose. It’s on my favourites list for that reason, because it is the most perfect cosy “can’t wear anything else, nothing too heavy” scent. Beautiful lavender (one of my favourite notes), green florals and clean musk. A big love from me, even if it’s nothing particularly daring.
This and CK One are great cheap fresh scents. I’d definitely wear this in the summer when I don’t want to spend time picking a fragrance to wear.

Smell fresh and clean, like lavender soap.It’s not really complicate or develop to other note. Apart dry down to Cedar.

I brought 200 ml. for a dumb reach on stupid day that I don't wanna use other fragrances and as freshener on sleepwear before sleep.

It’s wear more like 2nd Skin quite relaxing fragrance but I won’t use this for go out but probably I will keep this around as it’s coming handy

6/10.

I love this scent. My honest review, this scent sleeps on me. I spry it at 9am when i wake up the next day i still smelled it on me. The longevity is 9/10 and best fragrance during summer time & to rate it 10/10.

Whats best, everyone can wear this. Neutral fragrance for the whole family.
very fresh and really a good one. another advantage is that it's a unisex one too and really fits both genders imo
Smells like handsoap. I wear this at home to finish the bottle.

I wear this when I want to deal some business with men or when I want to punch a nose. It’s like the forrest you come out of a new man. Honestly, it’s the cedar and juniper that makes me so agitated? 😅

Not a lover of green scents so no surprise I didn't particularly enjoy this scent...

Soapy grassy green scent

My high school scent. Revisiting it many moons later and it still stands up as a nice fresh scent. Back then I liked it better than ck one, and I still like this DNA better. It was notorious for not hanging around too long back then, and still the case but it’s pleasant enough for a quick refreshing spritz.

Beautiful fresh, clean lavender scent, Perfectly unisex, But in my opinion this is slightly more feminine than CK One. Only downside is the longevity isn't great, But I don't mind spraying more when I have a big 6.7oz bottle. As long as you enjoy lavender, This is a safe bet! Definitely gives androgynous, Mysterious vibes, I like it.
Get this fragrance if you can get your hands on some perfume oil. If you add some to the bottle it becomes very good. Such a clean smell. It’s a shame that CK didn’t manage to make it perform well.

Another amazing truly unisex fragrance from CK. I love this but I definitely don't think "green" as the top. I get powdery, fresh, and lavender without being soapy. It feels so cozy and soft. I love this for bed and cant wait to wear it in the fall.
Very "serious" fragrance, really good, great performance.

So my favourite part of this scent is all in the top notes. It starts off aromatic, almost fougere like. Like a fresh out of the shower smell. Then it starts to develop into a clean smelling fragrance. But more of a detergent scent. Reminds me of the smell of clean laundry or clean linens.

If you’re a fan of soapy or fresh laundry type of scents, then you will enjoy CK Be. It’s very simple. It also does not last very long, or project, so don’t expect an amazing performing fragrance. But it is a fun fragrance for a quick dumb reach, or even just to spray on your wrist and smell for an hour or two.

A sleeper in my collection and one of my personal faves as well as one of my fave dumb reaches !!

In terms of scent, despite the many notes it’s actually quite simple. To my nose it just smells like a nice shampoo or tanning lotion. Idk why but that’s what it smells like ! (In a good way)

It’s extremely comforting,easy to wear and surprisingly has gotten a few compliments when others have gotten close ! You will definitely get nice wafts of this throughout the day without it being overwhelming. (Even with 1-3 sprays)

To my nose it smells very green,airy and has a fresh linen by the ocean feel !

Some complain about performance but I get 6-10 hours with average projection but very good silage

Overall rating -8 out of 10 ! Very solid fragrance for a very good price but nothing exceptional!! Ideal for casual use and I’d say this is unisex but leans masculine

A beautiful yet affordable unisex scent. I first got this in Jr High when it first came out and only recently repurchased it as an almost 40 yr old, but still love it. It's nonoffensive and I really enjoy the juniper note. Refreshing, gentle, but fun.

Maybe the best comfort scent ever created for men. There's no need to talk about projection, because it doesn't project at all, but longevity isn't bad. They reformulated it for shure, which is detectable on the opening but 20 minutes or so and it is the same thing. It's a stable good to go perfume, not more. It worth a try.
I really dont understand how someone can say this isnt a very weak fragrance. I have to get rite on top of it just after spraying to get a smell of it. I wouldnt waste my money on it...really.

90s fragrance, suitable for teenagers and twenties with quicksilver on. Dynamic, fresh fragrance, it smells of cleanliness and light-heartedness. It reminds me a lot of the scent of hair after shampooing in the summer, left to dry in the wind. Fresh sillage, evanescent duration.

Do not listen to those who say that it is a faint scent and that it disappears after 15 minutes ... Surely here on Fragrantica there are many people used to heavy and very sweet perfumes, obviously in comparison this is lighter and softer, but not so much! If it has been on the market for 26 years (1996) and is still among the best sellers in the world, there must be a reason ... don't you think? ... As the description of the fragrance says, it is a "transparent, silky and very sexy" perfume ... I assure you that it is really true! I only use 2 sprays because over 2 it bothers me, it gets a bit heavy, and I assure you that everyone around me feels it well! A friend of mine this winter, a few meters away and in the open air, told me "what a good smell you have", and I had only put 2 sprays under my heavy jacket! Even my brother, just yesterday, a few meters away heard it and told me "how good your perfume is!". In conclusion, the fragrance can be felt, and how, already with only 2 sprays, and it is wonderfully good, relaxing and makes you feel good! Far better and more sensual than its predecessor One, which despite many attempts I cannot tolerate!

CK Be is a shy, pretty boy who plays sports. He's cool but also has a sensitive side. Someone who makes you feel warm because he thinks you're the cutest girl in the world and is a good listener. The type who walks you home from school and saves his allowance to take you out to dinner. I tested this not too long ago, and it's all nostalgia that wouldn't linger long enough because of its cologne nature.

CK Be will forever be the 90s for many of us.

I think I percieve this fragrance very differently than most people. I'm not getting *any* green notes at all, not in a million years. Not really getting any "fresh laundry" either.

To me this fragarnce is a little bit subtle, a little bit mysterious, a little bit nocturnal. It's quite sexy but not vulgar. There's a little bit of sweetness but not too much. I know the marketing is prominently unisex but I think it skews masculine. I like to wear this on dates.

CK Be is also very much a 90es icon and I associate it with a certain kind of edgy 90es cool. I imagine Shirley Manson, Chloë Sevigny, or Lori Petty might have worn this.

For me, this smells like a softer, more powdery version of Davidoff Cool Water. For anyone who feels the opening of Cool Water is too concentrated or...sharp, CK Be sort of takes the essence of that and cuts it down to be more accommodating to your nose. The dry down smells like spicy baby powder on my skin. Of course, this means that longevity suffers. It immediately becomes a skin scent and I get about 1-2 hours before I can't smell it anymore. However, with 6.7oz bottles being found under $30, you can spray away and not worry about running out too fast. The atomizer is halfway decent too, it sprays wide rather than far, so full coverage doesn't take too long.

7/10
If your from a tropical country...Do not buy I'm from Jamaica and it didn't even last 15min before it was gone... I love the smell but the longevity is poor.

the smell is very generic, it reminds me of any other men's body wash or shampoo—even Irish spring soap. It's pretty artificial and not very smooth, decently harsh in the opening and the dry down is better. This has little to no projection and sits very close to the skin. Better to save your money and purchase something else in all honesty.

This used to be a lavender bomb with some green fresh vibes on top. I bought a small bottle recently to rekindle the memory but it's just a shell of itself, very weak and no longevity or projection. If you want a fragrance that almost 90% similar with much better performance try Maison Margiela's Replica Bubble Bath.
Nice summer scent😊 25-40 sprays after the night shower before bed.
CK Be has an opening that smells like spring to me...light, green, and airy. That seems to disappear after 30 minutes, leaving a lavender/cederwood skin scent that is nice but unremarkable.

I really like the scent of BE. Soft and very good. Longevity and sillage sucks. But the scent is so beautiful. I want my home my cloths even the world would smell like BE. Wife loves this on me. She doesnt like perfumes so much. She founds them heavy and many of them disturbs her. But she like CK BE on me and she wears CK One on her. Fair enough.
For me this is not a EDT this is EDC. Maybe not even an EDC.
Green freshie cologne. A barbershop scent for a place that charges $75 for a cut. Smells neither dated nor original. Very wearable. Unisex enough, but not for me. Minimal projection. Gone in 2 hours.

Not a review, an observation. I wore this back when it originally came out. I remember it being a wonderful kinda powdery fresh scent without being too citrusy. I ordered a new bottle to add back to my collection. When it comes I want to challenge all of these "weak and doesn't last" reviews: more often than not when I buy back my old classics this almost never the case. I almost never have longevity/performance issues with my old favorites when I buy current batches. I will update when I get my new bottle.

I love this, it's simply aromatherapy for me, the lavender is the most notable element here, then the musk & while I'm not usually a fan of musky scents but it's so clean here that it doesn't bother me. A comforting and unpretentious fragrance, so easy to wear and at any time by anyone, as long as they like lavender!

A timeless scent, I just wish it projected more, longevity is just OK particularly on clothing. They should make an intense version or shock horror bring out a reformulation that actually improves performance (without altering the scent)!

I remember going to the mall to smell this when it debuted. I've preferred this to ck one since first sniff. I think it smells more sensual. It used to remind me of Om from the Gap, in high school. It's been so long since I've smelled Om, though, that I don't know if that's accurate.

This is a unisex perfume that does nothing for either men or women.Too blah,too generic,too uninspired, it goes completely unnoticed.
Also, it changes completely when you reach to the half of the bottle,it becomes pure stink and that was one of the many reasons i had regretted buying it. Overpriced considering all its problems.

Fragrance Is Truly A Memory In A Bottle Indeed!! And This Sure Rings Very True To Me, For As Soon As I Sprayed This Onto My Skin, I Was Immediately Transported Back To 2005 And The Airport In Grand Canaria And About To Board Our Flight Home In Minutes!! lol"lol"lol"lol Coach Had Arrived Way To Early For Us At Our Hotel Complex, And I Basically Had'nt Enough Time To Dig Out My Perfume, And Put A Spray On!! I Remember This Being On Offer At Duty Free, Working Out Then At £13.90 For 100ml And Me Quickly Picking It Up, And Spraying It Liberally All Over Me!! (You Can Do This With CK be) And Not Choke Yourself Nor Anyone Else!! But Hey I Actually Liked The Waft I Got From It, As Did My Husband When I Returned To Sit Down Beside Him!! "What Did You Just Spray On Yourself"? He Enquired, "Oh CK be" The One In The Matte Black Bottle, As I Absolutely Hated CK one!! And It Was On Special Offer Too For A 100ml!! "Why Did You Not Buy It Then"? As It Sure Smells Mighty Nice On Ya"!! "Yea Very Clean, Very Fresh, Like A Very Expensive Spa Smell"!! So Without Second Thoughts I Ran Back To The Duty Free Perfume Shop, And Bought Two 100ml Bottles, One For Him, And One For Me!! And We Have'nt Had A Bottle Of It Since Then, Until Now!! (200ml Priced Around £19.95) And You Talk About The Memories Flooding Back!!

I like how it smells but it only lasts projects for less than an hour and then becomes a skin scent around 3-4 after spraying. really bad performance considering the price you have to pay for this.

Green Grass in a bottle. unfortuantely like CK one the performance is simply atrocious. Its scented water. I wouldnt buy this because it literally wont last longer than a few mins, even on clothes. Shame. I like the smell. just doesnt do anything.

This was the very first perfume I loved. I was a young teenager when I started wearing this and it made me feel grown up and classy-I loved it! It was so modern. It’s interesting to me that it has notes like rose and oakmoss that are not usually my favorites, but all together in this perfume, they’re great! This one is the only Calvin Klein fragrance I’ve ever liked, none of his others ever interested me. Unfortunately, he never was able to produce anything better than this, his very first fragrance.

Perhaps the most sophisticated and nuanced of all the fragrances from Calvin Klein also happens to be its first, released in 1978, and it's the most beautiful woody rose with fruity, peachy top notes and a green floral heart. The green notes here, however, aren't necessarily sharp or cold, there is just as much velvety as its verdant: the feel of petals and closely packed moss. As it further develops, a carnation merges with the heart, lending an ever so subtle granularity to the velvet, like occasional beads embroidered in, teasing the skin.

The full-figured rose lasts into the dry down, extended by an oakmoss that rivals that of the most hallowed chypres, shades of cedar, lingering whiffs of stone fruit, and a musky resonance. That this has been overlooked seems criminal; perhaps this is due to Calvin Klein's inconsistent reputation in the perfume realm. If their Obsession gets all the attention when it was really their competently done "also ran" of Must de Cartier, surely we should show some reverence for this truly original and magnificent creation.

BEST ROSE SCENT EVER.

😭 So sad it is discontinued. Have never seen it on Ebay. I saved the last few drops in the bottle but alas, the good scent has decayed.

There has never been another scent to compare. I never cared for any of Calvin Klein's subsequent fragrances.

Still longing for a rose scent but have not found anything I want to buy.

This was the first fragrance i bought with my own money. I had a job in high school at the Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf at the mall. I would spend my money on men's button up rayon shirts with paisley prints, YSL lipgloss in Soleil, monogramed Calvin Klein slippers and this fragrance. I had worn Emeraude, White Shoulders, Love's Baby Soft and Chantilly, given as birthday and Christmas gifts. Finally ready for a grown up scent i found this. Everything about it felt modern and new. I wish i could smell this again to see if i love it as much now or was it just the excitement of finding something that was just mine?

Very feminine floral perfectly blended;a note of comfy warmth wraps itself around the florals, ending with the smoothest trail of a fragrance reminder left behind to make anyone ask, "Hmmmm...what is the name of that gorgeous fragrance?" Absolute perfection.

THIS is rose done right in my mind. Testing a vintage original mini of cologne. The rose is soft and edged with woods and aromatics. Rose lovers you will like this one for sure. Interesting, and not too sweet or cloying. From the 70´s which was an interesting perfume decade. Softer than the shoulder-padded 80´s.
I am surprised to see this listed. It was my college fragrance. I felt sophisticated wearing this. How long did this survive?

Just got a decant of this. I remember this one back in the day. Who knew it was gonna become scarce as hens teeth. Smelling this takes me back to discos and I remember it mostly on men. Yummiest of ck frags. They should bring this one back for sure.
Wow. This is a deep, green, trip. Velvet to the nose. A little like Creature, with a Boucheron feel maybe. To me this is feminine but rich.

Thank you for explaining this perfume to me complete with photos. This is my best friend's favorite and I have listened to her sadly reminisce. It is her birthday and I managed to sleuth down a bottle with luck and this site. I am thrilled to give it to her! I will add photos when she opens present to add to this perfume profile.

I love this site and didn't know it existed.
This was such an insanely beautiful creation. Of course I'm relying solely on childhood memories of how much this enchanted me, but oh my how it enchanted me.

This was the first perfume I bought with my own money. I had the powder and perfume and I kept it for the longest time. How I wish they still sold this. In my opinion, the best Calvin Klein. Very woodsy, almost masculine yet amazingly delicious. I would love to find it again!

What A Distint Classic Fragrance it really stands alone.....Like it could be Lauren sister of Ralph Lauren I think also released in 1978, Some Real Excellent time wining fragrances release that year.......A truly treat of a fragrance to wear, why do a the Best always become....."Discontinued"....How Sad!

So glad this one was added to the database! My mother used to have a little round container of the Calvin Klein solid perfume. That magical red plastic doohickey was what made me fall down the rabbit hole that is perfumelove. Sadly, it's been so long that I can't remember exactly what it smelled like, other than that it was glorious and somehow different from the other perfumes on my mother's dresser -- that's a chypre for you.

Not long ago, I was reading a biography of Calvin Klein that talked about the launch of this, his first fragrance. Turns out, CK was offered what would become Lauren and rejected it in favor of this scent. He ended up kicking himself because Ralph made a mint off his sloppy seconds. Such is life in the perfume world.

I am very lucky to have a bottle of this precious juice in my hands as I write this (thanks to the ebay gods!!) This is the perfume I would always have my mom spray on from the tester bottle at Marshall Fields in the late 70s' (I was too young to afford to buy it for her yet!) it may have been launched in the winter because I remember that each time we did this, my moms' winter scarf would then smell of this for weeks after! O.K. now the scent.. sniff..sniff..aahhh..This is undoubtably first and foremost all about The Rose.. which is splashed with a little bit of peach juice and then it's surrounded in a light cloud of spices and woods..Sooo Beautiful and Sophisticated...The Masterpiece in the burgandy box simply titled Calvin Klein!

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I have this as a dupe as the female version is completely extinct. I have to say I love this. It's warm and sensual. I don't care much about femme and masc. I just really enjoy the warm sweet sandalwood.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Before I got all these niche frags I own I really loved this men’s Euphoria line..I Bought 2 testers of this fragrance Because not only did I love it then Lots seemed to as well! My girlfriend back in the day moved away and I’d send her my shirt with this on it. This not only has sentimental value, But is also expensive now & it’s because it’s good! When I spray this now I’m reminded it’s rich and projects like a beast…Too much if easily oversprayed I swere someone who didn’t know would think this wasn’t a designer fragrance!

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This is way too underrated. I don't know why people don't talk about it.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is a lovely perfume. Warm, spicy, woody and a bit sweet. I think there is much more than pepper, saffron and sandalwood. If anything pepper is not very distinctive, saffron is. There is a likeable sweetness and amber-like feel that is just phenomenal. The woody dry down is also awesome.

On my skin it lasts at least 8 hours and has a decent sillage.

The overall vibe is for sure oriental and masculine. The perfume is diverse though and can be - in my opinion - worn at almost any occasion and any season.

Great value for money.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is a really great fragrance. It smells really good. It's warm spicy woody safranny/leathery. I do get some powderiness and fresh spicy on top of it and the opening is a bit balsamic to my nose but that settles down very fast. Overall, after amber gold I am truly surprised by this coming from CK. I did manage to get one of the 2015 bottles so not sure about reformulations later. If Chopard Oud Malaki and Euphoria amber gold had a baby that would be this. It's different from both but also share some DNA.
