If you have oud Malaki or Amber Gold and you like it, and you can find one of these at a reasonable price then I would highly recommend to give it a try.
IMO, another fragrance from CK that was probably ahead of its time and if resurrected it would probably see a lot more success.
Good lesson for me to not overlook fragrances because of the brand's reputation.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Terrible terrible perfume, good scent, but awfull performance. I got the smell of whisky and is fine.

No sillage, no longevity, nothing. Does not have any projection and i sprayed like a mf.

An absolute 0, I mean, wtf? What´s the point of buying something that doesn´t project?

Save your $.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This is nice. My bottle has finally mellowed out and matured and NOW the fragrance is something I really enjoy. It lasts all day now and performs really very well. Before, the saffron was so sharp and dominating that it smelt like a box of bandaids..not anymore! Once this matures its really exquisite. I get more of the pepper and sandlewood and the saffron is laid back and gives it a soft and creamy feel. Man, this lasted me the full day. Had a kind of clean laundry smell and it somehow smells warm. Very nice office scent.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: It has taken a LONG time for this frag to grow on me. I think the bottle is just slow to macerate. It used to be a full on bandaid container smell and now it has smoothed down some. The saffron in this is vicious and quite overbearing on a fresh bottle. It isn't woody and it isn't fresh as the write up says. It is powdery spice is what it is. I find it a bit linear and smells pretty much the same from start to finish. Still is a bit medicine smelling, mercurial even. There seems to be a little bit of flower in it and old dusty leather. I think this is how a church would have smelt in the 17-1800's. Its not bad really, just different and dusty. This is a hard one to really nail down. I don't think anyone smelling it on you will be repelled, but you won't get compliments on it either. EDP Batch 6267, made in 2014. Purchased from FragranceX 2020

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Very nice scent. , will always have it in my rotation ...... last long on body and clothes ..... love the spicy black pepper opening with the safron that maintains all thru till the dry down...

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
A lovely soft & spicy wood scent.

Euphoria Liquid Gold, like Euphoria Pure Gold, has no relation smell-wise to the originals Euphoria and Euphoria Intense.

The smell is a soft woody scent (sandal) with a sharp, peppery spiciness (black pepper). I am not picking enough saffron to rate it second on the notes pyramid.

An oriental/Arabic smell for cold weather.

Both Euphoria Gold are a really good & interesting step from CK. They are trying, and delivering some good, somewhat exotic smells here, especially for the non-Arabic crowd.

Like.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I'm quite fond of the Euphoria Men line. Every release that came before this one has ranged from decent to delicious. When I heard that this fragrance had only three notes (black pepper, saffron and sandalwood) I was skeptical yet intrigued. After I sprayed this on though, I was mortified.

This smells like vomit; I'm not exaggerating. The mix of saffron and sandalwood is potent and harsh, and reminds me of vomit. My nose became accustomed to the scent after a while, but I never got to the point where I found this to be pleasing.

It goes without saying, but this is definitely not a blind buy. Even if you're someone that likes Liquid Gold, the truth is that it's unbelievably divisive, and I can't imagine a scenario where you could wear this in public and not turn off half the room.

I appreciate the simplicity of Liquid Gold, and give Calvin Klein credit for taking a risk and releasing something this bold and different, but at the end of the day I just find this fragrance nauseating and can't recommend it in the slightest.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Very similar to Bvlgari Man in Black Essence. VERY saffron heavy. Dries down to a spicy, sweet, saffron scent. Not picking up much to any sandalwood at all. Very long lasting. Was a bit hesitant of it at first but, as it dried down, this scent came together quite nicely. Reminiscent in sweetness to Tom Ford's Black Orchid. Also reminiscent of Penhaligons Blazing Mr. Sam or Halfeti.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: it is very similar to man in black by bvlgari. this is way too expensive for what it is. i wouldnt pay 85 bucks for this. get that bvlgari

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Opening smells like icy hot to me. Once it dries down the saffron comes through and it really starts to move well. Close scent bubble and relatively close to the skin

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Two sprays to the chest, hardly any scent. It takes a while to get going but it does get a lot stronger. I agree with the minty quality, sort of attached to an obvious saffron. The mintiness eventually dissipates considerably but the saffron lasts a very long time. I don't get a "real" sandalwood here, but more of a smoky, aroma chemical woodiness, possibly a combination of several chemicals, though it doesn't seem to be overloaded with iso e super, thankfully. For me the major problems are: 1. I'm not a huge saffron fan, 2. I think at times it would nauseate me due to the "chemical" nature, and 3. it's not complex, so nuances are not likely to reveal themselves with subsequent wearings (or perhaps I'm especially sensitive to at least some of the aroma chemicals used, and so they really dominant the experience). I'll also mention that the first Cadillac fragrance marketed to men was not all that different, so if you can find that one inexpensively it might be good enough for you. There is no real connection between this scent and the first Gold Euphoria for Men, and I prefer that one due to the clear honey note, the complexity, and the lack of obvious aroma chemicals, but Liquid Gold is certainly an interesting fragrance that is not some sort of generic/mass market cash grab, IMO.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This is outstanding! Fans of a few classic Gucci offerings (Gucci PH, Rush, and Envy) will really appreciate this one. Noticed someone below mention that they dont get the sandalwood, but to my nose, that's the lead player here. Full-on sandalwood. Woody, smoky, with a few dry spices. Pops off my skin in the winter months. It's not listed, but I wouldnt be surprised at all if the note breakdown mentioned incense. How CK ever got from the original Euphoria, to this, is beyond my comprehension.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: The sandalwood in this is very recognizable. Wearing this inspires me to explore other sandalwood leading fragrances.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Smoky, woody, manly magnificence in a classy black and gold bottle.

This beauty is first and foremost a very saffron-forward sandalwood fragrance. As such, it strikes me a bit on the "mature" side, and as such it's not going to be for everyone.

Top notes include a very camphoric side of saffron, which could be both unexpected and off-putting, but give it time. It levels off soon enough.

Once the saffron volatiles blow off, a warm and smoky side of saffron comes out, and puts it all into perspective. Without this, the sandalwood note (heavy on the javanol) would carry Liquid Gold into a dryness that would be both overly synthetic and too incomplete to fully enjoy. With it, LG morphs into something rounder and warmer, all without introducing more than just a little bit of sweetness. Pepper isn't prominent in any way, but it also compliments the effects of saffron in offsetting the powerful sandalwood base.

Warning: This is not a crowd pleaser. It's something you wear for your own enjoyment, and for those who can appreciate a challengingly dry and dark saffron/woody combination. Personally, I dig it! Try layering this with the likes of Molinard Cher Wood or MBZ Club Black for "next level" depth...

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Keep it short. It is The One Dolce and Gabbana Intense version that all the fans were waiting for except that CK decided to make it real.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Very good eau de parfum.

Minimal and heavy at the same time.

Sweet creamy sandalwood with madicinal spicy opening. Synthetic woodsiness (ambroxan?) that is yet crowd pleaser.

A very safe choice. Classy oriental vibe but yet playfull.

Longevity is solid.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Horrible sillage. When I first put it on I was left wondering if I had a cold or something inhibiting my sense of smell. I bought mine "shipped and sold by Amazon" on cyber Monday for $40. As a blind buy, it's probably one of the most disappointing I've ever made. The scent is pleasant, but it's just impossible to smell it without putting my nose directly on my skin. If this had some projection, really anything more than the NOTHING it currently has, then this would be a great edp. But this continues the trend for me. I've never had good luck with CK branded scents.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I never thought I would own another CK fragrance again and here I am writing a review.

CK was popular among my peers and I growing up and after running threw all the originals and owning a few, I moved on.

That was until I stumbled across liquid gold and blind bought it based on reviews here that it was niche. @FreshTones said it: woody, spicy, and sweet which I find blissful! To top it off, it's a powerhouse for longevity. Indoors, this will last easily 12 hours! I simply couldn't ask for more.

Although I havent tried Euphoria Gold, this blows away the original and intense versions imo.

Perfect for winter and fall. Warm climate buyers should be careful since it may be over powering in hot climates.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Outlet stores have become a regular outing for me lately as I've been finding super buys. This is one of them and what a pleasant surprise. I've had a modicum of success with CK overall, so I can't be too dramatic about it. Euphoria Gold, Reveal, Shock, Escape... Even Dark Obsession is pleasant enough. All pale in comparison to this baby right here.

The opening is a jolt to the senses. Woody, spicy, sweet. STRONG. Nothing smells synthetic at all, superb quality. Being a fairly simple scent, Liquid Gold delivers on it's promises of a natural smelling mixture of it's parts. It stays a strong woody and spicy for quite awhile into the dry down. There is where it hits it's mark. A dry, almost powdery version of the beginning is left projecting for what seems like forever. Warm, sweet, so creamy.

This bad boy is date signature ten fold but beware... If you spray this too many times (like I did) expecting a little more from your CK, your date may not be able to breathe. Longevity and sillage are beastly. I would say this is in my top five most intense fragrances. I would suspect it for an older crowd, probably above 30. Cold weather is probably going to be your best bet as well. For the price I see it going for online, I'd say well worth it. May not be for some so blind buying may not be appropriate but I'm sure glad I did.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I smell peppermint...like candy. This sounds bad but actually is it done very well. The first time around I didn't notice it as much. I don't get the ingredients listed, sandalwood especially.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Woody and smoky, you're in the mountain lodge with the fire burning. You're warm & cosy & it's cold outside. You're enjoying the moment. The crackling of the fire ripples through the room and some of the smoke escapes. U get a deep awareness of the still and quiet place you're in. As u take it all in u notice the warm inviting smell. It is calming and soothing. U go back to your routine in the city and long to be taken back to the mountains. U take out your ck liquid gold and spray it on, that's it, all of a sudden you're there again, u feel the fire and experience the smell of you're beautiful mountain moment.

Update

This is a longevity and projection beast. First smell was strong but nice then I kept smelling my wrist and it was strong but I stopped this and appreciated as it lingers around me.

If u love sandalwood then this is for u. This is the most beautiful sandalwood, nothing artificial smelling, this is an amazing fragrance if u can warm up to it. I'm not sure how it always comes across because it's so strong and unique, but I love it.

Am enjoying it in the comfort of my home in Sydney Australia, we're at the end of winter. According to some people this scent fades quickly in warm climates which I will soon see as spring and summer roll in. Jettison could pick up coconut and cinnamon & I get that too. A real surprise from CK and my new signature scent :))

Update

Ive had more time to reflect on this scent and im still very much in love with it, however this is a when your home scent. Perfect for cooler times. Keeps me warm. It's the deep, woody, smoky experience I love. Very comforting scent. home beacause i imagine smelling this on someone else and I really don't think I would like it. Just call me a home boy when I put this one on!

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Second time around and liking it even more. A very unique smell, pleasant for a romantic eve...

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Buttery like butterscotch with peppermint. Nice and somwhat unique but only light-moderate sillage and low to medium longevity. Definitely more of a night cologne than a day/work one. Even though somewhat low in sillage and longevity, I would grade this a B because of the interesting combo of fragrances.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Baloney-cologney. Haha. I love it.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Let me just ditto everything invaderlark mentioned below. I am not a fan of Calvin Klein fragrance (too much department store baloney-cologney) but Liquid Gold Euphoria is a well-crafted fragrance that is unique, is elegant/refined/classy, performs well and just smells terrific. The problem with a designer offering a niche-like quality fragrance is that not everyone will appreciate it...so try before you buy. However, if you're looking for something a little outside of the mainstream, for a reasonable price, then give this one a shot.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Upon first sniff, I'm in love. This is a perfect balance of sweetness, woodiness, and spice. It's a super sensual scent! I will post my official rating after I give it a proper wearing. Fingers crossed!

Update:
Wonderful scent...short lived on me.
7/10

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Absolutely hated it, asked the SA to smell it after she offered it to me and she couldn't hide her disgust either. Other than CK shock, I don't really care for much from Calvin Klein in the last 10 years as far as fragrances go.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Initial impression short review-

Very linear creamy sandlewood, made a bit dusty with saffron. Preformance seems good, decently persistent sillage. Very sweet.

Not quite what I expected, thought it would be drier.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
I work at Macy's as a vendor for Coty Prestige and we just got this fragrance in and I absolutely love it. It's such a quality sandalwood combined with that dry saffron. The opening is a bit weird because the saffron and sandalwood come off as smokey in tandem. I think it's the most unique and "niche" out of the Calvin Klein range. I was told by other vendors and associates that not many people are liking it due to the strong woody opening. It is a bit above the mainstream to really appreciate, not to sound like a snob. The drydown is more dusty sandalwood and saffron and it's definitely more approachable and I hate this word but "cozy". I really hope that we keep this one in our lineup because I think other fragheads/people in the fragrance community will really enjoy it. The projection is strong at first but I think it becomes a skinscent after about 2 to 3 hours; longevity is pretty good too. I got at least 6 hours on my skin and that was on dry skin.

The price is steep for this Eau De Parfum. It's in the high $90's to $100 range in one size with no gift sets as of right now. Some may say this fragrance is too simplistic and I can see that, but compared to other fragrances on the market today with every note but the kitchen sick, Demeter you should be making that one ;), it's nice to have a fragrance stripped back. This is probably the most niche quality fragrance Calvin Klein has produced. Perfect for all and winter.

Update*: The price has gone down to $85, at least that's what the cash register rang it up as. Get it while you can.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Okay let me put this review:
For those who live in South East Asia, this perfume is not suitable to be use in warm day light. Its just vaporized in few minute.

However, this perfume works fine if you use it in cold environment like office, rainy night or if you attend a special function in dinner where there is air conditioning in the dining room.

For the aroma, i totally love it. I got compliment for this because of the sweet taste.

longevity, is good and last for a day. Sillage is not that great but for those who desire intimacy like hugs and kisses, this is for you.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Imagine my surprise, while at Macy's today...and there this was !!! I asked the SA..."When did you get this in stock" !!??....She said last week. I tested it asap, and it was love at first sniff !!! One size, $85.00. But, I am going to wait this one out to see if on-line the prices will come down....lol.....This scent is reviewd as spicy..heavy....powerhouse...I guess that could mean for the middle-east version....???.....I find it has a certain spiciness...and freshness too..somehow. I wonder if it went thru a re-formulation for the introduction to the USA....???.... Still, I really like the scent alot!
The note you see listed above, to my nose, is exactly what you get. I am still upset about the discontinuation of the first Euphoria Gold....one of my Top 5's. I guess that happened to make "room" for this version on the shelves. As usual, the longevity is lacking...damn !!
But I honestly will have to do a "full" wearing to investigate that part.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is a "dark" fragrance in the sense that its smell can be related to other fragrances that incorporate the words, "Black" "Noire" and "Night" in their titles. In other words, it has that particular sweetness that is related to men's fragrances often intended for date nights and night clubs. Liquid Gold is a sweet woody-spicy fragrance, a touch powdery--a combination of a robust, bold sandalwood accord paired with saffron. The black pepper in this doesn't smell like pepper but rather it gives the fragrance a fresh-spicy edge. And that's something that I think is important to clarify with Liquid Gold if you're to understand anything about it by reading a review; although this is a very powerful fragrance with intense projection and a far-reaching sillage, it doesn't feel particularly thick or heavy. It maintains a sort of powdery freshness that makes it comfortable to wear. So it's indeed strong, but it's not the kind of scent that will weigh you down and make you feel like you're dragging around a heavy cloud of scent as long as you keep the sprays to a reasonable amount. This is a quality scent; the sandalwood is solid--it actually smells like sandalwood, as opposed to many fragrances which claim to use it-- and its sweet saffron is aromatic and pleasant, with a smooth, polished feel. I could imagine if this were sold in Sephora possibly under a different brand and name it would do very well. Call it "Tom Ford Midnight Noir" and people would love it. Unfortunately, Calvin Klein has developed something of a bad reputation among fragrance enthusiasts, so I think a lot of people have overlooked this one. But I think CK's been on the rise. Many of their recent releases--Reveal Men, Euphoria Gold, CK2, and CK Shock--are actually pretty good, and show signs of improvement in their department. You can add Liquid Gold Euphoria to this list as well. Considering it's now available in the US for under $60 it's definitely worth sampling and I'd even recommend it as a blind buy with some words of caution: Liquid Gold is INTENSE, and it has a sweetness that some find a bit feminine. Personally, I don't think it smells too feminine--at least not in the sense of florals and white musk--which are usually the notes that do it for me. Liquid Gold doesn't have those. Also, you probably won't be using this as a daily-wear style of fragrance. Due to its projection and sweet, woody-spicy character it feels best suited for nights out and colder ones at that. Overall, Liquid Gold Euphoria has excellent performance--big projection and 12+ hours of longevity--and avoids any harsh, synthetically chemical accords or the flat and sort of feeble structure some CK compositions of the past have exhibited. It will project an alluring sillage that seems designed to appeal to a mainstream audience as it's pleasant and devoid of any "weird" or awkward notes. Thumbs up.

To help figure out if you'd like it, think Dior Homme Parfum, Tom Ford Noir Extreme, La Nuit De L'Homme, Bulgari Man Black, Valentino Uomo and CH Men. While Liquid Gold smells different than these, it fits within this genre of dark, woody-sweet men's date fragrances.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Closely resembles Tom Ford Noir Extreme to my nose, which isn't a bad thing!

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Just received my bottle today. The bottle, alone, is worth mentioning, imo. It is black glass, and heavy...beautifully masculine. The first spray stirs up the sandalwood...very rich, not sweet at all. Then, comes the black pepoer, to jazz it up just a bit. Saffron is subtle, but important. Delicious scent...perfectly balanced in its non-overbearing quality, it is maddingly elusive. One could wear this in a social setting, and be fine. Glad I blind-bought it, based on reviews here...so thanks, ya'll! This scent is Divine.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I got this blind on auction site for steal. I was dreaming of the sandalwood note of Trend or Rush, what I get is a saffron bomb that mellows to a creamy spiced sandalwood that was unfamiliar to me. That is not a bad thing. It smells unlike any typical western scent from Sephora in my opinion, it's what I imagine the youth of the UAE smelling like. I find it young, it's a masculine scent. I get a heady floral spicey sandalwood that projects and gets noticed with positive results. Definitely will be much better in the fall and winter, in the heat of Texas summer is deteriorates a bit to the sweet side but not syrupy. I'm glad I got this because it seems like it will disappear into obscurity...

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Calvin Klein Liquid Gold Euphoria was allegedly released only outside the US in 2014 when it came out but luckily it has become available on BeautySpin recently ($72 for 100ml) so I was fortunate enough to grab a bottle. Its mainstay notes are vanilla, pepper, and balsam fir, but I get an element of sandalwood as well. The result is a very nice cold-weather-friendly composition that stands out from the rest of the Euphoria line.

To that point, Liquid Gold is the best expression of Euphoria I've tried--the sweetness of the line, with the spiciness of Gold, peppiness of Intense, yielding a truly interesting gourmand creation. Warm, spicy, sweet, smooth--this could be a cold weather mainstay for many.

Liquid Gold Euphoria also has the distinction (for me) of being the only EDP concentration Calvin Klein's men fragrance on the market that I'm aware of, though I could be neglectful here.

Accordingly, performance is very strong in terms of both projection and especially longevity. And although I'm testing it in the day, this is definitely preferable for nighttime usage, and can dress up well for formal occasions. I almost find this worthy of being kept in the cooler, though it's not terribly expensive.

Certainly a compelling blind buy and something you ought to check out if you like the sound of it---the consensus seems to be strongly in its favor.

8 out of 10

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Great, Rich and Deep.
The longevity +12 Hours on the skin.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This fragrance is rich, sophisticated, luxurious but a bit too sweet. I get more sweetness them smoke and there is indeed a sour aspect to it once it settles down which gives it a nice touch. Quality and performance are outstanding and if the sweetness would be just a bit less, then I could praise it even more. I any way its a great release from CK which will reach for often at special occasions or even workdays when I want to feel and radiate a vide of sophistication.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Liquid Gold is not for the fainthearted. Neither it is for people who likes run of the mill types. Probably, it is not so good for dusty humid climate. It is for the winter, for people who can come close together, bodies hugging each other. Your girlfriend had to come close enough to feeeeeeeeeeeeeel the scent! The first note it comes to mind is metal and then the next thing it hits you is sour, not the sourness of citrus or lemony or orange. Just sour. in two words, my review is "Sour Metal". Probably it mimics armpit sweat minus the cumin. I don't know why people mentions armpits as cumin flavour!! Eludes me, most armpit sweat small differently. It may go well on a rockstar, sweaty and energetic while the stage is fire lit! It's good for people riding on a Harley, chains dragging on from the black jeans, tattoos over arms, Gothic! That's it! This is a Gothic scent! The koel lined mascaric girlfriend with all leather black trousers and a sleeveless top to go with it. Smudged so to say. The smudginess is in the perfume, nothing straight. It's made to feel careless. And yes, it reminds of sex, sweaty sex on a empty highway, the sun soaking your naked torsos. But the longevity is not hat great, unless you spray it on your armpits. The sillage is minimal. So no statement either. But its different and unusual. Gothic Sour Metal! The bottom line cannot be better than that. Thank You.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
با سلام و احترام
عطري گرم و پرقدرت براي كساني كه از روايح قوي و همانند بلك اركيد تام فورد لذت مي برند
رايحه اي چوبي با تلفيقي از بوي زعفران و فلفل سياه كاري گرم و تند و پر قدرت را از لحاظ رايحه بوجود آورده است
سنگين و رسمي براي مهماني ها و جلسات كاري
ناگفته نماند كه بسيار به ادكلن جووي پرايويت ليبل شبيه است و در استارت اوليه مي توان قدرت و رايحه آن عطر را در اين كار برند سي كي مشاهده نمود اما با قيمتي در حدود نصف قيمت عطر جووي
با تقديم احترام
گالري عطر مهرداد

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I blindly bought it and didn't expect to receive such a masterpiece from CK! It's absolutely fantastic and I'm happy to have it! The longevity and projection are excellent as well. The scent itself is rich, woody, slightly sweet and a bit smoky. It is definitely a cold weather scent. Don't waste your time to read reviews, go and grab it, it deserves 10 stars in my opinion! The best CK Men's fragrance I have ever smelled.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Absolutely gorgeus! This parfume has a niche quality vibe.
You feel yourself like a king. It was really unexpected: my first CK fragrance.
Trust me when I say it's unique.

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: masterpiece

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: Wow my number one frag thank you ck for the exclusivel edition for the middle ed most brands dont give a damn for us so i did buy it for the fact its exclusivel but when i smell it wow pure luxury and the name says it all

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: magnificent perfume

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I need it

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: This actually sounds nice.. I would like to smell this.. Pepper, saffron, and sandalwood.. Nice notes! Will it be available in the USA or only in Dubai where all the good stuff is released?

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: عطر جميل جداً ، ثبات وفوحان رائعان .

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
مشابه آلى حدا ما عطر امواج انترلود Interlude Man Amouage for men
ولكن امواج فواح اكثر وآقوى

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content: I smelled it at a perfume shop and I didn't like it. because it has a strong woody aroma. I think it would be good for special occasions. if you are like me into the soft citrus smells then this perfume is not for you...

product_name: Liquid Gold Euphoria Men Calvin Klein
review_content:
Well, I guess I need to have my wife call her cousin in dubai to get me a bottle and ship it here to the US lol.

I just hope it lasts as long as intense euphoria, and not as short as dark obsession. ;)

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: This is an interesting one. I don't personally don't pick up any orange note off the top. There is some black pepper for sure. The one fruit I pick up on is coconut. I wasn't expecting it but I'm okay with it. Its like a creamy, mildly sweet type of coconut that blends well with the dominant leather note that's in here. Suede and Vetiver really helps to put those two together. Its a really pleasant scent profile and is rather masculine. Its even sexy and sophisticated. I'm sure you probably don't believe me but it just simply works. You can wear this year round because its very versatile. This is a good office friendly scent and can even be worn on a causal date especially if you got some leather or faux leather on of some kind lol. I really like it and I have been drawn to wearing this one more than expected. Its an addicting scent.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Having first tried Clavin Klein's original Defy as Eau de Toilette (a nice and clean but boring lavender bomb), this version –Eau de Parfum– is much bolder and rugged. Opens up citrus-fresh for a few minutes, then takes a turn into something gloomy. I love leather and animalic smells yet Defy EdP is of a "dirty" type, or pungent to be precise. Lots of pepper! Maybe the earthy vetiver is playing games here as well. I'm not digging it as much as I would have liked to…

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: soft and sweet citrus with a nice peppery touch with plenty of suede and vetiver and a hint of leather on the back. Fresh but with a little darker vibe it works pretty well. Smells pretty good and designer although simple and nice and masculine. Performance is OK and a nice reach for an all round scent especially for its often discounted prices on many sites.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: I get the orange citrus and it goes a little darker but in a soft way, I've tried this a couple of times but never all over, hope the longevity is decent thats all so the jury is maybe out but I like it, I'll come back to another review once the bottles been put through its paces but so far so good 😊

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: It's decent but the EDT version is far better.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is a very unique male scent a muscular strong profile not a trendy fragrance

I like it.. it doesnt smell like everyone else

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Great leather fragrance. Leather all the way thru. dries down to a smokey amber that has this "soft" feel when it hits your nose. It's a great wearable leather fragrance the give you a good dose of very identifiable leather notes that make it a leather frag but doesn't overplay it and provides enough smokey amber smoothness as it dries down to meld it with today's style. It doesn't go full "blue" as it dries down but the lather tones down enough to get that modern touch sprinkled in with Calvin K signature style

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: A simple, leathery blue frag. This is great for the right price

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Good stuff and affordable. Leather and Orange? Yum. Moderate performance but for the cost you can do extra sprays. Smells like old money.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: This one definitely deserves more than the current rating of 3.6. Very smoky and like how few of them rightly mentioned below, this smells money. This somehow reminds me of the smell that comes from the Boss/Mont Blanc leather wallets used by heavy smokers. A combination of leather and smoke. A very mature, wealthy kind of smell.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Haven't tried the parfum yet but so far the Defy line is crushing it! I Really dig the EDT and this one takes that dry down with the vetiver and that hint of leather and dials it up to ten. The leather in this one is definitely a feature but on my skin this is a "Blue" Vetiver fragrance.
Off my skin the fresh orange opening fades into the backround within about an hour or so but I catch whiffs of the freshness in the air for about 2-3 hours after that .This is ultimately a peppery, leathery, dry smoky vetiver scent with the citrus blue fragrance thing just hanging out back there.
May not be for everyone as that vetiver comes off so dry and smoky. It can be thick and almost musky.

Very well done
Performs as expected of an EDP for me
Unique-Nothing in my collection smells quite like this
Versatile in the cooler months-You can even dress this up to a suit and tie and it wont be out of place
Masculine and sexy
Great frag by CK. Awesome frag if you can get it at a great price.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
I'm a fan. The darker leathery dry down is superb. I actually like wearing it on a warmer day as the top notes really sing being quite citrus heavy.

Definitely not a linear fragrance like other Calvin Klein offerings can be. It walks the right line between being beautifully fresh and complex later on.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: العطر ذكرني برائحة ركوب المرسيدس مودل 1997

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: This is the same as Vince Camuto Virtu with some added citrus!!!!!!! I really enjoy the scent....for a 200ml at T.J.Maxx on clearance for $40, an AMAZING buy for sure!!!!!!!!

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
To my nose, Defy EdP is very different from the original Defy EdT.

The EdT version is generic and similar to many current popular fragrances on the market. Defy EdP, on the other hand, is unique with its leather/suede notes. Although the scent display is linear, three sprays in the morning lasted more than 8 hours on me. With every move, I got a whiff of vetiver, leather, and suede scent mixture. This vetiver/leather/suede profile smells warm and sweet, reminiscent of Butterscotch melting in the mouth; it is lovely!

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Just sprayed this on a tester strip and to me it smells like money! Like literally it smells like a brand new hundred dollar bill. Not sure how it would smell on my skin but I like it!

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Cooler weather nautica's Voyage.
Our friend down there nailed it.
Very nice presentation, sturdy glass.
Nice scent. I got at a sale discounted. Worth it!

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Should be rated higher than 3.6 as I think its a quite unique and surprising well blended nice simple sweet/woody/leather blue fragrance thats good for the colder months or would be on the fresher side for a date fragrance.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: A leathery, woody, citrusy, and somewhat sweet fragrance even though it's not listed as a note. A classy take on a blue fragrance. 6.5/10

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: This is a underrated fragrance, strong sillage and longlasting. Smell 10/7.5

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: I just had this amazing scent and funnily i found out that the dry down is pretty similar to Nautica Voyage's dry down except it's much stronger, darker and a bit powdery. They smell similar but obviously have two direction: oceanic vs leathery. Definitely reminds me of Tom Ford Ombre Leather. CK's fragrances are always cheap but this one is, you can say classy. Putting the fact that they made an expensive commercial video staring the dead Stark(the bodyguard guy).

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: I really like this fragrance. It's louder & overall a better scent than the EDT. It's more mature & more refined than the EDT. My only gripe is the performance. So for the first 30mins-1hr this fragrance will be very loud (depending on how much you spray). This will definitely fill up a small room for that time period. However, after that time period it drastically dials back. It's unfortunate because it is a great scent. At around the 3 hour mark it becomes a skin scent & lasts as a skin scent 4 more hours, so around 6hrs-7hrs of longevity. I personally believe that this scent can be worn throughout the year, but on hot days mind your sprays. Overall it's a good scent for the price.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Top notes: mandarin oil
Mid notes: leather accord
Base notes: vetiver oil

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Dry, smokey, woody, earthy, but at the same time has a freshness to it. Not a basic fragrance at all, like others have said it gives off a tobacco smell. Love the vetiver in this fragrance too that dry wood is really nice

In my opinion this is what Montabaco verano by ormonde jayne should've been....this one is much more safer and mass appealing. I'd say go with this one instead of montabaco verano by ormonde jayne.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Right off the top I get earthy, tobacco-ish a little dryness, woody, aromatics, leaning clean..

The vetiver diesnt feel her as it dies in other scents. (Usually vetiver is warm woody citric for me)
I don't know that I find this peppery- like Miu Miu is on me... possibly minerally earthy would be a better word for it, no overt citrus for me/not heavily citrus in feel either - no pith, I get alot more of the aromatics down the base layers and by that time I quite like it, sorta generically nice by that time. As a female I don't think I could spare this all over and feel great - due to the dry tobacco feel I get. I wouldn't say this scent feels very leathery either- its not like a couch or leather jacket.. the leather is very background.
But a good fragrance, I get the lavender gently with slight powder way down the line.

This is an interesting non blue smelling blue scent, the opener making it original, the edt has a little if the same but far less, and that one is cleaner/freshie/aromatic/blue and sits ontop of the skin and has more sillage, the edp sinks in and is a little quieter after a while.
Good longevity for me too, summer skin test.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Got this in a sample kit from Macy's for Christmas and it's been on my radar ever since. Saw a 100ml bottle at TJ Maxx for $40 tonight so I pulled the trigger. You won't find many votes under "This perfume reminds me of..." because there is nothing else like it. Just interesting, different, inviting, and well-blended..... get your hands on it. Easily one of CK's best.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Nice perfume, great value nice smelling

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: I can't help it, I love this stuff. Under appreciated! To me, this is a great crisp weather to cold weather scent that has versatility with light sprays in the spring/summer. Get your nose on this and have an open mind. I expect Calvin Klein to flank this out like they always do...and I can see a lot of potential with this scent profile.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Very underrated.
A cheapie Gem.
Great leathery citrus blueish scent with a good performance

I got myself a 200ml bottle

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: i really dislike this fragrance. i feel the scent is too harsh and not appealing. i haven’t worn it at all after having it for months and don’t recommend as a blind buy.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: I don't dislike the original (edt) version, but this one is far more interesting imo. Smooth, citrus/spice/leather/vetiver combo, extremely well blended. Not particularly summer scent, can be cloying in a high heat if oversprayed.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
I dont know,what the hate about this frags??!!this is beautiful&nice smelling frags on earth lol!!!.....yeah i agree if it's same character/even its identical with KING EDP By:D&G this is fresh,manly,sexy,leathery&clean!!!
Performance also not kind of that bad......give it a try guys!!!don't even bothered by low ratings before you try by yourself✌️😄😊😁
Overall:SCENT:8.5 PERFORMANCE:7.5 UNIQUE:8.0

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Oh, this is nice. It starts off in a similar way to other blue scents, but then veers off into leathery territory and stays there for the rest of its life. Some leather fragrances come up smelling of nothing but leather on me, but this doesn't. It's kind of peppery, but also kind of citrusy. I like it! I really like that Calvin Klein scents have a pretty common thread of freshness for the most part.

This is the best variation of Defy in my opinion - the EDT is just chemically citrusy blech, and the Parfum, while also very nice, doesn't do much more than a prominent cacao note. Like the Parfum, I really appreciate that Calvin Klein have done something different to other blue scents with this. I don't think it's going to put a spotlight back on them, but it's much better than the stuff they were putting out just a few years ago.

As with all Calvin Kleins, this is pretty good value - you can get 100mL of it for 90 AUD, or 200mL for just $20 more. So, if you like it enough, getting a lot of it won't set you back too much.

Is this going to be the blue fragrance I end up buying?? We shall see.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
I love the leather notes, just as the vetiver ones. But this somehow is just not tolerable for me.

Also, this is nothing like Pour Lui in Black, which I love.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is actually a good fragrance, I really like it after one testing. I am glad I finally did it cause I was put-down by the edt which I found to be incredibly boring and uninspired. I will definitely give this a full wearing!

This reminds me of a blue flanker to Baldessarini Private Affairs or even more of Gianfranco Ferre L'Uomo.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: The woody fruity minty scent is so fresh clean and calming. Very pleasant! Give it 9/10.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: I only have a 5ml sample of this. Just sprayed it on. It's quite nice actually with a good performance. A sweet, fresh fruity frag but nothing special. It's leather note is very muted. Pleasant enough. It's a versatile perfume but a much better option is the lovely Guess Man. I think I would buy this if the price fell however.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: To me this fragrance smells how I would expect the parfum version of D and G K to smell. It’s in a similar style to the edp but much darker. I would avoid wearing this is high heat situations but it still has some summer wearability. If you are a fan of K this could be a good pickup for the right price as it smells like it could be a flanker. For those seeking leather, look elsewhere. This is not at all a leather scent although it does have some noticeable traces

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
EDIT: Some more things to add, the drydown is very similar to K EDP by Dolce & Gabbana, a fragrance that I am not a fan of, because it is too bitter. However, Defy gets a pass- and is 100% more palatable in my opinion. My take is that Defy is the sweet younger sister of K, whereas K is the macho older bro. Defy is not a projection monster, but it does good. And enjoy that mandarin top note while it lasts- it is absolutely the icing on the cake for this fragrance! After that, there is a huge K-reminiscent drydown, only better in my opinion. I'll lower it to an 8.3 for factoring in a huge similarity to K EDP, since the drydown isn't as unique as it could be. Defy EDP is still a great pickup at a rackstore- wholly recommended!

Holy hell I love Defy EDP so much. My first buy was a 1.6 oz for $30 bucks at Ross. For that price, I thought it was a great deal. I ended up buying another bottle as a backup (thinking that it was 1.6 oz), but that bottle was $40- and as it turned out- twice the size (what a treat!). If you see it, BUY IT at a discounter while you still can. 3.3 oz for $40 bucks is a great target price. As much as I love this fragrance, I still recommend that you test it in Sephora (@ Kohls) first, because it might not be for everybody (I am a 20/yo male, it suits my age well). I first noticed Calvin Klein Defy EDP as I was casually fragrance testing in Sephora. This is where it first caught my attention- as a sampler on display. And it was love at first smell.

The leather note is prominent, but not overwhelming. It is blended very finely, especially the leather and vetiver. Take all of the notes listed for this fragrance, and blend them so that none of them smell like their individual parts; but each combine to create a sensual, alluring fragrance that is unforgettable. Some fragrances overdo it with top notes, or have distinctive elements that stick out too much (I'm looking at you, Cool Water- even though that drydown is what makes it). Defy EDP doesn't smell overly sharply of mandarin at all, and isn't overly spiced with pepper. It is just right, with a beautiful opening.

One con with the fragrance is that, perhaps, I can see where the previous commenter compared it to a body spray. It does have that "generic" vibe to it.. but I love it so much, even so. Imagine walking into a mall, perhaps a clothing outlet. This fragrance might evoke those memories. Then again, the "outlet store"-esque scent probably has something to do with the fact that the mid notes (leather and suede) are both used for certain articles of clothing. If you are afraid of blind-buying this fragrance, remember that it is relatively easy to find (heavily discounted) at rack stores, and just check in with their return policies before you buy it. Quality assured.

The longevity isn't perfect. The performance is fine, it gets the job done. But this is Calvin Klein we are talking about. I am partial to the house; i've smelled CK fragrances and consider them "hit or miss". Yet I love Defy EDP, and I wouldn't hesitate to call it a signature scent. 3.3 oz for $40 dollars? Best bang for my buck in the collection.

Highly recommended. 9/10.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: I don't get the "it doesn't smell like leather" comments at all. It is DOMINANT in it's leather profile. Everything else is second fiddle here. Cool Spring weather, Fall, and any Summer day that drops under 70 this will work. Last a bit off the skin for about 4-5 hours, then gets close to the skin for another couple hours, projects for 2 - 3 hours before becoming more of a personal bubble within a foot. For 35 bucks at Burlington, it is phenomenal.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: A surprisingly sophisticated freshie with a very faint leather. Quite enjoyable and inoffensive, this is very office-friendly. Stays close to skin. Wish the leather note were amplified a lot, because I love the leather in this but it's very faint or blended well to stand out.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: I'm not even gonna rate this fragrance but I don't like. I have a 10ml spray and will happily give it away.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Doesn't smell like leather at all. Don't even bother trying it if you came for leather.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: This was the last of probably 8-10 scents I tried and I purchased only this one, I loved it for its almost creamy scent for the first 24 hours but I work and thought "Why does it smell like my barber shop" then I realised it was the heavy and thick leathery, woody, powdery scent from the fragrance. I haven't worn it out yet and will probably sell it before I do, could see someone more mature (30's, 40's) wearing this, but not teens or early 20's. Would probably bode well for professional workspace environments with 2 sprays max, even 1 spray is probably enough for most purposes. I picture it as a workplace fragrance for the late 20s onwards white collar man who just wants to not smell like BO.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: This is flat out good. I been wearing it almost every day, every situation, Love this and K EDP....Really similar but enough of a difference with the Leather in DEFY EDP......Woman seem to like K EDP Better though when I ask everyone at work.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells like an inspiration or Flanker of Le Labo Santal 33 or Palo Santo by Cremo. I get papyrus, cedar, cardamom. Cremo is the better deal here.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
I just acquired a couple of Leather frags and just open and wore it today. I can relate to why it is so nice smelling mass Appealing but in a different direction compared to the usual suspects from chanel and Dior. This is like a sweeter more mass Appealing Gucci Guilty Absolute. Note are pretty simple but I do not know why it's also kinda similar the opening and sweetness of Armani's Stronger With You Leather. Both I have too and I'll need to go back nose all 3 and compare closer side by side.

Really lovely scent to wear.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: I grabbed this at Burlington for $35 cause it has been a few weeks since stopping at a rack store. I already really liked K EDP since it is different and easy to wear, versatile, signature worthy imo. I feel this is the Farenheit Aqua version of 2022. CK did a great job mainstreaming a blue frag, EDP, unique with the earthiness mixed with sweetness, anyone can pull it off, easy grab and go leather frag....I am glad to have it. It's 4-6 hours, never goes beyond 2-3 feet, but leaves a nice little trail later into the day. Good job by CK doing there own thing, not just go in the same direction of everyone else...I can't wear leather frags, not a fan personally of ombre leather etc......I like Leather/Suade in light sweet frags at times, but this is a great Gucci Guilty Green style scent that just works......I don't see how it is possible K and DEFY are not hyped online like other reduntant new relases and remixes. K EDP for $35 is a quality buy for anyone who wants a mass pleasing easy to wear blue leather, earthy, but sweet the right amount...If you like any of the King line, EDP best imo and this is a must have to have in the rotation. It's different enough to the average 90% of people.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Happened upon this in a pile of samples, and I’m pleasantly surprised. It’s much more compelling than it has a right to be. At the start I get creamy citrus and coconut with the darker elements buzzing at the edge, and the leather gradually takes up more space. I get the reference to Gucci Guilty Absolute below. I find a similar bandage accord lurking here to counterbalance the more conventional notes. After a couple of hours this calms down into a masculine coconut-vetiver that hovers at skin level.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
The only difference I can pull in comparison to the EDT is that this has the Vetiver amped up with an oak note as well or maybe it's that suede saffron blend. I don't get any leather. For me the EDT is more wearable. Both good performing.

Still it remains very good. More night time and mature than the EDT as well

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Can't deny this is versatile and very over sprayable. The citrus hits you nicely in the opening but unfortunately gives too much room to the woods and base notes too quickly.
The smell itself is good, nothing too unique, and very "orange."
Performance is pretty average (on the lower side) and does not call too much attention on my skin. I have a small sample of it that I've been wearing for the last two days. This feels a bit too non-linear and much overpriced at retail ($100+ for the 3.3oz) with the performance that not many would go for even on a fresh warmer temperature scent.
Do not recommend buying this at retail, but may be worth something in the order of $40 when it gets to discounters.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: it's pretty nice, on my skin it smells and feels very subtle. I'm usually pretty sensitive to colognes and do a spray from afar but this one took 2 sprays. the longevitity is pretty moderate, the smell is nice, just kinda subtle which I enjoy.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Very masculine, very wearable. Quite fresh, not sweet.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Wow I am actually deeply impressed by this one….. take Gucci Guilty Absolute and make it wearable to the masses. That’s what I get on my skin. Absolutely the last thing I expected out of a blue Calvin Klein bottle.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is one of those fragrances that while not being too showy or flamboyant somehow becomes quite compelling. There's an understated elegance here despite being a modern type scent, this is actually a decent release from a brand which IMO gets unfairly trashed by fragrance snobs and reviewers. I'll definitely consider buying a bottle at some point to keep alongside other excellent (and probably more unique) CK releases such as Obsessed for Men Intense EDP and CK2 in my collection.

Just to add, the leather vibe here is just right, not dirty or oppressive, so people who don't usually like this note may even like it here. This isn't revolutionary but it's a likeable & versatile modern masculine fragrance which lasts surprisingly well.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Received a sample of the EDP from Macy's. Never tried the EDT so I have no way to compare it against that but it's a fairly linear, fresh, and versatile fragrance. It has a simple note breakdown and you can definitely smell some components of each of the listed notes. With the leather and it being an EDP there is enough density to pull this off in cooler months. The leather is not an older dirty leather, its more of a smoother leather (think brand new modern car leather). The only time I would probably not reach for this would be in the dog days of summer in 80+ degree heat. I wore it a couple times and the compliment factor wasn't high like a Dior Sauvage or Dylan Blue but I did get an unsolicited "you smell nice" compliment from someone at work. It's not a monster projector and the longevity is just so so (about 6 hours). If you have a vast niche collection you would likely be bored from this. If you have some niche but mostly designer and you are in the market for a versatile "dumb reach" scent it might be worth a try but I am waiting it out until I can find it at a rack store or online discounter. I don't see enough value to justify full retail because it's a like not a love and I already have enough similar fragrances.

***Edit: I was able to locate and buy a 100ml bottle at my local Burlington on my lunch break Friday. $39.99.

Versatility: 8/10
Smell: 7/10
Performance: 5/10
Uniqueness: 6/10
Overall: 6.5/10

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Don't miss this one because of your opinions on the EdT! I usually ignore CK releases, but I am glad I gave this one a chance. The Defy EdT struggles to get any mention in the blue fragrance space because it cannot compete on any metric. The EdP is a different story.

This fragrance is a pleasant and soft woodsy and leather scent that has moderate performance, and a very competitive price-to-value ratio. CK fragrances tend to under-perform, lasting maybe 3-4 hours, leaving no trace. Defy EdP has a bit of that CK pedigree, in that it does not project strongly, but that intimate cloud is alluring. I'm experiencing 3-4 hours of arm's length scent, and then it retreats to a soft, intimate scent for another 3 hours or so. That's why I would recommend this fragrance for an understated user.

Defy EdP is best suited to casual or intimate wear, for a person that is looking to have a comfortable scent. The real appeal of Defy EdP is that it is widely available, is getting overlooked due to associations with the EdT, and is a fraction of the price of other frags in this space. If you're looking for something along this scent profile, Defy EdP is a smart buy.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Smell Oranges & a Blue Vibe in the opening. There's leather there for sure, mixed with woods & to me the woods are coming across as a cedar-like wood or a sandalwood similar to Santal 33 but it could just be the way the leather is mixing with the Vetiver. I'm getting some Sage, Musk & Amber, but they are not listed, but apparently Saffiano Leather can come across that way. Dries down leathery with Vetiver. The blue vibes stick around for a while but in the background more so.

Projection is not super heavy. It sits fairly close to the skin. Longevity is average, with it becoming an extreme skin scent in around 6 hours or so. Sillage is weak. People have to come fairly close to you to smell this. I got this for $40 for 100ml from Burlington. I don't mind it for that price, but its definitely not worth retail prices. If you have a huge collection, or like huge performance, this may not be for you. It's a decent fragrance that lacks uniqueness and that "wow" factor. Could be worn anytime or occasion as long as its under 80 degrees IMO. Presentation is the same as the OG but with a dark blue gradient and the glass is heavy. Box is basic, sprayer is standard, cap locks into place but is plastic and reminds me of the L'Homme Ideal caps in basic black.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Really a nice one; I personally think it deserves a higher rating than its current (at the time of this review) 3.42. A very well-balanced citrus and leather scent, which doesn't lean too far in either direction. The bottle design gives the impression of a typical "blue" freshy, but that's not what this is. It has a lovely smokey quality. Sexy and masculine.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Defy EDP is really good; certainly, it's much better than its current Perfume Rating in the mid 3's, and don't let the deservedly poor reviews of Defy EDT dissuade you from sampling this EDP. IMO, a very pleasant spicy-leather scent that leans citrus fresh. Performance is very good. The more I sniff, the more I like. I'm seeing 10 ml spray bottles for $19, so the price is reasonable.
UPDATE: Just had my offer accepted for a 100 ml bottle, $50!

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: too weak which is a shame: fragrance wise its decent if not somewhat generic in the sea of generics noiw a days but the real sadness is its not strong at all...if they had made this beastmode it would be worth the $40

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content:
Defy Eau de Parfum is an okay release but somewhat uninspiring due to its lack of creativity. Defy Eau de Parfum smells like a generic version of Gentleman Intense without the quality and sophistication. Defy Eau de Parfum is a masculine fragrance that could be worn year round but is probably better suited for spring/fall/winter seasons, day or night and worn in practically any situation. Performance and projection are solid.

Defy Eau de Parfum may be a good choice for newer noses. Fragheads and/or experienced noses should steer clear unless your goal is to amass a gigantic collection of fragrances, and/or if you simply enjoy the Defy line.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Ugh another decent smelling Calvin Klein with no performance, I got a sample and have worn it a few times ....the scent is enjoyable is a smokey citrus that dries down to a actually decent leather scent but it's disappearing quickly by 2-4 hrs its barely a skin scent this seems to be a downfall of a lot of Calvin Klein scents but the few hours you get, this is a cooler weather probably leaning towards a night scent .....I wouldn't pay full retail for this but at this point that goes for all Calvin Klein Fragrances

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: For a Calvin Klein frag, this is amazing. Starts off with the mandarin orange and black pepper which is smooth and transitioned to the leather + vetiver + smoky. The leather is not that strong and just subtle. This great for office, casual wear and dates. The longevity is good around minimum 6 hours for a CK frag. Hats off to Calvin Klein!

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: I love this new flanker. Noting like the original. very leathery and a bit smoky. The longevity is okay. It doesn't project as much. It is nice though, but I recommend you wait till it hits discounters. You can watch my first impressions on my youtube channel. I look forward seeing you there.

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Take the original, add leather and smoke, it’s a deeper but still pleasant fragrance

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells like a bright, fruity sofa. Although saying that it is really nice

product_name: Defy Eau de Parfum Calvin Klein
review_content: I tried this the other day. It isn’t anything groundbreaking, but a big improvement over the original EDP. It’s richer and more dense, and longer lasting.

product_name: CK One Platinum Edition Calvin Klein
review_content: I like the sweet profile, smells good and fresh, recommended

product_name: CK One Platinum Edition Calvin Klein
review_content:
Here’s a good deodorant that’s fresh, masculine, and fruity. It becomes almost like a bathroom freshener thanks to a single citrus note. Not dumb at all, but it fades — it’s not strong, showing all the typical traits of a deodorant.

However, it’s worth noting that the downside of being like a freshener disappears — unfortunately, along with the strength.

product_name: CK One Platinum Edition Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells like tinned pineapple. Probably packed full of manzanate, allyl amyl glycolate, and allyl caprioate. A bit of spice. That's all I get. Nice but too syrupy sweet for my nose

product_name: CK One Platinum Edition Calvin Klein
review_content: Why didn’t I buy it while it was still available and cheap? Certainly because I wanted to refrain from buying each and every fragrance. A bit synthetic but very pleasant. Longevity below average. Apple and aquatic notes.

product_name: CK One Platinum Edition Calvin Klein
review_content: Very sweet, clean, pleasing, and elegant. Raf Simons collab if I'm not mistaken. Earthy lavender, aldehyde, and nameless fruits are most apparent to me. The scent breakdown is actually very close for this one with a soft cashmere feeling. The platinum version of CK1 indeed.

product_name: CK One Platinum Edition Calvin Klein
review_content:
This unisex scent has notes of cardamom and a heart of pink pepper for a warm and modern blend.

EdT

product_name: CK One Platinum Edition Calvin Klein
review_content:
Sweet woody.

That's the definition of this fragrance. Sweet first; woody after.

And I love it!

Not surprised at all there are cinnamon and apple notes in here. Just beautiful!

But it smells like wood plus cinnamon on the dry down. The opening has apple, cardamom, vetiver, and very little lavender. There is a trail of amber here too, but luckily it is not distracting.

Too bad it is no longer being manufactured. One would be wise to pick this up should one see it in a store.

Longevity is acceptable. Lasts longer than CK One, though smells nothing like it.

Leaning masculine. Women can wear this if they really want to, but in all seriousness, there are a ton of other feminine and unisex fragrances for the ladies to choose. I still think this one is more male.

Perfect for spring. Distinctly reminds me of Dolce & Gabbana The One GREY, but without the incense and tobacco, and the sweetness amped up thanks to cinnamon and apple notes.

CK should make this in default production line instead of CK One Gold. I don't even know why that one exists given how scentless it is.

Grab a bottle while it's still on!

product_name: CK One Platinum Edition Calvin Klein
review_content: Opening is hyper sweet and really nice and then it goes away. Sort of like my ex wife.

product_name: CK One Platinum Edition Calvin Klein
review_content:
Unbelievable - CK Platinum opens up identical to AB Blue Seduction with just a hint more juicy apple faucet.

Around the hour mark is when the fruitiness and juiciness completely dissipates and Platinum becomes a fresh vetiver "woody" scent.

I recommend CK Platinum for newbies who don't already own AB Blue Seduction or its cousins Light Blue or Versace Eau Fraiche. The only complaints are the 3-4 hour longetivity, but that's expected with CK fragrances.

product_name: CK One Platinum Edition Calvin Klein
review_content: First 5 minutes it is very sweet fruity like AB Blue Seduction, but the drydown is woodier, reminds me of Gucci Rush which i love, but CK One Platinum is softer, and the sillage is very soft. I wish the performance can be stronger. The Gucci Rush smell in this is something kinda skin scent, you have to put your nose on your skin if you want to smell the gorgeous nostalgic smell.

product_name: CK One Platinum Edition Calvin Klein
review_content: It reminded me of chloe' s nomade

product_name: CK One Platinum Edition Calvin Klein
review_content: Never owning a bottle of the original CK one I decided to give this one a shot. Compared with the hoard of acquatic freshies that have taken over the fragrance world the last 20 years or so this is quite a different take on the genre IMO and for me it works. To some this will open up as a very sweet feminine like blast of fruits and floral notes mixed with some citrus. You probably wouldn't envision gentlemen such as John Wayne or Sean Connery saddling up in the wild west wearing this scent but that's ok. This is unisex after all and for all the guys out there the best part is yet to come. A soft layer of vetiver and woods will overtake the base of this fragrance creating a darker slightly masculine tinge to the base and most of the mid. I imagine women will fall in love with the bright opening. I talked to a few women at work about this one and one said the drydown was a tad bit to masculine while the other loved it from top to bottom. This is really blended very delicately to adjust to one's skin chemistry so let it settle down before making a decision on whether or not to but this. I think if you are in your teens and 20's this will work very well for you. Again for the older folks let it settle down before making any quick decisions. Its one of the most non-linear complex scents that I've smelt honestly. For those reasons alone I see the secret of the original's success. I'm a fan.

product_name: CK One Platinum Edition Calvin Klein
review_content:
ok, just got it.

First of all, this is not like CK One Gold. This one is far more masculine. Those who said — got's to feminine vibe have no awareness of how feminine perfumes smell :D

It does have some notes simillar to CK 2, but CK2 is far more feminine.

I want to test it a bit more, but I like CK One Gold better.

Opening — Blow of masculine notes
Then — takes 30 sec to transition in a sweet smell. Not quite like Million Lucky, but probably this is where the Smith Apple comes in.
Then — Starts to change into woody notes (probably vetiver)
Then — Spices (can definitely feel them)

Ladies who like masculine fragrances would love this. Guys, anyone can pool this off. Someone said this is for younger people — no, no, no. Again, if you believe that an older lad needs to wear a crappy Dior Souvage musk, then I get your point, but this is easily for anyone at any age group.

Smells are memories. If you think old people need to smell certain way of course you'll be kicking this off the shelf.

XX

product_name: CK One Platinum Edition Calvin Klein
review_content:
I am getting a pleasant smell which is not offensive. For me it's a mixture of flowers with some fruits. Not over citrusy like the original CK One. Not for matured men or women. Good for someone who is under 22 and in youth. It's not harsh at all. Kind of powdery and getting a smell of a fruity shampoo.
Compared with the original CK One, this one is more powdery and fruity. I am going 5 sprays with this. Which will last for about 4-5 hours.

Scent 7/10
Uniqueness 5/10
Versatility 7/10
Longevity 7/10
Overall 6.5/10

product_name: CK One Platinum Edition Calvin Klein
review_content:
Tried it out today, first blast heavenly,
1 minute later gone, the scent changed
into a more feminin vibe, first reminded
me of CK summer 2018, but it got better as
time passed, it is not a projection monster,
they never are but longevity was pretty good,
not a bad scent but a bit familiar from CK
not anything new.

product_name: CK One Platinum Edition Calvin Klein
review_content: I hope this last more than the Gold version. Such a waste of beautiful bottle if it is. I really want to have CK One Gold but the longevity is super duper poor, don't wanna waste my money for such cologne.

Yes, it's like the original CK One but more pronounced, sweeter and floral. Essence is an expanded version of the original. At first I was disappointed since it seemed harsh and abrasive in the opening, but it got better as it developed. I like Essence more than the original CK One since even my bottle from ten years ago is really weak in strength. I feel I have to wait until spring and summer to get the most out of this and allow it to bloom from the heat. This is a good warm weather freshie and it does last a long time, unlike the original CK One.
It is okay but I prefer the original CK one in terms of scent.

Kind of scent which smells like you’re the cleanest you’ve ever been. It’s CK one but stronger without that feminine leaning white floral / musk. It’s still unisex but I find it more masculine overall.

There’s something in this one that gives me the same medicinal, doctors office undertone note that there is in mfk baccarat rouge. They are by no means the same but I get this distinct note under there that is the same. Don’t know if it’s the oak moss or the ambroxan. I don’t see anbroxan listed here but this one has tons of it.

Definitely the same scent but smells and performs better than it has in the last twenty or so years. Slightly more modern...I'm guessing ambroxan has been dialed up here. It has a similar sweet, aromatic, musky, woody club feel of the 2010's blue fragrances (Bleu de Chanel, Sauvage, etc.), but it is still undoubtedly CK One. Essence also gets rid of the slightly sharp bathroom-cleaner edge that the regular version now has.

If they had released this 5-10 years earlier, I think they would have had a mega-hit on their hands. Sadly, Calvin Klein seems to be the only fashion brand these days not expanding their fragrance lines. A shame, since they have such perfume classics and a modern history to their name. Highly curious what a CK Privé line would look like.

Since CK One was the first fragrance I owned, it's quite a fun, nostalgic wear for me. Might finally be the time I start wearing this again after all these years.

Long lasting. Fresh. Clean. Nostalgic. Uplifting. Really, really unisex. Stays true to the original fragrance DNA, only a little woodier. What more could you ask for? It's the evolution of the EdT version. It's like they took all the greatest things about the original fragrance and improved its longevity. It's a classic for a reason, and Morillas never disappoints. I'm in love.
I'm also really thankful there's a 200 ml bottle. Great value for money.
ck one but less citrus and more modern
I like it but it smells pretty much the same as ck one, no noticeable difference. A lot more expensive though so I’d say buy the original.
Imma be real, not a huge fan of this scent dna, but I gotta give it to them this shi lasts forever. 12+ hours on my skin
I kind of forgot about it. I still wear the OG but this feels polished and modern by comparison. It's truly an excellent CK One.

I think Calvin Klein misunderstood the assignment of the 'minimalist' fragrance. Minimalist does not mean minimum creative effort, or quality dudes. meh. can't even get myself to write a review. Boringest fragrance ever.
I like it. Citrus, Tea and Musk. Safe and wearable moderni men's scent that leans unisex. Spring and summer casual day scent.

Meh.. Although its a "Freshie" its still supposed to be a " Parfum concentration", yet performance is STILL just Mediocre. Over- priced if ya ask me. Plus the OG smells better than Essence does, so there's THAT part. Again, " Meh"...
The ultimate mass appealing fragrance at this price point. Surpassing the original CK One in every way.
So refreshing and intoxicating!
Pleasant, but the geranium and musk notes are slightly too prominent for my liking. In saying this, upon first wearing, I got a compliment.

Opening: CK One
Dry down: CK Be

Bought this recently, such a beautiful perfume, a great all-rounder. Perfect for summer but I also can't wait to wear it on a cold winter morning - I think the perfume trail will be stunning. It's CK One without the fruitiness, slightly more masculine which I love. Gorgeous bottle too, would make a lovely gift

When I was a kid, my dad would buy a new fragrance every two weeks. Whenever he picked up a new scent, he would pass the old one on to me. I remember when he gave me CK One; I loved it! It was fresh, sparkling, and youthful. I recently purchased a bottle of CK One Essence for myself and sent one to my dad. It was both nostalgic and new for him. I really enjoy it!

Very close to og edt. Less sharp opening, has more tea accords. Very well done, performance is great. CK Parfums are very well performing. If you like original, you will like this. Similar to Banana Republic White Tea 90 also.

A citrusy, aromatic composition. Compared to the classic version, this one is bolder, edgier, and less smooth. The original is a pleasant, soft, summery citrus scent — here, the notes are sharper and more masculine and spicy. The sillage is slightly more pronounced, with similar longevity.
This now comes in a 200ml 6.8oz bottle. So happy . Love this scent.
Without musk, it would be really nice. Having musk in this type of fresh-tea-citrus concept is a no-go for me

This is amazing. I've spent a lot testing every popular frag I could research (to a large extent). And I don't like oud and poop smells. I've learned I like designer bangers, LV, and rarely any niche (They are repulsive enough that I won't wear them.)

This is one of the top 10 I've ever enjoyed I think. Pure pleasant. Non offensive. Boring for those who'd rather smell like poop, or scream "smell me". Good for those who just wanna smell good

I thought it was okay, nice but nothing too special, I kinda felt like it smelled a bit more synthetic than what I'm used to but I usually spend quite a lot more on perfume so maybe that's why. It lasts for a decent amount of time. reminds me of the calvin klein crave that I used to wear in my teenage years.

A refined yet nostalgic take on the original CK One. Fresh crisp citrus dominate in the beginning with a slight spiciness from the black pepper. As it dries down you get a beautiful tea note that's slightly bitter but still very fresh and, in some ways to me at least, very soapy.
Longevity is definitely improved but still doesn't match the longevity of some other freshies like L'Eau D'Issey pour Homme.
Sillage is fortunately pretty average since i hate when a fragrance projects across the room.
Overall a really good freshie, pretty safe blind buy.
For those looking to buy this in a store, Burlington has it for $29.99. This one is a gem. LOVE LOVE LOVE

CK one, but aptly modernized and slightly richer. It would be amazing as a put-it-on and go. Or a professional/work fragrance. Very unisex smell and its a bestseller so of course it smells good. Performs better too. Would recommend to someone who doesn’t like fragrances but wants a nice light, unisex, casual, sorta-natural smell. Odd remark but I see this much more suitable for Europeans than westerners. 7/10
Been looking for this locally and nobody has it. NOBODY. Reviews have been good so I blind bought a bottle. This is an excellent, modern take on CK One. I love it.

Why is there no 200ml bottle for this

smells good though
