So, where to begin with this one? Believe it or not, this is strangely similar to Issey Miyake Pour Homme vintage; the opening is almost an exact duplicate. I get tons of Yuzu, and don't know why it's not listed here on the fragrantica website. But it's here as far as I'm concerned and I'm probably confusing it with the bergamot.

There's a similarity to CK One original, no doubt. But this Essence, is ramped up. Opening starts me with a slight headache. It's powerful. I wouldn't over spray this. Issey Miyake Pour Homme does the same for me too.

As the Yuzu fades somewhat and I can only attribute this as being the bergamot, the geranium and musk come ever so slightly thru, being bolstered by the tea note. However, the acidity of the blood orange is next and this stays throughout. I don't get pepper, incense, none of that. There's a twinge of honey, slightly.

This fragrance is powerful. Many have waited a long time for CK One original to come back in strength and apparently, it has in Essence. As Essence softens, the fragrance gets more beautiful. And the bergamot comes back to the forefront as a lighter, creamier bergamot with a creamier musk. Layered with Cerruti Image, it's even tastier. 🤤

Very well done. Ramped up for sure. Longevity is near 6.5 to 7 hours on me. Sillage is about 3 to 5 feet. Price is about $65 on eBay. Much respect to the freshie king, Alberto Morillas 💪.
During the pandemic I kept finding 200ml of CK One for 20 bucks. So I can splash it on the couple times a year I might wear it, and have enough of it to last a lifetime. Just saying.
The opening of this is glorious!!! Couldn't believe it first time I smelled it!!

Right then, grab a handful of leaves, give yourself a proper rubdown, and there you have it—you’ve just recreated the scent of this fragrance. Simple as that. But here’s the real question…

Two bottles of CK One, or one CK One Essence?

I’ll be honest, I was missing that sharp, citrusy freshness that makes CK One a proper classic. CK One Essence? Well, let’s just say a thorough shower, a bit of body oil, and a decent fast-absorbing moisturiser will give you about the same longevity this one reckons it’s got.

That said, credit where it’s due—it’s a solid fragrance. But if I had to pick? I’d go for two CK One, no doubt. I mean, who doesn’t appreciate a bit of value for money?

➡️DanGreat | Proper mad about fragrances and cracking good stories 📸 @danlobarc.

love love love this one. Wear it daily and it definitely brings me back to my teens and the initial release of the original scent. This one is more potent and longer lasting with a lot comforting musk. I am so grateful to have this scent. My youth reborn in scent.

Still has the classic DNA , a little bit soapy in the opening , if you like perfumes that gives you the feeling of clean for sure you will like it or love it.
On my PH the sillage is 2-3 H at 1.5m and longevity is 10+H not bad for the price that is sold.
What i love is how good is feel the Green Tea and White Tee and how well they blend with the mint and blood orange , i wish they add and the Ginger and Ice from refections to this one to.

Haters don’t want to see this one win, but it does. Blows CK out of the water in terms of longevity but so does my fart. I do see where people are getting the silver mountain water from, maybe that’s why I’m drawn to this one. If you can find this for 30-40$ per 100ml you should for sure cop, blows all these clones out of the water.
It's like an orange forward silver mountain water clone with a clear reminiscense to the original ck one. Actually quite good.

Pleasantly surprised with this release. It's smells around 80-85% similar to the original, but with more citrus and musk. It's like CK one mixed with silver mountain water. Longevity is decent compared to other CK releases as I get around 6-7 hours (last 2 hours skin scent) with solid projection and silage for the first hour. Got a 100ml for 40 dollars and at that price point I think it's worth it. Definitely something that suits spring and summer. My only wish is that the beautiful opening lasted longer, but I do appreciate the musk dry down. If you like the original and want something that will bring back that nostalgia with a little more umph, this is a good pick up.

EDIT: The more I wear this the more I like it. Its just pleasant period.
IMO... Get sillage by armaf more potent more projection more silage more lasting and more juice.. value for your $$$..
It's nice and the dry down is beautiful. It's smells like a mix of Ck one and silver mountain water together. It's cheap lasts 5 hours sits close to skin. It's a solid 8/10
CK T-1000. A warmed up, less astringent, overall more refined and just all around more better version of the original. If you enjoy CK one then there’s no reason not to check this out.

This smells like a 5 dollars woman's perfume that women will buy at the mall because the bottle looks cute. Only it isnt 5 bucks and is from an actual designer brand, somehow in hell. I literally tried this on a date and I was pissed because I thought my date was the one that smelled like shit. Only it was this on my arm. I'd put cow dung on my armpits and fragrance myself with it than this trash. This smells so horrible I am genuinely surprised ANYONE likes it. Like seriously, what were they thinking when they made this?

The worst part? It lasts. So not only does it smell like ass. You have to smell it for a long time too.

I can rant all day about how shit this smells. Seriously. It is THAT bad
Smells way above its price range, this is a banger. I don’t know about performance but for a classy citrus that won’t break the bank it should be on top of everybody’s list.

I used to use CK One, and when it ran out, I tried this one. It was love at first sniff.
This has everything that makes you love CK One, but better. It's long-lasting on my skin and has great projection. I even sometimes smell it when I'm at the office.
Great projection, and it lasts longer on my skin than strong perfumes like Azzaro The Most Wanted. A true perfume and the best clean fragrance out there. I love this perfume.
the opening notes is almost identical to lv imagination until it dries ,it smells like the og ck one. good fragance for the price

It is fine, but when you see blood orange , mint and geranium the mind says to you ultrazest and kryptonint ... unfortunately nothing to do with them.
In the reality , this is like something from Lenor for the bed sheets... nothing bad , just not for my type of skin. On me It's like cat piss cleaned with wet towels. Sorry, this is the only way to describe it!

Thoroughly enjoyable. Better than CK One in every way although it unmistakably shares the same DNA. It’s “CK One now that it’s an adult”.

And it’s strong. I do not understand people experiencing poor performance with this. It’s not what I experience at all. It has true parfum strength and lasts many hours. Six sprays and I still get wafts of it when moving around at the end of a work day.

It’s definitely unisex, but slightly leans masculine for me.

Perfect for the office or any setting when you want to smell great and offend no one.

I paid £28 for 100ml on Amazon, so the price is now coming down from launch. Good. A welcome addition to my collection and one that’ll I reach for often.

Grassy, aromatic, musky.

Opens aromatic with grassy notes, it's fresh-spicy and a little aquatic.
Notes of orange, then something green and musky. The scent is light and airy.
Smells feminine (to my nose.)
Gets a little earthy, has a slightly spicy musk.
Turns coniferous on skin, remains aromatic.
Finally has some faint woodsy notes and something balsamic.

This is unisex, but definitely leans feminine to me. Would suit any age really.
Best for the spring and summer, daytime, but inoffensive and so fine for year round wear.

Ok projection which softens significantly after an hour, lasts as a musky skin scent for quite a while (10hrs on my skin.)

Reminds me of a less masculine "Paco," by Paco Rabanne.

It's not particularly exciting for me; though the performance is better than the original I feel the OG still smells better and so I wouldn't reach for this instead. There're also other CK One flankers that I prefer (Reflections, Summer 2019) so I wouldn't ever gravitate toward this. Above all it's "OK One" more than CK One.
In the opening you’ll get a blast of bergamot which quickly fades into original ck one smell. It’s a stronger fragrance than the original but it’s still only a couple of hours fragrance

Just grab online 50ml package, Ck one is my signature scents in high school, so I hv a lot of memories that the reason I purchase again after 25 years, also bcs I saw it’s Parfum intense, so wanna try how the performance compare with OG 25 years ago.
I tried yesterday, CK1E is lil more intense, bold and slightly lead to male. Projection is moderate not much different with OG, just abit disappointed the longevity, as a (Parfum Intense) concentration I think should be atleast last up to 6 hours, yes is last 6 hours but skin scents, projection last maybe bout 1-2 hours only, so I would say is not worth with price point to buy CK1E, better just go for OG bcs performance is not really big different but the price is big different.
This is totally modernized and enhanced classic green Chypre. Not special but really bring back the old days memory.
The scents remind me of the first ever perfumes I wore.

Dreamy Ultrabright Skin pheromones Grown up formal CK One Interesting Unisex Soapy

Morillas dances when he does freshness. I cant say I ever smelled anything similar.

It is like a musky hand soap in perfume form with a distinct nod to og Ck One.

Love Morillas mind.

If you're a fan of fresh clean unisex scents, this is not it. Yeah it's unisex ig but it's toooo artificial and pungent, with a metallic cologne-y dry down like in every crappy mainstream fragrance. The last note you get is Rubbing Alcohol. The original CK One is not this generic and pungent.
I would suggest CK Women for a more pleasant experience than this one.


Smells like a clean luxury mall restroom.

My only gripe with this fragrance is that when you screw on the sprayer, there is no cap to protect your stuff in your bag from accidentally pressing it and soaking everything. They should include at least one of those plastic fork stoppers. Or am I missing something? The fragrance in the early 90s was way better imo. It isn't bad today, but here in Spain there are similarly good options for half the money. To me this is a 3/10 purchase. The shower gel that was included in the box saved it from 2/10. It makes a relatively good gym fragrance. I was hoping for better.

Update: 100% lame. 1/10 This is just a dreadful and bad cheap fragrance. Think original 5% 4711 and 95% cheap nasty ambroxan. Absolutely not worth even the low price. This is nothing but a money grab. I do not get any of the listed notes, except a faint citrus at the beginning, then some cold nasty ambroxan, that smells like a Chinese store's plastic box section. Yukkk....

It’s the same story as it was with Eros Flame: that stood at 3.67 when I first bought it many years ago and which is now considered a very decent perfume by most. So it is with this one: a deeper, richer, smoother and longer lasting version of CK One which will be revered soon because it is a very nice fragrance indeed.

And it perfectly fits the role I want it to have: it is completely inoffensive in the best sense of the word. Because in most neutral, everyday situations, in a university classroom or a business meeting room, frankly, you don’t want anyone to notice your smell. And if they do, muted clean & playful fresh is a combination unlikely to cause bad impressions.

The regular ck one you can buy today smells like the ck one you bought in the 90’s. Any talk of “this smells like the OG” stuff is silly. 2024 ck one smells like 1994 ck one. The one difference between the two is the diminished performance of the current version.
Ck One Essence is different in good ways. It definitely has Creed Silver Mountain Water vibes. No doubt about that. And the performance is much better than regular ck one.
Basically, if you want a better-performing, slightly modernized ck one that happens to have SMW vibes, go for it. That’s what this is.

I literally googled “Ck One EDP” to see if that was a thing because I do truly still enjoy Ck One but I wanted something with better performance. Ck One Essence came up and I pulled the trigger. It gives you that better performance, with the aforementioned tweaks. Slightly different, but still most definitely ck one, only stronger.

Alberto morillas needs to stop with this dna already, i've seen this exact dna rebranded a million times under different designer brands but it's the same fragrance. Smells cheap and I expect better quality from alberto morillas than this
Silver mountain water dupe no doubt about it. Even the silver bottle points to that.

Honestly just gross. One spray on my wrist lasted all day, despite trying to scrub it off with soap and water!

It's CK one, but even more metallic and soapy and synthetic. They're selling it as unisex, but I can't see a woman wearing this. It's the worst of masculine scents, laden with some sort of metallic, ambroxan-esque... thing. Think cheap male deodorant/body spray. The way mens' locker rooms smell after the men have just left.

There was always something a bit.. sweaty? About CK one, but this flanker honestly just enhances it. In a bad way.

If you like this sort of thing, please, please don't wear it in public.
It's closer to the original formulation (when it was launched) than current CK one.

IT´S GREAT, SIMILAR TO THE ORIGINAL, BUT FAR MORE CITRUSY.

GREAT PERFORMANCE ALSO. VERY GOOD INDEED

For me, this is the only CK ONE release since the original release of CK ONE that actually smells comparable to CK ONE.
Though this has got a stronger cedar than sandal. The original had an amazing sandalwood base.
Strength wise, it's certainly on par with the original CK ONE. I would like to own this one. 🩵 It's really quite true (in the air) to the original.

I'm surprised by this one, initially it may just seem like another flanker, but there is a close link between this and the original formulation. The intensify is definitely there, I got a good six hours of longevity from it, projection too was also very good.

It's still ultra fresh, clean and bright, I've amassed so many CK one flankers over the years, sometimes it's hard to tell them apart, this one however, I keep returning to.

One of Calvin Klein's best releases for a while.
Received a sample of this today. Nice basic citrus smell. Instantly reminded me of the Red Scuderia Ferrari cologne I wore throughout my teens.

This has a strong connection to the original 1994 release. I think this is their best release yet. The scent is so fresh it cleaned my sinuses. 10/10. I recommend it if you're a fan of the original Ck one.

Haven’t really got much to say about it. Received a free sample from tiktok, and it is very fresh. Nicely fresh, citrusy even. I could’ve sworn it had lemon in it. Luckily enough I was looking for a perfume like it. To me though, it smells slightly too masculine for my liking. I’d wear it after the gym though; it’s an easy wear. Though I haven’t smelt the original one ever, if it’s remotely close, I’d probably buy.

The overall perfume opens with a green tea, citrus note. Then it’s got that dry down of musk. Scratchy, almost screechy at first. It’s quite minty too, I could definitely see a man wearing this.

Can’t complain though with a free sample!

In response to RGH01:
This is how a proper review is done. He / she said her personal take on it then added some details leaning towards on the objective side.
This flanker is the closest smelling to the ORIGINAL CK1 from the 90’s. It smells more like CK1 than CK1 and I love it. It really takes me back!
Smells just like the OG but stronger, not much else to say

CK One Essence is a bit of a pointless release, you could argue. It lives off of the previous success of the original, retaining its core values but attempting to mould it into something more modern and refined. I think it achieves that, but in doing so strips away the very character which made CK One so popular.

It’s still got that scratchy, musky, minty citrus cocktail feel about it, but very much smoothed out by an increase of the tea notes. Additionally, a surge in juicy blood orange makes the overall scent a little sweeter and fruitier. I can’t deny it smells very pleasant, but I just don’t see much need for it to exist.

I will admit, I am a huge lover of CK One - no one can deny how iconic it is and despite my usual tastes, I love the original scent profile. Whilst I can appreciate the thought process of this one, you’re better off just sticking with the original if you want this sort of scent.
acutally hate it, it's literally "boots suncream", if u want this smell buy that instead its so much cheaper
Can't believe that this supposedly doesn't have a ginger note in it
It opens fresh cirtusy, but after a while the musk comes out, slightly screechy, reminds me of Erba Pura.

Wearing this now.

My first impressions: It feels as if Morillas dialed up the tea present in the original, removed its floral midsection, and somehow made the whole affair less radiant than its predecessor. As it dries down, there’s a skin-like muskiness accompanied by a gentle but persistent woody base. While it’s not as loud as the OG, it lasts longer on skin, but your personal mileage may vary.

If you enjoyed the original and wouldn’t mind a stripped-down ‘acoustic’ version of it that feels a touch more modern, here’s your chance.

Edit: This wears extremely well in high heat.

Finally got my hands on one from Amazon, with their seal of "Premium Brand Sourced," which means it's an approved reseller (and therefore authentic).

The good: Essence definitely has the original CK One DNA -- all that 90s freshness and coolness is absolutely still there. Longevity is fab -- like 6 hours and still going strong.

The bad (for me): The "modern" note is, I think, a very lemony sort of ozone-y zing that seems to be found in every men's cologne from about 2014 onward (Dior Sauvage is a notable one with it). Even if I like the main idea of a cologne, I don't like that one note, at all (my brother loves it). I keep checking the pages of other stuff I smell this in, and they all show citrus notes, but to me it's not citrusy... I love orange and bergamot notes, and I love a creamier lemon (Replica's Under the Lemon Trees), but this reminds me more of the sourness that's in Demeter Petrichor...like a metal electric lemon! Ozone is what I keep thinking, not citrus.

I also find that single note to be too masculine for me, even though I quite like a lot of other scents that are conventionally called more masculine. This one somehow just doesn't feel like "me," though.

I think it's very possible that my concept of that ingredient as masculine simply goes back to the fact that it's been in SO many guys' colognes for the past 10 years. However, despite any of that, I also just don't like it -- on anyone. I think D&G Light Blue for women has it, too, and Juliette Has A Gun's Juliette...and I'm just not into it. Too sharp and I wrinkle my nose at it.

Good or bad depending on your needs: Sillage is very strong, one light spritz fills the room. While I do wish the original had more sillage, this is a bit too much for me. You will invade people's space with this, for better or worse.

Anyway, CK One Essence can easily be summed up as really strong CK One plus "that popular zingy note." I will stick to CK One.

So far weve learned...
1. It smells just like ckone...but also its "modernized".
2. Its a "more intense version of ckone"....but also its "smoother".
3. If you didnt like the original thats ok, because its "different enough."

But hey, its got "crystal moss" and "Egyptian geranium" right lmfao.

I LOVE THIS! At first spray it smells like the original formulation of CkOne. Little c and k, not the reformulated edition from 2008.

It's fresh and soft with a bright burst of citruses and tea. Very nice and calming. As the fragrance develops it becomes more warm and musky completely becoming an enveloping experience. That warmth from the musk and sandalwood are well blended.

This is the epitome of a "your skin but better fragrance".

On the drydown the sandalwood and upcycled musk exist in perfect harmony making this scent as easy everyday wear. Completely genderless with incredible longevity.

As someone who wore the orignal and loved it deeply..this is a respectful homage to the original formulation only made more modern. Well done.

A bit let down by this, after eagerly anticipating its release for months. It comes off as a warm CK One, it actually has the sensation of smelling warm. So imagine warm tea with musk...it's sort of odd. It's a scent that gets into the back of my throat and lingers.

I don't smell any black pepper or incense at all. It's not bad, per se. It's just not what I was hoping it would smell like. I prefer the original CK One because at least that one is refreshing, even if it is weak.

I will say that CK One Essence is definitely longer-lasting. It does not project too much but I can certainly smell it on my skin 6 hours later. It smells the most like CK One during the first couple minutes upon spraying. After that, the citrus starts to take a backseat as the other notes come through.

What's strange is that I seem to go nose blind if I smell CK One Essence too many times too quickly. I stop being able to smell basically any of it apart from the absolutely slightest hint of it. This doesn't happen to me with any of my other fragrances. Something in this has to be overpowering my olfactory system.
Trolls have officially taken over the comps lol
Incredible this is currently available in my country but around USD 80.00

It smells like CK One and to some extent CK ALL, it doesn't really modernise or improve on the original. The "Parfum Intense" branding has no bearing on the actual scent.

It lasted about 4/5 hours on my skin and then there wasn't a trace of it left. If you have the original or don't enjoy the original, then I wouldn't bother.

Big fan of the original CK One EDT, brings back so many good memories! This release is great, as soon as I sprayed CK One Essence I was pleasantly surprised. Alberto Morillas strikes again, CK One Essence is a smoother, more intense iteration of the OG. Performance is not bad at all, lasts all day on clothing, I get around 6-7 hours on skin. It’s a solid release!
It's available in the UK for anybody looking ... just ordered a bottle yesterday.

OG came out when I was a sophomore in high school.. Can't wait to try this, the current rendition is a shadow of its former self. Waiting on a real review and I'll have no problem paying retail if it's legit.
CANNOT wait to try this!! Looks like the DNA from 1994 is very present. CK14L
GIVE IT UPPPP but lowkey kinda looks nice

3, 2,1 TROLLS???

LET´S GO!!!!! START FU....ING UP THIS SITE

This is another fragrance I've had for a long time, and am almost done with, but have yet to write a review on. I think subconsciously I push CK fragrances towards the more unimportant part of my frag-brain because they've been around for so long, and are usually done so inoffensively, you spray them on without ever thinking about it.

It's kind of crazy how us as our own little community on here are spread out all around the world, yet the fragrances we all wear connect us, almost cosmically. Like, for instance, before even writing this, I had just taken a shower, and afterwards I look around at what has grown into a rather large collection of fragrances that doesn't seem to be shrinking, and of all the ones I could choose, I grab CK One Summer 2019.

I spray it on, all over, because it's a clean, refreshing scent that makes me care a bit less if I have a little heavier scent cloud around me. It's a simple scent, really. I wouldn't doubt the note breakdown for a second. There isn't much to expand upon, but its interesting to see how similar the times some of us seem to choose this fragrance are. After a shower, before bed, on a hot summer day...etc.

There is beauty is simplicity, sometimes, and I think this is a fragrance that exemplifies that. It isn't divisive as a lot of others, can be worn by more people, and there is a pretty good chance someone else is wearing it in the same situations as you.

8/10

I've tried a LOT of the summer editions. This is by far my favourite! It is light, carefree and yummie. The opening is a refreshing splash of tea, the dry down ends up at the beach, on a piece of driftwood, warmed up by the sun.

I use this as an out of the shower scent at home. Mostly for when I’m going to be relaxing or being laid back at home. Fresh and relaxing scent because of the tea note. A very mellow and relaxing tea note mixing with a lot of watery notes and a light aquatic wood in the background.

Smells fresh, a little aquatic, (I can pick up the tea note.) It's nice, performance better than some CKone's, but still moderate. Get it for a decent price and overspray, it's a nice pick-me-up spritz. Works best in the summer (duh,) daytime only. I like it.

I bought it couple years ago and let it sit in my drawer for the winter… i took it out yesterday.
for some reason, it feel more potent now, last longer and projects better, especially if sprayed on the clothes. As for the scent , it’s a good CK1 flanker, fresh and clean, the middle tea note is pretty dominant and adding this sweetness to it which makes it a bit more on the feminine side, but in a good way!
so for boys it could be a summer day/gym sent, girls may wear it anywhere anytime throughout the summer.
And because the CK summer flankers are limited editions, ill put it back in the drawer when summer is over :)

نُت ها و آکورد های این عطر رو بذارید کنار
ما اینجا با یک شروع کاملا میوه ای طرف هستیم با بویی شبیه به انگور سیاه+کمی میوه های شیرین مثل هلو یا حتی سیب؛که کمی حس ادویه ای تر و تازه هم توش احساس میشه،چیزی شبیه به هل بسیار نرم و پودر شده.
بخش آکواتیک عطر،هم زمان با شروع عطر احساس میشه اما زیر سایه روایح میوه ای کم تر به مشام می رسه و بعد از چند دقیقه که هیجان اولیه فروکش می کنه،حس چوبی-دریایی عطر هم بیشتر خودش رو نشون میده و به همراه یک مشک تر و تمیز کار رو جمع می کنه.
قسمت دوست داشتنی این عطر برای من رایحه زیبای چای هست که واقعا توی تابستون حس خنکی و حال خوب کنی داره ؛با این که کلیت رایحه کمی سنتتیک و شبیه به اسپری بدن هست.
ماندگاری بدی نداره اما پخش نسبتا ضعیفی داره.

It smells good… for about 10 seconds. Better than the 2020 one.
Simple and summery. For $10 I can’t complain. Usually spray this one on before bed or workout, doesn’t last but it’s a pleasant, soft, soapy scent.

Bought for $19 to use mainly as an out-of-the-shower scent (bc I mostly get a shower after work)

Honestly, think I might buy a 2nd bottle, bc this stuff smells fantastic!

Water notes are definitely there, as well as a nice tea note, not too overpowering, nor underpowering in my opinion, smells like I just made some iced tea for a summer day. Don't really get a driftwood or wood note but I don't mind, the tea is the reason I bought it after all.

Anyways, for $19, it's 100% worth buying

This one would send CK summer scents in the tea direction.

I'd have gone for more dialed-in driftwood and less water accord.

The tea keeps it from getting synthetic. A niche-quality release in a fun flacon that can be slipped into any bag or glove box for quick refreshment.
Yes!!! After a year or more on the shelf…it’s turned into an excellent fesh, sweet, orange/tea frag. Extremely pleasant.

This is my favorite summer fragrance from CK. I smile everytime I put it on! Its pleasant and clean smelling, very much office safe. Its different from most citrus summer frags and I have a couple backup bottles on standby. Grab it while you still can!

I blind bought this months ago because I love the original CK One, like many of us do, and it sat in my collection unbothered because it is very light and could not smell anything after spraying in my wrist. Finally I decided to solve it by overspraying like I don't usually do ( I usually only use 2-3 spritz of fragance in my wrist and hairline and that's it) and I found using 6-8 sprays is the solution. I am left swimming in a full morning of fresh, green, sunny, aquatic, green leaves bliss. I really love this scent so much, I will surely buy a couple of back up bottles. I don't think I can smell the driftwood, but as other commenter remarked, that is a concept and not a note per se. It makes me so happy it makes me think of travels, sea, clear sky and wind in your face; truly almost perfection to me. Try it if you enjoy cool, relaxing, fresh fragances; I think this is true to the concept and is 100% unisex.
Smells like straight women’s perfume and even at that it’s still very basic and average. Something your mom probably already owns 👎🏾

This is a really good frag for the Spring/Summer! It has clean bright aquatic with a hint of tea and creamy woods. I would use this as a casual day time fragrance. So far this is one of my favorites and for the price I would buy a back up bottle.

The woodiness hits me at the top and it infuses this watery aquatic with creaminess. Think of the soft, matte, smoothness of driftwood. Driftwood is a conceptual note in perfumery, anyway. The combination of "matcha tea" and "driftwood" concept makes a pleasant and almost vanillic splash. I could see this on bright warm days but not sweltering ones. It also has a spa vibe. Quality candle burning - not too cheap, not too luxurious - not cloying - in a tranquil protected space. Your ZEN garden, your private sahn with a water feature. This is far from a fruity, floral, or citrus freshie. If you want that, this could be your base for a fun soliflore freshie.

CK One Summer 2019 was one I skipped on for several years. Then I found my love of unisex fragrances through getting CK Everyone. I stewed on getting CK One Summer 2019 due to the similarities and then said, what the Hell? I got one and it is a great purchase. CK One Summer 2019 is the "This is brillant, but I love this" meme of fragrance. It is basically the prototype to CK Everyone and honestly is a better smelling fragrance than CK Everyone. CK One Summer 2019 is basically two CK Everyone sprays to 1 Ed Hardy Love & Luck (for men) sprays. That said it also smells like a number of other fragrances (as I already mentioned.)

CK One Summer 2019 opens with a citrus and watery note opening. I can't distinctly tell you what citrus it is, but I do think it is orangy as others have. The mid gives the CK Everyone matcha tea accord and it is distinctly similar to CK Everyone's. The base is where IMHO, we see the most difference to CK Everyone. I really just get the driftwood woodsy note. Now I think this is due to the fact that the musk and amber is a common skin scent drydown while driftwood is not.

CK One Summer 2019 is not unique but I do enjoy it because I love the type of scent that it is. A citrus aquatic. As mentioned before CK Everyone is nearly a carbon copy of it, but swapping driftwood with cedar. Ed Hardy Love & Luck is another scent with another similar scent profile to my nose. Calvin Klein even double downed with this idea in 2019 with the similar smelling Eternity for Men Summer release (which to my nose smelt like a more sea salty take on Love & Luck.) Zara also has a pair of releases (perhaps more but that is debated since at most it is note swaps) with similar smells. Blue Hole (their Dior Homme Cologne clone), Vibrant Leather Cologne, Vibrant Leather Summer and Vibrant Leather Eclat de Bergamot (their Vibrant Leather Cologne with a mandarin orange open.) That said, as mentioned earlier, I do love CK One Summer 2019.

CK One Summer 2019 doesn't perform that great, but it is common with CK One, let alone Calvin Klein fragrances period. CK One Summer 2019 lasts about four hours tops. I find it is a fragrance that projects OK. That said, it means it can work in work and causal settings during summer and even warmer spring days. CK One Summer 2019 is a slightly masuculine leaning unisex fragrance. I do however think that CK Everyone is a bit more usable in Spring and even Fall.

CK One Summer 2019 I find as a 7.8 out of 10 and my favorite of the CK One flankers I've smelt. I do have to get a back-up bottle of it, similar to 2020. I fully enjoy it and want it to last. Even with my amount of fragrances, I see myself wearing this easy going dumb reach a lot in summer and re-spraying it several times throughout the day.

8/7/22 update: my opinion hasn't changed ... this 2019 flanker smells sweet, citrusy, and with just a bit of muskiness ... it smells very light and pleasant, and it's a perfect scent for the hot weather/summer time... you can smell the ck one dna, but you also get hint of other popular aquatic scents... the performance on this scent is incredibly weak in both terms of how strong it projects and how long it lasts ... you have to really be incredibly liberal on the sprays to get much performance out of this scent ... i took a shot at this fragrance because i've heard good things... for $20, it's a great value and smells nice, but the performance? ... yikes, it's probably the worst performing fragrance i own... would i recommend this cologne? still yes, because it smells really nice and people really seem to like the scent, on 4 separate occasions i've been asked what i'm wearing and how good it smells ... would i buy it after i've finished the bottle? sadly no, because the projection is just so poor it's really starting to bother me

Smells incredible this WINTER. I can’t help but think of Christmas Oranges. Maybe because I winter in Miami? But something about this scent warms me up in the northeastern cold. I feel like I just took that 7am shower after the gym. It’s very unisex.

on parfumo.net there is completely different notes breakdown for this fragrance

Top Notes: Quince, Tangerine, Italian bergamot, Water lily
Heart Notes: Aquatic notes, Juniper berry, Coriander, Matcha tea
Base Notes: Driftwood, Musk, Amber
I absolutely love aquatic fragrances and this is absolutely stunning.
A pleasant scent for summer, clean and fresh, but nothing mesmerizing.

On me this summer edition is more green/vetiver than aquatic.
It starts very fizzy, like a carbonated lemon water but it lasts just seconds, and then somehow the driftwood (although to me it’s vetiver) appears and stays there unmovable.
I get some light green notes and some sort of cotton/sweet note way back in the background.

For once, it doesn’t smell like the original. And that’s a plus, otherwise why bother.
I actually find this flanker more contemporary and wearable.

But is it original? Is it something you can’t live without? Something truly remarkable?
Well, no.
Like most Ck fragrances, you can’t go wrong, they are safe, easy to wear but not memorable.

This was a pleasant surprise, reminded me of Erba Pura but a super light, watery cologne version.
Like Erba Pura, it's woody yet floral, which is a surprise from a CK One summer that's typically fruity citrusy.
Does well in the heat even if you have to overspray. I really enjoy this and I think it's worth a full bottle in your collection.
Very good frag i live in Los Angeles so i think i can use this year around but i wont, now long-lasting on my skin is good like 6-8 hours so in the en it's a good buy.

Pretty much OK summer juice. I didn't recognise any tea. It smells like fresh sun cream or bodylotion - something familiar there is.

Price is good 20€/100ml, but for me this is too feminive and a little bit boring. Also it reminds me something that my mother-in-law wears all the time.

I would say this is better than CK One Summer 2020 but much worse than Summer 2016.

7/10

Eternity Summer 2019 (women's) has been my summer scent and while last year's version was similar the longevity just wasn't there. I also didn't see a 2021 release when I saw this in Kohls (at an awesome price) I had to pick it up. I have read previous reviews so this was always in the back of my mind as a possible purchase but the price sealed the deal. So essentially this was a blind buy for me and one I am very happy with!

I was afraid that this would be too masculine for me but I really enjoy it. It is a nice refreshing scent! I pick up a lime scent (well to me it smells like lime) but perhaps that is the aquatic note that I am picking up. I highly recommend it if you are looking for a refreshing non-offensive scent!

A pleasant enough summer scent. Nothing mind blowing. But really nothing to not like either.
You will need to respray every few hours if you plan on wearing this all day, but that shouldn't be surprising.
I personally prefer the 2020 edition, but I am happy to have this one.
A very pleasant more masculine scent this is my favourite out of the CK summer line.. It's smells amazing... And very good value for money as well....

This is a very inoffensive summer banger. I would say that it does lean more masculine.

It does smell a little like a citrus iced tea during the drydown.

Longevity and sillage are garbage. If you can find this for 20 bucks, go for it. Never, under any circumstances, pay full retail for a CK One frag.

I really dont know what "watery notes" are? I get the bright opening, but dont find it THAT citrus. I quickly transforms to a much sweeter smell, mabey its tonka? I think is a pleasant smell and worthy of a blind buy. I doesnt last long, but again, not many CK's does

The opening is fresh citrus, the dry-down is a sweet tea-aquatic combo. The dry-down does not have any depth, it does not project, and is not especially great. It's definitely masculine, but probably for younger guys.

A pleasant tea like fresh citrus & marine frag. Moderate longevity and silage. Nothing much wrong here. The dry down is the best bit - really nice.
Great for the summer swimming pool.
I like this a lot.

I really like this fragrance. You can definitely smell the CK One dna in it. For some reason, this is a beast on my skin. I got crazy projection and longevity, way more than I expected from a CK fragrance.

I really like this. The opening reminds me a lot of Mandarina Duck in New York for Him. The CK is a little less sweet and has a more aquatic vibe and is a little less serious and I actually prefer it. To me, it's quite linear but that's not such a bad thing if you like the fresh sweet combination it offers. I get 1-2 hours of projection which I'm fine with. I probably wouldn't be if I bought it retail but for the current price of 13-15 euros, it's a great deal. I don't smell anything potentially annoying or risky in this fragrance so For anything under 20 euros/dollars, this is an easy blind buy.

I really dislike that they did a strange cartoon design here. Did they get inspired by JPG Superman?

Some things are best kept traditional. CK Summer always had gorgeous bottles every year.

(The scent is also not as the classic ones.)

The best in Summer Collection, it smells like green tea, so take this in mind. What it did to me - this is the best sport fragrance if you want to go to the gym and still stay fresh and not stinking like you have never taken a shower. It is the best beach scent someone can imagine because we are sick of all coconut sunscreens. Take it until it is on the market.

The scent - absolutely masculine, no doubts about it, to be unisex is very controversial. No comparisons with Everyone or Green Tea, nothing to do with it because it has no citruses, fortunate for me. No apples or fruity notes, no musc, it is all about green tea and wood.

Overall: I have 5 bottles unpacked because I know it is limited edition and I will keep it so close. I love it. Everyone makes compliments and everyone loves it BUT on the skin, not the bottle. Try it, that's it

This is quite lovely.

I am not a big fan of CK One to start, but this piqued my interest thanks to the bottle design. It’s such a departure from the rest in this line, and I appreciate that. I also love the simple orange lettering at the bottom of the summer logo. I decided to give this a shot based on positive reviews, the cheap price, and my interest in getting into summery scents—a category I tend to shy away from.

The tea in here is what really gives it its character. It serves as a teeter totter for the marine and wood notes. As it first developed on my skin, it kept tilting up and down. It gave me bold floral with this weird hint of something almost bodily. Probably just my underdeveloped nose In this genre. But ultimately, this is “basic,” which is what these fragrances are all about. No surprises there.

Life of the fragrance is exactly what you’d expect from a cheap freshie. It’s there for a few moments, but it quickly settles and begins to fade. This is something you will want to keep on/near you and reapply because why not? Unless you’re a collector, the quick disappearance of this fragrance from its bottle should not keep you from reaching for it over and over again.

I don't understand about the dislikes.
This is my first ck one summer, I remember when I first sprayed it, it disappeared really quickly.
But now it actually last pretty long, I think it might because I've never smelled something like this before.
I love the base notes, a very light sweet tea scent.
This is identical or very close to ck2 for me. pass!

A nice price, with an importart rebate in my city so I bought it yesterday "but" for me sounds as young and fresh classic summer fragance ... Sparkling citrus, volatile for the aquatics notes, but, oddly enough, the detail Calvin Klein: it takes shape and becomes creamy until it parks and calms down a bit ...In the same vein of Paco Energy ... nothing original but cozy for me.

Woody, watery and tea. Distinct notes. Clean fresh and leans towards the masculine.
Love it
Smells sophisticated and classy.
Moderate silage and above moderate longevity.
A bargain for the price.
The only downside is the logo on the bottle...eeeww..

Perfect not just for summer. All year all days all genders.

CK collection i genius.
It smells expensive and real sexy. It does smell more masculine though but it's doable for a women since it has a refreshing citrus vibe.

I am female and do own a few of these. My favorites are ck summer 06 & 2013.

I just bought summer 2019 and was disappointed. Smells too woodsy and masculine so more appealing to men.

I smell the water notes for a sec, but driftwood will take over and in 30 minutes, that's all I smell. I do not notice tea at all. This at least lasts about 6-7 hours. But I just didn't like it.

:/ meh!

I tested this beautiful perfume for the first time this summer, and wow - it was love at first sniff!!

I bought it online and got it yesterday, and I can't stop smelling my skin. First I smell lots of citrus, very much citrus, and I also smell the CK-dna in the background. There is some notes I think is the watery-note.

This beauty is very fresh and clean, and it fits perfect for everybody of all ages, it's office-safe, it will be very nice for use in summertime, but I will use it now for full winter, much snow and minus 10 degrees.


I give it 10 / 10

This fragrance is one of the most pleasant and unique summer fragrances I have smelled. For me, many fragrances advertised as summer editions are very similar to on another and smell nice but so incredibly boring.
However this edition, while it has that classic summer scent, adds citrus and a hint of sweet. I absolutely adore the scent.
Unfortunately the major downside of this fragrance is that it lasts less than an hour. Possibly even less than half an hour. This is so disappointing to me because if the longevity were greater, I think it would be far more popular and unique.

I can't wait for the annual CK One Summer fragrance, and I enjoyed having this one over the (short) British Summer. It worked better during the hotter days, it conjured up images of a shack by the sea. I got bright citrus notes, soft wood, and a lovely zingy tea note at the end. As the bottle would suggest, this is a fun fragrance, casual and carefree, less serious then last year's more sober release. Sadly, it doesn't last very well on skin or clothes.

Longevity apart, I loved it. I've stashed a few bottles away for future use.

This is the first CK One summer edition I actually like. All the previous ones have been total scrubbers and much too masculine for my tastes. This one is nice and super citrusy and it has a definite seabreezy note. Inoffensive and suitable for office.

The sea is clean, slightly frothed. Distantly I hear cries of gulls and feel soft sand underfoot. The water is rather cold, and the sea wind blows hair and clothing, touches face.Silence. Only sometimes and I hear lapping, or the fish splashing or another small sea creature. This is how this summer scene of CK smells for me. The aroma is not a beachy type of sunbathing and exotic oil. It consists largely of mixed citrus fruits with the addition of crystalline water, but without saltiness. And so it lasts until the end, revealing slowly a light male note, which makes it a total unisex. Quiet, safe, very sea and fresh. I do not feel tea at all. A successful version of the classic, although the parameters aren´t good.

This is a very nice fragrance.. on skin I get about 5 hours.. on the clothes its going on 7 hours and is still projecting nicely..
Oh yeah go heavy on the trigger

Sniffed this at a Duty Free today. I didn't spend a lot of time with it, but the initial spray was bright and brought a smile to my face. Can't speak for the longevity, but the opening was clean with indiscernible notes, just a gauzy, fruity, summery aroma. Didn't smell any citrus or ISO-e. Didn't strike me as particularly aquatic. A safe Summer frag. It was listed around $40 and the bottle was clear, not white.

I've been trying a tester of this. The opening smells very sweet and aquatic, then it dries down to a sweet tea smell. Sometimes it even reminds me of bubble gum. Great casual, fun, dumb reach scent for the summer.

Unfortunately longevity is quite poor, so don't spend your shiny penny on it but if you're just looking for something cheap to good off with in the summer this is great and I think that’s the point of this whole line.

The good thing about it is that once its gone, its gone, it doesn’t leave any musky smells that give you a headache.
Very synthetic, and in my opinion therefore unpleasant. No character and creativity. Go for Ck2 instead. Its nice.

So, I'm a big fan of CK frags in general, as they always seem to work well with my body chemistry. I've been getting into unisex freshies lately and have a soft spot for aquatics, so when I saw a bottle for testing while out shopping it seemed like a natural choice, especially when I saw matcha tea and driftwood notes.

Also, due to luck and decent moisturizing habits, my skin doesn't eat perfume. I can expect moderate longevity out of most anything that people on here vote poor to weak, including notoriously weak ones like Jo Malones.

4 hefty sprays of this stuff completely vanished less than three hours after spraying. As badly as I wanted to, I couldn't find driftwood nor matcha nor tea of any kind. All I got was a cheap aquatic reminiscent of cleaning spray or at best an air freshener. I really wanted to like this, so it was a huge disappointment. Don't waste your money.

The worst CK Summer yet, it is so weak, smells almost nothing! Since 2017 the summer editions have been really bad and this year is the worst. You might as well spray yourself with a bottle of water, there is almost no difference. Don't spend money on this!
The opening is nice, but the drydown is a little too sweet for my taste in a unisex perfume. Not the best summer edition of CK One (my favourites are 2014 and 2015). It's okay though.

This doesnt even smell like ck summer?

The old ck summer was known for a youthful and delicious summer fruit scent

This smells like a lightly scented cleaning detergent or window wipes

Miss

It starts with the sweet, intense quince and mandarin smell then tea and watery notes. The woody base note like driftwood and musk won't be noticeable until about 2~3 hours. Somewhat reminds me of ice fruit tea.

My first Calvin Klein fragrance and not a bad experience. A young, unisex and refreshing one perfect for summer. (Although I believe that as the fragrance is very fruity, it might not be suitable to men above 30+ and/or with masculine characteristics).

By the way, the package design is unique and attractive to me. It even attaches pop art style stickers to let you splash your creativity on the bottle. Like what some people would do to their suitcase or laptop.

Classic summer ck edt plus tea notes.
Orrible performance.
It's a good scent, but it smells like it's pretty much just for women. Isn't it supposed to be unisex?

What an amazing scent this time around. It’s weird but I get citruses, grapefruit to be exact, but it’s nowhere to be found in the pyramid. I picked this up for 75$ after tax. I collect these summer frags. I find these summer CK Ones are hit and miss for a lot of people. I really liked the 2016 version, but others hated it. On my skin I get 5 to 6 hours, and if on my clothes it lasts for a couple of days. You could do a lot worse than this one. Fresh, Fresh, Fresh.

POW! it's SUMMER!!!

this one is different from recent year's. I's OK :D

Admittedly, I love CK One Summer editions, some more than others, but I can’t think of a single one I’ve disliked. While 2019 is not my favorite, it is a solid edition and a solid addition to my collection. Tea notes usually aren’t my favorite, but here, the fizzy fresh tea note with the driftwood note makes for a lovely beachy wood scent, and I adore wood. I like it in my fragrance; I like it in my wine; I like it on my dash and steering wheel; I like it in my...ahem, well, you get the point. In my opinion, you can’t go wrong with this one for the summer. And the stickers to add to the bottle if you’re so inclined are a cute, nostalgic touch.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2011 Calvin Klein
review_content: copy Ralph Big Pony 3

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2011 Calvin Klein
review_content:
My father brought this to me when I was in Egypt, and he was coming from a connection flight in Qatar. I used this up in two mouths, or three. Not a baby bottle, no, the 3.4. This was my signature scent and this baby worked.

It's so hard to find it now, though. ;c

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2011 Calvin Klein
review_content: I have the decant for sale! PM me if interested!

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2011 Calvin Klein
review_content: I absolutely love this. So green and fresh! Amazing longevity and sillage, the best version of eternity for sure. Can also be picked up quite cheap for 100ml.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2011 Calvin Klein
review_content: Not a massive fan kinda has a cucumberish freshness but smells a little bit off to me

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2011 Calvin Klein
review_content: Hyper fresh, fruity summer scent. Easily the lightest and sweetest scent that I own but also one that gets a lot of attention when I wear it. Longevity is what you would expect from a very light summer scent and re application is recommended a few hours in, but when you smell this good, its worth it :)

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2011 Calvin Klein
review_content: I bought it recently... and i love it. I give to someone special for me

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2011 Calvin Klein
review_content:
Summer again, here you go Eternity Summer, I can see they got slight improvement on the longevity, 3-4 hours on me, better projection and less sharp citrus.

The first note is mild sour citrus that smell like a combination of lime, lemon and orange, not bad, minutes later, turn to a great green scent, something like a cooling lemon glass drinks feel, remind me a lot of CK Truth Men, green grass cutting kind of scent, except this one with little cooling effect - very good and I like it. An hour later, last note appear and it is amber with patchouli mild scent and before it completely faded, a mild windy cedar scent hit me, very nice instead!

Overall, it is much better quality Summer Eternity released so far, better projection and smell very green aromatic to me - I really like it alot, if you like green notes e.g. CK Truth Men, Escape and Lanvin L'homme Sport, this is the one for you. 7/10 from me. No men can get wrong with this this year's super versatile annual eternity affair!

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2011 Calvin Klein
review_content: Bought this for my man in the store today: a beautiful fresh light male scent for hot summer days comprising citrus fruit blended to perfection with mint and .. watermelon? He didnt get the lily-of-the valley which is usually an ingredient in female perfumes or the aniseed but he said he smelled "minty-fresh watermelon dipped in freshly cut lemons" on the opening notes. The overall effect was pleasantly tangy, watery and floating. The staying power was not that great, he needed to keep spraying, although after 2-3 hours I could still smell an attractive citrussy/melony scent which was still slightly tangy and mellow rather than sour. Highly recommended, delicious scent!

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2011 Calvin Klein
review_content:
Bought this for £28.80 at debanhamns. Been looking for a summer fragrance; it was a toss up between this and Dior Homme Sport.

Both very similar; bought this as it was almost half the price of Dior, staying power is very similar; Ive had a shower and a scrub and I can still smell both on my wrists and its a bloody hot day.

I swear to god though I can smell water melon in this; or maybe thats just my amateurish nose.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2011 Calvin Klein
review_content: Nice and clean sweet fruity fresh fragrance that is not zesty nor tangy sour. Juicy orange, watermelon, and mint are great together and quite mouth watering. It is pretty linear and is created to please everyone. It's not woody either, so it should have been Aromatic Fruity instead. Anyway, it is another fragrance that is made for a calm and relaxing hot summer day.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2011 Calvin Klein
review_content: Eternity for men Summer 2011 smells great. Smells a little bit like Eternity Aqua, but is very good anyway.

product_name: Eternity for Men Summer 2011 Calvin Klein
review_content:
I have not smelled this since it isn't for sale yet, but I just wanted to point out it has the same citrus-mint-anise combo that Curve Wave For Men has.

The curve Wave is a nice scent, but usually takes the backburner to my Pino Silvestre Blue or D&G light blue. will report back when i try this one out.

if magenta was a scent; strangely addictive. I got a sample of this as a gift from someone who worked at ulta. on first whiff, I got some strong old lady vibes, if you've ever step foot in a nursing home you know what i'm talking about. it was also...sour? like pickily. but after a moment I sniffed it again and I couldn't stop.
I got hints of pomegranate (which I thought was cranberry at first lol) along with that addicting rich woody smell...omg. it’s classy, great for a night out. I can't get enough, and I’ll probably end up buying the bottle.
Milf in the forest

I remember this as the first perfume I really tested as a teen 20 years ago. I really fell in love with the fragrance. But I was so sensitive so I couldn't wear it or any other perfumes, but that first memory just stuck with me all this time. Now, in recent years, I can finally wear different perfumes and my mind went straight to this. I tried some samples, and it just isn't the same anymore which is so disappointing. I remember smelling it sometime about 10 years ago and thought, this is different but still good. Not quite like how I remember and other ladies also commented on the change. Now its really changed. I'm still searching for a fragrance that made an impression on me like this did in the 2000s.

I had this perfume in 2010. I was looking into buying it again, but I saw people saying that they had changed the formula. So I tested it at the mall and, yeah, it's really disappointing. If you were a girl who played with Barbie dolls in the 90s, you probably remember the Barbie that came with the little bottle of perfume. This smells exactly like that little Barbie perfume.
Not one, not two, but THREE legendary perfumers!!!! I've only recently gone back to this scent, now that it's not smelled everywhere anymore. I can't believe it's been 20 years!

I love Euphoria. I still have quite a bit of juice in my old original bottle which I got sometime between 2009 and 2011 (got lost for a while after a move) but it has some white chalky looking stuff inside now, so I'm not sure its safe to use. I'm scared to buy another because I know its been reformulated and I'll be crushed if they destroyed it.
The juicy pomegranate, dark violet, mahogany wood, and whipped cream notes elevate this so hard. The vibe is very spicy sweet. Its a moody, elegant perfume for a dreamy, classy hottie.

Euphoria for Women is a typical, early aughts fragrance. Sweet, perfumey, vintage doll-head, powdery, synthetic. It reminds me of one of the Ralph Lauren Romance flankers, the one in the mirrored bottle, but not as crisp.

I recently bought a decant and have it on the back of my hand currently. The plasticky doll head note is really prominent. As someone who loves spicy ambers and sweet ouds, I find Euphoria to be the complete opposite of my preferred fragrance families.

Not to my tastes but can imagine how older millennials would find the composition nostalgic.

parfümlere karşı ilgim ilk artmaya başladığı zaman çok popüler ve bilindik olduğu için illaki severim diye düşünerek almıştım. 13 yaşındaki birisi için pek doğru bir karar olmamış çünkü şu an 18 olmama rağmen hala sıkabilecek olgunlukta olmadığımı düşünüyorum. bu benim kendime yakıştırmamamla da alakalı olabilir ama özellikle ilk sıkıldığında aşırı boğucu ve maskülen bir koku sanki 35 yaşındaymışım gibi hissettiriyor. ayrıca zamanında çok popülerleşmiş ve aşırı yaygın küçükken tanıdığım yetişkinlerin hepsi böyle kokuyordu sanki bu da beni birazcık throw offladı bu parfüm hakkında :( biraz daha feminen tarafa kaysa bile yoğun nar ve odunsu notalar sayesinde erkekler de kullanabilir diye düşünüyorum sevebilmek için burnunuzun alışması gerekiyor.

I thought I would like this because of the pomegranate (I love fresh berry notes) and the fresh green notes (I love the smell of grass) but it smells like a perfume heavy on white florals after a few minutes , so maybe it's the combination of the mentioned floral notes with the whipped cream. And maybe the persimmon along with the whipped cream is putting emphasis on the sweetness of the florals instead of other aspects of the floral notes. I don't know but i didn't appreciate it I thought it would be more fresh but it's too heavy and cloying and sweet to my nose.
Been smelling this for past twenty year just never knew what it was. It’s fine. Would prefer it to be woodier. Sillage is good. Safe blind buy.

Sweet and faint. I can't smell it after an hour, or even sooner.
Not an interesting scent.

Not sure how I feel
About it personally i find it a little masculine for me it’s weird it reminds me of same style of mugler alien it does last a long time and it does leave a trail..I will say like a lot of CK perfumes this one gets compliment mostly from other women other people seem to love it but I’m not obsessed
I find it weak but others say they can smell it. I want to really experience it. The first few seconds nice then it gone to me.

This is by far one of my favorite perfumes. Despite the fact I usually go for skin scents or dewy floral scents this one is so special. It definitely smells different on different people and to different people. When I wear it people tell me I smell “spicy”. I feel like it smells like a sweet resinous amber scent. If you are gonna test it out, try it on your skin and don’t just spray it on a testing strip it will smell so different. (And don’t just judge the first sniff let it sit a minute or two). I don’t get the top notes that much, I think they fade quickly and I don’t mind at all because the base is so beautiful. I definitely get the whipped cream after it’s been sitting for a while. It seems like every perfume interprets that “amber” note differently, but this is always what I imagine and Ambery perfume should smell like. Lasts forever especially on clothes. Love it so much.
Beast mode and leaves a beautiful scent trail. A PERFECT date night scent! I can't remember wearing this and not being noticed. So so beautiful

A lovely scent that lasts a decent amount of time and yet it's so disgustingly overpriced for what you actually get. Overpriced and overhyped, simply because of the calvin klein brand. Buy a cheaper dupe if you can because the scent is pretty good but for the love of god do not fork over so much cash for a brand.

I don't get the hype.
I got this gifted soooo many times that I feel euphoria in my dreams.
This review will be simple.
Smells like any other classy women You saw in Your childhood.
Nothing special, nothing too much.
Just classy.
(Really not suitable for younger women :D)
Edit: OH, forgot to say.
I can't seem to feel that pomegranate at alll, which is really sad, because I ADORE pomegranates smell and taste.

upon first spray it's floral and fresh, but as soon as it starts marinating with your skin (within a minute, if not less) it becomes nauseatingly sweet, peppery and powdery. The floral notes stay, but do not dominate. Slightly soapy. It's a very strong scent, overwhelming and intoxicating, made me feel a little ill. I would say the vibes are feminine and vintage. although I can see how someone would see it as a youthful scent if they were an adult in the early 00s (or is into Y2K fashion).

I usually like scents that fit this description, but not this time.

The man in the shop said, unprompted, that it was quite nice and that he hasn't smelled it before.

I'm fighting the urge to wash it off, as I wanna see how it develops. I will edit if I have anything else to add.

overall I would say it's a good scent, but definitely not my thing.

La primera vez que lo olí fue como una cachetada con mano abierta, demasiado especiado y pesado para mí, me recuerda muchísimo a Opium de Yves Saint Laurent, solo que este no me deja tan aturdida como el de YSL 😵💫
smells like a typical dillard's perfume section. it's good, just a bit too loud and heavy for me

I missed Euphoria when it was launched, and only recently bought an old used bottle online, with the wrap around metal, as pictured above. I wasn't quite sure what to expect, but Euphoria does smell a lot like the notes listed here on Fragrantica. In style it reminds me of both Angel and La Nuit Tresor, but less gourmand and more masculine leaning, which I appreciate. The start is sour red berries rather than herbaceous green on me, reflecting the Persimmon and Pomegranate. This opening is quite challenging, almost like drinking unfinished wine. I gave it another spray and go, and let the scent evolve into the more complex layer of exotic flowers, and then the resinous woods in the base. These two later phases are more intertwined than the initial tart blast. More put together. In the drydown is where Euphoria smells the most like Angel, or La Nuit Tresor, but less playful and more astringent. I love this about it, as I have been struggling with Angel and La Nuit Tresor lately, thinking my nose or body chemistry has changed with age. Euphoria gets it right. At the very end a spicy cedarwood oil quality appears, no violet or cream, and then all layers seem compressed and final. I almost think of Féminité du bois at this point. But just almost.
A sweet woody floral done well, this is a good one and performs well
i feel like my rich auntie ngl
Intoxicating and sexy. A real compliment getter. Was a signature scent for me before I had a large collection. The best one in the line.

yuck.
after seeing the notes i was excited to try this out, but i barely put the tester up to my nose before immediately putting it back. couldn't pick up any of the other notes except the mahogany and amber.
could work on some people maybe, but for me its way too masculine and intense.

I DO NOT CONSENT TO THIS BEING POSTED ELSEWHERE. A masterpiece. Will die on the hill of this one. The original vampire perfume, clad in furs and silk, so unbelievably “unlike” CK but I don’t mind. My mother wore this my whole childhood (other gen Z would relate) it’s exactly what I think femininity should be. Liberated, cozy, opinionated, compassionate, poetic, exotic. My mother is Persian- Jewish and has the most regal features, I feel like this fits women with Persian features or somewhat dark skin and a bird nose even better because it is EXACTLY the scent of this sort of woman, who didn’t get a nose job and isn’t a basic bitch who’s finding a perfume to wear to her next dick appointment, this is a woman who would never speak in this^ language, sophisticated and regal and has some harsh edges because she’s a woman, not a sex doll.

Totally forgot to add- my bottle is over 5 years old. I don’t know what they did to new ones. They do seem watered down and less dark..

Probably my favourite perfume ever.
It's sweet, strong, and DEEP.
An evening perfume.
Beautiful, sexy, a little vampy. A masterpiece.

I'm scared to try new batches in case they buggered it up like they have been doing to so many classics lately.

My 10+ year old bottle though? Magic. Still blows the damn doors off.
i think my nose is broken cause all i could smell was tobacco and a hint of a musky floral note

I’m 20 years late to discovering this perfume but it’s exactly what I was looking for. I wanted a warm, deep, floral, woody, amber and found it with Euphoria EDP. This is powerfully feminine with an alluring quality. The opening starts with a burst of rich & sweet florals accompanied by a deep amber. Unfortunately that beautiful opening quickly fades and leaves a lighter version of itself. Longevity is poor, 2 hours or less with 3-4 sprays. Spraying too much can be cloying so it’s better to touch up instead. 10/10 for the fragrance composition and 2/10 for performance. I would wear this all seasons and all times of day. A new top favorite!
A pleasant sweet & woody scent. Not overpowering or overwhelming, nicely balanced. Projection is moderate and sillage is intimate on my skin.
Confident, sexy, mysterious, intriguing, mature, put together, flirty, grounded. This feels so me. The perfect combination of sexy and cute. Mature and playful.
Sexy. Beautiful. Alluring. Confident. Intriguing. Uplifting. She’s a keeper.

I bought a rollerball tester of this fragrance at Marshalls and didn't like it. The batch code dated to 2024. Then on a whim, I decided to bid on a bottle and lotion set on shopgoodwill.com. I won the auction and just got a 10 year old bottle and what a difference. This went from a strong dislike to a perfume I actualy like. Find an older batch if you can. However, this perfume still isn’t for me. Selling the lot if anyone is interested in the US. Please DM me.
quite powerfull old school stuff
Smells like nothing 🤷🏼♀️ Either im anosmic or i got a fake but i smell practically nothing..

i got it as a gift and first i was like what the fuck it smells so manly. ladies, if you like smelling floral and sweet pleaseee layer it with a perfume like yum boujee marshmallow. it actually smells so good so i dont mind it anymore. is a good work scent and lasts long.
i understand the hate tho because it's pretty out dated scent profile and once i finish prob wont repurchase. follow my advice if you wanna get through the bottle and as you get through it will grow on you. idk why men like it?
Smells deep, smooth, and a little dreamy. Feels rich and confident — great for evenings when you want to feel polished.

How is patchouli not listed? It is the main note here in my opinion, or are other notes combined creating that sensation? Have I perhaps got a fake bottle? The liquid in mine is much lighter than the pictures here on the website. Still… nice enough.The drydown is the best bit.

wore this (in combination with molecule 01) to a dinner and was complimented as soon as i sat down at the table. "its so good!!" "it smells like my grandma in the best way. she is really cool"

i think i've already written a review for this one lol, but i think its true! it creates the visual of an older, super cool lady in the first few hours, then after a while it mellows down to a musky, deep sweetness i can’t describe. smelling it on clothes the day after is AMAZING

When i first tried this I immediately thought "ugh, shaving foam" and almost wrote it off. But after spending a month or two with it, its now really grown on me. I dont get shaving foam, but I get a dark woody scent with a fruity note that balances it out really nicely. I find it very androgynous and can be worn by all genders. Not very longlasting though, I get about 3 hours before I need to retouch it. But still a good one, and quite unique for an affordable designer fragrance.

very interesting scent profile. it's hard to describe if i'm going to be honest. it's quite creamy and almost has a lipstick/makeup type of scent but it's the type of smell of my moms makeup pouch i used to steal when i was a kid. it's not too heavy but also not a light scent. def would be ideal to wear for colder weather. it's not sweet at all, doesn't smell feminine so it would fit both women and men. but i will imagine someone more mature would rock this. i mostly get oriental, woody and creamy notes here. it's a quite unusual scent and not something i'd usually go for but something about it is intriguing

A cheapie but sooooo sexy! I remember this from when I was in my teens. Managed to get a hand on an older formula since they have been reformulated. The bottles now also don’t have the silver plating. On my skin kind of reminds me now of Velvet Orchid by Tom Ford. Like someone else said it really smells like a confident and sexy woman.

A kezdő illatjegyek szokatlan zöldes, friss gyümölcsösséget árasztanak magukból. A lótusz megemeli az elegyet, ettől könnyed, elegáns lesz. A virágok virágok. Az alapjegyek közt a szokatlan tejszínhabos, ibolyás, keserédes fás hangok megkülönböztethetővé teszik ezt a különös, mégis népszerű illatot. Sikerült nagyot alkotni. Valahogy érthetővé válik, hogy hárman is kellettek a megalkotásához
New bottel is not the same as the old one, the old one was strong and projected like ctazy, this one is gone about 2 hours, what a shame, good that I could tested it out before buying again!

She loooves to travel, trying new things, visit new places... her friends describe her as a free spirit. Still, she is also mature, respectful, organized and always has her life on track. I totally get the "sexy grown woman", "lady like" scent. This one may not be your scent, but I'm sure it will be someone's scent. Somehow this fragrance feels complete from the top to the base notes. It's not missing anything nor is too much - it's perfect. No surprise people still talk about this one.

This has a young girl trying to be mature vibe that I find very endearing. It’s like a teenager’s body spray plus a sneaky spray of her mom’s perfume. It has an expensive unburned incense quality that dries down into a tart berries and cream scent on the skin, but holds onto some of its deep, woody, spicy notes (especially on clothes). This smells to me like growing up too fast, down to the fact that it almost smelled like a smoker when I first sprayed it. This smells like a good time, a great going out scent.
This year marks the 20th anniversary of this amazing fragrance. Hopefully Calvin Klein gives us a collector's edition bottle to commemorate this event.

I just love this perfume.Id say my signature scent
I have the old formula( been stashing bottles) , been wearing Euphoria since it was released
I wear Euphoria in autumn, winter and evenings as it's a strong scent. Love the patchouli, champaca and orchid During the day I wear Deep Euphoria (discontinued )similar but more softer with rose.and pepper.
I think the Euphoria range would have to be the best perfumes ever for the price.
So happy and I smell good 😍
I'm not really understanding all of the "old lady" comments. However, after testing it today I can say that it actually bares some resemblance to the scent of the Dior mascara that I use...
Love this. One of my fav feminine Fragrances. One if the few outside if gourmands that I'd actually consider sexy.

I do love this one! I always smell this on one of my dearest friends and always think she smells amazing. For years this has been her signature scent.
It’s truly warm, seductive but it also has a fresh component and never becomes too sweet.
So I bought a little bottle. But it is the new version, the transparent bottle. Does anyone know if the juice is the same and if the longevity is good?
Otherwise I will hunt down the older formulation in the silver bottle.
But this is a true classic!
And patchouli

Gorgeous!! I’m not typically into violet but this overall composition works!! This is sensual, elegant, and seductive! This is a sexy grown woman’s scent! I adore it! The woody base make its perfect for fall-early spring! Although I think it would be gorgeous for a summer evening! It’s been around a while, so it’s pretty affordable now, but definitely does not smell cheap! Dominique Ropion makes such stunning fragrances, it’s no surprise to see his name attached to this beauty! I immediately ordered two back up bottles!

If this smells like an old lady, then she’s the coolest old lady ever! Like, this old lady is one of the queens of the GILFs (real queens share the crown, after all)! She gets with Donna and Miriam (Black Orchid and Shalimar wearers, respectively) in the retirement home every Friday night to smoke reefers and blast “The Deftones” in her room. Squares HATE her, cool cats want to BE or BE WITH her. Life is good.

It has almost a patchouli opening on my skin. But stick with it for 10 minutes, and it’s lovely. It’s definitely giving me emo y2k femme vibes - think Evanescence in the Fallen era. And not bad, for the price!

Oh by the way, this will last *maybe* a couple hours on your skin and for a lifetime on your clothes…

I'm screaming what Margot below is saying. All these new perfumes don't smell like perfume at all. They just smell like food. I want a fragrance/perfumey perfume that took 3 highly accomplished perfumists to create it. I already have vanilla extract in the kitchen cabinet that smells just like 99% of the new releases these past few years - when I spill it on myself when I'm cooking. I wore food scented body mists when I was in middle school. That's what all these newer perfumes remind me of - just some food and basic kid thinking "this smells good because food is good" taste in fragrances.

This is a fun throwback fragrance for me. I think my aunt wore it in the early 2000's, because it smells instantly familiar. Hilarious some are calling this "old lady". Listen, everyone thought they knew everything before their frontal lobe developed. I suggest ya'll humble yourselves, step back from the keyboard and reflect on the fact that ya'll have been raised on "I wear perfume that smells like baked goods" era. Sit back and learn something. Take a breath and maybe reflect on how much time you've had on the field compared to others. This is NOT an old lady fragrance. There's a whipped cream note. Whipped cream. Let your brains cook. Hahahah...

Hey what's the difference between this one and the one in the flattened square bottle?

Also, does anyone know if the NEW bottle design, which is the same as this one just without any silver on it, actually smells the exact same?

They're saying it's the same scent but I am worried it mightve been reformulated
One of the best perfumes ever !

A former stripper told me she would have the most successful nights wearing this perfume so I wanted to try it. At first, I was repulsed by this fragrance and found it to be very masculine+overpowering. After another try and also knowing what to expect, I liked it more. My preferences tend to be on the sweeter side so this isn't my first choice. I got the mahogany notes immediately in this rather than the fruit notes. I can see myself wearing a blazer over a sleek black dress with this, like a hot girl boss 90s executive

Ew!

Spicy. Fruity. Woody. And not in a good way. This one hits hard. Smells like an old lady with light blue eyeshadow and tattooed eyeliner that's fading away very quickly. She also has deep vein thrombosis and a vintage fur coat that’s seen too many decades.

It’s definitely an attention-grabber, but for all the wrong reasons. If you're into bold, old-school old lady fragrances, maybe you'll like it. Personally I couldn't scrub it off fast enough.

A friend of mine uses it as one of her favourites and I cannot unlike it :-) On her, it's sexy, sultry and a bit spicy, I can clearly detect pomegranate, but the rest blends nicely into some slight fruity sweetness and a solid woody base... Yet I would bet there is a bit of thyme spicing up the concoction. I would lose this bet, of course, but it feels so exotic and nice! Also, it develops beautifully when it's hot and creates a scent bubble around the wearer. A very pleasant surprise.

I don't know why, but I adore this perfume. You'd think I'd stray away from this perfume as there are so many others out there that are seemingly 'better,' 'newer' and more 'contrarian' out there, but I LOVE Euphoria. I'm still relatively new in owning perfumes. Maybe it's because of the strong woody undertone this fragrance has. Maybe it's because when that woodiness is combined with the scent of pomegranate and a violet black orchid, this perfume becomes heavenly. Maybe it's because of its relatively cheap price yet strong sillage/longevity.

It's a staple in my collection because of all of these factors. This isn't a sweet or youthful perfume, and I love Euphoria for that. It's refined, womanly, and downright alluring. It has a darkness to it that I can't quite put my finger on. I find this to be a secretly bold perfume with an understated confidence that makes it both a genuine crowd-pleaser and a stand-out. Maybe Euphoria proves that a fragrance needn't be an expensive, luxury perfume in order to be 'good perfume' but one that perfectly matches the wearer's very essence and skin chemistry. An absolute love.

a very long time has passed since i tried this one out, but i can say it didn't leave any lasting impressions. all i can remember is that i thought it was way overhyped. sure, it is cute and sweet, yet cloying and kinda ... boring. it's a fragrance without a spirit, something i can smell everywhere on every girl. definitely a perfume everyone tries to replicate. not a fan.

@philocalistsoul, there is no Euphoria body spray, but there is a body lotion that would work even better.
I hope that helps.
CAN SOMEONE HELP PLS THIS IS MY SIGNATURE SCENT IS THERE A BODY MIST FOR ME TO LAYER WITH THIS IN THE DAY OR TO REAPPLY THE SCENT

Calvin Klein Euphoria: A Mature, Orchid-Violet Combination
