Let's talk about Calvin Klein Euphoria. This isn't your typical, sweet, youthful fragrance. Euphoria is a statement. It's mature, sophisticated, and undeniably alluring. I've been wearing it for a while now, and it's become a surprising favorite.

What truly sets Euphoria apart is its longevity. This stuff lasts forever. I'm talking all-night, into-the-next-day kind of lasting power. And for the price? It's an absolute steal. You get a high-quality, long-lasting fragrance at an affordable price.

On my skin, Euphoria transforms into something truly magical. The prominent notes of orchid and violet take center stage, creating this deep, almost mysterious floral and woody scent. It's a dark, velvety floral, not your typical bouquet. This is what I love most about it. It’s a very unique scent.

I'll be honest, Euphoria isn't an everyday scent. It's a bit too intense and mature for casual wear. But for nights out, special occasions, or when you want to feel a bit more glamorous? It's perfect. It exudes confidence and sophistication.

I feel like Euphoria is a bit of a hidden gem. It's been around for a while, but it's often overlooked in favor of newer releases. If you're looking for a long-lasting, mature, and unique fragrance that won't empty your wallet, give Calvin Klein Euphoria a try. You might just be surprised at how much you love it.
at the start its good but wait for a couple of minutes, it turns into smell of ukrainian marshrutka

This has a luxurious quality to it that makes it feel more expensive than it actually is; I think it's because of the deep, woody mahogany note which adds richness and depth to the composition.

I’ve seen a few reviews calling it forgettable, and I do agree with that. It's strange, but when I’m not wearing it, I genuinely can't remember what it smells like. That might be because it’s still new to me and I haven’t formed a strong scent memory yet. Or maybe its just because the DNA isn't that memorable.

That said, I enjoy how it smells when I wear it, and I’m glad to have it in my collection.

This smells like a vague idea of ultimate feminine fragrance. Soft, powdery, forgettable, unintelligible. I don’t get any of the notes listed. It is such a nothingburger I forget how it smells even remotely as soon as it is gone off my skin. Nothing in it stands out or evolves. And it is gone too soon no matter how much you pour over yourself. A strong disappointment.

P.S.: When Fragantica users stop downvoting negative reviews the world will stop existing I suppose

Smelled it while Christmas shopping a while back, and loved it. Saw it was at Ross, so I got a bottle. However, it does not smell like the one I smelt while Christmas shopping at all. It smells VERY heavily of patchouli. So to me it's coming off more like the Euphoria Intense, but this bottle is definitely just Euphoria, so I'm just confused on what happened.

I’ve only tested Euphoria once so far, but I like it. The opening is a bit too sweet for my taste, like jelly candy, but thankfully it fades quickly. After that, it settles into a delicate, floral, and fresh yet sweet scent, with amber blending nicely into the composition. It reminds me a bit of Idôle but a little deeper thanks to its pomegranate and woody notes

Berries and flowers. It's clean. It's sweet. But nothing really stood out one way or the other to me. There's no distinct downfall. Nothing to specifically praise. No note that jumps out or reminds me of anything specific. Normal projection and last. It's just not anything special. Very mid.
the woody note is very apparent in this fragrance. i’d say overall it leans a bit unisex. it’s not for me but i know others would really like it.

Tart pomegranate juice and dark wood are most prominent, under which is a little soapy orchid, and it's all nicely rounded out with a cosy whipped cream base note.

Clean, juicy, and surprisingly unisex. I think it even leans a little masc on me tbh.

Moderate sillage. A little more on warm skin if exercising, but it's still subtle.

5 hours or so longevity from two sprays under my shirt and one on each wrist. (Actually very impressed with the longevity on my wrists, it's survived my doing the washing up and is still noticably fragrant!)

Really does smell like a much simpler version of L’Ile Pourpre by Liquid Imaginaires. I'm going to get a bottle of Euphoria for days/casual wear this summer and save my L’Ile Pourpre for nights/best.

My very first true-blue signature scent back in my University days. During the summer I would tutor chemistry and a girl I was tutoring smelled divine, so I asked her what her perfume was and it was this.

I promptly bought it and it just enveloped me. I was completely new to fragrance and oblivious to most social norms, so I tended to overspray, but I couldn't help myself.

I still haven't smelled anything quite like it.

It is dark and gothic, very deep and erotic; the musk smell from it is very spicy, earthy and carnal- as a previous review said, it does give off a very lustful feminine smell.


I couldn't figure out what to wear (getting bored of my usual rotation) and sprayed this for nostalgia. Wow. It is a bottle from perhaps, 2015, so I luckily haven't run into the dreaded current reformulation issue.

Euphoria will always be my first true love for fragrance. It defines a pivotal part of my life and still holds up. :3

2025 formula wearer here. Not sure what the negative hoopla surrounding this fragrance is about. *On my skin* I get fruity, nectary, violet candy whipped cream with a tinge of woody notes, not too shabby. Reminds me a lot of Shakira Dance Red Midnight which I wore a lot working as a stripper and sold lots of dances whilst wearing, ha! Do with that what you will! It’s not necessarily boundary pushing from an olfactive lens but it’s also not unpleasant by any means, I can see how this is a consistent scent folks come back to. Look into this one if you’re searching for a sensual ambery floral!

6.5/10
my coworker wears this. very solid projection and sillage lol, good thing i personally enjoy this fragrance
It's sort of like eating a warm custard. Not too sweet, comforting, reminds me of being at home.

I'm an amber ADDICT! I am not kidding I feel like I have been on the lifelong quest of finding the perfect amber. This fragrance comes really really close. I love to pair this with Mercedes Benz Club Black... If you wear them together expect everyone you see/meet to compliment how you smell. It leaves an intoxicating trail 💖

the scent is fine, not my favorite! very strong and synthetic and to me more suitable for an older person than i am. but smelling it on clothes a day or two later? AMAZING!!! i don’t know what it is, i didnt even recognize it as this perfume, but it smells so delicious. HOW!?

My mom has always been a perfume lover and loves this perfume. One time she wore it to work and one of her coworkers said she smelled really good and decided to kiss her randomly. We still laugh and make jokes about it to this day.
It was my signature fragance for seven years and always have a bottle ever since. I personally love it and can understand why it won a FIFI award.

I don’t know why people complaining about this fragrance, so much hate shown for this gem, but to be honest this is the best ck , whenever i use this i get compliments from people, it is underrated fragrance, best time to use this fragrance in winters not really for hot weather However, initially it kinda strong but after settled down it’s so smooth🔥personally I feel it is unisex perfume ..

Euphoria….I can’t get enough of you. Euphoria….the one I always come back to. Euphoria is the first perfume that I really fell in love with. All it took was for me to smell it one time and I was hooked. Whipped cream, black violet, persimmon, mahogany, black orchid, pomegranate….the composition of this fragrance is absolutely stunning. It’s floral, it’s pretty and sexy and just such a pleasure to wear. I wore this stuff all the time during my college years. I can still picture my younger self walking the halls in my favorite mesh top, long silver earrings and a sexy trail of euphoric mystery following close behind me. Someone was sure to ask what I was wearing and I was always happy to reply cause I knew nobody smelled like me. This fragrance stirs so many nostalgic feelings within me. I don’t wear it every day like I did in my younger years but I just can’t stay away from her too long. No matter the season, time of day or occasion, I’m always drawn to Euphoria.
It has strong scent trail can smell it after someone left the place for while, it's not bad smell but very synthetic.

I bought a pack of testers for 7€ and chose this in the mix since I usually like Calvin Klein perfumes, but this one? oh boy, it’s one of the worst things I have ever smelled in my life. I just can’t bring myself to even sniff it without feeling like throwing up. to me, it smells like heavy tobacco or cigarette smoke, trust me, I grew up with a tobacco smoker and this smells exactly like it along with woody, dark notes and maybe the slightest hint of powdery/floral notes that are extremely underpowered and barely noticeable due the obnoxiously loud woodiness and smokey smell. I had to hide my tester away because I couldn’t stay near it at all. Incredibly nauseating :(
edit: I wanted to add that this smells like a really masculine/unisex fragrance, I don’t smell anything remotely feminine or sweet
No.. very mature scent leaning almost unisex because of the wood. Thought it would be one of the fresh 2000s perfumes but I was very wrong. Gonna sell it.

Not for me. Too woody and leans more masculine or unisex. I am a gourmand girly growing into more “mature” scent and I was hoping this could be it. The whipped cream and fruits - I got none of that. I gave it to my mom and she absolutely loved it. She is 29 years older than me :)

Review #2 after purchasing a bottle and using it several times.

I can actually notice the whipped cream. The opening is smooth and resinous. It is deep and dark but decidedly feminine instead of unisex like other similar fragrances. However, the drydown is a little too bitter to me. I wish it retained its subtle sweetness that makes it so smooth. The woody note really stands out.

Regardless, I appreciate this fragrance. It is certainly of high quality and quite bold. Keep in mind this is NOT a safe blind buy! I tested it before purchasing and still did not like it as much as I imagined. Some women may find it not feminine enough. It is not for people who hate being noticed either.

Last but not least, there was absolutely no need to alter the bottle. It was perfect. I obviously got the new one and it looks "naked". This is a downgrade to me. Stop screwing with iconic bottles!
Disgusting, smells like slightly sweetened soil

A gorgeous unisex fragrance, which I honestly find quite unique. It is not generic, in the sense that is is sweet or floral. However, I find that many people enjoy the scent. It’s a sweet creamy woodsy scent with delicious florals. It lasts so long on hair and I have gotten so many compliments on how my hair smells. Absolutely love this fragrance, even more so because it is affordable.

I smelled this on an elegant older woman while holiday shopping. Purchased a sample- I’m getting berries, powdery, woodiness. Definitely best for cold weather as it is strong. Gives me glamorous new york aunt or grandma vibes, I kinda like it.

The fragrance is very mainstream, safe, and inoffensive—perfect as a gift. The fruity undertones in the opening are pleasant, gradually evolving into a floral composition with subtle woody nuances. There’s just a hint of boldness, enough to add character to the blend while keeping it easy to wear and universally appealing.

Smells like 2005 for real. It's soft and powdery, but dark because of the pomegranate. The woods blend so lovely with the powder, creating this soft, deep, dark, yet still inoffensive cloud. It's a beautiful, seductive, musky scent. It reminds me of Narcisso Rodriguez Musc Noir Rose but WAY less sweet and less loud. This feels sexy in an understated way.
Oh NO! This is awful on me, and had to wash it off after 6 hours of it! Not feminine enough for me, smelt like cologne with strong aftershave! Not for me...

I love this scent so much, it's very unique. I personally wear it almost every day. I love it with body mist bare vanilla by Victoria's secret, because it's more sweet and i love the contrast. I feel like it's not for everybody, people who love more sweet scents maybe won't like it.

It has that deep, nostalgic, mysterious scent.
I found it really pleasant. If you are a fan of stronger and deeper fragrances then this one is for you.
This one smells quite old fashioned for me. Quite cosmetic, powdery, floral, woody. It fits to every occasion
I really like this one! Tart fruitiness, blooming flowers, soft woods & warm amber. Interesting, but still easy to wear.

I really love this fragrance, in theory and practically, but I've come to find that it doesn't project too well on me. I'm not sure if it's simply just too warm where I am right now to enjoy it to it's fullest, or if it doesn't like my skin chemistry, but I feel it doesn't sit as well on me as it would for others. I definitely get the fresh greenness and juicyness of the pomegranate and persimmon in the top notes, but as it warms up I sort of find the orchid to stand out in a sort of tangy, metallic way between the lotus (which I usually adore as a softer, watery floral) and the champaca flower. I really wish I got stronger notes of whipped cream and heartier woodiness, but it dries down too quickly I fear. Maybe I'll retest this again in the winter, but definitely a super fun and flirty for those who want a moodier but still enticingly fresh fragrance. I've gotten complimented a lot on it, and my friends adore it, so it's definitely a crowd pleaser!

I keep trying to love this perfume because it was gifted to me by someone I care about and it's the most expensive one I own, but every time I spray it, I get blasted with woody aftershave and then a very very quiet, gentle floral orchid an hour later when the mahogany stops holding me hostage. The fruity notes are undetectable. Maybe I just don't dress up enough to justify it.

I do not have much to say about this perfume. It is pleasant, and it is a safe blind buy in my opinion. However, there is no wow moment. It is generally good for everyday wear and could be a good signature scent if you don't have one already. Smells like a woman who has her life sorted out and has sort of a motherly spirit to her, but there is also a young and nostalgic heart. There is a hint of romantic dust inside. The whipped cream is quite noticeable and smells very synthetic. Maybe without it, it would smell better. Overall the smell is quite calm but also passionate. If this perfume were a song, it would be Fire Meet Gasoline by Sia.

I was sent a sample of this along with a previous purchase of mine. I love blind buying perfume but I also appreciate the opportunity to try the scent beforehand. This was a love at first sniff. If I had to use one word to describe "Euphoria", it would be satisfying. Pure olfactory and visual satisfaction. I have already ordered a bottle as I am typing this.

Beautiful scent. Rich, deep, with just enough sweetness, all of which comes from the fruits and the amber. The orchid (? I guess) is gorgeous, powdery and refreshing. The green note is minimal but noticeable and sufficient. Despite being listed as a top accord, the wood is not too strong to me. It gives the fragrance depth and warmth. The persimmon and pomegranate do not smell cheap or synthetic, and are pretty close to my idea of what these fruits smell like.

I find "Euphoria" mature and youtful at the same time. I think it is great for people in the early 20s to late 30s range. Although I would wear it daily, I can also imagine it being perfect for nights out. It reminds me of the time I went to my coworker's wedding, got tipsy really fast, danced a lot, realized that my mom wouldn't be alive in 50 years and cried about it then drank some more. I do not go out often. This perfume reminds me there is a freak inside of me that wants to have fun and feel alive. I will wear it and imagine these moments for a few seconds then snap out of it.

Longevity seems promising. I sprayed this on my forearm and put on my sweatshirt afterwards. I could certainly smell it on my sleeve a few days later. I have other CK fragrances on my wishlist including its masculine counterpart. If I really enjoy this one, I will buy more of their fragrances.

It's very very warm and sweet
Giving la vie est Belle vibes
One of the perfumes that I really don't like
Love this fragrance it reminds me of a very memorable field trip I had in 8th grade it was the best trip I've ever had and the air constantly smelled like this faintly perfectly powdery and balanced

Where has this fragrance been and why am I just sampling it in 2024? I love this perfume- pomegranate, whipped cream and woody notes come together in a way that is sweet but mature. This fragrance has presence and needs to be dressed up a little to be worth the wear. Grandma perfume you say? Girl please. That's all.

A sweet, fruity and gourmand perfume enjoyer here, when I tested this on paper, I thought this was going to be my favorite fruity scent. But when I bought it and sprayed on my skin, I was really disappointed. It was obviously my fault that I forgot to spray it on my skin, but the difference was really shocking. It smells strong, intense with pomegranate, very woody, spicy that it almost feels masculine with a hint of sweetness. Kind of reminds me of intense grandma perfumes. Only appropriate for cold weathers, this could make you want to choke yourself if you spray this on hot days tbh. I can only see myself wearing this on night. Maybe on a cold jazz club date or a dinner. (NOT A BLIND BUY.) But I'm very disappointed.

This has a very nostalgic vibe for me because my best friend with whom I'm not talking these days used to wear it. Somehow, though, when I smelt it recently, it really felt like a "me" scent. In fact, it gave me gender euphoria on a very dysphoric day.

I am non-binary, look like a girl, so I went to my local beauty store to sample perfumes and the lady (who wouldn't let me look around on my own) seemed appalled when I told her I'm looking for something leathery and woody. Not only did she think that if I look like a woman, I must always choose feminine perfumes, she also thought it appalling that wood or leather would ever belong to a traditionally feminine perfume, before going on to sample me with a perfume that was among what I was looking for and it was literally called "This is Her" (by Zadig & Voltaire). Last but not least, I had told her I wasn't looking for anything overly fruity or floral, so when I tried on the lovely almond-y Poison Girl by Dior she was like "I told you I should have shown you sweeter scents!"

Anyway, rant about the autonomy of olfactory choices over. The thing is, this perfume is the exact mix of feminine and masculine elements for me. I know these are not the predominant notes, but to me it smells like a warm floral with a touch of oud. This unisex perfume really gave me gender euphoria.

If its not already a nostalgic love for you and it's a first try like it was for me....let it grow on you! It's a love for me now... different than the sexy sweet gourmands.. it is a sexy pomegranate woody musk.. office friendly or even club worthy. Over spray please!! Its better that way xoxo

My mom used to wear this growing up, and it will always remind me of those days. It was a mature scent, and I loved the smell. I think I was in middle school maybe when she started wearing it? It was strong….I remember going into her bathroom one day just so I could smell it lol. Definitely was one of my favorite scents growing up. Saw this at Ross or TJ Maxx and think I was able to smell it since someone had opened the packaging. Didn’t smell as strong or how I remembered it. Maybe they reformulated? Anyways, the OG bottles were something else. Dark, sexy, mysterious, and alluring are the images I have associated with the early days of smelling this perfume.

I always get compliments with this scent although I don’t find it that amazing. It’s sweet, simple, juvenile and playful in the best way. A crowd pleaser that will make you stand out from the Prada Paradoxes, Good Girls and Crystal Noirs. It’s very unisex, feminine but masculine leaning.
Professional yet sweet. For someone who is both.

Lasting is good but it's more masculine and didn't have any feminine vibe. Smells likes man's body spray with woody and spicy mesh up. Feels like department store may smells like this. With leather woody interior.Nothing special.

I only know CK Euphoria in its current iteration...I wish I could have smelled it in the early years, though I'm quite fond of it as is.

Put simply, I think of it as sitting at an unlikely junction between berries-and-cream and shaving cream: it is fruity and creamy while still being undergirded by woody notes and a dash of something ozonic and aquatic that keeps it from whetting the appetite. If it smells generic, it's probably because it has been copied to death -- itself a descendant of fruitchouli powerhouse Angel. On its own terms, I find it sweetly fruity, floral, and then woody; feminine with both grit and depth. Full disclosure, I have been having early aughts nostalgia BAD lately, but how I wish it were true today as it was 20 years ago that any old mainstream release you could find at the local JC Penney was this solidly good!

Ehh… not bad just unremarkable.
Kinda reminds me of a really intense version of a fruity body mist you could find at bath and body works

Cold lacquered mahogany wood, pomegranate peels and dewy orchids. I don't get any of the sweet and warm notes, this feels very cool, almost icy to me. It's a very Y2K scent, and the bottle design is absolutely perfect for it - it smells just like it looks. I think this is what a supermodel's penthouse interior would smell like, and even though it's the complete opposite of my everyday vibe, I really like it. And it's surprisingly affordable, too.

Euphoria was my favourite perfume since 2005. I remember the first time I tried it and fell in love with it. Such a unique, sexy fragrance that would last for ages. All these years I bought bottle after bottle and never got tired of it, it was my signature fragrance... until now.
A month ago I bought a 160ml bottle, to my surprise, the bottle had changed, the metallic part was gone and it was all glass. Ok. I spritzed it on my wrist and immediately smelled something different in the open, I can't tell what, but it smelled weaker and something was off. Then I got used to it but 2 hours later I could not smell anything. I asked my partner and he could not either. I wanted to think it was the 160ml bottle that was different, so I bought the usual 100ml. It came with the same new design and sadly the same weak opening and extremely poor performance. I sent them back, even at a good price, I am not spending £40 in a parfum that had been watered down and lasts less than 2 hours.
Such a shame, I will never understand why they have reformulate and ruin a fragrance that is so amazing? Such a disappointment, but this seems to happen with most of the parfums lately.
I will have to find a new love.
This is such a sensual and dark wood scent. If you love the smell of mahogany you will love this. When I wear this people stop me in the street.
I’ve got it 3 times just because it drives guys and people crazy like crazy ,they stop me in the streets, like !!! But I don’t understand this perfume at all.

If I had to use one word to descrbe this scent, it would be intense. All of the notes blend into one, and it is really hard to pick any of them out separately before the scent itself disappates. Reminds me a lot of a sexier Chanel No.5 if that makes any sense? Either way not my favorite.

A loved one gifted me this perfume recently, not to mention my mom had this in her collection for ages. To tell the truth, it is a dark seductive perfume. I LOVE IT. I get woody notes. Many claim this to be a bit masculine, I don't get that at all. This is perfect for a date. It lasts long on me for sure. Sensational smell. Not to mention, I've received a compliment from two people out of the 6 times i've wore it outside. Nostalgic as it is because I used to have a whiff of this fragrance as my mom used to apply this on her on special occasions. I love this perfume as it reminds me a lot of my mom. It is her signature scent for years. BEST ONE FROM CALVIN KLEIN.

My husband gifted me this perfume for a special occasion, and as he did for many years he would go shopping without me and come back with multiple sample cards of his favourites and have me close my eyes and smell each one, then I had to declare my favourite, I made it clear that I wasn't a fan of this scent but he keep trying to convince me that I was mistaken and the smelling saga continued, there was no mistake, I had to accept his gift and tried really hard to wear it but I struggled, there's something about the notes that irritates my sinus, I tried using it as room spray but that didn't work either, it ended up in the bin and it took years for my husband to learn to stop buying me perfumes that "he" liked, needless to say, this isn't the only one that got binned. I don't know what it is about it that I can't stand and what irritates my senses, I wonder if others have had the same experience with this scent
Yall this smells good though

This just smells really alcoholic to me. I was gifted this, and all I get is this blast of citrus when I initially spray it and it’s almost like battery acid. It’s almost reminiscent of hand sanitizer mixed with cologne to my nose. I don’t know if it’s because I’m more of a sweet gourmand person, but this just burnt my nose hairs to a crisp. Honestly, I only really use this if I need a really strong fragrance in a pinch that I know won’t wear off because of how nuclear it smells. The only plus to me is the insane longevity this fragrance has. Definitely don’t wear this in warmer weather if you are going to purchase this.

Uff this fragrance is strong, sharp and super woody. Almost incense-y. If woody fragrances with some spice are your thing you are going to love this. For me, as a sweet gourand/floral/fruity lover this is a no.

I had a decant of this in my collection I completely forgot about. I am BLOWN AWAY BY THE DRY DOWN ON THIS BEAUTIFUL BABY!!!! It has a rather harsh, early 2000's floral/fruity opening that is rather dark. For me at least, I am lucky that my least favorite part of the perfume fades quickly and enters the star of the show... The mahogany-amber whipped cream comfort goodness. My boyfriend doesn't interpret this as a dark perfume actually, he uses words like "pink, fluffy, cloud, comforting" and that exactly how I see it too. There's a comment further down that describes this perfume as "It's always given off the vibe of the tough girl who doesn't care what you think and gets the last word in, but also spends her weekend helping homeless animals with 3 legs." When I read that I was cracking up, and my boyfriend asked if I was watching a funny video (wanting to join the fun of whatever I was enjoying) and I just read the comment to him and he goes "that's a description of you!!!! You need to try whatever that is!!!" And I explained it was Euphoria, the perfume that he loved on me, and it just further affirmed my love for this perfume 💖
To me this smells more like blackberries and orchids but Iv been using it for nearly a year and it has a very nice feminine smell to it, might repurchase. (7/10)
Its good but not great, it didnt blow me away or make me reach for it in any way

Was given a sample of this, and I can confidently say I will not be purchasing. Which is disappointing because I LOVE pomegranate smells but this just didn't do it for me. Very strong and not in the good way, and just not feminine enough for my liking.

Category: Floral, woody, classy, feminine.

Notes: Sprays on very fresh and floral with a warm undertone, likely from the amber base note peeking through already. Slowly but surely develops into a timeless, gentle wood scent with a touch of orchid to balance things out and give it a bit more of a fresh feel.

Vibe: Sunday brunch with the girls. Walk in the park. Floral pattern sundress. Front row runway seats at NY fashion week. Vogue. Shopping bags. Champagne on New Year's Eve. Gossiping in the girl’s bathroom. Very mindful, very demure. Gala. Early morning coffee run. Tulips.

Sillage: 6/10. This has the perfect sillage in my opinion. It's there, it's definitely noticeable, but it's not overwhelming or offensive. The kind of scent that wafts over as you pass by or becomes apparent when you go in for a hug. Definitely wouldn't say it's intimate though, just mellow.

Longevity: 3/10. Unfortunately quite poor longevity on this one. Tried this on at the perfume counter and within 3 hours it was pretty much gone, just a skin scent remaining.

Wear: Day. I’d say this likely works year round, but probably performs the best both in terms of longevity and just letting the notes shine in the cooler months of the year. Perfect for both a casual day at the park and fancier events.

Overall rating: 6.5/10. Chic and elegant, this perfume is a classic. I totally see this being worn by a leggy, fashionable Manhattanite (cough, Carrie Bradshaw, cough). The reviewers who are saying this leans masculine are trippin’ for real, there's not an ounce of masculinity about this perfume - quite the opposite, I'd actually classify it as very traditionally feminine. Something about it is a bit more flirty than your typical “classy” scents in a way that I think gives it a unique edge more fitting for a younger wearer and/or someone who is very fashion forward.

Who would wear it?: 110% SUCH a Carrie Bradshaw scent.

I have smelled this perfume from my mother collection, very sharp heavy woody fragrance tends to be masculine fragrance for my own taste, but I like it on my mother. I think the Mahogany woods is the ingrediant which the reason of this intensive sharp fragrance, to my noise this fragrance overwhelming any other ingrediants. very suitable to wear at night.

If you didn't smell this perfume before, I advise you to not blind buy. This Fragrance didn't suitable for majority of people, needs someone interest this fragrance or someone like heavy perfumes.


لقد جربت هذا العطر فهو من مجموعة والدتي، وهو عطر خشبي حاد وثقيل للغاية يميل إلى أن يكون عطرًا ذكوريًا حسب ذوقي الخاص، ولكني أحبه على والدتي. أعتقد أن خشب الماهوجني هو المكون المسبب لكون هذه الرائحة حادة وكثيفة، بالنسبة لما يشمه أنفي فهو يطغى على أي مكونات أخرى. مناسب جدًا للارتداء في الليل.

إذا لم تشم هذا العطر من قبل، أنصحك بعدم شرائه شراءً أعمى. هذا العطر غير مناسب لغالبية الناس، يحتاج إلى شخص يستمتع بهذه الرائحة أو شخص يحب العطور الثقيلة.

Perfection in a bottle! It's Long lasting and has this mysterious feel to it.
My mom used this a lot back in the day and I've been missing her badly since moving abroad. So she's partly the reason I got it. Beyond the sentimental value, it is an amazing fragrance, and as someone who never repeats or uses familiar fragrances, the fact that I absolutely adore this fragrance till now is a testament to its timelessness. (PS: I've gotten perfumes for sentimental reasons in the past and I got bored almost immediately 😂)

My mother's scent, so gives off a comforting smell. You know this woman, she always wears dark makeup, dark colors dominates her clothes, her laugh is heavy yet intoxicating. A very feminine and strong smell. A beautiful combination of floral and fruits. The persimmon gives off the sugary smell that complements the woodiness, turning it into an addicting smell. But that might be personal since I love the way this fragrance mixes with my mom's own smell, reminds me of being her little daughter again, watching her get ready, hoping to wear perfumes like this.

Fruity open, pulling out to reveal wood and amber. It's clean and floral without falling into that synthetic world of cheap body sprays or cleaning products. This seems versatile -- a confident person of any gender could pull it off in a t-shirt, in a dress, in a button-down...
I dont know if its only me but smells so much like believe by Britney spears
very strong mahogany and amber

I was pleasantly surprised by this perfume. Much nicer and warmer than expected.
My only issue is the longevity- it has none. I spray it on quite liberally and my skin eats it up in minutes. A real shame, as I am really enjoying the few minutes that I can actually smell it on me.
However, looking at previous reviews, this seems to be a “Me” problem rather than an issue with Euphoria itself.
Anyway, if like warm and inviting scents, give it a go ☺️
the only euphoria i experienced is when scrubbing this off, blegh! unisex, zero sweetness, the mahogany overwhelms this fragrance. the poor florals have gotten lost in a sea of coarse woodiness
Peppery! A strong woody amber fragrance. Heavy on the amber.
Please, can anyone suggest a perfume similar to the original Euphoria, that had this creamy accord of whipped cream, that I totally miss??

I've always hated the bottle, but loved the juice. Sure the reformulation did change it a little, but on me at least it still smells like a mahogany cabinet and a fluctuating combination of fruity, patchouli, creamy, and spicy. It's always given off the vibe of the tough girl who doesn't care what you think and gets the last word in, but also spends her weekend helping homeless animals with 3 legs.

Daring, intoxicating and erotic. When you first spray it its SPICY. It starts off kind of unisex but as it dries down it becomes more feminine and sweet. This is a unique sweetness though. I have never smelled persimmon or pomegranate in perfumes so this scent was so unique to me. Its kind of a green sweetness. I like assigning mythical creatures to perfumes and this would definitely be what a succubus wears.

There is an element of tobacco in the dry down that reminds me of the smell of cigarette smoke on clothes after a night at the pub in the 90s - in a good way (and I don't like the smell of cigarettes at all).
Strong, sexy fragrance but have to be in the mood. 3.5/5.

I tend to be drawn to stronger scents as my body chemistry tends to dampen many of the more musky and cloyingly sweet vibes. Perfumes and colognes that smell delicious on me tend to be ones that are rather divisive. For example, my current best performers are Farenheit by Dior, Poison by Dior, Sauvage by Dior, Red Door by Elizabeth Arden, L'Eau D'Issey by Issey Miyake, and now Euphoria by Calvin Klein. On me, the strong fruity notes fade quickly, leaving only green accord, florals and the woody base notes with a hint of sweetness from the whipped cream and amber notes. It has surprising longevity on me, about 7-12 hours which is one of the best in terms of performance I have encountered. Sillage is about 6 feet from me - if I wear this you will smell my arrival in a room. I wouldn't wear this if I worked in an office, but it is a perfect scent for a weekend spent shopping and spending time with family and friends. It is a comforting, loving scent that gives mature vibes (opposite would be how Poison smells on me which gives gum-chewing carefree teenager vibes). I would wea
r this to daytime, spring, summer, and outdoor events. I think it doesn't have enough heavy spice or strong florals for me to consider it a winter scent. I feel like without the added boost of warmer weather, this perfume would fall flat on me as many of my favorites do (I'm looking at you, Like This by ELDO). That said, this was a gift, and I don't know if I will replace the bottle I have once it's gone. It's good juice, imo. I would give it 8.5/10 overall.

I got this perfume as a gift from my manager, who I talked about my newfound interest in perfumes with. She had the bottle lying around, and since it was a perfume with a purple color to it, she figured it would make a great gift (purple is my favorite color, which is easy to guess if you look at my profile and collection). She was right! I really appreciate it :) Also, don't worry, she said she was fine if I didn't like the scent, so I will now give my unfiltered opinion
It's very... interesting.
It's not a love or a hate, it hovers between like and dislike.

Likes:
The bottle is cool. It's aggressively 2000's, which can be a little tacky. I love that the liquid itself is purple.
I like the top notes/first impression. It's a bit screechy/metallic, but I like how it's cool, floral, green, and a little fruity. This is where I pick up on the darkly sexy vibes people are talking about. It smells avant-garde in a sophisticated way. The patchouli-like quality got me a compliment from a customer the first time I applied it, so it at least appeals to some people. I think I have an outfit in mind that would suit this, so if I remember to coordinate it, I'll update here.

Dislikes:
Creamy drydown is overbearing in my opinion and it erases most of the green and woody notes. I know a lot of people love the creaminess, but I'm really not a gourmand person. Definitely smells more mature than I think I want to convey. I'm a 22-year-old woman who's new to perfumes, so I'm leaning toward things that feel around that age and are also pleasant both to me and to other people. Sometimes I think the smell is mature in a 30-year-old woman way, but other times, it definitely falls in line with the idea of an old lady perfumes. It's also very easy to get sick of. I smelled the bottle too many times while writing this and will have to put it down for a day, haha.

Overall:
I think my score will shake out to about a 3/5? The first impression occasionally reaches a 4/5, but also feels like a 3 sometimes. The creamy drydown is a 2, and the indolic (in the overripe sense) feature is a 1 or 2. Maybe 2.5 is better?
It's definitely not a hate, I'll say that. My one true hate is Tom Ford's Black Orchid. lol

Side note: I cannot speak to the seasonality of this fragrance. I live somewhere without four true seasons, I only first saw a real autumn with widespread leaf color changes last October, and I haven't seen snow since 2009.

The only person I’ve ever known who wears this is a very masculine guy friend of mine, and he says he gets a lot of compliments from girls about how he smells. So take with that what you will. But to my nose, and on my skin, this opens to an almost watery pomegranate with an almost bitter undertone, and an almost floral pop. This scent is a lot of almosts. It’s just not quite what I want. It’s meh.

I could cry. This was my signature scent for the majority of my adult life… until the reformulation in 2017.

They have completely ruined what was once a beautiful experience, thanks L’Oréal (I hate you).

The OG Euphoria used to constantly get me complements, and the smell lasted all day with incredible silage. It used to be the most sexy, lovely, feminine scent…. Oh how I miss those days.

The new reformulation smells so cheap it makes me want to vomit. Nobody should wear any of the Euphoria perfumes, unless you are trying to prank or repel someone.
My mum loves it, I feel like it's a nice fragrance for the price and for a more mature woman

Wow. Iconic for a reason. My mom wore this for special occasions when I was a teen and it distinctly reminds me of her loving arms waiting with flowers to congratulate me after my musicals or dance recitals. So I do get the association others have with older maternal women.

BUT when I smell this objectively (and in loving memory of course) this is a very sexy and witchy scent. Also, my mama was no one to f**k with. This is sharp, woody, a little tart and spicy but with an addicting sweetened base. I think whipped cream was so smart in this composition because it lends a sweet creamy note perfect for the fall/winter but it’s more cool whip than dense vanilla icing, keeping it airy, whimsical and a bit dry. This is not a gourmand especially in today’s gourmands, but it is like forbidden fruit. Decadent, rich, and well rounded.

I love that the ads for this are just women climaxing in flowy purple gowns lol It really does have a raw sensual quality- quite naughty and dangerous! I feel like Sharon Stone smelled something like this in Basic Instinct. Love love love.
I absolutely love it! It gives a strong woman vibe

It took me a while to appreciate the understated sexiness of Euphoria.It has the early 2000s overt sweetness which is the Berry at the top, then it dries down to a skin like scent with the Violet and spices. Definitely more of a night time or winter fragance. I'd say its a clean/casual aesthetic rocking a Little Black outfit on a night out pulling out their glamorous yang to their clean yin.
I’ve worn this for years it’s a very dark sensual spicy clean scent to me. I get a ton Of compliments when I wear this it does smell very different on different people.
My mother's perfume, I love it and can recognize it anywhere

Reminds me of the Greek Goddess Persephone, the Queen of the underworld. A very dark and alluring smell. A little fruity and floral with some woodsy notes. Love it! I feel like it can be unisex though it is slightly feminine leaning.
smells like a powdery leather.

To me, feels like someone sprayed a piece of shinny metal with amber and floral scent, cold yet not very cold as the amber kinda embraces the metal feeling.
i love it!

I hope I'm writing this review on the right page since I have a mini that says EDP on the bottom label, in a clear bottle with pale pink juice. I'm pretty underwhelmed as there's nothing special about it. It's sweet, feminine (maybe pass as unisex), sits quite close to the skin, with longevity of about 4 hours. That's it. That's my review. I literally have nothing more to say about this.

Nostalgic Tart Pomegranate with Sugar-Crystal Texture & Evoked Patchouli...

This doesn't get a lot of love in the reviews, but it was groundbreaking when it came out and won a FiFi award for Fragrance Of The Year Women's Luxe 2006. I remember being mesmerized with it when it came out, and smelling it now it really takes me back to that time period, although it's a lot more tart than I remembered. I could imagine Angelina Jolie wearing this in the film Mr. & Mrs. Smith, which came out the same year. It has those same qualities as the film of being sweet, tart & frozen in time. The film was also sensational when it came out, due to the introduction of Brangelina.

Opens with a tart & fruity pomegranate with a sugar-crystal texture, purple/violet tones & green accents, but already the orchid, mahogany and what smells like patchouli are swelling through. Other reviewers have also mentioned smelling patchouli here (although it isn't listed), being built by green notes in combination with mahogany to give a deep, dark-green patchouli vibe with licorice-y facets. As it's drying down, the tartness settles a bit, and I get a faint whipped cream note. Overall, I get a tart, sugar-crystal textured, sour-purple/pomegranate scent with licorice-y wood/patchouli underneath. Performance is well above average for year round wear, although the tartness may verge on too tart in warmer weather. Those who enjoy tart purple/violet & patchouli scents with strong performance might like this. Enjoy!

A friend gifted me this many years ago. Unfortunately I could never wear it, the smell is so strange. I get some dark spices, maybe liqurice or fennel. It’s not feminine, neither masculine. It’s just weird and unpleasant.

I really wanted to like this and I gave it many tries. I love it on other women and I expected it to give me the same sexy, sophisticated, confident vibe, but it just doesn't work on me. It's way too sharp and masculine in the beginning, later it turns much sweeter and then I start enjoying it, but it doesn't last very long. The dry-down is, again, sharp and chemical. Definitely try before purchasing.

The fact that I actually smell the violet in here ruins it for me. Fragrances with violet ALWAYS remind me of hotel lotion. If they somehow removed the violet, it'd be (even more) boring, but I'd wear (not buy) it.

Edit: I actually wore this around the house today and my God it is headache inducing. I did not realize how strong this was. It's a Woody floral with a soft spice. But again, something about it reminds me of those watered down highly fragranced lotions from the 90s. It's headache inducing.
It's a beautiful acent but way too strong, heavy and mature for me. It's some late 30s and over. But the scent is nicelt blended, a deep floral scent that's not boring thanks to the woody notes

Hmmm this is a bit difficult to be impartial on because I have so much nostalgia attached to it.

It's heavily sweet. Way too sweet.
The florals, particularly the violet can be quite cloying and the base is slightly nauseating.

It's really missing something a bit more savoury or bitter to balance it out. It's very un-fresh.

With that being said, it is quite sensual and attractive. I always think of that slightly glamorous feeling of being in a bustling airport when I smell this for some reason.

VERDICT:
A wonderful trip down memory lane. I wouldn't wear it anymore.
Still a 'like' simply out of respect to my teenage self, and my somewhat dubious perfume taste back in the day.

Nice one😁. I'm into my second bottle but honestly i 'm a bit done with this perfume. I will finish but not purchase again. But projection and longtivity are moderate in comparison with early editions. Sadly that's the case with all perfumes with every new reformulation the juice becomes weaker and weaker. My beloved l'eau d'icey, dep red, ultraviolet, contradiction are on my off list just because of their weak projection and longtivity with todays formula. But overall this is a slightly sweet, woody and sexy office scent but still unique.
Smells too much like cologne

wowww it has an attitude...memorable, subtly intense, a cloud of fresh bitter mahogany that just lingers with you and suddenly everything around you seems to follow the misty vibe. euphoria really makes me feel confident. like a siren. or an edgy maneater party girl...not for everyone surely!! could defo wear this to a nightclub or a formal event. bold. futuristic. magnetic.

This is absolutely not a winter scent, maybe a fall or summer scent? Regardless I've smelt this on three separate women and it smells God awful. When they first spray it it's so intense it's sickening, the first opening notes there's no fruity or sweet notes, it's just a projectile of plastic, synthetic, white notes and that's all I ever smell on all three of them, then it completely disappears even when close to the skin.

I tried it on myself giving it the benefit of the doubt and it's the exact same. Never in my life have I smelt a perfume so ugly

This fragrance has a trail of nostalgia, presumably due to it being a popular 2010s fragrance. I don't love the initial spray, as it's far too masculine for my taste but I like the way it lingers when it has dried down into its woody, patchouli base. This is a more complex fragrance, meaning you can't layer it as easily without completely overshadowing its essence. I think it's very nice for fall time, but overall it is more masculine and I wouldn't recommend it to those looking for a girly fragrance. This reminds me of a businesswoman at a bar after a long day.

This is a review for the first edition release in the bottle that looks exactly as in this Fragrantica page. I first smelled this scent on a magazine scent strip. I remember I was enchanted because all I could really smell was the fruity accords - pomegranate and something that smelled like red berries. It was soft subtle but sweet. It's different on a piece of paper and it didn't really get into a dry down. Also smelled violet. So I went to the Macy's store to check if they had it and they did! The sales lady sprayed some on my wrist because I already smelled it on paper. On my wrist it was different. The violet popped out and some other vague florals, orchid and something 'pink' and light (lotus?). Then I continued to let it wear on my skin and it became woody. It's definitely a light wood and amber dry down. This is actually quite a simple fragrance. But it was making a statement. It's sexy and mature but not old lady; more like late 20s and into 30s a confident woman who wears sexy cocktail dresses and make up. She is very feminine. It goes with high heels and a sexy low cut dress. This is a scent of temptation and feminine sexual power. If I smelled this on my man like if it rubbed off on him from another woman I would totally lose it and immediately send him out of my life! The woman that wears this fragrance well can have any man she wants. The initial note is again the fruity notes of pomegranate and persimmon. They are deep and juicy, exotic, and with that orchid even more exotic. The florals blend in with the fruit and they are fresh and soft florals that shy away and do not come off as too floral or strong. But definitely orchid and lotus. Instead of being tropical it comes off as more a dark woodsy floral scent. The note of mahogany eventually settles on you as the dry down begins. By then it is warmer and becoming woodsy plus the amber. Then there is a touch of dark warm musk. This is a soft leather musk. Because of this it's warmth is suited to colder months like winter time but also fall and at night time. These dry down notes are what keep this fragrance from becoming too girly girl or too much like a Victoria Secret perfume. But in a way this is still like a more full bodied VS perfume. The dry down is bold and makes me want to just go out and get what I want. This scent is evocative of the night. It asks you to put on a hot sexy outfit and go out at night, for a dinner or night club dancing. It's seductive to your own nose and others. My boyfriend loves this on me and he will always associate it with me and only me.

i left a comment before it came in the other day, so i am back for an actual review.

like i had anticipated, it took me back to my mother wearing it in the 2000s. i currently am very stuffy and can’t breathe very well, but i can smell it perfectly. i can only imagine how it smells with my nose cleared!

i was just sitting in bed while have been wearing it, and my boyfriend said “it smells good in here” from across the room, so it has a very good silage. apparently it filled the room!

it smells like a dark hair women in pretty black dress, drinking a fancy cocktail. it’s definitely more mature, but i’m only 21 and i feel amazing wearing it. i see it being something for special occasions/nights out/dinners and such, but it could also been worn daily imo. i might come back when i can fully breathe, bc i have a feelings it’s even stronger than i can sense rn lol.
This opens far too masculine for my personal tastes. I like the dry down a bit more but it feels a little weak and more generic by then.

One of the best fragrances out there but the bottle just irritates me, so bulky and just oddly shaped. But the scent is worth the trouble, is very earthy and kinda sour to me but I love it . I just wish it lasted longer for the price

this is my “pre-review”
i just ordered euphoria on fragrancenet (which i highly recommend for amazing deals on designer fragrances), bc it’s what my mom wore. she passed away in 2008, and as soon as i saw the bottle, i recognized it. i needed it instantly!
i don’t quite remember what it smells like, but i know i’ll recognize it as soon as i smell it. i can’t wait to smell like my beautiful momma, i miss her so much.
i will come back and review when it comes in, i am so so so excited! it also has the purple box and details on the bottle, which was my moms color, as her birthstone was amethyst. it has so many good reviews as well, so i’m even more excited for it.
i mostly got it so i could be reminded of her scent, but even better if it smells amazing and becomes a scent i want to wear.

i love you so much momma, thank you for visiting me in my dream last night.

i will admit this scent is a bit cloying at first spray, like kind of sickeningly floral. but after a minute or two of letting it sit it becomes one of my all time favorite night out perfumes. it's a really sexy combination of powdery, sweet, florals and dark, smoky, wood notes. the fruity notes everyone describes don't really show through with my skin chemistry but that makes the scent feel more unique than it seemed on the tester.

My mom gave me an almost full bottle of this one. She said it was just ok but she didn't love it on her. I tried it and we both agree it smelled so good on me. I usually don't do well with woody perfumes and I wouldn't personally have chosen this one for myself but this one is the exception. I can definitely really smell the pomegranates and the violets on me. A surprise find and definitely a keeper!

Very strong, intense, rich fragrance. For me, this makes it a dislike - I usually love a fruity floral, but the deep woods in here overpower all. Like a commenter below also said, I would have thought patchouli was included because of a sharpness I sense, but it isn’t listed in the note breakdown. I could see Euphoria being a cold-weather night out fragrance for someone, but that someone isn’t me.

Not as fruity or floral as one might expect, more woody (at least on my skin), but still has a clean and light sweetness. Perhaps not something I would have picked out for myself, but an appreciated gift and I think an easy blind buy or gift for a young lady just starting out in the perfume world, or for anyone who can appreciate the lighter and sweeter things in life.

Fruity, ambery, powdery goodness. I don't get the green notes and the florals don't stand out as much (other then the violet) as the persimmon and pomegranate, but my god this smells so good. Its projection/sillage is pretty good, and its such an attractive scent that's garnered to get compliments.

Ah, my 'go-to' companion since my teenage years, and here I am at 34, still reaching for it on those special nights out. I affectionately refer to it as my 'f**k me perfume'—forgive the bluntness, but there's something about it that just works like magic! It's a potent blend that exudes sensuality and strength. The lasting power is incredible, and its sillage is top-notch. But fair warning, if you're sensitive to strong fragrances, this might not be your cup of tea. It's definitely not a blind buy; its intensity is not for the faint-hearted. There's an undeniable allure, a strong and seductive quality that accompanies every spritz. It's bold, it's lasting, and it's become an integral part of my nighttime allure.

When I first got this some years ago it unexpectedly evoked Christmas for me! I see someone else here mentions this too, though for me I don't have a prior memory that obviously explains it. It's not like we had pomegranates or persimmons at holiday time in my family.
I didn't always get this association on subsequent wearings, and haven't worn it a whole lot, but thought of it and trying it again today during the pre-Christmas season I'm getting some of that again! Win!
--------------------
I definitely get the fruit and I guess the wood. I would have thought patchouli but apparently I'm mistaken.
First two times wearing it i got complimented saying how nice it smelled. It must mix with my body chemistry very well!
I find this really intense at first but it dulls down into a nice woody frgrance.

A classic that smells so good. Many designer fragrances don’t impress me, but I really like the OG euphoria. It’s fresh enough for the daytime but also deep enough for night time. Its very likable imo. Smells very nostalgic to me, I’m pretty sure all the moms had this as their signature in the late 2000’s.
I don't like the first sniff of this, it's alcoholic, boozy to me and not pleasant. However, it settles into a lovely scent but smells a lot like Obsession to my nose. Probably don't need both.

This was my signature scent for years and years, nobody else was wearing it back when I was. Men & women would chase me down to ask me what I was wearing bc Euphoria mixed so well with my body chemistry & it was absolutely Lovely on me, intoxicating even. I truly LOVED the OG Euphoria.....

Sadly, as with all my favorite perfumes over the years, it’s been reformulated into something nowhere near the beautiful sensual beast this used to be back in the day...

I literally would do anything for a bottle of the OG Calvin Klein Euphoria....

Don’t waste your time or money trying to purchase the current knock-off version of the one, the only, Euphoria. The reformulated version is an insult to perfume wearers everywhere :(

I guess I am my mother's daughter because this was her signature when I was growing up. That may also contribute to my bias when I say this is absolutely amazing.

First spray/opening can be daunting, but after it settles into amazingly alluring deep and beautiful sweet floral woody goodness.

For a while I have been desperate for a frag that satiates both my sweet tooth and my love of depth and richness - without leaning too hard into either one. This fits the bill for me, and I feel like a femme fatale wearing it. Chef's kiss

I have two bottles of Endless Euphoria, which I really like; it's inoffensive, can be worn at work and doesn't project too much. I tried Euphoria some time ago and hated it; too heavy and too much - decided to give it a wide berth. Today, whilst walking around shopping, found Euphoria and some other perfumes on Black Friday promotion, and picked up the Euphoria bottle and sprayed it, and initially it was overpowering and harsh; however, within 20 minutes it had mellowed and I actually like it - not enough to buy it, but it's perfectly acceptable, and certainly has longevity and sillage as I can still smell it some four hours after initially applying it.
I asked a lady what she was wearing because her scent was iconic and powerful... She said the original formulation of Euphoria! Might need to test this soon.

Does anyone remember Sonia Kashuk's line of fragrances sold at Target? I liked them all...but I LOVED PURPLE SEDUCTIA!!! Like all of the one hit wonders that come through Target Sonia Kashuk's fragrances, lotions and shower gels got clearances out...not because they weren't any good, but I guess old Sonia decided to get out of the frag biz. I bought up ever bottle of fragrances, lotions and body washes as I could find on major clearance...we're talking $2 or less each! Purple Seductia was scarce, as my guess is that it was the most popular of the line. After years of using my two bottles, sparingly, I came to the bitter end. My husband is due back from military deployment and No Purple Seductia...what shall I do??? It's his favorite on me!!! Well, 9 times out of 10 Fragrantica comes to my rescue. How, you may ask? A few Fragranticans suggested Calvin Klein's Euphoria as a great dupe. So I took the leap and took the plunge....AND THEY WERE RIGHT!!!! CKE is the perfect dupe for SK PS. I found my long lost love and now my other love will be a happy camper when he comes home soon!!!

Even though it is such an old fragrance, to this day it remains my most complimented fragrance from both men and women. The sillage is beast mode and not to mention how amazing the price is and the value you receive! It is perfect for the day and evening, for university or the club, for dinner or lunch... its an amazing daily perfume. I have not smelt any perfume like it since I bought it a while back. The violet, orchard, cream and amber go so well together to make the most sexy, spicy, yummy and intoxicating scent ! It lasts for up to 7-8 hours and smells amazing from the initial spray to the dry down.

Missing it..I will buy it again, oldy but a goodie. ..for me it has everything, longevity, projection, sillage, not to sweet, a beast that I always can trust, wherever, whenever...!
It is only the bottle I don't like, I like simple plain bottles...but hey if I would go only for the bottle, I would not have many gorgeus perfumes, like Aura from Mugler, I also don,t like the bottle, etc....!

I think it is really heavy. Definitely for colder days, and for night. On my skin its too woody, that's why I think it's not for me. Don't get me wrong, it is a good perfume, but rather for those who like strong scents. It last whole day, but most of that day you smell on wood. Euphoria Blossom is better to me, since it is lighter.

On my skin euphoria is a jammy pomegranate scent with a solid woody base that backs it up and weirdly i get whiffs of Oud.
Am not mad at it tho , this is a seriously underestimated scent , it is not your typical girly designer perfume. I can see a mature sexy woman wearing this.

Sillage: 10/10
Longevity: a good 8 hours on my skin

Overall if you heavy woody jammy scents are your thing give this one a chance
Solid woody fruity flowery goodness. I really like Euphoria, it is well blended and balanced. I can smell the pomegranate, the orchid and the woods.

2010's something batch smells so suitable for fall / winter. i dont give a thing if someone wears this even in the peak of summer but thats on how much i love this and less of an objective measurement of how it cooperates with hot weather. very serious and no nonsense, gorgeously feminine scent. woody everything smells just right, she's an ENTJ with plans for her life, rocking business professional attire.
Beautiful chypre❤️

I was waiting for the cool weather to wear this one. I bought the coffret with the big bottle, the smaller one and the body cream. Using the body cream and the perfume would made this guy a BAD ASS BEAST, because he already his beast mode, on longevity and sillage. I love the smell, is woody and sweet, with a "boozyness", or a smokiness that evokes a sensuality on your skin. Not very suitable for work but 100% on point for night outs and dates.

Funny thing is: while I was spraying today, it reminded me of a perfume I had from I Boticário: Glamour Exubérance, a flanker with a brown bottle of the Glamour family. I wore it in college (2014 ish) for the nights out and it's definitely a resemblance.

I'm basing this review on a decant from Surrender To Chance. The vial didn't say, but I'm pretty sure I ordered the EDP.

I waited for cool weather where I live to test this. I like it! It's a strong fragrance; I can still smell it on my dry, perfume eating skin 12 hours after application. On me, it started out as floral and spicy, and over time, it's turned more woody. It reminds me of Obsession (not surprising as that's also a CK fragrance) and Angel, but it's not as spicy as those are on me. I really didn't get the fruity top notes; I have no idea why. I guess that's just my body chemistry.

To me, this is definitely a cool/cold weather fragrance. (However, that's my taste. Wear it in hot weather if you want!) And it would make a good "date night" fragrance. I do think it can be worn during the day if sprayed with restraint.

Do I recommend it? Yes, if you like strong, floral, spicy, woody scents. I'd say it's not a safe blind buy or a safe gift unless you're sure the recipient likes this type of fragrance.

With respect to office wear...Idk. I'd say, if you work with anyone you know has trouble with fragrance, don't wear this to work. And if you take mass transit, or sit close to anyone at work, I'd restrict this to 1 spray. And don't wear it on a plane! Please.

Will I buy a full bottle? Probably not, partly because we only have cold weather for about 5 months where I live. I might buy a travel spray or miniature size when I use up some other fragrances I have.

Just purchased this blind after looking at the notes as they were similar to another perfume I love (Dolce & Gabbana, The Only One) Initially Euphoria smelt slightly masculine but after 10 minutes it warms up and becomes more sensual and I really like it. Perfect for more of an evening fragrance which is exactly what I wanted it for. Honestly, an 8.5/10
Just got this one! I blind buy 100ml, which is not the most practical decision in general, but I am in love. Great fragrance! By the way, my sister is not into it, she is keen on D&G Imperatrice.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: soft, fruity, & pretty, but lasts no longer than a fart in the wind.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I had this one for a while. i absolutely loved it, the chocolate note really stood out to me. sure it had no longevity but i got what i paid for (i got it for cheap). but this is the only fragrance I've ever had that straight up expired. it never got funky smelling tho, it just lost its smell entirely and was just a nothing liquid. i pitched it :/

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: My uncles perfume gift to my mom that I remember, she barely wore it but it was a delicate sweet scent.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: The name doesn't fit - this is a very soft, gentle scent. I get the blackberries and citrus in the opening, then fluffy vanilla musk in the drydown. It's very intimate, a skin scent with no projection to speak of. I keep this in my bathroom to spray on after a shower - it's soft enough that it won't clash with your body lotion. It's nice, but not memorable.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: A faint sugary scent that has been done before, but I don't know where. If this was labelled as a Britney Spears Fantasy flanker, you'd believe it. Mild, so spraying everywhere possible is a good idea.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: somehow managed to completely forget that i own this despite the giant ugly bottle staring at me from my shelf for 2+ years; i never think to wear it. my grandparents bought it for me, probably because it's cheap and a bit edgy-looking (i am a lapsed scenemo kid), and i think the nostalgia factor of that association is making me extra fond of it. aggressively sweet berry and floral blast, and then it's mostly just a really pleasant wrist-to-nose sweetness on the skin. passion flower note makes me really happy bc they used to grow over the front of my house. smells really good on clothes actually! poor longevity and will only be smelled by others when hugging me, but i think i'll be wearing it as an inoffensive work scent or when i want to feel cosy around the house. it's not how i want to be perceived... but it might be how i perceive myself a little bit lol

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Opens with juicy blackberry & softens into light florals & sweet chocolate.
It's soft, perfect for cuddling up or just to smell good w/out making a big statement.
Great for summer nights or chill mornings when you just want to feel cozy & a lil sexy.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: The initial spray on this is quite pretty. It has the citrus of the original but starts to get sweet and a bit floral. It’s bright and fresh! However, within a few minutes, it fades away into almost nothing! When I first sprayed this, I thought I was going to like it best in the line, and if it weren’t for the longevity issue I probably would. The Mexican chocolate is such an interesting note but is barely detectable after a few minutes. I even doused my hand to see if this just needs a lot of sprays and it still faded away just a quickly! It’s unfortunate, it could be a great fragrance, but it wears even lighter than a body mist.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I wouldn’t recommend this. The scent is next to nothing. Zilch. Nada. Zip. You smell nothing the second you spray it from the bottle. You get the faintest hint of juicy and fruity sweetness, mixed with patchouli and warmth. But the longevity is so poor. Even when spraying a ton, like you would a body mist, the scent is nonexistent. If you want something similar, you should try Britney Spears fantasy intense… Although that longevity isn’t too good either, but it’s definitely better.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: It might smell good, but for few minutes only, then it disappears, no sillage or projection.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
i think they named it 'shock' cuz i sprayed it on my hair and when i went outside, it smelled like a very ketchupy cheesburbger from mcdonadls. i was, indeed, in shock – not gonna lie.

the night before, it actually smelled really good on my skin. how did my chocolate berry turn into this? intresting experience. well, thanks. now i’m hungry.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
The chocolate/patchouli/amber/vanilla notes in CK One Shock are reminiscent of Mugler's Angel, especially after it sits on the skin for 1+ hrs. With that in mind, its not a patchouli bomb at all. It's refreshing and bright with a cozy dry down. It's well blended and youthful but not overly sweet.

It doesn't last very long or project very far so I have to reapply throughout the day, which I don't mind since I got my bottle at Burlington for $20. I wear it t the office and on days when it's inappropriate to suffocate people with my Angel cloud

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
This was my first brand fragrance I ever bought. Smells very young and fresh.
Office friendly and a casual, everyday scent

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: It's really unique and I don't know how to describe it, theres something rlly comforting about it though . Pretty good

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Starts with a unique splashy floral note, has a bit of a wet and green feel for me. Quickly mellows out to a comforting sweet cocoa powder with a solid base of complex undertones. After a few hours it leaves my skin smelling gorgeous with a faint complex sweetness. It's not too strong and doesn't last a long time but the lingering skin scent is superb. Great everyday fragrance, can be layered with others as well easily.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: i want to drink this

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Mas frutoso que avainillado, entiendo el precio pero lo que no me entra en la cabeza es que sean 10000000 litros.
Te acabas cansando, nunca se terminaba el bote.
Ademas me ponia mosca que no se pudiese cerrar el bote.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This opens with a blast of really nice tart blackberry! Unfortunately though it's pretty short lived, & after the blackberry settles this just smells like a tin of Nivea Cream. Very subtle & sits close to the skin.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I blond bought this when Shoppers Drug Mart had a huge $21.99 this week. I love it! Definitely a light gourmand scent for summer. It lasts as long as a body spray. I get a floral chocolate but it is light. Definitely one I will reach for when I don't want to offend too many people or when I don't know what to wear.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
I have tested it in perfume store, This perfume is light fragrance, I didn't remmber that I had noticed the ingrediants moves between notes, but I remmber that this scent is linear fruity with sweety chocolate fragrance. I think this fragrance suitable for sensitive nose people. cozy very easy to wear at summer or spring seasons. For me I don't think I will purchase it because I can get this fragrance from any quality mist.


لقد جربته في متجر العطور، هذا العطر خفيف الرائحة، لا أتذكر أنني لاحظت التنقل بين المكونات للنوتات، لكني أتذكر أن هذه الرائحة خطية فاكهية برائحة الشوكولاتة الحلوة. أعتقد أن هذا العطر مناسب للأشخاص الذين لديهم حساسية في الأنف. مريح وسهل الاستخدام للغاية في فصل الصيف أو الربيع. بالنسبة لي لا أعتقد أنني سأشتريه لأنني أستطيع الحصول على هذه الرائحة من أي رذاذ عالي الجودة.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Hey its good but it doesnt last. also it stays the way you sprayed and then goes away.
I didnt like that you have to either put the cap or spray.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: First fragrance that came to mind when I smelled this was James Bond 007 which I love! Just like that one, this Shock for Her smells beautiful but doesn't last long which makes it a wonderful bedtime fragrance.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I really like this for summer. It somehow manages to be both refreshing and chocolatey. It actually lasts a long time on me, though the sillage isn’t impressive. Thats alright—- I don’t always want EVERYONE to smell me.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
It's difficult in hot weather to find a perfume that knows how to be delicious without smelling like a cake rotting in the sun or some vanilla cream that should rush back into the fridge before causing general gastroenteritis. But this one succeeds, it is fresh and sweet, delicate, light, can be reapplied ( I love reapplying, especially in summer, why do people always want long steady boring things ?? I’m a proud reapplying addict because it calms me down), a little treat for those who like to smell fruity sweet without killing the crowd behind them.
A gem for discreet refined noses, young fairies and wise experts. Bonus, nobody knows it :) so please don’t tell them and keep it for yourself.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
The first perfume that I bought with my own money, everything before that was gifted to me by relatives and I didn't really have a say in what kind of scents I was getting.
Originally the bottle got me, as I were in my emo phase back then. I loved the scent and probably would still, but the longevity is so poor (lasted about an hour on my skin) that I can't justify buying it again just for the nostalgia.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
An ex-partner of mine from many years ago used to wear this and it always smelled so good on them. Bought a decant for myself all these years later and yup, still love how it smells!
I'm getting gourmand over florals in this one. Must be the chocolate and vanilla. I do wish I got the passiflora and jasmine notes, but no hint of those on my skin.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I blind bought this. Sweeter than what I normally like, but I like it. Kind of reminds me of Vera Wang Princess and my youth. I felt like wearing something different and I like it. Yeah it probably smells generic but it's lovely and sweet without being to young. I'm almost 40 and I enjoy it. No compliments yet and I get why it's so popular.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Edit: I just realized there are no citrus notes listed for this. It must be the blackberry, which I guess is pretty tart on me.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is OK. Pleasant and inoffensive. I get mostly lemon and chocolate. I enjoy the powdery chocolate note but citrus isn't usually my vibe, so I don't reach for this often.
I find I like to wear it mostly on warm Spring days or during the Summer when I'm wanting something light but different from my usual florals.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
I don’t fully understand the need people have to bash a scent they dislike and then make others feel small for liking it. As if their own taste in perfume and preferences for scents is the end all be all through which everyone else is judged. If you don’t like something, that’s fine, but I don’t think there should be any reason to say that someone with “a real palate” would hate this, thereby implying that the people that do are uneducated Neanderthals.

I guess I’m one of those uneducated philistines with an underdeveloped palate for scent because I find nothing wrong with this.

Is it sweet? A bit, yes. Is it groundbreaking? No, not really. Are there other, better scents out there? Absolutely. Is there something wrong with this perfume because of any of the aforementioned things? Nope, there isn’t.

I get something akin to orange upon first spray, then that quickly fades into something sweet, somewhat chocolatey, and a bit earthy. It is a very soft, comforting scent. Sillage is not great, but I have more expensive perfumes that have terrible sillage so I’m not going to condemn it for that. I actually find it nice to wear when I’m at home and want to feel soft and comforted. I also like to wear it when people come over and I want to wear something that smells nice, but isn’t too “perfume-y.”

Is it the most gorgeously complex scent in the world? Is it going to do somersaults every five minutes on your wrist or perform an inspired soliloquy for you as it dries down? No. But sometimes perfumes can just be simple and comforting and nice.

And if you don’t find it nice, that’s ok too. Scent is a very personal thing, informed not just by individual chemistry but also by personal experience. So whenever you read someone’s super negative review or someone’s super positive review, take both with a grain of salt.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Light and sweet. Fruity with vanilla and a hint of chocolate. To me this is perfect for a day spent listening to fun music and dancing around your house while cleaning. It’s youthful and fun. I don’t care that it’s not complex or that it’s “basic”. I have complex, great projecting fragrances for when I want that. Some days I just want to sip my iced coffee, enjoy being carefree, and be basic, and this is perfect for that. It doesn’t last long, but it’s also $20, so I’m not expecting it to.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Cheap and generic indeed, for now i dont notice elsewhat different from low sillage and longevity, but at least the sweetness is not overwhelming and people with sensitive noses may enjoy the delicacy in this one.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I like this better and better, after initial hesitation. A beautiful chocolatey scent - I rather get chocolate-undefined citrus-undefined sweet than chocolate-blackberry-vanilla. It is a genuinely pretty blend, like a chocolate praline with sugary lemon-lime filling. However, spray three times what you usually do and put half of those sprays on your clothes. Would not repurchase, but I’m using it up with joy.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Ck Shock for her is Clean sweet and fresh. This is a wonderful day time spring fragrance giving clean laundry and fresh cotton vibes. This is great for when your just hanging out around the house and want to smell nice and clean. It has low projection, silage, and longevity so don't expect much performance from this, but it's cheap enough to just re apply every few hours throughout your day.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
