I immediately took a sniff on the cap and I was "shock"! I did not expect that CK will have a scent like this because it's way different from CK One, but I love it!!! It was like love at first sight!

The vanilla here was different, more like cream. The sweetness was liven up by the raspberry.

The thing that comes into my mind when sniffing (yes, you read that right. lol) this were strawberries and cream, but it does not smell generic. This one is more sophisticated. The vanilla and sweetness is not irritating and the raspberry just goes so well as it balances the sweetness.

To those who hate scents that goes with "sweet and yummy", you ought to try this one. This might just change your mind!

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I love the original, so always fascinated by any editions, the men's is class in a bottle, yummy. Out of curiosity I tried this, it's incredibly sweet, pretty and soothing. I bought one for the hell of it. Nice on towels and bedding. I get vanilla, sugar and strawberries, and who wouldn't want that. Zero association with the original though.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Let me just tell you that most reviews just don't fulfill me. Like when you're thirsty and all you drink is a sugary soda and after awhile you're dying of thirst and all you really need is pure water.

Well, let me tell you.... I am your water!

Let me give you a sense of relief by saying that you won't be reading stuff like : 'it's sweet but not sickly sweet.' Or 'it's sweet but not cloying.'

You know that moment when you see a really cute scene like a baby, or a father figure kissing that baby's nose , or an elderly man caressing his elderly wife with his shaky old hands..... It's an ' awe' moment, right?

That's ck one shock!
It's an 'Awe perfume'. Can't really offend anyone. Very innocent. Very yoghurty. And yoghurt was never too sweet.

It's very 'Aweeeee'.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: For some reason this has a similar smell to downtown perfume on my skin, even though the notes are very different.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: i love the first notes but when it dries down,,it becomes too powdery thats when i hate it :(

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I typically steer clear of incredibly sweet fragrances, but this isn't your average teenage girl blast of sugar nausea, it is a much more sophisticated and classy sweet fragrance for confident young women. The opening scent is a sharp sweetness which is perhaps what earns it the name 'shock'. After around an hour of wear it dies down into a lovely creamy vanilla floral, nothing spectacular but a lovely comforting feminine fragrance for every day wear. I don't detect any cocoa or berries unless I spray a lot of it, but the sweet vanilla stands out all the way through with the odd waft of floral. I also think the bottle reflects the scent well, understated for the most part but with a clear stand out element. I don't think this will ever become a classic or a favourite, but overall it's a nice fragrance.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I find this absolutely perfect for me as a gourmand lover. It's a soft billowy chocolate-covered fruity floral. It's just gorgeous on my skin, non-offensive at all. In my opinion, you could wear this anywhere and anytime. Also, biggest bottles I've EVER seen, so you can afford to spray and spray and spray... and spray some more ;)

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
The Shock for me was where are all the mentioned notes?!

What I get is a very soft vanilla.
It isn't bad at all &
I would not mind receiving it as a gift or maybe buy it on a whim :)
Why Im not really sure because I already know it's not something I'd wear that often.

But I think it would be nice for times I can't decide what to wear ~~ good for a simple non offensive go to scent :)
Longevity 4-5 . Sillage about the same .

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Sadly this perfume gave me my first lesson in "try, try & try again" before buying.
When I first tried this on randomly while out shopping one day I loved it! I had to get me a bottle right away.
Since owning it I have had a headache & felt very ill EVREY single time I have used it. Including now as I write this review. I dont know what it is in it that does it, maybe the poppy, or the passion flower, or a combination of the notes combined, but I have never had such a reaction to a perfume before.

Really is a shame because it was such a lovely one at first and i felt was ever changing.
Oh well, it's off to have a new home with a friend tomorrow.

product_name: CK One Shock For Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
I have this fragrance, and I love the scent of it, but i won't be replacing it as it doesn't last more than a half hour on me.

It smells like candy floss (cotton candy) berries and chocolate, so it stands out from other youthful sweet frags, which tend to be juicy-fruit, chewing gum sweet.

It is a very youthful fragrance, feminine, but modern and sleek, rather than feminine prissy-pretty! It's a very wearable everyday scent. Suitable for work and play. My hubby loves this smell!

It only lasts a very short time though, which is such a shame. It doesn't reach far either.

If it was a bit cheaper it wouldn't matter so much, as you would spray it liberally! I have found that Ck lighter, cleaner smells don't seem to last long, but the big spicy/floral scents last ages

This would be a good first foray into gourmands.

For such an inexpensive fragrance, this is great! Spring/Summer wear only. Have tried in Fall/Winter and it just doesn't work. Yes, it has a similar vibe to Versace Eau Fraiche. Gets compliments sometimes, but never a negative remark. Worth the buy.

Don't recall the normal CK free smelling like anything of note(LOL) but this is good...BUT it fades quick, and smells(to me anyways) like a weaker Versace Eau Fraiche. Good, but not great due to the mildness and essential plagiarism!

I actually like this scent a lot. I get oranges and just clean freshness. Really nice. Definitely a casual scent. The only thing that stinks is the longevity and sillage. Both are just baby breaths and then they're gone.
price 7/10
projection 5/10
sillage 4/10
longevity 4/10
scent 7.5/10
bottle 6/10

overall 5/10

Hmm where did i smell that one before, oh now
i know, it reminds me a lot of the new Boucheron
quatre, they do share some similarities tho
i think that boucheron has a more quality
juice than this one, but this is a great summer fragrance anyway and way cheaper, not bad at all.

I have CK Free and CK Free Blue and I like them but the longevity stinks. This fragrance, CK Free Energy is different and actually lasts longer than the others. I received two compliments the first day I wore it. This one is a keeper and it is already value priced. I purchased a 3.4 oz bottle for only $26.06 with no tax and free shipping. I highly recommend this fragrance, it reminds me of the long forgotten CK One Electric.
beautiful blend of notes. to be tested.
I'm just here for the Futura2000 bottle.
Smells exactly the same as the original, only difference is the bottle. This is lower quality than the original, stays 1.5-2 hours. The drydown is almost undetectable.

I am officially giving up on the Eternity Summer line. Have sampled through 2016 and just cannot get on board. Overall, too masculine and the 2014 and 2015 versions are nearly indistinguishable to me, so much green, almost evergreen.

Blind buy. I really don't like how the bamboo note hits you. It's like I rolled on a field of wet grass on a summer's day, but it doesn't really jive if you wear this to work. Probably better as an outdoor perfume. Lasts long though.

Blind buy in winter, first spray and...... I'm in summer. Blazing sun, long hot nights and iced drinks!!!! Oh wait it's frosty outside- mmmm better go and spray again, argh there we go back to summer. Bliss!!!

For me, this is a straight up cucumber-melon scent, light on the melon, vaguely reminiscent of various '90s toiletries or body mists. I've been interested in trying out perfumes with watermelon notes lately, and this one misses the mark as far as watermelon goes--doesn't have any sweet, fruity, juiciness to it. It is rather wet (perhaps the water lily + bamboo is what I am smelling as cucumber?) and more vegetal than floral to me. More than anything, this smells to me like a cucumber-melon lotion, or cucumber deodorant, cucumber soap. I get a definite "bath product" vibe; which I suppose could read as "clean."

If you want to smell like you just stepped out of a shower (that involved cucumber-melon shower gel followed by cucumber lotion and cucumber deodorant, and perhaps then dressing in clothes that have been wash with some kind of cucumber-y fabric softener...), this would be legitimately great! Maybe if you were really hot and sweaty and didn't have immediate access to a shower?? I don't -dislike- this. But I'm not particularly interested in perfumes that just make me smell showered or laundered--and again, 0 watermelon--so I don't think this is a keeper for me.

I had to add to my review below how much i love this. The water lilies,lotus and watermelon shine through a lot. 3 of my favorite accords. It's very feminine. Projects perfectly. Not too little or too much. Lasts a good amount of time to where you won't get sick of it and can apply a different fragrance for night if you're too rushed to shower mid day. Not too sweet at all. Non offensive and office safe. One of my all time favorites.

I find this fragrance very aquatic and floral. I detect some pear and bamboo. It reminds me of Eternity Summer 2008,which i used to own. It was a humid day today and it lasted 6 hours on me just like Eternity Summer 2008 used to on me. The only difference i can note is that Eternity Summer 2014 is more fruity floral and a little less bamboo and aquatic than Summer 2008 I like it. I hope to start newer memories with this one than the 2008 edition which i wore to work daily for a year in South Florida.

I got this at Marshalls for $25. There were three bottles of it available and all were opened which should've clued me in that I wouldn't like it.

This fragrance doesn't really smell aquatic, but it smells clean. It reminds me of synthetic clean linen which isn't a bad scent, but it wasn't what I was expecting or looking for. On my skin I get more of the white florals with a touch of bamboo, none of the watermelon or pear I was looking forward to. I think it's suitable for late twenties and up, as it does smell a bit more serious and not very playful.
I bought this blind based on the soft notes in the description and I'm not disappointed. Really nice fragrance!

I found the 3.4 oz bottle at TJ Maxx for $29.99, which is a great price for a nice summer scent. I was actually considering paying full retail price for the smaller bottle, but glad I saw it at TJ Maxx. I like the twist of bamboo in this fragrance. It's fresh, floral, creamy, and soft. Perfect for hot summer days when I want a breezy, summery scent. I love the drydown. I dislike the original Eternity and always look forward to the summer versions.

Tried this twice now. The start is lovely green, just like fresh cut grass in the summer. I love it. From the heartnotes I get something that reminds me a lot of Body Shops Amazonian Wild Lily. Very bright and floral, at the same time discreet. First time I tried it I got absolutely no drydown whatsoever, it just disappeared. Second time I tried it was on a hot (for Scotland) summers day, and finally I could smell the basenotes, they're really quite nice! But it takes a real hot summer's day to bring out this perfume, and I don't think a bottle of this size will be of much use where I live.

Just got this scent tonight at a local Marshall's for $30! Surprised that they had such a new fragrance!

I sprayed it, and I loved it at first smell. It reminds me a little bit of Vera Wang's Sheer Veil, if you combined it with the original Eternity, you would get this!

It's really fresh and perfect for the summer months. It's a light, but somehow strong scent at the same time. A perfect combination of aquatic notes, floral notes, and fruity ones! It's a well-rounded scent that is not too strong in any one area in a way that's overwhelming, but also each area is well-defined and unique!

I would highly recommend this one if you've liked any of the other Eternity Summer editions, or the original Eternity!

It's very fresh and doesn't last very long on me. In fact I can barely smell anything just an hour after I sprayed it. I got this new just yesterday and I've tested it twice. Still don't last very long. Smell's good for summer as it's non heavy. But I think I have to look for something else. Even EDT from M&S last longer on me. So sad :(

Very delicate, fresh scent, surely good for hot summer. However, it is too mild for me. Moreover, after a short time, I can barely smell it, I mean, I have to touch my wrist with my nose. So office totally safe, I think.

It is ironic that this scent comes in a pastel purple, lilac flanker because that is what this fragrance has become in my mind... Even though this isn't listed in the notes, I get the most amazing purple hyacinth, along with the water lily and gardenia.
This is Easter in a bottle. I was attracted by the bamboo and there is quite a nice watery, green-ness to the dry down.
I don't find this sweet, regardless of the fruity notes, I just get fresh spring flowers and clean watery plants all with a lavender hue....

A beautiful fragrance, however the sillage is not as strong as id have loved.
Constant re-application is required...
But overall CK rocks, and i love the summer editions that come every year.
for me and i don't know why this smell just like fresh LILAC...and what a surprise-it's not in the listed notes...strange,very strange!!!

Lots of Eternity Summer flankers, this one is very nice, I like it, it is floral, fresh. Easy to wear. One of their best versions so far... Fresh floral. Smells so good!!!i don't find it soapy or powdery..
Too bad it only comes in big bottles, but once I find it at a discount, I will buy it, it is so feminine, rounded and springlike!!!

I really wanted to love this as I have the original Eternity. I smelled a lot of rose for some reason and very little watermelon. Reminded me of a pretty pink floral soap like my grandma used to have. It's soft and pleasant enough, but after leaving it on all night, it also gave me a rash.:(

Very floral and a blast of Spring initially. Then, it settles down to a lovely soft floral with a bit of the bamboo clean feel mixed with the mandarin/watermelon. I saw that one reviewer got rose, I got that as well, but I also got lilac, which is also not listed. I enjoy these flankers every year and look forward to them. They are reasonably priced and help me welcome Spring. Macy's has it.

I just bought this today on impulse, and I love it! The initial spray is a blast of floral, and smells like rose to me, although that is not one of the notes listed. That overwhelming burst dries down quickly and smells very fresh and lovely. It lasted 5+ hours on me, although it stays close to the skin. I definitely recommend this for summer!

The notes makes me think it should be a nice perfume.
Let's see on me...
Let's see....the 2013 version I got was so fresh & lovely but lasted 0 time on my skin :(

THIS IS NOT A REVIEW...just an observation. I am shocked that so many people on Fragrantica know what AXE smells like! Apparently, many frag heads shop at trailer park convenience stores!! Lord, I'm an elitist..

Orjinal olarak satın aldığım ilk parfümdü bu. Daha önce o kadar da fazla parfüm koklamamış birisi olarak harika bir koku olarak gelmişti ve gerçek parfümlere ne kadar geç kaldığımı düşündürmüştü. O zaman mağazaya BDC alma hedefi ile gitmiştim ama satıcı bana bunu yeni çıktı diye önermişti. YAZ AYINDA. Öve öve bitiremediği bu kokunun yazlık olduğunu ona düşündüren neydi anlam veremedim. Gerçi performansı o kadar kötü ki insanlara koku ulaşmayacağı için rahatsız edeceğini düşünmüyorum. Ama yine de koku profili olarak kışlık kullanıma daha uygun. Tatlı ve aromatik kokunun içinden kakaoyu ilk günden o ham burnumla bile alabiliyordum.

Parfüm gerçek anlamda ilk parfümüm olduğu için uzun bir süre günlük hayatıma dahil olmuştu ve o zamanlarda yaşadığım duygular bu kokunun içinde gömülü. Şu an bu parfümü elimden çıkardım ama geri almak gibi bir planım var. Bu kadar spesifik olarak bana anıları/duyguları hatırlatan bir parfümüm hala yok. Mevcut şişelerimin yanında kalite/koku/performans olarak geri kalsa da bir çoğundan daha önemli bir yere sahip benim için.

Son yorumum ise eğer benim gibi özel bir yeri yoksa CK parfümü alınmaz.
i tried this from a 1.5ml tester. it's ok for the first 5 minutes then it just gets too sweet and turns more feminine. i don't like it.

I tested it in unusually hot and humid weather 🌡️💦, so it’s hard to judge it fairly. It seemed good, I guess 🤔—but I feel like I didn’t give it a fair shot. Definitely needs a proper, focused re-test 🧪🔁.

I need to mention this first cause when I first sprayed it, I thought it was light and not projecting but I was very wrong. I walked out of the dining table and came back only to realise that it was fully in the air. This stuff projects silently but really well. Has good longevity too. Smell wise, I see AXE Chocolate there but this does not smell like that at all. It started with a clean soapy blue scent type of lavender. As it dried down, it became more powdery and the cacao shows it self there. If you go in for a closer sniff, you can smell the pepper there. My brain is connecting the dots and telling me that its F black by Ferragamo kind of pepper but with a powdery chocolaty base. Is this something very complex and unique ? Not really. Does it smell good tho ? yes it does. Looking for a clean chocolaty powdery scent thats not sickeningly sweet and has good projection and longevity ? give this a try.
Way sweeter than expected. Don't really care for it. It's just a boring linear vanilla sweet scent.

expensive version of chocolate axe that was popular as a kid in high school.

I cant wrap my head around the scent. cacao as a top note is a weird mix with lavender. Cant think of any situations where i would wear this.

I sampled it , and liked so much that bought the 200ml at an very good price , after i broked the seal and let it to macerate for 5 weeks and after this 5 weeks the magic started like the tester from the shop i was.
What is weird after 2h i feel some fruity note that i am not sure wich is (blackcurrant or blueberries) but blends amazing with the cocoa , even that has cocoa on my skin when is applied do not smell sweet or very sweet , its more woody and i think has vetiver and , but not sure pine needles as olfactory note.
Its not a beast at sillage, but on longevity on my PH goes really well 9+ hours.
Sillage : 3/5 i wish they could make it project more then 1.5-2h and more then an arm lenght at how great smell on my skin , but for the price that i pay'ed is more then ok (99€ that was a bargain for 200ml)
Longevity 5/5 9+ hours is quite good
Versatility and Olfactory notes 5/5 in my case can wear it to everything and the fact that is not overly sweet on me is a pleasant surprise.

As a suggestion test it before or sample it and for sure not everyone will like it or love it.

The balance of clean lavender and warm, comforting cocoa is really nice, and makes this an easy reach for casual every day wear.

Since spraying this first around a month ago, the lavender has calmed significantly and the cocoa is now stronger and blooms within the first ten to fifteen minutes. (It took hours to be barely noticable under the opening notes initially.)

Masculine till it dries down, then gets more unisex throughout the rest of the wear time.

12h+ noticable sillage/longevity sprayed 3 times over moisturised skin, and the slightly floral chocolate in the dry down stays as a skin scent till you wash it off.

Moderate projection with a subtle intensity. I can smell it but it's not really noticable to others unless they're right up close.

Another fragrance with a stupid low rating it doesn't deserve.

This is a calm, blue scent that no one will be offended by. The cacao tone isn't overwhelming, and you may not even perceive it as cacao. Lavender is the star of the show: relaxing and subtly sweet.

There's something floral and slightly indolic to my nose if you smell it super close off skin, but it's very warm and inviting in the air and I don't get the indolic intimations off clothing.

Glad I gave this a shot in spite of the negative reviews. If you like soft, sweet fragrances like those in the Boss The Scent line, you'll probably dig this one.

I don't know how people call this "Axe Dark Temptation"... Nowhere near close that IMO. I don't even get that cacao much honestly but yeah there is a slight nuance coming from it which is really cool and not overwhelming.
I can say that, this fragnance may not be the most unique one out there, may not be the best parfum I've ever had, but still, its crisp and clean and doesn't smell cheap. Also performance is not WEAK. This is the PARFUM edition, how people say its not strong... Surely it doesn't act like a niche, 200USD perfume, but the projection and longevity is just enough. It was a blind buy for me and I'm keepin it, my office friends also like it.

Though people stated that this a winter-fall perfume, it will also do the job in spring and summer nights. So this is kinda all around perfume with strong background. I recommend it if monetary concerns is not on your list when you are buying a perfume.

Edit: Dry phase of this perfume is AMAZING and this fragrance has some serious performance. It stayed like 8-10 hours on my skin without losing its notes and easily stayed like 2 days on my sweatshirt collar. And you get projection around 4 hours which is more than enough; people will notice you in office. I'm updating the overall score accordingly.

8.5/10 I would say.
This opens with fresh spicy pink pepper and lavender. Dry down is very clean and enjoyable. Longevity 6-8 hours.

This is a classic lavender "blue" fragrance with a tiny hint of cacao. Won't knock your socks off, but smells a little unique to the standard YSL Y, Dylan Blue, Sauvage combo.

Good for work, lasts long enough, leaves a nice trail. Good buy as a daily fragrance.
Axe Dark Temptation... nothing more... The Eau de Parfum is the best of the line to me

Why almost nobody speaks about this fragrancs,YT etc...
Very underrated beautiful cozy scent.It opens with red pepper,lavender and spices,in the drydown goes toward sweet cacao with musk for sure.As parfum concentration projects really well for first two hours,then became nice warm bubble around you in arm lenght for next three hours.After that sits close to skin giving you very calm feeling.Like you don't want it to fade yet.
Real fall to winter perfume,like it warms you up when you applied it.Deserve more love for sure and much higher rating,like 4.25 at least.
For me 9/10

Saw it for sale and bought it to try, didn't get to test it so it was a blind. I have the EDP and while this parfum kept the Defy dna, it does smell different. Parfum has lavender and while the same pepper smell from the EDP project, instead of the leather it's the lavender and a Chocho background and base supports it. It smells like a CH men or maybe the extreme and the robotic paco robanne...tried to be gourmandy but it's still pretty much designer. Don't really suit the older folks...
The fall season version of Defy EDP, it is pretty nice and universal for day or night, but there is NOT much cacao !!

I have been collecting for about a year now and this was the one that started it. Today in the northeast it is slightly cooler, so I decided to wear Defy. it is projecting like a beast for the first 2-3 hours of wearing it then it becomes around a 6-inch skin scent for the remaining 3-4 hours. I would say this is a perfect scent for the fall or a summer night out. the opening hits you in the face with cacao but during your second whiff you get the spiciness of the pink pepper with a cool lavender undertone. Defy is fore sure sweeter than other CK frags but it does not disappoint, if you can get it on sale grab it for the fall

Reminds me of the chocolate Axe/Lynx body spray I’d use in middle school. This is, in no way, shape or form, a blue fragrance.

Synthetic, chocolatey, peppery: imagine walking into your favourite cafe right after working out. You want to smell fresh, but you know cardio day doesn’t help a fresh cologne’s performance too much. So you spray this on.

They’ve tried to complicate it. But its complications are for the sake of complications. Lasts 5 hours on the skin. It is cheap, and it smells cheap. But it’s better than a few expensive fragrances I’ve smelled.

Minty, fresh and modern.

Opens with a mint note, it's fresh and a little aromatic.
Notes of chocolate-patchouli emerge but it remains fresh.
Becomes gourmand with vanilla aromas and something else that resembles coconut. Smells like a fig tree as it wafts through the air.
Retains the minty coolness quite well throughout.

Modern and masculine leaning, ages 18-45(ish.) Best worn during the day, any time of year, and fine for the office too.

Performance is fine, solid projection and lasts as a skin scent for 10+hrs.

Smells a little generic as it follows modern vanilla trends but smells nice and will pull compliments.

I got quiet a bit of green orange and sweet lime in the opening, mixed with sweet woodsy notes. Not found cacao (or may be a hint) but lil vetiver and vanilic sweetness. Overall I liked it and enjoyed.

Top notes: Mandarin oil, pink pepper, cardamom oil
Mid notes: Lavender, geranium, fresh ginger
Base notes: Cocoa shell, vetiver, sandalwood

Not bad, not amazing but it is mass appealing. Smells somewhat like a mix of Phantom EDT and Bad Boy Extreme in the opening and then leans towards the cacao in the dry down. Does a great job at what it's intended to do.

Edit: The more I smell this the worse it gets, I no longer agree with my statement of it being 'not bad' because now to my nose it is just awfully synthetic, had to get rid of my tester.
Similar to AF First Instinct Extreme for the spiciness. After that, dry, dusty, slightly powdery chocolate scent through all day. Imagine yourself as walking cocoa powder coated macaron.
Pretty plain and simply put; a very modern, very masculine, mass appealing scent. Great longevity. Best of the line.

Summer skin test.

This one is nothing like the edp and edt AT ALL.
That's fine, but if someone hates the other two why would they pick this one up? This should be another stand alone scent.

Anyway.

This is warm, gentle aromatics, effing lovely. I can't think off hand what it's similar to if anything, but I'd call this 'experienced nose unisex'.. you know how the black bottle of JPG is, and there's a gold one too .. and some valentinos are... that warm feel, yeah that's here.

Oh and that cheapie Beckham ... um beyond I think its called - that rounded powdery lavender- that's the aromatic level here. A bit dry too. Zero tobacco feel as I've mentioned in my reviews of the edt and edp.

This frag sits quiet,but lasts well I think.

Good job

I don't know if it's because this fragrance is the "new new" for me but i'm loving to wear this around the house now a days and I can't wait for warmer weather to wear it out and about. It's like they took all the good aspects of all past Calvin klein mens fragrances and mashed them together into one bottle. Then made sure it was modern and added some sweet cocoa and even some freshness. I'm even thinking that this can compete with its great unique blue leather predecessor Defy edp for top Calvin klein scent.

this is my first CK fragrance and it was a big surprise

this is very good one.
it does not smell cheap as its price... it is not too dark/sweet.. it is in the same vein as Bad boy EDT
smells very similar to the edp with added chocolate

Oh no, I think I've just realised what this smells like.

This, to my nose at least, smells like the chocolate Lynx/Axe spray - Dark Temptation I think it's called? It has a strong, but smooth cacao note and not much else.

I mean, it's nice, but this is a smell I haven't thought of in over a decade. As a high school student, I went absolutely feral over Dark Temptation. I love chocolate, and it was different to any of the other scents they had in their range at the time. Something about the slightly dark sweetness appealed to me. That same chocolatey sweetness that this has drew me in as well.

Is it worth buying? I'm not sure. You can get 200mL of the stuff for 100 AUD, and it's certainly going to last a lot longer than a can of Lynx. It's pretty simplistic, but it does at least go in a different direction to the other blue bottle scents. I am a firm disliker of Sauvage, BdC and Dylan Blue on account of how ordinary they smell, so I appreciate that Calvin Klein has done something different with their contribution to the trend.

That said, I find the EdP much better and more interesting than this, and you can get that for the same price. I'd go with that instead of this.
Is it just me or this reminds me of JPG Le beau LE PARFUM?

Coming from a niche lover, this is nice. Thecombination of notes are polarizing but in a good way to someone that prefers to standout from the crowd. I can report on longevity and sillage later. For now, I'm satisfied.
I will start by saying I really don't like the EDT or EDP of this. But the Parfum is lovely to my nose. Easy to wear, good performance, great price.
This is 99% same scent with the CK Obsession Night (Man EDT), it project the almost similar potent obsession night scent in a good way. It stick to my skin more than 8 hours, top quality!

Tried it. Up front it smells very incense-y. It actually smells exactly like CDG Incense Kyoto, which I own.
Dries down differently. Comes out a bit 'heavy herbal' vibe, almost vegetal. Not sure who'd want to wear this.

I like how nobody is actually reviewing this fragrance.

I haven't sampled it either but I get the vibe, nobody asked for this from Calvin Klien.

a guy wearing this must have hooked up with some incels crush; why else would he create five accounts to call this gay and feminine, 4x4 hose in hand, crying. sorry your pdm couldn't get you laid. get a life.
What's really annoying is people complaining about the complaining about the bombing but that's the internet for you 🤪

Smelt this on the weekend, it’s nice, not nearly as unique or memorable as the EDT or EDP, cacao note is prominent and not much else stood out. Doesn’t have much to do with the rest of the Defy line which I find annoying

What else is annoying it the ratio of people on here complaining about review bombing or hating on this or that, more than I see anyone actually bombing or hating, I see people complaining about it
At least doesn't have ambroxan mess.

It’s not even out yet and look at all this shiz. You’re all a bunch of liars and make this site pretty insufferable at times. I’ve seen this before only for opinions to flip and suddenly hype and praise come. Can you all get a grip and wait until it’s actual out to trash? Sad as f.

It smells similar to 1 Million Royal, but not nearly as sweet. The cacao note is quite prominent because the pepper seems to bring it forward earlier than you might expect. After a brief drydown, a smooth lavender sweetness comes out. The cacao is still there, and adds a kind of nutty edge to the sweetness, like a nutmeg or dry walnut accord.

Of the Defy lineup, I would say the best one is the EdP - with it's smooth leather accord. The Parfum is a safe pick for someone who wants to smell just a tad sweet and warm/spicy. A black licorice/anise note would have done well here, to give it a bit more body. Defy Parfum is pleasant, not overly expensive, and aims to land in a restrained space to avoid being divisive. I would recommend this fragrance to someone who wants to smell intriguing, but not project an ostentatious insecurity.

To those complaining about pre-release negative comments, I hear you. I assure you, this review is based off three applications to my skin, days apart - and from a tester in a retail store in Canada. This fragrance is, in fact, released - and Canada usually gets releases weeks after the US, at best. Don't worry about the overly-negative troll reviews flipping to shill-based vapid praise in a few months. Defy Parfum is nice, but not great. It's a competent release, but won't be a tour de force on YouTube or social media as one of the greats in 2023.

Oh yeah Andy’s wig? Got a free tester?

Between comments like that and the voting from trolls who haven’t smelled this yet…this is just sad.
These people review bombing should get a damn life

The trolls are out with the votes above I see ('female' 'very weak' 'intimate and 'way overpriced') 🙄

Interesting to see how people get so upset about CK when once they hit discounters they are far more affordable and less of a rip-off than many (most?) other designer brands.

The Defy EDP was very nice, I'm looking forward to trying this (always hoping to discover another gem from CK to go with my Obsessed Intense for Men EDP and CK2).
The EDP is pretty solid in my opinion. I’ll definitely be trying the new Parfum. Discarded Cocoa shells? I did laugh…

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
I bought this at a duty free shop in an airport. I really loved the tester, and it is a huge inexpensive bottle, so i figured why not?🤷♀️
This is nice but nothing to write home about imho. I feel like it is very light and doesnt last all that long. I smell the top notes of citrus but not so much after that. I can see people liking it for the gym or exercise in general. Im wondering if it has been watered down in reformulations? I normally love a citrus vanilla - one of my favorites is taunt by dedcool and has a similar accord structure. But i like taunt much better.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Loved this perfume, and was my daily almost year-round scent. Was also my first perfume.

It's super fresh, citrusy, clean and pleasant. I was very sad when I ran out. Definitely perfect as a day to day perfume, and I find it to be a little unisex as well.

It was a blind buy, and a great one at that.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: My skin is considered “warm,” so it tends to sweeten some fragrances, but with IN2U it’s not a sugary-sweet scent. It turns into a rich amber–musk that feels warm and inviting. Every time I wear it, I feel cozy, mature and a little sensual.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This is probably one of my favorite fresh,beautifully simple, ambery! Really my favorite over all rn

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I love to wear this when I play tennis or go on walks on the pier. Very clean girl. Very refreshing. Has that early 00s DNA in the best way. Makes me want to wear an all white skort set and slicked back ponytail.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This is a great freshie perfume, it lasts a long time & has a creamy note to it as well

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Fresco, cítrico, me encanta!

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I love it but it doesn’t last on me. Not even 30 minutes later it’s like I don’t have perfume on.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I bought this cos I loved how it smelled on my best friend, powdery, cirtusy, bright, fresh- Turns out I only like it on her. Doesn´t work on my skin. Smells like a cleaning product on me. Gave it to my best friend, it just works for her.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Comfortable, never gives headaches. It evokes happy feelings. Good for everyday wear. Great longetivity for a citrus scent and price as well.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Puaj, muy malo

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Beautiful, citrus, with layers on top of vanilla and it's so special and well blended - it makes you gorgeous.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Soft, citrusy, refreshing and easy-to-wear summery scent. OK longevity and a safe blind buy.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I call this my 'tomboy' perfume as it always evokes the idea of sports in me whenever I wear it for some reason. The tart grapefruit note makes this incredibly refreshing, even somewhat energetic, while the cedar gives the fragrance a musky yet invigorating appeal. The vanilla and orchid notes are soft and not too overpowering. I like the type of femininity this expresses. It's not your typical sweet or floral scent, but more of an understated, casual femininity - effortless, carefree, a bit sporty, with a relaxed, clean vibe. It's modern and youthful without trying too hard. I normally wear this when I exercise or play volleyball or tennis, and I'm always happily reminded of my tomboy phase from when I was a young girl when all I ever did was play sports and didn't have a care in the world.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I've come to appreciate the artistry of this more and more. There's a delicacy here in the portrayal of the red-cedar which in the sillage evokes steamy saunas and red-cedar chests. It's gotten a lot more woody over time. Still quite citrus-y in the grapefruit top, but something resinous underneath plus the red-cedar woodiness which leans a bit soapy along with the steamy citrus wafting off of it. I like this more each time I wear it. Today it's giving me some passing reminders of White Tea Elizabeth Arden (although these aren't clones). Love it still. Original review 08/24/23.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is a really nice basic citrus scent! The opening is so juicy and bright like a fresh grapefruit, and it quickly morphs into a clean man fresh out of the shower. Definitely unisex, men don't overlook this one! It's very nice and for the price its worth a try for men or women!
Edit: I've just tried Wulong Cha and it smells very similar (to my nose), if you need a cheaper version of that one, check this out

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I would actually describe this perfume as unisex, it's a sweet and citrusy vanilla grapefruit scent with a faint orchid note which would be the only feminine things about it but i would definitely see a lot of men pulling this off.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is the scent my friends wore in the 00s on nights out so I bought it for the nostalgia but I now love it for myself.

It’s fresh, woody, confident and zingy. I didn’t always understand the hype 20 years ago, but I get it now.

The transition from grapefruit and lemon to woody vanilla is delicious. Like a more citrusy White Tea, or a more masculine-leaning precursor to Devotion.

It lasts a decent while and the cost is so low that I can (re)spray with abandon.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Oh this feels like a cold, iced lemon tea with water drops on the outside of the glass on a hot summer day. I really like this! Tried it in store and was really positively surprised. The attached price tag makes this even better. Will be adding this to my collection soon to throw in my gym bag!

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This is a great gym/yoga/pilates scent 🍋

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is one of the first fragrances I ever started wearing. My Mom loved CK so I’d steal her bottle all the time. You can smell the lemon when you first spray it, and then there is a creamy vanilla dry down that has always mixed SO well with my skin. I have gotten many compliments with this one over the years, and this will forever be a go to fragrance!

Perfect for spring/summer, but I wear it year round!

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: If you remember CK fragrances when they first came out in the 90’s… this is very reminiscent of that unisex DNA that most of the CK fragrances had. However… there is something in this that makes it stand out much more and is so addicting to me. I’m not a big freshie lover…I have maybe 70 ish fragrances and about 5 or six freshies that I love. This is one of them. 100% unisex. Absolutely beautiful grapefruit and lemon and dries down to a more woody citrus. If you like truly unisex fragrances, or if you like citrus/grapefruit openings in your fragrance, I don’t see how you couldn’t like this. I honestly don’t think this fragrance can offend anyone. Its sillage and projection are not the greatest…however, I bought a 5oz bottle for under $20. Literally cheaper than a bath and body works mist these days and about the same lasting power as Jo Malone fragrances. I don’t understand how this does not have more hype and I’m kinda glad about it because I don’t want to smell like everyone else. If I smelled this on a male, I would go crazy… but I honestly love it just as much on myself. I would pay three times the price that this is selling for. Definitely an oldie but goodie and is a timeless freshie that I could never be without.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: My mother was gifted this and used it as a toilet spray but i found it when it was almost finished and wanted to put the bottle on my table for display and smelled the last sprays which were very very appealing. As a man I am proud to say this is one of the best fragrances I've ever smelled and I'm planning to buy this for personal use.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
CK IN2U holds so many good memories for me. It’s fresh, energetic, and effortlessly wearable, with a unisex vibe that almost leans masculine. The bright grapefruit and bergamot opening feels crisp and clean, while the vanilla and amber add a subtle warmth without being sweet.
🍋🌵🪵🌿
Casual yet distinctive, this scent is perfect for anyone who loves fresh fragrances. If you enjoy unisex leaning scents, CK IN2U is definitely worth checking out.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I aggressively love this. I see so many this is good comments but this is aggressively good. I just dosed myself in lemon water. And as it dries down it gets creamier. The opening is bomb. Not too much it's going to be so good in the warm weather even though we don't get much of that here

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I used to enjoy wearing this perfume to the gym - it’s refreshing and invigorating. However, over time, I developed sensitivity to the amberwood chemicals that many manufacturers have started adding to perfumes in recent years to enhance sillage and longevity (though most people don’t notice their scent). Unfortunately, this perfume contains some of those compounds, and unfortunately it ruined it for me. Now, I smell a distinct screechy note that messes with the fresh and fruity accords, making it unwearable for me. Off my shelf it goes.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells fresh, lasts about 20 minutes. I wear it to the gym

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
An excellent fragrance that adapts to the wearer. A man and a woman can wear this.

I love its burst of freshness. So much romance in a bottle!

My dad smelled like this. Full of vitality, strength, and a lot of sass that surpassed any man.

This is just beautiful.

01/10/2025
During the day this is all I want. I wake up craving this like I am starving for food. CK into You is a lemon with a pinch of sugar I don't think I'll ever be able to live without.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Yes, it’s a little more masculine for my taste and the longevity isn’t great, but that burst of citrus in the opening is quite refreshing. It’s a pretty great summer scent for those days when you need something light and airy and crisp.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This is a bit disappointing for me. I bought it because of a review, but let me tell u this doesn't last more than two 2hrs especially in winter time. The scent is not bad, but don't waste ur money on this. It's a bit synthetic and outdated. About the unisex if u like more masculine fragrances just buy the male version.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Classic citrusy floral. Perfect for the summer or spring. It smells like fresh Lemonade with a little hint of vanilla. It smells like covering Prickly Pears in lemon and salt or making nopal (cactus) salad and drenching them in lemon juice on a hot summer day. On the dry down I can smell Orchid and Red Currant leaf.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Fresh, citrusy vanilla. The first perfume I had when I was in high school. I remember not being able to smell it on myself a few hours after spraying it.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
This smells like a womans perfume to me. I'm not sure why people think this is unisex.
It's got a lovely bright citrus opening then the drydown is floral with a grassy sort of smell .
Guess it's the cactus note. After a while the grassy note dissappears and its powdery sweetness . I Don't detect any of the basenotes apart from a hint of vanilla. It's a skin scent after around 20 minutes. It's a nice summer freshie for women
Longevity around 3 to 4 hours.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
The opening reminded me of a fresh green apple explosion (although no apple note is listed). Then it got a bit too soapy for my taste in the down.
I think all genders could wear this.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This perfume is so nostalgic to me and i dont even know why

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I think this is the first "proper" perfume I really liked. This perfume is a warm citrus. It sprays on with a lime-heavy scent until it dulls to a semi-sweet key lime pie kinda smell. I think it's wonderful, but I wouldn't call it the most feminine scent. It's a safe unisex, I'd say. I wonder what the male version of this line smells like. You can usually find this perfume at Burlington/TJMaxx/Marshalls/etc for $20. Super affordable and one of my go-to if I'm in the mood for a fresh scent. I recommend!

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Beautiful every day sporty kinda unisex perfume. Citrusy vanilla accord. Price is good. I like to wear it with leisure clothes. Clean fresh cozy scent. Budget friendly. Highly recommend👍

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: The citruses are a bit tangy. Smells a bit like men's cologne.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I love it! The drydown is sweet but not cloying, feminine, bright. It smells very very good and for the price this is an absolute gem.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
As other reviews say, it‘s quite generic but that’s why I bought it. I just wanted a perfume that didn‘t bother me. Reason why I could wear it even when I was pregnant and everything else made me sick.
It smells mostly like amber on me, my skin always pulls the sweetest notes out of perfumes somehow.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
I love this stuff! I've had my bottle for somewhere between 12-15 years and it smells exactly the same as it ever did.

This scent is zingy and energetic, and I've never smelled anything like it. It's a citrusy vanilla that manages to be fresh and aromatic, not cloying. I love the brightness of the grapefruit, the very soft vanilla and hints of greenness. It also has a "glossy" smell to it, reminding me of the high gloss pages of a magazine.

Performance is also fantastic - this stuff lasts on my clothes all day. And people here seem to have voted this as a summer scent, but I totally disagree. Back in the day I specifically used to spray this in winter! These days I see it as an excellent all-year-round scent.

If you like fresh citrus perfumes but you hate the poor longevity, you can't go wrong with this one.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: It's ok but has the smell of masculine cologne so I don't use it very often. For me it's for occasional use or after shower.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I spontaneously purchased this scent when I saw it on sale. In general, I love Calvin Klein perfumes. This one feels richer, more collected and mature compared to the others. A good combination of citrus freshness and maturity.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: this smells like a forest or, any kind of greenery for that matter, after it's rained. Like damp greenery in short. So it's not whimsical or cottagecore in any way, but rather, it's fresh and sporty. It's something you'd wear outdoors preferably, but i can imagine it being a staple gym scent, for both men and women. I like it!

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: It smells very generic and like any other ceder wood/lemony perfume. I regret buying it. The price is no excuse to make a perfume that is so basic...I am sorry but that's how I feel. I hate that I bought it based on reviews from a youtuber. I should know by now that smells are subjective.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
A gorgeous perfume.. and the price? 🔥
Years ago, this girl smelled like heaven.. Then I bought it and I was in love, my skin was super compatible with this scent.
Citrusy vanilla, I can affirm that could be labeled unisex, but not masculine!!

Over the years, I got the impression that this has been reformulated, because of the longevity and some flankers I bought had this scratchy citrus that was not in a first place.. and in a way it lacked depth it had..

But I'm going to buy it regardless.. Can somebody tell me (people who love this scent maybe) is this anyhow similar to Santal Complet?

⭐️

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: It just smells like some sort of men cologne or after shave, is not very feminine. I had this a few years ago. I feel like this is more suitable for men.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I bought this one 5 years ago and didnt like it at first, found it in one of my boxes today and i smelled it again. It turned in to a sweet citrus perfume and became more feminine and strong. Just hide it and use it in a few years, u will love it

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Oh how I love to try the cheapies!. Unfortunately for me this was one of those blind buy fails. I get a blast of grapefruit in the opening (which.I like) but this disappears very quickly and all I am left with is cedar. Just two notes are all I can smell! When I purchase a fragrance and see it has cedar in it, I await it's arrival with trepidation, actually more akin to dread. It's a note that has ruined many a perfume for me, it just doesn't smell nice on my skin and I would say it's very masculine. Some fragrances I own and really like do have cedar, so I am quite confused about this.

People have said this is a freshie. Would I describe it as fresh? Well, it starts out that way and then swiftly turns into a musty, sweaty armpits kind of smell on my skin. That may be ok on a man but it's not exactly attractive or appealing on a woman lol. Not a safe blind buy then, but for the price I guess you have nothing to lose.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Its a clean fresh scent that doesn't smell like soap or a laundry detergent. It transitions from citrus to woody and then vanilla. It stays close to the skin. Great for all year round. It works best for me in the summer without smelling like bug spray.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This is a great freshly for the summer, indeed not very feminine, but very "out of the shower" citrus. To me, it reminds a lot of Green Tea from Elizabeth Arden, so I was a bit surprised when I haven't seen this one listed here as close to it.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I adore this perfume. I blind bought it because it was so cheap at Walmart. I actually didn't like it at first, as I loved the bright grapefruit opening but I thought the mid became too masculine, or really, too CK One in DNA. However, I sampled this one off and on for about 3 weeks, and now I'm really in love. I don't find the mid too masculine; in fact, I've embraced its astringent tea note (despite tea not being listed) amidst a backdrop of soft vanilla. It's like having a cup of tea with a lemon scone. It's both uplifting and cozy at the same time with that little hug of non-gourmand vanilla. It makes me really happy to wear this and the heat makes it shine! Longevity is quite good, as is sillage. The only thing I don't love is the plastic atomizer, but besides that, I would definitely repurchase. It's something I would keep in my collection as long as I can get it!

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
On the blotter, CK IN2U for Her initially smells predominantly citrusy, but on the skin, it transforms into a rough vanilla with hints of grapefruit. I love this unsweetened vanilla, which gives the fragrance a special charm. While the fragrance starts off bright, it soon blends with the skin, creating a clean skin effect. This effect is achieved thanks to the cedar and vanilla in the base.

I chose this perfume for summer and find it to be an excellent neutral scent for various occasions – whether it's for a walk, sports, or work. Although the fragrance doesn't strike me as too masculine, I think it can be unisex, suitable for both women and men.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
I am not sure why this is marketed specifically as a woman's fragrance when it is completely unisex or could be even marketed as men's cologne that could also be unisex. There is no sweetness. It is just a carbonated citrus blast but moderate and less screechy or in your face at least and then dries down into subtle whiff base notes.

This would be ideal for those who prefer to share fragrances or prefer an androgynous understated clean smell.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This fragrance reminds me so much of the Anthropologie Capri Blue Volcano candle, it’s sweet and citrusy, but in the best way possible. It’s sugary lemon goodness and definitely not offensive, 100% one for Summer 🍋

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Its a beautiful and unique scent. But to me it is masculine, to my husband it is feminine. I would love it if he wore it but he doesn’t. Neither do I. Its complicated.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: A woody creamsicle scent that, despite being marketed towards women, I think it has a clean masculine edge to it. It is a citrus perfume that I think shines in colder weather. I find this one to be very long lasting and the citrus note stays for a very long time. You can get a large bottle of this for a really good price too!

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I keep trying this one because I like the opening, but a few hours in, it's just a no. It loses the citrus scent (which I really like) and turns masculine after the dry down.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Refreshing I can see this as a good gym scent & occasionally in summer spring. Not big on it for every day.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is a very weak short lived slightly citrus tea scent.

The bottle is difficult to handle while spraying too.

I'm usually impressed by CK but this 1 is a disappointment.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
very generic, “blah” scent. not bad, but nothing spectecular. it smells like a cheap drug store body mist which you won’t remember at all how it smelled like after finishing the bottle. to be honest, even some avon perfumes are more catchy than this.

if you want to buy a perfume gift, in2u is a great choice. so dull but it won’t make anyone upset... you just spray it until you empty the bottle and won’t remember it ever again.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Uhm, citrusy, perfect for the gym in a hot summer day. It doesn't smell artificial to me. I would say it has a Unisex vibe. I mixed it with Pink Sugar and it made it fresh, I believe now I can wear Pink Sugar at the gym😅👌

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: More like a masculine scent for me... gave it to my brother after I got the bottle. But it is versatile, gives a fresh scent and could be used for a daily use.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Bought it for my mom, very yummy fragrance. I sprayed it on my wrists at night, woke up the next morning, can still smell it after a shower.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Bought this for my mum and she says it's masculine so I bought her Coco Chanel instead.

It's unisex so I took this for myself as it smells like Missoni Pour Homme. I'll try it again in the summer and update this 🌞

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I like this. Different than my normal favorites - the vanilla would usually be a no go for me - but everything else here keeps it on the fresh side of sweet. Casual and easily unisex. Lasts all day for me. I don't reach for it enough but I'm always pleased with it when I do. Can't imagine wearing it in heat, though - I think it might be a bit stifling in warmer weather.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: When I first sprayed, I thought it was too masculine. The weather was also warm and humid at the time. I have let it sit for a month or so and resprayed it tonight and I like it a lot more, it smells very unisex, but now it is colder. I live in FL, so how perfumes smell/perform in the heat is crucial. I hope it remains unisex leaning feminine when I try it again in hot weather! I get an aromatic citrus, a profile I have been looking for that doesn't smell masculine - please let this be the one!

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: For me, however, it almost brings back a Christmas atmosphere.... where you can almost smell the garlands made of pine needles, it must be the red juniper reported here by Fragrantica, I loved the beginning, loving citrus fruits, I really liked it.. but it's the aftermath that I don't like and doesn't convince me! I was definitely expecting a perfume that was sensual enough because of the orchid, but more than sensual it feels a little stale, almost old! I purposely looked for the check/fresh on the site and it doesn't depend on the perfume (I thought it was bad), probably too amber for my nose, it gives me the feeling of an old, truly adult men's perfume! Yes for men because I feel it is more masculine than feminine and I assure you that I own several unisex brands from this brand, indeed perhaps more tending towards the masculine than feminine gender! As always when it comes to noses, everyone has their own and so be it, otherwise we would be poor... we would all be the same.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
At first I thought this was very masculine, almost like an aftershave. I then appreciated the fresh, crisp, citrus notes, although I would class this as a unisex fragrance, rather than feminine.

This also performs like a body mist for me, so I use this to layer rather than on its own. So for the performance, I would say it's overpriced.

I would not repurchase this again.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I love to wear this fragrance during colder months due to amber and vanilla notes. It reminds me of a citrus body lotion, it is fresh but at the same time it has this lotion-like smell. After 3h i can't smell the fragrance on myself, but i received compliments on it even after 8+ hours.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Fresh citrus without extra sweetness. It has a bit of brightness to it, nice bit for someone who enjoys lemon or orange scents. I dont get any vanilla or green from the cedar in here at all
This would have been nice as a body spray more than a perfume, honestly I use it as an air freshener or on my sheets instead of on my skin.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I love this scent, but I only wear it in October, so I don't get much use out of it. It's autumn in a bottle - I'm missing the freshness that a lot of people are mentioning, but instead there's a bitter orange opening to it, settling into a smoky, earthy amber. I could maybe stretch this to late August, but I really think this smells better in the cold air.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
An all season, daytime scent that does not live up to other offerings by Calvin Klein.

If CK IN2U Her maintained the beautiful green fruitiness of the opening, I would be in LOVE. But Almost immediately into the drydown it becomes a powdery sour vanillic scent. The Amber in here is the cloying, powdery variety; and it smells both sickly and uninteresting?

I wish this was more of a balsamic Amber, with a prominent cactus note. But unfortunately, this one is a pass.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This is a masterpiece. It took not one, not two but FOUR different renowned perfumers to create this citrusy toilet cleaner in the perfume form. Just unbelievable.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I got this as a gift from my parents back in 2007 who unfortunately had no idea what I like and it didn't suit me at all in the long run as I am more of a woody smokey ambery person.. It had a strong grapefruit smell that I think was a bit overpowering and I felt slightly nauseous at first, but I remember it drying down quite gently and became more soft as the amber developes and actually lands on a nice creamy ending. However it aged quite badly because now when I retried it (the same bottle, as I never used it back then) it now smells like toilet cleaner and I blaspherely use it as a air freshner in the bathroom - but mind you this is after a good 16 years haha.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Grapefruit comes across strong, but creamy rather than sharp due to the musk/vanilla. I live in the tropics where wearing strong perfumes is not the norm, and I find this comes across a little bit too strong in the day, as well as in office environments. I slowly stopped using it in favour of fresher, more green scents. I think it works best for hot, tropical nights out, and in late spring/early autumn.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: For some reason this smells like sickly vanilla to me. No freshness at all. Gave it to my sister and she liked it.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Amazing fragrance when you’re at, and after the gym..! Fresh citrus but also a bit soft and creamy, like a lemonade/whipped cream-bodywash.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
I received this perfume as a gift. First thought was it's not my thing. Too fresh or something.
But after giving it more than a few tries it turned out to be a fresh, clean and also powdery fragrance. I don't reach out for it much but it's also a very nice bedtime scent.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This is a nice citrus at first spray. A light nice citrus scent. Then I get citrus and vanilla it smells really good. Well, at least until the dry down. It turns into a powdery vanilla citrus, which is not my thing. It's a bit to powdery. Maybe I will try it again in the winter....maybe.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Me encanta, para mi es un aroma perfecto siento más el aroma a vainilla qué el cítrico, muy recomendable

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I blind bought this because someone referred to it as summer in a bottle and it smells sour on me :( pretty bummed

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: So I was gifted this perfume and this isn't the first Calvin Klein perfume I own, but the first one I bought (Obsession) was absolutely amazing and blew me away. Didn't know what to expect with a Calvin Klein perfume. Well got N2U and holy moly, blown away again, I can see how some other people might not like it, but I LOVE the citrus vanilla scent. It's not super heavy and not super overwhelming in my opinion and I just love how it brings on a really happy and just relaxing scent. I personally think it's just a perfectly blended Perfume

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Fresh CITRUS Over VANILLA-WOODS Scent. Opens with a fresh citrus-y burst of pink-grapefruit & bergamot accented by red-currant-leaf. That segues into the cactus & orchid heart. Cactus here bringing some green, juicy tones and something near a tea note, while orchid brings soft powdery florals and helps to continue the faint fruitiness of the opening citrus notes a little into the heart. This all rests on a base of vanilla & red-cedar resin that combine into a lather of sweet, powdery, faintly-soapy, woody & aromatic notes. This has average performance for a spring through fall wearing experience, although the citrus component lasts only part-way into the heart.

Overall: affordable, unisex, gorgeous fresh citrus over vanila-woods scent with average performance for a spring through fall wearing experience. It's a love for me. Cheapie gem: Enjoy!

Update 06/17/25: I've come to appreciate the artistry of this more and more. There's a delicacy here in the portrayal of the red-cedar which in the sillage evokes steamy saunas and red-cedar chests. It's gotten a lot more woody over time. Still quite citrus-y in the grapefruit top, but something resinous underneath plus the red-cedar woodiness which leans a bit soapy along with the steamy citrus wafting off of it. I like this more each time I wear it. Today it's giving me some passing reminders of White Tea Elizabeth Arden (although these aren't clones). Love it still.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: If you want an affordable scent that wears well in this God forsaken HEAT of the summer, look no further than CK IN2U for her. I feel like I can tackle the day head on when I spray this after getting dressed. Definitely one of the MVP's of my collection and i'm pretty sure I got it for under $20 in Burlington, wish I had gotten a backup.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: So this is my second review of this fragrance, the first bottle of this, I absolutely hated, it smelt like latex gloves to me in the drydown, I just couldn't stand it. A few years after this, I got another bottle, this time a partial bottle in a bundle of secondhand fragrances, and wow, it's gorgeous, it's a soft fluffy lemon vanilla with a bit of woodiness. The woodiness is almost like pine, like what I smell in Chloe Nomade but much lighter than that. I've been spraying this one like crazy this summer and loving it. I think there must be either a reformulation or a need to let bottles sit for a while, because the two bottles that I've tried have been night and day, this might also explain the very split opinion on this fragrance in the reviews here...

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
I really enjoy this scent. I use it on daily basis and it has pretty much become a staple in my routine.
I love the fresh citrus opening. It's definitely suitable for the summer months.🏝️
Can't wait to see it's performance in the colder ones

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
I have never smelled this one, but now I would like to try it... How come that this is similar to Santal Complet? :-O
Some of you said "Strong citrusy scent with some hint of green." which is everything but Santal Complet to me...

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Please can people that don’t understand in citrus fragrances stop leaving comments on such type of scents. Like it is supposed to be sour/tart. It citrus dominated fragrance. It is supposed to be a blast of citrus (bergamot, lemon, grapefruit etc) in your face! That’s the point of lemony,citrusy notes sometimes!!!!! Those fragrances are usually are used in very hot and humid environments, cause it’s one of the most refreshing things you could wear when it’s 100°f outside and you can’t literally breathe outside. And no in those situations it doesn’t smell like detergent/dish soap etc.
Now about the fragrance great citrus and aromatic fragrance! It does however barely lasts on my skin. Till the moment I get to that gorgeous vanilla dry down it mostly disappears. Otherwise smells expensive with some niche aromas in it. I even prefer it over Chanel Chance eau fraiche (despite that Chanel’s fragrance is one of the best citrusy fragrances)

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This isn't a sharp citrus, at all. It's the creamiest, softest, citrus ever. Quite beautiful. Probably one of my favorite citrus/vanilla scents, just wish it lasted longer. The longevity on this is terrible!

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: With the reviews I read, I thought I would really like this perfume even if the longevity wasn't great. I have been looking for some citrus scents that wouldn't break the bank, and this one obviously doesn't. I found a bottle at Ross. I LOVE the opening of this fragrance! Terrific citrus forward scent! That lasted about 10 minutes. Then as it started to dry down, the familiar aroma of Calvin Klein fragrances of yore (and I'm of the age to know yore), came through. It was then I remembered how much I didn't like Calvin Klein's DNA. I didn't like it then and I still don't. I had to scrub it off to rid myself of the memories of young guys wearing too much of the CK scents years ago and not being able to stay in their vicinity. At least my bad memories only cost me about $20. Anyone in the US want a bottle with about 3 sprays out of it? I'll give it to you cheaper than Ross!

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This is a sharp citrus with a subtle sweetness & a woodsy undertone. IMO it's more unisex than feminine. I've had it for a while now & I have layered it a few times but do not reach for this much at all. Today it dawned on me to try it out as a bug repellent so I will see how it goes.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This smells like citrus washing up liquid (dish washing liquid), it's sharp and made me want to scrub it off.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: actually such an amazing unisex perfume. i got this in spain last year and forgot how amazing this fragrance is. i adore the vanilla aromatic blend this perfume has (surprising because i usually stray away from aromatic perfumes) and i think this might be my new favorite summer time perfume.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
My mom got me this perfume as a gift for my 19th birthday and I've loved jasmine citrusy things ever since as a true summer baby.
Before that I didn't really care much about fragrances except for the occasional powdery perfume on some of her friends.
I remember I ran out of it pretty fast and only managed to get a second bottle years later but now that we've been reunited I'm not letting it go.
Fresh, sparkly and warm like summer should be.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: It is really nice one! First time I bought it in 2008 when I came to england and used it with pleasure. Now bought it again in 2023 and Im glad I did. It is such a nice scent for spring/summer.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This surprised me because it smells really good! It's a soft citrus but it goes away as quickly as I spray it, my skin eats it right up. The bottle is so hideous to me though. The price for this isn't bad but I couldn't imagine wearing this in any other season other than summer. A good cheapie for those in warmer climates.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
This one is marvelous. Is springy, summery and it is so nice. This is a citrus heaven mixed with freshness and a hint of sweetness, I am in love with this one. It makes you so happy after spraying it on yourself, it has also a hint of acidity but this fragrance is so well thought.
The design of the bottle is simple yet elegant and cool.
I recommend you trying it in store, but I have to say, again, that this one is so amazing.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: My first impression of this scent was sweet iced tea. It has a greenish quality to it and it's sugary and lemony at the same time so it brought back memories of Summer. It's not super unique, but it's pleasant. I think it's a good everyday sunny day perfume. It's not dark and seductive, because it wasn't intended to be; it's lighthearted so don't take it too seriously. One qualm I have is that I can smell alcohol mildly in the background which I wish wasn't there. I'd say it lasts and projects moderately, but it won't perform like a beast, what citrus does? In general, I prefer more floral notes in my perfumes, but if this is your vibe, then it's a good cheapie. I'm also a fan of the bottle, I think it's a fun shape that makes it looks modern and sleek.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Cloying. It's a pass for me

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Perfect easy grab. True unisex imo.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
With this one, I have found my perfect white-t-shirt scent! Fresh but a bit sweet, maybe a bit shampoo-ish? I like it a lot for those sunny days in spring and summer!
@veromoth : is it the same for you when you spray it on your shirt? To me it is not so masculine, maybe unisex…

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Wow... I'm so disappointed with this one.
My colleague wears it sometimes, and when I compliment her on her scent it just always turns out to be in2u.
I decided to try it for myself, and... oh man... literally. It is so manly on my skin. Is it really the same scent my colleague uses? She definitely wears it better than me.
I know the price is tempting, but I would recommend (as for any other perfumes) to try it on your skin before you buy it.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
this gives me a headache
I loved it so much when I first got it

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This is Satsuma from the Body Shop with a little less punch. If you like Satsuma, you'll probably like this.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Chcąc poznać gust zapachowy mojego męża pocięłam paski i popsikałam wszystkimi zapachami jakie posiadam w tym ten CK (ale dopiero co kupiłam i nie dla siebie tylko w prezencie)
Po kilku minutach mąż podstawił mi pod nos swojego faworyta.....właśnie CK.
Ehhhh pomyślałam.... to zapach w prezencie dla teściowej ponieważ to jej zapach od lat.
Ma w sobie coś z nut męskich, długo się utrzymuje i rozwija się na skórze.
Doskonały do pracy, biura, na zakupy. Wary swojej ceny i nie czuję żebym przepłacała.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: It's a very likeable scent - not a lovable one for me. I've known it for years and tested it a multitude of times but never felled compelled to get a bottle. I got one a few days ago due to an awesome price offer. And I still like it - but not totally love it. It is very user-friendly - feminine, citrussy-sweet, like an overly sweetened lemon ice tea. But that's the point. It soon gets too sweet. The wonderful freshness of citrussy notes soon gets overwhelmed by the sweet/ambery notes. I'd kick out the amber and vanilla and it would be just fine and it would fit the bottle design perfectly! Still - it's worth trying and buying and having - just in case you have no better idea what to wear on a given day. It's pretty versatile. In my opinion it may be really good on a late summer/early fall sunny day - when you don't want to let the summer go but already know it's on it's way...

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: IN2U's opening is so gorgeous, it's a shame how quickly it dry's down. I still like the dry-down, though. It's a classic musky grapefruit scent that's pretty one-dimensional. For the price point, I can't really complain. This is a nice out-the-shower everyday fragrance that I'll be using more with spring upon us.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This is nice! I like it, don’t love it. Very inexpensive to buy a huge bottle of, which is good as this is one I have to over spray to get any lasting power or sillage. It opens very fresh, reminds me of lemongrass or verbena. It’s green and juicy and citrusy for the first 10-15 minutes. As it dries you get the vanilla coming in and kind of turns the fragrance into a really mellow creamy, cozy, sweet lemon/grapefruit scent.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Strong citrusy scent with some hint of green. Overall pleasant.

Very poor projection, silage, longevity. It becomes a skin scent within minutes.

Only buy it on a very good deal.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I find this to be pleasant but nothing outstanding. It’s mostly vanilla with a vague citrus-green character. Good for the gym or hanging around the house but I wouldn’t wear it if you want people to notice your perfume. Light to moderate longevity and sillage.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: What a disappointing buy. I purchased a large bottle based on the review recommendations here. The scent is pleasant enough, but it does not last at all. I gave myself a good eight sprays before leaving the house. Wrists, clothes, hair. When I walked into work 30 minutes later, it was gone. If I press my nose against my wrist, I can kind of smell it. I have had good like with the other CK scents, so this was a big flop for me.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: It smells very pleasant, clean and fresh. It's such a shame that it doesn't last long!

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Needed a cheapy for the gym (saw the rec on youtube so I blind bought it) and this perfume serves that purpose perfectly. Top note smells like you just squeeze a citrus, kinda grapefruit-y rather than lemon-y since it's a bit sweet, but very fresh. The citrus scent lingers for around 2-3 hours then settles down to a creamy scent, not too sweet but very comfortable. Will not give you a migrane. Many people said that longevity wasn't good.
