Personally I find it has very decent longevity, around 5-6 hours or even longer, although after 3 hours, you're probably the only one who smell it. Good projection I feel, not coying at all and it makes me feel pretty and happy when working out. Doesn't smell cheap, in fact, it smells quite interesting for the price. But also in a way, kinda basic because of the citrus top note but I don't mind. Personally I like it way more than D&G light blue because of the sweet, feminine base note. Overall, I am super happy with the purchase. 10/10

You prolly won't like it as much if you buy it to use every day. But it's the perfect gym fragrance especially for women, but I think men can pull this off too.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Fresh sweet-ness!

I agree with the comments made by ‘London Lady’ just below my comment AND I also bought it because of YouTuber Ksenja 👍

I have wanted to try this one for some time now, but I was afraid of the citrus notes. I’m not big on the coldness of freshies……but the vanilla really warms this one up for me. 😊

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I too purchased this on a YouTuber's recommendation (Ksenja). I wouldn't normally blind buy...actually that is not true - I try not to blind buy, but sometimes, if the price is right, I just can't resist it! The price of this fragrance is excellent, although I don't normally buy Calvin Klein due to the scent never really lasting with me. However, this sounded like I would enjoy it so I went ahead and ordered it. So here is my verdict: this is lovely! It's a sweet freshness that is softened by the warmth of vanilla to create a lemony creaminess. What immediately sprang to mind was that this is very similar to Tom Ford's Costa Azzurra - the difference being that one costs around £150 + and the other is £14! I liked Costa Azzurra, but could never justify paying a luxury price for what was to me just a "nice" scent. Tom Ford's has a little more body and depth to it, but since both fragrances have the same (IMHO) silage and longevity I'd much rather go for the Calvin Klein. IN2U is an everyday perfume that you can overspray, respray, sniff-your-wrist-all-day and enjoy. It's a fun, fresh, pretty scent that gives off a classy, clean, sparkling vibe.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Just purchased this upon a YouTuber’s recommendation. There are some good notes, but I’m getting an overarching bug spray vibe on me personally. I really hope this scent can either age in the bottle or develop on my skin to where I don’t get this sensation anymore. I’ll still give it a chance, as I also have a sinus infection and may not be all there smell-wise.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: It took me a while to fall in love with this scent, which has a lot of things going on. At first, I kept getting the amber, the cedar, and the orchid. It was ok, but I couldn't make heads or tails of it. So I let it macerate and develop. I tried it the other day, and was so happy with the scent! Finally, the citrusy sweetness started to come out, but not in a sharp way. Rather, the vanilla teased it out beautifully, playing background to the first notes of the bergamot and grapefruit. The other notes poke their heads out very softly. I've started to wear it in this muggy, warm weather and I love it! It is sweet, pretty, and elegant. The scent bubble around me is delicious!

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: A fleeting perfume, you spray it, you smell it and it’s gone in a flash. I like the original CK One perfume but this formulation is so weak, I feel like when you spend money on one of those flavored sparkling waters that don’t fully satisfy you. Sad to say, because I like the scent, if only it would linger.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Stole this from my mum and got the karma i deserved (she didn’t mind though). This huge bottle was such a hate pan for me but I got through it. This is such a nothing scent. I’ve said it before but Calvin Klein excels at mens fragrances but drops the ball for womens. It seems like they are all created by men, for men.

This is fresh, citrus, sharp and alcohol. Nicer than CK One but kinda related.

If you are into feminine and or girly scents, this one is not for you.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Call me crazy, but this remided me so much of how Dior Sport was on my historical boyfriend.

I got it as a gift, still testing...but so far not bad, it's pleasant and i think it's more unisex than feminine even if it's "for her".
Love the zesty, on me almost bitter citrus :)

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Honestly so relaxing. I've been on the fence about getting this for about an year now but I finally decided to get it. I was looking for a freshie for my little work out yoga session at home because I realized i had nothing really fitting for just refreshing after a shower.
It's a clean citrus, nothing strong like toilet cleaner but definitely zesty. It doesn't last too long but when it becomes a skin scent it's a really subtle soft vanilla. I really like it, it feels really comfortable and it wont overwhelm you if you over-spray.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
God this is good. Blind bought based on reviews. The first time I spritzed it I was transported to high school memories. I would recognize the scent anywhere - the fragrance of my first love and first heartbreak. Not what I thought I was signing up for purchasing this LOL.

Now I'm wondering how much of a part this scent had in my feelings for this person. Because this perfume is GOOD.

It leans masculine to me, in fact I remember telling them I "liked their cologne" only to be corrected that it was a women's perfume. However, I think any woman or man could rock this. It's both fresh and sexy, and the citrus sticks around far longer than it does in other fresh scents I've tried.

It's winter right now and this feels cozy somehow, but I can't wait to rock it in the heat.

It's versatile, inexpensive, unisex, decently long lasting. Signature scent worthy, I'd gladly grab this regardless of the outfit / occasion, save for maybe a super formal event.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Has a very clean and citrusy scent, almost lemony. I don't really smell the spicy notes everyone is mentioning. Comes off very strong when initially sprayed on and usually lasts a couple of hours. It's nothing mind blowing but very nice and casual. It's a bit of a boring scent but sometimes that's exactly what you need. I would definitely recommend it for day-to-day activities.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Very nice citrus green spicy frag. I like it during the winter, too. That spiciness is incredible in the icy-frosty weather. Try it ❄️❤️

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This is my favourite fresh smelling perfume I have in my collection. There is a slight citrus undertone to it but it is not overpowering. Doesn't last long and although not groundbreaking, it's a great perfume for every day. Inexpensive, too!

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This is one of the few citrus/fresh scents that I like, it’s unique because it has a sweets side to it. Only wish it lasted longer :(

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Very underrated cheap fragrance. Hell, this smells more expensive than the price tag.

In2U for Her is a fresh, citrusy, spicy and fruity fragrance. The opening is really harsh, but the magic starts after 5 minutes.

Refreshing, but soothing. Playful, but not brash. You can wear it anytime as it is very inoffensive.

As a bald, fully bearded man, I don’t have a problem wearing this fragrance. But I think for me it’s best to wear In2U in casual settings.

Longevity is around 5 hours-ish, with moderate projection in the first hour.

Very solid.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
To start off, as this was my #1 impression when first trying: this EDT is way more masculine than I was expecting, and I was pleasantly surprised. Slowly, I've been getting more and more into masculine and unisex scents, shying away from traditionally feminine perfumes. I'm discovering that I love citrus, wood, and green fragrances, so CK IN2U fits the bill perfectly.

The notes of cactus, orchid and red cedar were intriguing... On first spray, I didn't really smell much. It kind of smelled like nothing. So I sprayed again, figuring that since it's EDT it just needs an extra push to come alive. Now I could smell it perfectly, strong citrus right off the bat: it smelled so lemony for a very brief moment, then grapefruit and bergamot took over for a few minutes. Unisex, leaning neither fem or masc. Five minutes later, and it smells like straight up man's cologne to me, mostly in the notes of cedar and amber. I enjoy it immensely, wood and pine notes have a calming effect on me, but some who are looking for a more feminine perfume may be disappointed. The only thing I would consider feminine about the drydown is the vanilla.

Sillage isn't exceptional, but occasionally I'll get a whiff of it when I'm moving around which is always nice. Always good to own at least a couple perfumes that aren't too loud. Lasts around 6 hours on me. As a side note, a man I sat next to on a Greyhound to Salinas wore a strong cologne very very close to this one, so IN2U smells just like Northern California to me.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I used to like it when it was released and bought it now because of nostalgy. It’s still a pleasant citrusy scent, but the sillage and longevity is extremely weak. If you want a citrusy fredh scent I would rather buy D&G Light Blue intense, which is IMO way way better than this one. Now I only use the CKIn2u as a gym-scent. Will not repurchase it and I do not recommend it.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I could never make up my mind about getting this fragrance. I first thought it leaned masculine, but I was wrong. This is a unisex gem. I couldn't stop sniffing my wrist. Smells amazing! sweet aquatic heavy citrus and a bit tropical. I wish it lasted longer, but hey! 20 bucks not bad at all...

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: citrusy, green, with a floral background. i find that my mom likes an orchid note in her perfumes, probably because it was quite trendy back in the day. dated fragrance imo

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Girls! Don't be scared of unisex perfumes, this one smells amazing on ladies 😍

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This... Is not my favorite citrus scent. It almost comes off to me like a salty food like a saltine cracker with like apples sliced on it. I just feel like this smells cheap and like a cracker is the only way I can describe it. Lol. Also doesn't go well with my body chemistry.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells like a clean bathroom to me. Nice but boring

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: this was my first "grown up" perfume I got at 13. It is fresh and it's not too strong or complicated and it's perfect for work / school just normal day to day life. I love wearing this for work. It just smells clean and its a really low price for 100ml which is perfect. It doesn't last all day so it's best to apply every couple of hours but for the price you can't complain. Perfect gift for tweens to women maybe in their 30s (?)

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: i have an unopened, sealed 50ml bottle for sale. pm me :)

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: After a slow start, this has grown on me and is now one of my favorites. It opens with a big fruity flourish that put me off for a while, just because it seems kind of simple and juvenile. The opener reminds me of the fragrances I used to wear in middle school. But it doesn't take long for IN2U to drydown into a spicy, woody, unique fragrance with a surprising sweet center. Much more grownup and complex than the opening promises! I bought a 15ml sample but I like it enough to go for a full-size bottle. I think of IN2U as a warm weather, daytime, suitable-for-work fragrance, and it seems firmly unisex to me. It's warm and spicy enough, though, that I will try it when the weather cools down and see what happens. Looking forward to it.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This is one of my favorite warm weather fragrances. The citrus stays for hours before becoming an slightly sweet woody fragrance. This is very smooth and well blended considering the cost and quality of the bottle. It doesn’t have amazing performance, but most of my citrus freshies don’t. This is definitely unisex even though it isn’t marketed that way. It’s right up my alley and every time I wear it, I am pleasantly reminded how much I love this.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I am really into unisex perfumes and generally fresher scents and this one I really love. It's not the typical freshie, to me it has more depth to it. Performance is not great, but I don't mind overspraying since it's so affordable. The reason I bought it is because to me it has a striking similarity to Replica Jazz Club, another favourite of mine. It's almost like CK IN2U is the teenager version of Jazz Club, that said it's way more appropriate for day time wear, also very office-friendly since the projection is very little. Deffinately a white t-shirt, summer time, casual scent in the best way possible.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Very unimpressed. All I smell is wood and something like bergamot. I'm just giving it away now. Disappointed, but should've known since also cheap

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
A citrusy vanilla, it’s actually quite nice as the base notes are heavier than they typically are with freshies, which lends some nice depth and longevity.

I would have preferred a small decant of this as it’s really nice but I’m not the biggest fan of freshies. I passed this along because I don’t reach for it enough to finish the 100ml bottle.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Sporty, candied grapefruit. It’s my favorite Unisex leaning fragrance, the vibe is you’re rocking your mans hoodie :)

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
I got this because it was recommended by Ksenja on her youtube channel. It's okay, but I'm really not sure I like it all that much. I don't get any vanilla in this, even though it's listed. I think I'd like it if it were a tad sweeter, and it almost seems a tad masculine to me. I gave it a full day's wear the other day on a hot day, and was underwhelmed by the scent. Longevity was pretty decent though. I'll give this some time and see if it grows on me.

Update: I'm probably going to declutter this one, it didn't end up growing on me at all.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: My high school perfume. It's just very fresh and sporty. You can feel the citrusy openning and at dry down its like citrusy-vanilla. I liked it. Still like it.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is such a neutral fragrance. It's bones are even inoffensive. It's unisex and citrus! I can see anyone wearing this. Male or female, teen or mature.

Honestly it's a hard one to pin down due to it being so ... Nothing.

The only thing I can say for sure about this is that if you over spray the amber can be too much. Definitely more of a daytime scent, maybe even for the gym. Fresh but not green or aquatic in any way I was expecting.

Like I would wear this after playing soccer. It's a bit like ... The memory of grass.

Very 90s.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I would describe this as a slightly creamy citrus. Starts off very citrusy but the vanilla starts to peak through in the dry down and says there. Fragrance is light and airy. Loved this as a teenager. My mum loves this too. I guess it’s perfect for the very young or more mature crowd.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Very fresh scent, citrus is the star and it smell beautiful on me for the 10 minutes it last on my skin. Definitely unisex in my opinion, I tried on my boyfriend and it was a lot more expressive on his skin, I loved it and could really smell the green notes come out. I agree that it does not smell synthetic to my nose, the grapefruit smells real and delicious.

I might wear this to the gym or somewhere I don't want to project much of anything, but will probably give to my boyfriend as it smells much nicer and more complex on him. For reference I have sensitive/dry type skin and he has more balanced/slightly oily skin type. Even as I am typing now I can barely even smell it on myself from 10 minutes ago :'(

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This scent is citrusy, warm and woody. The citrus smell doesn´t go away, niether on skin or clothes. On skin it smells more woody and amber and deep. On clothes it smells like lemonade, fresh cut citruses, aromatic and lightly sweet, very bright. I don´t think this perfume smells synthetic, the citruses here are very realistic (tangy, juicy, bitter, sweet).

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Instant thick candy and powder scent on my skin which lead to a headache. Very surprised as was expecting a fresher clean scent with the grapefruit. Did not smell citrus at all. Smells very generic sweet mall scent imo.

ETA my skin seems to amplify any amber notes in a fragrance to the max, perhaps making them suffocatingly sweet on me when on others they would still smell fresh.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: It is a sweet and fresh summer/ spring scent . Similar to light blue but way better in my opinion! Even though the performance is not beast mode , this is worth repurchasing! Especially amazing for hot humid weather in my opinion !!! Beautiful and sexy clean scent ! I sense a sugary citrus and mint drink ! I have a back up bottle cus I liked it so much.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Fizzy sprite, energetic, pleasant, great for everyday.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I first bought this fragrance on a whim in 2015 and it quickly became one of my favorites. I'm very sensitive to fragrances and some (certain floral ones) give me a headache. This one always makes me feel good and and whenever I wear it I get compliments. I hope it always remains available.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Very light, after 10 minutes on my skin it went ... the scent would also be pleasant, but the persistence is ridiculous. It costs little, but unfortunately due to the low intensity it is worth even less. A defect that the perfumes produced by Coty often have. A pity...

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
In the description it says, "Calvin Klein demonstrates that he still knows what young people need," which is cringe, and saying so only demonstrates the opposite. But that doesn't matter to me! It actually smells really good--there's a milkiness that just works in this fragrance, and I love the cedar. I'm surprised no one else mentions a lactonic impression from this. 🤷♀️ I am not sure about whether Coty is this watering-down Devil whom people have described; I wish I could say for sure, but I don't have the experience to tell. If they are doing that, the hatred is really justified. CK IN2U does have a strong alcohol smell upon spraying, which dissipates. I have the 100 ml bottle, which I feel like could last me at least two summers. But I do not wear this every day by any means. I go through streaks when I wear it repeatedly, then forget about it completely. I actually do find this fragrance sexy when I am in the right mood.

Update 09/02/22: I may have to disagree a bit with my first impressions, because now I don't feel like this "just works." I feel like IN2U really should work, I don't know why it doesn't work, and it's not just the name and the bottle. Feels unfinished.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This was a blind buy because of YouTube… let me say I don’t like citrus or cedar that much however something about this frangrance keeps drawing me in. The dry down on me is a bit too masculine but I’ve been layering it with VS bare vanilla and I’m loving it. I want to try ckin2u gold which is supposed to be this but better

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I think this is a very good parfum, especially for the price! I’m usually not a very citrusy fragrance kind of person, but the citrus notes in combination with the base notes of vanille and amber just work wonderfully! It’s fresh and clean but still feminine and it has a bit of elegance to it. Definitely worth trying!

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This was my signature for a long time, all day, every day/ night, any occasion. This is very citrusy and bright in the beginning but it does not dry down that way. Sexy but not dirty, Fresh & clean but not soapy. Last all day/ all night, 8+hrs. Highly recommend 10/10, bringing this back out for spring/ summer. Sooooo many compliments every time!

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Great Great freshie ! I love the grapefruit at the top and the vanilla that envelops it. There's definitely that Calvin klein dna present. It's a great every day, non offensive office type scent. Great for its value.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I wore this in a store the other day, and the sales associate assisting me needed a managers help and she mentioned to him she kept smelling pledge furniture cleaner so maybe this isn't a compliment getter. It's not for everyone but anyone can wear it if that makes sense. It's unisex smelling and never leans too masculine or feminine. It starts like warm pledge imo but the drydown is fresh and sweet. This works very well in hot summer days if you're wanting something unique and not a typical aquatic or fruity scent. Seems like a fragrance you either really like or you really don't. It smells really lovely to me.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This smells like fresh squeezed orange juice in the opening and dries down to a vanilla, green fragrance. It doesn't last long and somehow smells like a typical CK fragrance. Jeans and white Tshirt. Very casual. I consider this a gym fragrance.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
As every citrus, this lasts like an hour on me. BUT thats not a problem at all. To me this is the perfect summer fragrance - its a fresh lemony, orangey vanilla from start to finish. It smells like something you have smelled for the last 20 years (which is also kinda true).
To describe it best I would say that it smells cheap, but not in a bad manner, more like a fabric softener. This fragrance smells like clean sheets or laundry that you have just pulled out of the machine - this is what I mean when I say cheap. I love it and its also totally worth the money even with the poor longevity.
Everyone loves the CK One for a summer fragrance, but this is better.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
I have a huge problem with finding ''summer'' perfumes cause I don't like the generic citrus perfumes, eg. Light Blue, and sometimes my usual perfumes are a bit too much on 40+ weather. With that said, I have been absolutely obsessed with in2U since 8th grade. My friend used to wear it a lot and I got myself a 150ml bottle that I still have to this day. I think it was one of the first, if not the very first perfume I have ever had and I remember begging my mom to buy it for me cause back then I didn't have much money.
I personally feel an intense orange blossom in this one, and maybe it's the blend with the grapefruit and vanilla, but I just think orange blossom when I wear it. What can I say, it's the perfect summer day fragrance that you can not overspray, literally even if you have soaked your shirt it still smells nice and not overpowering. Longevity is not good, but I don't mind at all for the price, I will just keep it on me and spray all day long, it just smells like ''happy'' (still don't know if it's the memories that I have with it, but it puts me in a good mood). It reminds me of looong hot summer nights out with friends, maybe after a few drinks, you just laugh and have a good time. You can't go wrong with it, they have done a very good job with this one and I know I will forever have it in my collection.

So, YESS BUY IT IT'S AMAZING!!!!! :)

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I'm very disappointed... The opening is amazing it smells very expensive but after an hour or two it starts smelling very faint and almost like a plastic citrus smell. So it doesn't smell cheap but it doesn't last and the smell changes a lot with time on me.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
I didn’t like it at the beginning but then I started falling in love with it.
It’s the best fresh fragrance for hot summer morning dates,

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
It's not bad at all, but I would never classify it as feminine or even unisex - this is a very masculine scent. I love citruses and cedar, but I'm sorry, this is straight up men's aftershave.
The notes and reviews had me so excited, but sadly, this is not for me. It's a linear grapefruit/juniper scent (with no sweetness at all) and is quite potent for an EDT. A good afforable freshie for men.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
If you’ve ever been to The Whaler in Santa Monica and had their raspberry lemonade, you’ll know this perfume smells almost exactly the way the drink tastes (if that made any sense)! Only difference is that the perfume has a hint of vanilla added to it.
This scent has easily become one of my favorites. I’ve been wearing it pretty much nonstop since I bought it! It has a really bright citrus opening and the dry down is a perfect mix of warm vanilla amber with a hint of that citrus still lingering.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I am honestly still surprised I like this scent, as it doesn't really fit in with anything I usually go for. It's crisp and fresh, with just the slightest hint of warmth. I can smell the red cedar pretty prominently in the dry down, but the citrus lingers for quite a while too. It's just a really lovely, unusual and yet inoffensive scent, and seems to last for a while compared to other scents in it's price range.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Refreshing citrusy aromatic scent, great for hot summer days. Totally unisex. Great value to be honest.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: How fresh! I'll admit I got a bit tricked by the vanilla, since I thought the dry down would be sweeter, but it isn't sweet at all. After the sparkly top notes fade away, but before the dry down, there's a unique note that I'm assuming is the cactus, and I can't help but find that mid phase so damn charming. It's definitely a T-shirt and jeans kind of fragrance, for me. There's something about it that screams casual without trying too hard.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Very fresh and aromatic citrusy perfume. I had it in the past, I sold it. I have bought it these days and it is perfect. I have many fresh citrusy scents, but this is a little bit different, special and it can be unisex I think so.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Ok after almost six monthes finally I’m writing this review…
First of all this perfume is totally a hot summer day fragrance, it’s not suitable for any other season and also not suitable for nights.
For me I dislike citrus perfumes so it took me long time to get used and accept how does it smells also when it dries down all of sudden it gets warm and heavy because it has vanilla and amber in base notes.
It can be actually considered as a unisex fragrance also, the first time I sprayed it I though that they made a mistake by putting male perfume in the female bottle … so yeah its a summer day refreshing citrus unisex perfume.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Love this blind buy, beautiful blend of citrus and vanilla. It's my go to perfume for work in warm days.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Lovely grapefruit burst opening with some vanilla. Dries down a bit green, ambery and woody, not too sweet, not too herbal but ultimately also not super impressive. I can see the cactus associations. Could be a nice summer cheapie. Juniper makes this slightly masculine, can easily be unisex. Quite enjoying drydown which seems still citrussy I guess due to the tartness of the cassis.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Disappointed in this- I'd heard good reviews and thought I'd enjoy it so I blind bought it at TJ Maxx. At first spray this is an okay citrus, maybe a bit powdery and odd but not bad. However, on dry down, this smells awful on me. It becomes a dirty, sweaty, stale scent. I have to layer it under other fragrances in order to tolerate it. I was honestly expecting I'd love this especially with the cactus and citrus notes but oof this is not for me.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Blind Buy Win -

I actually really enjoy this. This is a perfect spring / summer scent, or whenever you want to smell "fresh". It's not your typical fresh scent though, it's quite unique in my opinion. It definitely leans more on the unisex / masculine side, due to the Red Cedar note but I actually really enjoy unisex / masculine scents on me.

It starts off with a blast of strong citrus, then quickly mellows out into a beautiful blend of soft citrus, vanilla, amber, and cedar. I don't pick up on the orchid, or the cactus blossom (not that I really know what that smells like). I'd call this a woodsy - vanilla.

I know a lot of people complain about the performance on this, but I'm actually quite impressed with it. I'm worn this several times and it lasts me all day with moderate projection. I'm currently wearing CK IN2U, and at 7 hours in I can still smell this quite prominently. I get wafts of it throughout the day, and I can still detect the fragrance on my skin.

Overall, a successful blind buy and $20 well spent.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: If u want to transform this perfume into a sexy vanilla ambery lemonade. Layer with VS. Amber Romance!!

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
I really noticed the cedar and bergamot notes, less so the vanilla and orchid. This is a unusual scent and not a safe blind buy. As opposed to what most reviewers are saying it has an evident woody pine, bergamot end point which leans masculine. I'm surprised this isn't considered a unisex fragrance or even a masculine one. Blind bought it before I checked the notes after hearing it described as fresh citrus vanilla - amber but I couldn't detect vanilla much at all.

That said, I understand why woodsy citrus turpine lovers would adore this fragrance.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: If this fragrance had more lasting power I would be OBSESSED. I love it! I don't normally fall for fresh or citrus fragrances unless they're tropical (this is definitely NOT tropical lol), but omg there is just something about this. My description will do this absolutely no justice, but the best explanation I have is that this is a sweet, warm, Lemon Pledge scent lol. It doesn't smell like cleaning products, but I just don't know how else to explain it. It's fresh, comforting, sweet, a little warm, and just... idk. I love it. If they could figure out a way to make this last and have a little throw (it's definitely a skin scent, no sillage to be found) I would buy this in bulk. As it is, I use it like a body spray and drench myself and my clothes in it. Even so, after an hour or two I can only smell it if I lift my shirt or arm to my nose. Such a pity because this fragrance is delicious.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Не ми хареса, има нещо унисекс, даже клони към мъжки за мен.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Calvin Klein’s In2U for Her is THE OG, and the perfume I’ve owned the longest. This was, interestingly, a blind buy. A friend of a friend, having read my humble note on perfumes, recommended this perfume to me, and while I didn’t exactly have access to it from my humble hometown, I always kept that in mind. Two years later, I casually mentioned the name to the “not sure if he is my boyfriend” person in my life. And a few months down the line, when our families had already talked about us getting married and we decided to meet for the first time as potential partners, this was what he brought for me, and this was what I wore when I was falling deep, deep in love with him. Cheesy, yes? But hey, I was all of 24, and realising I had already met the man I was going to spend the rest of my life with was a heady feeling.

Each time I sniff this perfume, I immediately see me in a yellow top with thin straps – a fun, flirty girly piece I discarded from my wardrobe just a few months ago because it was worn to death. I had bought that top right before my fiance landed in Bangalore from Vietnam, when we took a trip with my sister and brother-in-law (who, by the way, are his college mates) to Pondicherry. It was the thick of summer, and our hotel room overlooked the rocky beach. This was the perfume that stayed with me when we went out for that lunch where he cut my pork ribs for me (such a sweetheart!), when we went to the beach to see the sunset and my brother-in-law took candid photos of us (still some of my favourite photos in the whole wide world) and even when we went to that serenely intimate French restaurant for our engagement party and I came back to the room slightly wobbly and lightheaded from all the wine.

CK In2U Her is summer in a bottle. It has the obvious citruses in the top, a very unusual cactus in the middle and the usual vanilla, cedar and amber in the base. CK perfumes unfortunately don’t have a very good reputation longevity and projection wise, and until recently I belonged to the group of people who dismissed any perfume that doesn’t last very long. What’s the point of wearing perfume if no one can smell it on you? But then I was initiated into the idea of – surprise, surprise – respraying. Groundbreaking stuff, I know. If I needed any more reason to love this perfume, it is extremely easy on the pockets, which is why you won’t even mind spraying it again, and again, and again. Oh, hello sunshine!

If you were to ask me to recommend one, just one perfume to you, I would probably say CK In2U Her. It’s such a crowd pleasing perfume. More than the smell, I think it encapsulates the essence of summer – the invigorating nip in the air after a bout of summer rain when you can smell the wet earth, the eye-blinding brightness of a white sheet drying in the sun, the sweet-sour thirst-quenching harmony of a tall glass of lemonade and for me, that of being young and in love and walking on the beach wearing flip-flops, holding the hand of the man I was falling in love with.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Smells very pink grapefruit very limoney...
linear, one note, fresh
but lacks depth for me, although I love citrus smells one linear ones are like being one big walking lemon or in this case one pink grapefruit walking...

Rating
Wear
4/10

for Aromatheraphy
6/10

Artistic creation

2/10

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Very straight forward and not so sophisticated citrus fragrance. Wouldn’t recommend this to anyone above 21.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I’ve been wearing this perfume on and off for the past 10 years and still can’t get enough of it, so under rated!

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: im usually into vanillas or marshmallowy-fruit scents, but i am IN LOVE WITH THIS PERFUME. this is the only citrus perfume I have fallen in love with so far

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Not a fan of this one, I initially really liked it but with time the smell got annoying. I am still new to perfumes but citrusy is not my thing. It barely stays and I finished the whole thing without anyone ever mentioning the smell. Either they weren't a fan or they just couldn't smell it.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
Citrusy and spicy with depth at the opening and it gets a little bit sweeter as it dries down. I personally find it works equally in every weather and season. It lasts 4 to 5 hours, but it becomes a skin scent after 3 to 4 hours. Perfectly unisex though leaning on the feminine side as it dries.
I wouldn't be able to pick any separate note except for the grapefruit. However, I certainly think it has that CK DNA.
It smells more expensive than the retail price for sure as it has it's own personality.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: At first, I did not care much for this. If you are familiar with Calvin Klein's Eternity Summer scents, then smell this, you'll recognize the DNA. I adore light, bright, citrusy scents and light watery florals. This in comparison to my Guess Dare, CKin2U leans more unisex.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: The opening is very citrusy/springy/bright and while I didn't hate it, I also didn't love it. The dry down though, I love! It deepens, get a bit sweeter, but still with that bit of citrus. This is a very nice, clean smell without being soapy or laundry-like. I think it would be great for the office. My only issue is that while the opening is a bit bright and loud, it VERY quickly fades to skin only. I can't even really smell it on myself unless I huff my clothes or wrist. I'll have to treat this more like a body spray than a perfume, which I don't mind for the price.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I came across this perfume on a YouTube video where Ksenja gushed about her love for this perfume . Boy was she right !!! It smells fresh yet sexy , citrusy yet sultry . It smells expensive yet $20 at tj maxx ? Score !!! It’s definitely a sprint / summer scent but I have to admit, I may wear it this winter because I love it THAT much . My husband is not one to love all of my perfumes because of how sugary sweet I like them but he really liked this one ! ( it’s not sugary sweet ).

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
I agree with the comment below. I read and heard so many positive things about this and the notes looked promising. I picked up a 3.4 oz at Marshall’s on a blind buy for $20 or so.

However the dry down is odd to me. It is strangely stale and masculine. I am not overly feminine with my perfume tastes and can handle unisex fragrances, but the dry down smells like a cheap men’s cologne in its final appearance before disappearing completely.

Maybe it’s the cedar?

Edit: I just tried the CK Gold and it smells like the MUCH better version of this.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I blind bought this as a YouTube recommendation for summer. The opening is wow, fresh citrus, perfect. Then within seconds, the dry down begins and I begin to dislike this more and more. It took me a while to work out what this smelt like, but I get a few things. I used to spend every working day wearing latex gloves and that powdery latex is what the drydown reminds me of. I also get a smoker covering up their smoking with gum from this and a log cabin in a pine forest. I think this perfume is more autumn for me, it's got a lot of warmth to it despite the fresh citrusy opening. Needless to say, this isn't for me but it doesn't mean it's not for you. A lot of people love this one. It's now found a new home!

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: Absolutely stunning fragrance with near to zero longevity&projection. The opening is fresh and citrusy, the dry down creamy and alluring. I would pay 10 times more for the same smell but lasting at least 3 hours. Anyway, I'll repurchase for sure.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: I really wanted to like this. On paper it ticks all the boxes, juicy fresh citrus, the typical unisex quality of ck fragrances, and a dry down into vanilla and amber to make it more feminine. What could possibly go wrong? It opens with a very in-my-face, rather masculine citrus scent, then quickly turns into nothing much on my skin. A faint cologne smell lingers, but doesn’t excite me either. What a shame.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content:
I was testing it for two months now, I don’t like it at all it’s a unisex perfume.
It starts with a strong citrus opening, then the base notes sandalwood starts .. the notes are not blended well

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: SO GOOD! I love it, it's such a nice citrus scent OMG! It has this sweetness also that makes it perfect! Amazing for summer! Only thing is you have to reapply, but I don't mind! I ALWAYS get compliments wearing this one!

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This is a lovely fragrance with an unusual note that I assume is the cactus since it outlasts the opening grapefruit and citrus. Orchid is an imaginary floral note, so it's not that. It only works well in warm weather, so late spring, summer and early fall. Now sadly it doesn't last very long, perhaps 3 hours, so I have been been looking for something similar with more longevity. FCUK Late Night is definitely not it, as it is missing the lovely cactus smell.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: What can I say? I love it. It's a beautiful perfume for very little money....and that's my favorite kind!! I first heard of this from Ksenja's YouTube channel and she highly recommended it. I was still wary because my taste isn't the same as hers but I figured in would try it anyway because it was less than $20 for a huge bottle. Another $2 would have gotten me double the size but I didn't want that massive thing in my collection and I still wasn't sure what it smelled like but OMG it was love at first sniff for me and I'll never be without it again. It's fresh and zesty but there's a sweetness to it at the same time that is very addicting. I can't stop smelling my wrist when I spray this. Overspraying is required w this one but that shouldn't be an issue considering the price point. This could be worn in the Fall, Spring and Summer but not in the Winter. It's a pleasant day time fragrance that is an easy reach. Perfect for the gym, running errands or staying at home....a major win in my collection.

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: This smells awesome on me. Love the zesty opening! BUT my skin eats fragrances so within 2 hours any hint of the perfume is gone. I have tried every tip and hack to prolong my perfume. Any recommendations of another perfume it can be layered with?

product_name: CK IN2U for Her Calvin Klein
review_content: In this I smell CK One, CK Be, & Grapefruit. I am not getting much Vanilla on my skin, or Sandalwood on the drydown. Sandalwood isn't listed, so I guess some are getting that note as it's turning on their skin. I am not in love, I hope I will get there like some of you have!

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Not bad. Opening is competitive with more expensive colognes. It doesn't change much after that. Notes sort of peel off until it's faint. An easy winter reach when the more expensive stuff like Spicebomb Extreme isn't warranted.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is a feel good, sweet cherry tobacco fragrance to me, smells nostalgic to me even though I don't recall ever smelling this one. Surprisingly nice performance with my bottle, 5 solid hours! May not sound great, but 5 hours.. I mean, that's pretty long, and just when you think it's a skin scent, you get a whiff and realize its projecting still.

I think this is an all ages fragrance, its simply up to your interpretation. It's worth your money, if you don't like it, your out $20 MAX, give it a go!

also I can't help but defend the bottle design, the neon green spray-paint, yeah I mean.. it's different but I think it's kind of nice looking, especially in a collection.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
It does resemble a sweet pipe tobacco but only when it's moist and unburned in the container, not while being smoked. And then not for long.

But if you want something that REALLY smells like pipe tobacco (perhaps a little too much) try "Pipe Tobacco" by Demeter. Not subtle, it's like getting hit over the head with a tub of Captain Black. Alas, I like getting hit over the head with a tub of Captain Black.

Anyway, Shock and Demeter should layer nicely.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: I finally let my curiosity get the best of me and I bought a bottle of this after years of hearing what a solid cheapie it is. I must say I totally agree. Shock is a tremendously likeable tobacco-centric scent that's more than worth the modest price of admission. The tobacco here is genially sweet and nicely paired with some fresh aromatic notes and a noticeable amount of lavender in the dry down. It's warm, masculine, and inviting with a nice blend of tobacco, amber, spice, sweetness, and fresh fruit & floral notes. Performance is pretty average, not terrible and certainly acceptable at the $20 price point I paid for a 100ml bottle. The dry down reminds me vaguely of several other colognes without being an imitation of any of them. Burberry Brit might be the closest, though I prefer Shock thanks to it's more prominent tobacco (and Brit always smells like shaving foam to me). It also reminds me a little of the OG Spicebomb, and I can't help thinking that Shock might be what you'd get if you added some tobacco to the OG Le Male with its shared lavender base. Anyway, it's funny how odd the bottle design is for this scent: why CK thought "let's splatter the word 'Shock' in a dayglo green graffiti font" to market this cozy tobacco scent is beyond me. But a solid scent it is bad bottle and all. If you're curious like I was, I say go for it.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Very basic but it smells nice. Definitely a safe blind choice.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Poor performance

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
9/10
This is absolute peak. The tobacco in there is absolutely amazing! Reminds me of tobbaco vanille from tom ford and gentleman society ambrée from givenchy (to be honest, i like CK one shock more than these 2 COMBINED) this is amazing. smell 10/10 but the longevity is bad. Great fragrance overall, better for winter and fall id say.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Already left one review, this was one of a few starters that got me into the 'game'. In a rack store I knew Calvin Klein from adolescence and bought Obsession for Men and yes I still love that one. But I decided Ck One Shock for Him sounded interesting. I could have cared less about concentration, scores, or what time or year to wear. I got it and loved it! Wonderful comforting smell, some citrus at the top as well. It's cheap and punches above that price. Try it, worth every penny. Want a long lasting version? Dua Fragrances Shocker for Him is a highly concentrated version and it's great and long lasting.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Fantastic oriental tobacco fragrance for beginners. Only for cool weather or cool nights. You'll have to respray so keep a refillable atomizer with you and get the large bottle. Once you're done with this bottle, i suspect you'll be ready to graduate up the ladder to other tobacco fragrances.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: A pleasant Winter/Autumn scent that dries down to a bland musk. Inoffensive and uncomplicated and definitely leans more to the younger generation. In terms of bang for buck this is a solid choice, if you're a teenager this'll do the job.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: La Nuit De L'Homme but with some sweetness and opening that smells like a Monster energy drink. Good for the price, can't go wrong with it. Might need to overspray.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: This is one of those you get if you absolutely need a cheapie for fall. Otherwise save your money and put it with the other money you’d be spending on a cheapie to replace this one when you realize that this lasts about two hours and then it’s gone and buy a better one. It’s not bad, the scent is pleasant but you have to do like 20 sprays to get anything out of it.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
A surprisingly well-rounded fragrance for the price. The opening brings a sweet, slightly earthy tobacco that's warm and smooth. This is paired with an ambery base that feels cozy and inviting.

There’s a sticky, syrupy sweetness, but it avoids being overly dense or cloying. I get faint hints of licorice and violet, which add a soft nuance, but for people who don't like licorice it's not that strong here. Despite the tobacco/amber core, there’s also a subtle clean, woody-aromatic undertone that keeps it from feeling too heavy.

On my skin, I don’t pick up much spice, but I would assume that would only make the tobacco more lively and possibly give it a little bit of smokiness.

Overall, CK One Shock is one of those excellent entry-level amber-tobacco fragrances—warm, approachable, and versatile in cooler weather. A inexpensive pick for someone just getting into deeper, slightly darker scents.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Unjustifiably overhated by fragrance snobs because of its affordability, afforable does not equal bad quality.

This fragrance is better than any other cheap arabian fragrance and you can notice it from the quality of the notes, it does not smell cheap at all, this can very be a worthy $120+ fragrance if put in a Prada or Dior bottle, and everyone would go insane

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
10/10

Probably the most non-offensive cold weather fragrance and the most wearable one, which will not give you a headache when oversprayed, surprisingly.

Well blended creamy, linear cardamonic and warm tobacco scent, you can't go wrong 9 out of 10 people will like this one.

I don't get the redbull note that everyone is talking about.

It persists like crazy on my skin, I can pull 8-10 hours with a few sprays, maybe it's been reformulated?

Absolute steal for $25.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
CK One Shock
You know what? This fragrance isn't that bad. I gave it another chance one day, and this is what I experienced.
The opening is still fucking ass, just like my old review explained, but the drydown actually isn't the worst thing in the world. It reminds me of tobacco and coke mixed together, very interesting and good in its own way.
Completely disregarding the old review I made, this fragrance is really special for being ass until it's not. But the opening weighs this down enough for me to say that it's just ok
(Never mind, this shit left residue on my skin, never wearing it again and getting rid of it asap).
3.5/10

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
I'm so old I remember ads for this fragrance on TV back in 2011! If Dr Pepper sold pouches of cherry tobacco for rolled up cigarettes it would smell like this!

People compare this to smelling like an energy drink. I never pictured that before but it definitely could remind you of a fresh can of red bull just opened perhaps but the tobacco gives it more quality and hides the sweetness well.

The tacky green spray paint art font gives it a youthful impression but any guy can wear this. Great for cold weather mornings especially. I've seen 200ml on deals for 25 euro! Insane value! Maybe it's not the longest lasting but it's not terrible, average for an edt, smells really nice.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Got this mostly for the graffiti bottle, and heard there's a Futura 2000 one too, now I'm on the hunt! Smells mostly like smoky tobacco on me, kinda like a sweaty club. Longevity is super weak, reapplied all night. Bottle's awesome, but the scent fades fast, welp.

6/10

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Just got this one today after basing off of reviews only, but I'm kinda mixed with it. I'm a casual scent user but I was able to smell different scents before. This one smells like a medicine-like cherry and a bit of powder at the initial spray. I almost hated it, but after it dries down, it kinda settled into a more lavender powder and a bit of cherry cola. Overall, its fine but I dont think its for me lol. Still would use it tho.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: I enjoy this but fail to understand how it is a flanker for CK1? I can’t determine any similarities. It’s a lovely and inoffensive sweet tobacco. The spray painted bottle art is offensive because it’s ridiculous and lazy. Ck could have launched a new new fragrance altogether with this new

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells just like La Nuit De L’Homme just with added light tobacco. Just as boring too

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: No harsh opening, great smelling fragrance the tobacco and base notes really stand out and shine for me. Great for fall, winter, and/or a date/cuddle night. lasts around 6-8 hours projects for around 4-6 with moderate sillage but for the price being cheap just do extra strays for it to last longer and project. at the least 6. 7.5/10

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Very y2k. The duality of a y2k frat bro with a popped collar and a visor hat on, or the y2k emo invader zim sort of vibe. The apple is like a dry jolly rancher apple but more complicated. It’s a no brainer for either of those fits. Youthful. I like it for both the vibes and general feeling. I wear it for specific silly y2k outfits I wear. It’s comforting in a way it screams young ignorance and i like it.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: my sniffer must be all kinds of messed up because this smells like apple cinnamon oatmeal

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Criminally underrated!
Opens icy & sharp, then melts into spiced tobacco, lavender & citrus.
Cozy, sexy & addictive, like Burberry London’s rebellious cousin, yet it carves it's own youthful edge.
Dirt cheap for 200ml.
Just wish it lasted longer.
8/10.
Needs an EDP.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Can't remember if I reviewed this previously but this is one of my favorites for winter and fall. I have a cost with fur around the hood. I always spray it down with CK Shock in the winter. It's a signature scent when I wear that coat.

It's so so SO so good. I didn't know what to expect the first time I purchased it. The bottle is terrible and looks nothing like the fragrance smells. The bottle will have you thinking you are about to buy a damn monster drink. But the juice is exquisite.

It's kinda sweet but the tobacco in this isn't as serious and stern as it is in a lot of fragrance. The tobacco is really chill and sanguine. Very laid back and hedonistic.

Btw I almost always layer this with Cremos Spice & Black Vanilla. Major compliment puller. They cut through winter air delightfully together. If you're on the fence, just get it. For the price there are very few in its league. It doesn't smell cheap, the atomizer gives a very generous amount of juice each spray. It's long lasting. It's sexy. Very sexy. 9/10

Deducted a point because of the bottle

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Honestly, CK One Shock is way better than I expected for the price. The first spray hits you with a sweet, almost citrusy redbull vibe with a little spice from cardamom and lavender. It’s solid, but not over the top in terms of intensity.

As it settles, that warm, sweet cherry pipe tobacco kicks in and really gives it an balanced edge. The dry down is smooth It feels warm, a little sexy, and honestly kind of addictive makes you want to lean in again to catch a whiff.

It doesn’t last all day maybe 4 to 7 hours max on me but for a cheaper scent it has a banger status in my opinion. I rate it 8/10 will buy the 200 ml again.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Pretty good choice for people who don't care about fragrance too deeply and just want something cheap that's reasonably well done and easy to like.

This is a slightly gourmandy (but not terribly sweet) tobacco in a similar area as something like Burberry London or D&G The One, with an amber-woody base, but it's a step less complex than either of those already quite straightforward scents. The upside is that for me CK One Shock seems to have better performance than either of them.

The combination of sweet + simple makes this feel appropriate for young guys, a teenager could surely wear it too. If you want to underline sophistication or authority through your perfume, look elsewhere.

The contrast between the terrible branding and the scent itself is funny, though still not as silly as Philipp Plein No Limits.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: It doesn’t smell bad - but to my nose it feels very juvenile. Would do good for a 16 year old, but I can’t see myself pulling this off. I wish there was some bitterness in the base, maybe some vetiver to balance out the sweet tobacco. Just my thoughts.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Absolutely love it! For around 20€ for 100ml this is great buy. Opens up like sour, medicinal cherry, but startes fading in to milky vanilla, tobacco and powdery musk. I am in my early 20s now and got this only year ago beacuse I remember seeing it in stores in 2012. Probably first fragrance in my life that I saw/remember. Definitely for younger crowd, I wish I started with fragrances in my early high school days (not at end of high school like i did) my high school experience would be much better and this fragrance would definitely be my pick, great for high school parties and dates. I live in mediterranean climate and this is for winter, autumn, spring day and night and cooler summer nights. I love this bottle and box design soo nostalgic to me like drinking energy drink before going to party. Longevity is solid on my skin probably around 6 hours, projection also solid, but don't be afraid to use 4 or more sprays. My advice if you are in early highschool days(14 to 17,18) don't waste money on expensive fragrances get this one, you won't regret it. I think it best suits mid teens to mid 20s.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Omg ... best $21 I've spent on a blind buy fragrance in a long time ... big YES! This really is pretty simple ... it's a slightly sweet, spicy, slightly fruity tobacco. As it dries down it pretty much smells the same as the opening and mid notes ... just a little more subtle with the addition of the woodsy note with awesome amber and musk. This is a masculine fragrance ... PERIOD. If you're the kind of guy that likes John Varvatos Vintage, Bentley Absolute ... or even the original Bentley for Men .... then you probably will like this. The funny thing is because of the weird and "youthful" presentation and marketing ... well, I kept saying NO. Luckily a friend who is in his late 50s was wearing this ... I asked and was surprised ... SOLD! I ordered it that night. It smells great, is masculine, lasts around 4-5 hours with decent projection and IT'S CHEAP. BUY IT!!!

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: All the downvotes on La Nuit De L’Homme are trippin. Smells just like it.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: A delightfully addictive scent! On first spray it's piercing and slightly icy but it dries down to a sharp, yet warm, herbal, and spicy scent. Yes the bottle is quite tacky but the juice itself is great :) great price too!!

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Used to smell amazing fresh on the opening sweeter on and drydown and last really long like you could spray it and smell it the next day but now it almost smells like nothing maybe a little bit of tobacco but mostly nothing if anyone knows what happened tell me

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells like cigarette dipped in red bull. Very unique scent profile. Good for those who like it, quite nauseating for me though.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Nose Note #277

To me it smells like cinnamon more than anything. I don't feel tobacco. Cinnamon, amber, cardamom, a little bit of pepper - those are dominant notes. Smells like Christmas.

I have two other similar fragrances: Yohji Yamamoto I'm Not Going to Disturb You Pour Homme and 1986 Eclectique Les Bains Guerbois. They all go in the same direction, but Shock for Him is noticably the most synthetic and weak of them. In 15 minutes it's a skin scent on me...

Yet!! I enjoy it more than those two!

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Absurdously disgustingly cheap bottle for the great fragrance it got inside. I have never seen this thing being advertised anywhere and I cannot help, but blaming Calvin Klein for ruining themselves by poor captaining of their own company.
Guys, I see some of you being overzealous for a thingy, that's around 20$. I mean let's be honest choice of women won't be the best for you if you can only afford 20$ to spend on a date. Same goes along other stuff in life.
The scent of this bottle (I won't call a perfume intentionally) is one of the best you can get in this price range. Why? Because it is a definitely good designer blend, which we rarely find in arabic dupes. There are designer companies out there, which could have easily sold this for thrice this price and half the volume (like D&G, Valentino, etc.) and you would have appreciated it just because you are a fanboy or biased. Now, I gotta say, that Calvin Klein sells the best designer fragrances at a very reasonable cost to this day and 20$ for a 200ml juice of this kind is like a one great 'welcome home' from a lady for your cheap ass.
Depending on your local climate and weather factors, you can easily abuse this even in the summer, when it is windy. It is intoxicatingly fresh and beats the entire Calvin Klein Eternity line imho.
There is something I noticed the chemistry of my body does with this fragrance, altering it to something very mature, masculine and appealing to women, once I return from my daily running exercise. I have made it a ritual to always buy me a can of beer after that, so women on the queue in the store would start staring at me and approaching me to get a sniff or two. Just for a comparison almost every other sweet perfume I have, would turn to something like a sweetened vinegar and pickles, so good job here CK.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: I bought this when I was in high school to cover up the smell of my cigarette smoke. unexpectedly it was able to remove the smell🤣🤣. it's good for those of you who like the smell of tobacco, but not overpowering. The longevity is pretty good for an EDT, about 6 hours on my clothes and skin, while the projection is good in the first 3 hours. i would give it an 8/10.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: I really enjoy wearing this fragrance when I'm at work or if I'm just lounging at home or running errands. Great tobacco fragrance with some sweetness and the cardamom in this fragrance is prominent to say the least. Longevity and projection are great for me because I spray my clothing as well as my skin so for me this lasts most of the day I'm talking 12+ hours and longer. Very good bargain fragrance that smells great and you can find this at your local Ross or Marshalls.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Just want to say I love this fragrance but it doesn't last long. Maybe 2 hours unless I'm going nose blind to it. It is a perfect combo of sweets and tobacco. One of my top favorite tobacco scents only recently dethroned by Insurrection II Wild which smells like a cherry swisher sweet.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Reminds me a lot of Obsession for men but more smooth and youthful. Good winter/fall Cheapy.

7/10

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Sweet tobacco and gives you a warm feeling, ck killed it with this one. this is basically the scent i wear at home and my go to for a quick outdoorsy trip longevity sucks on that one but great scent regardless.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Sweet and spicy! I can really smell the pepper and lavender in the opening.

The logo design is kinda crazy (doesn't match the scent), the bottle is refillable (has a screw off removable atomizer), similar to CK One.

The drydown is nice. Hints of tobacco, wood and patchouli. Subtle, not overly powerful.

It's a great starter for someone curious about getting into tobacco fragrances.

Price point was nice. I got 100ml for $30 CAD.

Longevity and projection is average/decent. If this performed like an EDP, that would be amazing.

Just overspray or decant some to a 5ml travel atomizer bottle and respray midday!

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: All I get is sweet tobacco, clove-like ingredients, musk, and mandarin ( a note that goes away after 10 or so minutes). I can't really pick up on the other listed notes clearly, but this is such a nice scent. For an EDT, it lasts pretty long on the skin for 8 hours; projection is decent for the first hour or so. Smells very similar to PDM's Oajan. For under $30 you cannot go wrong.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
When I occasionally wear this I am always surprised of how good it is! It’s a no-brainer for the price. Yeah the bottle is ugly, but the juice itself is heavenly. A really round and comforting Tobago sent. Love!

Honestly, think if the bottle had a great design, this would be super popular

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
I loved Dark Obsession and was over the moon when I learned that CK Shock is basically that except with fruity notes instead I believe a more chocolately or some kind of darker/rich top note. I was worried it would be too fruity or sweet. I got the bottle the other day for a great price ($26 for 6.7oz I believe). The minute I opened it I was in love. It was sweeter than I remember, but not overwhelmingly cloying. After inserting the sprayer, I went into the kitchen (I have a 3000+ sq ft house). This scent, not having sprayed it or anything yet, was filling the living room, kitchen, and first bathroom within 5 minutes. I didn't realize it at first until I was like, "What is that beautiful smell? Ohhh the Shock!" Just having the cap laying around, I kept smelling it and smelling it.

Despite the potency, it was not overwhelming and was quite pleasant. Whenever the bottle is near me, I get little wafts of it. It is so intoxicating, so beautiful. I love it on my boyfriend. I am tempted to wear it myself around the house I love it so much. I am not sure about projection or sillage yet on the skin, but I get little currents of smell of it from my boyfriend when he's wearing it. I did notice it seems to mellow out relatively shortly (within 3-4 hours) on skin. But you get so much of it for a good price that I think having to reapply is worth it. I also think the new fruity note puts it right on the edge of almost being too sweet but it toes that line well. I am guessing Shock is CK's way of trying to compete with Axe and other body sprays, which is why it is marketed towards younger men. But I think if you don't want to smell like a barbershop or a blue/sport fragrance all the time, this is a good alternative. Would be great for date night, too.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: CK shock would have smelled SO GOOD without that DAMN CUCUMBER NOTE (It ruins both náutica voyage and CK shock). 7/10 with the CUCUMBER NOTE, 9/10 without It.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Sweet, fizzy orange-y cinnamon bomb. I smell a total of zero percent tobacco in this fragrance. Very loud, brash and in-your-face. It does smell like an extra spiced up version of Red Bull.

It's the same kind of fragrance as Fuel for Life by Diesel; for the young crowd that want to be seen and heard by their peers. For me, it's fun to wear for a little bit but dulls out as it does not progress beyond its initial smell.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Gonna come back and write a follow up but first impressions are a miss with me.

I smell all the notes and the "energy drink" sweetness but to me it has a head that smells like incense and dries down to a powdery musky incense. Reminds me of walking into a spencers in the 2000s and smelling that incense smell.

Can smell the spicy/tobacco/pepper but its just overwhelmed by whatever the musk/incense note is.

Wouldnt even say its a masculine smell either smells unisex/more male at best. I heard calvin klein has been making their "for him" scents more unisex lately and this one seemingly falls into that category.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: This is a great buy. I picked up a 200ml bottle for around 25$ and it smells fantastic. Sweet tobacco and spice throughout. The cardamom is very nice here, but not a cardamom bomb by any means like LNDL, or D&G The One. Definitely more tobacco leaning. Reminds me a lot of Sexual Sugar Daddy by Michel Germain, but less soapy and more spicy. I also think I smell a slight leather note, but that might just be my nose. The atomizer is also fantastic.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
I bought this based only off of the reviews. The first time I smelled it I was struck with the memory of what VO5 shampoo used to smell like. It totally ruined this for me. Every time I wear it I can’t get “VO5” out of my head.

Maybe I’ll try it again in the future…

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Fall/Winter Cheapie extraordinaire

Value = 5/5
Sillage = 3.5/5
Scent= 5/5
Performance = 4.5/5

If you’re looking for a Fall/Winter signature scent that won’t break the bank, look no further than CK One Shock.

The dry down is fresh red tobacco, cherry cola/ energy drink, and lavender, with a slight powderiness

There’s a reason that CK one Shock has been around for 30+ years. It’s a classic scent that pulls compliments. Equally at home in a office setting or a date night. This is a subtle scent that lasts about 6 hours. I use 4 squirts and add one of Tom Ford Lost cherry or Maison Alhambra Lovely Cherie just to amp up the cherry aspect

100% blind by worthy for the price and performance

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Not bad, my issue with this is that it smells so darn cheap.

It’s like eating a cheeseburger from McDonalds — You immediately know from even just the smell it's cheap. McDonalds has the unmistakable taste and smell of a fast, mass-produced sandwich, evoking memories of getting a cheeseburger for a few bucks that disappears in two bites, leaving you questionably satisfied and still hungry. No complex, sophisticated, premium, multifaceted image comes to mind. It instantly registers as McDonalds, point-blank.

If you can get around that, you might like it! The performance is pretty good but I certainly wouldn’t want to smell like this for a while; not for me.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: This is one of my favorite fall/winter fragrances, and at the price point, you can't beat it. I find it comical how they marketed it, and if they had put it in a more refined, mature bottle, chances are you wouldn't find it so cheap. It has a wonderful, warm, sweet tobacco smell with some mild spice, and lasts a long time. You can find this pretty regularly at Ross. So if you see a bottle and don't have it yet, are looking for a nice, easy cold weather fragrance, I say pick it up.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Entry level oriental fragrance.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
The opening is just how I remember it from years ago...energy drink. It's synthetic in a sweet and addictive way...that orange (or whatever citrus) with the cucumber and herbs converge in a way that just reminds me distinctly of energy drinks. The neon green wording against a black bottle doesn't help either 😆 I love it.

It dries down quickly, and it's adorable in it's casual-ness. When I first encountered this one, I was younger, and less jaded. Nostalgia is all over this review, and I'm sorry, but it's a fragrance more for the heart than for a refined palate.

Still, this isn't objectively a bad fragrance at all. No, it's nothing particularly special (it's a little like Jazz Club or The One, but less rich and dense), but it's a profile I tend to absolutely fall for. Maybe, in some way, I love the other tobacco spices because this one left an impression on me as a young woman. Hard to know exactly, I have a type though.

I nagged my husband into buying this (it's fine, he loves it too), and it's drying down in a lovely way on him. It's ambery, inviting, unpretentious, simple, but it's such a true feel-good fragrance. If he didn't want to wear this, I just would myself to experience it. It's a bit more masculine, with it being herbaceous the way it is, but not terribly so (many warm-leaning fragrances are fairly unisex to my nose, men's or women's, but who cares, wear what you love).

Glad to have a bottle of this in the house finally. CK is one of my favorite brands, I must concede. Simple, effective stuff that tends to evoke nostalgia. Extremely easy to wear, but often...not boring. Shock is a love.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Been contemplating this one for a while. Finally got a bottle. This is a different take on the discontinued CK Dark Obsession. It seems they simply removed the floral note from CKDO and replaced it with a fruity note for CK Shock.

This would be a good substitute if you enjoyed CK Dark Obsession but find it overpriced now or difficult to find. Longevity is about the same for both. Another difference is that Dark Obsession seemed more mature and formal, while Shock is a bit more youthful and casual. But the DNAs are very similar.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells just like a weaker version of obsession to me, i like obsession so this smells nice.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Just picked up my third bottle of this from Ross today and they had the 6.7 oz bottle for 29.00 bucks and I had to get it. CK shock is one of the best budget friendly fragrances you can buy and for me I love to wear this to work in the winter ❄️ months because it smells great and it projects all day on skin and clothing. If you enjoy sweet tobacco fragrances but your short on cash? Grab yourself a bottle of CK one shock. 10/10

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Quick addition, Prada Black smells very close to CK One Shock for Him. Shock has more citrus and rounded for the year. Prada black, less citrus. Both great. Prada lasts longer (it should for 5x the cost) but I like Shock better. Just an observation to help others

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
@Nabster

Sorry, but where are you from? Throughout Europe, CK One Shock is available in all possible perfumeries, stationary and online... there are millions of bottles. And if not Europe, check if, (for example) Amazon operates in your country. They also have full warehouses with Calvin Klein perfumes.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: KanyeWestFragrances: Shit comment. Your TF tobacco is for metros. REAL TOBACCO SMELLS LIKE SMOKIN PIPE IN A DIRTY BATHROOM IN THE RAIN

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Ck On Shock I remember when this came out.. Its impressive considering its a designer CK fragrance.. Was ahead of its time with why they tried to do. Unfortunately it doesn’t perform well.. For the price however.. You can reapply without worrying.. Really cool classic!

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Anyone know where I can get this I cant find it anywhere! Thank you please send me a priv message or something. Ty

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Cinnamon vanilla and tobacco, good cheapie fragrance and perfect winter budget cologne, also don't listen to the idiot spoon feds who say there's better fragrances and you're a sucker for getting this, BRO THIS IS $20 and I can overspray! YOUR TF TOBACCO VANILLE IS $400 QUIT KNOCKING POOR PEOPLE DOWN!!

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: I find it very strange that the same perfumer who created some of the most obnoxiously loud fragrances known to man -- a good number of the AXE Body Spray fragrances -- created a great smelling tobacco fragrance that has hardly any projection after 30 minutes, and virtually disappears after a few hours. You would think that with a proper perfume/cologne being sold at this price point, the projection would be monstrous and the durability would be eternal, given who made it. This is bizarre to me.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: @FRAGfanSK if this is "the best tobacco fragrance you've ever smelled" then you havent smelled enough tobacco fragrances lol

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
This was my first tobacco fragrance I bought and still it remains the best tobacco fragrance I smelled - in terms of smell.
The smell is really good, tobacco in there is soft, sweet, and balanced. There is nothing harsh, syntetic or disturbing. Smell does not change during the drydown too much, it is pretty stable.
