It is a masculine scent, but not too much, that means it fits younger guys too. Besides the tobacco, cardamon could be smelled, then amber and patchouli. I do not get the mandarin nor cucumber... I like the smell really much, and everybody I asked loved it too. Drawback is the longevity and projection. It lasts for about 4-5 hours and projection is moderate. I recommend to re-spray it after 4 hours, because after that it is a skin scent only. Price is nevertheless amazing, you will not buy better tobacco fragrance for this price. It smells better than spicebomb extreme, belive me. It is verry underrated fragrance, that deserves your attention. Do not be affraid about tobacco, it is pleasant for women in this version, it is manly but still confortable to wear by anybody. Wear it during the fall or winter, day or night, is suitable for date or to office. It will surprise you after the first spray, how good it is. Enjoy!

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
If you're over the age of 16, I wouldn't recommend this one.
I got half a bottle of this as a gift and every time I tried to give it a chance, I ended up hating it more. Maybe it's the cucumber in the opening combined with the tobacco base note, but it just has a sickly smell to it. The longevity is definitely good though, I sprayed some in the kitchen after cleaning up the bottle a bit and I would smell it every time I entered the room for the next 3 days (and regret spraying it).
Something about it just screams immature and trashy to me. The first fragrance of an inexperienced teenager.
Even if you're looking for a cheap starter fragrance, there's much better options. Do yourself a favor and avoid this one.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Opening, like another user mentioned, smells like Dr. Pepper, the tobacco is front and center rounding things out, and the drydown smells like a less intense Joop! Projection and longevity are great. For what it is it's much nicer than it has any right to be. One of the best bangs for your buck.
Believe the hype.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Still to this day the hype is real. Everything you've likely heard about it is accurate. " Possibly the best rack store cheapie you can buy" , "Shockingly sexy for the money", "Among the best bang for your buck fragrances on the market", Etc. Thank the fragrance Gods that Calvin Klein stuck this in an absurd and Ill-fitting bottle, put it in the CK One line, and put no promotion behind it because otherwise it would still be to this day 3-4x the price, and people would totally pay it. Starts out smelling like Dr. pepper meets Red Bull then settles down into a strangely fresh and energetic warm spicy ambery sweet Tobacco. Truly unique and alluring, masculine yet sweet, warm yet a bit youthful. Pretty versatile in the fall and winter. You could wear this day or night, to work/school, on a date, or just hanging out. Nothing too dressy or formal though. If youre not sure about tobacco, I assure you this is non intimidating, easy to wear and mass pleasing in a very good way. A banger from CK. $20 bucks at Burlington all day. Just buy it!

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: solid blind buy ngl, ysl lndl comparison kinda eh with this one but still solid just to wear every once n a while

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: One of my favorite budget friendly fragrances in my collection. I love to wear this at work in the winter ❄️ time and it last on my skin and clothing all day with great projection. And with a 20.00 💵 dollar price for a 100ml you can't go wrong with this one .

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Pleasantly surprised by this one! I love a spicy warm scent- and my favorite is Spicebomb. And anyone that says they are the same is nose-blind. I can see some similarities, but that's like calling folders and nesspresso the same thing! But this is pretty darn good for the price point- and it delivers on the warm spicy. The bottle betrays the scent- as they don't really connect at all. It looks like it's gonna be a sassy loud sport scent. I get a lot of sweetness at first- and surprised I don't see Cinnamon as an intentional note. It mellows out well and lasts longer than I was expecting. I have been trying this side by side with Dirty English- and I will say it holds up MUCH better after a couple hours. At this price- I'll be keeping it in the collection and rotation for days I don't want to put on the expensive stuff! As a woman who loves masc scents- I find this very gender neutral.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
SOTD
It's a good scent for today's weather (a rainy day in the fall). As other reviews said, the smell is complicated. Although the opening is a little harsh to me, the dry down is not a simple smell. I agree with others that this one probably does not need to be included in the CK One line; it absolutely can be itself. I got it 6.8oz for around $30, which is worth a blind buy to me. It stays on my skin for 6hrs. However, the dry down is nothing special, like many mid-eastern cologne.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Think I have written before but this one is 🔥 imo. I think it's one that even non CK fans will respect. One of the best tobacco scents you will get. I like this better than jazz club by far, and several other tobacco scents. It's just unique and worth the blind buy at $15 to $20.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Nothing special

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Smell like straight rubbing alcohol and geese necks

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
A likeable tobacco/amber perfume with some fruits. Performance is moderate overall. Similar to Zara's Unexpected Fresh Spicy, although the Zara performs better.
But Shock is a really nice masculine scent. Almost a love from me.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
All I get from this is amber a hint of tobacco and slight pepper in the drydown. Strong alcohol opening.its a linear scent .And has little projection . It does however last long , I get over 7 hours which is great for a ck fragrance . I don't know how on earth people are smelling chocolate at all , so strange 🤔
It suits the younger crowd best I think.
I tried this quite a few years ago and it was different to what I remember, I actually enjoyed it when I tried it before. Maybe they took out some ingredients. I get no top notes at all. And it's a genuine bottle from a retailer. I can't imagine anyone faking this scent.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: It's amazing for it's price. Smells like chocolate tobacco filter

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Interested in picking it up? Looking at reminds me of? Well, do pick it up!
And don't look at the reminds me of lol. Le Nuit De l'homme? No. Dark Obsession, no. The one Dolce&Gabbana, seriously? No. There is some similarity to Bentley Intense for Men. The tobacco in both are similar, but Shock is a zesty burst somehow warm and masculine all at once. The notes listed in top notes I don't really understand because I pick up zero cucumber among others but who cares. You just need to try it. $20 for 100 ml, $30 for 200 ml. Love this! It is a sleeper. Not gourmand but sweet. Very masculine and great tobacco note. It's very versatile and cheap. It hangs close to the skin but spray more on! It's cheap! When I wear it I have a travel bottle that I carry to refresh. Love it!

Update, still love it so unique and projection and longevity are a lot better than people have said in my experience. Great stuff!

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: This came as a disappointment, it came off in my skin as a grannies house, yeah... 💀5/10

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: This is my first fragrance, a drop deal no brainer blind buy for collectors and for those just getting into fragrance! This stuff rocks, I’d almost go as to say it’s an all season fragrance but not for the mornings, but it would be fitting mostly for fall and winter. For night, this stuff is great! My mom even likes it so that’s a plus 🙏

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is all over the place with its notes. I smell a ton of things. At first spray it's strong . It's an aroma bomb and is giving hints that it's a beast mode long lasting fragrance ( it's not). So as I had heard it does smell like cherry cough syrup . With a little spice and pungent rubber. After about a minute or 2 it starts smelling a lot like a fall cinnamon candle. The sweet tobacco in this to me smells a lot like cinnamon. At this stage it smells a lot like a fall spices candle. Like walking through the fall aisle in a store. At this point I think it's ok but I don't know if it's something I want to smell like. It's still pretty strong . Once it has been on the skin and hits its final form which is about 15 to 20 minutes later it really mellows out and becomes way easier on the nose. It's like a spiced tobacco cinnamon syrup . It stays close to the skin but it's definitely there. It projects strong for about an hour. And becomes a close but strong skin scent after that. The sillage is not bad at all. It will be a close skin scent at about
2 hours and will fade away by the 4th hour. It's not that horrible performance wise but on the first whiff you assume this thing is gonna be nuclear for hours.
It is definitely a fall and winter fragrances. It will work day and night . But it will be more for the evening for me. I also see myself wearing this more when I go out with friends. Don't think I would wear this on date night and probably not work. It is very masculine smelling. Anyone that tries this out don't just spray it on and wash it off of you don't like it. It totally has stages and the end result is quite nice. I wish this were less spiced to let more of a natural tobacco note shine. It smells too much like cinnamon to me. Overall I can see why CK One Shock is liked by many and I can see why many will think it smells nasty. I give this a 6/10 . I'll update this score once we hit the end of fall. I just hope the performance improves but I kinda doubt it will.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: This is much fruitier and sweeter than the note breakdown shows. This has a definitive cherry opening that last halfway though the dry down that is not even mentioned here. Delicious fragrance, if it wasn't for the less than average projection and longevity.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: I love this smell so much, probably my favorite or second favorite smell. It's super like.. vanilla ey to me? It's not a note listed, but I definitely can smell it. It almost smells a bit how I imagine animal musk smells, which sounds weird but it's comforting. I kind of like the bottle actually, it's very smooth and the etching on the bottle is fun to run my fingers over. I also like the font. The marketing is poor, and it should not have been part of the ck one line. Completely different scent profile. Only problem is longevity is kind of mid, 3-4 hours max but it's so cheap it doesn't matter. Great buy, 200ml for like 25 dollars. 5/5

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: One of the best bargain fragrances you can wear for the cooler months to come. I have a medium size collection of niche and designer fragrances and CK One Shock will always be in rotation. Great everyday grab and go casual scent that's very pleasant and has great longevity and it's being sold at an affordable price.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Ok where to start, it's all good tbh. Nice tobacco fragrance that is not that sweet, I wish it was even less sweeter but it's ok, it's cheap and I don't have a performance issues with it, it's not a beast but it lasts ok and my skin eats fragrances like a mofo, so for the price it is a banger!

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: I can't get past the bottle.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: I received the 100ml bottle last XMAS. For $20-$25 this is a bargain for those wanting a relatively simple and straight forward sweet, tobacco scent. Sure the longevity isn't all that great (3-4 hours), but so what? This is an uncomplicated solid tobacco scent. Buy it and wear it with confidence. You can wear it on a cool summer night and during the other 3 seasons as well.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
In certain parts of India, people used to let cow dung dry up and then eventually the cakes, known as 'upla/kanda'(Hindi) were used for cooking because that's how expensive and inaccessible gas was. I have vivid memories of this because I grew up in central India where this was a common practice, especially at my grandmother's, which was like a second home for me.

I keep reading about how every second oud gets called 'barnyard/animalic' on this site and always think that's an exaggeration. This right here, smells exactly like the cow dung cakes we used to use. I say this as someone who comes from a place where we used to have cows in most homes and worshipped them.

As the religion based politics made the place unliveable for someone like me, and now that I have now spent a good 16 years running away from it, this scent managed to remind me of those nights where we'd all sit on the terrace as power was cut, and make something called 'gakkad bharta'(probably the best Indian dish you haven't heard of) on these cow dung cakes. Nostalgic but not something I'd want to smell like and I love nothing more than a good tobacco perfume.

In short, this smells like dried cow dung.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
A shocker.

I only tried it, but to me this is incredible tobacco based perfume, especially for the money.

If you are on the budget and looking for something in that direction, you cannot go wrong. I find C&K in general very underrated, their prices are great and quality too.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Not a bad fragrance as many can say. Recommended for starters looking for a affordable perfume. My problem with this perfume is that its performance is mid, otherwise I'm pretty sure people will be paying more attention to this one. Some may find this smell generic or very common, that's my case.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: This is Shit in a BOTTLE

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: im sorry but this sucks

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: This fragrance smells like spice bomb edt. If you want to get ck on shock don't get spice bomb edt. Spice bomb edt just smells better and has better longevity and sillage.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Completely unusable fragrance, lasts around 2hours, smells very cheap and synthetic. Yes it is cheap, but if you are low on cash just save up for something that is worth it.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
* Attractive hybrid tobacco/aromatic fougere/amber cologne
* The love child of Calvin Klein Eternity and your favorite tobacco fragrance
* Appealing blend of sweet, tobacco, amber spice, musk, herbal and powder aromas
* Great entry level tobacco fragrance
* Actually works well in high heat despite the tobacco base

* Very little effort in presentation
* Should have been separated out from the CK line
* Not unisex
* Not suitable for younger users despite being in a line specifically designed and marketed for younger users
* Not as sophisticated as more popular tobacco fragrances on the market
* Just okay performer; requires overspraying and occasional respraying
* Atomizer separated from bottle and cap won't fit when atomizer attached


Calvin Klein CK One Shock for Him is an original fragrance from Calvin Klein, a flanker in the popular and very prolific CK line which include CK One, CK Be, CK All, CK Everyone and the multitude of flankers each of these spinoffs has generated. They're all very high quality, affordable and distinguished by the famous "drinking flask" bottle.

CK One Shock for Him is definitely one of the better ones in the line. It's a hybrid cologne that mixes tobacco, aromatic fougere and amber style fragrances into a single very attractive mix. Sweet, tobacco, amber spice, musk, herbal and powder aromas come together seamlessly This is very much the illicit love child of Calvin Klein's own famous fougere classic Eterntiy and your favorite tobacco fragrance (think Mancera Red Tobacco or A*Men Pure Havane, for example). That freshness actually makes this work well even in high heat, which is very rare for a tobacco forward fragrance.

This is a great entry level tobacco fragrance for users. However, it still very much leans older due to those tobacco notes and is not suitable for younger users. This makes its inclusion into the CK line as a flanker all the more puzzling to me, as the rest of the entire CK line emphasizes fresh youthful fragrances and are marketed towards younger users. This really should have IMHO been its own separate product away from the CK line and marketed towards older users and deserved a better presentation than the CK bottle. I'm also puzzled by the decision to separate the atomizer from the bottle, as you have to attach it yourself and once you do the cap no longer fits on the bottle. The only other fragrance I have that does this is Paco Rabanne Pour Homme and it's also just as annoying that they did that.

Performance is just okay and I would recommend overspraying on first application and occasionally respraying throughout the day. This is common of the CK line, though. This is overall a reasonably good quality fragrance at a reasonably good price. Recommended.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
I picked up a 100ml bottle at Burlington for about $18 3 years ago. I'm not sure if the price has increased since then, but even if it has, I'd say $25 to $20 range for 100ml is still worth the purchase!

CK One Shock is a great entry level tobacco note frag. I would definitely recommend it to someone who is new to fragrances and is just trying to figure out what they like.

I use this just for daytime casual wear when I'm running errands or going to work. During the fall and winter, I may wear this once or twice a month when I get the itch to spray it.

I'd say I typically get 6 to 8 hours of performance. Which, for a fragrance in this price range is great. However, In order to get to that 8 hour mark, you'll definitely need at least 6-8 sprays. Half of those sprays would need to be on your shirt/clothes.

I get a decent sillage for the first hour, and an arms length of projection for two hours tops.

If you're hunting for compliments, I'm not sure if this will garner many simply because someone may need to be close to you in order to smell it.

For the price point, it's a great value. Overall, CK One Shock is a candidate to be up there with Nautica Voyage on the Cheapie Mt. Rushmore of fragrances.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Feedback for CK One Shock For Him by Calvin Klein

I recently purchased CK One Shock For Him by Calvin Klein. While the scent itself is pleasant and sophisticated, I unfortunately experienced headaches every time I applied it. This is quite disappointing, as I was looking forward to enjoying this fragrance. It might be due to sensitivity to one of the ingredients, which is something potential buyers should be aware of. I hope Calvin Klein considers reviewing the formulation to make it more suitable for individuals with sensitivities.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Blind bought this one at a rack store and struck gold. Wonderful tobacco scent that isnt overly sweet or full of spices. If it preformed better this one would be legendary. Excellent cheapie, highly recommend.

It's also great to layer with some of the other tobacco fragrances out there that are overly sweet, this will really mellow that out. 7.3/10

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Great smelling fragrance but I wish it lasted longer…

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: I’m getting a lot of black licorice and tobacco in mine.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Seriously underrated! And I think it is due to the tackiness of the bottle and colors. In a classier bottle, with a catchier name, this would be several times more expensive.

What a nice tobacco fragrance... Very masculine and clean smelling as it is freshly dried tobacco leaves with spices.

In my opinion, this can be used at all times, as it is a very agreeable scent. Durability? Who cares! This is so affordable that you can reapply whenever you feel the need for that superb tobacco that tingles the nose.

Blind buy recommended!

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Reminds me a little of Versace The Dreamer, not for having the exact scent, but for the cozy feeling it evokes. A cheap, or rather one should say an inexpensive, cuddly scent especially in the mids. Half way through the dry down it becomes a very nice/safe scent. The opening is a bit on the cheap side, but that is only the first 15-30 minutes. If you're thinking this is close to Mancera Red Tobacco, or something gourmand like a TF Tobacco Venille, well, it's not. It is a designer style cologne that shines nicely half way in its dry down.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Only niche snobs will dislike this, this is absolutely delicious and amazing, GREAT CHEAPIE, performance isn't great, works well for summer nights and winter days, very sweet and smooth tobbaco, not a sharp or choking fragrance but it is very cloying if oversprayed. Get 200 mil of this, 100 is simply not enough. Smells very unique, you won't find this on people often because the second they hear CK, they move on. Get this fragrance if you like sweet smooth tobacco and amber fragrances.

Smell: 9.5/10
Performance: 4/10
Bottle: 5/10
Value for price: 10/10
How many sprays? 6-8 should be good.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Great cheapie, heavyyyy on clementine in my batch!

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
All you've heard is true:

1. This smells gorgeous. Sweet and powdery cherry tobacco. It would smell great on a man or woman.
2. You can purchase a huge bottle for next to nothing on discounters, and yet it doesn't smell cheap at all.
3. It's not a top contender in the projection and longevity departments.

So, what should you do with this info?

---> Buy a bottle for next to nothing, carry it in your pocket (where it will fit easily due to its sleek, pocket-friendly design), reapply every hour on the hour knowing it's costing you pretty much nada, and put a smile on your face knowing that you smell amazing and all those around you get to enjoy this great fragrance with you.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Got a bottle today. Great fragrance i get sweet amber smell that reminds me of cola. Smells a bit like the classic Obsession,but more modern. Performance is ok. Good price also. Definately try this fragrance if you like sweet scents.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Vibes with tobacco, amber, and vanilla, similar to oriental perfume, spicy gender, best in winter and fall, but may be used in the summer in a nearby place with air conditioning. It is really good for the 30/40 age group.

Important Note before u buy :

After drying down, I began to smell like ''Vicks VapoRub"
Do not ask me how, which is unpleasant
so test it well before u buy

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: I don't understand why this is an autumn-winter fragrance. It can be worn all year round except on the hottest days. It has freshness, it is pleasant to others, it is not strong and irritating, and this makes it flexible. I wear it for short outings, to the store or around the neighborhood for an hour or two or three.. It's just amazing for the price and no offense to anyone!

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: It has a really pleasant, but masculine scent. Very unique. It stays really close to the skin, no one can smell it around you unless they literally sniff your skin! For it to actually perform somewhat decent you have to go crazy with it and apply about 10-15 sprays, and even then it doesn't last that long. The fragrance performs horrible but just for the nice smell alone I have to give it a 6/10.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
#27 review

Really unique for that price. Affordable but as most of CK not expect much about performance. Good for fall/winter.

My rate 6.5/10

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Have an almost full bottle of this for swap…..

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
I will try to keep this short. This cologne was my first fragrance and smells alright for its price, genuinely nothing special. The scent has tobacco smoky and a little herbal kind of scent to it. Also it is quite chemically and smells a little like my church in the good way. The longevity and sillage are weak to moderate. The bottle is very weird and doesn’t come with a cap that is really accessible. Overall I would not buy this again but it does smell very good. Dont let my review constrict your purchases and if you don’t have it, its only 15 dollars away.

Longevity 6/10
Sillage 5/10
Scent 7.5/10
Bottle 3/10
Blind buy safe 6/10
Overall 6.5/10

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Some People, say that Invictus Victory is a kinda Chocolate Fragrance. This Fragrance ist to me the best Chocolate Tobacco scent ever, this is true pleasant Choco scent. If u want to smell delicious masculine Tobacco like get this. Performance is also great. Dont spray to much.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: I only recently got into fragrances and bought every single fragrance I own without testing it and from about 25 blind buys this was the only one I really hated. It's pungent, stings in the nose. First time I used it it actually made me sneeze. Somehow it's both very harsh and has absolutely no projection. I also hate the capless bottle design which means you can't bring it on the go without it going off in your bag. To me it's a very warm, citrussy fragrance that lasts for about 30 minutes with the citrus being way too overpowering for the first 5 minutes and then being gone completely. This bottle is going to be collecting dust in my collection for a long time.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
No projection at all. Even with 3 sprays on the same spot it's still a skin scent and a very tame one at that.
The scent is not bad, sweet and warm, but the absolutely non existent projection make this completely useless.
With this one you really get what you pay for. Very disappointing.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
The whole thing has a plastic cherry hiss, like a gas leak. A cigarette snubbed in a Red Bull.

And yet, somehow, I have come to love it, even need it.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
You have to like sweet, woody, boring scents with no definite character to love this one.
Sugar, a little caramel, a little sandalwood.
Tobacco? Cucumber? Lavander? Forget it!
I can't find anything like that.
Otherwise smooth, weak and insignificant.
Later on, the terrible sweetness seems to diminish and a floral freshness emerges. Elegant for a date. or office wear, perhaps. Not my thing.
The only shocker is the sweetness.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Starting to use this fragrance as my dress up choice. When it's colder, or I wear a sweater I really enjoy the warmth and powdery tobacco this fragrance puts out. Isn't perfect for everything, I think if it's above 75F or sunny out it doesn't work, but on a nice cloudy day when I've got to get dressed up, it does it's job. The bottle is ugly, the performance (on skin) is mid af, but its a cheap tobacco scent that is unique. A guilty pleasure of mine

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Warm, soft and spicy. Doesn't project too much, but it does last. I enjoy wearing this at night around the house. It gives off cozy vibes and I won't feel any pain when it comes time to buy a replacement. It's not unique enough to wear out in public if you're trying to "wow" others imo, but I find it's better than Burberry London for Men.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: The best way to sum up Ck One Shock is it reminds me of "711" back in the 90's when you walked into your local store. That pungent aroma of Slurpee and Coffee! An amalgamation of every treat sold under one roof and squeezed into a bottle.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Very quick burst of lavender. Dry down smells of a powdery cherry tabacco that lasts around 3 hrs of sillage and 6 close to the arm. Should get you through a work day in the office. It's a awesome winter and fall scent

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Lasted a whole week on my wrist

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
CK One Shock by Calvin Klein:
This is a warm and spicy yet sweet woody fragrance with a big focus on tobacco, with that particular note being done well. It’s a great pickup for the price and a semi-safe blind buy. Good for those colder months with fairly average performance.

Top notes: Pepper, basil, tobacco, some cinnamon
Middle notes: Cardamom, lavender, osmanthus
Base notes: Tobacco, patchouli, wood

3/5

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
This reminds me of The One by D&G EDP, they aren't the same but both share 50% of the same scent profile/type... I bought this blindly 2 years ago and it shocked me because I expected it to be generic fresh CK style or max a simple cologne like an aftershave quality(it was $25 200ml), but surprisingly found it very nice, sweet Tobacco yet balanced, fresh and aromatic.. manly and rich in the dry-down after 10 minutes!... I like the alcoholic blast in the opening (people complaining about it saying it's synthetic) I like it, it disappears quickly and it's very refreshing, especially after showering 💚

I disagree with reviews talking about the weak performance... personally this last 8+ hours on me plus 90 minutes to 2 hours of nice decent projection... the more time passes it smells better and better and becomes more natural on the skin.

This fragrance is not less in beauty than The one by D&G ... it fills the same gap and serves perfectly on the same occasions... and honestly the Tobacco here especially when it settled is way better, richer and more prominent than The one...

I recommend this, young men would love it, and it's a great entrance to the mature type of fragrances ... seriously it's way better than many expensive fragrances... test it, if you like it get the 200 ml it is worth it... good deal👌 you won't regret it.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Yes, it has the Burberry London vibe, but without the prominent cinnamon note. That's why London smells more delcious.
Shock is more energetic, wilder, spicier. London is all about cosy dinner time.
Both are good tobacco fragrances. Both inexpensive!
200ml Shock can be found for 30 EUR in Europe, such a steal!

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Pretty rough initial first smell, but once it dries down it becomes this warm and sweet scent that projects really nicely. For the price you can get this it is an awesome starter fragrance.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
CK Shock Is a beautiful warm and sexy spicy fragrance with that CK sweet and playful DNA. To my nose Shock opens with that sweet clementine and lavender, you get a lovely cardamom, strong pepper and basil but blended nicely with that Apricot smelling osmanthus, the base and the mid work together as the warmth and dryness of the amber and tobacco combine to make this fragrance sexy and ideal for intimate situations, musky...for sure, earthy too! CK Shock does not smell cheap by any means it's beautiful but yes it's a CK fragrance in the end... I adore the bottle with the writing Shock and screwing on the cap gives it more of a personal feel, for the price this is gorgeous and go ahead and spray 20 times because you probably won't reach the 4th hour mark of longevity as soon as you apply this one it starts to sit closer to the skin. I love applying this before bed it's so nice and uplifting If this fragrance was beastmode I'd have to give it an 8 possibly 9/10, but it's not so I'll give it a 6.5 😁

Price 10/10
Scent 8/10
Longevity 4/10

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Based on the insanely good price of $30/200ml, this is amazing stuff.

Mainly cinnamon and tobacco, with some general sweetness and warm spice mixed in.

I do get a little bit of the lavender and orangey notes in the opening but they fade to the background quite quickly on my skin (like 5 minutes).

Honestly, if you want something that’s sweet but maintains its maturity, this is a fantastic 3/4 year fragrance to me. It’s an easy dumb reach because it smells nice and it’s cheap. Smells much lighter and even a bit woodsy and almost a little fresh in the air but as you get closer to skin it gets so nice and warm and sweet with the cardamom mixing in.

Genuinely ver appealing perfumery and for the price it’s just absolutely incredible.

A lot of these disgruntled reviews seem to have pretty unrealistic expectations of this perfume at this price point. Not sure what you guys are expecting- for $30/200ml, this is incredible stuff. I’d even be happy if it was $30/100 but any higher would be a bit crazy for me.

Decent longevity, okay projection, but scent profile alone is enough to keep me coming back. 100% worth trying if you’re thinking about it.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: This would be a 10 outta 10 if the bottle design was better. Just saying

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
A Chic Blend for Warm Weather: CK One Shock! For Him

Rating: ★★★☆☆

As a fan of almost all CK fragrances, I find them to be beautifully crafted and well-made. The company has a distinct personality that shines through in its products, which are never weak or hit-and-miss. They always adhere to a strict set of rules before a release, ensuring quality and consistency.

CK One Shock! For Him is no exception. It’s a prestigious amber/Smocky fragrance perfect for warm weather. The composition is beautiful, slightly sweet, warm, and undeniably chic. It can be compared to Spicebomb Extreme, although the latter is a bit more mass-appealing and longer-lasting.

Like most CK fragrances, don’t expect too much from its performance. However, the price justifies it. In the US, CK perfumes may be less appealing due to overuse and ubiquity, causing them to lose their appeal. But in far-off countries like ours, people can easily enjoy the art of these fragrances without the hype factor.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Cheap, Spicy, Warm, oh so cozyy. How could you not like this, i love it. the initial opening is very nice on my skin, i get a warm creamy spicy cinnamon smell at first, then it dries down into an even smoother tobacco smell that’s irresistible. this is bound to get compliments and it’s affordable aswell. One of my personal favourites.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
The most luxurious fragrance you can get for your money

Smooth amber chocolate tobacco flavor

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells like Fireball. I kinda like it.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Another dumb reach for a fall and winter. It’s super cheap, and smells great to me. I bought this on a whim a couple years ago and I find myself using this often in the colder weather. It’s a pretty masculine spicy fragrance. Pretty good beginner oriental fragrance. Projection could be better and it only lasts a few hours but it’s so cheap you can spray away. I have way better winter fragrances in my collection but I still use this. I’ve probably never got a compliment from anyone but I don’t care I like the smell. I’ve never got a complaint though l.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: It's just a pleasant sweet scent with spices. Nothing groundbreaking, but the price is fair. Also don't believe "reminds me of" section, smells nothing like London for Men

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
The sillage is very strong, it lasts ages-I put it on at around 9am and had a shower late afternoon and still smelt it when I woke up the next morning. Sticks to clothes and stuff for a while. It is a pleasant tobacco cozy smell but can be very cloying and induce headaches. Good for colder days and should not be over sprayed. Atomizer dribbles and sprays inconsistently but for $40 for 200ml it’s pretty good.

Edit: it’s much better on the Drydown and is quite pleasant. Dark, amber sensual scent over which is overall pleasing

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: I bought this fragrance a couple years back and personally wouldn't recommend it, it smells way way too sweet to the point it overdoes any other notes and gives you a headache, only positive I can think of is that it is cheap but personally, not for me

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Absolutely love the scent, really poor performance, lasts 30 - 50 minutes with barely no projection after 20 minutes , got it for 20€/100ml, i wish they made a better performance version.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Meh, pretty avarage even for its price. Smells better on clothes than on skin. Cheap synthetic opening. Not similar to Burberry London in my opinion, BL has better quality and a nicer bottle.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
I was looking for a winter fragrance and found this as a recommendation. Found it fairly cheap so I went ahead and ordered it. At first I couldn't stand it. It was as advertised a shock for my nose. Too sweet too sharp too much. But as it slowly dries down it becomes more and more pleasant. When I smell this I'm thinking of snow, knitted sweaters , Christmas vibe , Christmas herbs and spices. Shortly it's a very wintery / christmasy scent for me. Is a bit too sweet for me but it isn't bad. Some compared this to lattafas Asad but I can't really see any similarities as such.
I'm not saying there not similar , it's just that me personally can't connect those two.

I don't think I would buy it again but that's just because I believe that this scent was made for younger people and not old farts like me... Well middleaged farts like me anyway. I'd prefer something a bit less sweet But that's just my two cents.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: A nice cheap, but well done, pipe tobacco scent with amber, patchouli, and spice. Some basil and slight cocoa. Its biggest negative is how weak it is. Weak projection and poor longevity. That graffiti logo is awful and the name doesn’t fit at all. I usually turn the atomizer around and display the back of the bottle. Still if you can find it cheap, it’s a nice addition to your collection. The dry down, though somewhat faint, is wonderful. This one will stay on your clothes a decent amount of time, but at least on my skin, it doesn’t last long.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: It's cheap, it smells like chocolate, tobacco and a pinch of spice. Don't go out of your way for it, but if you see it for super cheap, or just want to add a nice semi sweet masculine bottle to your collection: you won't be dissapointed.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Did you like LA Nuit de L'homme?
Did you ever want La Nuit de L'homme to add tobacco, but not a Thierry Mugler Pure Havane type?
Then CK One Shock is for. Comes in two sizes.
3.4 and 6.8.
One of the best affordable colognes.

If you did prefer a Pure Havane scent then Reyane Tradition Insurrection Wild II is for you.

CK One Shock has that Cardamom note that many associated with La Nuit de L'homme. This one is a sweeter tobacco. It's not like TF Tobacco Vanille or PDM Herod.

Yes,the packaging is cheesy. Yes, Calvin Klein should repackage this.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: The Best Calvin Klein men’s fragrance imo I’m sure others would agree too eternity flame for men is pretty solid too but doesn’t compete with this this is beautiful majority of people won’t even think this smells like 30-40 dollar fragrance this is like Tom Ford quality I’ve been sleeping on this for a long time and I get good longevity with this 4-5 hours 6 when I spray my clothes Get the 200ml guys 9/10

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
The opening is so good to my taste (A fresh spicy opening reminds me of la nuit de L'Homme, due to the combination of lavender with cardamon, Also there is a boozy spicy accord in there which I love).
But after the opening, the scent becomes a sweet somehow linear but not so loud till the dry down, I am not interested in this phase.
Overall I think that I like the scent but not a love for me, although I like tobacco note in fragrances, but here it has more sweetness than I love.
Also considering the quality to price ratio factor, I think it is a good fragrance as everyone mentioned before.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Dropping another review to say once again this is the best cheapie ever.

Also, I have a solution for the goofy bottle.

Take an old pair of your Calvin Klein boxers, the one with the skid marks you can’t wash out, cut the band off of it, now cut it so that it’ll wrap snug around the bottle, stitch it, put it on and cover that god awful graffiti. Now you have a bottle like a blacked out ck everyone. You’re welcome.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Considering the price, this is top tier in every possible aspect. I wore this just today and got compliments both from older ladies and teenage boys. Everyone seems to like it. I wear many different fragrances and hardly ever get compliments but this one is always an exception.

Longevity 8+ hours.

This is a cheapie that could easily be someone's signature.

Yes the bottle looks childish but so what?

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Good value, nice scent, worth to try it

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Do you like Starbucks? Have you ever wanted to smell like gingerbread latte? Here's your chance.
I don't hate it it's just wayyyy too sweet for me. The sent profile here is totally different from what I smell. I get VANILLA cinnamon nutmeg and after the dry down finally a hint of smoke and wood.
It's definitely a younger persons scent. If the description sounds good to you totally go for it. It's usually under $30 if you can find it. Just be careful you will most likely have some stray pumpkin spice girls following you around.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is by far the best value for money fragrance that I own. I've seen it garner hype in the community in the past but I never pulled the trigger. That was until the discounter that I use in the UK came out with a ridiculous deal which I couldn't refuse. In the end I managed to pick up 200ml for £6 and it has got to be one of the best buys I've made since I started collecting fragrances.

The scent itself is a masculine, sweet tobacco which is phenomenally sexy in the cooler months. It has a sweet almost herbal undertone which is mass appealing and seductive.

Performance is also much better than expected as lasts about 5/6hrs and projects well for the first hour or so and then sits a lot closer. I would recommend spraying this on clothing to make the scent last even longer.

The presentation was unlike anything I've had before but I like the screw top on the bottle and the separate atomizer. It distributes a lot of fragrance and I really like how rustic it is. The bottle style aswell is a bit hit or miss but even a massive 200ml bottle doesn't look out of place with the rest of my bottles and I love the style of it.

All things said it is the best value for money fragrance that I own and it has been one that the ladies love. Would definitely recommend even if it was £30/40 an excellent fragrance.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Scent-wise, this is one of the most quintessential fall fragrances I've ever smelled. Yes it's great tobacco (not just for the price), but the way it's supported evokes almost a pumpkinspice accord. Thinking of this as a halloweeny scent can almost excuse the gaudy packaging too (almost). This is so cheap and pleasant it's a must-have, too bad the performance is dreadful. It also does not have a cap, which is bad for a poor-performing fragrance as you'd have to take it around with you to respray and wouldn't want it spurting about in your bag or glovebox. Despite the downsides, I still just love the smell - just wish there was a parfum version or something.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: It have nothing like red bull. I am not say that I dont like it, but the desire to have red bull scent makes me regret 5 buck buying this.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Just a bit too synthetic for my taste in the opening, but the drydown is excellent for what it is. I get about 4-5 hours longevity. My only real complaint is that it has the worst atomizer of any fragrance I own.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Really was missing out on this. Found one at my local ROSS for $19.99 and was kind of skeptical about it, though the price and reviews I've seen truly couldn't lie.
Very smooth, not as sweet and sticky as I was expecting. It sure would be easy to pull this off as a signature scent year-round, especially since it'll get you a bubble that is off the radar amongst your typical freshie.
On the cheap, quite surprising quality, though very moderate performance ~3h apparent on my skin, then on the 3rd+ hour gets mild and smells of clean skin (soapy).
I dislike the bottling, but love the idea of having a screw on cap/atomizer.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Packaging is a bit silly and juvenile. The bright neon SHOCK is just not for me. Atomizer is ok, nothing special.
The opening is all sweet, warm tobacco and an undercurrent of spiciness. I'm not really getting any of the clementine or cucumber some other folks smell off the top. Maybe a slight hint of that lavender.

The dry down is pretty linear, and the fragrance more or less maintains that sweet, warm tobacco, spiciness, and wood notes. There isn't much evolution, but that's ok because this fragrance is fantastic. Shock definitely reads as an Oriental, dark fragrance.
Both longevity and sillage were moderate to weak for me. After about 2 hours, it sort of disappears. But, this EDT is so cheap, you can be very liberal with sprays and reapplication.
I'd wear this casually in the cooler months, day or night. I don't think this is a formal/dressy option, and for sure not something I'd wear in warm weather.
The value of this fragrance is phenomenal. They are practically giving this stuff away at discounters. I paid $20 for 100mL, and I've seen 200mL for only $30! At this price, I'd recommend CK One Shock for him to anybody who enjoys tobacco fragrances.
Overall, I really think this is a can't miss blind buy for anybody who enjoys a tobacco fragrance. It is a bit lacking in longevity and sillage, but again...it's so cheap you can just spray some more. Anecdotally, this is one of my more complimented fragrances, more than some of my more expensive fragrances!

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Burnt cherries. Just that. Tobacco and cherries, tobacco with a little of sweetness & freshness, does not lasts much or project insanely, but for the price? pretty good especially for winter, it was my first tobacco perfume and im enjoying it!

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: This is a great introductory tobacco fragrance. A little sweet and spicy mixed with the tobacco blends really nice. Very inoffensive and you can find it very cheap online and at pretty much any TJ Maxx/Marshalls/Ross. If you're wanting to dip your toes into tobacco, I highly recommend.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Finally finished my bottle so long ck one shock you served a great purpose during fall and winter 🙌

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Whoever designed the bottle and ads for this must have laughed their ass off.
It looks like a perfume designed for bubble gum eaters.
Smells way better than you would think.
Smooth tobacco and warm spices, decent performance.
Great budget pick, just don't look at the bottle when you're using it.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: I'm a big fan of CK2 and CK One, two of my favorite budget-friendly scents. I decided to pick this one up on a whim after finding if at a tj maxx for a very decent $20 and was surprised! It's warm and cozy, the spicy tobacco note is more comforting than I expected. This is very different than the other CK fragrances that I own, but it was definitely a blind buy that I don't regret.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Don’t buy it, I don’t want anyone to smell as good as me.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
This fragrance took me by surprise it has similarities to ASAD. I was very on the fence on this but if you can get it under 20$ it's well worth it the tobacco and amber are the star of the show the fragrance is sweet and well balanced for the price you really can't beat this. Great winter or fall fragrance.

Smell-6/10
Performance-6/10
Versatility-6/10
Overall Rating-6/10

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein

CK Shock is a nice amberish tobacco frag that's inexpensive and it's available in 200ml bottles for about 33 usd. I keep a 20ml decant of it in the office drawer and just spray it abundantly once a while when I wanna smell some not so loud tobacco. It isn't that lasting and stays on the skin for about 4-5 hrs. Good enough

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: This one is the fruity version of Herod. Not too fruity, but more of a unisex perfume unlike Herod or Mugler.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
ONE REAL BIG SHOCK

In the last decade of the past century - seems like one million years ago - someone offered me a bottle of the original CK One. The year was certainly 1994 and that gift was a surprise for me. I never had seen it before in a Duty-Free shop, so that flask was certainly "fresh bread out of the bakery".
By then, all I cared about was Issey Miyake and Kenzo scents for summer days, Tuscany, Eau Sauvage and Paco Rabanne XS for the office and Kouros, Antaeus, Obsession, Boss Number 1 and Opium for a night out or partying. All of them had a magnificent and elegant presentation and had an extremely good performance, as well a very alluring scent... and a high price as a social toll. They were part of the "créme de la créme" back then, both for juice quality and looks (and price). Even today, all of them are perfume industry.

The original CK One was an unexpected launch for me. Although I liked Obsession very much (and still do) I did not care much about any other CK scent. I remember thinking that the fragrance was all wrong. It was democratically inexpensive (so it should be a bad scent), with an under-average performance (so it should be a bad scent), with a vulgar flask and no cap (so it should be a bad scent), unisex (so it should be a bad male scent), 200 ml flask volume like a big bottle of a cheap drugstore cologne (so it should be a bad scent), and with a transparent juice (so it should be a bad scent).
I never cared much about that bottle and later on, I gave it away as a gift, not to my father but to my father-in-law at the time (I did not like him all that much).
To my past century's astonishment, Calvin Klein kept on releasing new different multicoloured CK One flankers once every two years or so. Unconsciously I labeled them all as cheap and low-quality colognes, as I did before with the original fragrance back in 94. At the same time, Paco Rabanne released the inexpensive "infamous" Paco. Oh my god... it seems like a spreading disease. I did not realize then that this perfume democratization was indeed very healthy. Due to this type of product strategy, now we have a larger industry with a larger offer, both in quantity and in scent types, and an extremely wider consumer base. With that conclusion in mind, I now admit that CK One was probably one of the most important fragrances of the XX century.
Twenty years later, older, wiser and with a different father-in-law, I saw a very positive youtube review about the new not unisex CK One Shock. "The reviewer must be sponsored by Calvin Kein" has been my first thought. Six months and half a dozen "Shocking" reviews later, I bought my first bottle of Ck One Shock for Him. Two years and two bottles later, I'm writing my first review on the CK One Shock fragrance. However, so far I have not bought any bottles of the original CK One. For this to happen, I must be even older and wiser than I am now.
As everyone knows CK One Shock, I don't need to refresh your memory in this lines, describing its magnificent bracing pepper and cozy warm amber blended with the intense and creamy tobacco notes, the confort of having a family size bottle, and the smiling face I put on whenever I pay twenty and someting Euros for this 200 ml Eau de Toilete.
By the way, have you noticed that this fragrance is quite unique in the [price & scent type & presentation] combo?
And if you compare it with way more expensive similar fragrances like Herod, Spicebomb, Pure Havane and Kokorico, they have been released at the same time or after CK One Shock?
Now, the mathematical magic mirror for this thousand volts Shock:
_______________________
- Opening.: 9.5 (surprisingly good)
- Dry Down: 8.5 (still good, but more common and a bit faint)
- Longevity: 8.0 (up to 7~9 hours on my skin, with 2 sprays)
- Sillage: 7.0 (sillage up to 5~6 feet; it projects for 1.5 hours... flimsy)
- Versatility: 9.0 (just avoid the hot temperatures of summer days)
- Usability: 9.0 (a scent quite versatile and easy to please. Use it in all situations except beach, gym and sweaty events)
- Compliments: 8.5 (it will please a lot of people. Compliments will happen)
- Uniqueness: 8.0 (I will just mention, as a predecessor, a similar inexpensive fragrance: Bogart pour Homme)
- Quality: .8.0 (above average quality ingredients; good spray)
- Presentation: 7.0 (suitable for positioning in the mass market of which it is part)
- Price: 10.0 (200 ml flask in the range of €22,50~€29.00)
_______________________
- Average: .8.41/10.00 (The only Calvin Klein fragrances I tested with this average classification were Obsession, both men and women)
between 7 and 8 => above average;
between 8 and 9 => recommended;
equal or bigger than 9 => don't miss it;

My conclusion: Gorgeous! I do recommend it even as a blind buy.

Music: "I Want You To Want Me" by Cheap Trick

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Smelled this in a pharmacy in Queensland Australia yesterday (5th of October 2023).

The smell reminded me of energy drinks. Gave youthful and carefree vibes.

Great for the price.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
I am late to the game on this one, I had read and watched reviews on this one but never really planned on getting it. I was at Burlington a store I don’t frequent much then I see the 200ml bottle for $29. So I said well it’s just $29 if I don’t like it I will just gift it to someone that does. First I didn’t like the bottle you have to install the atomizer and it doesn’t have a cap. I have 2 other bottles that don’t have a cap bulgari aqua and Mercedes Benz club black atomizer is built in to bottle. Ok now to the scent; it is very similar to D&G pour homme the dark blue box. CK shock opens up kind of fresh with floral notes, I guess that is why people say it smells like a granny scent. There is a sweetness but on the ambery side, no candy not bubblegum just sweet and it stays throughout the scent. The freshness dies down fast and it gets a little spicy but not Spicebomb spicy just faint hints of pepper and there is waxy/oily feeling to it from the tobacco. I don’t get a sweet pipe tobacco it is more of a cigar raw leaf ready to be rolled a shiny oily leaf. It feels warmer because the sweetness of the amber. The patchouli it feels more noticeable on the dry down and can barely get the woodsy notes. The dry down feels it’s just three notes. For the price it is a good fragrance but I can say it might not please everyone, it is not polarizing but some people might not like this type of fragrance. Performance: projects for an hour then it goes closer to skin but still have a good bubble; after 6 hours it just starts to fade and it’s gone by the 8 hour mark on my skin. I can say it is a good alternative to the D&G pour homme if you want a little more sweetness with a bit less spice. Not a shocker but a decent cheapy and better than many clones out there costing more. I guess for the time it came out it was unique and it can keep up with today’s fragrances doesn’t feel so outdated.

Fall/winter/spring
Day or night
Easy reach
Projection 7/10
Sillage 7/10
Longevity 7/10
Price point 10/10

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Tobacco, woods, baby powder, a hint of herbaceous notes. Smells decent for the low price of about $20-25 for a massive bottle at discounters and rack stores. A decent tobacco-centric fragrance for a younger guy branching out into something more mature, or someone on a budget, but it just can't compete with higher quality tobacco frags.

Definitely a cool weather fragrance, better suited for night, but could be pulled off on a sufficiently cold day.
Longevity is good, projecting pretty strongly for at least 3-4 hours and easily detectable within arms reach up to 8 hours.
This smells best in the sillage, which off of my skin is respectable at 6 feet or more and it leaves a trail.
Smelled close up, it's a bit irritating, headache inducing and nauseating. If you use this for date night, make sure it's not sprayed directly where someone will be nuzzling you.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: much much better tobacco smell than the overhyped and overpriced le male elixir.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: I like the bottle i think its unique looking. This is not a good performer on my skin but it stays a long time on my clothes. This was my first tobacco fragnance and i can say that it has grown on me over time.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: I tried it for the first time and immediately noticed it was similar to another perfume. Encre Noire A L'Extreme. Yes, it looks quite similar. I'm not saying they smell exactly the same, but they are in the same style and remind each other. The difference is that Ck is more functional with a bit of citrus and amber.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
This smells like niche! Very delicious for a cheap designer. Bottle is cheap too


Overall - 8.5/10 good job ck

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: One of the best and most underrated cheapies ever. The tobacco and basil sweet smell is perfect in the car and office, I'll definitely purchase one. It's a shame CK didn't advertise CK shock effectively

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
The bottle is ugly. You have to remove the cap to insert the sprayer (like Serge Lutens bottles). I am not a fan of that due to exposing the fragrance to air.

That being said, for the price, it is a very nice fragrance that lasts for around 6 hours and radiates within an arms length. Perfect for Autumn and Winter. Can be worn by any age group, male or female.

As "cheap" as this fragrance is, you can't go wrong with it.
9/10 - Love

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
I blind bought a bottle of this back in like 2013 reading that it was something unique, and after having all the typical mall scents (Hollister, Buckle, Aero, Abercrombie) back at that time in high school, I wanted something that was a little different, interestingly, it being early fall time when I got it, I hated it at first, but after a couple of months, I ran out of every bottle, and this was all I had so I used it and somehow just absolutely loved it! I wanted to come back around now being almost 30, and again wanting something a bit unique as I build a small collection I saw this was still available and jumped on it for I think 30 bucks.

This hit exactly as I remember it did back in 2013. Though, I feel it is definitely a fall/winter scent overall, I've worn this recently in hotter weather, and it still was pleasant, not completely ideal in every facet, but I wouldn't rule it out. More evening, but I've worn it earlier in the day, and its still great, but I seem to gravitate toward these kind of heavy type scents regardless of the time of year, so that's just me. It has a very tobacco/warm and spicy/sweet type of thing that I really love in a scent.

Seems most folks give the sillage and longevity a bit of a down, I will spray a fairly liberal amount, and it'll last me through a shift at work + some, and it'll last on clothes into the next day. Love this stuff!

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: I love this fragrance. Burberry London smells similar to this one. I love and own both. I liked this one more because to me it smells like Cherry and Tobacco. Burberry London is more Vanilla and Tobacco. For those who smelled Burberry London swap Vanilla for Cherry and you'll smell Ck One Shock.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
After desiring a tobacco note fragrance and hearing so much convo regarding this 'cheapie', I finally purchased a bottle.
It certainly does satisfy the need for a tobacco smell. Interesting combination of notes to achieve this goal.
Definitely nothing fancy here and not really worth more than the 25 buck pricetag yet works in a pinch.
Dries down to a more basic cologne smell with a remaining hint of 'tobacco'.

✨

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
got 200ml for 27 euro, by far the best ml to price ratio fragrance ive ever had, however the bottle is kinda weird
the atomizer is strong, and it smells really good too

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Had to finally snag a bottle and check the hype, I wasn't expecting much... turns out the majority opinion is correct, this thing phenomenal for the price, and it's pretty dang solid if you just ignored the price. All the notes are there, and from start to finish it's a bit of an enigma - the opening is a nice fresh/spicy citrus+lavender but then goes an unexpected direction with mild, sweet tobacco-amber and has kind of a spicy cherry Dr. Pepper vibe. It doesn't smell cheap to me at all, but obviously isn't loaded with delightful naturals either - masterfully blended. Performance is moderate all-around with 4-5 hours longevity and mild projection, which I'm pretty happy with. Truly, this is a no-brainer dumb reach for cooler weather. CK killed it with this one. It's better than it has any right to be.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: It's such a fun winter/ fall fragrance with unique scent. It manages to convey tobbaco cherry vibe with just a hint of spices without making it extremely mature which I find unique. Good even for teenagers. Projection and Longevity could be better but the overall scent and quality to price ratio are awesome. I think it has lots of lattafa Asad vibe (not dior sauvage elixir as Asad and elixir do not smell similar to my nose) and is actually nicer and smoother. Weak projection and Longevity but it kinda works making the fragrance airy and not cloying which is not obvious with winter scents which can get overwhelming.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: I used to absolutely love this when I first got it, but now Im finding that it gives me a migraine more often than not.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
In all fairness, came back to this after a number of years and I honestly think this is a very under rated scent, horribly marketed, that spray paint “Shock” absolutely horrendous in fairness and it’s little wonder this flopped.

But the scent itself is very good imo, the tobacco is very nice imo, the lavender coming thru and the amber making it sweet, not a room filler, not a beast mode fragrance but an enjoyable one for a very good price.

In my collection I have expensive niche fragrances like Oud for Greatness, Naxos and designer like Ombre Leather and Dior Homme Intense plus many more and this is an everyday easy to wear fragrance that is inoffensive and mass appealing, it could easily be someone’s signature scent I’m that confident.

Such a shame the marketing was dreadful but on the upside not many people will be rocking this which will make you unique.

7/10.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
£26 for 200ml 🤌

Used to wear this all the time about 10 years ago.
Still great. Banger for the price. Probably better for comder months but ill wear it all year round.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: I love to wear this fragrance to work!! Longevity on my skin and clothes gives me around 10+ no kidding. And this stuff doesn't smell bad at all, so for 22.00 I believe it's a great low cost fragrance to wear to work or play.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Really smells very similar to Burberry London. Very nice fragrance for the coldest days of the year. Superb quality for the price.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: I just picked this fragrance up several hours ago from Burlingtons for $20 after seeing Ash of Gent Scents' recent review on it. After getting this on skin, I like it a lot. This is a really good cheapie especially if you like tobacco scents. This will definitely be in my fall/winter rotation.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Smells like smothering your face with dry tobacco leaves in a tobacco processing plant with some sweet peppery undertones to balance it out. I am no smoker myself but this really does remind me of what a smoker smells like if it was turned into a pleasant perfume. It's okay, I guess, but not for me.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: This is a amazing fall and winter scent, great value for money, dosnt smell cheap, definitely a great buy

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Get it!!! It’s like Jean Paul Elixir or 1 million elixir on a massive budget! Won’t last near as long but it does last a good long time! Out performs all ck one flankers. Perfect date night fragrance.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Best cheapie you can buy imo. Such a nice cozy sweet tobacco scent.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: Easily a top 10 Tobacco Fragrance and every single man should have this in rotation. CK’s marketing team failed miserably with this. I never wanted to try it because I expected it would be a newer version of CK ONE. Instead , we have one of the most beautiful fragrances I’ve ever experienced. Tobacco is soft similar to Pure Havane / Herod. Had this marketing team called this CK Havana or anything other than SHOCK (with goosebumps looking font) this would easily be the most expensive CK frag.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
nicely done, entry level of tobacco scent
among all my other perfumes this is the most i wear when i go to market, school or gym
it is cheap too

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content: CK Shock? More like CK disappointment! I mean, seriously, what's the hype about? The scent is so bland and generic that I could barely tell it apart from other cheap fragrances at the drugstore. And don't even get me started on the price - it's a complete rip-off for what you're getting. I wouldn't pay more than a few bucks for this kind of scent. Save your money and buy something better

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
This is not at all similar to Burberry London. Both are wonderful scents.

If Burberry London fits the Christmas scene in Wham's Lask Christmas music video

Shock goes well with the image of smoking whiskey and cigars in a high-class jazz bar with jazz music playing

In Shock's dry-down, the unique amber scent blends with the tobacco scent, giving it a soft chocolate scent. It's a luxurious scent

Why was it released as a ck line? I wonder, but it is one of Calvin Klein's best fragrances.

product_name: CK One Shock For Him Calvin Klein
review_content:
Wouldn’t it be an enlightening experiment to line up a group of perfume lovers who believe that ‘you get what you pay for’ and give them a range of unmarked frags for blind testing. I’d like to see how they’d do, relying on their noses alone and not anything else to sort out high-end from low-end, works of art from hack jobs. One can say whatever they want about their ability to discriminate but who’s verified that ability?

@DarthFragrance I see no reason to dispute that point about ingredients, but it is your point, not mine. 😉
